IncidentDescription: While Mr. Sanchez was on the derrick board adjusting his pull back rope he suddenly felt discomfort in his right eye. He felt as if something (unknown) flew into his eye causing immediate irritation. Mr. Sanchez did has his safety glasses on.

IncidentDescription: While 3 men were in personnel basket waiting for the crane operator to take them off work boat, it began to drift away from the lift boat. IncidentDescription: Matt was lifting the end of a lube from the ground to put on stand. When he stood, he noticed sharp pain in lower back.

IncidentSummary: After successful packer setting, tool string was returned to surface and bumped-up into lubricator.
IncidentDescription: After successful packer setting, tool string was returned to surface and bumped-up into lubricator. The employee bled off pressure and disconnected lubricator from the pump-in sub. Driller slacked off on lubricator using a cat-line as Jay swung the lubricator over to the side of the BOP. The driller continued to lower the lubricator, which caused the rope socket to break. The tool string fell, striking Jay on his right thigh and right foot.
InjuryDescripti: ee struck by tool string resulting in laceration to right thigh, right foot fracture and tissue damage.

IncidentSummary: Employee was knocking off the well head connection with a hammer. When he swung the hammer he missed
IncidentDescription: Employee was knocking off the well head connection with a hammer. When he swung the hammer he missed the well head connection. Employee hyper-extended his left elbow in this process, causing his left thumb to go numb.

IncidentSummary: Employee was walking on location while carrying approximately 100lbs, and rolled his ankle. The ankl
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking on location while carrying approximately 100lbs, and rolled his ankle. The ankle rolled outwardly when he stepped wrong. He was wearing workboots at the time of the injury.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was walking on location while carrying approximately 100lbs on 3/13/13. and rolled his left ankle. The ankle rolled outwardly when he stepped wrong.

IncidentSummary: Crew was breaking down a junk basket from a set of jars. They were having difficulty in this task an
IncidentDescription: Crew was breaking down a junk basket from a set of jars. They were having difficulty in this task and decided to use cheaters. Employee slipped when the tool broke free and the cheater struck him in the face. Employee broke 2 teeth.

IncidentDescription: In sub when driller turned on the kill line. Kill line had plug in it when turned on and it jumped and hit ee's left ankle, causing contusion to ankle.

IncidentDescription: Employee was walking from line truck to engineerGs pickup. Took off hard hat and glasses due to them being covered in snow. It took 4 other employee to pick the shaker up enough for employee to get his foot out from between the bolt and the bottom frame. InjuryDescripti: Contusion to the top of his Right Foot, it was caught under a bolt on the shakers

IncidentDescription: EE was building pop-off with two other employees. The other two ee went up to the rig floor to make a connection. When Craig finished rebuilding pop-off, he tried to stab pop-off back on 3" line. He was making up hammer union for pop-off housing when it slipped and fell off the 3" line. EE tried to catch the pop-off before it hit the ground and his hand was smashed between the 3" line coming from the pulsation dampener to the pop-off.
InjuryDescripti: hand was smashed between the 3" line coming from the pulsation dampener to the pop-off resulting in fracture to 5th digit, left hand.

IncidentSummary: While tripping in the hole the employee struck his left thumb inbetween the horn of the elvators and
IncidentDescription: While tripping in the hole the employee struck his left thumb inbetween the horn of the elvators and a stand of 4.5" drill pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Left thumb knuckle close to palm sustained swelling which at all times employee was still able to move thumb.

IncidentSummary: Emp fell on top of rig tank while trying to turn shaker off.
IncidentDescription: Emp fell on top of rig tank while trying to turn shaker off.

IncidentSummary: Prior to starting rig move crew washed the substructure to get all the mud off that was left over fr
IncidentDescription: Prior to starting rig move crew washed the substructure to get all the mud off that was left over from drilling. After washing crew then unpinned 45's and mud boat from substructure. After unpinning the crew then called in the forklift to laydown the 45's. The crew was moving out of way. The I.E. was walking backwards when he slipped on water left over from washing falling backwards on wellhead lacerating right knee and suffering contusion to right rib area.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right rib area and laceration to right knee.

IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping out of hole; ee was loosening chain tong, ee tripped over the drill collar slips, resulting in ee falling onto his left side.

IncidentDescription: Finger struck by slips on rig floor while rigging up/down.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging up on well. They were unable to get the rig base beam close enough to the well so t
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging up on well. They were unable to get the rig base beam close enough to the well so they had to remove the expanded metal grating that covered the celler. In the process employ lost his footing and fell approximately 4-5 feet into the opening.
InjuryDescripti: Right shoulder contusion

IncidentSummary: Jonathan was breaking packing nuts on a pump using a come a long and a wrench. When he struck the wr
IncidentDescription: Jonathan was breaking packing nuts on a pump using a come a long and a wrench. When he struck the wrench with a hammer, the come a long chain came off and struck his left middle finger
InjuryDescripti: laceration on the side of the left hand middle finger about 3/4 inch long.

IncidentSummary: While climbing dowN, the hand slipped a fell against yellow barrier.
IncidentDescription: While climbing dowN, the hand slipped a fell against yellow barrier.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging up. Kyle was flanging up the bottom of the first stick to top of the second stick w
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging up. Kyle was flanging up the bottom of the first stick to top of the second stick while standing in the BOP stand tied off in a full body harness. He and another employee was tightening up nuts/bolts with a pull bar. The pull bar gave way and Kyle lost his footing causing him to fall backwards. He extended his right arm to break the fall and injured his right hand.
InjuryDescripti: swelling to right hand. xray confirmed non displaced fracture to right index finger.

IncidentSummary: Employees had finished tripping out of the hole and were preparing to run thru-bit logs. The hands h
IncidentDescription: Employees had finished tripping out of the hole and were preparing to run thru-bit logs. The hands had went to help the logging company get their equipment ready and the driller was on the rig floor trying to organize it and prepare to run the logs to bottom. He walked over to a lifting sub (approx... 150 lbs) that was used to lay down the mud motor and attempted to move it from the middle of the racking area. He bent over at his waist and attempted to push the sub out of the way. While he did he felt a mild pain in his back. He continued to work and tripped the remainder of pipe into the hole. As time went on the pain began to increase and he reported the incident to the toolpusher. He suffered a slight muscle strain and was given a full release to duty.
InjuryDescripti: Employee suffered a lower back strain from an improper lift made

IncidentSummary: MISS HESS dropped aux block
IncidentDescription:
Incident occured when crane operator scoped out boom and aux winch hook two blocked and fell. No anti-block shut 
down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oxy lubricator
IncidentDescription: Employee removed lubricator from wellhead before fluid was drained

IncidentSummary: Ee was going up stairs to wrangler to roll a joint of pipe that was half in and out of trough, slipp
IncidentDescription: Ee was going up stairs to wrangler to roll a joint of pipe that was half in and out of trough, slipped and twisted his right knee.

IncidentSummary: MISS EOG defective wiring
IncidentDescription:
While running power to the perforating trailer, the logger generator shut down. Engineer investigated and found that 
the power cord that splits the power to the trailer lights shorted out. This caused it to over heat and arc when power 
was applied to it.

IncidentDescription: When pressure testing our lubricator we had left two valves open. When they filled the lubricator with fluid it sprayed out of the valves and on to the ground.

IncidentDescription: Ee was making up the hammer union, swung the hammer and hit his left little finger, causing a laceration.

IncidentDescription: While loading 5 1/2 BOP onto a trailer with a forklift and sling, the BOP rolled towards employee striking him on his left knee. The employee then jumped off the trailer as the sling slipped off the forklift. The BOP fell on to the lubricator loaded on the trailer.

IncidentDescription: When co-worker was taking suction cap to place on skid floor, the cap slipped out of his hands, bounced on skid and struck ee's right little toe.

IncidentDescription: While spudding in the hole the employee was working floors making connections when he began to feel over heated. Symptoms consisted of cramps and nausea.

IncidentDescription: Ee was walking into the sub and stepped on spreader which was covered in ice, causing ee to slip and fall. As he fell, he caught himself with his left arm which caused a strain to his arm.

IncidentDescription: Working on mud pump, ee was trying to stand up linear and pull off thread ring, thread ring slid down linear and smashed ee's left middle finger between linear and thread ring.

IncidentDescription: Co-worker had ee extend elevators out, pushing ee into St-80, catching him between elevators and St-80 which caused a contusion on his lower back.

IncidentDescription: Employee stuck hand into an impact glove. An hour later he felt a stinging sensation. Pulled glove off hand and there were two small stings/bites. After removing the glove, bites began to swell. No insects were found.

IncidentDescription: Unknown how he got injured, he felt pain in his right testicle and it got worse and than he told his drill and his driller sent him down to report it to Rig Manager. as of 5-20-13 employee is feeling better.

IncidentDescription:
While rigging up Scanalog equipment, the operator ran the blocks up and out of the way and installed the chain on the 
brake handle. The operator diverted his attention and did not see the chain had slipped off. The blocks came down 15-
20 feet. The elevator and bales stopped by the BOP's, missing two people before the blocks were stopped.

IncidentSummary: Employee tried climbing onto the rear of truck to lower tarp. He placed his hand on grease head on b
IncidentDescription: Employee tried climbing onto the rear of truck to lower tarp. He placed his hand on grease head on bumper causing one of the collars to spin. This in turn caused him to lose his balance. He fell to the ground, striking his head and back on the concrete. The fall left bruising on his head and back.

IncidentSummary: Robert Roddy was driving north heading toward Graham Texas. Driver said the truck had a mechanical p
IncidentDescription: Robert Roddy was driving north heading toward Graham Texas. Driver said the truck had a mechanical problem and the truck veered to the right off of the pavement. The cruise control was on and the driver tapped the breaks and the truck lost control. The truck veered into the left lane and started to fall on its side. It stopped on the side of the right lane, the truck was on the driver side.
InjuryDescripti: Multiple body parts injured due to a vehicle accident

IncidentDescription: Employee was checking water in duck ponds and stepped backwards off step grabbed onto the 2'' line valve and felt a strain in his right shoulder, Employee stated that he had a previous type of injury to the same shoulder. He wanted to be totally honest.

IncidentDescription: Employee was loading 5 1/2" 5K lubricator onto trailer. As he bent down to position lubricator onto trailer rack, the lubricator slipped/fell back and pinched his genitals against the trailer rail.

IncidentDescription: When Tying load down with binder, driver felt a pop in left wrist. (Note: Doctor at South Texas Cost Containment told Billy Ray King Jr. that it was an old injury, he had calcium build up.)
InjuryDescripti: Felt a pop in left wrist while secureing load with binder. (Note: After evaluation it was determend that it was an old injury and had cacuim build up therefore causing discomfort and swelling. Employee desided to see his on doctor for ferther evaluation.)

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying down 4" drill pipe and had to use tongs to break connection due to joint being too t
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down 4" drill pipe and had to use tongs to break connection due to joint being too tight. The motorhand positioned his finger in at the tail end of the tongs while tong hand through the tongs back pinching his pinky finger in between the tong body and cable bracket. The ee was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to the tip of the left pinky finger due to pinching it between the tong body and cable clamp at the tail end of the tongs
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Ee was standing on well head to stab BOP's. Grabbed the joint of iron to catch balance. While grabbi
IncidentDescription: Ee was standing on well head to stab BOP's. Grabbed the joint of iron to catch balance. While grabbing iron, left middle finger became pinched between the joint of iron and the BOP's. After taking off gloves, saw that left middle finger had been cut open.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to middle finger of left hand.

IncidentSummary: Ee was helping Chase Melancon (another shop employee in Maurice) flange up BOP's in the shop. Chase
IncidentDescription: Ee was helping Chase Melancon (another shop employee in Maurice) flange up BOP's in the shop. Chase was swinging a sledge while ee was holding a rope attached to the hammer wrench. Suddenly, the wrench came off the nut striking ee in the left shin. There was no laceration with minimal swelling for the rest of the shift. Ee went to Mark Denette's office on 5-23-13 to show him the affected area. He still did not want to seek medical attention. On 5-25-13, ee sent picture of injury to Mark Denette via text, and injury appeared bruised and colored. We decided to get an appointment for evaluation.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to shin of left leg after being struck by wrench.

IncidentSummary: EE was driving company truck to have new tires installed. While at stop sign, our truck was struck f
IncidentDescription: EE was driving company truck to have new tires installed. While at stop sign, our truck was struck from behind. The configuration before the accident was as follows: our vehicle was behind two other vehicles at the stop sign. The first vehicle proceeded through the stop sign, the second pulled up and the third (our vehicle) moved up, keeping an appropriate distance from the car in front. While waiting for his turn to proceed, our truck was then struck from behind by another truck -- our vehicle did not make contact with the vehicle in front.
InjuryDescripti: unconfirmed -- neck strain resulting from MVA

IncidentSummary: Employee states that he was hurt on this date. They were performing a fishing job for slick line.
IncidentDescription: Employee states that he was hurt on this date. They were performing a fishing job for slick line. When they were changing out a tool he noticed a strain around his navel. Employee states that the pusher, John Benge, told him to go to the clinic in Vidor, TX the next morning. He states that the doctor at the clinic told him he had a hernia and he needed to follow up with his personal doctor when he returned home from the suitcase job. He worked another week and was terminated.
InjuryDescripti: alleges hernia

IncidentSummary: While hand was tightening a 3/4 inch bolt on 2 inch jet line, hand was on an open-end box-end wrench
IncidentDescription: While hand was tightening a 3/4 inch bolt on 2 inch jet line, hand was on an open-end box-end wrench towards his chest and he felt a pull in his right flank muscle about tho the fourth rib down
InjuryDescripti: While pulling on a wrench employee felt a strain on his right side flank muscle about the fourth rib down

IncidentSummary: Had a normal day at work. Regular activities. At the end of the day his back muscles tightened up.
IncidentDescription: Had a normal day at work. Regular activities. At the end of the day his back muscles tightened up.
InjuryDescripti: muscles tight in back

IncidentSummary: MISS falling blocks (ND)
IncidentDescription:
While installing the wiper rubber, the operator was going to pick up on the blocks. When he released the chain from the 
brake handle, his hand slipped off allowing the blocks to drop about one foot to the top of the tongs.

IncidentSummary: I.E was getting ready to make a connection by bringing slips closer to the rotary table. He set them
IncidentDescription: I.E was getting ready to make a connection by bringing slips closer to the rotary table. He set them down, after setting them down the slips fell over. Employee was walking back to pick them back up. As he moved in to pick them back up the I.E. right foot slpped causing him to do the splits. His right foot fell into rotary bowl resulting in his foot being struck by the spinning pipe 4 times.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot caused by foot slipping in rotary bowl while pipe was in it spinning.

IncidentSummary: while walking up stairs on shaker side, employee slipped with soap bucket in one hand and scrub brus
IncidentDescription: while walking up stairs on shaker side, employee slipped with soap bucket in one hand and scrub brush in the other hand. Because both hands were occupied employee was unable to get a 3 point contact on steps. this resulted in employee to fall backwards and lose balance resulting in a contusion to back of heel, right foot.
InjuryDescripti: diagnosed with sprained foot

IncidentSummary: MISS brkn transfer cylinder bracket (ND)
IncidentDescription:
While TOH with 1" rods, the derrick hand picked up with the transfer, heard a pop and saw the transfer cylinder raise instead of the triple hang. The 
transfer cylinder 
mounting bracket had broken. The blocks were brought back up and the elevator installed on rods to hold.

IncidentSummary: While rolling up drill line EE was standing on the fin of the spool using his body weight to roll it
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While rolling up drill line EE was standing on the fin of the spool using his body weight to roll it up. When EE's foot slipped off the fin while the spool was rolling, the fin came down pinning EE's left foot between the fin and the drill line spool skid.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion and numbness to left foot.

IncidentSummary: Coverall caught on fire. Employee removed them but inhaled smoke.
IncidentDescription: Coverall caught on fire. Employee removed them but inhaled smoke.

IncidentSummary: While making first swivel connection, tubing turned in slips. Emp set the back up on the tongs and
IncidentDescription: While making first swivel connection, tubing turned in slips. Emp set the back up on the tongs and had the stiff arm disconnected and the tongs spun around and hit him causing him to lose balance. He fell on his left knee.
InjuryDescripti: laceration to left knee

IncidentSummary: Crew was washing rig at the carwash when he slipped while washing the back of the rig near the valve
IncidentDescription: Crew was washing rig at the carwash when he slipped while washing the back of the rig near the valve banks and weight indicator. He was climbing down when he lost his footing due to water, oil, rig wash, grease, etc. Hit his left shoulder on a piece of 3" pipe that is welded in the back of the rig on "y" base
InjuryDescripti: left shoulder contusion

IncidentSummary: Employee was driving a company vehicle, a 2008 Ford F-250, on a hot shot. He was to drive to Cody,
IncidentDescription: Employee was driving a company vehicle, a 2008 Ford F-250, on a hot shot. He was to drive to Cody, WY from Billings, MT, pick up tools from the crew that was completing a job there and drive back to Billings, MT. This incident is still under investigation; but there was also a job up for the morning of June 2nd near Roscoe, MT. Employee was spotted along side of the road near Roscoe at approximately 6:00 am the morning of June 2nd. Employee then put fuel on in Columbus, MT (can find out from fuel receipt exactly what time this occurred). Employee then proceeded to drive to the Billings, MT shop. Employee hit the ditch on Interstate 90, eastbound, going approximately 75 MPH about 6-7 miles outside of Columbus, MT. Vehicle traveled 178 yards in the ditch, before hitting and smashing through a guard-rail (see photos). Employee phoned safety manager, who informed the appropriate employees. Air bag was deployed, employee also phoned emergency services. Employee was taken to the Columbus, MT hospital for precaution. He was released later that morning with a deep bone bruise in his left leg. A drug/alcohol test was administered in Billings, MT approximately 2 hours later.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left leg after traveling 178 yds through ditch and striking guardrail.

IncidentSummary: MISS Southwestern Energy pins (AR)
IncidentDescription: Operator looked up and noticed pins that hold up tubing board to derrick where sliding out.

IncidentSummary: EE was changing the spin rollers on the ST-80 and was using a 1 3/4" wrench to loosen the bolts. The
IncidentDescription: EE was changing the spin rollers on the ST-80 and was using a 1 3/4" wrench to loosen the bolts. The wrench slipped off of the bolt and struck him in the safety glasses and caused a cut under his left eye.
InjuryDescripti: laceration under left eye from wrench

IncidentSummary: Employees were cleaning the derrick during the evening of rig move at a staging area. Employee was i
IncidentDescription: Employees were cleaning the derrick during the evening of rig move at a staging area. Employee was inside the derrick scrubbing with a scrub brush and had a drip of soapy water land on his eye brow then drip into his eye causing irritation.
InjuryDescripti: Slight eye irritation

IncidentSummary: While operating tong, emp got splashed with hydra. oil when a 1/4" hose busted.
IncidentDescription: While operating tong, emp got splashed with hydra. oil when a 1/4" hose busted.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to face and eyes

IncidentSummary: Crew was tripping pipe into the hole. They had put approximately 2700 feet of pipe in the hole. Inju
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping pipe into the hole. They had put approximately 2700 feet of pipe in the hole. Injured employee was stabbing pipe. They latched on to the stand that had the rotating rubber on it and picked it up off the floor. Employee used a tail rope to tail it to the stump. When it got close to the stump he dropped the tail rope, put his hand on the rotating rubber, and started pushing the pipe towards the stump. The pipe had some momentum still and started to swing back toward the employee causing his hand to slip off the rotating rubber that was covered in dope and invert till just his fingers were pushing on the rubber. This caused his wrist to bend backwards and he said he heard a pop followed by moderate pain and slight swelling.
InjuryDescripti: Slight pain and swelling in left wrist

IncidentSummary: Crew were removing flow line from bell nipple and slid ring back from dresser sleeve. When it cleare
IncidentDescription: Crew were removing flow line from bell nipple and slid ring back from dresser sleeve. When it cleared the bell nipple, the hose fell and dresser sleeve bolt struck motorman Robert Tyer around his thumb area of his left hand. Employee was wearing gloves.

IncidentSummary: Employee was trying to loosened cap on suction manifold of frac tank with 5 ft. bar, when 5 ft. bar
IncidentDescription: Employee was trying to loosened cap on suction manifold of frac tank with 5 ft. bar, when 5 ft. bar slipped employee struck head against manifold cutting him above left eye.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was trying to loosen end cap on suction manifold of frac tank with 5 ft. bar when 5 ft. bar slipped causing employee to strick head against manifold cutting him above left eye.

IncidentDescription: While working his tour, ee became overheated and dehydrated.

IncidentSummary: Emp was changing out a swab and using a screwdriver to pry out a ring. He was having trouble with g
IncidentDescription: Emp was changing out a swab and using a screwdriver to pry out a ring. He was having trouble with grip and removed his gloves. He ended up cutting his left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: laceration of left thumb

IncidentSummary: While moving washer on derrick lock down bolt, the bolt fell on employees right ring finger, mashing
IncidentDescription: While moving washer on derrick lock down bolt, the bolt fell on employees right ring finger, mashing through impact glove.
InjuryDescripti: LACERATION TO RIGHT RING FINGER

IncidentSummary: While transfering rod to elevator, driller picked up on rod string. Driller did not give derrick ha
IncidentDescription: While transfering rod to elevator, driller picked up on rod string. Driller did not give derrick hand time to remove rod transfer off rod. Driller came down on rod string pulling transfer and cable loosing clamps. Employee was struck in the hard hat, but he is unsure of what hit him.
InjuryDescripti: no injury

IncidentSummary: Pusher left location to go to town and get lunch. In route back to work the pusher blacked out and
IncidentDescription: Pusher left location to go to town and get lunch. In route back to work the pusher blacked out and left the roadway and the truck went into ditch
InjuryDescripti: lower back trama

IncidentSummary: They were loading two 30 ft joints of pipe onto mudtank. Lester was on one end of the pipe and Defi
IncidentDescription: They were loading two 30 ft joints of pipe onto mudtank. Lester was on one end of the pipe and Defino and Omar were on the other end. They dropped their end of the pipe and Lester lost control of pipe, which bounced up and came down on his fingers
InjuryDescripti: ring finger and middle finger on left hand fractured

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped pipe (ND)
IncidentDescription:
While rigging up hydrotest tools, the operator ran the blocks up out of the way. As he brought the brake handle up, he bumped the slip control lever opening the 
slips. The pipe was dropped downhole.

IncidentSummary: When employee was attempting to pull a 3" vacuum hose over the hand rail behind the shakers the hand
IncidentDescription: When employee was attempting to pull a 3" vacuum hose over the hand rail behind the shakers the handrail broke. The employee lost his balance and fell from the walk way on the mud tanks down into the shale pit. Employee had a small bump on his left elbow but, was not seriously injured.
InjuryDescripti: A small bump on the of his left elbow; did not affect his ability to work. Employee said he was fine and able to work.

IncidentSummary: Ee was walking off hopper skid to stairs, lost his balance and hit his back against the hand rails.
IncidentDescription: Ee was walking off hopper skid to stairs, lost his balance and hit his back against the hand rails.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to back and neck from slip/fall off skid

IncidentSummary: Lifting pipe off trailer and putting it on the rig floor.
IncidentDescription: Lifting pipe off trailer and putting it on the rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: possible pulled muscle in the groin area

IncidentSummary: The crew went to rig up for a job and there were puddles of water on location. He was walking throug
IncidentDescription: The crew went to rig up for a job and there were puddles of water on location. He was walking through a puddle when he stepped into the mouse hole with his right leg.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion/bruise to right leg after walking through a puddle and stepping into a mouse hole.

IncidentSummary: Picking up tubing and pulled a muscle in his shoulder blade
IncidentDescription: Picking up tubing and pulled a muscle in his shoulder blade
InjuryDescripti: strain in shoulder blade

IncidentSummary: Ee was pre-tripping his truck to leave for rig move. As he was checking the radiator, he slipped off
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Ee was pre-tripping his truck to leave for rig move. As he was checking the radiator, he slipped off the fender and fell to the ground on his left side.
InjuryDescripti: checking the radiator, he slipped off the fender and fell to the ground on his left side resulting in sprain to left shoulder and contusion to left chest wall

IncidentSummary: EE was at the hopper weighting up for airgas kick. When it started to rain, he stepped under the hop
IncidentDescription: EE was at the hopper weighting up for airgas kick. When it started to rain, he stepped under the hopper house roof. He had one hand on the hopper and the other on the discharge valve of the bulk tank. Lightning struck nearby, EE told TP that he felt an electrical shock across his chest and both arms.
InjuryDescripti: electrical shock across chest and both arms

IncidentSummary: EE was pressure washing by shakers when he began to feel dizzy, stop sweating, vomiting. Another emp
IncidentDescription: EE was pressure washing by shakers when he began to feel dizzy, stop sweating, vomiting. Another employee brought him to the TP. Sat EE down, gave him Pedialyte and had him sit in the shade to rest.
InjuryDescripti: EE began to experience symptoms of heat exhaustion.

IncidentSummary: While hitting union on stand pipe with sledge hammer, hammer slipped in ee's hand due to gloves bein
IncidentDescription: While hitting union on stand pipe with sledge hammer, hammer slipped in ee's hand due to gloves being wet from rain and he hit his right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee

IncidentSummary: Ee complained of cramping and headaches after lunch. Possibly heat related, but ee states he may hav
IncidentDescription: Ee complained of cramping and headaches after lunch. Possibly heat related, but ee states he may have eaten something spoiled for lunch.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping and headache from either heat or spoiled food.

IncidentSummary: When ee attempted to pull the pad on lifted crane legs, it didn't move. Ee pulled harder on the pad
IncidentDescription: When ee attempted to pull the pad on lifted crane legs, it didn't move. Ee pulled harder on the pad and it flew out and hit left shin.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left shin after being struck by crane outrigger pad.

IncidentSummary: Ee was running lines from pump to pits and as he was putting force behind line to stick it into the
IncidentDescription: Ee was running lines from pump to pits and as he was putting force behind line to stick it into the hole on pits, he felt his left knee pop out of place then back into place.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to left knee

IncidentSummary: Ee was walking on base beam and stepped on dog ear. Ee fell down due to ankle being twisted.
IncidentDescription: Ee was walking on base beam and stepped on dog ear. Ee fell down due to ankle being twisted.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left ankle after twisting it as he walked on base beam and stepped on dog ear causing him to fall.

IncidentSummary: Ee was attempting to cut a bolt off using a grinder and the grinder jumped back on him. He lost his
IncidentDescription: Ee was attempting to cut a bolt off using a grinder and the grinder jumped back on him. He lost his grip on the handle and the disc struck 6"above his left wrist, on the under side, lacerating it.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to underside of left wrist

IncidentSummary: Employee was in the process of turning on the water well and when he went to start the engine he fe
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was in the process of turning on the water well and when he went to start the engine he felt a small bite 6" above his left wrist.
InjuryDescripti: irritation/inflammation 6" above left wirst

IncidentSummary: EE was hammering a pin into the spreader on the back of the bottom of the sub that was missing. As h
IncidentDescription: EE was hammering a pin into the spreader on the back of the bottom of the sub that was missing. As he was hammering the pin it kept moving. He had his hand underneath the pin to hold it in place while he was swinging. He hit it and it stuck in a little so he thought that he could hit it hard but he didn't remove his hand from the bottom of the pin. As he swung the hammer the pin moved and he struck the back of his hand with the hammer on the left hand pinky finger. He said he is feeling some pain on the knuckle where his finger meets his palm. Impact gloves were worn at time of incident.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand after hammering pin into spreader

IncidentSummary: Crew was attaching swivel yoke to block and air hoist chain was attached to side of yoke. Blocks wer
IncidentDescription: Crew was attaching swivel yoke to block and air hoist chain was attached to side of yoke. Blocks were lowered and hook was latched to yoke of swivel. Air hoist chain slipped up yoke to the center and ee went up to to level of swivel. He tapped with a shop hammer to free chain and when it came free, his left hand was pinched in hook of blocks when they closed.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to second finger on left hand. Examination with second doctor to be made later to see if there is an secondary injury

IncidentSummary: Ee was trying to free stuck tubing. Crew was torquing pipe with tongs when something let loose and t
IncidentDescription: Ee was trying to free stuck tubing. Crew was torquing pipe with tongs when something let loose and the pipe jumped. The sandline was caught and parted. Ee jumped from the floor injuring ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained sprain to right ankle after jumping from rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Ee was standing on the sub support beams which are at a 20 degree angle. The beams were wet due to
IncidentDescription: Ee was standing on the sub support beams which are at a 20 degree angle. The beams were wet due to a rain shower and ee slipped and fell, striking his forehead on the support beam.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration on forehead

IncidentSummary: Employees were putting on the cellar covers. The cellar was washed out and muddy when carrying them
IncidentDescription: Employees were putting on the cellar covers. The cellar was washed out and muddy when carrying them to put them on the ground caved in under him. His legs fell knee deep causing his left knee to pop. There is a bit of swelling but he doesn't want to get medical attention at this time so we are going to ice it down and put a wrap on it. We are monitoring at this time. No medical
InjuryDescripti: swelling to left knee after ground gave way

IncidentSummary: Ee and two other hands were on catwalk laying down tubing. The hand at the rear of catwalk removed t
IncidentDescription: Ee and two other hands were on catwalk laying down tubing. The hand at the rear of catwalk removed tubing from slide and the hand at the front of the catwalk dropped his end of tubing causing the tubing to slightly pinch ee's right index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to end of right index finger after it was caught under tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Ee was picking up tubing on ground and pulled back on right side.
IncidentDescription: Ee was picking up tubing on ground and pulled back on right side.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain back on the right side.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Ee was picking up polished rods. Polished rod clamps slid down polished rod resulting in striking ee
IncidentDescription: Ee was picking up polished rods. Polished rod clamps slid down polished rod resulting in striking ee on left hand and thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hand and thumb after being struck by clamp on polished rods. Continued to work for over one week without any apparent issues with his hand or thumb prior to going to the ER.

IncidentSummary: MISS HESS floor wing (ND)
IncidentDescription:
Pusher stepped on floor wing and the weld on the hinge broke.  This caused half of the wing to fall on top of the flow line.  The wing dropped approximately 1 foot 
before landing on the flow line.

IncidentSummary: Ee was pulling 2 3/4 x 21' gun off the back of trailer when it fell and caught the pinky finger of h
IncidentDescription: Ee was pulling 2 3/4 x 21' gun off the back of trailer when it fell and caught the pinky finger of his right hand between the gun and trailer. Ee was not wearing safety gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right pinky finger after it was caught between gun and trailer.

IncidentSummary: Ee was running rods into well. As he was taking off rod hook from elevator, the bail on the elevator
IncidentDescription: Ee was running rods into well. As he was taking off rod hook from elevator, the bail on the elevator fell over and pinched his left middle finger between bail and rod table.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to inside of left middle finger after it was caught between bail and rod table.

IncidentSummary: Ee was opening a suitcase lid by himself and felt a sharp pain in his lower right groin, down to his
IncidentDescription: Ee was opening a suitcase lid by himself and felt a sharp pain in his lower right groin, down to his scrotum area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right groin area while opening a suitcase lid.

IncidentSummary: Ee was operating the airhoist to retrieve MWD tool from monel collar. After the MWD hand had attache
IncidentDescription: Ee was operating the airhoist to retrieve MWD tool from monel collar. After the MWD hand had attached the retrieving tool, he flagged Jonathan to pull. As he pulled, the retrieving tool slipped off, throwing slack in the airhoist cable, and the cable hit ee in the mouth, chipping his front tooth. NOTE: the chipped tooth is artificial in nature.
InjuryDescripti: Chipped front tooth

IncidentSummary: As ee was coming up with the tongs, a cable fell from the derrick striking the hard hat, left arm an
IncidentDescription: As ee was coming up with the tongs, a cable fell from the derrick striking the hard hat, left arm and chest.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left arm and chest after being struck by cable which fell from the derrick.

IncidentSummary: Ee stepped off suitcase by mud pumps, in between water tank and mud tank, and twisted his left ankle
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Ee stepped off suitcase by mud pumps, in between water tank and mud tank, and twisted his left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strained left ankle

IncidentSummary: Doing a wiper trip, IE was on the make up tong. He grabbed the tong to make a connection and as soon
IncidentDescription: Doing a wiper trip, IE was on the make up tong. He grabbed the tong to make a connection and as soon as it was going to bite, the other end hit his side which impacted him and at that time his left wrist began to hurt.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left wrist

IncidentSummary: The floor hand was performing the coupling of vibrator hose coming from the pump to the stand pipe p
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: The floor hand was performing the coupling of vibrator hose coming from the pump to the stand pipe pine; held the hose with both hands while they slowly approached the pipe line that fits this hose with the nails of charger to deal with the union of the hose and proceed to make the coupling; however, the line consisting of a "T" turned resulting in contusion to right thumb.
InjuryDescripti: contusion to right thumb while handling stand pipe line

IncidentSummary: Crew was pulling tubing out of hole. Ee was trying to insert the DIW valve on top of the well head a
IncidentDescription: Crew was pulling tubing out of hole. Ee was trying to insert the DIW valve on top of the well head and the pressure of the salt well knocked him back, causing him to trip and fall.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion/abrasion to left knee after being knocked back by pressure of salt well.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving towards the rotary, getting ready to make a connection, when the double drill pipe str
IncidentDescription: IE was moving towards the rotary, getting ready to make a connection, when the double drill pipe struck him above his right eye, causing a laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration above right eyebrow

IncidentSummary: Ee was rigging down 4" rag hose that was used to wash out mud tanks and had minimal water in it. Whe
IncidentDescription: Ee was rigging down 4" rag hose that was used to wash out mud tanks and had minimal water in it. When he went to pull it out of the reserve pit, he felt a sharp pain in the left side of his groin area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right groin area

IncidentSummary: Ee jumped approx. 5 ft to ground from behind the controls of the crane when it started to roll over.
IncidentDescription: Ee jumped approx. 5 ft to ground from behind the controls of the crane when it started to roll over.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after jumping approx 5 ft to ground as boom truck/crane started to roll over.

IncidentSummary: Ee felt dizzy and lightheaded when working his tour.
IncidentDescription: Ee felt dizzy and lightheaded when working his tour.
InjuryDescripti: Heat exhaustion

IncidentSummary: While off-loading lubricator from a flatbed trailer, Gabriel Miller was operating the forklift and E
IncidentDescription: While off-loading lubricator from a flatbed trailer, Gabriel Miller was operating the forklift and Ee was guiding and stabilizing the load. The front right tire of the forklift rolled forward onto Ee's left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration and fracture to left foot after being rolled over by the right front tire of the forklift.

IncidentSummary: Ee was on air hoist #2. Operator of air hoist latched #1 air hoist to snubbing post. Instead of grab
IncidentDescription: Ee was on air hoist #2. Operator of air hoist latched #1 air hoist to snubbing post. Instead of grabbing air hoist #1 lever, he accidentally grabbed #2 causing ee to be dragged around the outside of the derrick board and his left shoulder hit the board. He was not wearing the tag line because he was on the outside of the board and it was not needed.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder and back while rigging down.

IncidentSummary: Ee and rig manager were working on the pressure washer and ST-80 dies under safety booth under a tar
IncidentDescription: Ee and rig manager were working on the pressure washer and ST-80 dies under safety booth under a tarp, which provided shade, when ee suffered heat exhaustion.
InjuryDescripti: Heat exhaustion

IncidentSummary: While on the forklift moving pipe, Ee felt a slight cramp on the right side of his back.
IncidentDescription: While on the forklift moving pipe, Ee felt a slight cramp on the right side of his back.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced a slight cramp (strain) to the right side of his back while operating forklift.

IncidentSummary: Sustained contusion to left hand after slipping off valve he was standing on and falling 4 ft to gro
IncidentDescription: Sustained contusion to left hand after slipping off valve he was standing on and falling 4 ft to ground.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion/bruise to left hand after landing on it after falling 4 ft off valve.

IncidentSummary: Ee was finishing rig-up procedures and started getting nauseated and throwing up.
IncidentDescription: Ee was finishing rig-up procedures and started getting nauseated and throwing up.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion.

IncidentSummary: Ee was tailing 2" CT pipe cut in 40' section down to ground from man lift. Rope used to lower CT pip
IncidentDescription: Ee was tailing 2" CT pipe cut in 40' section down to ground from man lift. Rope used to lower CT pipe slipped off the end of pipe and pipe dropped to ground. Pipe hit the ground and bounced into Ee's right side torso and knocked him to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right side of torso after pipe bounced, hit him and knocked him to the ground.

IncidentSummary: Removing the swivel assembly from rotary bowl. Winch line was attached to bell region of swivel. Ope
IncidentDescription: Removing the swivel assembly from rotary bowl. Winch line was attached to bell region of swivel. Operator hoisted the swivel assembly from the rotary table bowl and employees began to push it to the rig floor. When at desired area, operator lowered swivel assembly. Due to the tremendous weight of the swivel when the air volume was reduced to the winch lifting device, swivel dropped abruptly, allowing the bell to momentarily fall toward the rotary. Ee's fingers were pinched between the lower bell area and the swivel body.
InjuryDescripti: Fingers were pinched between the lower bell area and the swivel body resulting in crush injury to fingers and eventual amputation.

IncidentSummary: Ee and the welder were removing a 2" 5000 lb wheel valve from the kill line under the subs. The area
IncidentDescription: Ee and the welder were removing a 2" 5000 lb wheel valve from the kill line under the subs. The area was very restricted to work in and to be able to swing the hammer. As ee was trying to knock the valve loose, the hammer clipped something and struck ee on the shin.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shin

IncidentSummary: Tongs were pushed over handrail while running casing. Ee and driller pushed tongs out and picked the
IncidentDescription: Tongs were pushed over handrail while running casing. Ee and driller pushed tongs out and picked them up to bring back to rig floor. As tongs cleared handrail, they swung toward the floor and ee was caught between tong arm and 2" water pipe valve and his sustained an abrasion.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to lower back

IncidentSummary: Ee was opening latch on the doghouse and caught his right thumb between latches. He was not wearing
IncidentDescription: Ee was opening latch on the doghouse and caught his right thumb between latches. He was not wearing gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right thumb after it was caught between latches of doghouse as he was opening it. He was not wearing gloves.

IncidentSummary: MISS Chris Bain/Broken chains
IncidentDescription:
Casing would not go to bottom so company ordered 24" tooth bit. When we got ready to make it up, bit breaker would not 
fit rotary table so company man asked could we use chain to hold back up to make up bit so we did. We wrapped chain 
on it and also wrapped chain around snubbing post at V-door and torqued it up.  All hands were inside top house while we 
torqued it up.  When we got ready to break bit we wrapped chain around bit and snubbing post at V-door for back up 
because we didn't have bit breaker and hands got inside house. Chain had broken the hook and 18 links fell in hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry Petroleum/blocks, topdrive
IncidentDescription:
While running production casing, the driller and crews stopped to install a rotating rubber.  Crew got the rubber on the 
floor. The driller slacked off a joint of casing into the rubber and chained the brake down.  The driller then proceeded to 
operate the hoist controls from opposite side of floor for a better view of employees' operation. The blocks began slacking 
off contacting the blocks on the top drive.  Driller immediately stopped blocks and operation.

IncidentSummary: EE said he had lifted a mud sack and felt a burn in his abdominal area like had been bitten on 06-30
IncidentDescription: EE said he had lifted a mud sack and felt a burn in his abdominal area like had been bitten on 06-30-13. EE came to TP about 20:00 on 07-01-13 and told TP about a knot in lower abdominal area. TP looked at knot and called Safety Department. -- From report
InjuryDescripti: EE alleges abdominal strain after picking up mud sack.

IncidentSummary: Sucker rod picked up with transfer which hung on rod already in basket. Rod in basket fell, striking
IncidentDescription: Sucker rod picked up with transfer which hung on rod already in basket. Rod in basket fell, striking EE on head.
InjuryDescripti: pipe struck top of employee's head, resulting in scalp laceration

IncidentSummary: Ee had been helping with rig up and preparing tool runs for the day's operations. He noted that some
IncidentDescription: Ee had been helping with rig up and preparing tool runs for the day's operations. He noted that sometime during the course of the day he had stressed his right wrist. He did not notice the stress to his wrist until after the job was completed. The next day, ee was on a plug and cement job when he started to notice weakness in his right wrist, which he then reported.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right wrist after helping with rig up and preparations for the day's operations.

IncidentSummary: Ee was trying to unload pipe from pipe rack. When pulling on the pipe his right hand popped, and he
IncidentDescription: Ee was trying to unload pipe from pipe rack. When pulling on the pipe his right hand popped, and he had trouble moving fingers. Ee's hand was iced, and he declined medical treatment.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right hand while unloading pipe from rack.

IncidentSummary: Ee was trying to break a connection using a pipe wrench. Right middle finger was pinched between ton
IncidentDescription: Ee was trying to break a connection using a pipe wrench. Right middle finger was pinched between tongs and the pipe wrench.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right middle finger after it was pinched between tongs and pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: Ee was walking out from under the substructure and stepped on the cellar cover on the 1st well drill
IncidentDescription: Ee was walking out from under the substructure and stepped on the cellar cover on the 1st well drilled on a 3 hole pad. The cellar cover slipped out from under him, causing him to fall in cellar. He caught himself by his arms and he sustained scratches underneath his right arm to his elbow.
InjuryDescripti: EE slipped into cellar, catching himself, resulting in abrasions underneath right arm.

IncidentSummary: Ee was running rod tongs. Ee was walking back to the doghouse when the toolpusher noticed the Ee was
IncidentDescription: Ee was running rod tongs. Ee was walking back to the doghouse when the toolpusher noticed the Ee was looking pale and had stopped sweating. It was 30 minutes after his last break.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion. It was 30 minutes after last break.

IncidentSummary: Ee was walking to rig floor to tighten up stuffing box. Fell through middle of floor and scraped rig
IncidentDescription: Ee was walking to rig floor to tighten up stuffing box. Fell through middle of floor and scraped right leg.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to right leg after falling through middle of rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Ee was taking the Washington bolts off from under the floor. While walking out from under the floor,
IncidentDescription: Ee was taking the Washington bolts off from under the floor. While walking out from under the floor, ee stood up and struck head against stairs resulting in a strained neck.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to neck after striking it on stairs as he was walking out from under floor.

IncidentSummary: Ee was rearranging equipment in bottom doghouse. While putting shaker motor in bench, ee's finger wa
IncidentDescription: Ee was rearranging equipment in bottom doghouse. While putting shaker motor in bench, ee's finger was pinched.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left middle finger

IncidentSummary: Ee was tiring off some drill pipe to pick up to V-dor when he started cramping and was overheated.
IncidentDescription: Ee was tiring off some drill pipe to pick up to V-dor when he started cramping and was overheated.
InjuryDescripti: Heat exhaustion

IncidentSummary: The pump hose was being disconnected from the pump manifold. The hose came loose and struck Ee on le
IncidentDescription: The pump hose was being disconnected from the pump manifold. The hose came loose and struck Ee on left shin above the ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained an abrasion to left shin above ankle after being struck by pump hose.

IncidentSummary: Crews were preparing to trip out of the hole. Ee was attempting to secure the mud bucket to the draw
IncidentDescription: Crews were preparing to trip out of the hole. Ee was attempting to secure the mud bucket to the drawworks using a rope and clevis by handling it with his right hand. With his left hand, he decided to attempt to swing the tongs on the "Off-Driller" side out of the way in order to allow the mud bucket to clear the area around the ST-80. When he attempted to latch the clevis to secure the mud bucket, he mistimed it and the tongs swung back and pinched his right little finger between the mud bucket and tong housing. Ee was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: EE hand caught between mud bucket and tong housing resulting in deep bruising to right pinky finger.

IncidentSummary: In the process of rigging down. EE was suspended appx 20 ft when tension limiter cable broke resulti
IncidentDescription: In the process of rigging down. EE was suspended appx 20 ft when tension limiter cable broke resulting in the EE falling, striking top drive assembly.
InjuryDescripti: Fall from appx 20 ft height as the result of the cable leading to the tension limiter breaking, struck top drive assembly.

IncidentSummary: Just finished cementing 5-1/2" casing and rigged down casing crew. Ee went to remove elevators, took
IncidentDescription: Just finished cementing 5-1/2" casing and rigged down casing crew. Ee went to remove elevators, took out bolts on the link ear of elevators. Elevators cocked sideways when removing bolts and Ee's left index finger was pinched, causing blood blister and smashed fingernail.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to top of left index finger, a blood blister and smashed finger nail

IncidentSummary: Ee had Strung Stage 6. Ee and two other employees were lifting 300 lb gun over some other guns on th
IncidentDescription: Ee had Strung Stage 6. Ee and two other employees were lifting 300 lb gun over some other guns on the trailer. While lifting and stretching over guns, ee felt a burning in his abdomen.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced burning in his left and right groin areas while helping to lift 300 lb gun over some other guns on trailer.

IncidentSummary: Ee became light headed and disoriented while working on location. Fellow employee saw the symptoms.
IncidentDescription: Ee became light headed and disoriented while working on location. Fellow employee saw the symptoms.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion while performing duties.

IncidentSummary: Ee was on the ground moving some boards when his back began to cramp. He also experienced nausea.
IncidentDescription: Ee was on the ground moving some boards when his back began to cramp. He also experienced nausea.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced nausea and cramps in back while moving boards.

IncidentSummary: Crew was nippling up BOPs. In putting on the choke line to block on festoon skid, they needed to tur
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Crew was nippling up BOPs. In putting on the choke line to block on festoon skid, they needed to turn the choke line a little more to get studs started. While trying to get choke line to turn, the line let loose, swinging towards Ee and hit him on the right leg. When the choke line hit his leg, it forced his leg into a pole on the festoon skid at the same time.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right ankle

IncidentSummary: Ee and two other floor hands were tripping pipe. Ee was doping the pipe. Ee came off the floor and s
IncidentDescription: Ee and two other floor hands were tripping pipe. Ee was doping the pipe. Ee came off the floor and said he had thrown up. He was told to drink plenty of water and sit in the truck with the AC on. He refused to be taken to the doctor. He mentioned, after the fact, that he had called his girlfriend to come and get him.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion while working on rig floor doping pipe.

IncidentSummary: The Ee and floorhand were on the floor working on the tongs when the Ee directed another worker to u
IncidentDescription: The Ee and floorhand were on the floor working on the tongs when the Ee directed another worker to unlock the manual locks on the pipe rams. The worker proceeded to the accumulator and opened the rams releasing gas and oil onto the Ee and floorhand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained possible irritation to multiple external body parts after gas and oil was released.

IncidentSummary: The rig operator and Ee were on the floor working on the tongs when the operator directed another wo
IncidentDescription: The rig operator and Ee were on the floor working on the tongs when the operator directed another worker to unlock the manual locks on the pipe rams. The worker proceeded to the accumulator and opened the rams releasing gas and oil onto the operator and Ee.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced possible irritation due to contact with oil and gas when the rams were opened.

IncidentSummary: Ee stepped off the tongs into a dip on the floor. When he put his weight on his right foot, he rolle
IncidentDescription: Ee stepped off the tongs into a dip on the floor. When he put his weight on his right foot, he rolled his ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle after stepping off tongs into dip on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: EE was told by driller to move flange sitting on pallet by water tanks and place in junk box. EE the
IncidentDescription: EE was told by driller to move flange sitting on pallet by water tanks and place in junk box. EE then asked another hand to help him pick it up and the hand also told him to use a forklift. The driller and the other floorhand walked off to discuss other jobs that needed to be done. Ee decided to move the flange by hand and proceeded across the backside of the mud pits towards the junk box. Halfway to the junk box, he stated that he stopped for a rest and set the flange down. A third party hand was there and picked the flange up to see how heavy it was. He sat it back down, standing it up on its' edge. They stepped back and started talking when the flange fell over on EE's right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot

IncidentSummary: EE was helping the derrickman swap pumps and when he stepped off the pump skid, he stepped on a rock
IncidentDescription: EE was helping the derrickman swap pumps and when he stepped off the pump skid, he stepped on a rock and rolled his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Right ankle strained while swapping out pumps.

IncidentSummary: EE was tightening the clamp on the service loop and when he finished the task, he came back down to
IncidentDescription: EE was tightening the clamp on the service loop and when he finished the task, he came back down to the rig floor and noticed that he had a slight cut on his left index finger. The glove was not torn and crew member did not know where he had gotten the cut.
InjuryDescripti: laceration to left index finger

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/BOP
IncidentDescription:
Started testing pipe rams, low test to 300 was good so tester let driller know that he was starting to test high to 5000 psi. 
Tester pressured up to 5000  psi and rig crew heard a loud bang and then stopped the job to check equipment. Rig crew 
noticed a lock down screw was gone off well head.

IncidentSummary: EE and co-worker were driving pin into derrick. Co-worker was lightly striking pin while EE was hold
IncidentDescription: EE and co-worker were driving pin into derrick. Co-worker was lightly striking pin while EE was holding it to get pin started. Pin slipped out of padeye as EE caught it. Co-worker was in motion to strike it and EE's right middle finger was between pin and hammer/
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger

IncidentSummary: While rigging up, the rig was a half mast with t-bar in place. Ee was inside the derrick putting der
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, the rig was a half mast with t-bar in place. Ee was inside the derrick putting derrick and safety pin in the derrick. Alexander Rook was holding the drum brakes with a bar we had welded on so that we can leave our operator stand on the derrick. Alexander noticed some hoses hung up on derrick. He let go of the brake bar to get the hoses that were hung up and the t-bar did not hold the traveling blocks letting the blocks fall a few feet striking the Ee on his left hip. This caused him to fall onto the back of the rig striking his lower back and right shoulder. When Alexander noticed the blocks were coming down, he immediately grabbed the brake bar and stopped the blocks.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion and strain to lower back and right shoulder after being struck on the hip by falling blocks causing him to fall onto the back of the rig and strike his lower back and right shoulder.

IncidentSummary: While pushing back a stand of pipe, EE felt a pop in his left knee. On the next stand he was pushing
IncidentDescription: While pushing back a stand of pipe, EE felt a pop in his left knee. On the next stand he was pushing back, he felt anther pop but this time he could not bear weight on his knee. EE's knee started to swell and he started having difficulty walking and was complaining of pain in his knee.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee

IncidentSummary: While coming out of hole, Ee grabbed elevators while they were coming down and pushed them away from
IncidentDescription: While coming out of hole, Ee grabbed elevators while they were coming down and pushed them away from him. His right hand slipped off elevators resulting in them swinging toward Ee and striking right hand with elevator horn.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a slight abrasion and contusion to right thumb after being struck by elevator horn.

IncidentSummary: EE was pressure washing off drill side stairs to drawworks when he stepped on pressure washer hose a
IncidentDescription: EE was pressure washing off drill side stairs to drawworks when he stepped on pressure washer hose and twisted his right ankle. He fell face down on drawworks floor and co-worker came and helped him up. EE went into change house and sat down for 10-15 minutes. Then he went to rig floor and told the driller what happened.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle

IncidentSummary: Ee felt overheated while rigging up BOP stack. Ee had been without blood pressure medicine for 1 m
IncidentDescription: Ee felt overheated while rigging up BOP stack. Ee had been without blood pressure medicine for 1 month.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: Ee didn't put stiff arm on tongs. Tongs came around and struck right arm. Ee kept working because it
IncidentDescription: Ee didn't put stiff arm on tongs. Tongs came around and struck right arm. Ee kept working because it didn't hurt. When it started to swell he reported it to rig manager.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right arm after being struck by tongs.

IncidentSummary: EE was climbing over bypass line and slipped, twisting his right foot.
IncidentDescription: EE was climbing over bypass line and slipped, twisting his right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Strained right foot

IncidentSummary: While pulling joint of pipe back in board, EE stepped the wrong way on finger and leftt foot slipped
IncidentDescription: While pulling joint of pipe back in board, EE stepped the wrong way on finger and leftt foot slipped in between fingers, causing him to hit ankle on finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left ankle

IncidentSummary: Ee and another employee were unloading a Baker #20 setting tool on wash rack. There was already a se
IncidentDescription: Ee and another employee were unloading a Baker #20 setting tool on wash rack. There was already a setting tool in the vice. Morington Vitte set his end of the tool on the ground, and when Ee bent over to slide the tool it hit a divot in the concrete and fell 15" striking top of right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion/abrasion to top of right foot after being struck by Baker #20 setting tool as it was being unloaded from wash rack.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up flare line (4" panic lines) had to manually move the last joint over the clamps on
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While rigging up flare line (4" panic lines) had to manually move the last joint over the clamps on the flare stack. While holding the pipe, the co-workers moved to pipe to put in place to slide it over clamps. EE's right middle finger got caught in between pipe and hand.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right middle finger, laceration to right hand while rigging up flare line.

hand was tailing pipe off of the wrangler when the tail rope slid off of the bottom of the joint causing it to swing and nearly

IncidentDescription: Employee went to swing the hammer and almost hit someone that was standing behind him.

IncidentDescription: While making up stand with ST-80 employee was almost truck by ST-80.

IncidentDescription: Employee was setting slips while ST-80 operator was bringing the ST-80 forward nearly hitting the employee with the ST-80

IncidentSummary: Employees were attempting to turn an 8" OD diameter mud motor around on the ground so that the box e
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employees were attempting to turn an 8" OD diameter mud motor around on the ground so that the box end would be facing in the appropriate direction for picking it up to rig floor in order to make up intermediate BHA. In doing so, they were using the forklift to set the mud motor on boards and go to the other side and pick it back up from the ground. While setting the mud motor off the forks. the mud motor rolled further than anticipated, rolling into EE's left ankle and, consequently, rolling his ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to left foot and ankle

IncidentDescription: A pallet of bar was being moved over to the pre mix. After picking up the pallet began to break apart.

IncidentDescription: Employee notice hyrdraulic line under foot as crew was walking the rig.

IncidentDescription: While working with 11.6# cal/cloride, chemicals went through slicker suit due to hole obtained while working

IncidentSummary: IE was stepping off suitcase by the #1 mud pump when his right foot came down on the ground. The gro
IncidentDescription: IE was stepping off suitcase by the #1 mud pump when his right foot came down on the ground. The ground gave way causing his leg to fall in the drainage ditch and right knee was sprained.

IncidentDescription: When hammering union to tighten it, employee missed and sledge hammer slipped and fell out of hands.

When going up the ladder to tighten the flow line leak, employee noticed the ladder was not secured to the ground and had

IncidentSummary: EE went to put a 4" hose on frac tank, valve was closed on frac tank. Pulled 4" cam lock off and mud
IncidentDescription: EE went to put a 4" hose on frac tank, valve was closed on frac tank. Pulled 4" cam lock off and mud came out of valve and went into EE's eye. Ten bbls of mud was lost before getting hose on.

IncidentSummary: Ee was under the floor loosening BOP nuts when the wiper rubber box slid off the BOP's striking Ee i

IncidentDescription: employees were picking up pipe when one employee nearly had a hand pinched between a joint of pipe and the stand.

IncidentDescription: While tripping in the hole and picking up the stand to tail it in, the tail rope almost came off of the bottom of the pipe

Employee was hammering up union and he swung the hammer, missed the union, hammer went flying out of his hands and

IncidentDescription: Employee was removing thread protectors off of joint and dropped it and it nearly rolled out of the v-door which could have hit someone.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80
IncidentDescription:
Employee was helping to pull the ST-80 over to stand to mark it up, operator came ahead a little fast with ST-80 to pipe nearly

IncidentDescription: Hand was rolling casing and forgot to put a thread protector on a joint of pipe casing which could have damaged the joint.

While loader operator was picking up the shaker skid he did not get both forks under it and nearly picked up to unbalance his

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/manlift, lights
IncidentDescription: A crew member was in the manlift, placing lights onto one of the buildings when one almost fell

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/hard choke line
IncidentDescription:
A hand was removing a stud from the hard choke line, it was the last stud between choke house and the line and that's where 
he was standing. If he would have stayed there to remove the last stud, when the stud was removed, the line would have 
jumped to the choke house and he would have gotten hurt between them.

IncidentSummary: EE was hammering up nuts on the choke hose connecting to the block and hard line, using a hammer wre
IncidentDescription: EE was hammering up nuts on the choke hose connecting to the block and hard line, using a hammer wrench and hammer. While swinging down at the hammer wrench, EE completely missed the wrench. In missing the wrench with a full swing, his right hand slid down the hammer handle and got pinched between the hammer handle and the hammer wrench, causing his right finger to split open.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right index finger

IncidentSummary: Generator motor #1 was shutting off due to low fuel pressure. EE and toolpusher had just finished ch
IncidentDescription: Generator motor #1 was shutting off due to low fuel pressure. EE and toolpusher had just finished changing the inline fuel filter. The engine had been primed and started. Toolpusher left and went back to shack. EE decided to take off air filter and blow it out. As he took the cover off and started to remove the filter, he felt resistance from the suction of the turbo. As the air filter came loose, it twisted and EE lost his balance, causing his left hand to be sucked into the turbo and his index and middle finger were impacted. This caused a small laceration on his index finger and partial amputation of the middle finger to halfway up the fingernail.
InjuryDescripti: Tip amputation of left middle finger and laceration to left index when hand was sucked into turbo.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/hammer slip
IncidentDescription:
An employee was hammering up choke line, the employee was swinging the hammer when he missed the hammer wrench 
causing the hammer to fly out of his hands and he nearly struck another employee

IncidentDescription: While putting on a choke line a crew member put himself in a pinch point between choke line and stair tower.

IncidentDescription: Hand was pushing back a stand and slipped on the floor

IncidentDescription: While pulling slips from mousehole, hand ALMOST set slips on his own foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/trip hazard
IncidentDescription: Hand almost tripped over pressure washer.

IncidentDescription: Crew was bleeding pressure from well bore to gas buster on mud tank, as is normal procedure, when gas ignited in vicinity of mud tank resulting in injury to crew member.

While getting a thread protector out of skate on  catwalk, employee didn't wait until trough was all the way down and nearly 
got his feet crushed.

IncidentSummary: Breaking out a 6" drill collar and EE knelt down with his head facing the air hoist when the driller
IncidentDescription: Breaking out a 6" drill collar and EE knelt down with his head facing the air hoist when the driller pulled on the breakout tongs. The latch popped open and hit EE on the head.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to head above left eye

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/non-tethered tools, derrick
IncidentDescription:
Employee went to derrick board to mousehole a stand when he found non tethered tools that were being used in the derrick 
shack.

IncidentSummary: While changing out M.W.D. tool, the crew was laying down lift sub on floor from the stump with the e
IncidentDescription: While changing out M.W.D. tool, the crew was laying down lift sub on floor from the stump with the elevators. While he opened the elevators, they released, pinching his right ring finger between the horn on the elevators and a drill collar that was in the mouse hole.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger

IncidentSummary: MISS potential fire (ND)
IncidentDescription:
Crew started hot box on rig to test it. A small rag under the box started to smolder. There was no flame, and well was not open 
at the time.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped rod string (ND)
IncidentDescription:
RIH with rod string, this rod string had to be backed off. Crew had been RIH with rods for about an hour checking every 
connection as they went. A 3/4 hang in the 
derrick. The bottom rod came unscrewed falling to the floor. Floor hand picked up rod and tailed it out to rack.

IncidentSummary: Crew was pulling the BOP off and grabbed the wipping plate with ring grabber. Mike Mullery stated th
IncidentDescription: Crew was pulling the BOP off and grabbed the wipping plate with ring grabber. Mike Mullery stated that the plate was coming off. The Ee walked in front of the BOP, as it was coming off, and the plate landed on the Ee's back. The plate weighs approximately 25 pounds and was around 7 feet off the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to back after being struck by wipping plate.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/cementer's stand, leak
IncidentDescription: Cementer's stand pipe started leaking during cement job.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/cementers, wipe check
IncidentDescription:
When cementers were done putting their head on joint they started to walk away saying they were done with no whip check 
on their iron.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/shakers, pressure washer
IncidentDescription:
While cleaning shakers an employee was spraying. The person operating  the pressure washer didn't realize that someone 
was walking by. The potential for debris flying through the air and hitting the person walking by was there.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tugger
IncidentDescription:
Tugger operator was raising pipe from wrangler, paying attention only to the line above the chive. Hand was not ready for the 
tail and had to catch pipe with his hands instead of with rope. Major pinch points for hands instead of using rope.

IncidentSummary: Floorhand had power washed unit on forklift. Injured employee saw 4x6 post in front of wheel, bent o
IncidentDescription: Floorhand had power washed unit on forklift. Injured employee saw 4x6 post in front of wheel, bent over to move wood out of way. When he stood up, he felt sharp pain in lower left back.
InjuryDescripti: lower back strain after moving 4x6 wooden post

IncidentSummary: When pulling out of hole using spinner tongs, EE got caught between spinner tong and rig tong. He wa
IncidentDescription: When pulling out of hole using spinner tongs, EE got caught between spinner tong and rig tong. He was hit in right arm by spinner tong pushing him into rig tong striking his waist area. He states he has some pain in left leg.
InjuryDescripti: contusion to left hip after being struck and caught in-between spinner tong and rig tong.

IncidentSummary: Ee was lowering platform stairs to the ground when right foot was underneath footing of stairs. The
IncidentDescription: Ee was lowering platform stairs to the ground when right foot was underneath footing of stairs. The stairs landed on his steel toe boot on the right side of his right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right side of right foot after losing footing and being struck by stairs.

IncidentSummary: Ee was working the brake handle and the pads on the brake were stuck. The pads popped off and caused
IncidentDescription: Ee was working the brake handle and the pads on the brake were stuck. The pads popped off and caused the brake handle to strike the employee on his wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusions to left wrist after being struck by the brake handle.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/elevators
IncidentDescription:
Hands were on the floor waiting to make connection. Hand was standing next to pipe in mousehole and was almost hit by the 
elevators that were being lowered. The other hand on the floor was watching his back and told him to get out of the way.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/forklift, electrical cord
IncidentDescription:
Employee was operating forklift when he nearly ran over an electrical cord with the tires but another employee stopped him in 
time.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, forklift, lube pallet
IncidentDescription:
Third party hand was using loader, hand nearly backed into a pallet of lube. PES hand stopped the third party hand before he 
did.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/topdrive, hand placement
IncidentDescription:
While making a connection with topdrive employee was going to stab pipe with one hand partially on pin end and nearly 
pinched his hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/topdrive, wrench
IncidentDescription: A crescent wrench was spotted on top of top drive while raising derrick that was removed before falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/racking pipe
IncidentDescription: Employee was racking back drill pipe getting in too big of a hurry and almost smashed hand between pipe on bank and joint he was racking back.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/3P, wrangler
IncidentDescription:
Started running casing, casing company had new crew member working the floor. When our deckhand ran joint of casing up to 
the floor in the pipe wrangler the casing crew member wasn't aware of the wrangler behind him causing him to get almost 
pinched or hit by the wrangler.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/mud bucket, hand placement
IncidentDescription:
Crew was tripping out of the hole. Pipe was wet. Crew was using air controlled mud bucket. When they were putting mud 
bucket on pipe the guys were putting their hands in the way. Possibly smashing or cutting fingers and hands.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/mud pump, leaking caps
IncidentDescription:
Derrick hand was isolating mud pump to work on pump. They started taking off the caps to go through valves. They noticed 
they were leaking mud so derrick hand went and checked to make sure all suction valves were closed. One of them was left 
open causing possible spill of water based mud onto floor of pump and ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/union
IncidentDescription:
