driller was about to kick in pumps when employee noticed a union was leaking and he stopped driller until union was 
hammered properly with out leaks

IncidentSummary: Driller and EE were rigging down the weight indicator. EE bent down to loosen the set screw that hol
IncidentDescription: Driller and EE were rigging down the weight indicator. EE bent down to loosen the set screw that holds the weight indicator up. When he broke the set screw loose, the weight of the indicator caused it to slide down inside the pipe that it sits in, falling on top of EE's right hand, pinching it between the wrench that he was using to loosen set screw and the weight indicator. Right thumb was dislocated.
InjuryDescripti: Dislocation of right thumb while rigging down the weight indicator.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/drill line, gloves
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Employees were rolling up cut drill line one of the employees went to grab a hold of the drill line bare handed. Employee was 
stopped and was told to put on gloves before helping in task.

IncidentSummary: EE was trying to hook up a gas buster line with the aid of a crane. The line was twisted at the hamm
IncidentDescription: EE was trying to hook up a gas buster line with the aid of a crane. The line was twisted at the hammer union so it would not go into place. They hooked a chain to one end and tried to turn it with the crane. This didn't work so the crane set it down and the EE started to walk away up the mud tank steps. As he got to the steps, the gas buster line rolled forward pinching the EE's leg between the skid of the mud tanks and the gas buster line. The line striking the EE's leg caused a strain to the calf and a small laceration to the shin. NOTE: the last action of the crane operator helped in this incident not being worse. He was paying attention and picked up the load so the EE did not take the full impact.
InjuryDescripti: strain to right calf and a minor scratch on shin while trying to connect gas buster line.

IncidentSummary: Ee was travelling on dirt road and was unable to see because of the dusty conditions. When EE attemp
IncidentDescription: Ee was travelling on dirt road and was unable to see because of the dusty conditions. When EE attempted to pass vehicle in front of him, he hit a farm tractor travelling in the other lane.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained sprain to right ankle after being involved in a vehicle accident.

IncidentSummary: Ee was moving boxes in warehouse by sliding them over the floor, and a box fell and hit EE below lef
IncidentDescription: Ee was moving boxes in warehouse by sliding them over the floor, and a box fell and hit EE below left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion below left knee after a box he was moving fell over and struck him.

IncidentSummary: EE was cleaning paint gun with starting fluid and paint thinner. Paint thinner got onto his shirt a
IncidentDescription: EE was cleaning paint gun with starting fluid and paint thinner. Paint thinner got onto his shirt and after sometime his arm started to get warm and tingling. He moved his sleeve up and saw a chemical burn on his left arm from his wrist to his elbow about 2" wide.
InjuryDescripti: Chemical burn to left arm from wrist to elbow

IncidentSummary: Well tripping wet with salt water mud when EE got a rash on both of his elbows.
IncidentDescription: Well tripping wet with salt water mud when EE got a rash on both of his elbows.
InjuryDescripti: Both elbows were irritated

IncidentSummary: Pulling shaft from drawworks with boom line and was going to swing it over to choke house. EE was ho
IncidentDescription: Pulling shaft from drawworks with boom line and was going to swing it over to choke house. EE was holding onto tag line when shaft started swinging around. Ee's hand got tangled in tagline strung across the floor and got stuck on handrail and tagline pinched EE's hand and pulled on it.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/gloves
IncidentDescription:
While tripping pipe in the hole, employee was having a hard time holding onto the pipe while trying to stab the stand in the drill 
string. His gloves were very dirty and couldn't get a grip on the pipe.

IncidentSummary: Ee was laying down one joint of tubing and missed a step, stepped off catwalk and fell to the ground
IncidentDescription: Ee was laying down one joint of tubing and missed a step, stepped off catwalk and fell to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left calf after stepping off catwalk and falling to the ground.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Driller was breaking union on casing with sledge hammer and missed hitting EE on right shin.
IncidentDescription: Driller was breaking union on casing with sledge hammer and missed hitting EE on right shin.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to shin of right leg after being struck by sledge hammer being used by the driller.

IncidentSummary: Picked up the pipe off the ground. Martyn was picking up the pipe and EE was doing something else. H
IncidentDescription: Picked up the pipe off the ground. Martyn was picking up the pipe and EE was doing something else. He ran to show the new hand how to do it. The rabbit got stuck on the pipe and the operator stopped the pipe 4+ feet above the ground. Julio was standing in front of the pipe when the rabbit came out and hit EE between the leg and stomach.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to abdomen after being struck by rabbit.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loader, fork alignment
IncidentDescription:
Employee was picking up pipe from finger racks with loader and didn't have forks aligned so one fork was above the pipe and 
the other was under it

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/rig floor
IncidentDescription:
Floorhand was cleaning up tools off of the rig floor when he bent over by the bails and stood up too fast and 
almost hit his head. He caught himself quickly

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hydraulic hose, topdrive
IncidentDescription: While tripping in, a hydraulic hose blew on the top drive nearly spraying oil in the face of one of the floorhands.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/elevator pin
IncidentDescription: When Tugger operator pulled up at beginning the pin slipped out of the elevators. He lowered it down then pushed it back in

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/camlock
IncidentDescription:
Workers were transferring mud and double checking lines after turning pump on and worker found a camlock with one side not 
locked so this hose could have blown apart

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/four sided tank, hose
IncidentDescription: Hose from four sided tank spilled out and let remains of cement hit the plastic

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/barrel, body placement
IncidentDescription:
While bringing up drum of top drive oil with tugger employee just stood underneath the barrel whilet it was being hoisted in 
the air.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/racking board
IncidentDescription:
while racking pipe on the rig floor personnel got foot stuck in racking board because the original board had been replaced with 
a piece that was too short and it left a boot sized hole on the racking board

IncidentSummary: EE was using a screwdriver to break the o-rings off a sub. The screwdriver slipped off and stabbed E
IncidentDescription: EE was using a screwdriver to break the o-rings off a sub. The screwdriver slipped off and stabbed EE between the finger of his left hand. He was placing the screwdriver on top of the o-ring and pushing down to break the o-ring instead of placing it beside the o-ring and twisting.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture/laceration to left hand between fingers when screwdriver being used to break an o-ring off a sub slipped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/bit
IncidentDescription:
Crew hand cleaned bit for company man to take pictures of company man and directional hand walked away, hand 
went to flip bit on its side, bit rolled towards directional hand's foot and hand yelled to warn both parties; the bit 
just missed the directional driller's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/forklift
IncidentDescription: Employee forgot to put forks low to ground while carrying drill pipe and the pipe fell off forks almost hitting another employee.

IncidentSummary: While running tubing on Barnhart 12-H, EE began to experience constant and painful cramping througho
IncidentDescription: While running tubing on Barnhart 12-H, EE began to experience constant and painful cramping throughout his body and was unable to move.
InjuryDescripti: Doctor determined EE experienced H20 intoxication from consuming too much water and not enough electrolytes while working in the heat.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tongs
IncidentDescription: While using breakout tongs, tongs slipped before pipe was loose and swung back wildly

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/fluid leak, hammer union
IncidentDescription:
Derrickhand was transferring fluid to flock tank and noticed a leak on a hammer union pump was turned off and 
union was 
hammered up

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/mud tanks, gate
IncidentDescription:
Employee was on mud tanks and leaned against gate above hopper house and almost fell through the gate, the gate was 
bent so the latch wouldn't catch.

IncidentSummary: While drilling, EE was weighing mud and opening and closing 2" valve on pumps when making connection
IncidentDescription: While drilling, EE was weighing mud and opening and closing 2" valve on pumps when making connection. He went to Rig Manager and told him he was cramping in his legs. He had been taking Pedialyte tablets, drinking water and Gatorade.
InjuryDescripti: Cramping in legs

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tongs, chains
IncidentDescription:
While running casing, casing crew was changing to hydraulic slips, one of the hands was trying to secure slips with chain as 
another hand threw on the hydraulic tongs and began to spin in and torque connection, hydraulic slips started to spin in circles 
around casing and flung chain hitting a hand with chains.

IncidentSummary: While cleaning out catch all box, EE was moving the poles for the horizontal life line that they use
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While cleaning out catch all box, EE was moving the poles for the horizontal life line that they use during rig moves. EE grabbed the pole to move it to the other of side of the catch all box. The pole slipped out of his left hand as he was laying it down and the pole caught his right hand between another pole laying in the box, causing a laceration to right middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right middle finger

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/paint can placement
IncidentDescription:
Employee was painting stairs and set paint can on steps and bucket fell approx six steps high, landing on ground. No 
one was injured!

IncidentSummary: MISS/SM Energy/forklift
IncidentDescription: Forklift operator was handling materials when a third part employee walked into path of moving forklift.

IncidentSummary: EE was leaving truck at dealership for repairs and was taking equipment off one truck and moving it
IncidentDescription: EE was leaving truck at dealership for repairs and was taking equipment off one truck and moving it to another. When EE picked up a 25 lb 3-1/8 collar locator, it fell about 1 foot landing on top of his gloved left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to base of left index finger after being struck by 3-1/8 collar locator.

IncidentSummary: MISS Denbury/power lines
IncidentDescription:
Crew was rigging down and employee removed the W/L from the bottom sheave to pull the cable head through the lubricator. 
As he walked back with the W/L, the power line overhead arced to the W/L and it split the power line in two. The line then fell 
on the back bumper of the perforator and over the grease trailer. No injuries occurred. The work over rig heard popping behind 
the rig on one of their guide lines. Denbury Resources Company Representative indicated that he "understood" the power lines 
were "inactive" and had he known they were "live" he would not have rigged up either the Well Service rig or wireline.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/high voltage plugs
IncidentDescription: Employee was power washing when another employee saw him getting close to high voltage plugs.

IncidentSummary: EE was walking and took a step to get off of the suitcase. He slipped and his left foot went into t
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE was walking and took a step to get off of the suitcase. He slipped and his left foot went into the ditch and his ankle was strained.
InjuryDescripti: Left ankle strained

IncidentSummary: The crew was picking up tubing. EE was picking up pipe to work floor with another crew member when h
IncidentDescription: The crew was picking up tubing. EE was picking up pipe to work floor with another crew member when he felt a strain below his right shoulder and ribs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right shoulder while picking up pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was unlatching the doghouse and kicking the block underneath.
IncidentDescription: EE was unlatching the doghouse and kicking the block underneath.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to toenail of 2nd toe after kicking jack board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/T1W, Draw works
IncidentDescription:
Three hands were manually lifting the  TIW valve from the front of draw works. The bottom of the TIW valve skimmed past one of the employee's 
steel toe boot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hard line, leak
IncidentDescription:
While cementers were pressuring up hardline there was a leak down on the ground. They forgot to hammer up one union. 
Could have been a big spill if not caught as quick as it was.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/stand
IncidentDescription: Hand went to the board to latch up a joint for the connection just after relief time and found a stand of 5" pipe in the finger not tied back.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hopper valve
IncidentDescription:
Hands were replacing the jet in the hopper and when they got it all put together they were going to turn it on and make sure it 
worked properly but they realized the hopper valve was open which would have caused an invert spill.

IncidentSummary: EE was rolling pipe with crew, crew member at end of pipe rack pushed joint of pipe and went to get
IncidentDescription: EE was rolling pipe with crew, crew member at end of pipe rack pushed joint of pipe and went to get more joints. EE was pushing the same joint as a joint came up to EE's leg. No injury/no medical needed.
InjuryDescripti: contusion to right leg after being struck by joint of pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/house bolt
IncidentDescription: Hand was pressure washing inside choke house. Hand sprayed over loose bolt and almost got struck.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/vacuum hose
IncidentDescription: Hand was emptying out vacuum into shakers. Hose wasn't properly secured. Hose flew out of possum belly.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/stabbing guide
IncidentDescription: When making a connection employee nearly forgot to put the stabbing guide on the stump

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/liner, indenters
IncidentDescription: While rolling liner onto indenters, employees had liner nearly come off

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/mudline, leak
IncidentDescription:
Well pumping on mud line we notice pressure loss inspecting mud line for leaks and found leak under the sub removed floor 
plate and tightened hammer union and retested.

IncidentSummary: While tripping pipe out of hole, EE unlatched elevators with left arm and pulled back pipe with righ
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe out of hole, EE unlatched elevators with left arm and pulled back pipe with right arm. His right shoulder was strained while pulling back pipe to derrick board fingers.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/pipe rack, top drive
IncidentDescription:
Was tripping out of the hole and a floorhand was racking pipe back. The driller kicked out the stand with top drive, and the floor 
hand almost got knocked down while racking pipe back.

IncidentSummary: During nippling up BOP'S, EE and and a floor hand were working on installing the flowline extension.
IncidentDescription: During nippling up BOP'S, EE and and a floor hand were working on installing the flowline extension. They noticed a flowline stand was too short to support the flowline. EE and the floor hand installed a bolt in an upper pin hole to act as a handle to extend the stand to the next pin hole. They lifted the stand, unpinned it and attempted to re-pin. The floorhand's hands slipped, causing the stand to fall. The bolt acting as a handle pinched EE's right middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/stair chain
IncidentDescription:
hand noticed that there was no chain or handrail on  flowline extension where stairs hook up to festoon from stair 
case on second hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tongs
IncidentDescription:
Employees were lowering the tongs down the beaver slide and the tongs got caught on the railing. Another employee was pulling on it when it 
swung out and nearly got him in the leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/stand, racking board
IncidentDescription: An employee was tailing a stand back on the racking boards when he pushed it too far back and landed on the metal.

IncidentSummary: MISS Geosouthern Energy/tail rope
IncidentDescription: Worn out tail rope.

IncidentSummary: EE was in the desander/desilter pump house trying to remove a butterfly valve from the piping system
IncidentDescription: EE was in the desander/desilter pump house trying to remove a butterfly valve from the piping system. The butterfly valve was stuck in the open position due to the handle part o' the valve being stripped out and would not turn the flapper to the closed position to let the valve slide or be removed from the top. EE put a 2" lady slipper pry bar between the snail of the centrifugal pump and the flange in efforts to slide the centrifugal pump back far enough to get the valve out. While prying, the bar slipped out of the crack, which made EE lunge forward due to him using his weight to spread it apart. He struck his head on existing piping which caused a small cut above his left eye.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration above left eye

IncidentSummary: MISS Geosouthern Energy/hand placement
IncidentDescription: Hands in the wrong place (pinch/smashed hazard)

IncidentSummary: MISS Geosouthern Energy/slip handles, tripping hazard
IncidentDescription: Almost tripping over slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS Geosouthern Energy/swinging door
IncidentDescription: Swinging door on trash trailer almost closed on employee's hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slips
IncidentDescription: while bringing over elevators and slips to the cat walk the slips came unhooked

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loader, attachment pin
IncidentDescription: hand got inside loader, turned it on and noticed that the attachment pin was not in it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/tieback, hand placement
IncidentDescription:
A crew member was rolling pipe back when he tried to stop the forward motion of one joint that was going to roll off the end of the 
rack he didn't notice the one behind was rolling also and almost pinched his fingers

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ladder, weather hazard
IncidentDescription: Before a big storm hit, a ladder was found leaning up against a wall which would have fallen and injured someone

IncidentSummary: EE was nippling down BOP. The operator bumped the winch line and the EE's finger was pinched between
IncidentDescription: EE was nippling down BOP. The operator bumped the winch line and the EE's finger was pinched between BOP and the nut on the bottom of the flange.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to middle finger of right hand after it was pinched between BOP and the nut on the bottom of the flange.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/rotary table
IncidentDescription:
Employee was stabbing the joint into the stump during a connection. He slipped on the rotary table almost falling down due to palamer on the 
rotary table.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/ST-80
IncidentDescription:
Was moving St-80 forward to make a connecton, employee's finger almost got smashed between the control panel on the st-80 and the torque 
tube

IncidentSummary: MISS Whting/thread protector
IncidentDescription:
When taking off thread protector, employee tossed a protector in the bag nearly missing and throwing it off the floor and it could have hit 
someone

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/slips
IncidentDescription: Two employees pulled slips out of rotary table, and set them on the rig floor. The slips tipped over and almost fell on personnel.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/joint
IncidentDescription: Loading wrangler with kickers, kicked a joint across catwalk onto ground

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/hook, lifting eye
IncidentDescription:
Got done making up stand in mousehole. Picked up and run stand all the way down. Set slips, slacked off the hoist line as floorhand 
went to the other controls. The driller picked up a little and almost pinched an employee's fingers with hook and lifting eye assembly.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/lift cap
IncidentDescription: was making up joint in mouse hole and liftcap almost came unscrewed

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/stairs, tripping
IncidentDescription: i was walking up the stairs quickly and missed a step. I lost my balance but didn't fall, i got ahead of myself.

IncidentSummary: Ee was the 5th hand. While walking around location picking up garbage and putting tools away, EE sta
IncidentDescription: Ee was the 5th hand. While walking around location picking up garbage and putting tools away, EE started feeling light headed. EE was told by rig supervisor to sit down in the shade, relax and drink water. After 20 minutes he felt better and resumed cleanup of area. After 15 minutes he started to get cramps. He was told to stop work, sit in crew truck, take off his FR's, cool down and drink more fluids.
InjuryDescripti: EE was light headed and experiencing cramping while picking up garbage and putting away tools.

IncidentSummary: EE was taking off keeper ring for swap cup on rig pump #12 in the yard at testing station. Spring po
IncidentDescription: EE was taking off keeper ring for swap cup on rig pump #12 in the yard at testing station. Spring popped out and hit EE in the forehead.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to forehead after being struck by a spring that popped out while taking off keeper ring for swap cup.

IncidentSummary: EE was working floors and picking up tubing using pick up machine. EE was feeling bad so the operato
IncidentDescription: EE was working floors and picking up tubing using pick up machine. EE was feeling bad so the operator had him go cool off.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion while picking up tubing with pick-up machine.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was picking up pipe while standing on catwalk. EE stepped on tubing drift (rabbit) and lost his f
IncidentDescription: EE was picking up pipe while standing on catwalk. EE stepped on tubing drift (rabbit) and lost his footing causing him to fall off catwalk approximately 2.5 feet to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion (bruise) to left elbow after falling off catwalk and landing 2.5 feet below on the ground.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: When EE and motorman were picking up lid to suitcase, Ee felt sharp pain to center of back.
IncidentDescription: When EE and motorman were picking up lid to suitcase, Ee felt sharp pain to center of back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back.

IncidentSummary: When tripping 4" HWDP pipe out of the hole, EE pushed the stand of 4" HWDP to the matting board. He
IncidentDescription: When tripping 4" HWDP pipe out of the hole, EE pushed the stand of 4" HWDP to the matting board. He slipped and fell to the matting board. When he fell, the stand of 4" HWDP swung back and set down on his fingers of his left hand, trapping them under the 4" HWDP pin end of stand. Driller had to have the derrickhand take and latch the 4" HWDP stand back up into the elevators to lift the 4" HWDP stand off of EE's fingers.
InjuryDescripti: Hand was caught beneath a stand after ee had slipped and during rig operation resulting in amputation of left index finger and laceration of left middle finger

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/stairs
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking up the stairs to the floor to make connection when he got to the landing he slipped

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/top drive, hand placement
IncidentDescription:
Employee was going up to the blocks to grease them.  The employee was holding onto the top drive and his hand got stuck, but was able to 
pull it out

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/chemical spill, slip hazard
IncidentDescription:
While making a connection, a chemical was added down the pipe in the stump. We overfilled pipe with the chemical and it spilled onto the floor. 
When we were ready to pull slips employee lost footing due to slippery floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/chugger hook, pipe
IncidentDescription:
a crew member was using the chugger to pull up the stand pipe and the hook got caught on the floor and the pipe kicked back 
and nearly hit a crew member that was standing by the pipe

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hose, whipcheck
IncidentDescription:
when employee went to bleed pressure off with the two inch on the tree he noticed that the hose coming off the two inch 
valve didn't have a whipcheck on it

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/casing protector
IncidentDescription:
while running casing third party hand put casing protector on trough and while hydraulic catwalk was coming down casing 
protector fell out and hit the ground no one was around the catwalk barrier

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/catch tank, fly ash arm
IncidentDescription: while cleaning out catch tank hand forgot to raise the fly ash arm almost clipped it and broke it off

IncidentSummary: Collar rope was tied to hold up flow line. EE went to release chains from pole truck, flow line shif
IncidentDescription: Collar rope was tied to hold up flow line. EE went to release chains from pole truck, flow line shifted and caught EE's right leg between flow line and grating.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right leg after being caught between flow line and grating.

IncidentSummary: While breaking swivel in preparation of laying down pipe, EE was using an 18" pipe wrench to hold pi
IncidentDescription: While breaking swivel in preparation of laying down pipe, EE was using an 18" pipe wrench to hold pipe while backing off swivel from pipe when pipe wrench swung around and struck him on the right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right shoulder after 18" pipe wrench he was using to hold pipe swung around and struck him.

IncidentSummary: While tripping in the hole, IE was attempting to unlatch elevators when he dislocated his left shoul
IncidentDescription: While tripping in the hole, IE was attempting to unlatch elevators when he dislocated his left shoulder (his shoulder has been dislocated before).
InjuryDescripti: While attempting to unlatch elevators, EE sprained left shoulder.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pipes, uneven surface hazard
IncidentDescription: Nearly dropped load of pipe from the loader forks, do to a rut that was unseen during dark hours

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/charge pump, hand placement
IncidentDescription: While breaking bolts to take off charge pump employee nearly crushed his hands between the wrench and the floor

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/bushings
IncidentDescription:
When we put the rotary bushings back in the rotary, we set one half in the rotary. We went to put the bushing puller in the other half and the 
bushing nearly fell over on employee's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/power washer wand
IncidentDescription:
hand was lowering power washer from floor and power wand started to fall from floor but it was tied to rope so hand grabbed it quick before 
it fell

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/electric short, light(s)
IncidentDescription: motor man noticed that one end of light was sparking and shorting out by sparking and changing of colors

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/grounding
IncidentDescription:
Rig manager was doing walk around during delivery of fuel and noticed that the driver did not have any grounding. he was also 
talking on a cell phone with the door wide open and did not have an H2S monitor

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/lifting personnel
IncidentDescription: While lifting a man, the air hoist operator lost sight of the man on lift and immediately stopped lifting

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/PPE
IncidentDescription: Third party employee was unloading chemicals in a short sleeve cut off shirt with no h2s monitor and not clean shaven.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/slips
IncidentDescription:
while tripping pipe in the hole, employees did not place slips far enough back and vibration caused them to tip over onto 
bushing while stand of pipe was coming down

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/forklift operation
IncidentDescription: forklift operater was moving too fast with pipe and lost control of pipe on forks nearly dropping one

IncidentSummary: EE went up derrick to put a cable on air hoist line that was suspending the casing tongs, to hold th
IncidentDescription: EE went up derrick to put a cable on air hoist line that was suspending the casing tongs, to hold them away from the top drive. He did not wait until top drive and tongs were lowered. He tried to get cable before top drive moved and got his right foot crushed between angle iron on derrick and top drive trolley beam.
InjuryDescripti: trauma to right foot (resulting in partial amputation) during running casing operations.

IncidentSummary: EE reached down to straighten a pallet of guns. The pallet had two metal bands around the guns to st
IncidentDescription: EE reached down to straighten a pallet of guns. The pallet had two metal bands around the guns to stabilize them during transport. A different employee must have cut one of the bands and did not discard it. As the employee reached down, he did not see the exposed metal band and his forearm was cut by the metal band.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right forearm after striking it against metal band that had been cut on a pallet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Sabine/trapped pressure release
IncidentDescription:
While on a job site, J.Moreno, engineer, was going to start logging the well. The pressure pump testing crew 
began to pressure up on the well to 2500 psi so Jose could start logging. He started to log at about 2:00 pm at 14,310 feet 
and was going to log to about 5, 000 feet. We were using 5 1/2 5 K BOP and lubricator as per job procedures. Jose was 
logging for about an hour around 3:00 pm and was at 10, 900 feet when the BOP and lubricator were blown off the wellhead. 
The bottom section of the BOP connected to the flange on the well parted. Caused by 12,500 psi on well. The BOP are rated at 
5 K working pressure but tested to 7.5 K. The BOP and lubricator was last tested on 7-13-13, 2012.

IncidentSummary: MISS NFX/tag line, drill pipe
IncidentDescription:
Employee was hoisting a drill pipe thru beaver slide, other employee was using a tag line when drill pipe was on the rig floor. 
employee stopped drill pipe with tag line and slipped from his hands but managed to catch tage line in time

IncidentSummary: MISS NFX/ST-80
IncidentDescription:
While coming out of the hole while reaming employee was using ST80 and attempted to break stand while pressure was still in 
stand driller immediately stopped employee and was told to wait till there was no pressure

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/stand, body placement
IncidentDescription:
While taking stand to the stump floorhand was standing in a pinch point area so when the driller picked up the employee could 
have potentially been smashed by the stand of drill pipe

IncidentSummary: EE was coming down scaffold ladder after installing trip nipple. When he got to the last rung, his f
IncidentDescription: EE was coming down scaffold ladder after installing trip nipple. When he got to the last rung, his foot slipped off, causing his back to be jarred.
InjuryDescripti: Back strain

IncidentSummary: While putting drill line on drum, EE was struck on side of his right knee with a 5' bar.
IncidentDescription: While putting drill line on drum, EE was struck on side of his right knee with a 5' bar.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to side of right knee after being struck with a 5' bar

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/chugger, pipe
IncidentDescription:
Employee was running chugger when the handle got stuck, the pipe came up very fast and pulled employee holding tail rope 
pulling him across the floor

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pipe, tail rope
IncidentDescription:
When picking up 5 inch drill pipe the driller came up too high on blocks and the person taking in the pipe didn't have a long 
enough tal rope and the rope fell off and the pipe swung freely

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/manlift, lanyard
IncidentDescription: hand was getting into manlift to pressure wash and forgot to hook up his lanyard

IncidentSummary: Armando BHA, estaban conectando el monel con el estabilizador; el trabajador se sube a la ST-80, par
IncidentDescription: Armando BHA, estaban conectando el monel con el estabilizador; el trabajador se sube a la ST-80, para alinear la conexi+n. Una vez alineada la conexi+n prodceden a enroscar mientras tando el cu+ero se iba a bajar de la llave pero esta se acciona cuando el cu+ero pisa el extend/retract lever, saliendo hacia el riel del top drive donde se genera el atrapamiento.
InjuryDescripti: abdominal trauma resulting in ee being caught between ST-80 and top drive torque.

IncidentSummary: EE was spinning quick collar on CCL instrument. After breaking initial connection with pipe wrench,
IncidentDescription: EE was spinning quick collar on CCL instrument. After breaking initial connection with pipe wrench, EE began to unscrew the collar with his hands and a sliver of metal punctured his left index finger. He was wearing cotton gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to left index finger after coming in contact with a metal sliver from a threaded connection he was loosening.

IncidentSummary: MISS pipe hung up, fell (MS)
IncidentDescription: Laying down pipe in lay-down machine. Pipe hung, swung out and hit rig floor handrail as it slid free.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/forklift, hopper house
IncidentDescription:
Team member picked up pallet of chemical with forklift and was bringing it up to the  hopper house when he bumped the 
hopper house door almost bending it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/tail rope, hand placement
IncidentDescription: Hand nearly smashed hand between drill pipe and stump of pipe in the mouse hole with improper techique of using tail rope

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, no harness
IncidentDescription: Third party was climbing on mud tanks with out a harness before hand rails were put in place

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, chains, brace
IncidentDescription:
While Black Gold was picking up blocks with crane they had the chain around a brace that wouldn't hold the weight and almost 
picked it up

IncidentSummary: EE had drilled a joint down and was in the process of making up another joint. EE states that he tie
IncidentDescription: EE had drilled a joint down and was in the process of making up another joint. EE states that he tied off the swivel to slips and was backing up out of the way when he tripped and caught himself on hand rail. While pulling himself up he felt pain in his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after tripping and catching himself on hand rail.

IncidentSummary: While tripping out of the hole, EE was standing on the tubing board holding 2 7/8" stand with his ri
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of the hole, EE was standing on the tubing board holding 2 7/8" stand with his right hand. He reached out with his left hand to unlatch the elevators and felt discomfort in his left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left shoulder when he reached out to unlatch the elevators.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tugger, line
IncidentDescription:
While spooling up the tuggers, a hand was holding tension on the line by letting it slide threw his hand and his glove got 
caught almost pulling him off of his feet.

IncidentSummary: Crew was taking nuts of BOP and well was bleeding down. EE was squatting down taking nuts off 5000 b
IncidentDescription: Crew was taking nuts of BOP and well was bleeding down. EE was squatting down taking nuts off 5000 bolts while backside was open, H2S came out. EE's H2S monitor went off. EE was exposed to H2S. EE walked away upwind. Rig supervisor and company consultant used a 4-gas monitor to check the level of H2S on the backside and it read 167 ppm. Rig supervisor contacted the Safety Manager regarding the incident. The Safety Manager advised them to continue to nipple up for well control and then close in the well and call for a H2S safety trailer. The EE stayed upwind from the well head until the Safety Manager arrived on location. EE felt fine and signed a medical treatment waiver.
InjuryDescripti: Potential exposure to H2S after it escaped from back side of BOP as EE was removing nuts off 5000 bolts.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/forklift, spreader beams
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Employee was operating forklift hauling spreader beams when he hit a hole and beam flew off forks landing close to another 
employee

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hopper
IncidentDescription: When mixing gel in the premix hopper the hopper suction plugged off and began to fill the hopper with mud nearly overflowing onto the ground

IncidentSummary: Laying pipe down using catline-as rolling pipe over and laying down another-EE leaned over to push a
IncidentDescription: Laying pipe down using catline-as rolling pipe over and laying down another-EE leaned over to push already laid out jt back. Felt discomfort to lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after leaning forward to push jt back.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was holding horn on elevator while block was coming down to unlatch joint. Elevator did not open
IncidentDescription: EE was holding horn on elevator while block was coming down to unlatch joint. Elevator did not open and EE did not let go of horn in adequate time.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left ring finger after being struck by block.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was picking up pipe and felt a pain in back due to the repetitive motion of bending down.
IncidentDescription: EE was picking up pipe and felt a pain in back due to the repetitive motion of bending down.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while picking up pipe off the ground.

IncidentSummary: EE and other floorhand were installing cellar covers. EE bent over at waist and grabbed the cellar c
IncidentDescription: EE and other floorhand were installing cellar covers. EE bent over at waist and grabbed the cellar cover and started pulling it into position with both hands. While EE was pulling the cellar covers, EE's left foot slipped out from under him. He caught himself with left arm to keep from falling, and his lower back was strained. Cellar area was muddy from drilling surface.
InjuryDescripti: Strained lower back while installing cellar covers

IncidentSummary: EE was cutting the lids off of 5 gallon buckets. He had the bucket turned upside down and was cutti
IncidentDescription: EE was cutting the lids off of 5 gallon buckets. He had the bucket turned upside down and was cutting with a downward stroke with both hands on the knife. The bucket slipped off its' resting point which caused the knife to slip off of the rim of the lid. When this happened, the blade collapsed to the closed position and was at a 90 degree angle, and when EE went to catch the bucket, he brought his hands together and the top of his left wrist was cut, causing a laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to top of left wrist by knife when trying to cut lid off bucket

IncidentSummary: The operator stand was being moved to another position. The EE was using the winch line to pick up.
IncidentDescription: The operator stand was being moved to another position. The EE was using the winch line to pick up. When the stand stuck, the EE pulled more with the winch and it popped out and flipped backwards. The EE fell and landed on the beam.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to head after winch popped out and flipped backwards causing EE to fall and land on beam.

IncidentSummary: MISS Sheridan/snakes, wildlife hazard
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While moving a piece of PVC with the forklift employee said that when he picked up on it that a rattle snake came out of the 
end of the pipe.

IncidentSummary: Crew was trying to kill well by pumping 17# mud into the well. After pumping mud, a hose was run fro
IncidentDescription: Crew was trying to kill well by pumping 17# mud into the well. After pumping mud, a hose was run from the mud pump manifold to the top of a frac tank on location to bleed off pressure between the pump and the well. The crew finished pumping 30 bbls of mud into the well and Lonnie Slaughter was going to open the valve to relieve pressure between the well and the pump. As Lonnie began opening the valve, the EE was sent to the frac tank to see what returns came back and/or if the pressure was bled off. The EE was on the stairs going up the frac tank and the hose came out of the top of the frac tank and began to whip around. The EE was hit on the shoulder and the back of the head causing a 1"-1.5" laceration to the back of the head.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to back of the head after being struck by pressure hose that was whipping around after it came out of the top of the frac tank.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pressure washer, face shield
IncidentDescription:
Employee was told to pressure wash and was about to start doing it with out a face shield. Could have resulted in injury to 
face or eyes.

IncidentSummary: MISS Sheridan/H2S
IncidentDescription: The H2S alarms went off after making a connection and going back to drilling.

IncidentSummary: The driller, EE and another floorhand were making connections during normal drilling operations. T
IncidentDescription: The driller, EE and another floorhand were making connections during normal drilling operations. They set slips on 6" collar that was in rotary table. Then they brought the ST-80 over to break the connection. After it was broken, they set the ST-80 back out of the way and lifted the kelly to let fluid drain. They guided the kelly towards the mouse hole, in order to make a connection with 6" collar, no tail rope or guide equipment was being used in doing so. They failed to stab the pin end into the box end. The stabbing guide was not being used either because its' inability to fit on the collar. The pin side was resting on the box end approximately 90% of the way from being connected. The floorhand on the V-door side was attempting to guide it in by hand. Driller lifted on kelly and EE did not remove his hands off the kelly before it swung back towards the stump in the rotary table. This caused EE to get his right ring finger pinched between the kelly and the stump, resulting in a laceration to inside of his finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to inside of right ring finger when pinched between the kelly and stump

IncidentSummary: Employees were installing cellar covers and while dragging the cellar covers across the cellar, EE s
IncidentDescription: Employees were installing cellar covers and while dragging the cellar covers across the cellar, EE slipped, striking his right shoulder against the BOP.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right shoulder after slipping, causing shoulder to hit BOP

IncidentSummary: EE went to move the service loop inside the transport skid and he got help from a floorhand. They b
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE went to move the service loop inside the transport skid and he got help from a floorhand. They brought the forklift over to the service loop with a strap and decided to do it by hand. They were both pulling on the service loop when EE slipped and fell, hitting the back of his head on a beam causing a cut.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to back of head caused by slipping and falling and hitting head on beam.

IncidentSummary: Three employees, who were on new location with 3rd party forklift operator, were unloading pipe and
IncidentDescription: Three employees, who were on new location with 3rd party forklift operator, were unloading pipe and collars. IE and one of the employees were rolling drill collars while other employee was across location driving the little forklift. IE and co-worker were trying to place two bad collars on back of rack out of the way. Forklift driver grabbed one good one by accident and one of the employees rolled the good one forward a little so IE could point out the other bad one. As he walked off, the good collar started rolling back. IE reached down and grabbed a rock to shove under the collar, rock slipped out and collar rolled back, mashing IE's right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand when drill collar rolled back and mashed hand.

IncidentSummary: EE was changing stripper rubbers on BOP. He was standing on steel line when his foot slipped. EE att
IncidentDescription: EE was changing stripper rubbers on BOP. He was standing on steel line when his foot slipped. EE attempted to break his fall by grabbing a hose with his left arm, causing his shoulder to pop.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left shoulder while making an attempt to break fall by grabbing a hose when his foot slipped off steel line he was standing on.

IncidentSummary: Crew was trying to break the TIW valve to remove it from pipe string. Floor hands were using two 36"
IncidentDescription: Crew was trying to break the TIW valve to remove it from pipe string. Floor hands were using two 36" pipe wrenches to break out collar under TIW valve. Crew used the tongs as additional backup to assist with breaking the collar. The operator locked down the brake handle and stepped down to the rig floor to assist floor hands in breaking pipe. The floor hand was instructed to engage tongs to help with backup. The floor hand engaged the wrong lever and the tongs raised up catching EE's right index finger between tongs and pipe wrench.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained injury resulting in amputation of right index finger after wrong lever was engaged and tongs raised up catching finger between tongs and pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: Crew was running tubing in the hole. EE is the tong operator and came in contact with small amount o
IncidentDescription: Crew was running tubing in the hole. EE is the tong operator and came in contact with small amount of 10 pound brine water. The brine water contact was due to small amount of overflow out of the tubing. A small area of skin on his abdomen became irritated.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced irritation to the skin on his abdomen after coming in contact with brine water when it overflowed out of the tubing that they were running out of the hole.

IncidentSummary: While walking on location, EE noticed an irritation on knuckle of right hand. Did not feel any sting
IncidentDescription: While walking on location, EE noticed an irritation on knuckle of right hand. Did not feel any sting or bite.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced an irritation of knuckle of right hand while walking on location.

IncidentSummary: Following description based on that given by EE. Brought trailer into shop loaded with empty grease
IncidentDescription: Following description based on that given by EE. Brought trailer into shop loaded with empty grease barrels to cut tops off, clean out and dispose of. Jeromy Dailey, Eric Rohr and EE were in the process of unloading barrels and putting in place to be cut. EE unloaded a barrel and when dropping it to the ground, it took a wild bounce and smashed finger into barrel next to it. EE removed glove and saw it was badly cut.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture and laceration to right middle finger after it was caught between two grease barrels being unloaded.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pelican hooks
IncidentDescription: Employee was climbing up on the shack and had too long of pelican hooks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/slippery floor
IncidentDescription:
Slippery floor --  hand was holding a pipe with the tail rope and it slipped and he had to hold himself up with another stand so 
he wouldn't hit the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/peanut pump, hose
IncidentDescription:
Employee was going to pump out the cellar. Started peanut pump and went to see if he was getting returns over the shakers. 
4'' hose fell out of the shakers and the peanut pump wasn't primed so nothing was being discharged.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slips
IncidentDescription: Employee pulled the slips while making a connection and nearly smashed his foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/hose, fittings
IncidentDescription:
Was told to fix high pressure hose; kept blowing off fitting, told tool pusher it had blown off four times and he said to keep 
trying other hoses but it kept blowing off. He came out and fixed it without fittings. There is a new hose in the pusher office 
that was not used because he didn't want to change out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loader pins
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
After changing attachments on the loader an employee on the ground noticed the pins were not fully engaged on one side and the attachment 
could have fallen off causing damage or injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pin end, hand placement
IncidentDescription: When tripping in the hole and employee had their hand on the pin end  of the pipe and it was nearly pinched.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/SRL
IncidentDescription:
While an employee was climbing the derrick climber, he realized that his SRL was sagging and had no tension on it, he looked 
up and saw that it was snagged on the electrical outlets in the board.

IncidentSummary: EE was hammering up the vibrator hose that goes from the #1 pump shed to the hard line manifold and
IncidentDescription: EE was hammering up the vibrator hose that goes from the #1 pump shed to the hard line manifold and had hit it repeatedly. As he was striking the 4" hammer union, a burr on the hammer union broke off and struck EE on the side of his nose, glanced off his safety glasses, causing a small laceration on his nose.
InjuryDescripti: EE was hammering up the vibrator hose that goes from the #1 pump shed to the hard line manifold and had hit it repeatedly. As he was striking the 4" hammer union, a burr on the hammer union broke off and struck EE on the side of his nose, causing a small laceration.

IncidentSummary: The hands were lowering service loop into carriage bin with crane when cord end got caught on hand r
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: The hands were lowering service loop into carriage bin with crane when cord end got caught on hand rail pocket. One of the hands reached up and flipped cord end out and it swung approximately eight feet and hit EE in face, causing contusions to chin and jaw bone.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to chin and jaw when cord end hit EE on the face

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to step onto a suitcase leading with his right foot. He was in the process of prep
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to step onto a suitcase leading with his right foot. He was in the process of preparing to send a sweep down hole by walking onto and over the suitcase where the valve was positioned on the mud tank. He was walking over from the hopper over to the valve location. When he stepped onto the suitcase with his right foot, he felt a sharp discomfort in his heel.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right heel by walking onto suitcase

IncidentSummary: EE claims to have strained back somewhere between the date of 9/24/13 through 9/26/13 while pulling
IncidentDescription: EE claims to have strained back somewhere between the date of 9/24/13 through 9/26/13 while pulling slips during a normal trip out of the hole. He cannot pin point an exact day or time when the incident occurred but claims to have reported it to both the driller and rig manager on duty. However, no report was ever made until 10/7/13. He was taken to seek medical treatment on October 8th where he was told it was just a muscle strain and no follow up would be necessary unless complications arose in the future.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to back while pulling slips

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn-Virginia/pulsation dampner
IncidentDescription:
While drilling ahead, the mud motor stalled out raising the differential pressure to 5800 psi and caused the pulsation 
dampner on mud pump #2 to blow off. The dampner blew off and went about 20 to 30 ft. up in the air and landed on 
the cooling pond box and skid between both pumps.

IncidentSummary: EE was attempting to remove the flow line from the festoon skid and was using a 20 lb sledge hammer
IncidentDescription: EE was attempting to remove the flow line from the festoon skid and was using a 20 lb sledge hammer to break loose the 10" hammer seal union. He was swinging the sledge in a motion from the right shoulder to the left hip. When he hit the ear of the seal union, it suddenly came loose and he followed through with the swing. His right index finger was caught between the flow line and the handle of the sledge hammer, causing a fracture to his right index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Right index finger fractured when caught between sledge hammer handle and flow line

IncidentSummary: Description as reported by EE. Once we disconnected the lubricator from the well, the lubricator was
IncidentDescription: Description as reported by EE. Once we disconnected the lubricator from the well, the lubricator was still full of well bore fluid and it fell from the lubricator on on the the rig floor. The well bore fluid splashed off the Wireline B.O.P. and covered the rig hand and myself. I was wearing FR's and safety goggles that I had received from the rig crew that were brand new, along with all of my other PPE the whole entire job. I instantly put my head down for the fluid to splash on my hard hat instead of my face. After waiting about 8-10 seconds for the fluid to rush out of the lubricator, the gun barrel would start coming out of the lubricator, so I would walk under the lubricator and grab the gun barrel and move it to the side of the rig floor where James Barnett could land it onto the trailer. After handing James the shot gun barrel, I climbed down from the rig floor and noticed that my eye was burning. I asked James and the work over rig worker if my eye was red. They replied, "yes."
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to right eye after coming in contact with well bore fluid.

IncidentSummary: Durante la operaci+n de Quebrada de tuber+a en el hueco auxiliar, el Cu+ero se encontraba dirigiendo
IncidentDescription: Durante la operaci+n de Quebrada de tuber+a en el hueco auxiliar, el Cu+ero se encontraba dirigiendo el DP 5- hacia la canoa del Cat walk con sus manos (El Drill Pipe se encontraba sostenido con winche). En el momento de asentar el DP 5- en la canoa el trabajador no ubica sus manos en el cuerpo de la tuber+a y pellizca su dedo quinto de la mano derecha entre el protector del pin y el sello de la rosca del tubo, se dirige a la unidad m+dica en colaboraci+n del perforador. donde se le presta los primeros auxilios y se remite a valoraci+n con especialista. **Refer to reports on L Drive.
InjuryDescripti: EE pinched finger between guard pin and seal pipe threads resulting in a contusion to finger.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Two employees were tightening lower set of bolts on BOPs. They were using the proper tools for the
IncidentDescription: Two employees were tightening lower set of bolts on BOPs. They were using the proper tools for the job, hammer wrench with rope on the handle,had impact gloves on and an 8 lb sledge hammer. One employee was hitting the hammer wrench to tighten the bolt and EE, though the bolt was tight, reached over, grabbed the handle on the hammer wrench to move to another bolt without letting the other employee know what he was doing. This caused his right ring finger to be struck by the hammer.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger when hit by sledge hammer

IncidentSummary: EE pulled pin to remove pipe causing it to roll off and strike him on his right foot.
IncidentDescription: EE pulled pin to remove pipe causing it to roll off and strike him on his right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right ankle after being struck by pipe he was unloading from truck.

IncidentSummary: EE smashed finger while hammering a flange.
IncidentDescription: EE smashed finger while hammering a flange.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right index finger after striking it with a hammer while hammering a flange.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, forklift, incorrect use
IncidentDescription:
Third party rig movers were using a pallet and forklift to lift personnel and rig manager stopped job and told them no one 
else would be lifted until man basket arrived on location.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, suction line, vehicle operation
IncidentDescription: Third party truck driver was reversing too fast and slammed suction line, nearly pinning the driller

IncidentSummary: Operators lifted and carried a 7" bridge plug from the back of the engineer's pickup to the catwalk
IncidentDescription: Operators lifted and carried a 7" bridge plug from the back of the engineer's pickup to the catwalk of the drilling rig. The distance between the pickup and the catwalk was appx 60 yards. The operator who was injured was walking backwards. Once the operators approached the catwalk, they moved from a front/back walking motion to a side-to-side motion. At this point, the operator slipped, fell to the ground and dropped his portion of the bridge plug.
InjuryDescripti: strain to right ankle after slipping on ground while assisting in carrying equipment from vehicle to catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer, body placement
IncidentDescription:
While employee was loosening discharge screw cap on the #1 pump he was not aware of another employee coming into the work and in 
striking distance of hammer. if employee hammering on the cap missed he could have struck other employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Crew member was trying to carry heavy trash can down stairs by himself and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS RKI/ST-80, drill pipe
IncidentDescription:
While bringing drill pipe up on to the rig floor the pipe struck the st-80 and got stuck in it. There was no damage to any equipment and no 
one was hurt. The pipe did not swing with a lot of force.

IncidentSummary: The crew was through working for the day. After the EE got dressed to go home, he stepped out of the
IncidentDescription: The crew was through working for the day. After the EE got dressed to go home, he stepped out of the doghouse on the way to the crew truck and rolled his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle when he stepped out of doghouse on the way to the crew truck.

IncidentSummary: EE was eating lunch. He took a bite out of his hamburger and a yellow jacket stung his upper lip are
IncidentDescription: EE was eating lunch. He took a bite out of his hamburger and a yellow jacket stung his upper lip area. He had been stung before and never had a reaction so he let it go. He started experiencing swelling and light-headedness and decided to go to the doctor.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced swelling and lightheadedness after being stung on upper lip by a wasp while eating lunch.

IncidentSummary: EE was jacking up the doghouse off the crew truck. The EE's leg was positioned under the tongue of t
IncidentDescription: EE was jacking up the doghouse off the crew truck. The EE's leg was positioned under the tongue of the doghouse. The operator moved the crew truck forward. The doghouse sunk into the ground and caught the ball of the crew truck. The doghouse dropped off the ball hitch of the crew truck. The doghouse slid forward and the tongue of the doghouse hit the EE's left knee and bent it forward. The EE stated he was fine. There was no swelling or bruising.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right ankle after being struck by the tongue of the doghouse when it slid forward as it was being jacked up.

IncidentSummary: While moving crossover sub basket into place on floor, co-worker and IE could not get it all the way
IncidentDescription: While moving crossover sub basket into place on floor, co-worker and IE could not get it all the way back to railing, out of the way. IE took the tugger line and went around the railing that was welded to floor and the same height as where the hook on load would be to pull basket back into place. On the basket, on all four corners, is angle iron 1-1/2' tall which is where IE hooked it as low as possible so it would pull at the lowest part of the center of gravity allowing it not to tip but just slide. When IE came up with the tugger, everything worked perfect sliding into place. When it reached the railing, somehow the hook came off, hitting IE's left hand. He was wearing impacted gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to left hand when struck by the tugger

IncidentSummary: EE was tripping pipe in, during high winds. The stand of pipe that EE was holding with aid of a lead
IncidentDescription: EE was tripping pipe in, during high winds. The stand of pipe that EE was holding with aid of a lead out was swaying, due to the wind velocity. A violent jerking motion caused IE's left elbow to be strained.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left elbow due to pulling harder on lead rope because of high wind velocity

IncidentSummary: Everyone at the scene had taken precautionary measures to assure a safe work area and proper techniq
IncidentDescription: Everyone at the scene had taken precautionary measures to assure a safe work area and proper technique. The chains were inspected prior to use. One of the links broke causing the pipe to strike Coty. No one else was injured. Coty was using a come-a-long ratchet and a chain to pull the shifted Nitrogen tank that was on the trailer. While using a pipe for easier securement, the chain broke a link and it is believed the pipe struck Coty on the top of his head causing him to clinch his teeth resulting in a chip to the front right tooth.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained chip to front right tooth after being struck on the top of his head by a pipe he was using on the chain to secure load on trailer.

IncidentSummary: EE was walking back to his company truck which was parked about 20 yards away, and he started to fee
IncidentDescription: EE was walking back to his company truck which was parked about 20 yards away, and he started to feel dizzy, confused and felt his left foot start to shake. At this time he was looking for a place to sit down. He doesn't remember anything until he "came to" in the ambulance while still on location. He was transported to a hospital in Jourdanton then transferred to another in Corpus for observation. He went to a follow-up appointment yesterday, and his doctor is leaning towards a possible seizure.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced seizure while walking back to company truck on location.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping out rods. The rig floor was laid on the ground behind the operators stand. The
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping out rods. The rig floor was laid on the ground behind the operators stand. The EE took a break and when he was walking back to the rig, he walked on top of the rig floor. When he stepped off the rig floor, he stepped on a 36-inch pipe wrench and sprained his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle when he stepped off rig floor and onto a 36-inch pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: While on scaffolding, EE was power washing the BOPs, getting them ready to nipple down. The scaffold
IncidentDescription: While on scaffolding, EE was power washing the BOPs, getting them ready to nipple down. The scaffolding was wet and EE slipped and fell one foot, catching himself on BOP. He was completely tied off. No injury reported but EE wanted to let driller know he fell.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to chest/torso in slipping and catching himself on BOP

IncidentSummary: EE's hands and feet began itching while on location. It began Saturday night around midnight. EE cou
IncidentDescription: EE's hands and feet began itching while on location. It began Saturday night around midnight. EE could not sleep or rest on time off and no one on the platform had Benadryl or other allergic reaction medication. After consulting with his supervisor and company rep, the decision was made to have him come in to get medication.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced irritation/itching on hands and feet while working and again while trying to sleep during time off.

IncidentSummary: While piecing together 1" square tubing framework for pit roofs, employees got roof area together an
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While piecing together 1" square tubing framework for pit roofs, employees got roof area together and layed over on side for legs. Started all four legs and were tapping legs into sockets for safety pin alignment. EE bent over leg on ground and began knocking leg into socket. Leg above him was not secured with keeper yet and came out, falling onto him and hitting back of hard hat and neck. The tubing was approximately 8' long.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to back when tubing hit back of head and neck

IncidentSummary: EE was wrenching on a flow tee with a 48" pipe wrench when he twisted his lower back.
IncidentDescription: EE was wrenching on a flow tee with a 48" pipe wrench when he twisted his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while wrenching on a flow tee using a 48" pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: During rig down operations, EE was loosening the Bowen connection on the BOP's when his right forear
IncidentDescription: During rig down operations, EE was loosening the Bowen connection on the BOP's when his right forearm scraped against the certification tag on the Howco valve that was just below the BOP's on the pressure control stack.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a 2-inch laceration to right forearm after striking it against the certification tag on the Howco Valve that was below the BOP's on the pressure control stack.

IncidentSummary: While greasing drawworks, EE stepped on toe board with right foot and his toes were bent back and fe
IncidentDescription: While greasing drawworks, EE stepped on toe board with right foot and his toes were bent back and felt discomfort in his foot.
InjuryDescripti: Strained right foot and toes after stepping on toeboard and toes were bent back.

IncidentSummary: EE was re-heading Wireline. Steel barb was exposed, punctured finger on left hand.
IncidentDescription: EE was re-heading Wireline. Steel barb was exposed, punctured finger on left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to finger on left hand after coming in contact with steel barb while re-heading Wireline.

IncidentSummary: While three workers were picking up the polish rod, one of the worker's gloves caught on the stuffin
IncidentDescription: While three workers were picking up the polish rod, one of the worker's gloves caught on the stuffing box lurching him forward. Because his feet were planted, this sudden motion caused a strain in his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after being lurched forward after glove became caught on the stuffing box while picking up the polish rod.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was installing the wiper plate onto a joint of tubing. EE positioned the tongs to push down the p
IncidentDescription: EE was installing the wiper plate onto a joint of tubing. EE positioned the tongs to push down the plate and asked the floor hand to lower the tongs. As the tongs came down, the EE pulled down on the backups below the tongs and his fingers were pinched between the backups and tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to ring finger on right hand and fracture to right middle finger after tongs came down and pinched fingers between backups and tongs.

IncidentSummary: EE and a co-worker were changing a leaking swab on the pump. EE was working on the swab and watching
IncidentDescription: EE and a co-worker were changing a leaking swab on the pump. EE was working on the swab and watching its' position as the other employee was turning the pump over by hand. A socket was knocked into the pump and EE reached down to grab it. The pump was still turning over and pinned EE's right arm between the pony rod clamp and the face of the liner.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right arm when caught between pony rod clamp and face of liner

IncidentSummary: While disassembling the grease head using pipe wrenches, the grease head shifted on the tool racks c
IncidentDescription: While disassembling the grease head using pipe wrenches, the grease head shifted on the tool racks causing the EE to fall backwards against the step on the truck.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to abdomen and back when grease head being disassembled shifted on the tool racks resulting in the EE falling into the step on the truck.

IncidentSummary: EE was pulling a cluster of hoses while laying down lube when he stepped on a chunk of scoria causin
IncidentDescription: EE was pulling a cluster of hoses while laying down lube when he stepped on a chunk of scoria causing his foot to slip on rocks.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left knee after slipping on rocks while pulling on cluster of hoses.

IncidentSummary: XTO/machinery, powerlines
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While resetting the Geronimo anchor employees was backing up in forklift. While he was backing up he did not notice that the Geronimo line 
was getting close to the existing powerlines in the area. As he stretched the anchor back the line touched the powerline causing it to arch 
causing the two powerlines above the one that was touched to split.

IncidentSummary: Rigging down work floor after running rods to get ready for acid job. EE placed hand between rig flo
IncidentDescription: Rigging down work floor after running rods to get ready for acid job. EE placed hand between rig floor flap and rig floor while operator was letting flap down on rig floor. EE said he turned his head away for a second and flap was laid on hand. EE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hand after it was caught between rig floor and rig floor flap while rigging down.

IncidentSummary: While rotating rod string with wrenches, EE's wrench slipped fron hand and hit him on right forearm
IncidentDescription: While rotating rod string with wrenches, EE's wrench slipped fron hand and hit him on right forearm and right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to right forearm and shoulder after being struck by wrench as he was rotating rod string.

IncidentSummary: Finished tripping out of hole. Changing back-ups around on big tongs. Pulled pin PU tong and back-up
IncidentDescription: Finished tripping out of hole. Changing back-ups around on big tongs. Pulled pin PU tong and back-up shifted to side of EE's foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to side of left foot after being struck by back-up after it shifted when pin was pulled on PU tong.

IncidentSummary: Sustained strain to right ankle after jumping off catwalk to avoid getting struck by pipe.
IncidentDescription: Sustained strain to right ankle after jumping off catwalk to avoid getting struck by pipe.
InjuryDescripti: While laying down pipe, the pipe fell off the back end of the catwalk. EE jumped off the catwalk to avoid getting struck by the pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While making up joint with Kelly hose, the hammer union got caught on bails, backed out and fell ont
IncidentDescription: While making up joint with Kelly hose, the hammer union got caught on bails, backed out and fell onto EE's right shoulder and side knocking him down onto the rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right shoulder and side after falling onto rig floor when struck by hammer union after it got caught on bails.

IncidentSummary: Pulled up to make a connection. Driller was paying attention to weight indicator. EE and other flo
IncidentDescription: Pulled up to make a connection. Driller was paying attention to weight indicator. EE and other floor hand to set slips on edge of rotary table, employee and other floor hand pulled slips into rotary bowl to set them. Slips did not set, employee put foot on slips to set them. Driller heard employee sent slips but did not realize slips were on top of employees for. Driller heard employee scream before putting full weight on slips. Driller picked weight back up; other employee pulled slips to get employee's foot from under slips.
InjuryDescripti: multiple trauma to right foot when pipe was set on employee's foot.

IncidentSummary: Employees were utilizing the forklift and the man basket to reach the cable sheave for the make up s
IncidentDescription: Employees were utilizing the forklift and the man basket to reach the cable sheave for the make up side tong cable. They were greasing each derrick sheave, including this one prior to stringing up and raising the derrick. This is a normal procedure. After applying grease to the sheave, the forklift operator began to lower the man basket and retract the boom away from the derrick. The basket edge caught a coil of the tong line cable (unseen by the operator) and as the boom was retracted, the length of cable was stretched to its' limit, finally releasing from the man basket and exiting off same into IE's back. He was struck by the single 9/16" cable and the 3/4" shackle. The cable coil was tied in the derrick. However, due to the force exerted upon it, the rope broke, casing the cable end to descend at a rapid rate.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to upper back when struck by cable

IncidentSummary: Co-worker was in thread protector basket and was tossing thread protectors to EE about 10' away. Whe
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Co-worker was in thread protector basket and was tossing thread protectors to EE about 10' away. When co-worker tossed one, it hit EE on his upper lip, causing a small cut.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip when struck by thread protector
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was screwing self-tapping sheet metal screws into the wall of an enclosed trailer. A fragment of
IncidentDescription: EE was screwing self-tapping sheet metal screws into the wall of an enclosed trailer. A fragment of the screw or a piece of the metal got into his eye. EE rubbed his eye and thought it was out. He started to feel pain that night and tried to flush his eye out, but it was still irritated. When he came to work the next day he notified management of the problem. EE was not wearing safety glasses.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced discomfort in right eye after a foreign body got into right eye while EE was screwing self-tapping sheet metal screws into wall of an enclosed trailer.

IncidentSummary: While working on the rig floor, EE was assisting drilling crew with tripping out operations. They w
IncidentDescription: While working on the rig floor, EE was assisting drilling crew with tripping out operations. They were using tongs to break every connection due to torque issues. At 4:00 AM, EE used the tongs to break loose a connection of drill pipe and grabbed the tong on the upper part of the tomahawk, just above the handle and swung tong back in order to rack back the tong. As the tong moved back, EE's left hand got caught between the tomahawk and the ST-80. The left index finger at the knuckle was a little swollen and sore. EE was wearing impact gloves. He waited until the end of the tower to inform the driller of the incident.
InjuryDescripti: Left index finger sustained an abrasion when caught between tomahawk and the ST-80

IncidentSummary: EE had cleaned out junk box, and washed everything in it. As they were putting everything back in it
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE had cleaned out junk box, and washed everything in it. As they were putting everything back in it, EE picked up a cut of 3/4" flat plate about 2-1/2' long. As he was letting it go, it slipped through his hand, cutting his right thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thumb by 3/4" flat plate approximately 2-1/2' long.

IncidentSummary: Strained left bicep while doing routine truck maintenance.
IncidentDescription: Strained left bicep while doing routine truck maintenance.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left bicep while performing routine truck maintenance at the shop.

IncidentSummary: Crew was starting to trip 4-1/2" liner to bottom with heavyweight drill pipe. Driller came up to bo
IncidentDescription: Crew was starting to trip 4-1/2" liner to bottom with heavyweight drill pipe. Driller came up to board with elevators and stopped to latch up stand of heavy weight. EE untied stand needed to go in the hole. Using his tail rope, he let the stand out towards elevators with left hand on tail rope and his right hand on the box of the heavyweight drill pipe. EE released rope with left hand and led stand in with right hand. When the stand hit the rear side of elevators, the horn (door) side of elevators came up and elevators were forced to close, closing on Ee's right little finger.
InjuryDescripti: Amputation of tip of right little finger caused by elevators closing on finger

IncidentSummary: Crew was nippling up the BOP. EE was tightening the nuts on the BOP studs with a hammer. Another cre
IncidentDescription: Crew was nippling up the BOP. EE was tightening the nuts on the BOP studs with a hammer. Another crew member was holding the wrench with a tagline. The EE was holding the hammer with his right hand, above his left hand, close to the base of the hammer. The EE swung the hammer and hit the bottom of the wrench causing the hammer head to come off the wrench and the hammer handle to come in contact with the wrench.The EE's right index finger was caught between the hammer handle and the wrench.
