InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right index finger when it was caught between the hammer handle and the wrench.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Sub, collar
IncidentDescription:
A hand was spinning out handling sub in collar and tried to lift it rather than using a chugger and it nearly fell on his toes because he wasn't 
expecting it to be that heavy.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/3P casing employee
IncidentDescription: While unloading casing from the truck while it was backing up one of the casing employees walked under the load of casing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Barrel picker, loader operator
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While picking up drums with the barrel picker, loader operator picked up and the barrel picker wasn't latched up very well to the drum. Hand 
stopped the job and signaled loader operator to lower the drum back down. This could have caused the drum to fall and hit the hand or spin.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Sub beam
IncidentDescription:
Hand was standing on top of a sloped sub beam while asisting with the nipple up operation. Sub beam was wet and muddy with no braces for 
support.

IncidentSummary: EE was making stand with pipe spinners when he slipped and grabbed handle making spinners go back th
IncidentDescription: EE was making stand with pipe spinners when he slipped and grabbed handle making spinners go back the opposite direction. This caused EE's right little finger to be pinched between tong and spinners.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right little finger when pinched between tong and spinners

IncidentSummary: EE was using tong to break out pipe while laying down drill pipe. He stated when he went to throw t
IncidentDescription: EE was using tong to break out pipe while laying down drill pipe. He stated when he went to throw tongs, he twisted in order to throw and his feet slipped out from under him. He landed on his left hip on anti-skid material.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left hip after slipping and falling on anti-skid material
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was picking up a joint of iron and while putting it on the back of the 18-wheeler, felt a sharp p
IncidentDescription: EE was picking up a joint of iron and while putting it on the back of the 18-wheeler, felt a sharp pain in his back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while picking up a joint of iron. Admitted to having a herniated disk and went to chiropractor that evening after incident for treatment. Paid for out-of-pocket.

IncidentSummary: EE was walking back to well head with chain. The ground was rocky and not level causing him to twist
IncidentDescription: EE was walking back to well head with chain. The ground was rocky and not level causing him to twist his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle while walking on a rocky surface while carrying a chain back to the well head.

IncidentSummary: MISS calcium flow (MS)
IncidentDescription:
While screwing in pup joint into hanger (to pull hanger), well came in and was flowing 11.6 calcium. Stabbed TIW valve. Calcium got on employees and spill was contained in 
cellar.

IncidentSummary: Clint was headed east on Hwy 84. When he was passing intersection, vehicle number 2 failed to stop a
IncidentDescription: Clint was headed east on Hwy 84. When he was passing intersection, vehicle number 2 failed to stop at stop sign.
InjuryDescripti: After being struck by a vehicle that ran a stop sign, EE was taken to doctor as a precautionary measure due to feeling soreness throughout his body.

IncidentSummary: EE was putting a tool box back into a trailer tool box and didn't see the can of Aerosolve II below
IncidentDescription: EE was putting a tool box back into a trailer tool box and didn't see the can of Aerosolve II below it. The spray can was punctured, and after hearing the hissing from the spray the EE lifted the tool box back up and was sprayed in the face. The degreaser ran behind his safety glasses and into his eyes.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced irritation to the right eye when sprayed by a can of degreaser after setting a tool box on it causing it to puncture.

IncidentSummary: EE was putting shiv on trailer and smashed the middle finger of right hand between handle and shiv.
IncidentDescription: EE was putting shiv on trailer and smashed the middle finger of right hand between handle and shiv.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to middle finger of right hand when it was caught between handle and shiv while loading shiv onto trailer.

IncidentSummary: EE was hooking up pump lines to mud pump and twisted back after stepping wrong.
IncidentDescription: EE was hooking up pump lines to mud pump and twisted back after stepping wrong.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after stepping incorrectly and staining back while hooking up pump line to mud pump.

IncidentSummary: While traveling on Hwy. 123N, EE noticed an 18-wheeler turning in front of him. EE applied his brake
IncidentDescription: While traveling on Hwy. 123N, EE noticed an 18-wheeler turning in front of him. EE applied his brakes, but collided with the back tires of the 18-wheeler.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to chest/torso after being involved in accident.

IncidentSummary: EE was washing shale shaker, prepping for rig move. He was kneeling down by #2 shake shaker and wa
IncidentDescription: EE was washing shale shaker, prepping for rig move. He was kneeling down by #2 shake shaker and washing underneath it. He reached with his left hand to brace himself so he could see under the shaker to see if it was clean. His hand was on the side of the #2 shaker under the on/off control panel when it shocked him.
InjuryDescripti: Electrical shock to body caused by shale shaker control panel

IncidentSummary: Nipplng up BOP with third party crew and was on walk around at top of BOPs, tightening up flow line
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Nipplng up BOP with third party crew and was on walk around at top of BOPs, tightening up flow line flange. Bolt broke and hammer wrench slipped out of thirty party's hand and fell to ground, hitting EE's upper left side of neck and shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to neck when hit by hammer wrench

IncidentSummary: EE was mixing mud, left the hopper to pick up used sacks and then stepped on a big rock and rolled
IncidentDescription: EE was mixing mud, left the hopper to pick up used sacks and then stepped on a big rock and rolled his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Right ankle was strained after stepping on a big rock

IncidentSummary: Employee was getting in a catch-all box, put right leg over to climb in and right foot caught top of
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was getting in a catch-all box, put right leg over to climb in and right foot caught top of box causing him to roll back falling on palette on the ground. Hit right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee when EE's foot caught on catch-all box, causing him to fall back and strike a pallet.

IncidentSummary: EE initially described discomfort in back as a result of childhood injury and not related to work.
IncidentDescription: EE initially described discomfort in back as a result of childhood injury and not related to work.
InjuryDescripti: Secure extension ladder to well head. EE climbed ladder and removed plug from needle valve to check for pressure. EE then attempted to remove 2 3/8Gǥ swedge from well with 24Gǥ pipe wrench. Unable to back out with 24Gǥ wrench crew got EE a 36GǥWrench and had him place it parallel to flow line. With EE working 36Gǥ pipe wrench Kevin Lancon and I on the ground, we worked the breaker bar to loosen the connection to where EE could back off using a 24Gǥ pipe wrench. We had to take several small bites with the 36Gǥ wrench to get connection loose. After stopping to talk with pump operator and Company man, noticed EE standing against truck in police stance.

IncidentSummary: The crew had lifted the B section with the winch then pulled it back away from the well approximatel
IncidentDescription: The crew had lifted the B section with the winch then pulled it back away from the well approximately 6 feet to get it out of the way for nipple up procedures. When coming down on the winch the B section did not get all the way to the ground before the strap broke that was holding it back causing the B section to move forward and "brush" against employee's left leg. No medical or first aid was required; also there was no equipment damage.
InjuryDescripti: Employee's left leg was brushed by the B section during nippling up procedure.

IncidentSummary: EE was stepping from one barge to another when right foot slipped into a fill hole on the barge. The
IncidentDescription: EE was stepping from one barge to another when right foot slipped into a fill hole on the barge. The hole had a cover over it, but it flipped open. EE's leg went up to his knee in the hold. Leg was sore to walk on.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle, due to the cover slipping off hole and leg slipping in, while stepping from one barge to another.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/forklift, bent fork
IncidentDescription:
Driller noticed that forklift had a fork that was bent more than usual and was causing load to be unstable. this could not be seen during 
inspection unless load was on forks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/fire extinguishers
IncidentDescription: During team hazard hunt, floorhand found two fire extinguishers that needed recharging or damaged

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/PPE
IncidentDescription: Safety captain noticed that fellow crew member did not have H2S monitor on and stopped him from going to rig floor before putting one on.

IncidentSummary: EE was working on a crane truck replacing the flex hose on the turbo. His hand slipped off the wrenc
IncidentDescription: EE was working on a crane truck replacing the flex hose on the turbo. His hand slipped off the wrench that he was working with and cut his right thumb in two areas.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to thumb of right hand after wrench he was using to replace flex hose on a crane truck slipped.

IncidentSummary: EE slipped off the pack of Unit #14 and landed on his left knee on the truck's catwalk. The power pa
IncidentDescription: EE slipped off the pack of Unit #14 and landed on his left knee on the truck's catwalk. The power pack is located at the front of the trailer and right above the fifth wheel. There is a round tube located at the bottom and in front of the power pack. The EE lost his footing on the tube which caused his head to fall forward and his feet to fall backward, landing on his left knee on the grating.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to left knee after losing footing on tube of power pack, falling and striking knee on grating of catwalk.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up, EE and another employee were installing mud line extensions (4" HW) from sub to mu
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, EE and another employee were installing mud line extensions (4" HW) from sub to mud pump #1. The extensions were placed in the #1 mud pump shed on rig down. During an attempt to pick an extension from the shed, EE experienced a sharp pain in his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back in attempting to pick up a mud line extension.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/choke lines
IncidentDescription: While taking off the choke and hcr lines, one fell to the floor and could have smashed a hand's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/uncovered floor hole
IncidentDescription: While making connection, an employee was walking backward and nearly fell into an open hole in the floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Rotating head housing
IncidentDescription:
Team member nearly pinched a finger while reaching under the rotating head housing to pick up a nut that he dropped. Other team member 
was tightening other bolts causing housing to roll toward first hand nearly injuring the employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Elevators, storm bar
IncidentDescription:
Hands on the floor sent 4'' elevators up on the hydraulic hoist to the derrick board, not realizing that the storm bar was set across the board. 
Derrick hand latched up pipe and hand on chugger tried to send the pipe down the mouse hole when the elevators became hung up on the 
storm bar and the derrick fingers. There was great potential for the elevators to slide off the storm bar and jam the hoist line which could 
have led to breaking the hoist line and having the pipe fall down the mouse hole as well as destroying the elevators as they hit the mouse 
hole which would have in turn caused shrapnel to go everywhere.

IncidentSummary: EE stepped off the well head and twisted left knee.
IncidentDescription: EE stepped off the well head and twisted left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left knee as he stepped off well head and twisted knee.

IncidentSummary: EE was hanging from catline and was being raised up to install jack head when left foot was caught o
IncidentDescription: EE was hanging from catline and was being raised up to install jack head when left foot was caught on tree bolts. Operator did not hear EE tell him to stop.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left ankle when it was caught on tree bolts while being raised up on catline.

IncidentSummary: EE was strapping equipment down on the tool truck. When the strap became caught, the worker yanked o
IncidentDescription: EE was strapping equipment down on the tool truck. When the strap became caught, the worker yanked on it causing him to fall backwards, landing on right hand and wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right wrist

IncidentSummary: The crew was laying down 4.5" frac string using a pipe wrangler. There were 2 workers on the floor.
IncidentDescription: The crew was laying down 4.5" frac string using a pipe wrangler. There were 2 workers on the floor. On the 66th joint the EE had put the joint into the trough. When the elevators came down, the EE pulled back on the elevator horn with his left hand with his right hand wrapped around the pipe.When the tong operator unlatched the pipe, the EE's finger was pinched between the pipe and the trough of the pipe wrangler.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained open fracture to right 2nd middle finger after it was pinched between pipe and the trough of the pipe wrangler while laying down pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/bleeder plug
IncidentDescription:
A hand was about to pull the bleeder plug out of the filter housing. He hadn't closed the supply line prior to pulling the plug. Another hand 
notice before he got the plug all the way out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/latch, door
IncidentDescription:
After exiting pitside backyard door, a hand closed the door and latched it closed. The hand turned around to head down 
the stairs and heard a bang, followed by another bang. When the hand turned around and noticed the door handle was 
gone then he heard a clunk clink clink, he turned around again and saw the handle rolling and bouncing down the stairs, 
quickly, the hand looked over the rails to notify anyone who may have been below the stairs. Luckily no one was 
because the handle went over the edge of the stairs and landed on the rig mats below.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/stands, storm bar
IncidentDescription:
After making connection, hand went to send the next stand down the mouse hole and two stands were hooked up to the hydraulic hoists, 
both stands were leaning up against the storm bar. Hands on the floor thought it would be okay the way they were sitting to send a stand 
down the mouse hole. As the lift nubbin went past the hurricane bar, the bar bounced out and the other stand almost came all the way out of 
the board. Once this happened the hands stopped to go fix the situation.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down, EE was taking all the safety belts out of the top dog house, one of the belts wa
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, EE was taking all the safety belts out of the top dog house, one of the belts was stuck under the main power cord to the top dog house. He lifted the cable to take the belt out from under it when he felt a strain in his lower middle back.
InjuryDescripti: possible strain to lower back resulting from lifting cable.

IncidentSummary: EE was pulling slips out after screwing in top drive. He said he pulled really hard, thinking slips
IncidentDescription: EE was pulling slips out after screwing in top drive. He said he pulled really hard, thinking slips would come out quick and easy but slips still had to much weight on them to be pulled on hard yet yet. Afterwards his back hurt.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while pulling slips

IncidentSummary: MISS snagged Kelly hose (AR)
IncidentDescription: Jeramiah Rogers was making swivel connections. While raising the blocks to make a connection, the Kelly hose slid between two handrails at the corner of the floor where the chains connecting them had come unhooked. The hose stretched 8-9 feet, pulling the blocks against the derrick opposite the drilling side and under the derrick board, raising up that side of the board two feet. When he came down with the blocks, the board fell back in place.

IncidentSummary: MISS SRL catch (AR)
IncidentDescription: Derrick hand was standing on frac valve to steady the blocks. He slipped and was caught by SRL, tag was popped.

IncidentSummary: Crew was in the process of making up a 1-1/4" x 12' gas anchor into the bottom of the seating shoe.
IncidentDescription: Crew was in the process of making up a 1-1/4" x 12' gas anchor into the bottom of the seating shoe. The top pup joint backed off while the gas anchor was being made up, dropping the working barrel on top of the EE's left hand. The EE's left hand was caught between a 24" pipe wrench and the top of the mud anchor joint, resulting in a cut below the first knuckle on the thumb of the left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration below first knuckle of thumb on left hand after hand was caught between wrench and top of the mud anchor joint.

IncidentSummary: MISS transfer cup (EC)
IncidentDescription:
Crew was running in the hole with rods out of the derrick. While going in the hole, transfer cup got hung up with the 
rod elevators as they started down. Derrick man yelled stopping the operator before breaking anything. Picked back up 
and let him remove transfer cup.

IncidentSummary: MISS block/rod basket strike (BR)
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up pipe and running in the hole with baler. While picking up a joint to make the connection, the operator pulled pipe up to a stand, resulting in block making contact with the rod basket. The sun was obstructing the view.

IncidentSummary: While tripping in hole, latched onto stand of drill pipe. Chris was standing back by V-door. While w
IncidentDescription: While tripping in hole, latched onto stand of drill pipe. Chris was standing back by V-door. While walking over to make up stand, ice fell off stand of drill pipe, hitting Chris on nose.
InjuryDescripti: laceration to nose after being struck in the face by falling ice during tripping in operations on the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Walking down steps from doghouse, hand slipped on ice and fell downs stairs.
IncidentDescription: Walking down steps from doghouse, hand slipped on ice and fell downs stairs.
InjuryDescripti: Multiple contusions to upper back and left shoulder after slipping on ice while descending stairs.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/festoon, 3P
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Black Gold Trucking was picking and moving the festoon house, when they had it tail rolled on and were moving it to 
the edge of location to chain down when the passenger side of the truck sank into location and the festoon slid off.

IncidentSummary: A wedge support from the shale shakers rattled loose and fell into the slide or trough bin for the c
IncidentDescription: A wedge support from the shale shakers rattled loose and fell into the slide or trough bin for the cuttings. It became stuck in the outlet pipe of the cuttings trough and EE reached down into the trough which also had approximately 4" of OBM flowing across the bottom to retrieve the part. When EE grabbed the shaker wedge, he also grabbed some metal shavings that were underneath the OBM. When trying to remove the shaker wedge, his hand slid across the shaving, causing a very small cut to the inside of his left little finger. Further investigation revealed that latex surgical gloves were being worn at the time of the incident.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left little finger caused by metal shaving

IncidentSummary: Vehicle pulled out in front of our driver and our driver turned to left to avoid contact. Contact wa
IncidentDescription: Vehicle pulled out in front of our driver and our driver turned to left to avoid contact. Contact was made when our driver's front right corner hit the side left corner of other vehicle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to chest after being involved in a vehicle accident.

IncidentSummary: After draining the mud from the motor, the driller picked up on motor and bit to fill it with water
IncidentDescription: After draining the mud from the motor, the driller picked up on motor and bit to fill it with water and drain again. When coming up on the blocks, EE grabbed the handle of the bit breaker to stabilize it, but while picking up, the bit breaker shifted suddenly and pinched EE's right index finger between the handle of bit breaker and the bit.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right index finger when caught between bit breaker handle and bit

IncidentSummary: TEXT: a 6" bit sub rolled on his foot while they were trying to knock float out of bit sub they had
IncidentDescription: TEXT: a 6" bit sub rolled on his foot while they were trying to knock float out of bit sub they had bit sub on boards on rig floor when bit sub rolled off boards on top of EE's foot. INCIDENT REPORT: EE had bit sub propped up on 4x4 board on rig floor to remove float. Sub rolled off 4x4 and landed on driller's foot.
InjuryDescripti: Left foot abrasion after bit sub rolled off boards and on to foot while during tripping process.

IncidentSummary: On 12-01-13, EE states a small scrape on left wrist was observed after it began to itch. EE is assum
IncidentDescription: On 12-01-13, EE states a small scrape on left wrist was observed after it began to itch. EE is assuming he received the cut that morning while helping break down a gun. On 12-02-13, EE noticed the cut was getting swollen, slightly sore and tender. EE informed fellow hands and company men at this point and then sterilized and bandaged it that night. On 12-03-13, the inflammation increased, and that evening EE notified management it was getting worse. On 12-04-13, Ryan Slapnika took EE to a clinic to have the laceration treated.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left wrist possibly while he was assisting in breaking down a gun.

IncidentSummary: While making connection, IE was tailing pipe out of mouse hole with a rope. He lost his footing and
IncidentDescription: While making connection, IE was tailing pipe out of mouse hole with a rope. He lost his footing and slipped, catching himself with his right hand. Driller told him to report to rig manager. Rig manager talked to him and IE said his right wrist was sore. RM did not see any noticeable swelling, but did notice a small spot about the size of a BB, touched it, and IE indicated it was sore. RM had IE flex his wrist, up/down and side to side, as well as opening and closing his fingers. IE was able to do all that was requested but still felt sore.
InjuryDescripti: strain to right wrist after catching self from slip hazard

IncidentSummary: Crew had just finished eating lunch in the doghouse. EE stood up and was walking out of doghouse whe
IncidentDescription: Crew had just finished eating lunch in the doghouse. EE stood up and was walking out of doghouse when his left leg went forward and right leg went backward, causing him to end up in a split position.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after slipping into a split position while walking out of doghouse after lunch.

IncidentSummary: While pulling casing tongs to rig floor from V-door. Door on tongs came opened EE right foot was cau
IncidentDescription: While pulling casing tongs to rig floor from V-door. Door on tongs came opened EE right foot was caught between tongs and casing bowl.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot when it was caught between tongs and casing bowl.

IncidentSummary: Made up fishing tools on ground. Floor hand tied catline on tools and was tying tagline on tools to
IncidentDescription: Made up fishing tools on ground. Floor hand tied catline on tools and was tying tagline on tools to hold back equipment. EE grabbed tagline to drop back end of tools on ground because crew had made up tools using stands. When EE grabbed tagline, floor hands on rig floor thought he was ready to pick up on tools. When operator picked up on catline, the weight from tools caused tool to slide off stand and strike EE on left foot. EE hadn't given a sign that he was ready. Drillers vision was obstructed die to stands in derrick so he had to rely on floor hands decision.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left foot after being struck by fishing tool when driller picked up on catline before EE was ready.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loose plate retainer
IncidentDescription: Wear plate pad dripped out, the reason for this is that the retainer plate came loose.

IncidentSummary: EE as finished putting wood away, started going up steps to see what to do next, slipped on 3rd step
IncidentDescription: EE as finished putting wood away, started going up steps to see what to do next, slipped on 3rd step up, twisting his left knee.
InjuryDescripti: twisted left knee after slipping on stairs

IncidentSummary: EE was pulling/laying down casing. Picked up and pulled drill pipe slips. EE stood up wrong while pu
IncidentDescription: EE was pulling/laying down casing. Picked up and pulled drill pipe slips. EE stood up wrong while pulling slips and felt a catch in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back upon standing up wrong while pulling slips.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was breaking down iron along side, with Jose Chavez assisting with the back saver, when EE felt a
IncidentDescription: EE was breaking down iron along side, with Jose Chavez assisting with the back saver, when EE felt a sharp pain in his right bicep area down to his forearm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a strain to right bicep while breaking down iron.

IncidentSummary: EE tripped and fell on the walkway in front of the 5th wheel where the steps to climb up between the
IncidentDescription: EE tripped and fell on the walkway in front of the 5th wheel where the steps to climb up between the tractor and trailer are located.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture in the lumbar area of L4 after tripping and falling on walkway.

IncidentSummary: During the incident when the blocks were dropped, injured employee and another employee were attempt
IncidentDescription: During the incident when the blocks were dropped, injured employee and another employee were attempting to evacuate rig floor abruptly in an emergency mode down the V-Door stairs. In doing so, injured employee was the first one going down and was accidentally bumped from behind and lost his footing one step from the bottom and strained both ankles when he hit the floor. Employee is fine and is refusing medical treatment at this time. First aid (ice and ibuprofen) was given on location. * steps on stairs were extremely icy and slippery due to very snowy, icy, and wet weather conditions.
InjuryDescripti: possible strain to both ankles upon impacting ground from slip on stairs.

IncidentSummary: EE was raising horsehead from ground to set back on pumping unit. EE lifted horsehead while floor ha
IncidentDescription: EE was raising horsehead from ground to set back on pumping unit. EE lifted horsehead while floor hand was holding tag line. Only one tag line was attached to horsehead. When EE lifted horsehead, opposite side of horsehead slowly swung in towards EE's console. EE reached out to catch horsehead. The weight of the swinging horse head caused EE's hand to be caught between rig floor and horse head. EE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hand after it was caught between rig floor and horse head.

IncidentSummary: During the incident when the blocks were dropped, injured employee was attempting to evacuate the ri
IncidentDescription: During the incident when the blocks were dropped, injured employee was attempting to evacuate the rig floor abruptly in an emergency mode down the stairs that lead down to ground from dog house. When he was about halfway down, he lost his footing and struck his right knee on a railing of stairs. He suffered a minor contusion but refused medical treatment at the immediate time. First-aid (ice and ibuprofen) were given on site immediately afterwards.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee from slip on stairs during evacuation of rig floor.

IncidentSummary: EE was working outside for about 20-minute intervals in 9 degree weather. EE was wearing cotton glov
IncidentDescription: EE was working outside for about 20-minute intervals in 9 degree weather. EE was wearing cotton gloves and continued to wear them after they became wet. He developed numbness and tingling in fingers of both hands.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced possible frostbite to middle, ring and pinky fingers on both hands while working outside in wet cotton gloves in a temperature of 9 degrees.

IncidentSummary: EE lost footing and fell off the back of the Wireline truck while rigging up. He initially stated hi
IncidentDescription: EE lost footing and fell off the back of the Wireline truck while rigging up. He initially stated his right side was sore and he twisted his ankle. He said he did not hit his head. EE called Axiom and was told to take Aspirin, not Ibuprofen. He continued working, began to feel nauseous and threw up. He stated he did not remember falling from the truck. He was taken to the doctor for evaluation.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right shoulder while losing footing and falling to ground while exiting Wireline truck.

IncidentSummary: Employee was working on dressing derrick out to be raised. He was working in the man basket in extr
IncidentDescription: Employee was working on dressing derrick out to be raised. He was working in the man basket in extreme cold weather. Employee was properly dressed for weather conditions and taking breaks when needed to warm up but toes started to hurt and he took boots off and checked feet and found that the toe next to big toe on left foot, nail started to turn black and blue.
InjuryDescripti: possible frostbite on a toe of left foot during extreme weather.

IncidentSummary: While picking up 2-3/8" tubing, EE fell from catwalk and hit right elbow on ground.
IncidentDescription: While picking up 2-3/8" tubing, EE fell from catwalk and hit right elbow on ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right elbow after falling off catwalk while picking up tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Tripping out of hole, employee bent over to pull slips, the hood of a rain jacket hung up on eleva
IncidentDescription: Tripping out of hole, employee bent over to pull slips, the hood of a rain jacket hung up on elevators bullhorn. Employee went up with elevators about 5 feet when driller noticed employee was hung up. Stopped and employee fell off and hit top of slips on the left hip and side. Feels sore but no medical needed.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hip and side after falling on slips when jacket was hung up on elevators bullhorn.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/weight bucket cable
IncidentDescription:
While drilling, driller heard loud noise come from carrier, weight bucket cable parted and weight bucket came down 
and hit HPU on carrier.

IncidentSummary: While making a connection, the injured employee pushed the kelly back to the other floor hand at the
IncidentDescription: While making a connection, the injured employee pushed the kelly back to the other floor hand at the mouse hole. Employees stabbed the Kelly into the joint in the mouse hole. The hand at the mouse hole released the kelly and began to step back as the driller engaged the kelly spinner, not realizing that his jacket had gotten caught between the kelly and a joint of drill pipe in the connection. The kelly picked up the floor hand and spawned him around, striking the injured employee, who was reaching for the ST-80, knocking the injured employee down. This resulted in a strain and bruising to the injured employee's left knee. The employee that was caught in the connection sustained no injuries.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee after being struck by kelly.

IncidentSummary: refer to PRIVATE DOCUMENT ATTACHMENT in SUB-INCIDENTS
IncidentDescription: refer to PRIVATE DOCUMENT ATTACHMENT in SUB-INCIDENTS
InjuryDescripti: Received laceration to second toe on right foot after being struck by equipment.

IncidentSummary: The crew was preparing to remove the lubricator from the well. A floor hand removed the wing nut and
IncidentDescription: The crew was preparing to remove the lubricator from the well. A floor hand removed the wing nut and pushed off the lubricator allowing it to hang on the sandline while the pack-off was still pumped up. Another floor hand reached down to retrieve a tool under the lubricator as the operator released the pack-off. The lubricator dropped about a foot striking the EE in the lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lower back after being struck by lubricator when it dropped.

IncidentSummary: The crew had backed off a rod string and started TOH with rods. While tripping out, the derrick work
IncidentDescription: The crew had backed off a rod string and started TOH with rods. While tripping out, the derrick worker was installing the transfer when the rod string jumped due to the string separating down-hole. The rod jumping up caused the transfer to strike the derrick worker in the face. The rod then popped out of the rod elevator and started falling to the ground. The operator yelled to watch out and the EE froze in position. The rod came down and laid over tagging the EE on the top of the hard hat and shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to neck when struck by rod on the top of his hard hat and left shoulder.

IncidentSummary: The crew had backed off a rod string and started TOH. While tripping out, the EE was installing the
IncidentDescription: The crew had backed off a rod string and started TOH. While tripping out, the EE was installing the transfer when the rod strign jumped due to the string separating down-hole. The rod jumping up caused the transfer to strike the EE in the on the cheek near the left eye. The rod then popped out of the rod elevator and started falling to the ground. The operator yelled to watch out and the floor hand froze in position. The rod came down and laid over tagging the floor hand on the top of the hard hat and left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to cheek near left eye after being struck by transfer jumping up when it separated down-hole.

IncidentSummary: While EE was drilling hole in tool rack, drill bit hung and twisted drill motor in hand straining ri
IncidentDescription: While EE was drilling hole in tool rack, drill bit hung and twisted drill motor in hand straining right ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ring finger after drill bit hung and twisted drill motor in hand.

IncidentSummary: While changing out wiper rubber, EE lifted wiper plate to set on side of floor. Five minutes later E
IncidentDescription: While changing out wiper rubber, EE lifted wiper plate to set on side of floor. Five minutes later EE went to change suction hose and felt pain in left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left shoulder after lifting wiper plate.

IncidentSummary: EE was working on a truck generator at the San Angelo district. While investigating a strange noise
IncidentDescription: EE was working on a truck generator at the San Angelo district. While investigating a strange noise, EE removed the fan guard and started the generator. When EE reached around to feel a hose, right middle finger was struck by the generator fan. The tip of finger and finger nail were torn off.
InjuryDescripti: EE's finger struck by fan blade of generator resulting in laceration and fracture.

IncidentSummary: Three employees were attempting to carry a 16G tool string from the plug-shoot trailer out to the st
IncidentDescription: Three employees were attempting to carry a 16G tool string from the plug-shoot trailer out to the stands on the ground. There was a heater hose inside the trailer, one employee was stepping over it, but tripped. The tool string fell from the employee who tripped, leaving the load on the EE, injuring (bruise) the EE's shoulder and arm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained bruise to left shoulder and neck area while carrying one end of a 16' tool string that slipped out of the hands of the employee carrying the other end.

IncidentSummary: While sliding packer into lubricator, EE picked up on packer close to stand. When packer moved, the
IncidentDescription: While sliding packer into lubricator, EE picked up on packer close to stand. When packer moved, the stand shifted hitting his finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left ring finger when stand shifted while picking up on packer close to stand.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was taking O-rings off and went to pick up hand tool from trailer and punctured left ring finger
IncidentDescription: IE was taking O-rings off and went to pick up hand tool from trailer and punctured left ring finger with a metal shaving.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to left ring finger while picking up hand tool from trailer and striking against a piece of metal.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/SRL
IncidentDescription:
While getting ready to do a rig service, the hand in the boatswain chair went to attach the SRL to himself and let go of 
the SRL thinking that it was connected but the hook for it was inside of the D ring not around it. SRL took off to the 
board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/cracked cam lock
IncidentDescription:
While a hand was transferring kill mud into the pill tank, he noticed a leak on the cam lock. Upon inspection, the hand 
saw a crack on the cam lock.

IncidentSummary: EE reported a sore knee but was unaware of any specific cause for the injury.
IncidentDescription: EE reported a sore knee but was unaware of any specific cause for the injury.
InjuryDescripti: EE reported a sore left knee but stated he has no cause for the injury.

IncidentSummary: EE was in the process of running the hydraulic catwalk as crews were tripping pipe out of the hole.
IncidentDescription: EE was in the process of running the hydraulic catwalk as crews were tripping pipe out of the hole. EE left the controls of the hydraulic catwalk and walked across the floor to the top dog house. He stepped in and grabbed a rag to wipe his hands. As he was walking back to the controls of the catwalk, the rig manager called to him from the top dog house. He turned around to see what the rig manager wanted and during the turn, lost his footing and slipped, landing on the left side of his body. He stood up quickly and thought he was fine. However, as he went to run the controls for the hydraulic catwalk, he noticed his hand had a laceration and notified the rig manager.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand after falling down

IncidentSummary: While tripping pipe out of the hole for a bit trip approximately 34 stands out, they had both tongs
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe out of the hole for a bit trip approximately 34 stands out, they had both tongs on to break out stand. Driller kicked in rotary and make up tongs didn't release, make up tongs swung around and struck EE in chest area, knocking him into make up tong chain pole.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back when struck by make up tongs into make up tong chain pole.

IncidentSummary: We had just released on/off tool and laid down landing JT. Cameron hand removed BP valve, broke out
IncidentDescription: We had just released on/off tool and laid down landing JT. Cameron hand removed BP valve, broke out hanger and put collar where hanger was. He then put tongs on TBG and pulled up slick joint. EE went to back joint out and tongs swung around and hit him and knocked him to the floor. Did not have stiff arm on.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to chest area after being struck by tongs when they swung around.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Crew was tripping tubing in the hole. The tip pin on brake bar came unpinned while going down with b
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping tubing in the hole. The tip pin on brake bar came unpinned while going down with blocks putting pipe in hole.Blocks stacked out on tongs and bent over hitting EE on the shoulder before he could move out of the way.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right shoulder after blocks stacked out on tongs and bent over striking EE.

IncidentSummary: MISS parted tubing (BR)
IncidentDescription: Crew was jarring on the packer to free a stuck "Hornet" packer so they could remove the production tubing for a cleaning out of the well bore. The supervisor and crew understood the risks with jarring and had everyone off the rig floor due to the potential that pipe could part. As the operator pulled 83,000 lbs on the string, a 2-foot pup joint supplied by Devon, parted an estimated  10-11" below the collar. The rig operator and packer hand were at the operator's console when the tubing parted, so no one was in the area to be struck by the pup joint.

IncidentSummary: Crew was trying to get the HCR hose to set into BOP area. EE was standing on the inside top beam on
IncidentDescription: Crew was trying to get the HCR hose to set into BOP area. EE was standing on the inside top beam on the sub structure getting ready to pick up the hose from two other employees who were helping with the job. When the two employees, who were standing on the outside of the sub, picked up the hose, EE grabbed it but lost his grip on the hose. When the hose started to move,, EE tried to stop it and slipped on the beam and couldn't regain his balance, causing him to fall backwards three feet onto the rig mats between the subs and the cellar.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after falling backwards three feet onto the rig mats.

IncidentSummary: IE was in manlift removing hammer seal for flow line to orbit valve. He was hammering on the top win
IncidentDescription: IE was in manlift removing hammer seal for flow line to orbit valve. He was hammering on the top wing when his left hand struck the lower wing and his left ring finger was lacerated.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left ring finger when hand struck the lower wing.

IncidentSummary: While raising derrick, EE was holding cat line. Cat line apparently became hung up on derrick which
IncidentDescription: While raising derrick, EE was holding cat line. Cat line apparently became hung up on derrick which allowed the line to whip out of EE's hand and the chain to hit against his hand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left wrist and thumb after being struck by chain while holding cat line.

IncidentSummary: EE was pulling and holding a computer system in a tight and awkward space, skid unit, when all the w
IncidentDescription: EE was pulling and holding a computer system in a tight and awkward space, skid unit, when all the weight went onto his left shoulder and arm. EE felt a sharp discomfort with popping in his left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left shoulder while pulling and holding a computer system inside skid unit.

IncidentSummary: Drove to location. EE was doing wire line work. It was very windy and when EE touched the truck door
IncidentDescription: Drove to location. EE was doing wire line work. It was very windy and when EE touched the truck door it slammed on his finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to finger after truck door slammed on it.

IncidentSummary: Employees were unseating a seat nipple on pump. EE was holding a back-up hammer on back side of seat
IncidentDescription: Employees were unseating a seat nipple on pump. EE was holding a back-up hammer on back side of seat nipple. Another employee swung a small shop hammer to loosen seat nipple, and hammer bounced off seat nipple and hit EE's left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hand after being struck by employee swinging a shop hammer while EE held a back-up hammer.

IncidentSummary: Ee was attempting to open the casing valve in the cellar with cement about knee high. Cement allege
IncidentDescription: Ee was attempting to open the casing valve in the cellar with cement about knee high. Cement allegedly went into his left boot, causing irritation to his foot shortly after.
InjuryDescripti: chemical burns to left ankle after alleged contact with cement in boots.

IncidentSummary: Moved the old kelly hose out of the way with fork lift to install new kelly hose (on the ground). Af
IncidentDescription: Moved the old kelly hose out of the way with fork lift to install new kelly hose (on the ground). After removal from derrick, the fork lift was hooked onto end of hose and picked up to lift over crate on the ground containing new kelly hose. The employees noticed that the fork lift was about to run over the lid that was removed from crate. EE stopped the fork lift, moved in and proceeded to move lid out of the way. It was not noticed that the hose was caught on the corner of crate containing the new kelly hose. The trapped energy in the old hose being held caused the crate to shift and caused the hose to slide across ground striking EE on right leg (knee and lower thigh area) knocking him to the ground and hose coming to rest on his leg.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee and leg after being struck by kelly hose

IncidentSummary: EE was about to step into logger but slipped on tarp cover that was covered in snow.
IncidentDescription: EE was about to step into logger but slipped on tarp cover that was covered in snow.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to left elbow after slipping on snow covered tarp while stepping into logger. He also had slight abrasion to the left shin.

IncidentSummary: While preparing to make a connection with the rig tongs (could not use ST-80 due to excessive torque
IncidentDescription: While preparing to make a connection with the rig tongs (could not use ST-80 due to excessive torque from back reaming tight hole). The tongs were facing the driller. EE put his right hand on the latch handle of the outer jaws and his left hand on the back of the outer jaw in the swivel area, to be able to get momentum to turn the tongs towards the drill string. When starting to turn them, the outer jaw swiveled back, pinching EE's left middle finger between the back of the outer jaw and the bolt that holds the tong body and the tong arm together causing a laceration to the finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to tip of left middle finger when pinched between back of outer jaw of tongs and a bolt

IncidentSummary: EE was guiding a set of 2 7/8" BOPs to place on a wellhead. High winds suddenly swung the BOPs and E
IncidentDescription: EE was guiding a set of 2 7/8" BOPs to place on a wellhead. High winds suddenly swung the BOPs and EE's right hand struck the wellhead flange. EE experienced mild discomfort and minimal swelling to his right index finger, but no laceration. He was wearing cotton gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained bruise to tip of right index finger after striking the wellhead flange when high winds suddenly swung the BOP.

IncidentSummary: EE unlatched elevators, pulled stand back. Stand hung up on end of board, not going in totally. EE
IncidentDescription: EE unlatched elevators, pulled stand back. Stand hung up on end of board, not going in totally. EE pulled again, feeling pain in belly button area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to abdomen, causing an umbilical hernia, while pulling stand of pipe.

IncidentSummary: While going out of the sub cellar area, EE was on his way to go rig up the rotating head to be insta
IncidentDescription: While going out of the sub cellar area, EE was on his way to go rig up the rotating head to be installed on the BOP. When he was crawling over front sub cross beam, he slipped, causing him to fall, injuring his testicles and left hip area.
InjuryDescripti: genital contusion to genital(s) and left hip as a result of a fall.

IncidentSummary: EE was hammering up the 4" 10-02 on well from the manlift basket on Cornerstone plug shoot and felt
IncidentDescription: EE was hammering up the 4" 10-02 on well from the manlift basket on Cornerstone plug shoot and felt a pop in his neck and sharp constant pain as he swung the 8-lb sledge. Temperature was -20 and claims he had stretched prior to working.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to neck while swinging an 8-lb sledge from the manlift basket.

IncidentSummary: EE noticed difficulty bending and is not sure how it was strained.
IncidentDescription: EE noticed difficulty bending and is not sure how it was strained.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back. Not sure what caused the strain.

IncidentSummary: EE was on manlift removing swedge from T.I.W. valve with pipe wrench and felt a pop in his right wri
IncidentDescription: EE was on manlift removing swedge from T.I.W. valve with pipe wrench and felt a pop in his right wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right wrist while removing swedge from T.I.W. valve with pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: While tripping pipe out of the hole, EE was in the derrick waiting for the next stand of pipe. When
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe out of the hole, EE was in the derrick waiting for the next stand of pipe. When it came up, he put the pullback rope around the stand of pipe and unlatched the elevators. He then put his right foot forward, for stability, and when he pulled back the stand of pipe to rack it, his right foot slipped out, causing him to lose his balance. He then pivoted on his left foot and tried to step onto a pipe finger with his right foot to catch himself. He twisted his body in such a way that it caused a burning sensation down his right leg.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right leg trying to catch himself after losing his balance.

IncidentSummary: EE was helping the motorman hook up water lines and thawing out. EE grabbed the 3" water suction an
IncidentDescription: EE was helping the motorman hook up water lines and thawing out. EE grabbed the 3" water suction and went to hook it up to the water pump when his right hand slipped into a burr or wicker on the union body and hand was punctured.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right hand when hand struck a burr or wicker on the union body.

IncidentSummary: EE pinched left pinky finger in the hinge of the tongs when the tongs closed while coming out of hol
IncidentDescription: EE pinched left pinky finger in the hinge of the tongs when the tongs closed while coming out of hole.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left pinky finger after it was pinched in the hinge of the tongs when they closed.

IncidentSummary: Gerardo Rodriguez was talking with a group of people and suddenly fell to ground. No further details
IncidentDescription: Gerardo Rodriguez was talking with a group of people and suddenly fell to ground. No further details.
InjuryDescripti: EE was standing with a group of people and suddenly fell to ground.

IncidentSummary: While picking up fishing tools on rig floor, EE pushed back on tool with hands and barb on metal str
IncidentDescription: While picking up fishing tools on rig floor, EE pushed back on tool with hands and barb on metal struck his left palm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to palm of left hand after coming in contact with barb on metal fishing tools he was picking up.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: As the EE was was coming out of the derrick, he was stepping from the base beam to the ground and ro
IncidentDescription: As the EE was was coming out of the derrick, he was stepping from the base beam to the ground and rolled his ankle on a hose.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left ankle as he stepped onto hose on ground as he stepped down from the base beam while exiting derrick.

IncidentSummary: EE allegedly strained left ankle while walking across location. EE states he didn't realize he hurt
IncidentDescription: EE allegedly strained left ankle while walking across location. EE states he didn't realize he hurt ankle when it happened. The only thing he can thing of that could have caused it was that he tripped when walking across location earlier that day.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly sustained strain to left ankle while walking across location earlier in the day.

IncidentSummary: EE was taking apart a #10 setting tool on the back of truck #43. EE removed the bleeder port plug an
IncidentDescription: EE was taking apart a #10 setting tool on the back of truck #43. EE removed the bleeder port plug and ruptured disk, then proceeded to remove the first barrel. While removing the bleeder port sub the threads tightened. When removing the sub there was trapped pressure below the firing piston and it came apart and hit EE in the arm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right arm after being struck by piston when it came apart.

IncidentSummary: EE stated that after repeated heavy lifting something "popped" under the left shoulder blade.
IncidentDescription: EE stated that after repeated heavy lifting something "popped" under the left shoulder blade.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to area under left shoulder blade after doing repeated heavy lifting.

IncidentSummary: After working outside for about an hour, EE reported his finger tips hurt and were white and hard. E
IncidentDescription: After working outside for about an hour, EE reported his finger tips hurt and were white and hard. EE was directed to stay in the doghouse and warm his fingers up. As the fingers warmed they started to hurt and he took some Tylenol for the pain.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained mild frostbite to finger tips after working outside in sub-zero temps.

IncidentSummary: While tripping out of hole, the well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger). Shortly aft
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole, the well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger). Shortly after, the rig crew was out of breath and had eye irritation.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to eyes and was out of breath after well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger) while TOH.

IncidentSummary: While tripping out of hole, the well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger). Shortly aft
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole, the well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger). Shortly after, rig crew was out of breath and had eye irritation.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to eyes and was out of breath after well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger) while TOH.

IncidentSummary: While tripping out of hole, the well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger). Shortly aft
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole, the well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger). Shortly after, rig crew was out of breath and had eye irritation.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to eyes and was out of breath after well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger) while TOH.

IncidentSummary: While tripping out of hole, the well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger). Shortly aft
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole, the well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger). Shortly after, rig crew was out of breath and had eye irritation.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to eyes and was out of breath after well came in with oil, gas and chemical (H2S Scavenger) while TOH.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken stiff-arm (AR)
IncidentDescription: While working joint up with power swivel, the stiff-arm caught in the derrick and broke off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Hess/dog mechanism (ND)
IncidentDescription:
While rigging up, the top section was scoped out and the dogs did not engage. The operator sent the derrick hand up to inspect 
the dogs and see if he could get 
the dogs to kick out. The derrick hand attempted to engage the dogs. While the derrick hand was standing on the tubing board, 
the operator moved the top 
section of the rig down to see if they were set. The dogs were not set and the operator came back up with the derrick top 
section. At this point, the job was 
stopped and the derrick hand was called out of the derrick and we had a safety meeting to discuss the situation that had just 
occurred.

IncidentSummary: While coming out of the hole, the well took a kick resulting in fluid coming out of the pipe. Fluid
IncidentDescription: While coming out of the hole, the well took a kick resulting in fluid coming out of the pipe. Fluid sprayed onto face irritating both eyes. EE's hand was caught between valve and tongs when he tried to exit rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right hand after it was caught between valve and tongs as he exited the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: While picking up 2 3/8" tubing off catwalk, EE said his lower back was hurting him.
IncidentDescription: While picking up 2 3/8" tubing off catwalk, EE said his lower back was hurting him.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while picking up 2 3/8" tubing off catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While EE was taking two 4" suction hoses apart, the hose came out of the cam-loc connection and popp
IncidentDescription: While EE was taking two 4" suction hoses apart, the hose came out of the cam-loc connection and popped up and hit him in the face.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to mouth after being struck by 4" suction hose when it came out of the cam-loc connection and struck him.

IncidentSummary: EE went to check position of 4" 5000# valve on choke manifold. He grabbed the handle with both hand
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE went to check position of 4" 5000# valve on choke manifold. He grabbed the handle with both hands and when he pulled, there was a sharp burning pain in left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder when pulling handle

IncidentSummary: Employees had stabbed the HCR valve onto the BOP stack and were installing the nuts to the bolts. l
IncidentDescription: Employees had stabbed the HCR valve onto the BOP stack and were installing the nuts to the bolts. l The HCR flange is roughly 1.5' above the ground level. Employees had placed boards across the cellar in order to sit on them to install and tighten the nuts. The cellar covers were not in place at this time due to the distance from the edge of the cellar to the HCR/BOP flange. The cellar is also 7' deep, making it impossible to stand flat footed and reach up to perform this task. Width is 8' across cellar. At any rate, the board Mr. Perez was sitting on, tightening the nuts, broke, resulting in a fall into the cellar.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation/inflammation to lower back and hips after falling into the cellar.

IncidentSummary: EE was tightening up chain with boomers. It got tight. He was wrapping slack around chain, causing D
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE was tightening up chain with boomers. It got tight. He was wrapping slack around chain, causing D-ring to pop and hit EE on right testicle.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right testicle when hit by D-ring

IncidentSummary: EE was screwing the sleeve for plug onto the setting tool. A piece of metal was sticking out and pun
IncidentDescription: EE was screwing the sleeve for plug onto the setting tool. A piece of metal was sticking out and punctured his thumb through his glove.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to right thumb when metal shard went through glove while screwing the sleeve for plug onto the setting tool.

IncidentSummary: Osiel Guardian was backing up T-34 to hook up the gooseneck trailer. EE was spotting Mr Guardian. Mr
IncidentDescription: Osiel Guardian was backing up T-34 to hook up the gooseneck trailer. EE was spotting Mr Guardian. Mr Guardian lost sight of EE due to him being pinned between the tailgate and the trailer. George Saavedra tapped on the side of the truck and got Mr Guardian's attention and he pulled forward.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after being pinned between truck and gooseneck trailer while he was spotting Osiel Guardian who was backing up truck.

IncidentSummary: While IE was doing his walk around checking equipment, he noticed a leak in the boiler room. He shu
IncidentDescription: While IE was doing his walk around checking equipment, he noticed a leak in the boiler room. He shut steam off to the rig, winterized steam lines around the rig. He then gathered his tools needed to repair the leak, two 9-/16" end wrenches and a step ladder to reach leaking supply steam line flange. While performing the task, IE lost his footing on the ladder, causing him to fall and injure his left leg and ankle. IE was working off the second step of the ladder 2' off the ground inside the boiler.
InjuryDescripti: Fractures to left leg caused by falling 2' off a ladder

IncidentSummary: EE strained right forearm while pulling night cap off well head.
IncidentDescription: EE strained right forearm while pulling night cap off well head.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right forearm while pulling night cap off well head.

IncidentSummary: EE does not recall time or date of incident. EE was trying to remove desander from mud tanks. He was
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE does not recall time or date of incident. EE was trying to remove desander from mud tanks. He was standing on a ladder hitting a hammer union with a sledge hammer. In the motion of swinging the sledge hammer over his head, EE felt a sharp pain in right shoulder and lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strains to various external body parts while swinging sledge hammer.

IncidentSummary: EE was turning a swing to get ball bearings out to replace them. EE removed gloves because it was di
IncidentDescription: EE was turning a swing to get ball bearings out to replace them. EE removed gloves because it was difficult to get the ball bearings out with the gloves on. While turning the swing, right hand came into contact with a metal burr and caused a laceration approximately -+ inch to the inside of the right palm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a laceration to right palm after striking a metal burr while turning a swing to get ball bearings out to replace them. EE had removed gloves to make access to bearings easier.

IncidentSummary: EE was standing beside pallet which had drillers console on pallet (note: wind was blowing very hard
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE was standing beside pallet which had drillers console on pallet (note: wind was blowing very hard), holding console on side so it would not fall over until forklift came back to secure pallet. The console was not secured to pallet. While waiting on forklifts arrival, wind blew console, causing wheel on console to fall in crack of pallet, which caused console to fall. EE tried to stop console, instead of moving out of the way, causing the console to fall on EE's right knee and then rolling onto his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee and ankle when console fell.

IncidentSummary: EE was going up to put a pup joint in the catwalk when steps broke off and he fell through steps, br
IncidentDescription: EE was going up to put a pup joint in the catwalk when steps broke off and he fell through steps, bruising his left leg and ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Contusions to left and right legs and left ankle after falling through steps.

IncidentSummary: EE was laying down 4 1/2" casing and felt something poking the left foot. The EE notified the operat
IncidentDescription: EE was laying down 4 1/2" casing and felt something poking the left foot. The EE notified the operator and was told to take the boot off. EE found a metal sliver in his foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to left foot from a sliver of metal in his boot while laying down 4 1/2" casing.

IncidentSummary: While picking up pipe running in the hole, EE (operator) struck the tubing board with traveling bloc
IncidentDescription: While picking up pipe running in the hole, EE (operator) struck the tubing board with traveling blocks bending the rail, or slide for the delay, causing damage to the tubing board.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to chest after being struck by swinging pipe when pipe hit tubing board after being hit by traveling blocks.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While picking up pipe running in the hole, EE (operator) struck the tubing board with traveling bloc
IncidentDescription: While picking up pipe running in the hole, EE (operator) struck the tubing board with traveling blocks bending the rail, or slide for the delay, causing damage to the tubing board.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right arm after being struck by swinging pipe when pipe hit tubing board after being hit by traveling blocks.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping in stands of 2 7/8" tubing in very windy conditions. The pipe stand back in th
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping in stands of 2 7/8" tubing in very windy conditions. The pipe stand back in the tubing board came forward pushing against the EE as he was inserting a stand into the elevator. The EE finished installing the stand and turned his attention to the stand which had fallen against him. As the EE was pushing the stands back, the operator started down with the blocks. The EE was then pulled from his feet onto the diving board and ended up below the board hanging from his positioning lanyard. The operator stopped the blocks and sent up the winch line. The EE hooked the winch line to the harness seat and was hoisted up to the board and was able to then climb on it. The EE then came down and was check over for his injury. No injury was found and they continued to work. Later he began to have pain in his upper back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to upper back when the operator started down with the blocks while the EE was pushing a stand back that had fallen against him causing him to be pulled him from his feet, which resulted in him hanging below the diving board from his positioning lanyard.

IncidentSummary: While EE was washing rig, felt sting on top of hand when the rig wash soap got on hand.
IncidentDescription: While EE was washing rig, felt sting on top of hand when the rig wash soap got on hand.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced irritation to right hand when soap he was using to wash rig came in contact with his hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/BOP manual ram wheel
IncidentDescription:
While nippling down, a hand was removing BOP manual ram wheel. After removal, he tossed it down nearly striking a 
hand that was working in the cellar.

IncidentSummary: EE was loading 2 ft perforating guns from a pallet in the gun shop to the bed of a pickup truck. EE
IncidentDescription: EE was loading 2 ft perforating guns from a pallet in the gun shop to the bed of a pickup truck. EE was organizing the guns to keep them level, when a gun rolled on top of his left middle finger. The incident took place at 4:00 am on 1/22/13. EE did not report the incident until 7:00 am on 1/23/13. The finger was swollen and sore and EE wanted to have the finger evaluated.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to left middle finger when it was caught between two perforating guns he was leveling after moving them from the pallet to back of truck.

IncidentSummary: EE was in extreme cold on the work floor. The operator noticed the EE's left cheek turned white. The
IncidentDescription: EE was in extreme cold on the work floor. The operator noticed the EE's left cheek turned white. The rig was shut down and he was directed to the doghouse to warm up.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained mild frostbite to cheek while working in extreme temperatures.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The crew was pulling out sandline and a loop developed in the rolled out line. The loop sprang up an
IncidentDescription: The crew was pulling out sandline and a loop developed in the rolled out line. The loop sprang up and struck the EE in the nose.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to nose after being struck by loop in rolled out sandline when it sprang up while crew was pulling out the sandline.

IncidentSummary: EE felt pain in left hand while pulling down on 24" pipe wrench while rigging up tubing testing equi
IncidentDescription: EE felt pain in left hand while pulling down on 24" pipe wrench while rigging up tubing testing equipment. EE stated he felt pain from a previous injury and just wanted to report it to supervisor.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced pain in left hand while pulling down on 24" pipe wrench while rigging up tubing testing equipment. Admitted he was feeling pain in the hand from a previous injury.

IncidentSummary: During rig down, EE asked Chris Cummings to throw the tie-down straps under the lube while he lifted
IncidentDescription: During rig down, EE asked Chris Cummings to throw the tie-down straps under the lube while he lifted the 2-5 K pieces of lube (1-10 ft & 1-20 ft) with a lifting strap. This was not done in a timely manner, so EE had to put the lube back onto the trailer. His thumb became wedged between the 2 pieces of 5 K lube, pinching/smashing his thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion/bruise to left thumb after it was caught between 2 pieces of 5 K lube he was lifting and returning to truck after tie-down straps were not put under them in a timely manner.

IncidentSummary: While attempting to close sliding outer door to choke manifold house, EE's right index finger was pi
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While attempting to close sliding outer door to choke manifold house, EE's right index finger was pinched between back of door and wall of house. He was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right index finger when pinched between door and wall.

IncidentSummary: EE arrived at shop 30 minutes before duty time was to start. When EE walked into shop, he was confro
IncidentDescription: EE arrived at shop 30 minutes before duty time was to start. When EE walked into shop, he was confronted by another employee who was angry at EE over a personal matter. Employee began yelling at the EE and the EE told him he needed to calm down and go outside to cool off. The two employees began shouting at each other and an altercation occurred. EE was struck on his left ear. Employee striking EE on left ear was terminated after the altercation.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration that required stitches after being struck by another employee 30 minutes prior to the start of duty.

IncidentSummary: Two operators became doused with well bore fluid, which was a Methanol combination. We will be recei
IncidentDescription: Two operators became doused with well bore fluid, which was a Methanol combination. We will be receiving the SDS from the 3rd party flow-back operators. EE was having difficulty with the hammer union and James Valentine went up onto the platform to assist. They hammered off the union and the crane operator, James Barnett, began lifting off the lubricator. The fluid in the lubricator then splashed over the EE and James Valentine.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced chemical conjunctivitis to both eyes after being doused with well bore fluid while hammering off the union on lubricator. Was doused over entire body and was treated for eyes as well as nausea.

IncidentSummary: Two operators became doused with well bore fluid, which was a Methanol combination. We will be recei
IncidentDescription: Two operators became doused with well bore fluid, which was a Methanol combination. We will be receiving the SDS from the 3rd party flow-back operators. Timothy Crow was having difficulty with the hammer union and EE went up onto the platform to assist. They hammered off the union and the crane operator, James Barnett, began lifting off the lubricator. The fluid in the lubricator then splashed over the EE and Timothy Crow.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced nausea and eye irritation after being doused with well-bore fluids while hammering off union on lubricator.

IncidentSummary: Unloading items off junk box at Pioneer drilling yard in Corpus Christi. Forklift lifted sub basket,
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Unloading items off junk box at Pioneer drilling yard in Corpus Christi. Forklift lifted sub basket, chain hung on control panel and forklift went back down. IE pulled chain to put back on sub basket when control panel fell over and caught IE's right hand between panel and junk box.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right hand when caught between control panel and junk box

IncidentSummary: The crew was TIH. The derrickhand picked up a 7/8" rod triple with the transfer. While picking it up
IncidentDescription: The crew was TIH. The derrickhand picked up a 7/8" rod triple with the transfer. While picking it up, he noticed it wasn't picking up as quickly as it had been so he pulled up on the rod again. When the rod jerked up, he noticed a rod had fallen from the fingers so he yelled to clear the floor. The operator saw the rod and yelled, but the EE was struck on the top center of his right foot. The rod then fell to the ground on the operator side.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to right foot after being struck by falling 7/8" rod when it fell from the rod transfer to the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Crew got to location on 1/30/14 at 06:30 AM to relieve the night crew. The crew started to TOH with
IncidentDescription: Crew got to location on 1/30/14 at 06:30 AM to relieve the night crew. The crew started to TOH with 2 7/8" tubing at 07:00 AM. At 09:00 AM, the EE came down and was sent to the doghouse to warm up while the rest of the crew laid down the BHA. While in the doghouse, the EE changed his socks and put his feet near the heater to warm up before replacing his boots. The EE continued working the rest of his shift doing housekeeping around the location. On the way home after his shift, the EE's left foot started to hurt. When the EE got home, he took his boots off and noticed a blister on the big toe of his left foot. EE came to work on 01/31/14 and reported the blister to the rig manager immediately.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained frostbite to big toe of left foot after working through the night on tubing board in extreme temperatures.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging up and EE was pulling Kelly hose from BOP trailer to hook the hose to casing valve.
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging up and EE was pulling Kelly hose from BOP trailer to hook the hose to casing valve.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hip after falling through a small hole in the grating covering the cellar while pulling Kelly hose from BOP trailer to casing valve.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped brake handle (ND)
IncidentDescription: The crew was picking up and tripping in 2-7/8" tubing. On the 136th joint, the operator started to set the brakes to slow to a stop about 8' up. The brake handle suddenly dropped to the floor. The operator set the slips and the emergency brake to stop the blocks. The elevators stopped on top of the tongs and stacked the blocks, which leaned about 1' off center.

IncidentSummary: EE went to the Rig Manager at the end of the day, stating that he had allegedly hurt his back the pr
IncidentDescription: EE went to the Rig Manager at the end of the day, stating that he had allegedly hurt his back the previous day while hanging up wind wall tarps. EE stated that he reached over the hand rails to grab the tarp and felt a sharp pain in the lower right hand side of his back.
InjuryDescripti: Alleged strain to lower back while hanging up wind wall tarps.

IncidentSummary: EE said when he was attempting to set the swivel packing, he caught his left index finger between th
IncidentDescription: EE said when he was attempting to set the swivel packing, he caught his left index finger between the packing and swivel.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left index finger when caught between packing and swivel.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping tubing out of the hole. The tubing count was off by 2 stands. When tubing anch
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping tubing out of the hole. The tubing count was off by 2 stands. When tubing anchor was pulled out, it hit the tongs causing them to come up and strike the EE on the right side near the rib area. The gear lever hit the employee when the tongs were brought up by the tubing anchor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right side near rib area after being struck by the gear lever of the tongs as they were brought up by the tubing anchor.

IncidentSummary: EE was pulling up 4 X 4 crane mat that was stuck in the mud and slipped straining his lower back.
IncidentDescription: EE was pulling up 4 X 4 crane mat that was stuck in the mud and slipped straining his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while pulling up 4 X 4 crane mat that was stuck in the mud.

IncidentSummary: EE stepped out of logger and twisted left ankle as he stepped into frozen tire ruts in the gravel.
IncidentDescription: EE stepped out of logger and twisted left ankle as he stepped into frozen tire ruts in the gravel.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left ankle when it twisted as he stepped out of logger truck and into frozen tire ruts in the gravel.

IncidentSummary: EE was standing in recorder cab cleaning window and sprayed Aerosolve II in right eye.
IncidentDescription: EE was standing in recorder cab cleaning window and sprayed Aerosolve II in right eye.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced no irritation after spraying Aerosolve II into right eye while cleaning recorder cab window. Aerosolve II causes irritation so EE flushed eye immediately and felt no pain and had no blurred vision.

IncidentSummary: During rig move, mast was taken off of the floor and separated. Motorman knocked the inside pin out
IncidentDescription: During rig move, mast was taken off of the floor and separated. Motorman knocked the inside pin out of his side on the bottom.
