He then picked up his pin and ducked his head as he went under the derrick beam to the outside of the mast. As he was going under, the rigger on top of the mast knocked one of the top beam pins out. The pin fell 10 ft., striking the motor man on the spine where his neck meets his shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: contusion to neck after being struck by a falling object.

IncidentSummary: EE was checking a check valve on the air system that he thought was stuck shut. He isolated the air
IncidentDescription: EE was checking a check valve on the air system that he thought was stuck shut. He isolated the air tanks and bled them off and locked and tagged out the air compressor. He then found that the check valve was not the issue and decided to add methanol to the tanks before returning to service. At that time, a tool fell out of his pocket onto the floor. As he bent down to retrieve the tool, the sleeve on his jacket caught the valve and opened it. The upper valve was open and the filler 90 was left pointing up at this time and blew methanol into his left eye.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left eye when methanol blew into eye.

IncidentSummary: While picking up 8th round of 3 1/2" tubing, drift (rabbit) struck EE on top of his right foot.
IncidentDescription: While picking up 8th round of 3 1/2" tubing, drift (rabbit) struck EE on top of his right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right foot after being stuck by drift (rabbit) while picking up 3 1/2" pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Crew was tripping pipe out of the hole. When they reached the collars the slip bowls needed to be re
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping pipe out of the hole. When they reached the collars the slip bowls needed to be removed. As Stacy Thompson and the EE were picking them up, the EE felt a pain in his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while picking up slip bowls.

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying down 2 7/8" pipe and the chain, or cat line, slipped off the wet JT and knocked the
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down 2 7/8" pipe and the chain, or cat line, slipped off the wet JT and knocked the EE off catwalk.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right leg after slipping off catwalk when was struck by the cat line that slipped of the wet JT.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Before moving rig out of yard, EE went to the drill console to tighten up the drill line. EE placed
IncidentDescription: Before moving rig out of yard, EE went to the drill console to tighten up the drill line. EE placed his left hand under the handrail and on the brake handle. When he clutched in the drawwork, the brake handle jumped up and caught his wrist between handrail and brake handle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left wrist when it was caught between handrail and brake handle due to the brake handle jumping up as he clutched in the draw work.

IncidentSummary: MISS shifting rig boards (PA)
IncidentDescription:
Moved rig up on well and noticed location was sloping down in front. Called yard to get more boards to put under front of rig to get it level. Once we got rig level, 
boards shifted in front and ground started sinking.

IncidentSummary: While removing safety valve from 2 3/8" pipe, saltwater sprayed up into EE's face knocking his glass
IncidentDescription: While removing safety valve from 2 3/8" pipe, saltwater sprayed up into EE's face knocking his glasses off getting saltwater in his eyes.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to both eyes after being sprayed with salt water while removing the safety valve from the 2 3/8" pipe. EE was not wearing approved safety glasses and those he was wearing were knocked off by the spray.

IncidentSummary: While standing up derrick, EE stepped on "A" frame of rig to untie block. Chain did not have enough
IncidentDescription: While standing up derrick, EE stepped on "A" frame of rig to untie block. Chain did not have enough slack to untie. Pusher was on drillers platform and told driller to pick up derrick a little bit. When the driller did this, swab line anchor point parted at rod. Rod flew up striking EE on right thigh area, cutting leg.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right thigh area after being struck by rod that flew up when swab line anchor point parted at the rod.

IncidentSummary: EE was tightening flange bolts of pump and the wrench slipped causing him to fall down.
IncidentDescription: EE was tightening flange bolts of pump and the wrench slipped causing him to fall down.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back when wrench slipped causing him to lose his balance and fall.

IncidentSummary: During routine drilling operations, the crew noticed that the kelly was hung up on the bushing rolle
IncidentDescription: During routine drilling operations, the crew noticed that the kelly was hung up on the bushing rollers. It was allowing the bushings to rotate but not allowing the kelly to spin freely. They then decided that they needed to change out the kelly due to a bad spot that was found on it. The company man decided that they needed to pull out of the hole thirty one stands into the shoe to change out kelly. The crew was in the process of setting kelly into the shuck. The rig manager decided to remove two rollers to allow the kelly to enter the shuck properly. He did not want to take the chance that the kelly bushings would hang up on kelly while picking up kelly from shuck. After removing the two rollers, the crew was in the process of setting the cap back down on bushings with the off driller side air hoist. The driller got down on his knees to help guide the cap down. When he grabbed the cap, the air hoist unexpectedly let out line which caused the cap to come down, striking drillers right hand, causing lacerations to both middle and ring fingers.
InjuryDescripti: Lacerations to right middle and ring fingers when struck by cap.

IncidentSummary: During nipple up on intermediate, after tightening the bottom bolts of the BOP, EE went to retrieve
IncidentDescription: During nipple up on intermediate, after tightening the bottom bolts of the BOP, EE went to retrieve one side of the cellar covers. As he was walking around the mouse hole to get it, his right leg slipped into the over-sized hole that the mouse hole was in. He fell sideways to the ground on his right side, resulting in pain in his right leg and knee.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee after leg slipped into the oversized hole that the mouse hole was in.

IncidentSummary: EE was spinning a 7/8" rod wrench and it it left knee.
IncidentDescription: EE was spinning a 7/8" rod wrench and it it left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left knee after it was stuck by a 7/8" rod wrench he was spinning.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down, the EE was holding onto the guy line and was stuck in the finger by a whicker (s
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, the EE was holding onto the guy line and was stuck in the finger by a whicker (sp).
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to finger ? after being struck by whicker on guy line.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up stands off the ground to go in the hole. EE was picking up tail end of the pipe.
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up stands off the ground to go in the hole. EE was picking up tail end of the pipe. The guy standing at the front end of the pipe picked up his side of the pipe and pulled it towards him to push it on top of the other pipe that was already there. EE's finger was pinched between the collar on the joint he was holding and the joint that was in the stack.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left middle finger when it was caught between the collar on the joint he was holding and the joint on the stack.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Rig crew was working on mud pump # 1 and removed caps from pump, attempting to remove plunger on suc
IncidentDescription: Rig crew was working on mud pump # 1 and removed caps from pump, attempting to remove plunger on suction side modular 1. Tried pulling them by hand, would not come by hand, tried pulling them with chain hoist, same result with about a 40" bar. EE was holding the bar with both hands at the end of the bar while another employee was hitting the middle of the bar with a hammer. When the bar was hit with the hammer, it caused the bar to bounce up, striking the palm of EE's right hand. EE did not report to rig manager immediately because he thought the pain would go away.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to palm of right hand when struck by bar.

IncidentSummary: While racking back drill pipe, EE slipped on floor, falling on right hand and wrist was bruised.
IncidentDescription: While racking back drill pipe, EE slipped on floor, falling on right hand and wrist was bruised.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right wrist after slipping on floor and falling on hand.

IncidentSummary: Rigging down to slide rig. While knocking the pins out of the mud boat and pony sub, EE hit himself
IncidentDescription: Rigging down to slide rig. While knocking the pins out of the mud boat and pony sub, EE hit himself on the left ankle with 10 lb sledge hammer. This was in the daylight hours at or around 3:00 PM and the weather was fine. All employees were wearing all necessary PPE for doing this job.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left ankle when hit by sledge hammer

IncidentSummary: While picking up and racking back pipe with air hoist, EE's left thumb was caught between two stands
IncidentDescription: While picking up and racking back pipe with air hoist, EE's left thumb was caught between two stands of pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb when caught between two stands of pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE was leading a convoy and fell asleep at the wheel 5 miles outside of George West on the way to La
IncidentDescription: EE was leading a convoy and fell asleep at the wheel 5 miles outside of George West on the way to Laredo. EE woke up as he hit gravel and tried to take control of the perforator. Had discomfort in his left shoulder. See EE's attached statement.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left shoulder caused by the seat belt restraint when truck ran off road.

IncidentSummary: The crew was picking up tubing from a pipe rack. After 70 joints were picked up, they started removi
IncidentDescription: The crew was picking up tubing from a pipe rack. After 70 joints were picked up, they started removing thread protectors from the joints on the next row. The EE reported to the operator that his nose was hurting and was told to go warm up, thinking he had frostbite. He was later found to have some redness of the nose form possible windburn or the beginning stages of frost nip.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained possible wind burn or frost nip to nose after removing face mask due to fogging of his safety glasses in extremely cold conditions.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: EE picked up a 10' sub of 2 7/8 tubing. Upon standing, foot slipped on some ice. As EE tried to bala
IncidentDescription: EE picked up a 10' sub of 2 7/8 tubing. Upon standing, foot slipped on some ice. As EE tried to balance, he strained lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after standing up and losing footing on ice after picking up a 10' sub 2 7/8 tubing.

IncidentSummary: FROM PWS FROI: "While driller was going up with pipe & block, other joint pn rig floor roll of and h
IncidentDescription: FROM PWS FROI: "While driller was going up with pipe & block, other joint pn rig floor roll of and hit hand on hard hat & neck while hand was pick up. rabbit, had fallen on catwalk."
InjuryDescripti: contusion to neck after being struck by joint of pipe

IncidentSummary: From Mark Denette: The driver, Kail Williamson, was driving unit number #162 (plate # LA P214350), t
IncidentDescription: From Mark Denette: The driver, Kail Williamson, was driving unit number #162 (plate # LA P214350), trailer plate number Oklahoma 453474, turning into a truck stop, and turned too sharp resulting in the hydraulic tank on the driver side at the rear of the trailer striking the dovetail of a parked gooseneck trailer. The spill is approximately 20 gallons, and Luke is working with the service station to get it cleaned up ASAP. No one was injured and the Sheriff is on the scene. More details and reports to come.
InjuryDescripti: After hitting back of parked trailer as he was pulling into Shell station driver decided he needed to see a doctor even though he had no pain. Report from the doctor describes injury as MVA/Body.

IncidentSummary: EE was picking up tools around wellhead, stepped on the grating next to the wellhead, foot slipped a
IncidentDescription: EE was picking up tools around wellhead, stepped on the grating next to the wellhead, foot slipped and he fell onto his back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lower back after falling when foot slipped as he stepped on the grating around the wellhead while picking up tools.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped rod (ND)
IncidentDescription: Crew picked up a rod and set it on a pin to make up. When the operator slacked off, the rod fell out of the elevator and to the ground. The area had cleared and there were no injuries or damage. The latches in the rod elevator were found to be contaminated with paraffin, which prevented the latches from closing properly. The elevators were not properly inspected and cleaned before use.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped rod string (ND)
IncidentDescription: After jarring on the pump for 3 hours, the operator started pulling up on the rod string to about 45 k lbs. The elevator broke which allowed the rod string to drop down-hole. It was later found that the failure was caused by a sheared anchor, which most likely caused the string to jump.

IncidentSummary: EE was walking across the stack out yard location to retrieve two empty diesel fuel cans. While en
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE was walking across the stack out yard location to retrieve two empty diesel fuel cans. While en route, EE had to walk down a small grade that was covered in snow and ice. EE slipped on the ice and snow, which caused his feet to come out from under him and landed on his buttocks.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after slipping on ice and snow and fell on buttocks.

IncidentSummary: EE was tripping drill pipe in hole from the drillers side of the monkey board. EE had a rope around
IncidentDescription: EE was tripping drill pipe in hole from the drillers side of the monkey board. EE had a rope around the pipe, waiting on the blocks and elevators to get to the board. When the elevators got close to the monkey board, EE dropped the rope and held onto the pipe with his left arm and reached out with his right hand to grab the horn on the elevators. EE leaned out to release the pipe into the elevators and the drill pipe smashed his right thumb on elevator horns. EE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right thumb when struck by drill pipe.

IncidentSummary: EE was rigging down a mobile rental light tower when he attempted to lower the mast that telescopes
IncidentDescription: EE was rigging down a mobile rental light tower when he attempted to lower the mast that telescopes lights in with the hand crank. It took off, spinning freely, and struck EE's first knuckle on his left little finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to third knuckle on left little finger when struck by hand crank.

IncidentSummary: EE was lifting a perforating gun with Dayton Bentz. He used his back and twisted to lift instead of
IncidentDescription: EE was lifting a perforating gun with Dayton Bentz. He used his back and twisted to lift instead of using his legs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to back while lifting a perforating gun and using improper lifting techniques.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up, crew was setting the walkway up on the back side of the shakers using a gin truck.
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, crew was setting the walkway up on the back side of the shakers using a gin truck. EE was waiting for the walkway to be placed in position to place the braces into position. Trucking company employee hooked in grating to pick it up and place into position with a gin pole truck. They set it into place and could not place the braces into place. They picked up on it some more and that is when the grating broke and the hooked grating slipped out from it and caused the grating to fall and strike EE on right ear, causing a laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ear when struck by grating.

IncidentSummary: While using the winch line through the rotary table to install the choke line valve assembly,using a
IncidentDescription: While using the winch line through the rotary table to install the choke line valve assembly,using a strap to lift the assembly, the winch line moved the assembly towards EE while he was between the trolley rail and the valve assembly. The assembly struck him on the inside of his left ankle and the valve hit him on the outside of his ankle. The lift was to be less than 4".
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left ankle when struck by valve assembly.

IncidentSummary: MISS snagged SRL cable (ND)
IncidentDescription: The crew was hydro-testing in the hole and were on the 6th stand, which was at 66.98 feet. The derrick hand walked the tubing out to the diving board and latched the elevators. The operator clutched in and the derrick hand looked up and noticed the SRL cable was wrapped around the tubing. The derrick hand immediately yelled to stop. The elevators caught the SRL cable and the operator released the clutch and applied the brakes. THIS RESULTED IN THE DERRICK HAND BEING LIFTED APPROXIMATELY 6 INCHES OFF THE TUBING BOARD.

IncidentSummary: EE was in the process of re-heading, slid his hand down the wire line and his right index finger was
IncidentDescription: EE was in the process of re-heading, slid his hand down the wire line and his right index finger was punctured by the cable armour.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to right index finger when stuck by a strand of wire as he slid his hand down the wire line while re-heading.

IncidentSummary: Thomas Francis description: EE slipped on the back bumper of a perforator and bumped his right leg.
IncidentDescription: Thomas Francis description: EE slipped on the back bumper of a perforator and bumped his right leg. Lee was exiting the perforator (in a forward fashion) after rolling up the unitGs tarp and his boots were greasy. The truck had been modified with expanded metal to prevent slipping and Lee had sprayed excess grease off the bumper before entering the unit.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right leg after slipping and striking bumper upon stepping out of perforator.

IncidentSummary: As EE was installing the firing head on the setting too, a wicker slid into right palm.
IncidentDescription: As EE was installing the firing head on the setting too, a wicker slid into right palm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to right hand after coming in contact with a wicker while installing the firing head on the setting tool.

IncidentSummary: MISS pipe failure
IncidentDescription:
Pulling out of well with coiled tubing 2" pipe. The pipe came out of injection head and fell to deck. The Sparrow crane operator was walking to his crane to set in and 
start crane to unstab injector head. Pipe landed approximately 2 ft from him. No injury occurred and no one else was in harms way.

IncidentSummary: When stabbing pipe in injector head, EE was holding pipe while standing on injector head. Had anothe
IncidentDescription: When stabbing pipe in injector head, EE was holding pipe while standing on injector head. Had another employee holding rope on pipe for support. Crane was tied to pipe to hold pipe as well. Boomed crane down to straighten out pipe and swing over. Pipe was 2" CT. The rope broke and pipe slipped from employees hand and hit him in the mouth. Both employees were tied off and communication with crane operator was with radio so communication was good. Also, supervisor was on deck watching everything to ensure safety. JSA was reviewed before job was performed.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture (chip) to front tooth and cut to lip after being struck by pipe after rope broke and pipe slipped from his hand and struck him in the mouth.

IncidentSummary: IE pulled forklift over by diesel tank to fill forklift up, IE got off forklift and ran diesel hose
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: IE pulled forklift over by diesel tank to fill forklift up, IE got off forklift and ran diesel hose from fuel pump to forklift upon going to turn valve on for fuel, derrickman got on forklift to go to get 4" hose for jet system. Derrickman did not see fuel hose in forklift and started driving ahead, causing fuel line to stretch and pop out of fuel tank of forklift, striking IE in right shin with nozzle with a lot of force.
InjuryDescripti: Fractures to right leg when struck by fuel line.

IncidentSummary: While looking for a union in the parts house, EE knocked a small container off a shelf which hit hi
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While looking for a union in the parts house, EE knocked a small container off a shelf which hit him in the face, causing a small scratch on his nose.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to nose when a small container fell off a shelf and hit nose.

IncidentSummary: EE was cleaning up rain water by the mud pump area with the super sucker vacuum. After finishing th
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: EE was cleaning up rain water by the mud pump area with the super sucker vacuum. After finishing the job, EE was taking apart the 2" hose so he could move the vacuum (there was no pressure on the hoses). While rolling up the hoses, EE was attempting to separate the two hoses, and he had one hand on each hose end, about 1" away from each connection, and was pulling them apart. When the hose parted, the hose end in EE's left hand struck him on the right side of his lower lip.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right side of lower lip when hose end struck lip.

IncidentSummary: MISS crane tip-over
IncidentDescription:
Employee went to rig up crane and did not extend the outriggers before lifting the boom up and swinging it off the passenger side of the crane. This resulted in the 
crane tipping over onto the passenger side. The boom hit the passenger rear corner of Truck 68 before landing on the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure testing lube
IncidentDescription:
See attached report in Private Document Attachment for more detailed description.
Opened well to lubricator and tried to move down with tool trap closed. Tool would not move. Shut well in, bled lubricator to lower pressure, dropped grease 
pressure and worked line by hand to no avail. Tool came loose from grease head and pulled out of rope socket when hit end of slack from working tool, landing on 
tool trap.

IncidentSummary: MISS setting tool
IncidentDescription: Tearing apart #10 setting tools and trapped pressure in bottom of the tool caused it to blow off the bottom piston and connector approximately 15 feet.

IncidentSummary: EE was cleaning subs in parts washer in the enclosed trailer on a plug/perf job. Left thumb caught o
IncidentDescription: EE was cleaning subs in parts washer in the enclosed trailer on a plug/perf job. Left thumb caught on sharp burr on the sub. EE was wearing "thickster" rubber gloves when the incident happened.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left thumb after it caught on sharp burr on the sub he was cleaning.

IncidentSummary: EE was removing port plugs from shot perforating guns after a completed run on a plug/shoot job. The
IncidentDescription: EE was removing port plugs from shot perforating guns after a completed run on a plug/shoot job. The EE slipped off the 24" pipe wrench he was using and came into contact with a vice. Right ring finger was smashed and has a small cut. EE was wearing both surgical blue gloves and cotton gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right ring finger upon striking vice after slipping off 24" pipe wrench he was using.

IncidentSummary: EE was found to have some frost-nip on his nose while working on the floor with -22 windchill. EE wa
IncidentDescription: EE was found to have some frost-nip on his nose while working on the floor with -22 windchill. EE was able to warm up and continue.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained frost-nip to nose while working in -22 temperatures.

IncidentSummary: EE was laying down gun string and felt something pop in his right calf muscle.
IncidentDescription: EE was laying down gun string and felt something pop in his right calf muscle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to calf of right leg while laying down gun string.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving a valve from the pump into the tool trailer and experienced a sharp stabbing pain in t
IncidentDescription: IE was moving a valve from the pump into the tool trailer and experienced a sharp stabbing pain in the lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while moving a valve from the pump into the tool trailer.

IncidentSummary: Hands were setting BOP on flow cross getting ready to nipple up the BOP's that were suspended on for
IncidentDescription: Hands were setting BOP on flow cross getting ready to nipple up the BOP's that were suspended on fork lift operated by Danny Avila. They were setting the BOP's on flow cross, Jesse had his pinky finger under edge of the flange and when the BOP's were set down his finger was caught between the flow cross and BOP's.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to right pinky finger when it was caught between flow cross and BOP's.

IncidentSummary: While tripping drill pipe into the hole, the north wind started to blow extremely hard, causing EE t
IncidentDescription: While tripping drill pipe into the hole, the north wind started to blow extremely hard, causing EE to have to hold the pipe against the wind and guide into the elevators. This resulted into straining his left shoulder and middle and upper back muscles.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder and upper and middle back muscles when wind blew extremely hard and EE had to hold the pipe against the wind.

IncidentSummary: Coming out of hole with pipe, derrick man grabbed pipe with wrong "left hand." Hand opened elevators
IncidentDescription: Coming out of hole with pipe, derrick man grabbed pipe with wrong "left hand." Hand opened elevators with right hand and elevators struck top of left arm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left arm after being struck by elevators while tripping out.

IncidentSummary: Rig crew was standing swivel back in derrick. EE was pushing hydro lines back and fell through floo
IncidentDescription: Rig crew was standing swivel back in derrick. EE was pushing hydro lines back and fell through floor where piece was missing. EE hit ribs on slips.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to ribs on left side of torso after falling through floor while pushing hydro lines back.

IncidentSummary: MISS turnbuckle adjuster bolt eyelet (ND)
IncidentDescription:
While jarring on a stuck pump, the brake handle dropped down but the operator was able to stop the blocks. The crew was able to lower the blocks to the ground 
safely. Upon inspection, the eyelet on the turnbuckle adjuster bolt was broken. The brakes had been inspected earlier without issue.

IncidentSummary: IE was on the man lift attempting to remove tape from chain using a screwdriver. The screwdriver sli
IncidentDescription: IE was on the man lift attempting to remove tape from chain using a screwdriver. The screwdriver slipped resulting in a small laceration to left palm. He was wearing impact resistant gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained small laceration to left palm after screwdriver being used to remove tape from chain slipped.

IncidentSummary: Crew was working on rig upgrade to a hook and drag system. When EE was walking down the cap and beam
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Crew was working on rig upgrade to a hook and drag system. When EE was walking down the cap and beam and went to step across onto the suit case, he rolled his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle when stepping onto the suit case.

IncidentSummary: While tripping in 4" HWDP, EE, who was on the board, missed the latch on a stand of HWDP, causing th
IncidentDescription: While tripping in 4" HWDP, EE, who was on the board, missed the latch on a stand of HWDP, causing the stand to fall to the back of the board. To bring the stand back across the derrick, the hands on the floor wrapped a hydraulic tugger line around the mid section of the stand and brought the stand over to the board. EE wrapped his rope around the stand and pulled it into the alley. The stand had had tension on it making it go the back of the board. When the stand went to the back of the board, it knocked EE off balance and took him with it. EE's left foot was caught in between the HWDP and the back of the board.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot when caught between HWDP and the back of the board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Pratt mast trailer
IncidentDescription:
Driver left shop without securing pin in Pintle hitch. When going over RR tracks the trailer bounced causing the Pintle hitch to release and the lunette ring to come 
out of the hitch. Mast trailer was then being pulled by safety chains for about 1/4 mile. When trailer hit the bump on the road the chains broke. The emergency 
break away was triggered causing the trailer brakes to lock up, the trailer to turn left into oncoming traffic, go down into a ditch and through a farmers fence.

IncidentSummary: The crew was preparing to rig up. While pulling out the guy lines from the rig carrier, the IE slipp
IncidentDescription: The crew was preparing to rig up. While pulling out the guy lines from the rig carrier, the IE slipped on some ice and twisted his ankle. IE had some discomfort but was able to continue working.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle after slipping on ice while pulling guy lines from rig carrier during rig-up.

IncidentSummary: EE was unthawing pipe spinner in top dog house. Rig manager and crew moved pipe spinners in top dog
IncidentDescription: EE was unthawing pipe spinner in top dog house. Rig manager and crew moved pipe spinners in top doghouse due to the heater. EE was working on activator that works the pipe spinner that opens and closes it. He was connecting and disconnecting 1" air line to pour antifreeze into air line to fire up activator into air line to fire up activator . In doing so, it caused the liquid to come out of exhaust, causing impairment of EE's vision and it was harder for him to breathe so he stood in front of pipe spinners away from exhaust. He leaned over closed pipe spinner and was standing far enough away but when he leaned forward, his right lower leg was in the closing part of the pipe spinner, causing pipe spinner to close on his leg.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right lower leg when it was caught in pipe spinners.

IncidentSummary: Employees were tightening up flange bolts between choke flex line and HCR valve. Employee using sma
IncidentDescription: Employees were tightening up flange bolts between choke flex line and HCR valve. Employee using small sledge hammer lost his grip on hammer and struck a glancing blow to EE's nose as he was holding hammer wrench.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to nose when struck by small sledge hammer.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT trapped pressure
IncidentDescription:
While making up BHA the driller was filling the hole on the back side thru the kill line with the #1 mud pump @60 stks. 
& 251 gpms. Hole was figured at 441 bbls. after loading the hole with 332 bbls the mud tank volume was getting 
low,down to 370 bbls. so the driller shut the pump off and continued to make up BHA. After finishing with BHA the 
driller cleared the floor, opened the HCR and then the blind rams. The blind rams did not open, so the driller 
functioned the rams a couple of times. When the blind rams opened there was trapped pressure in the lines. The 
pressure blew mud on to the derrick and blew the rotary bushing out of the table.

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying down drill pipe and EE was working on breakout side. He moved his tongs off to the s
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down drill pipe and EE was working on breakout side. He moved his tongs off to the side to push pipe in trough when tongs came back. When he tried to stop them, tongs hit his left arm above his wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left arm above wrist when struck by tongs.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While sitting on the bumper, IE was lifting a sheave out of the holder from the back of the Wireline
IncidentDescription: While sitting on the bumper, IE was lifting a sheave out of the holder from the back of the Wireline truck. When the IE handed the sheave to the operator, they could hear his muscle tearing.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right arm while lifting a sheave out of the back of the Wireline truck.

IncidentSummary: While laying down 4" HWDP at end of hole, IE was pushing pipe into trough. The rig beats the catwal
IncidentDescription: While laying down 4" HWDP at end of hole, IE was pushing pipe into trough. The rig beats the catwalk most of the time so your waiting on it so when the catwalk trough was coming through the V-door onto floor, IE was pushing joint into the trough at same time using his right hand and was low on the joint. When getting joint into trough, it was hugging the left side V part of trough, and the end of the trough was pushing against the sleeve of his shirt, which caused his hand to slide down the pipe more and right thumb got caught between trough and joint.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture and laceration to right thumb when thumb was caught between trough and joint of pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was working board, tripping out of hole, weather was bad, raining and wind blowing. Approximately
IncidentDescription: IE was working board, tripping out of hole, weather was bad, raining and wind blowing. Approximately 5500' of pipe had been tripped out of hole, had 30 joints 5" HWt pipe, second to last stand of HWt, when IE slipped while pulling pipe to fingers. As he went to pull the next stand, his lower back was strained.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after slipping while pulling pipe to fingers.

IncidentSummary: While tightening cap on mud pump, EE slipped and lost his balance and fell onto suction piping.
IncidentDescription: While tightening cap on mud pump, EE slipped and lost his balance and fell onto suction piping.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hip after losing balance and falling onto suction piping.

IncidentSummary: Employees were tripping pipe. The injured employee was pulling slips when he said he felt a pop in h
IncidentDescription: Employees were tripping pipe. The injured employee was pulling slips when he said he felt a pop in his left arm followed by a light burning sensation. The employee stated he was fine just wanted to report he incident.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left arm while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: EE was taking off wedding band and was swinging hammer, hitting clamp wrench and swung the wrong way
IncidentDescription: EE was taking off wedding band and was swinging hammer, hitting clamp wrench and swung the wrong way. He then felt he pulled something in his back and dropped hammer.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while swinging hammer

IncidentSummary: EE was climbing down derrick ladder, stepped off ladder onto pad-eye on base beam
IncidentDescription: EE was climbing down derrick ladder, stepped off ladder onto pad-eye on base beam
InjuryDescripti: Misstep on pad-eye resulting in strain to left ankle.

IncidentSummary: MVA
IncidentDescription: MVA
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to neck and upper back after being involved in a roll-over incident.

IncidentSummary: While cleaning up rig floor, EE attempted to move the hydraulic choke panel to clean up around it.
IncidentDescription: While cleaning up rig floor, EE attempted to move the hydraulic choke panel to clean up around it. EE did not close the lid to the panel before attempting to move it. EE put his left hand on the front of the panel in the closing area of the lid and his right hand on the back of the panel. When he attempted to move the panel, the lid came down and struck his left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand when panel lid came down and struck hand.

IncidentSummary: IE was drilling a hole in a cabinet with a power drill. The drill slipped and the but cut the right
IncidentDescription: IE was drilling a hole in a cabinet with a power drill. The drill slipped and the but cut the right index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right index finger when struck by bit after power drill slipped.

IncidentSummary: EE was on the rig floor with the driller and the floorhand. They were rigging down the rig floor and
IncidentDescription: EE was on the rig floor with the driller and the floorhand. They were rigging down the rig floor and EE noticed that the hydraulic lines needed to scope in the derrick had not been rigged up. EE put on his belt and rigged up the tension limiter and did not do a personal hoisting permit and failed to put on his secondary fall protection. He went up and hooked up the hydraullic lines and on his way down noticed that the block hanging line was still pushed through the derrick and need to be pulled back in. He grabbed the line and had the winch line operator come up on the winch while he was holding the line so he could pull it through to the inside of the derrick. As the operator was coming up on the winch line, the tension limiter broke apart and EE fell ten feet. He impacted the load hitch on the top drive cradle and was able to grab a hold of it and stop his fall. The driller put on a belt and went up the ladder on the side of the top drive cradle, hooked up the second winch to his harness and they brought EE to the floor.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left leg after falling ten feet onto load hitch.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/wrangler
IncidentDescription:
Hand was running the pipe wrangler and kicked a joint into wrangler while the trough was in the air, he brought the 
trough back down nearly bending the joint under the trough.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Elevator safety pin
IncidentDescription: While a hand was latching the 4'' elevators, he put the safety pin in but as it was being raised the pin popped out and the hand noticed it in time and had the tugger operator lower the joint.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pipe, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While making a connection the floorhand picked a stand of pipe out of the box and proceeded to move the ST-80 forward and unclamped the ST-80. The drill had already began to move the top drive down to spin into it. This caused the pipe to drop onto the rig floor with enough force to cut a whole in the floor mat.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/skate
IncidentDescription:
Hand was running the wrangler for laydown. As he was bringing the trough down with a joint in it he moved the skate all 
the way back. The joint of pipe slid down and nearly broke the skate.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pin end protector
IncidentDescription:
While laying down drill pipe, a hand put a joint in the trough and unlatched the elevators while lowering the trough, the 
pipe slid down and hit the skates and the pin end protector shattered. A piece flew and almost struck a hand on the 
ground.

IncidentSummary: EE was lifting a joint of tubing to the rig floor to be picked up. As he adjusted his grip, his righ
IncidentDescription: EE was lifting a joint of tubing to the rig floor to be picked up. As he adjusted his grip, his right hand slipped off causing the weight to shift to the left. The weight transfer caused his left arm to hyper-extend.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left arm after his right hand slipped off a joint of tubing while lifting it to the rig floor.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS broken rig up chain
IncidentDescription: Rig up chain broke on bottom of sheave causing the sheave to follow the wireline into the back of the truck.

IncidentSummary: IE complained of a sore elbow and was unable to straighten left arm. IE was unable to point out a sp
IncidentDescription: IE complained of a sore elbow and was unable to straighten left arm. IE was unable to point out a specific incident which would cause injury. Claimed the injury was due to repetitive work as a floor hand. Gave no indication of doing any treatment after having pain. Wanted to see a doctor as he claimed the issue was work related.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly sustained strain to left elbow due to performing repetitive work as a floor hand. Can't provided an exact date and time when pain initially experienced.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/wrangler, skate
IncidentDescription:
While making up stand in the mouse hole, a hand walked right in front of the wrangler while operator was bringing up a 
joint with the skate almost striking the hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/safety latch
IncidentDescription:
While latching up heavy weight, the elevator's safety latch didn't close all the way and the derrick hand shut down the 
driller before he picked up the stand. The driller came down and the derrick hand shut the safety latch.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/spinners
IncidentDescription:
Employee swung pipe spinners over to mousehole to make up two joints. Hand noticed the snub line wasn't hooked up to spinners and yelled to 
stop the job.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Hydraulic hose
IncidentDescription:
A hand was replacing a hydraulic cylinder on "gull" wings after turning off the catwalk and bleeding pressure, the hand removed the hose and 
hydraulic oil squirted out and sprayed the hand on the chest but he didn't get injured.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/forklift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While driving the forklift, an employee backed over two pallets and hit an arm on the catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/climate exposure
IncidentDescription:
While hooking up the choke hose to the choke house, team members noticed other team members face was bright 
red/white.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ladder
IncidentDescription:
While changing a hose on the top drive, a hand was on a ladder and the ladder nearly slid out from under him but the 
hand was wearing SRL and harness.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/cement head
IncidentDescription:
A crew member was bringing the cement head to the floor and was going too fast on the chugger and the cement head 
flew in and nearly hit a crew member that was on the floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/catwalk, skate
IncidentDescription:
While the skate and catwalk were in motion coming down with thread protectors in, a hand ran up to grab them nearly 
getting struck by the skate.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tool joint
IncidentDescription: When pulling a stand out, the tool joint got caught on the pushing and pulled out of the hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/missing, broken bolts
IncidentDescription: The shaker motors had one bolt missing and a couple of other bolts broke off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/latch snag
IncidentDescription:
As single latch was being sent up, it snagged a keeper on a pin along tracks and operator was stopped and lowered it 
down to free it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/latch tension, elevators
IncidentDescription:
While building a stand, an employee unlatched the single latch elevators before all of the tension was released and 
once he unlatched the elevators, they shot up in the air about a foot or two.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/snapped bushing
IncidentDescription:
Hands were pulling bushings from the rotary table and a bushing got wedged in the table and the tugger operation kept 
pulling causing the bushing to snap out of the table, out of control, coming loose from hooks and almost hit a hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/no collar
IncidentDescription:
After setting up BHA in mousehole, driller came down to set the slips while in the mousehole and a hand reached up to 
unlatch the elevators without the collar installed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/malfunctioning fill gauge
IncidentDescription: While filling the up right tank with fresh water, a worker realized that the fill gage was not working.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tugger
IncidentDescription:
After using the tugger 4" latch to pull a stand out of the mousehole and after it was done an employee did not place 
the straw inside the finger.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, unhooked cone
IncidentDescription:
A Schlumberger hand hooked up cone and C plate and sheave to hoist the line and signaled up hoist so the operator 
started up when a hand in the V-door noticed cone came out of the hook and the cone slid down the beaverslide 2' 
and hit the catwalk, rolled off of the catwalk and the hoist operator went down to make sure that everything else was 
hooked up properly.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/brush, mousehole
IncidentDescription:
A hand was doping pipe when the brush slipped from his hand causing the brush to go down the pipe into the 
mousehole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/fill hose
IncidentDescription:
Hand went to take off the fill hose and didn't know there was still 400 pounds of pressure. The driller stopped him and 
had him open 2" bleed off valve.

IncidentSummary: The crew was pulling the first stand from the well. When the blocks were at the tubing board the der
IncidentDescription: The crew was pulling the first stand from the well. When the blocks were at the tubing board the derrick hand saw sparks and heard popping coming from the drill line. The drill line parted at the blocks allowing the block to free fall. The operator told everyone to run and set the brake. He then ran toward the front of the rig on the catwalk. The derrick hand moved to the back of the tubing board. One floor hand cleared the floor and ran. The EE stayed on the floor pushing out on the rods to get more space. The blocks struck the floor and severed the tubing which dropped into the well causing damage to the lifting and floor equipment. The rods jarred striking the floor hand on the arm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right arm after being struck by the rods when they jarred while he was pushing out on them.

IncidentSummary: While attempting to move fork on forklift, EE put left hand between fork and rack. He put his hand t
IncidentDescription: While attempting to move fork on forklift, EE put left hand between fork and rack. He put his hand there to brace himself while he pulled fork toward him and in doing so hit his finger. He was wearing proper impact gloves at the time of incident.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left index finger after getting hand caught between fork and rack while attempting to move fork on forklift.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing by pump # 1 and talking to driller. Employees were hammering unions loose on pump #
IncidentDescription: IE was standing by pump # 1 and talking to driller. Employees were hammering unions loose on pump #2, twelve feet away when something struck IE's chin and assumed it was a chip that came off when employees were hammering on union.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture in chin by unknown object.

IncidentSummary: MISS valve not set (BR)
IncidentDescription:
Crew had just finished pulling rods out of hole. They were getting ready to start tripping tubing. Operator picked up on tubing string and the crew heard a loud 
unusual sound. The operator set the tubing back down and they heard the sound again. Crew stopped the job and inspected the rig. The rig supervisor noticed the 
upper derrick locking pin on the driller side of the derrick was not in place  After and the upper section of the derrick had shifted approximately 4 inches to the driller 
side of the rig. After further investigation, it was found that the crew did not set the valve to prevent the hydraulic pressure from bleeding off on the upper derrick 
locking pins after they were engaged.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pipe wrangler
IncidentDescription:
An employee was running the pipe wrangler and hoist while bringing the pipe in it skipped and came out of the trough 
while bringing it through the V-door with the hoist.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80 hydraulic hose
IncidentDescription:
Upon pre-use inspection of the ST-80, a hand noticed a hydraulic leak. The hand found a hose had been pinched and 
torn.

IncidentSummary: EE alleges he was in the process of moving trash through suitcase. He slipped on a small dent in the
IncidentDescription: EE alleges he was in the process of moving trash through suitcase. He slipped on a small dent in the suitcase, causing his left knee to pop. He did not report this incident. EE claims that it was only after he was at the gas station on his way home that he misstepped and popped his knee again only this time resulting in him making a trip to the clinic in his hometown of Roma.
InjuryDescripti: Left knee strain as a result of slipping on suitcase while moving trash.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80 hose
IncidentDescription: While getting the rig floor ready to make up BHA, a hand noticed a hydraulic leak on an ST-80 hose.

IncidentSummary: Attempting to install flow line. While holding onto flow line so another employee could start hammer
IncidentDescription: Attempting to install flow line. While holding onto flow line so another employee could start hammer union, flow line slipped out of sleeve and came down, pinching EE's left middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left middle finger when it was pinched between flow line and handrail.

IncidentSummary: MISS cable backspool
IncidentDescription:
Crew had a compression shear and laid down lubricator, re-headed and then lifted the lubricator back up with the 
crane. When lifting, they side-loaded the crane causing the lubricator to swing more than normal. They put the 
lubricator on the well for their next gun run. After putting the lubricator on the well they noticed that the blocks would 
not move down. After trying a couple of times they saw that the cable had jumped off the sheave and was stuck 
between the sheave and the side plate. This caused the cable to back-spool on the drum.

IncidentSummary: Driving south on Hwy 85 at 50 mph with crew. Conditions were poor and 4X4 was engaged. Back tires sp
IncidentDescription: Driving south on Hwy 85 at 50 mph with crew. Conditions were poor and 4X4 was engaged. Back tires spun causing the truck to slide sideways spinning twice around into the opposite ditch.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced soreness in neck after being a passenger in a vehicle accident on the way to the job site.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down, the IE was working on rig floor underneath the tie-back toque tube beam (located
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, the IE was working on rig floor underneath the tie-back toque tube beam (located approximately a foot above him). When IE loosened the beam (simultaneously, the driller clutched the rig to pick up the bolster), the bolster and tie-back beam came down onto the employee, resulting in injuries to his lower back and knee.
InjuryDescripti: Compression fractures to lumbar vertebra when struck by stabilizer.

IncidentSummary: While going in the hole with an overshot to retrieve fish, EE was attached to self-retracting lifeli
IncidentDescription: While going in the hole with an overshot to retrieve fish, EE was attached to self-retracting lifeline with upper d-ring to his full body harness and was attached to the tail rope with his lower d-ring to his safety harness. As he attempted to latch stand with elevators, he missed the stand. EE unlatched the tail rope from harness in order to pull pipe from derrick towards him with a nylon rope. Once stand was retrieved, EE did not latch his tail rope back to his safety harness and proceeded to latch pipe with elevators resulting in leaning forward, losing his balance and was forced to grab onto stand of pipe. Operator sent the cat line to EE to assist in lowering him to rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right wrist while attempting to latch pipe with elevators and while leaning forward, lost his balance and was forced to grab onto stand of pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE notified Mario Gonzalez, Rig Supervisor, that he had cuts on both wrists due to remodeling his ho
IncidentDescription: IE notified Mario Gonzalez, Rig Supervisor, that he had cuts on both wrists due to remodeling his home. IE developed a slight infection after coming in contact with zinc bromide.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to cuts he had from remodeling his home after coming in contact with zinc bromide.

IncidentSummary: MISS lubricator
IncidentDescription: Lubricator for the job was past annual inspection date. This was caught prior to start of job.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped tool
IncidentDescription:
Crew was coming off well head after completing a perforating gun run and had a 3rd party crane (Taylor Crane Service) on the job. Crane operator was on 
location with no relief for over 24 hours and was also talking on his phone while running the crane. The crane operator lifted the lubricator off the well and turned 
off to the side. While turning, he started lowering the lubricator. Our employee on the ground signaled for him to stop and the engineer tried to lower the tool to 
keep from dropping the tool string but could not keep up. The tool pulled off the wire line and fell on the tool trap. The tool stayed in the lubricator and nobody 
was hurt.

IncidentSummary: MISS clipped mirror
IncidentDescription:
Driving north on Hwy 23 heading towards Keene, ND when another tanker semi heading South was blown into my lane due to strong winds. Immediately moved to 
give him room to avoid collision. The side mirror was nicked. See attached statement from Kevin Schatz.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped BOP
IncidentDescription:
Daniel Thompson was in the Casper shop with three other employees getting tools and equipment ready for a job that was to be completed on Sunday. One of 
the pieces of equipment was a 10K BOP. Engineer in charge was operating the forklift. The BOP had the flow-T, quick-change and 1502 already attached. 
Employees used a lifting cap and 2-inch strap to secure the BOP to the forklift. Employee suggested that the ball (hitch) be put on the forklift to ensure that the 
BOP did not fall off. Forklift operator moved the BOP over to the trailer, which was outside, and the crew began to lay the BOP down on the trailer. There was a 
tag-line attached to the bottom of the BOP. Another employee had to pull back on the tag-line so the BOP would lie down on the trailer. When the employee 
pulled on the tag-line, the lifting strap on the forks of the forklift slipped off and fell on the trailer. The BOP missed the employee standing on the trailer by less 
than  one inch.

IncidentSummary: MISS well blow-out
IncidentDescription: See attached statement in Private Documents

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure release
IncidentDescription:
Operators were disassembling Wireline plug/perf tool string. 4 X 2' 65 PF guns, Weatherford plug, Over Shorty setting tool. Quick change sub on set tool firing head 
had suspected trapped pressure. Operator placed wheel of lay-down cart in front of tool and warned crew to stay away. Operator continued to remove sub until it 
released. No injuries. Proper PPE in use, nobody in line of fire.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken cable
IncidentDescription:
When Kelly Keever and Igor Elatov were rigging up on Ensign 122, they were going to lift the bottom sheave from the catwalk to the rig floor using the air winch on 
the rig. When attempting to lift the sheave, the air winch got stuck and the rig crew thought they had a birds nest in the cable. As one of the rig operators grabbed 
the cable and began to walk it out on the catwalk, the cable broke and the rig hand fell on the catwalk only a few inches from Kelly.

IncidentSummary: MISS icy wing valve
IncidentDescription: Joe Robinson was standing on wing vavle 3-4 feet off ground and slipped off and fell due to ice on the wing valve.

IncidentSummary: MISS improperly secured sheave
IncidentDescription:
Lower sheave attached to rig floor section that was not secured to rig floor section stayed in place while lowering tool (junk basket) in hole. As tool was hoisted out 
of hole, lower sheave lifted floor section and traveled down wire line striking Wireline truck.

IncidentSummary: During tripping operations, the driller had a double in the mouse hole. The driller turned the elev
IncidentDescription: During tripping operations, the driller had a double in the mouse hole. The driller turned the elevators from the tripping position (handles facing forward) to drilling position (handles facing back towards drawworks) so that he could reach the double in the mouse hole. If he did not turn the elevators,it would make it difficult to latch the elevators. The driller latched on to the double and the crew made it up on the drill string and the driller began to come down on it. The crew then broke the stand. As they were going to rack it back, the driller was slacking off to set down the stand to turn his elevators. As he was coming down, the handle caught the top drive track, then fell to their original position, causing the stand to whiplash, striking EE who was in the position to help tail the stand into the racking area. It struck EE struck on the right side of his body, causing a contusion to his right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee when struck by stand of pipe.

IncidentSummary: Crew was pulling out of hole with rod assembly, placing rod thribbles in derrick. Supervisor was on
IncidentDescription: Crew was pulling out of hole with rod assembly, placing rod thribbles in derrick. Supervisor was on the brake handle and the operator was helping the floor hands. Supervisor pulled up to overshot and slacked off. The IE was not aware that the supervisor was going to slack off so he reached to put crows foot causing the rods to fall in the hole. The IE was struck by 1/4 chain on his left hand. He was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hand after being struck by 1/4 chain while he was reaching in to put crows foot on. He was wearing impact gloves.

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure
IncidentDescription: The hand went up in a man-basket and started to hammer off the lubricator while there was still pressure on it.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up, EE was walking backward while holding guy line when he tripped and fell into cella
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, EE was walking backward while holding guy line when he tripped and fell into cellar landing on his back side.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to lower back after falling into cellar while walking backward while holding guy line.

IncidentSummary: MISS struck tubing tongs (AR)
IncidentDescription:
Employee was running automatic catwalk and not paying attention. He hit the tubing tongs with the pipe. The pipe came off the slide and shot down the trough and 
off the back of the catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS bumped control box switch (AR)
IncidentDescription: Crew picked up joint of pipe with winch line and bucket to make new connection on swivel. Graco made up joint on swivel and the floor hand put 24 on the joint to ensure that it was made up. The tool hand accidentally bumped the forward switch on his control box, turning the pipe and wrench 3 rounds. The floor hand was able to get away from harm.

IncidentSummary: EE was trying to move a stand while gun was on it. When the gun was lifted, the stand was stuck to h
IncidentDescription: EE was trying to move a stand while gun was on it. When the gun was lifted, the stand was stuck to hand and pulled it. Gun fell on hand between the stand and gun.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right hand after hand was caught between stand and gun when gun fell off stand he was moving.

IncidentSummary: As IE was moving cable back from sheave, glove got caught and pulled hand back up into sheave.
IncidentDescription: As IE was moving cable back from sheave, glove got caught and pulled hand back up into sheave.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right ring finger after hand was pulled into sheave as he was moving cable back from sheave.

IncidentSummary: While tightening a screw on a plug, screw driver slipped and punctured left hand between index and m
IncidentDescription: While tightening a screw on a plug, screw driver slipped and punctured left hand between index and middle finger in the crease. About 1/2-3/4 inch.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to left hand between index and middle finger in the crease after being struck by a screw driver.

IncidentSummary: The crew was preparing to change over the drill line from the tied back position to double-fast. Whe
IncidentDescription: The crew was preparing to change over the drill line from the tied back position to double-fast. When the IE was removing the drill line from the deadline anchor, he was holding the drill line with both hands. When the rope socket was released, the line recoiled and popped up striking the IE in the forehead.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to forehead after being struck by drill line he was holding when it recoiled after rope socket was released.

IncidentSummary: IE picked up valve cap and pulled something in right shoulder
IncidentDescription: IE picked up valve cap and pulled something in right shoulder
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder when picking up valve cap.

IncidentSummary: Operator was coming down with elevators and EE did not push elevators back enough. Elevators stuck i
IncidentDescription: Operator was coming down with elevators and EE did not push elevators back enough. Elevators stuck in collar and EEs right index finger was caught between elevators and bails.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right index finger after it was caught between elevators and bailss due to EE not pushing elevators back enough.

IncidentSummary: EE sat bit on floor and was holding it still while co-worker installed the bit breaker. It went onl
IncidentDescription: EE sat bit on floor and was holding it still while co-worker installed the bit breaker. It went only halfway on, so co- worker started hitting it with a sledge hammer and then missed, striking EE's left ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left finger when hit by sledge hammer.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken rig floor cable/falling (MS)
IncidentDescription: While picking rig floor up with cat line, the lift cable on the floor broke and rig floor fell down onto BOP's.

IncidentSummary: EE was going to put up sub pin in a box. On his way, he slipped and trying to keep his balance, he t
IncidentDescription: EE was going to put up sub pin in a box. On his way, he slipped and trying to keep his balance, he tossed the pin in the box, causing the pin to hit an open end wrench on the edge. That caused the wrench to flip up and strike EE on the right side of his chin.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right side of chin causing by wrench striking him.

IncidentSummary: Crew was tripping in hole with 2-7/8" tubing. IE had just latched joint from tubing board, and opera
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping in hole with 2-7/8" tubing. IE had just latched joint from tubing board, and operator started to raise blocks. Tubing fell out of elevators while it was being lifted. IE was guiding tubing onto rig floor when it started to fall. As it started falling, it hit his hand causing him to pull his arm back and hit his elbow on the trough on hydraulic catwalk.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion after tubing fell striking him on his right hand which caused him to pull arm back and strike right elbow on hydraulic catwalk trough.

IncidentSummary: While running tubing in the hole, IE missed elevators and his middle right finger was caught between
IncidentDescription: While running tubing in the hole, IE missed elevators and his middle right finger was caught between the elevators and the pipe. IEwas wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right middle finger after missing elevators and catching it between elevators and pipe while running tubing in the hole.

IncidentSummary: IE was inspecting electrical cables and supports that were on outside of mud tanks in yard. As he w
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: IE was inspecting electrical cables and supports that were on outside of mud tanks in yard. As he was walking down the side, a piece of stainless steel strapping was sticking out and cut right little finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right little finger when stuck by piece of steel strapping.

IncidentSummary: EE was using a 1" drive impact wrench taking bolts out of choke line. While he was doing this, the s
IncidentDescription: EE was using a 1" drive impact wrench taking bolts out of choke line. While he was doing this, the socket slipped off the nut. When it slipped off the nut, the socket was still spinning. When it slipped off, EE had his left hand on the handle. He lost control of the impact while it was still spinning which caused the nail that was holding the socket to the impact to strike his left arm causing a puncture to his left arm. After investigating, it was determined that the handle of the impact wrench was damaged which contributed to EE's losing control of the impact wrench.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left arm when struck by a nail that was holding the socket to the impact wrench.

IncidentSummary: Crew was drilling plugs and as they pressured up to 2600, the rubber broke into pieces and hit the I
IncidentDescription: Crew was drilling plugs and as they pressured up to 2600, the rubber broke into pieces and hit the IE on the left arm. IE was on the floor about 10 feet from the well.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left arm after being struck by the rubber after it broke apart as the crew was drilling plugs.

IncidentSummary: EE claims he hurt his back by pulling a hose across location while rigging down rig on 3/27/14. It
IncidentDescription: EE claims he hurt his back by pulling a hose across location while rigging down rig on 3/27/14. It was not reported until 4/4/14.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly sustained strain to lower back while pulling hoses across location while rigging down. Did not report injury that day.

IncidentSummary: MISS working area awareness
IncidentDescription: Employee was taking ladder out of cellar, when he almost fell in.

IncidentSummary: MISS tagline placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was hooking the tag line on the V-door in the wrong place, prior to V-door being lifted.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking between two mud tanks to turn on jagger pump and slipped and fell as he stepped over
IncidentDescription: IE was walking between two mud tanks to turn on jagger pump and slipped and fell as he stepped over suction hoses. IE attempted to catch himself with his hands on the ground and hurt his right thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right thumb after slipping while stepping over suction hoses while going to turn on jagger pump.

IncidentSummary: MISS foot placement
IncidentDescription:
Employee was picking up trash and broken pallets when he stepped on a nail, causing the nail to go thru his shoe and 
missed his toes.

IncidentSummary: MISS chemical handling
IncidentDescription: Employee moving palletized chemicals with forklift, almost had bagged chemicals slide off.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping 2-7/8" PH6 tubing out of the well. The IE unlatched a joint and pulled back to
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping 2-7/8" PH6 tubing out of the well. The IE unlatched a joint and pulled back to clear the blocks. As he was waiting for the blocks to clear the tubing, the elevator horn on the slip-type elevator caught his chest strap and started to pull him down as the blocks were lowered. The operator was focused on the blocks and didn't realize the IE was hooked until he had been pulled off the tubing board. When the IE had come off the board, the elevator released and he hung onto the tubing but slid down about 4-5 feet. The IE remained hooked to the positioning lanyard and SRL. He was able to self-rescue by climbing up the stand of tubing using the SRL to hold him in place to change grip. There were 20+ mph crosswinds gusting to 30 mph.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after elevator horn on the slip-type elevator caught his chest strap and started to pull him down as the blocks were lowered.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving a tool string from one stand to another, felt a popping in lower back and fell down wi
IncidentDescription: IE was moving a tool string from one stand to another, felt a popping in lower back and fell down with tool string.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while moving a tool string from one stand to another.

IncidentSummary: MISS Bruington/drill pipe, forklift
IncidentDescription: Employee was moving drill pipe with the forklift when one drill pipe fell off the forks landing on the ground, no injuries

IncidentSummary: MISS loose drill pipe
IncidentDescription:
Employees were picking up pipe through the v door when the tag line came off and drill pipe swung across the derrick, 
no one was injured and it was place into the mouse hole

IncidentSummary: MISS Bruington/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was pressure washing the rig floor and almost slipped due to slippery mud on the floor

IncidentSummary: MISS Bruington/foot placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was climbing the derrick when his foot slipped causing him to lose his balance

IncidentSummary: MISS Bruington/3P fall protection
IncidentDescription:
A third party electrician was going to make some repairs in the derrick and was stopped by one of the rig's employees 
and he was told he needed a harness and lanyard before climbing above four feet high

IncidentSummary: MISS Hurd Ent/improper lifting-handling
IncidentDescription:
Employee notice another employee trying to pick up lift subs by himself and told him to use the hoist and lift straps so 
he wouldn't hurt his back

IncidentSummary: MISS Goodrich/tool handling
IncidentDescription: Employee was putting away tools and dropped a pipe wrench and it almost struck his foot

IncidentSummary: MISS Goodrich/forklift
IncidentDescription:
Employee failed to slide forks in all the way prior to making a lift and he was stopped as so he wouldn't cause damage 
to the forks on the forklift

IncidentSummary: While trying to break top of annular to change out seals, IE was in sub by BOP. Started pulling with
IncidentDescription: While trying to break top of annular to change out seals, IE was in sub by BOP. Started pulling with tongs and eye in sub broke, causing BOP and casing to turn and the choke hose hit IE on the left side of his chest, spraining his ribs. At the medical facility it was found that IE had calcium build up in his lungs probably caused from ? and this was going to be explored as personal matter but not part of this incident.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to ribs when choke hose hit left side of chest.

IncidentSummary: IE was carrying a perforating gun from the trailer to the stands on ground. Twisted the wrong way an
IncidentDescription: IE was carrying a perforating gun from the trailer to the stands on ground. Twisted the wrong way and strained back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to back while carrying perforating gun from trailer to stands.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to enter back seat of pick-up and right foot slipped off step.
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to enter back seat of pick-up and right foot slipped off step.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle when foot slipped off step while attempting to enter back of pick-up.

IncidentSummary: MISS mast trailer
IncidentDescription:
John was standing at the trailer controls, which were located on the side of the trailer lifting the boom up in the air, getting ready to rig up for a bond log job. 
There was a slight breeze at the time. The boom was about 8-inches away from the stopping point. When the wind came up, it started to bounce the boom back 
and forth against the stop-bolt putting pressure on cast iron bearing housing. The weight from the boom and the wind pushing caused the housing to break from 
the trailer and the boom to fall from the back of the trailer. There was no secondary safety device to control which way the boom fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS catline strike (MS)
IncidentDescription: While picking up power swivel, Svane Washington unhooked cat and tail of catline struck forehead, without injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS driving risk (BR)
IncidentDescription:
Rig 53 was working on 02/14/14 for Denbury Resources in the Hastings Field.  The crew worked from 7:00 a.m. to 1:00 
a.m. the next morning (18 hour day).  The crew was receiving OTE to stay out of town.  They were instructed by the 
supervisor Efrain Cedano to stay in Alvin and get some sleep before driving back to Bryan for the weekend off.  An extra 
pickup was on location due to a hand swapping out earlier in the week.  The derrickhand convinced the floorhands to 
leave with him at 1:00 a.m. and drive back to Bryan.  Luckily the crew made it safely to Bryan in the middle of the night 
after an 18 hour workday but this was a near miss.

IncidentSummary: IE was cutting excess cable off tong cable with cutter. The cut shaft got stuck in cutter and turned
IncidentDescription: IE was cutting excess cable off tong cable with cutter. The cut shaft got stuck in cutter and turned upside down to hit it and when he came down to hit cutter IE's finger got under it hitting the right knuckle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to right hand after it was caught under cutter.

IncidentSummary: The brake handle was being unpinned in order to raise the operators platform. When the brake handle
IncidentDescription: The brake handle was being unpinned in order to raise the operators platform. When the brake handle was unpinned it fell and struck the IE, who was attaching the turnbuckle from the base beam to the derrick leg.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to the back of head after being struck by the brake handle when it fell after it was unpinned.

IncidentSummary: The driller and IE were removing the test plug from drill pipe. The test plug was touching the floo
IncidentDescription: The driller and IE were removing the test plug from drill pipe. The test plug was touching the floor while the drill pipe was being held upright by the winch line. IE was holding a chain tong on the test plug for back up while bent over. The driller was using another set of chain tongs on the drill pipe unscrewing the pieces when the connection came apart and a column of test water flowed out of the pipe to the rig floor. splashing back up into IE's face, knocking off his hard hat and safety glasses. The water went into his right eye, causing discomfort, irritation and pain.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to right eye when water went into it.

IncidentSummary: IE was instructed by driller to pressure BOP, to get ready to 4 bolt BOP. After IE was through clean
IncidentDescription: IE was instructed by driller to pressure BOP, to get ready to 4 bolt BOP. After IE was through cleaning BOP, he was instructed by driller to let him know he was through so he could jet the cellar out and send a co-worker to assist in cellar to 4 bolt BOP. He did not let driller know. Instead, he proceeded in the cellar to four bolt BOP. As IE was climbing in cellar, he stated he slipped and fell, his left side of his body and right leg striking against side of cellar.
InjuryDescripti: Contusions to left hip and right leg after slipping and falling against side of cellar.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/thread protectors
IncidentDescription:
Floorhand was rolling casing when the catwalk operator was bringing thread protectors down. The thread protectors hit 
the skate and bounced off almost hitting the floorhand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/sheave, drill line
IncidentDescription:
A hand was taking the shiv off of the drill line from the man basket and when he unhooked the shiv the drill line fell 
down a bit. Another floor hand was standing near by and almost got hit.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/clamping hard band
IncidentDescription: When a hand was making up pipe he clamped down on the hardband.

IncidentSummary: While crew was setting well head grading by hand, all crew members except for IE let go of grading t
IncidentDescription: While crew was setting well head grading by hand, all crew members except for IE let go of grading to drop it in place. This caused grading to fall towards IE striking his left foot just after the steel part of his boot. IE put an ice pack on his injury and continued to work.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left foot after being struck by grading.

IncidentSummary: The crew was TIH/hydrotesting 2-7/8" tubing. After over 7000' had been tripped in, a joint was picke
IncidentDescription: The crew was TIH/hydrotesting 2-7/8" tubing. After over 7000' had been tripped in, a joint was picked up and run in. When the operator came down and stopped, he set the slips and lowered the blocks to unlatch the elevators. The IE came to the front of the elevator to unlatch them and as he did, the slips did not hold the pipe and the line pipe came down and struck the elevator. The weight of the pipe pulled down on the spring loaded blocks allowing the elevator to strike the tongs. The tongs tipped forward and the handle on the backups struck the IE on the top of the foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to top of right foot after being struck by the handle on the backups when the tongs tipped forward.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pipes, indexes
IncidentDescription:
The loader operator rolled a piece of pipe onto the cat walk and the D.S indexes were down and the pipe fell into the 
indexes.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/backstoppers, joints
IncidentDescription:
Loader operator was unloading casing off of a pipe rack when the back stoppers fell down and two joints of casing 
rolled off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/boiler, blowdown
IncidentDescription:
Motorhand was starting to blow down the boiler, a floorhand started to walk between the boiler and the reserve fuel tank 
near the blowdown outlet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/elevators, latch
IncidentDescription:
While tripping out of the hole, a hand noticed that the elevators did not completely latch onto the pipe. He stopped the 
driller before he could pick up the drill string.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tie off
IncidentDescription:
