An employee nearly forgot to tie off in the man basket which could have caused him to fall out but another employee 
corrected the action.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, crane operation
IncidentDescription:
A third party employee tried to work the crane up to the stand pipe and didn't hook it up right causing it to potentially 
swing and take out the guys in the man basket.

IncidentSummary: When IE took off his boots after work, he noticed a bite mark on his right ankle.
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: When IE took off his boots after work, he noticed a bite mark on his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Bite on right ankle by unknown source.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, improper securement
IncidentDescription:
A third party hand tried to hook up the crane to S pipe and didn't hook it up right causing it to potentially swing and 
Nearly strike the guys in the man basket.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tongs, ST-80
IncidentDescription: The tongs were left where they could have damaged the ST-80 after breaking the bit connection.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tail rope
IncidentDescription:
While tailing in a joint of pipe from the catwalk the tail rope slipped off letting the joint swing uncontrolled, causing a 
pinch point. Employees were not standing in the path of travel and no injuries occurred.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loader, slipped load
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
An employee was standing next to the forks on the loader. The loader operator was moving a transport beam for the 
derrick and the load slipped off of the forks nearly landing on the employee's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pallet, loader
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While picking up a pallet of bar, the crew member did not have the forks all the way into the pallet and nearly caused 
the pallet to fall off the forks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/power tongs
IncidentDescription:
While running casing, a third party member was nearly hit by the power tongs when they were floating back to the set 
pin.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/missing keeper
IncidentDescription: A hand found a 4'' fluid transfer hose that was missing a keeper to hold the cam-lock from opening.

IncidentSummary: While changing a swab on # 2 mud pump, employees removed damaged swab and were going back together w
IncidentDescription: While changing a swab on # 2 mud pump, employees removed damaged swab and were going back together with installing new swab. Employees were using socket wrench to roll pump back for clearance to install spacer rod behind swab rod. When pump reached the end of stroke, it stopped moving. Employees pulled harder on wrench, pump no longer rolled so one employee let off wrench and as the other employee released, the wrench sprung up and struck IE on the upper lip below left nostril.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip below left nostril when struck by wrench.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/improper driving, loader
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
A hand was driving the loader with pipe on the forks. The loader was being driven too fast and the driver hit a pothole 
and nearly lost the load of pipe that was on the forks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/elevators, slips
IncidentDescription:
Hands went to set the slips and one of the hands didn't get to the handle in time and that caused the elevators to 
stack out on the slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/tool placement on body
IncidentDescription:
A hand was being hoisted down after rig service. While descending his grease gun handle got caught up in the platform 
for working on the wash pipe. The hand started to feel himself being sucked toward the top drive.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80, guide assembly
IncidentDescription:
While bringing up the ST-80 to make up the connection a guide assembly fell out of the bottom of the ST-80 and fell 
into the rotary getting caught up in the slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/wrench
IncidentDescription:
While installing the bridles onto the top drive, a hand noticed a wrench laying on top of the rotator handler. The hand 
climbed up to retrieve the wrench but it was caught in a bind.

IncidentSummary: Tripping 4" drill pipe out of hole and broke stand out with ST-80. Picked stand out of stump. IE put
IncidentDescription: Tripping 4" drill pipe out of hole and broke stand out with ST-80. Picked stand out of stump. IE put hand on stand, driller kicked in link tilt. The wind was blowing around 30 mph and stand swung to the left and IE's left hand was caught between ST-80 and stand of pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand when caught between ST-80 and stand of pipe.

IncidentSummary: While building stands and racking them back in derrick prior to spud in, the stand was pushed back a
IncidentDescription: While building stands and racking them back in derrick prior to spud in, the stand was pushed back and set down on racking board when the safety keeper for the single stand elevators struck Rafael on the left elbow.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left elbow when struck by safety keeper for single stand elevators.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While removing small floor plate between driller's console and rotary table, IE felt a burn and pull
IncidentDescription: While removing small floor plate between driller's console and rotary table, IE felt a burn and pulling sensation in his stomach.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to abdomen while removing small floor plate.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/moving catwalk, pipe
IncidentDescription:
While latching up to pipe on the catwalk a crew member moved forward to put the single latch onto the pipe while the 
catwalk was still moving and said crew member was nearly struck by the pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80 securement
IncidentDescription:
A hand didn't put the ST-80 back out of the way in a secured place while making stands and this could have pinched 
fingers or body between the ST-80 and the pipe while tailing in.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/V-door gate
IncidentDescription:
While bringing the catwalk up to the rig floor, a hand nearly hit the v-door gate. The gate had not been opened and 
the job was stopped before damage could occur.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/plug
IncidentDescription: While hooking up electrical lines a hand noticed a plug laying in the mud.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pressure release
IncidentDescription:
While reaming out the lateral, a worker was going to open the 2" valve while making a connection before the driller 
turned off the pumps.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/peanut pump, system pressure
IncidentDescription:
While sucking out the cellar the peanut pump pressured up and stopped working. A worker took off the discharge hose 
and the system exploded some pressure as the hose was taken off.

IncidentSummary: IE and another employee had carried 4-5 guns from pallet to trailer. There was red caution tape surr
IncidentDescription: IE and another employee had carried 4-5 guns from pallet to trailer. There was red caution tape surrounding the perimeter of the Wireline work area. The tape was hanging 12-14 inches off the ground. IE stepped over the tape and caught right foot on the tape.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right foot as it twisted while stepping over red caution tape that was 12-14 inches off ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/unsecured line
IncidentDescription: While using the hoist to pull bushings, the line got caught on the top drive.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80 operation
IncidentDescription:
While operating the ST-80, the hand pulled the wrong handle causing the ST-80 to jump forward almost hitting the 
elevators.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, unsecured thread protector
IncidentDescription:
A third party worker didn't place the thread protector all the way on the skate and it fell off the trough and to the 
bottom of the sub.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/track, festoon cables
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While walking the rig to the third hole, the track for the festoon cables separated and almost made the section fall off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/scaffolding, air lines
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Employees were putting scaffolding in the substructure and one employee was guiding the forklift operator and saw the 
scaffolding was snagging air lines that were hanging from the floor. The forklift operator was told to stop immediately 
before the lines became taught or tore apart.

IncidentSummary: IE was going to latch up a stand of 6" NMDC. There were high winds blowing straight to the back of t
IncidentDescription: IE was going to latch up a stand of 6" NMDC. There were high winds blowing straight to the back of the board. As he pulled, the stand out of the finger, he lost control of the stand, pushing him towards the back of the board. IE was not able to get his body out of the way in time and the stand pinned his upper left leg and hip area between the stand and strong back bar in the board.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hip when pinned between stand and strong back bar in the board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/catwalk, skate travel switch
IncidentDescription:
While operating the catwalk and making up stands, personnel operating the catwalk had a joint of 5" drill pipe in the 
trough waiting in the v-door. While the floor hands were making pipe in the mouse hole, the catwalk operator had hands 
off the controls and the skate started moving forward on its own and the catwalk operator saw it moving and quickly 
turned the catwalk off at the podium. The employee saw that the skate travel switch was sticking and not returning to 
neutral.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/descender pump, cracked weld
IncidentDescription:
While team member was inspecting equipment he noticed a mist coming out of the side on the descender pump. It had 
a crack in the corner weld.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/awareness of surroundings
IncidentDescription:
A third party hand was cleaning the catch tank with the extend-a-boom and was not aware of the loader behind him 
collecting old screens from the tanks even when the loader operator honked his horn to let him know that he was 
behind him.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/packing off, shaker(s)
IncidentDescription:
A hand was going to close the valve to shaker #3 to prevent the shaker from constantly packing off. Closing shaker #3 
would provide enough flow for shakers #1 & 2 to run continuously without packing off but shaker #3 has the gas 
detector on it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/cementer's hard line, CRT
IncidentDescription:
The cement crew had their equipment rigged up to the beaver slide but the casing CRT tool needed to be rigged down 
first. While lowering the CRT tool down the slide it caught on the cementers hard-line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/kick hose, boom line
IncidentDescription:
Employees were hooking up the kick hose from the derrick to the tree. They were using the boom line to lift the kick 
hose end. Employee told the boom line operator to get a strap. The boom line operator left the boom line controls. 
When he left the boom hoist continued to raise the kick hose almost pinning an employee against the wind wall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/clogged pipe, drainage
IncidentDescription:
A hand was going to loosen the ware bushing bolts and as he walked into the sub he noticed that a pipe was full of 
mud and draining into the cellar.

IncidentSummary: The relief operator was picking up the blocks. The collar hung up on the d-ring on the tong line. Th
IncidentDescription: The relief operator was picking up the blocks. The collar hung up on the d-ring on the tong line. The tongs were raised and then dropped, damaging the handrail. The IE was exiting the rig floor when he tripped and landed on left wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left wrist after tripping upon exiting rig floor where he had been running tongs while picking up tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While attempting to nipple up the BOPs, employees were installing the HCR valve at around 1:00 AM. T
IncidentDescription: While attempting to nipple up the BOPs, employees were installing the HCR valve at around 1:00 AM. The HCR was being suspended by the hoist operated by one employee from the rig floor and being tailed in with the forklift operated by another employee using a lifting strap. IE was standing on the right side of the valve attempting to line up the bolt holes. Once IE saw that the bolt holes appeared to be in line, he put the bolt through the HCR flange and attempted to pull it through. With his left hand now between the two flanges around 10" apart, he began to attempt to stab the bolt through the BOP flange. The HCR valve suddenly cocked down and slipped forward, catching his left thumb between the bolt and the BOP flange.
InjuryDescripti: Left thumb was lacerated when caught between the bolt and BOP flange.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up equalizer lines in between the tanks in very tight quarters, the top 6 inch equaliz
IncidentDescription: While rigging up equalizer lines in between the tanks in very tight quarters, the top 6 inch equalizer line hammer union was hard to get to; injured employee was holding a 12 pounds sledge hammer on the ear of the 6 inch union while second employee was using an 8 pound hammer to hit the 12 pound hammer that was on the ear of the union. Employees had hit the hammer that was on the union about 10 times when a piece of metal broke off, went through injured employee's shirt sleeve and lodged in his left forearm causing a laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left forearm from flying debri.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking across new walkway installed to get to the rig floor. As he crossed the walkway, he s
IncidentDescription: IE was walking across new walkway installed to get to the rig floor. As he crossed the walkway, he stepped on hole cover that was turned upside down, and it moved, causing him to fall, striking his back on the hand rails.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to upper back after slipping and falling on handrails.

IncidentSummary: Employee was standing on valve to check on levels in a tank; foot slipped off valve, resulting in st
IncidentDescription: Employee was standing on valve to check on levels in a tank; foot slipped off valve, resulting in strain to right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right knee when foot slipped off 2" chicksan iron he was stepping up on.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to help spool wireline cable onto the trucks drum under low tension. The wireline
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to help spool wireline cable onto the trucks drum under low tension. The wireline regained tension due to an inadequate rig-up and incorrect rig-up chain. The cable pulled Darin 15-20' into the air, and as he slid back down the wireline he collided with the back of the perforating unit. The IE landed on his left hip and lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back and right hip after being pulled into air by wireline and landing between the measuring/horse head and back of the logger.

IncidentSummary: IE was just finished rolling bull wheel on #2 mud pump when he lost his footing and fell back off sk
IncidentDescription: IE was just finished rolling bull wheel on #2 mud pump when he lost his footing and fell back off skid and his left foot went into the skid. His boot caught on other side of skid and the weight of his body was supported by his calf muscle against the I-beam of the skid. The pump was not rigged up and had no energy source to it.
InjuryDescripti: Left calf sustained a contusion when he slipped, fell and his leg was against the skid I-beam

IncidentSummary: MISS Rig-up chain failure
IncidentDescription: Chain hook failed while wrapped around well head. While trying to replace chain, tools fell in the well causing wire line to force Darin onto grease trailer.

IncidentSummary: While putting away equipment, IE was holding onto wireline to keep tension while spoiling back on th
IncidentDescription: While putting away equipment, IE was holding onto wireline to keep tension while spoiling back on the drum. IE motioned to Bruce to stop, but Bruce activated the wrong lever and made the drum rotate faster causing the wireline to go from a slack position to a taut position. This resulted in it hitting the IE in the genital area and on his right hand. IE worked for a week and a half before going to see the doctor to get X-rays.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right hand after being struck by wire line he was holding when wrong lever was activated causing wire line to go from a slack position to a taut position, pulling it out of his hand.

IncidentSummary: IE was on snubbing unit floor pulling pipe up to be latched onto by elevators. When he twisted to pi
IncidentDescription: IE was on snubbing unit floor pulling pipe up to be latched onto by elevators. When he twisted to pick up the pipe he felt a sharp pain in his back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back when he twisted to pick up pipe to be latched onto by elevators.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was on the ground hooking up catline to pick up fishing tools. Being new to operations, IE attemp
IncidentDescription: IE was on the ground hooking up catline to pick up fishing tools. Being new to operations, IE attempted to pick up fishing tool string himself after hooking up the catline, and felt a sharp pain in his chest.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to chest after attempting to pick up fishing tool string by himself after hooking up the catline.

IncidentSummary: Laying down pipe, pipe was rolling down gull wings. IE slipped in mud. Pipe rolled across top of le
IncidentDescription: Laying down pipe, pipe was rolling down gull wings. IE slipped in mud. Pipe rolled across top of left hand. It was muddy, frozen ground and slippery.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to left hand when pipe rolled across top of hand.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE alleges he was going down the dog house stairs with a five gallon bucket in his hand to get some
IncidentDescription: IE alleges he was going down the dog house stairs with a five gallon bucket in his hand to get some oil when he twisted his left ankle and fell, landing on his left thigh. IE went about his work without reporting the incident. The next day, IE was pressure washing in the sub and stepped over a spreader beam and twisted his ankle again.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to left ankle on 2 separate occasions (both slip-falls), once on 04/28/14 and then again on 04/29/14.

IncidentSummary: IE picked up the rod table to put it on the wellhead. IE twisted his body while holding the rod tabl
IncidentDescription: IE picked up the rod table to put it on the wellhead. IE twisted his body while holding the rod table and had some pain in lower back. He continued working without further issues.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after twisting body while picking up rod table to put it on the wellhead.

IncidentSummary: While laying down 2-7/8" joint of pipe with rod pump stuck inside of pipe, gas anchor was grabbed fr
IncidentDescription: While laying down 2-7/8" joint of pipe with rod pump stuck inside of pipe, gas anchor was grabbed from the bottom to guide the joint down to the ground. In the process of bringing joint down, gas anchor snapped from pipe causing anchor to swing towards the left side striking IE on top of hard hat resulting in a small knot on the top of head.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to top of head after being struck by gas anchor after is snapped from pipe while bringing joint down.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was standing beside the wheel valve opening the well when the flywheel came off and struck the IE
IncidentDescription: IE was standing beside the wheel valve opening the well when the flywheel came off and struck the IE in the mouth.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to mouth, resulting in stress fractures to tooth, after being struck by flywheel while opening well.

IncidentSummary: While coming out of hole with last stand, well began to flow pushing out oil jars, bumper jars and o
IncidentDescription: While coming out of hole with last stand, well began to flow pushing out oil jars, bumper jars and overshot to the rig floor. As well was flowing, IE went down the stairs. The well then pushed jars causing them to hit the rig floor. Jars then bounced towards the hand rail and ladder striking IE below the right knee, causing a small cut about 1" in length.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a 1" laceration to the right knee after being struck by bumper jars when they bounced towards the hand rail and ladder.

IncidentSummary: While mixing mud into mud system, IE tried to lay down a barrel with the help of the derrick hand.
IncidentDescription: While mixing mud into mud system, IE tried to lay down a barrel with the help of the derrick hand. When they got the barrel tipped on its' side, it hit the handrail, pinching IE's left index finger in between the barrel and the handrail, causing a laceration to his finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left index finger when finger was caught between barrel and hand rail.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to put kelly bushings in rotary with 5' bar. IE had 5' bar inserted in hole on bu
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to put kelly bushings in rotary with 5' bar. IE had 5' bar inserted in hole on bushings and was prying down on bar to try and get bushing in rotary. (Rig is not level, bushings are off hole by 2 or 3 inches.) 5' bar slipped out of hole, causing IE to fall back and the right side of the middle of his back hit the brake handle. 5' bar also hit IE's hard hat when it slipped. IE had used makeup tong line and air hoist to try and get bushings in but was not successful.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right side of middle of back after falling back on brake handle.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/Rope Socket
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of the hole, a stand was racked back, the blocks were coming down to get another stand and about halfway down to the floor, a loud banging noise was heard from the drawworks. The job was stopped and upon investigation, it was discovered that the rope socket had somehow slipped off the end of the drill line, allowing the line to come out of the side of the drum.

IncidentSummary: IE was laying down tool string and slipped in mud. As IE stood up to pull tool, slipped again and la
IncidentDescription: IE was laying down tool string and slipped in mud. As IE stood up to pull tool, slipped again and landed on wire brush in mud.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hip after striking brush in mud when he slipped while laying down tool string.

IncidentSummary: IE and other operator were tailing out a #10 setting tool and weight bars. Other operator let go of
IncidentDescription: IE and other operator were tailing out a #10 setting tool and weight bars. Other operator let go of the front of the tool to place it on the stand. When he let go, the weight of the tool pulled the IE's arms straight down. IE didn't feel much at this point. Later, while grabbing a wrench to break a tool apart, IE noticed shoulder was sore and tender.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right shoulder when Operator let go of #10 setting tool they were both carrying and the weight pulled his shoulder down.

IncidentSummary: While IE was walking across rig floor, he stepped on mouse hole cover with right foot, slipped and f
IncidentDescription: While IE was walking across rig floor, he stepped on mouse hole cover with right foot, slipped and fell down. He stopped himself with his right hand and all his weight fell on his right wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right wrist after slipping on mouse hole cover and falling on right wrist.

IncidentSummary: IE twisted left wrist while picking up lubricator.
IncidentDescription: IE twisted left wrist while picking up lubricator.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left wrist while picking up lubricator.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up, IE was kneeling down spotting the base beam. IE stood up and felt an itch on his r
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, IE was kneeling down spotting the base beam. IE stood up and felt an itch on his right calf.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced an itch on his right calf while kneeling down spotting the base beam.

IncidentSummary: The crew was in the process of laying down pipe. After breaking a connection, the driller was spinn
IncidentDescription: The crew was in the process of laying down pipe. After breaking a connection, the driller was spinning out the joint using the rotary table. The tongs were still on the pipe while it was spinning, and the tongs came unlatched, causing them to swing towards IE, striking his right wrist and forearm. (Investigation is still ongoing.)
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right wrist when struck by tongs.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was replacing alternator and belts on rig and became light-headed. IE stated he had not eaten tha
IncidentDescription: IE was replacing alternator and belts on rig and became light-headed. IE stated he had not eaten that day and denied medical treatment.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced a light-headed feeling while replacing alternator and belts on rig due to not eating all day.

IncidentSummary: While installing 6" liner into pump, IE had to pick up the rear end of liner to screw in gland nut.
IncidentDescription: While installing 6" liner into pump, IE had to pick up the rear end of liner to screw in gland nut. While picking up liner, IE's lower back was strained.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after picking up rear end of liner.

IncidentSummary: As the crew was laying down pipe the pipe started to roll. As the IE reached out to stop the pipe fr
IncidentDescription: As the crew was laying down pipe the pipe started to roll. As the IE reached out to stop the pipe from rolling, the two middle fingers on left hand were caught between two joints of tubing.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to two middle fingers on left hand when they were caught between two joints of tubing as he reached out to stop them from rolling.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While spotting base beam on location (Wingnut-B3H), IE took one step back and fell approximately 3-1
IncidentDescription: While spotting base beam on location (Wingnut-B3H), IE took one step back and fell approximately 3-1/2 feet into well cellar.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle after taking one step back and falling 3-1/2 feet into well while spotting base beam.

IncidentSummary: IE just got through making a connection and was making up a stand in mouse hole. After making a stan
IncidentDescription: IE just got through making a connection and was making up a stand in mouse hole. After making a stand, he started to walk to the tugger when a bolt hit his right elbow that fell out of the top drive's link stop. The bolt had wire tie on it and wire tie in the plate. The wire tie was broken in the middle of the twists.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right elbow when a bolt fell out of top drive's link stop and hit elbow.

IncidentSummary: While laying down pipe, they were using a rope to unlatch pipe into the trough. IE unlatched the pi
IncidentDescription: While laying down pipe, they were using a rope to unlatch pipe into the trough. IE unlatched the pipe into trough. After unlatching pipe, IE then started to guide the elevators over the stump. He then noticed that the rope from the elevators was tangled on the stump. He tried to move it off the stump. IE was in the line of of the driller's sight. The driller did not see IE reaching for the rope. IE's left hand was caught between the stump and the elevators, causing a laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand when caught between stump and elevators.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS crane aux line ball drop
IncidentDescription: Operator was scoping crane out and pulled the auxiliary winch into anti tube lock. The anti tube lock did not work and pulled the ball off.

IncidentSummary: IE was assisting the other floorhand in locking the rotary to begin sliding down hole. The other flo
IncidentDescription: IE was assisting the other floorhand in locking the rotary to begin sliding down hole. The other floorhand was pulling on a rope that was attached to the lock. The lock would not engage so IE placed a 5' bar in the lock to pry it over as the driller bumped the rotary table. When he did, the lock engaged, striking the bar, causing it to strike IE on right side of his mouth.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to lip and fractures to 4 teeth when struck by pry bar in mouth.

IncidentSummary: IE was loading guns on trailer and gun got caught on of the slots. As the IE and Oscar Gutierrez lif
IncidentDescription: IE was loading guns on trailer and gun got caught on of the slots. As the IE and Oscar Gutierrez lifted the end up, Oscar pushed the gun and the IE's right middle finger was caught between the gun and slot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to right middle fingertip after it was caught between gun and slot as it was being loaded onto trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging down fuel lines in suitcases. He opened up suitcase to unlock line. The suitcase lid
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging down fuel lines in suitcases. He opened up suitcase to unlock line. The suitcase lid shut on him, striking him on his lower back, on the right side, causing a contusion.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back when struck by suitcase lid.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing on lay-down machine deck while giving directions to rig driver backing up to wellhea
IncidentDescription: IE was standing on lay-down machine deck while giving directions to rig driver backing up to wellhead. IE stepped forward and placed foot on kicker arm opening (approx. 4"X 8"). This resulted in the IE falling forward and placing right hand on lay-down machine grating causing a tiny puncture to his right pinky finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a tiny puncture to right pinky finger after falling on lay-down machine deck while spotting driver backing up to wellhead.

IncidentSummary: While IE was attempting to latch an 8" collar, the collar got away leaning over to the driller side
IncidentDescription: While IE was attempting to latch an 8" collar, the collar got away leaning over to the driller side of the derrick. The crew on the floor then attempted to pull back the collar with the hoist. At this time, IE put himself on the right side of the rope tied to the collar and the derrick. When the hoist pulled the collar back, it swung to the right, catching IE between the derrick on his right and and the rope pushed on him from his left, causing a back strain.
InjuryDescripti: Lower back was strained when collar swung and caught IE between the derrick on his right side and rope pushed on him from his left.

IncidentSummary: Three employees and IE were manually lifting one end of the spreader beam while a crane lifted the o
IncidentDescription: Three employees and IE were manually lifting one end of the spreader beam while a crane lifted the other end. In the process of placing it on the platform, in slippery conditions, IE's right thumb was pinched between the spreader beam and bottom substructure, resulting in a bruised and swollen thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right thumb when it was caught between the spreader beam and bottom substructure.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping guide BOPs as they were being removed from the wellhead. While walking back guiding B
IncidentDescription: IE was helping guide BOPs as they were being removed from the wellhead. While walking back guiding BOPs, the IE stepped on the grading that covers the cellar. The grading had a 3"-4" gap causing left ankle to be twisted.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left ankle after stepping in 3-4" gap in grading while guiding BOPs.

IncidentSummary: The IE and another floor hand were rigging down the mud lines from rig pump. They were trying to pla
IncidentDescription: The IE and another floor hand were rigging down the mud lines from rig pump. They were trying to place the line on the hangers of rig tank. One floor hand was able to hang his side of the line but the other floor hand was not able to. The IE started shaking the line and the other floor hand went to help him. While doing so, the line fell and struck the left foot of the IE.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left foot after being struck by mud line while trying to free it after it became stuck.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the process of rolling down the tarp on Truck 58. He was stepping backwards rolling down t
IncidentDescription: IE was in the process of rolling down the tarp on Truck 58. He was stepping backwards rolling down the tarp. He lost his footing as he stepped backwards from the steering arm onto the deck of the wireline unit to the cement floor of the shop. He struck his right buttocks area on a board that is placed on the deck to keep the tool stands in the back of the wireline unit. He hit the bumper with his back and has pain in his ribs below his shoulder blade on the right side. He then struck his left shoulder and head on the cement floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to ribs below shoulder blade on right side, left shoulder and head after losing footing and falling backwards as he stepped backwards from the steering arm onto the deck of the wireline unit as he was rolling down tarp.

IncidentSummary: Employees were picking up directional equipment to rig floor in order to start making up same. In th
IncidentDescription: Employees were picking up directional equipment to rig floor in order to start making up same. In the process of doing so, the employees were bringing a UBHO sub and lifted it to rig floor using the forklift. The equipment was being picked up with a strap laid over a fork on the forklift. Forklift operator tried to place the equipment on the racking mat of the rig floor by tilting his forks down so that the strap would slide off forks. The strap did not slide off forks when the forks were tilted down. IE pushed strap off of the fork causing the strap and subs to fall off the fork. When the subs hit, the UBHO sub landed on top of the lift sub The UBHO then fell of the lift sub and struck IE's right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Right foot was sprained when UHBO sub fell on it.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling slips while tripping in hole and he he felt pain on the right side of the middle of h
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling slips while tripping in hole and he he felt pain on the right side of the middle of his back, like a muscle spasm or strain.
InjuryDescripti: Strain in middle of back on right side while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: IE attempted to loosen a tight gun sub with a cheater pipe. When the sub broke free, IE was thrown
IncidentDescription: IE attempted to loosen a tight gun sub with a cheater pipe. When the sub broke free, IE was thrown off balance and twisted his right knee. IE felt pain in the knee and he had difficulty putting weight on it.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right knee when a tight gun sub he was attempting to loosen with a cheater pipe broke free throwing him off balance.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning out cellar while invert mud was running onto him.
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning out cellar while invert mud was running onto him.
InjuryDescripti: Chemical burns to arms and legs when he had contact with oil based mud.

IncidentSummary: IE was loading 7" lubricator into the back of pickup without the assistance of another employee or f
IncidentDescription: IE was loading 7" lubricator into the back of pickup without the assistance of another employee or forklift. The lubricator needed to slide under the truck toolbox in order to fit in the bed of the truck. As the IE bent over at the waist and pulled on the lubricator, a "tweak" was felt in the lower back and mentioned it to the hand helping him. IE felt it was minor and went home for a few hours to get some rest for the job. Upon returning to work, he informed management of his injury.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while loading a 7" lubricator into the back up his pickup without assistance from another employee or forklift.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging down equipment on pits. While removing trough from degasser, it slipped out of his ha
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging down equipment on pits. While removing trough from degasser, it slipped out of his hands and landed on both feet behind his steel toes. There two employees performing this task.
InjuryDescripti: Contusions to both feet when trough fell on them.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing bolt from ear on elevators when bail popped out, pinching his left middle finger bet
IncidentDescription: IE was removing bolt from ear on elevators when bail popped out, pinching his left middle finger between bail and ear on elevators. (IE was wearing impact gloves.)
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left middle finger when caught between bail and ear on elevators.

IncidentSummary: IE and another hand were loading a generator into the doghouse. IE felt a strain in the lower back.
IncidentDescription: IE and another hand were loading a generator into the doghouse. IE felt a strain in the lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while assisting in loading a generator into the doghouse.

IncidentSummary: The crew was preparing to install the BOP. The IE was using the ring grabber to hold the BOP rig gas
IncidentDescription: The crew was preparing to install the BOP. The IE was using the ring grabber to hold the BOP rig gasket up while the tubing and BOP was being lowered by the operator. As the tubing came down, a collar caught the ring gasket as the operator looked up. The collar pulled the gasket down into the slips causing the slips to push up the ring grabber which struck the IE in the left jaw. IE has soreness in the jaw muscles on the right side.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left jaw and strain to right jaw after being struck by ring grabber after the collar pulled the gasket down into the slips while preparing to install BOP.

IncidentSummary: While pulling slips, IE's lower back was strained.
IncidentDescription: While pulling slips, IE's lower back was strained.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while pulling slips

IncidentSummary: IE stated that he did not lock the elevators completely to secure the stand while going in the hole.
IncidentDescription: IE stated that he did not lock the elevators completely to secure the stand while going in the hole. As the elevator went up, the IE was lifted off the board about 1-2 feet while holding on to the elevators attempting to secure the stand. While the IE was off the board, the tail rope tightened up causing the left elbow to be strained.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left elbow after being lifted 1-2 feet off board while holding on to the elevators attempting to secure the stand as a result of not locking elevators completely.

IncidentSummary: While tripping pipe in the hole, IE was placing a stand of pipe in the elevators. While placing it,
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe in the hole, IE was placing a stand of pipe in the elevators. While placing it, IE lost control of the stand. While in the process of trying to gain control of it, IE's left was pinched between the pipe guide and the pipe itself, causing a contusion to his hand.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand when it was caught between pipe guide and pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping mix lime with full PPE. He noticed his right wrist was burning so he took off his glo
IncidentDescription: IE was helping mix lime with full PPE. He noticed his right wrist was burning so he took off his glove and saw it was red and reported it to toolpusher.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to right wrist after contact with chemicals.

IncidentSummary: A 6" suction hose fell on right thumb while hooking hose to mud system.
IncidentDescription: A 6" suction hose fell on right thumb while hooking hose to mud system.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right thumb after being struck by 6" suction hose while hooking it to mud system.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping in 2-7/8" tubing. The IE was working the tubing board for the first time with
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping in 2-7/8" tubing. The IE was working the tubing board for the first time with the assistance of the derrick hand. At about the 4th stand, the IE tried to push the tubing into the elevator. The IE became nervous as he leaned out to latch the elevator and grabbed the rods with the left hand and tried to reach the elevators with the right hand. The IE lost his balance, pulling the left arm causing the muscles in the left shoulder to be strained.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left shoulder after losing balance while grabbing onto rods with left hand while reaching for elevators with the right hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling casing (LI)
IncidentDescription: Picked to 68-K to remove slips and slip bowl around 4 1/2" casing in 7 hanger head. Just after removing slips, casing collar on 4 1/2" casing came off and the casing fell about 6 feet.

IncidentSummary: When rigging down, substructure was being pulled away from the well. Toolpusher instructed driller
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: When rigging down, substructure was being pulled away from the well. Toolpusher instructed driller to cover exposed rathole and mousehole with a pallet and then to get a forklift to move grating to cover well. When grating was being installed, IE went to pull on grating and then his right foot and leg slipped into mousehole up to his waist. IE got a 3" scrape on his right shin from the bull rock that was on location pad. Pad was made of bull rock.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right leg when IE slipped and fell through mousehole up to waist.

IncidentSummary: MISS Petrodome/tong coordination
IncidentDescription:
While making the connection, both floorhands came in at the same time with the tongs.  Lack of communication and 
lack of paying attention.  Fortunately nothing happened.

IncidentSummary: MISS Petrodome/dropped sack of chemicals
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While moving a pallet of chemicals, forklift hit a bump on the ground and a sack of chemicals fell off the pallet.  No spills 
occurred.

IncidentSummary: MISS Petrodome/slips falling
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe, slips fell off to the side near employee's foot. No one was hurt.

IncidentSummary: MISS Petrodome/misstep on stairs
IncidentDescription:
While going up the stairs to the rig floor, employee misstepped and could have fallen. He was able to hold on to the 
handrail.

IncidentSummary: MISS Petrodome/tail rope
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe, tail rope broke. No one was near.

IncidentSummary: MISS Petrodome/slip handles
IncidentDescription:
After breaking drill pipe (DP), employee was going to rack DP on the rig floor. Employee tripped on the slip handle. 
Fortunately nothing happened. He was able to regain his balance.

IncidentSummary: The IE was folding out the catwalk alongside the rig and the handrail swung out. The operator was po
IncidentDescription: The IE was folding out the catwalk alongside the rig and the handrail swung out. The operator was pounding out the pins before the catwalk was laid out. The IE had his hand in the hinge area and the left index finger was pinched between the catwalk and handrail resulting in a laceration on the finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left index finger when it was pinched between the catwalk and handrail while folding out catwalk alongside rig.

IncidentSummary: MISS tool string pull out
IncidentDescription:
While picking up the gun getting ready for the first stage. Could not see the bottom of the lubricator and the cable 
head got wedged in the bottom of the lubricator. The wireline pulled out of rope socket and the gun fell to the ground. 
The reason the cable head got wedged is because the lubricator was not high enough.

IncidentSummary: IE was taking O-rings off a sub and the pick slipped and punctured left index finger.
IncidentDescription: IE was taking O-rings off a sub and the pick slipped and punctured left index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to left index finger when pick slipped while taking O-rings off a sub.

IncidentSummary: Temperature was in the 100's and IE started to feel overheated while rigging up.
IncidentDescription: Temperature was in the 100's and IE started to feel overheated while rigging up.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced overheating, due to temps being in the 100's, while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: While running in hole with 3/4" rods, rod skid was stuck in rod basket finger. Rod was too far down
IncidentDescription: While running in hole with 3/4" rods, rod skid was stuck in rod basket finger. Rod was too far down to latch transfer elevator. IE had to pick up rod stand with both hands to be able to latch transfer elevator on rod stand. While doing so, twisted and felt a sharp pain in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after twisting and holding on to rod stand with both hands while trying to latch transfer elevator.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing under rig floor, turned and walked into valve handle and bumped head.
IncidentDescription: IE was standing under rig floor, turned and walked into valve handle and bumped head.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion above eyebrow upon turning to walk, striking against valve handle under rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying down tubing. When elevators were unlatched, IE reached to grab horns on elevators an
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down tubing. When elevators were unlatched, IE reached to grab horns on elevators and missed, striking right hand against tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to right hand after striking tongs while missing horns on elevators when reaching out to grab them.

IncidentSummary: IE was on catwalk holding back-up with 36" pipe wrench on a joint of tubing while another employee w
IncidentDescription: IE was on catwalk holding back-up with 36" pipe wrench on a joint of tubing while another employee was tightening the safety valve on joint. The wrench slipped causing the IE to fall off the catwalk and the wrench to strike the right leg.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right leg after being struck by wrench after falling off the catwalk when wrench slipped off joint of tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to knock loose a two inch hammer union. He was holding the hose with his left hand
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to knock loose a two inch hammer union. He was holding the hose with his left hand and swinging a hammer wrench with his right hand. As he was swinging the hammer wrench, he slipped, causing him to strike his left hand with the hammer wrench. IE had the hammer with him but chose use to the hammer wrench instead.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand when struck by hammer wrench.

IncidentSummary: After putting bushings in, IE went to grab the hole cover which was flipped over the mousehole. When
IncidentDescription: After putting bushings in, IE went to grab the hole cover which was flipped over the mousehole. When he picked up the hole cover, he fell, one leg went in the mousehole and the other one stayed out. His tailbone hit on the edge of the mousehole housing.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to tailbone after slipping and one leg went into the mousehole and one stayed out.

IncidentSummary: After latching pipe in derrick, stand was slacked off in mousehole to put in screen. After stabbing
IncidentDescription: After latching pipe in derrick, stand was slacked off in mousehole to put in screen. After stabbing pipe in mousehole, the floor was cleared for the derrickhand to install screen in the drill pipe from the board. IE returned to the floor to put tail rope on stand and slipped on OBM that was on the diamond plate floor, striking his right knee and his right little finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusions to right little finger and right knee after slipping on OBM and falling.

IncidentSummary: Picking up drill collars from V-door to mouse hole. While IE was placing his tongs on drill collar
IncidentDescription: Picking up drill collars from V-door to mouse hole. While IE was placing his tongs on drill collar to torque up, he felt a pain in his testicles. IE said his veins are purple and feels like they are being squeezed.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to genitals when placing tongs on drill collar to torque up.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While picking up the blocks after switching from tied-back to double-fast, the IE was pushing off on
IncidentDescription: While picking up the blocks after switching from tied-back to double-fast, the IE was pushing off on the bales to clear the elevators from the floor. As they came up, the elevators caught on the floor and the IE pushed them out more. The elevators caught a second time and then popped over the floor and swung in. The IE had his left leg caught between the elevators and the tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left leg when it was caught between the elevators and the tongs while pushing back blocks from floor while they were being raised.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling joint (LI)
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up pipe with catline, making up on power swivel with ring clamped to cable. Clamp came off and joint fell while picking up on it.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking union on the stand pipe that connects to the rig floor from the substructure. When h
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking union on the stand pipe that connects to the rig floor from the substructure. When he struck the union with the hammer, the saddle clamp that holds the stand pipe through the substructure broke off from the weld that held the square tubing to the substructure, striking him on his lower right leg just below the knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right leg below knee when struck by saddle clamp.

IncidentSummary: While walking down steps, IE slipped and fell on step covered in oil-based mud.
IncidentDescription: While walking down steps, IE slipped and fell on step covered in oil-based mud.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to back after slipping and falling off step covered in pil-based mud.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/shackles, keepers
IncidentDescription: During nipple up employee noticed that there wasn't any keepers in shackles on BOPs during installation.

IncidentSummary: IE was at end of lay-down machine to the right side of unit. Rig was picking up joint of casing. IE
IncidentDescription: IE was at end of lay-down machine to the right side of unit. Rig was picking up joint of casing. IE dropped the bar, and while bending down to pick it up touched board line of rig, causing the casing to come out of trough on lay-down unit. Another hand saw what was happening and yelled to IE. IE looked up just as the joint hit him on the right side of head and shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to right shoulder/clavicle after being struck by a joint of casing while bending down to pick up piece of dropped re-bar.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Memorial RD/pipe spinners, body placement
IncidentDescription:
Employee who was operating the pipe spinners was not holding the spinners correctly and had bad body positioning yet 
still continued to operate pipe spinners. He almost lost control and just missed striking his elbow on safety cable.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/Hoses
IncidentDescription:
After hooking up water lines from frac tanks to rig tanks. Employee opened the valve and noticed that there was water 
leaking out of hammer unions.

IncidentSummary: MISS Memorial/powerwashing
IncidentDescription:
Employee was washing stairs with powerwasher when another employee walked into the direction of powerwasher 
nearly spraying second employee in the face.

IncidentSummary: Crew was breaking loose and backing out the Ratigan rod and the stuffing box from the pumping tee. I
IncidentDescription: Crew was breaking loose and backing out the Ratigan rod and the stuffing box from the pumping tee. IE was heeling the wrench. As the other two employees pulled on the wrench, it turned slightly and pinched the left index finger of the IE between the wrench and pumping tee.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left index finger when it was caught between wrench and pumping tee as he was heeling the wrench.

IncidentSummary: While crew was pulling rods out of the hole, the floor hands were inspecting the rods as they come o
IncidentDescription: While crew was pulling rods out of the hole, the floor hands were inspecting the rods as they come out. When they got to the bottom of the 3rd rod in the stand, they noticed a bad spot in the rod. By this time, the derrick man had already attached the rod transfer to the rod and was getting ready to move the rod to the fingers in the rod basket. Without looking up to verify the derrick man was ready for the rods to come back down, the operator lowered the blocks thus causing tension on the rod transfer. The rod transfer broke and flew off the end of the rod and hit IE on the left hand. This was the operators 1st day on the job as an operator.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left hand after being struck by the rod transfer as the operator lowered the blocks without looking up to verify the IE was ready for the rods to come back down while pulling rods out of the hole.

IncidentSummary: Rigging up tubing tongs chain/cable. Derrick hand swung cable around head and struck IE on the lip w
IncidentDescription: Rigging up tubing tongs chain/cable. Derrick hand swung cable around head and struck IE on the lip with a double-hook chain.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lip after being struck by double-hook chain while standing next to derrick hand as he swung cable rigging up tubing tongs chain/cable.

IncidentSummary: IE was pumping fluids a 09:56 PM. At 10:30 PM IE called Ricardo Hernandez, Rig Manager, to the pump
IncidentDescription: IE was pumping fluids a 09:56 PM. At 10:30 PM IE called Ricardo Hernandez, Rig Manager, to the pump and advised him that he was feeling shortness of breath.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced shortness of breath while pumping fluids.

IncidentSummary: IE was stringing pipe, had plenty of water next to him and had been drinking it all day. While worki
IncidentDescription: IE was stringing pipe, had plenty of water next to him and had been drinking it all day. While working, passed out and the next thing he remembered he was sitting up and Tim was telling him to drink some water. The water would just come back up. The IE also told me that he had passed out about 2 months ago on a STX job location, but he didn't let anyone know. IE has done some blood work about a month ago with his personal physician in Erath, LA and was found to have low potassium and was prescribed Paxil for anxiety and mood swings. IE told me he had eaten a lot of chocolate candy on Monday and had been trying to eat healthy, due to putting on about 30 lbs in the last 2 months, but cannot figure out why.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced loss of consciousness while stringing pipe. Doctor determined that it was a personal issue which included poor diet, and previous illness.

IncidentSummary: IE was holding back BOP hoses when hands were tightening up BOP's. The hammer head came off and stru
IncidentDescription: IE was holding back BOP hoses when hands were tightening up BOP's. The hammer head came off and struck the IE in the head.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration 2 inches above the left temple after being struck by hammer head that came off while IE was holding back BOP hoses for hands that were tightening up the BOP's.

IncidentSummary: While making connections, IE began feel hot and sick. He told his driller and he sent him down to th
IncidentDescription: While making connections, IE began feel hot and sick. He told his driller and he sent him down to the Rig Manager house. Spinners are not working.
InjuryDescripti: Heat exhaustion while making connections.

IncidentSummary: After IE latched drill pipe, he stepped into gap on diving board, causing his left foot to get hung
IncidentDescription: After IE latched drill pipe, he stepped into gap on diving board, causing his left foot to get hung up and his left knee was twisted.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee when left foot became hung up and knee was twisted.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/catwalk, rolled joint
IncidentDescription:
An employee was running the catwalk and rolled a joint off and missed gullwing allowing the joint to hit the ground 
nearly damaging the catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/flow line, track
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While walking the rig the flow line fell off of its track due to a bolt on the cross over failing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/lifting eye
IncidentDescription: While picking up a joint out of the trough with the tugger, the lifting eye partially spun out of the pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/improper driving
IncidentDescription:
While driving to the other location, and employee did not slow down enough for the sharpness of the turn in the road 
which made the truck slide a little and there was oncoming traffic.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/sub halves, ground rod wire
IncidentDescription:
While walking next to the sub halves, an employee tripped over a copper wire going to a ground rod. It was a poorly lit 
area and a bad location.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pipe wrangler, trough
IncidentDescription:
A hand was running the pipe wrangler and went to come all the way down with the trough. The side of the trough got 
caught on the wrangler and nearly broke off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/two forklifts
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Hand was running the forklift and loading pipe and when the hand went to back away from the rack, the other loader 
was behind him trying to get by and they nearly ran into each other

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loose joint
IncidentDescription: While laying down drill pipe, a joint came close to bouncing out of the trough due to the elevator position.

IncidentSummary: As IE was rolling down the tarp on truck 121, lost footing, put his hand out to catch himself and hi
IncidentDescription: As IE was rolling down the tarp on truck 121, lost footing, put his hand out to catch himself and hit the tip of his left ring finger on the side of the truck, resulting in a laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left ring finger after losing footing and hitting hand on wire mesh on side of truck while rolling down tarp.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slip-fall, trough
IncidentDescription:
While running casing, thread protectors were sent down on the trough. A hand stepped up on the catwalk to retrieve 
them as the trough was being lowered and he slipped on invert and foot slid under the trough as it was almost down 
nearly getting crushed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription:
A hand was trying to maneuver between ST-80 and trough, was in too tight of a space and could have gotten in a 
pinch point if anything was moving.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/breaking valve, pipe fell
IncidentDescription: Breaking apart 4'' valve when we got to the last bolt and nut, one side of the stand of pipe fell and almost hit a hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hole, draw works
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: A hand almost stepped in hole in front of the draw works while running cords (hole was about 8'' deep).

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hydraulic lines
IncidentDescription:
When removing the draw works from the floor with the cranes, a hand spotted that there were still a few hydraulic lines 
connected to the sub structure; a pick by the cranes would have resulted in ripping them out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/inattention, loader
IncidentDescription:
When putting pallets of bar in the hopper house, the operator wasn't paying attention to the person giving directions 
and turned the wrong way. He almost pinched the person between the wall and a pallets.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hammer union, catwalk
IncidentDescription:
When rigging up the cementing crew, a hand was using the chugger to bring up Sanjel's hard line pipe and the hammer 
union at the end of the pipe got hung up on the catwalk indexes.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pressure, cam lock fitting
IncidentDescription:
After pumping out the cellar the hand started to discharge it into the shakers. It built up pressure and started to spray 
and leak from the cam lock fitting because it was not closed all the way.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/incorrect cable configuration
IncidentDescription: The cables for the laydown machine were rigged up incorrectly.

IncidentSummary: MISS Duchesne/improper driving
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Third party water hauler was driving way too fast and could have hit someone or something.

IncidentSummary: IE put pack-off on bumper, got on bumper and picked it up to put in truck. Right hand slipped off pa
IncidentDescription: IE put pack-off on bumper, got on bumper and picked it up to put in truck. Right hand slipped off pack-off, pulled out of left hand causing it to fall onto right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right hand after being struck by pack-off after it slipped out of hand while loading onto truck.

IncidentSummary: MISS truck in ditch
IncidentDescription:
Eli Atol was driving Truck 78 to location. He was following his engineer who was pulling a trailer. They went up a private drive and were forced to back doen. Eli backed 
down the road and pulled to the shoulder to allow his engineer to get by. As Eli started to pull forward, the shoulder gave way and the truck slid partially into the 
ditch. Tow truck were able to get the truck out with no damage to the truck. Road was rain-soaked and wet.

IncidentSummary: IE started to feel over-heated while working on pipe rack. Temperature was over 100 degrees.
IncidentDescription: IE started to feel over-heated while working on pipe rack. Temperature was over 100 degrees.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced mild heat exhaustion while rolling pipe in temperatures around 100 degrees.

IncidentSummary: MISS fatigued driving
IncidentDescription:
0730 - Geno Vallejos arrived at shop for safety meeting which lasted 2 hours. Decided to stay at shop and to work rather than drive 45 min home and back again.
1730 - Shaun and Geno left for job site in Riverton, WY, stopping for fuel and Port-of-Entry travel permit on the way.
2130 - Geno's 14-hour driving limit was up but continued driving to location.
0300 - Arrived at location. Rig was still coming out of hole, waited 2-3 hours on the rig.
0600- Job was ready but had to wait on engineer to make adjustments on well logs and make prints.
1130 - Shaun and Geno left location, even though recording device showed Geno was out of hours to drive. Shaun and Geno changed vehicles so they could drive 
to the nearest town to get a signal to send logs out and find a hotel. Geno was driving the engineers pickup and fell asleep at the wheel. As the vehicle started to 
leave the road, he hit the road marker/reflectors and woke up in time to correct the vehicle and get back on the road. He tried to get in touch with 
the engineer, but there was still no signal. He kept going to catch up. Geno was on duty for 25.5 hours with only 2-3 hours of sleep.

IncidentSummary: While stacking grease totes on top of each other, IE was aligning the tote that was on the forklift
IncidentDescription: While stacking grease totes on top of each other, IE was aligning the tote that was on the forklift with the tote on the ground. While pushing on the tote, it moved and the tip of the right middle finger was caught between the top tote and bottom tote.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right middle fingertip when it was caught between grease totes being stacked as he was aligning them with each other.

IncidentSummary: MISS Emerald/3P vehicle tires
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While backing up a third party vehicle, a third party employee backed over some random iron and blew out two tires, 
causing the vehicle to almost tip over.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/water pump room door
IncidentDescription:
Day tank settled with all the rain and the door to the water pump room was starting to sit down on the suitcase behind 
it.  Employees took door off the hinges to prevent damage to door.

IncidentSummary: Vehicle was traveling north on Hwy 83, 6 miles north of Aspermont, Texas, when the left front tire b
IncidentDescription: Vehicle was traveling north on Hwy 83, 6 miles north of Aspermont, Texas, when the left front tire blew out. This caused the vehicle and trailer to cross over oncoming lanes, through fence and into pasture. There was also damage to trees.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right knee when left front tire blew out in vehicle causing the vehicle to cross over oncoming lanes on highway, through fence and trees and into pasture.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/Lifting sub
IncidentDescription: During BHA, hand was trying to lift a lifting sub by himself and could have nearly hurt or strained his back.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/man lift basket
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While operating the man lift, crew member nearly swung man lift basket in the side of the sub.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/stuck slips
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping in hole and driller went to pick up on stand so crew could pull slips. Slips were stuck in floor block.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loader bucket
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While dumping trash in dumpster, the pin on the loader wasn't locked good so when operator tilted down to dump it, 
the bucket almost came off the loader.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/catwalk
IncidentDescription: Bringing up joint of pipe, employee nearly got hit by catwalk coming up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hopper valve
IncidentDescription: Employee shut hopper off and hopper valve wasn't sealing shut all the way, causing it to fill up and almost overflow.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription:
While tailing/stabbing pipe into hole, a crew member placed himself between ST-80 and moving pipe. The tail rope 
caused pipe to move toward ST-80 and almost caught crew member between pipe and ST-80.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/unsecured hose
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Draining out vacuum  tank when hose came shooting out of waste tank because it wasn't tied down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/safety clip, single latches
IncidentDescription:
Worker was going to lift a joint out of the trough with single latch elevators but the safety clip was caught on the 
trough and almost unlatched the single latches.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, body placement
IncidentDescription:
While bringing up casing tongs using chugger, third party hand placed himself in a possible pinch point which could 
have 
resulted in an injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/forklift, improper operation
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand was backing up forklift and nearly hit the building.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, incorrect lanyard
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While preparing to work on flow sensor from the man lift, third party hand nearly used wrong lanyard for man lift use 
which could have resulted in an injury.

IncidentSummary: IE was fixing to close jet line valve next to mud mixer. When walking on 6" pipe under hopper area,
IncidentDescription: IE was fixing to close jet line valve next to mud mixer. When walking on 6" pipe under hopper area, his right foot slipped off and his right ankle was twisted.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after slipping near hopper area.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/lifting eye loose
IncidentDescription:
While raising joint with tugger, hand noticed that the lifting eye was starting to spin loose.  Hand stopped tugger 
operator and had him lower joint back into trough to properly tighten lifting eye.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pallets nearly dropped
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand was moving pallets of material to different locations and nearly dropped the load due to excessive speed on rough terrain.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/employee under elevators
IncidentDescription: Driller was reaming stand and as he was coming down, a hand was standing under elevators.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/electrical cord hanging low
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Hand was walking between mud pits and pump sheds when he almost got clothes lined by a electrical cord that was 
hanging too low.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80, tongs, hand placement
IncidentDescription:
Hand was turning the ST-80 out of the way and let it loose and nearly pinched his hand between the breakout tongs 
and the ST-80.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/half latched elevators
IncidentDescription:
While tripping out, the driller was latching elevators and the floorhand realized the elevators were half latched. He told 
the driller to stop the fully latched elevators.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/joint fell off rack
IncidentDescription:
When starting to run casing, the first joint, on the bottom row of the pipe racks, fell off because nothing was put in 
front of it to keep it from rolling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loose grommet
IncidentDescription: Electrical cord that runs alongside shaker was vibrating and seemed to loose grommet that attached cord to shaker.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hand placement
IncidentDescription:
While making up a stand in the mousehole, one employee attempted to help pull air spinners onto pipe and nearly had 
his hand caught between the two objects which could have resulted in an injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/agitator bearing
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While passing by agitator, employee noticed a humming noise coming from agitator coupling or motor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/near slip-fall
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
One employee was watching the hose to make sure it didn't spill and it started pouring out too fast. That employee 
yelled for someone to shut off the vacuum.  An employee that was near pressure washing heard and turned to go shut 
it off and almost slipped on a matting board.

IncidentSummary: After torquing up drill pipe to drill string on a connection, IE went to pull slips and got a sudden
IncidentDescription: After torquing up drill pipe to drill string on a connection, IE went to pull slips and got a sudden pain on his left side of groin behind his left testicle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left side of groin behind his left testicle while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: Sustained an abrasion to upper back after stepping off grating and falling into cellar while knockin
IncidentDescription: Sustained an abrasion to upper back after stepping off grating and falling into cellar while knocking bolts off BOP's.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to upper back after stepping off grating and falling into cellar while knocking bolts off BOP's.

IncidentSummary: IE was rolling pipe on pipe racks and installing thread protectors on pipe. At 4:15 PM he reported t
IncidentDescription: IE was rolling pipe on pipe racks and installing thread protectors on pipe. At 4:15 PM he reported to the rig supervisor, Leo Snell, that he was feeling dizzy and was not sweating normally.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced possible heat exhaustion (dizzy and not sweating normally) while rolling pipe on pipe racks and installing thread protectors on pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/cords caught
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: We were walking the rig and the cords on the festoon got caught between the choke line T-handles.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P foot placement
IncidentDescription:
Third party hand hooked up chugger to his tongs and tried to push them out the V-doors by himself.  The load was too 
much and caused third party hand to lose his footing, nearly causing the tongs to swing back in towards the 
drawworks.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking down 7" lubricator using a chain wrench. The chain wrench was on the last notch of t
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking down 7" lubricator using a chain wrench. The chain wrench was on the last notch of the chain and did not have a good bite. The IE pulled up with the chain wrench and twisted his right wrist and felt a pop, but did not think it was important enough to do any paperwork at the time. The engineer was notified and the IE continued to work. The wrist is sore and swollen but is moving fine. AXIOM WAS NOT CALLED.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right wrist when chain wrench being used to break down a 7" lubricator did not have a good "bite" on chain.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/unsecured latch
IncidentDescription:
When tripping hole, driller ran elevators up to derrickhand to latch pipe.  Derrickhand roped pipe into elevators and 
latched them but noticed the latch was not closed all the way.

IncidentSummary: IE was picking up pipe and latching elevators and caught finger between collar and elevator.
IncidentDescription: IE was picking up pipe and latching elevators and caught finger between collar and elevator.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right index finger when it was caught between collar and elevator while picking up pipe and latching elevators.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Emerald/tail rope control
IncidentDescription: While picking up drill collars an employee lost hold on the tail rope, causing the drill collar to swing in, nearly striking another employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Emerald/foot placement
IncidentDescription: While hand was pulling slips, he didn't have good foot placement and he nearly slipped and fell.

IncidentSummary: IE said that his shoulder blade was sore this morning when he got to work but did not report it. Wh
IncidentDescription: IE said that his shoulder blade was sore this morning when he got to work but did not report it. While tripping pipe out of the hole, the soreness started getting worse. Then he felt a pop and it got more painful while pulling slips.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS Emerald/catwalk remote
IncidentDescription: Worker hit wrong button on catwalk remote and kicked pipe down inside of catwalk when catwalk trough was up in the air.

IncidentSummary: MISS Emerald/hinges, suitcase lids
IncidentDescription:
While rigging down top drive service loop through suitcase, two hands tried to move lids, hinges were broken, lid slid 
towards hand, nearly smashing knee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Emerald/unsecured safety ears
IncidentDescription:
While setting the catwalk side stairs, a hand only flipped and bolted one of the safety ears down because he thought 
that the swamper had secured the other ear.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/wires incorrectly plugged
IncidentDescription:
Hand was plugging in wire and had two mixed up and plugged in wrong place. Driller walked by and noticed and 
switched them before turning them on.

IncidentSummary: IE was latching up elevators and walked off floor to take a water break and cool off in the pickup.
IncidentDescription: IE was latching up elevators and walked off floor to take a water break and cool off in the pickup. IE sat in truck for about an hour and then returned to work.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced overheating while latching up elevators.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE had been working for around 7.5 hours when wrist and hands started cramping. The rig manager told
IncidentDescription: IE had been working for around 7.5 hours when wrist and hands started cramping. The rig manager told the IE to get in the shade, rest and start drinking fluids. After following these instructions, the IE felt better.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping in wrist and hands while working outside in heat for about 7.5 hours.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up the substructure, IE was assisting other employee in carrying the middle spreader b
IncidentDescription: While rigging up the substructure, IE was assisting other employee in carrying the middle spreader beam for the substructure. IE was carrying the beam between his legs with his back bent down and walking backwards to set it in place. While walking backwards, IE tripped on a section of the matting board, causing him to fall backwards, dropping the piece of beam on his right hand, which caused a fracture to his right ring finger and lacerations to his right middle and ring fingers.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right ring finger and lacerations to middle and ring fingers when piece of beam fell on hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/forklift, refilling racks
IncidentDescription:
While waiting for DFO to refill pipe racks, floorhand was standing against racks and DFO dropped a load on to racks, 
taking floorhand by surprise and he darted out of way to avoid being struck.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling 4" hose out of reserve pit that had water in it that couldn't be reached with forklif
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling 4" hose out of reserve pit that had water in it that couldn't be reached with forklift. While pulling on hose, IE felt a pop and a sharp pain hit his stomach and now there is a hard knot forming above his belly button the size of a soft ball.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to abdomen while pulling hose.

IncidentSummary: IE was kneeling on the parts house floor, looking to see if electric motor was the right size to wor
IncidentDescription: IE was kneeling on the parts house floor, looking to see if electric motor was the right size to work for power washer pump in water pump house. After seeing that it was the right size, went to get up and reaching up with left hand, twisting and pushing up with knees felt sharp pain in back at base of rib cage.
