InjuryDescripti: Strain to upper and lower back when trying to get up from kneeling position.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping other employees work on getting the BOP set for the wireline. IE was holding the heav
IncidentDescription: IE was helping other employees work on getting the BOP set for the wireline. IE was holding the heavy piece of equipment. When they finished with the BOP, the IE stood up and felt a sharp pain in the middle of the back. The rig manager was notified.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to middle back while holding the heavy piece of equipment while employees were getting the BOP set for the wireline.

IncidentSummary: While pressure washing shop, IE was walking backwards and tripped on a BOP stack laying on a pallet.
IncidentDescription: While pressure washing shop, IE was walking backwards and tripped on a BOP stack laying on a pallet. When he tried to push off with his legs he twisted his knee and fell onto his back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back and right knee after tripping while pressure washing and walking backwards.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hand placement
IncidentDescription:
While installing the flow line, a floorhand was guiding it while on stair area. The flow line had bumped the wall nearly 
pinching his hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/incorrect body placement
IncidentDescription: Floorhands were making a connection. Floorhand was standing between the ST-80 and the A-leg section.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80, employee awareness
IncidentDescription:
A hand was unlocking the ST-80 bolt locks. Another hand started to move the ST-80 back, nearly hitting the hand 
unlocking the ST-80.

IncidentSummary: While laying down rods, IE felt light-headed and stopped sweating. Rig supervisor advised IE to go i
IncidentDescription: While laying down rods, IE felt light-headed and stopped sweating. Rig supervisor advised IE to go into the cooling trailer and cool down.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced symptoms of heat exhaustion, such as feeling light-headed and lack of sweat, while laying down rods.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/joint
IncidentDescription:
A joint had just been stabbed on to mousehole stump.  The chugger operator lifted the stand accidentally, nearly 
hitting another hand.

IncidentSummary: IE had returned to work after one week off and started to feel weak, dizzy, lightheaded and complain
IncidentDescription: IE had returned to work after one week off and started to feel weak, dizzy, lightheaded and complained of cramping.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced symptoms of heat exhaustion while working floors after being off for 7 days.

IncidentSummary: IE took several breaks throughout the morning, but complained of dizziness after lunch.
IncidentDescription: IE took several breaks throughout the morning, but complained of dizziness after lunch.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced dizziness after lunch. IE had taken several breaks throughout the morning.

IncidentSummary: Entire crew had taken frequent rest and water breaks throughout the day due to the hot conditions. N
IncidentDescription: Entire crew had taken frequent rest and water breaks throughout the day due to the hot conditions. Noticed that IE did not return to the rig and went to check on him. IE said he was not feeling well. Skin was not and was normal color. Crew left location for El Campo at 04:20 PM.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced slight heat exhaustion while working on rig floor running tubing.

IncidentSummary: Employee was moving rotating head packer to rotary. Driller lowered drill pipe to stab a rotating h
IncidentDescription: Employee was moving rotating head packer to rotary. Driller lowered drill pipe to stab a rotating head packer. Tool joint struck stump and swung striking the employee on left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Left shoulder inflammation after being struck by tool joint.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/elevators

While laying down drill collars, tried breaking out one with st 80.  It would not break the collar out, put tongs on 
driller got a bind on, every one got out of way and when driller pulled on it break out tongs popped off and were 
sucked into drawworks nearly causing damage to tongs and draw works.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/forklift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Raising load it with forklift, employee was walking under the boom.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/shackle pin

During pre tour walk about it was discovered that a shackle pin connecting the stubline to the 4 inch pressure lines

IncidentDescription:

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/V-door

Hands were starting to make up a stand in mouse hole.  One hand engaged the air hoist without checking to see if the

came off hinges and fell to ground. It would have struck someone if they had been standing where it hit the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Memorial RD/hammer

Employees were putting the flare line on and in doing so employee was hammering the union and missed the union

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/lay down trough

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/drawworks
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Hand was tying off something on drawworks when truck started to pick up draw works causing the drawworks to top 
where the back of the drawworks was touching the ground most, crushing the hand's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription:
While removing pin with 10 pound sledge hammer on top drive gripper with third party hand in swing zone, the hammer 
bounced off in nearly striking third party hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/sheave
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While rigging up wireline truck for logging, the truck operator slacked off the wireline causing the tension sheave to

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer, slippery surface
IncidentDescription:
While tightening up pipe liner, employee swinging the hammer was standing on a slippery surface.  Employee swung the

IncidentSummary: As the IE bent over to get water from the back of the mechanics truck he touched the side of the air
IncidentDescription: As the IE bent over to get water from the back of the mechanics truck he touched the side of the air compressor and burned his right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a minor burn to the right hand after touching the side of the air compressor in the back of the mechanics truck while getting water.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hook
IncidentDescription:
Hand was pulling on a derrick assist line and the hook fell off of the derrick, nearly  hitting a person that was walking 
underneath the derrick.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/open hole cover
IncidentDescription: A hole cover for a small hole on the floor was open and the employee, unaware, stepped in it, nearly getting hurt.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/racking board
IncidentDescription:
While tailing in stand of pipe, employee slipped on racking board that has a six inch rise on it and almost smashed hand 
between stump and stand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pressure testing lines
IncidentDescription: While Halliburton was pressure testing the lines, hand walked onto floor next to hard lines. Halliburton boss and driller stopped job.

IncidentSummary: MISS Emerald/elevators hit top drive
IncidentDescription:
While making up 4" stands with single latch elevators, pipe wrangler, and a chugger, elevators were on the way up and

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ST-80, deadman
IncidentDescription: Hand was not paying attention to ST-80 when moving away from stand, almost ran into deadman.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/trash drum, improper lifting
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was attempting to lift a trash drum by himself and was having trouble lifting it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pipe, manlift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Team was laying down pipe. When moving pipe from catwalk to racks noticed employee almost hit manlift wipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, tie-off
IncidentDescription: 3rd party climbing the sub without tying off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, lack of safety belt
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: 3rd party employee was climbing equipment without a safety belt.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand rigging up wind wall railing, was using shop hammer to tap rails in when hammer slipped out of his hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hose, trip hazard
IncidentDescription: 4" discharge hose run in front of, and at the base of, shaker stairs, a high-traffic walkway.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While hammering up union (?) (?) line on transfer pump, hammer slipped out of the employee's hands nearly striking 
another employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was knocking out a pin when the hammer nearly slipped out of his hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/black ice, board
IncidentDescription: While dressing the board, employee almost slipped while getting on board to dress it out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, body placement
IncidentDescription:
As pole truck was backing up tailing rams into the sub. 3rd party hand was between truck and stairs in a potentially 
dangerous area.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer, loose pin
IncidentDescription: Was hammering the pin into derrick when it bounced out. The pin fell to the ground.

IncidentSummary: IE started to climb out of mud tank and was on the second rung when right leg slipped off rung, brus
IncidentDescription: IE started to climb out of mud tank and was on the second rung when right leg slipped off rung, brushing the inside of his right knee on suction valve inside mud tank. IE got his balance and climbed out of mud tank, not thinking anything of it until he pulled his pant leg up and it had gotten puffy. Steven Perales was the floorhand that was on top of the mud tanks watching IE in the mud tank.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee when foot slipped off rung, brushing knee against suction valve.

IncidentSummary: IE had preexisting stomach issues that caused him to lose fluids and contribute to heat exhaustion.
IncidentDescription: IE had preexisting stomach issues that caused him to lose fluids and contribute to heat exhaustion. Doctor determined this was not heat related.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion. IE had preexisting stomach issues which had caused him to lose fluids prior to working. Heat allegedly further aggravated this condition.

IncidentSummary: IE was pushing kelly to mouse hole for a connection when he felt a sting in the groin area for a cou
IncidentDescription: IE was pushing kelly to mouse hole for a connection when he felt a sting in the groin area for a couple of seconds and then the pain went away. Continued to make connection and then felt a sharp pain when pulling slips. Pain lasted for two seconds and went away.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to groin when pushing kelly to mouse hole

IncidentSummary: While tailing out #10 setting tool with two over-body weight bars, Tool slipped causing IE to strain
IncidentDescription: While tailing out #10 setting tool with two over-body weight bars, Tool slipped causing IE to strain right elbow.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right elbow when tool slipped while laying down #10 setting tool with 2 over-body weight bars.

IncidentSummary: MISS gun string pull-out
IncidentDescription:
Engineer-in-Training, Brian Johnson, was attempting to lower a shot gun string into a lay-down cart. There were 3 other people on the job. Matt Simpson, Engineer, 
Matt Neimi, Crane Operator, and John Kelly, Operator on the floor. Matt Simpson was standing between the lay-down cart and the wire line truck blocking 
the view of Brian Johnson. On the 3rd attempt to put the shot gun in the cart, Brian had to raise the gun up a few inches and the gun caught the bottom edge of the 
lubricator. The gun pulled out of the rope socket and fell to the ground.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing on top of a hose reel attempting to close a gooseneck on an injector head. When the
IncidentDescription: IE was standing on top of a hose reel attempting to close a gooseneck on an injector head. When the gooseneck came free, it swung open knocking the IE off the hose reel causing IE to fall 4' to the deck of the trailer. IE hit the trailer and fell another 4' to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to sacrum/coccyx and left arm radius after being struck by gooseneck and falling 4 ft onto trailer, then falling another 4 ft to the ground, while standing on hose reel attempting to shake gooseneck to loosen pin.

IncidentSummary: The rig was in the process of changing out their mouse hole from a 30' mouse hole to a 90' mouse hol
IncidentDescription: The rig was in the process of changing out their mouse hole from a 30' mouse hole to a 90' mouse hole. The 90' mouse hole has a larger bowl at the top of it to allow for slips to be used in the mouse hole while building stands. A welder was cutting out the old mouse hole bracket to allow for the new mouse hole to fit. He cut out the 10" piece of casing, which was welded into the rig floor for a bracket, by cutting it apart into 6 pieces. He then would hammer the pieces out until they fell into the sub on the ground. However, one of the pieces hung up on an I-beam directly below the mouse hole bracket. Once the pieces were cut out, the crew attempted to stab the 90' mouse hole. As they were guiding it into the ground, the IE starting pushing on the mouse hole, attempting to stab it into the hole. While he was doing so, the piece that was hung up was knocked free and fell approximately 15', striking IE on the back of the neck. The measurements of the pieces of casing were 3/8" thick, 8" wide and 17" tall, weighing approximately 15-20 lbs.
InjuryDescripti: Fractures to neck when piece of casing fell and struck him.

IncidentSummary: IE was replacing the hydraulic cooling fan in the back of truck 47. The old fan was disconnected and
IncidentDescription: IE was replacing the hydraulic cooling fan in the back of truck 47. The old fan was disconnected and the new fan hooked up. Instead of mounting the new fan before turning it on, he told the engineer, Josh Folkers, to turn it on. The IE said he wanted to make sure it worked before mounting it. Once they knew it was working the engineer turned off the fan and the IE went to lay the fan on the wireline drum. The blades were still moving but slowing down. His left hand slipped and his index finger and middle finger got caught in the blade.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left index and middle finger after being struck by the blades of an hydraulic cooling fan he was replacing as the blades were slowing down.

IncidentSummary: Crew was connecting wireline BOP to lubricator. BOP was strapped to wellhead scaffold. When crew rem
IncidentDescription: Crew was connecting wireline BOP to lubricator. BOP was strapped to wellhead scaffold. When crew removed strap, BOP fell over nearly pinning IE's leg. Crew removed the strap because they thought they could hold it up while connecting the lubricator.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to right leg when it was nearly pinned between the BOP and the well head scaffold after the crew removed the strap.

IncidentSummary: Pushing back a stand of pipe, and when pipe set on racking board, it twisted, causing the IE's right
IncidentDescription: Pushing back a stand of pipe, and when pipe set on racking board, it twisted, causing the IE's right wrist to twist.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right wrist when pipe twisted on racking board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/frayed strap
IncidentDescription: Hands were picking up pipe, and driller noticed fraying in strap on double hook. Stopped the job.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/mouse hole cover off
IncidentDescription: Mouse hole cover was left off while making up BHA.  Someone could have fallen in.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling packer
IncidentDescription:
Picking up packer assembly from the ground. Rope socket got close to lubricator, realized lubricator was not high enough for tool to go in straight. Stopped wireline 
and was about to tell everyone to stop so that I could lower the tool. Third party Crane operator picked up on lubricator and wire pulled out of the rope socket on 
surface. Packer fell towards the wellhead striking a handrail and continued falling to the ground. Everyone had cleared away.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/truck backing up
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Water hauler was backing truck in and almost hit the catch tank.

IncidentSummary: Crew was running tubing using 3rd party tongs belonging to Pipe Pros, which were leaking hydraulic o
IncidentDescription: Crew was running tubing using 3rd party tongs belonging to Pipe Pros, which were leaking hydraulic oil on the work floor. IE was latching elevators when he slipped on oil resulting in striking right knee on slips.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right knee after slipping on the work floor in hydraulic oil that had leaked from 3rd party tongs being used.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription:
While tripping pipe in the driller was coming down and hands were setting the slips, as slips went in a hand slipped due 
to oil base on the soles of boots nearly getting caught between slips top edge and floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/mouse hole
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While laying down BHA, we was picking up mud motor out of mouse hole to lay it out use of V door.  As we went to 
pull the slips, of the slips got hung up in the mouse hole causing the mouse hole to pick up and drop.  Mouse hole 
twisted as it dropped missing employee's foot by less than an inch.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/missing nut & keeper pin
IncidentDescription: During pre-tour inspection and shackle connecting tong cable to the torque cylinder was missing a nut and keeper pin.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/3P, harness
IncidentDescription: Third party was on rig floor when unpinning derrick with no harness on.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/slips, hand & body placement
IncidentDescription: After making a connection when pulling slips, hand almost set slips on foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/wire line & sheave
IncidentDescription: When running wire line and down hand to solve that the wire had come out of sheave on derrick leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/slips, hand & body placement
IncidentDescription: After making a connection, hand A went to grab slip handle before driller came off  slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/forklift, electrical lines
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
When installing vibrating holds, forklift operator was moving suitcase closer to hoses and almost cut some electrical 
lines.

IncidentSummary: IE complained that he felt overheated while rigging up.
IncidentDescription: IE complained that he felt overheated while rigging up.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced symptoms of heat exhaustion while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Memorial RD/slips, chain tongs
IncidentDescription:
While taking off test plug employees were using the chain tong and did not realize the slips were not plugged correctly 
causing chain tongs to slip off and employee losing his step.

IncidentSummary: While exiting the tank farm, the IE missed the bottom step of the stairway and fell forward, catchin
IncidentDescription: While exiting the tank farm, the IE missed the bottom step of the stairway and fell forward, catching himself with his right hand. He felt pain and swelling in his right hand shortly after.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right hand after falling forward on stairway and catching himself.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/PPE, mask
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Derrick hand was not wearing proper mixing PPE. He needed the right mask.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/tail rope
IncidentDescription: When picking up a pipe in V-door, a hand did not have a tail rope.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/nut & keeper
IncidentDescription: Safety keeper on drill-side tong came out, and nut was almost off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/tail rope
IncidentDescription: While picking up pipe from hydraulic catwalk, hand wasn't going to use a tail rope to stabilize pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE slipped off the catwalk while assembling an open-hole tool string. The tool string fell with IE
IncidentDescription: IE slipped off the catwalk while assembling an open-hole tool string. The tool string fell with IE and landed on right ankle. He was able to continue working.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle when struck by tool string after slipping off catwalk while assembling open-hole tool string.

IncidentSummary: While making connection with power swivel, IE started getting a cramp in his right arm due to repeti
IncidentDescription: While making connection with power swivel, IE started getting a cramp in his right arm due to repetitive motion.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right arm due to repetitive action while making a connection with a power swivel.

IncidentSummary: IE was checking hoses on injector head. After the injector head was off, the IE began to walk away,
IncidentDescription: IE was checking hoses on injector head. After the injector head was off, the IE began to walk away, experienced a seizure and fell to the ground. Garrett Martin observed the situation and called Ryan Alleman on the radio. When Ryan arrived, he called 911 and an ambulance was in route.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced a seizure while walking away from injector head after changing hoses.

IncidentSummary: IE was unscrewing a stainless steel line from the top of a tree cap. All pressure was bled off, and
IncidentDescription: IE was unscrewing a stainless steel line from the top of a tree cap. All pressure was bled off, and chemicals being pumped into well were turned off as well. IE was unscrewing stainless steel line from chemical drums and two drops of emulsion inhibitor handed on the inside of the right leg above knee. It started burning instantly and he ran to the ice chest, removed pants, flushed with water and cleaned area. Put new pants on and resumed working.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained slight irritation to right leg after two drops of emulsion inhibitor dripped from stainless steel line on chemical drums.

IncidentSummary: Crew was coming out of hole with tubing and rods at the same time. The derrickman was on the cat lin
IncidentDescription: Crew was coming out of hole with tubing and rods at the same time. The derrickman was on the cat line breaking rods with the rod wrenches while the employees were on the rig floor working. The derrick man lost grip on one of the rod wrenches and it fell to the floor. The operator yelled to the guys on the rig floor, but it was too late. The IE saw it falling and ran to the corner of the floor and covered up to protect his head and neck. The rod wrench struck the left foot behind the steel toe.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left foot after being struck by falling rod wrench while on the rig floor working the tongs.

IncidentSummary: IE and another employee were lifting a bond tool off the trailer to put into the pickup. IE was lead
IncidentDescription: IE and another employee were lifting a bond tool off the trailer to put into the pickup. IE was leading and the other operator was on the tail end. He tripped on some pipe and fell to the ground, uninjured. The IE was struck in the shoulder by the bond tool.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left shoulder after being struck by bond tool after operator assisting in carrying it tripped as he walked behind the IE.

IncidentSummary: The IE grabbed make up tong and swung it to latch on pipe while making a connection when he felt a h
IncidentDescription: The IE grabbed make up tong and swung it to latch on pipe while making a connection when he felt a hard sharp pain to his lower back, causing tingling to run down left leg.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while making connection

IncidentSummary: MISS flammable solvent
IncidentDescription:
Operators in enclosed trailer after gun run cleaning gun and prepping next run. Typical aerosol cleaner "Aero solve II" was not available for trailer load-out prior to 
job. A substitute cleaner had been purchased and loaded. Zep Aero solve II and Nutech Misty Supersolve, our typical fast-drying solvent contact cleaners are non-
flammable cleaners. The substitute, also a Nutech brand, name "contact cleaner" was also labeled as a "fast drying precision cleaning solvent," however, further 
inspection of the label marks it as being "extremely flammable."
The gun subs had just been washed and dried and used Nutech Contact Cleaner to remove remaining gunk from the sub. With the aerosol in his right hand, he 
took a screwdriver in his left hand to scrape the gunk while he sprayed it. The solvent caught fire, presumable due a spark created between the screwdriver and 
gun sub. The fireball burned and partially melted the cotton gloves, but he was able to remove them without injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slip-fall, pipe
IncidentDescription: We were pushing back pipe and it was muddy on floor and we slipped and almost got pinched by pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P on catwalk
IncidentDescription: Laying down casing tools out the V-Door and the casing hand was on the catwalk.

IncidentSummary: IE came down from the derrick and informed his rig supervisor that he felt some cramping in his rib
IncidentDescription: IE came down from the derrick and informed his rig supervisor that he felt some cramping in his rib area.
InjuryDescripti: IE experienced cramping in his rib area while tripping in tubing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/clamp keepers bent
IncidentDescription: Collar clamp dies keepers were all in and in working condition but were starting to bend upwards.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loader backing up
IncidentDescription: Loader operator nearly backed into pipe rack.

IncidentSummary: After making a connection to pull slips out of rotary to bring kelly down, the IE, while pulling sli
IncidentDescription: After making a connection to pull slips out of rotary to bring kelly down, the IE, while pulling slips, felt a sharp pain on left side of back above buttocks.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left side of back above buttocks while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: Blind rams were shut-in at 11:00 AM while waiting on a tool. Once tool arrived at 6:00 PM, IE and fi
IncidentDescription: Blind rams were shut-in at 11:00 AM while waiting on a tool. Once tool arrived at 6:00 PM, IE and fishing tool hand were on rig floor when Roy Gallegos opened rams causing trapped pressure to release and slips to shoot up. As slips shot up, IE stepped back striking his lower back on the handrail.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lower back after stepping back and striking against handrail as slips shot up when trapped pressure was released.

IncidentSummary: IE felt weak and hot before falling down on location. The outside working temperature was 95+ degree
IncidentDescription: IE felt weak and hot before falling down on location. The outside working temperature was 95+ degrees with high humidity. IE showed symptoms of heat exhaustion.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced dizziness, slow speech and felt weak and hot prior to falling down on location.

IncidentSummary: IE was rotating elevators to start tripping in the hole with tubing. Elevators swung towards him, st
IncidentDescription: IE was rotating elevators to start tripping in the hole with tubing. Elevators swung towards him, striking his right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right shoulder, after being struck by elevators as they swung towards him, while rotating elevators prior to tripping-in.

IncidentSummary: IE and Brett Evans were carrying a #20 setting tool from stands to truck. The location was muddy and
IncidentDescription: IE and Brett Evans were carrying a #20 setting tool from stands to truck. The location was muddy and IE lost his footing and tripped causing tool to shift in arms, straining elbow. IE did not fall.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left elbow when mud caused a slip and #20 setting tool he was carrying shifted.

IncidentSummary: IE became light-headed and complained of cramping.
IncidentDescription: IE became light-headed and complained of cramping.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion while closing in well.

IncidentSummary: IE was unloading generator from doghouse so it could be hooked up to turn on the A/C. While picking
IncidentDescription: IE was unloading generator from doghouse so it could be hooked up to turn on the A/C. While picking up the generator, the IE felt a sharp pain in lower back. The IE immediately went back to work to see if it would get better. When it did not, it was reported it to the rig supervisor at approximately 10:30 AM.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while unloading generator from doghouse.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/sledge hammer head
IncidentDescription: Hand was tightening up hammer union when he noticed head of sledge hammer was loose.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, harness
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
An employee noticed truck driver was about to off load a 125' man lift off a lowboy trailer.  Employee went up to truck 
driver and asked if either he had a harness to put on or needed to borrow one.  Truck Driver asked why he needed to 
wear a harness and he also mentioned he never wore one before. Employee told him if he were to unload the man lift 
and a tire would have come off trailer, it may jolt man lift and spring him into the air.  Truck driver then said he would 
put a harness on but would like to borrow one.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loose saddle clamp
IncidentDescription:
As employee was going up derrick board to make up lifting nubbin to mouse hole a stand, he noticed the saddle clamp 
on the stand pipe on back side of derrick was loose.  Employee came down and notified the driller and floorhands to 
stay clear of area underneath.  A saddle clamp half and bolts could have come completely out and possibly struck an 
employee who may have been walking through area. Before hand tightened the bolts, there was a one inch gap 
between clamp half and stand pipe. It was hanging by threads.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/stop pins out
IncidentDescription:
Casing joint was about to be loaded on carrier trough to start casing job when a hand noticed the stop pins were out 
on the off drillers side of catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/clevis
IncidentDescription:
While pressure washing, floor hand noticed a clevis close to the edge of the rig floor that had the potential of falling 
and hitting someone.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/rotating head
IncidentDescription: Employees were putting on rotating head when it got caught on bird bath.  It fell and almost broke a fitting off.

IncidentSummary: IE reported cramping in his hands and legs and stated that he had been ill the previous weekend.
IncidentDescription: IE reported cramping in his hands and legs and stated that he had been ill the previous weekend.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced symptoms of heat exhaustion with cramping in hands and legs while coming out of hole with rods.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/wrong tool
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While employee was working on air pump, he was about to use a crescent wrench to tap on a pin.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/coupler, fuel lines
IncidentDescription: Motor hands were rigging up motors and noticed they were getting air with the fuel lines, causing motors to shut down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/wind, unsecured stand
IncidentDescription:
While drilling, wind was blowing pretty good, causing two stands that were tied back to come untied. One stand went 
to the back of the board and other stayed in the alley. Note: Hurricane bar was done.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/service loop
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:

employee noticed. No one was near after that.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription: Hand almost swung ST-80 into another hand when putting on cement head.

IncidentSummary: Employee was hitting mule sub with sledge hammer when hammer slipped out of his hand and hit IE in h
IncidentDescription: Employee was hitting mule sub with sledge hammer when hammer slipped out of his hand and hit IE in his lower abdomen area
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower abdomen after being struck by sledge hammer.

IncidentSummary: MISS Talaria Gas & Oil/rope
IncidentDescription:
Employee was using tag line to stab it on the stub when the rope slipped off his hand but managed to recover pipe but 
no one got hurt and no equipment damaged.

IncidentSummary: Crew was installing horsehead, tied off to cat line #2, and IE was tied off to cat line #1. IE used
IncidentDescription: Crew was installing horsehead, tied off to cat line #2, and IE was tied off to cat line #1. IE used hand signals and also verbally instructed operator to lower the horsehead down which resulted in IE's right hand being caught between horsehead and horseneck. Operator saw him and proceeded to raise the horsehead.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/scoria
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While first raising derrick, rig manager noticed scoria rocks were packed underneath derrick board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/sala line

While climbing mast ladder, employee began to notice slack in sala cable.  Employee immediately came back down and 
switched to other sala.  Employee went up to crown and found that the first sala was tangled on itself.  Wind was 
blowing. Could have blown slacked sala into drill line or if employee had fallen, sala could have failed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hurricane bar, cotter pin
IncidentDescription:
Pin for hurricane bar worked its way out and broke cotter pin.  No safety cable was present on hurricane bar.  Hurricane 
bar needs secondary fall protection.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hand placement
IncidentDescription: While laying down 5" drill pipe, an employee noticed the employee's hand dropping low on the pipe while pushing it into the trough.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/bail, rubber gasket
IncidentDescription:
After rigging up cementers, employee noticed a Halliburton bail was leaking. Halliburton unscrewed the bails to find the 
rubber gasket was not there.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/power washer
IncidentDescription:
Two floorhands were washing the sub. One was up on the scaffolding and he set his power washer down. The power 
washer then fell to the floor next to the other floorhand.

IncidentSummary: IE was loading a 2-3/4" bond tool onto the rocket launchers of this pickup truck. The tool got caugh
IncidentDescription: IE was loading a 2-3/4" bond tool onto the rocket launchers of this pickup truck. The tool got caught and when IE attempted to spin the tool to free it, the tool slipped off the rocket launchers and struck right collar bone.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained puncture to neck after being struck by the bond tool after it slipped off the rocket launcher as he was attempting to free it up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Pride Energy/hand placement, rolling pipe
IncidentDescription:
Hand was putting lifting caps on pipe then rolling it onto catwalk and another hand went to help him out. That 
employee was not paying attention and almost struck his hand while rolling pipe but the other employee stopped the 
pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Talaria Gas & Oil/ground rod
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was hitting ground rod when he missed ground rod and missed his leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS Talaria Gas & Oil/hose
IncidentDescription: Employee was getting stuff up on the lockers when a roll of hose fell down, missing employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Bosque/liner
IncidentDescription: When changing out liners on pump and hand had liner and when picking up liner, liner slipped almost smashing his feet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Bosque/oil, slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While employee was going to check mud pumps, he slipped and nearly fell on oil that was on the skid.

IncidentSummary: Tightening hose clamp on water hose, wrench slipped off, hit the IE on bottom lip.
IncidentDescription: Tightening hose clamp on water hose, wrench slipped off, hit the IE on bottom lip.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to bottom lip when hit by wrench that had slipped off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Bosque/sub, slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand was reaching back at stand of pipe and when pushing stand hand tripped over sub and almost fell down.

IncidentSummary: Rig floor was slick due to water from tripping out pipe. IE slipped on wet floor and after work comp
IncidentDescription: Rig floor was slick due to water from tripping out pipe. IE slipped on wet floor and after work complained that groin was sore.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to groin area after slipping on rig floor that was slick after tripping out pipe.

IncidentSummary: One hour into his tour, while tripping out of the hole, the injured employee stated that he was pull
IncidentDescription: One hour into his tour, while tripping out of the hole, the injured employee stated that he was pulling slips when he felt a pop followed by a sharp pain to his knee. He attempted to walk on it and the pain continued.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/PPE
IncidentDescription: Using pressure washing without face shield.

IncidentSummary: MISS US Enercorp, Ltd/trash
IncidentDescription:
Hand was dumping trash when he started to spill all over the ground.  He quickly stopped the spill by repositioning trash 
can.

IncidentSummary: MISS US Enercorp, Ltd/PPE
IncidentDescription:
Hand was chipping away as PPE are in but was not wearing face shield.  Chips were hitting him in the face he put one 
on.

IncidentSummary: MISS US Enercorp, Ltd/diving board
IncidentDescription:
Hand notice that when he pulled pipe back his foot was slipping on the diving board so he weaved a rope in the 
expanded metal it helped him maintain his footing.

IncidentSummary: MISS US Enercorp, Ltd/slips, foot placement
IncidentDescription: After pulling slips the slips fell over and landed very close to one guy's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/hammer
IncidentDescription: Observed a hand using hammer in derrick that was not tied off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/slip-fall, stairs
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand slipped and almost fell using dog house rear exit.

IncidentSummary: The crew had just finished rigging up the well. They broke the polish rod off the pump jack. When th
IncidentDescription: The crew had just finished rigging up the well. They broke the polish rod off the pump jack. When they went to lay it down, IE was on the end coming off the rig floor and the crew on the other end let their end drop, causing a lot of weight on the IE's end of the polish rod.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left shoulder when crew on holding other end of polish rod suddenly dropped it, putting all of the weight on the end IE was holding.

IncidentSummary: Crew was unlatching from on/off tool at the packer. IE was turning 2-2/8" tubing with a 36" pipe wre
IncidentDescription: Crew was unlatching from on/off tool at the packer. IE was turning 2-2/8" tubing with a 36" pipe wrench along with 3 co-workers. At the end of the shift, IE notified supervisor, Joe Molina, that a slight pain was felt on the left side of torso. IE did not want to seek medical attention.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced a pain in upper torso while helping turn 2-7/8" tubing with a 36" pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: Crew came out of the hole with tubing and were done with the top set of the 2-3/8" BOP. They then st
IncidentDescription: Crew came out of the hole with tubing and were done with the top set of the 2-3/8" BOP. They then stumped off the 2-3/8" BOP. While lowering the height of the work floor, the IE stumbled and fell forward. While falling forward, the IE reached out with right hand to catch himself and strained right ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ring finger trying to catch himself after stumbling on work floor as it was being lowered.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall, cellar
IncidentDescription: While climbing down into the cellar hand's boot slipped off ladder step nearly causing causing him to fall.

IncidentSummary: While mixing sacks at hopper, the IE started to feel overheated and floorhand noticed him slumping o
IncidentDescription: While mixing sacks at hopper, the IE started to feel overheated and floorhand noticed him slumping over. Floorhand assisted him into rig manager house to cool off and re-hydrate. Rig Manager called safety man and superintendent and was told to allow the IE to take a cool shower and re-hydrate until he was cooled off.
InjuryDescripti: Over heated while mixing sacks at hopper.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/drawworks
IncidentDescription:
Hand was tying off something in drawworks when track started to pick up drawworks covering the drawworks to top 
when the back of the drawworks was touching the ground almost crushing the hand's foot.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing on a valve trying to screw a nut on the bottom of the BOPs, slipped and fell on a ne
IncidentDescription: IE was standing on a valve trying to screw a nut on the bottom of the BOPs, slipped and fell on a needle valve shaft, which scraped underneath the groin area.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to area below groin, after slipping and falling on a needle valve shaft while standing on valve attempting to screw a nut on the bottom of the BOP.

IncidentSummary: The crew was rigging down to move over to the next well on the pad to be completed. The rig floor wa
IncidentDescription: The crew was rigging down to move over to the next well on the pad to be completed. The rig floor was removed from a work height of approximately 24 ft. and lowered to the ground. As the floor reached the ground, the floor hands were pushing the work floor away from the BOP stack to prevent it from hanging on the wellhead. The IE's right hand was caught between the work floor and the flow-back line coming off the wellhead. The IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to right hand after it was caught between the work floor and the flow-back line coming off the wellhead while rigging down.

IncidentSummary: IE and another employee were loading 5-barrel perforating guns off the 3-rack and putting them on th
IncidentDescription: IE and another employee were loading 5-barrel perforating guns off the 3-rack and putting them on the trailer to take to a plug shoot. After loading the guns, IE said his back was sore and informed his on-site supervisor. The incident did not get reported to management until 07-29-14.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after lifting 5-barrel perforating guns off 3-rack and onto trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was hooking up transfer pump and felt a pain in his back and continued working.
IncidentDescription: IE was hooking up transfer pump and felt a pain in his back and continued working.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while hooking up transfer pump.

IncidentSummary: As crew was making up a steel line to joint casing to pump fluids IE stated he was feeling chest pai
IncidentDescription: As crew was making up a steel line to joint casing to pump fluids IE stated he was feeling chest pains. Rig supervisor stated all employees had just been in cooling trailer for 3 hours waiting for BOP accumulator to arrive from Houston.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced chest pains while assisting in making up steel line joint to casing to pump fluids.

IncidentSummary: After walking the rig ahead to the next hole, the IE was pulling the derrick assist line back to a s
IncidentDescription: After walking the rig ahead to the next hole, the IE was pulling the derrick assist line back to a safe position. He attempted to toss the cable over the festoon electrical track and was struck by the chain hook on the mouth, causing a laceration to the lower lip.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to lower lip when struck by chain hook.

IncidentSummary: MISS Marathon/3P, blocks
IncidentDescription: Driller was lifting blocks and 3rd party was not operating hoist.

IncidentSummary: MISS Marathon/3P
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand was throwing (illegible) and almost hit co-worker.

IncidentSummary: MISS Marathon/cables
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While lowering derrick employee got caught up in cables.

IncidentSummary: MISS Marathon/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: A hammer fell and landed next to employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Marathon/drill pipe
IncidentDescription: Employee was standing in front of drill pipe when lead hand was about to pick up the hoist.

IncidentSummary: MISS Marathon/keeper & nut, tong
IncidentDescription: While making connection, employee noticed keeper and nut missing on tong.

IncidentSummary: IE was tightening air lineto back brake on rotary table when wrench slipped and left tip of little f
IncidentDescription: IE was tightening air lineto back brake on rotary table when wrench slipped and left tip of little finger hit plate on rotary and split end of little finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left pinky finger when it struck the plate on the rotary.

IncidentSummary: MISS Marathon/pipe, EE inattention
IncidentDescription:
When picking up pipe from V-door to mast hold the floor hand running the hoist wasn't paying attention and picked up 
the pipe too high.

IncidentSummary: MISS Marathon/pipe, EE inattention
IncidentDescription:
Floor hand was moving pipe with the forklift and wasn't paying attention and knocked down the pipe stopper on the 
pipe rack.

IncidentSummary: IE was trying to break suction hose apart and the camlock whipped up and hit lip.
IncidentDescription: IE was trying to break suction hose apart and the camlock whipped up and hit lip.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to lip after being struck by camlock while trying to break suction hose apart.

IncidentSummary: IE was sprayed with mud while moving hose.
IncidentDescription: IE was sprayed with mud while moving hose.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to both eyes after sprayed with mud while trying to move hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS pipe hung in elevators (AR)
IncidentDescription: While making up a top gun on end of tubing to go in hole, collar came off joint of pipe hanging in elevators.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/near-fall slip
IncidentDescription: Employee was working on floor and tripped over piece of equipment.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/pipe
IncidentDescription: Employee was rolling pipe and it rolled (illegible) and off one side of rack.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/ST-80, hand placement
IncidentDescription: Employee had his hand on the drill pipe when the ST-80 was being brought to pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/slips
IncidentDescription: The pipe slips fell over and almost hit employee in the leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS NGL Water Solutions/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription:
Employee was making connection and while pushing and tailing in kelly to stub, his boot slid causing him to lose 
balance.

IncidentSummary: MISS NGL Water Solutions/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was pressure washing near BOP when he slipped but managed to stay on balance not getting injured.

IncidentSummary: The IE walked across muddy floor, slipped and fell on his right knee.
IncidentDescription: The IE walked across muddy floor, slipped and fell on his right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee after slipping on muddy floor and falling on knee.

IncidentSummary: Crew was coming out of hole with 2-7/8" tubing when the collar on the joint caught on the tongs and
IncidentDescription: Crew was coming out of hole with 2-7/8" tubing when the collar on the joint caught on the tongs and lifted them. When the tongs fell back down, they struck the IE on the right hip and the right calf. The bracket that attached the stiff arm to the tongs broke during the incident.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right hip and right calf after being struck by the tongs when the stiff arm broke.

IncidentSummary: MISS defective drum drill-line clamp (LI)
IncidentDescription: While running Tbg in hole, clamp came off drill line inside drum.

IncidentSummary: IE was changing o-rings on a 10K BOP. The top ram had been removed exposing sharp threads. As IE r
IncidentDescription: IE was changing o-rings on a 10K BOP. The top ram had been removed exposing sharp threads. As IE removed the bottom ram, the ram dropped and its weight pulled IE down. Head hit the exposed threads causing a small laceration above his left eye. Axiom was called, no stitches were required. The cut was cleaned and IE continued working.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration above left eyebrow after striking head on top of BOP after losing balance while changing o-rings.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While setting slips, a hand almost slipped and fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/air hose, foot placement
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Hand was stretching out air hose for task. Air hose got caught around his foot and he almost fell. Could have broken 
foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription: Breaking loose BOP in cellar with hammer wrench. Hammer slipped in hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pin
IncidentDescription:
While performing brake inspection and as soon as driller removed front cover on drawworks he noticed pin was sticking 
out on driller side of brakes. He immediately showed the rig manager.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/slips
IncidentDescription: Hand made mistake of using foot to push slips in when slips did not set all the way first attempt.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/casing, body placement
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Hand was rolling casing with another hand on opposite side; helping hand got in between casing with back turned when 
more casing started rolling toward him nearly got caught in between casing.

IncidentSummary: While tripping pipe into the hole with 2-7/8" tubing, the second collar did not line up correctly ca
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe into the hole with 2-7/8" tubing, the second collar did not line up correctly causing the collar to get caught up in the tongs, pushing them down. Once the collar released from the tongs, they shot upward striking the IE below the jaw which caused him to fall back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to jaw area after being struck by the tongs after they shot upward when the collar did not line up correctly causing the collar to get caught up.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up base beam from one corner to pull geronimo line from under base beam using forkl
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up base beam from one corner to pull geronimo line from under base beam using forklift. The fork slipped from under the base beam striking IE and knocking him back onto ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to jaw after being struck by forklift after fork slipped from under base beam while pulling Geronimo line.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up, IE was looking for a "T" connector (1502) behind the pump between the heads. As he
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, IE was looking for a "T" connector (1502) behind the pump between the heads. As he was coming down the back he slid down the fender to the ground and hurt his back on the bumper where the lights are.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to upper and lower back and left ankle as he struck the bumper after slipping while exiting vehicle while looking for a "T" connector.

IncidentSummary: During skidding operations, the IE employee was trying to connect the 4" vibrator hose coming from t
IncidentDescription: During skidding operations, the IE employee was trying to connect the 4" vibrator hose coming from the back of the #1 mud pump house, to the 4" hard line valve on the suction pit. There was a tandem truck connected to the mud pump house and was trying to position it. The crew needed the mud pump house to to be approximately 1" closer to the 4" hard line valve in order to connect the hammer union. The IE was standing on the landing on the backside of the mud pump house in between the pump house and the pit. He had his right foot positioned in line with the 4" valve, causing a crush point between the deck of the pump house and the 4" valve. When the truck pusher signaled the driver to "bump" the load back, he failed to see that the back tires of the truck were against the rig mat. When the driver of the truck broke over the edge of the rig mat, it caused the truck to lunge back approximately 3 feet, pinching the IE's right ankle between the load hitch and the 4" hard line valve.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right ankle when caught between load hitch and 4" hard line valve.

IncidentSummary: The IE was stepping over from the suitcase to the mud boat skid package to begin pressure washing th
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: The IE was stepping over from the suitcase to the mud boat skid package to begin pressure washing the mud boat package. The span between the suitcase and the mud boat package was 2'8". When the IE stepped onto the mud boat package, he slipped and tried to catch himself and landed on his left hand, causing minor swelling on his left wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left wrist after slipping and landing on wrist.

IncidentSummary: IE was using a bucket to hold pipe while making a swivel connection when the chain became bound. IE
IncidentDescription: IE was using a bucket to hold pipe while making a swivel connection when the chain became bound. IE did not let go of bucket used to pick up the pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right shoulder when chain became bound and pulled on bucket being used to hold pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE was tying cat line onto four joints of tubing and pushing pipe into position on floor and complai
IncidentDescription: IE was tying cat line onto four joints of tubing and pushing pipe into position on floor and complained of heat and cramps.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramps while picking up cat line.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS casing scraper (LI)
IncidentDescription: While making up casing scraper on bottom of drill collar stand lifted sub back off.

IncidentSummary: Incident described by Danny Hazel: Kenny Farquer was driving an open-hole logging truck in muddy and
IncidentDescription: Incident described by Danny Hazel: Kenny Farquer was driving an open-hole logging truck in muddy and dark conditions. Truck fishtailed and started to slide into ditch. Truck struck 3 culverts buried in road right before the truck flipped onto right side. Kenny is complaining of a sore ankle. Axiom was called and treated with first aid measures at this time. Chris Desaire was in the sleeper at the time of the accident and is complaining of a sore back. Axiom was called and is being treated with first aid measures. Claims were filed in the event either employee should require medical treatment at a later date.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to back as he slept in the sleeper of the Wireline truck when it rolled into the ditch.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling bale hinge bolt (EC)
IncidentDescription: While running tubing in the hole, the bottom bolt on the hinge that holds the bales on the blocks backed out and fell to the floor. The blocks were about 40-50 feet high when the bolt fell. The bolt should have had a cotter pin in place and it is unknown if there was one and it broke or if there was one at all. The cotter pin was not found on location. Inspection showed wear on both the threads of the nut and bolt of the hinge.

IncidentSummary: As rig was drilling # 2 pump motor over heated and turned off and the IE climbed onto motor to open
IncidentDescription: As rig was drilling # 2 pump motor over heated and turned off and the IE climbed onto motor to open radiator cap to check fluid. As the IE turned the cap, fluid splashed out and burned the IE on forearm, hand and neck.
InjuryDescripti: Inflammation to neck, right arm, and left hand when fluid from radiator splashed on to IE.

IncidentSummary: The IE and Eddie were moving trash pump in. Part of the hose would not reach pump. Needed to move tr
IncidentDescription: The IE and Eddie were moving trash pump in. Part of the hose would not reach pump. Needed to move trash pump closer so the IE climbed on top of trash pump to move sling to another fork. He slipped and fell off trash pump on to left shoulder, causing red rash and small knot on forearm. The IE reported to the Rig Manager at 4:02 AM and the Rig Manager called the safety man, Bailey, Joseph to report accident and also let company man, Robert Carpenter know of accident.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back, contusion to buttock and left forearm and shoulder after slipping and falling off trash pump.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/catwalk, body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was standing on catwalk while picking up pipe with the air hoist.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/wildlife on location
IncidentDescription: Employee was in smoking area when he saw a 4 ft rattlesnake on edge of location.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/electrical plug
IncidentDescription:
Electrical plug to shakers malfunctioned causing sparks to come out of plug causing small flame. Hole was made to plug 
due to malfunction. Nobody was in area. Derrickman noticed it from the mud pump area.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/unsecured pin
IncidentDescription: Pin fell out of beam in sub under racking board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Pride Energy/stairs, hand placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was going up stairs without grabbing handrails.

IncidentSummary: MISS Pride Energy/PPE
IncidentDescription:
Hand went out to help derrickhand mix chemicals and started picking up sacks and right before he cut sack open, hand 
was told to stop the job.

IncidentSummary: MISS Hat Creek/tie-off
IncidentDescription: While putting kelly hose on top drive, employee was not tied off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Hat Creek/handling equipment
IncidentDescription: While picking up service loop Employee didn't see it getting caught under sub.

IncidentSummary: MISS Hat Creek/tail rope
IncidentDescription: While making a stand employee didn't have tail rope in his hands.

IncidentSummary: Anthony Ramirez was on location as the 5th man on the crew. The company man called the operations m
IncidentDescription: Anthony Ramirez was on location as the 5th man on the crew. The company man called the operations manager and complained that Mr. Ramirez was not working. Stated that he was just standing around with his hands in his pocket while everyone else was working. At 12:00 noon, Mr. Ramirez complained that his fingers were cramping. The Rig Supervisor put him in the air conditioned dog house. The Rig Supervisor stated that Mr. Ramirez was checked on freqeuently. The Rig Supervisor stated that every time he checked on Mr. Ramirez, that Mr. Ramirez was either on his phone or texting. (Texting with cramping fingers?) He stayed in the dog house for the remainder of his shift and was feeling better when he left work that evening. At 9:00 pm that evening, Luis Ramirez (Anthony's brother) called Eugene Bustamante (Operation manger) and stated that he was taking Anthony to the ER. He stated that Anthony was cramping really bad and needed to go to the hospital. Mr. Bustamante asked if it was due to something that occurred at work and was told it was not. Luis called Mr. Bustamante and told him that the hospital would not see Anthony so they were going to a different hospital. Mr. Bustamante told him to turn around and go back that he would call the hospital. He talked to a lady at the hospital and did not get her name. She told him that it did not appear to be work related and that they would go ahead and see him.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly experienced cramping of fingers while standing around not working.

IncidentSummary: MISS Hat Creek/mouse hole
IncidentDescription: Personnel was making connection when he was setting slips his trip with mouse hole cover.

IncidentSummary: MISS Rhino/forklift, chemical sacks
IncidentDescription:
While mixing chemicals to a slog.  Employee stepped on fork to get a palette so he could grab barite sacks.  He slipped 
on the fork while stepping up and lost balance on top of sacks.  He was trying to reach top sack.

IncidentSummary: MISS Rhino/rotary
IncidentDescription:
While racking pipe back employee stepped on rotary to walk to rack pipe. Rotary was still spinning. Employee lost his 
balance and nearly fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Rhino/lighting safety cable
IncidentDescription: Hand was washing sub and when washing sub hand noticed the one of the lights did not have safety cable.

IncidentSummary: MISS Rhino/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand was pushing drill pipe into trough and when pushing it hand slipped and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Rhino/collar clamp
IncidentDescription: Hand was putting on collar clamp and when putting clamp (illegible) was loose and almost fell in hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Rhino/missing safety keeper
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While rigging up casing crew employee noticed safety keeper was missing on lay down machine post.

IncidentSummary: MISS Rhino/hand placement
IncidentDescription: While employee was pushing drill collar into lay down machine trough nearly smashed his hand on post.

IncidentSummary: MISS Rhino/sub, foot placement
IncidentDescription: Hand was picking up sub from rig floor and when picking it up it slipped almost hitting his feet.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped up on 6" pad of pumping unit with right foot while cleaning around it. As IE started to b
IncidentDescription: IE stepped up on 6" pad of pumping unit with right foot while cleaning around it. As IE started to bend over to pick up trash, a slight pain was felt in lower right side of back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after stepping up on 6" pumping unit pad and bending over to pick up trash.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing-back a 60-ft stand. Rig manager saw IE grab left calf and asked if IE was cramping u
IncidentDescription: IE was standing-back a 60-ft stand. Rig manager saw IE grab left calf and asked if IE was cramping up. He was instructed to go to the cooling trailer. After 30 minutes had passed, rig manager went to check on IE and was told left side of body and hands were cramping and IE then requested medical attention.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced possible heat exhaustion after cramping on left side of body and hands while standing-back a 60-ft stand.

IncidentSummary: IE's right eye was struck by a piece of emery cloth on Wednesday, August 6th. A fellow employee was
IncidentDescription: IE's right eye was struck by a piece of emery cloth on Wednesday, August 6th. A fellow employee was cleaning out a switch sub when small piece of emery cloth broke loose and hit IE's right eye. IE stated that he was not wearing safety glasses at the time due to sweat in his eyes. IE reported the incident to manager, but declined medical attention. A few hours later, IE left the shop and went to a nearby emergency clinic, without informing anyone, where he was prescribed eye drops and pain medication. IE brought the clinic paperwork to his supervisor's attention on Friday, August 8th and returned to work 08-12-14.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to right eye after being struck by piece of emery cloth while standing by employee cleaning switch subs with a drill and emery cloth.

IncidentSummary: Employee was asked to assist another employee help unspool drill line from derrick and while walking
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was asked to assist another employee help unspool drill line from derrick and while walking over to help out he was walking behind HPU and rolled his ankle on a rock. He reported injury to driller and told toolpusher.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after rolling foot on rock.

IncidentSummary: Employees were in the process of making a connection. Floorhand was pulling over elevators and bails
IncidentDescription: Employees were in the process of making a connection. Floorhand was pulling over elevators and bails to latch up a stand in the mouse hole.The driller kicked out the elevators, and the employee's hand slipped and was pinched between the elevator and bails. He was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand, pinky finger, when hand was caught between elevators and bails.

IncidentSummary: Employee was cleaning up the top dog house when he grabbed a loose rag off the knowledge (?) box and
IncidentDescription: Employee was cleaning up the top dog house when he grabbed a loose rag off the knowledge (?) box and was stung by a bee in the right thumb. It began swelling immediately and IE has a known allergy to bees.
InjuryDescripti: IE was stung in the right thumb by bee while cleaning top dog house.

IncidentSummary: The crew was picking up casing to run into hole. A co-worker started to roll pipe towards IE. IE los
IncidentDescription: The crew was picking up casing to run into hole. A co-worker started to roll pipe towards IE. IE lost balance and fell off catwalk 2-3 feet to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left shoulder after losing balance and falling 2-3 feet from catwalk to ground as pipe was being rolled to him.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving pipe from pipe rack to catwalk by hand. IE had a joint on forearm for leverage to get
IncidentDescription: IE was moving pipe from pipe rack to catwalk by hand. IE had a joint on forearm for leverage to get it onto catwalk. When IE picked it up to transfer it to catwalk, it slid down and landed on his left arm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hand after being struck by pipe he was transferring to catwalk when it rolled down his arm.

IncidentSummary: The IE was changing out the butterfly valve in the pre-mix tank when his wrench slipped, causing him
IncidentDescription: The IE was changing out the butterfly valve in the pre-mix tank when his wrench slipped, causing him to strike his right index finger on one of the studs. This caused a laceration to the knuckle.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right index knuckle when wrench slipped and knuckle struck a stud.

IncidentSummary: When installing new hub on agitator, centerpiece of hub fell, striking the IE on the upper lip, caus
IncidentDescription: When installing new hub on agitator, centerpiece of hub fell, striking the IE on the upper lip, causing a small cut.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip when hub centerpiece fell, striking lip.

IncidentSummary: While going in the hole, IE was operating tongs and began to experience stomach cramps.
IncidentDescription: While going in the hole, IE was operating tongs and began to experience stomach cramps.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced stomach cramps while operating tongs while tripping in hole.

IncidentSummary: The IE was tightening swab rod clamp. After changing swab, valves and seat in #2 pump #3 pot, he wa
IncidentDescription: The IE was tightening swab rod clamp. After changing swab, valves and seat in #2 pump #3 pot, he was tightening clamp with broken bar. Standing on side of pump, socket slipped off bolt and IE lost his balance and fell, hitting the back of his head on the hopper line, knocking him out for about 3-5 seconds.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to back of head after losing balance, falling, hitting head on hopper line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/SRL
IncidentDescription: Hand had the sala line hooked around the trigger line and then hooked to himself.

IncidentSummary: The IE was helping install new rotating head. IE was installing studs in to the top of the annular
IncidentDescription: The IE was helping install new rotating head. IE was installing studs in to the top of the annular using a 24" pipe wrench. IE had had two nuts installed in the top of the stud so that he could use a wrench on it and not damage the threads. He was sitting on the catwalk that is installed around the BOP. IE was using left hand to pull wrench and had his right hand on the catwalk bracing himself and was pulling the wrench back. The wrench slipped off the nut, striking the IE on right little finger, causing a laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right little finger when struck by wrench.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up in a confined position, IE had to stand close to the exhaust of another rig. IE beg
IncidentDescription: While rigging up in a confined position, IE had to stand close to the exhaust of another rig. IE began to feel dizzy and stated that it was due to inhaling the exhaust of the other rig.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Hand was swinging a hammer tightening up the flare line when he missed the wing, and his hammer bounced 
awkwardly back at him nearly hitting his leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Stairs, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription:
While running tie back Employee was going upstairs of catwalk to retrieve thread protectors. Employee slipped on stairs 
nearly falling. Employee was able to grab hand rail and catch himself.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/3P, hose, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand was walking around rig floor, stumbled over his hydraulic hoses and nearly fell to the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/sub, hand placement
IncidentDescription: Team member attempted to pick up lifting sub by hand and almost pinched finger when it slipped out of his hands.

IncidentSummary: IE and another employee were using a T-bar in the elevators. Realized they should have been using th
IncidentDescription: IE and another employee were using a T-bar in the elevators. Realized they should have been using the chain instead of the T-bar because it was not certified for use. IE ran chain over the top of blocks to hang sheave wheel. While swinging chain over, the loop end came around and struck IE on the lower lip.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lower lip after being struck by chain as it was being swung over top of blocks to hang sheave wheel.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/improper use of bucket
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking back by the top driver generators when he saw roustabouts standing on a bucket with boards to reach something.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription:
Hand bent down after stabbing pipe to pick tail rope up and didn't pay attention to ST-80 coming in and nearly hit his 
head.

IncidentSummary: MISS Linn/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While the floorhand was attempting to stab a joint of pipe in the mousehole, he slipped on the racking floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/tongs slipped
IncidentDescription: While pulling the wear bushing, the chain tongs slipped and employee slipped and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/latching pipe
IncidentDescription:
While tripping out of hole, floor hand only half latched pipe as driller picked up. Driller immediately stopped and came 
down to re latch pipe before continuing to pull up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/foot placement, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription:
While tripping into hole floor hand was having a hard time with his new boots slipping on the rig floor, nearly falling 
tailing in every pipe.

IncidentSummary: During rig-up operations, IE was standing on the ground next to the rig carrier. IE was tightening t
IncidentDescription: During rig-up operations, IE was standing on the ground next to the rig carrier. IE was tightening the guy lines on the front end of the carrier. As the IE looked up to see the slack on the line, the sun blocked the view. IE struck the back of his right hand against the metal framing on the carrier as it was raised to block the sun.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right hand after striking against the metal framing on the carrier as hand was raised to block sun.

IncidentSummary: Crew were connecting onto the 2nd well, 4-H, to release any trapped pressure before nippling down BO
IncidentDescription: Crew were connecting onto the 2nd well, 4-H, to release any trapped pressure before nippling down BOP's from 1st well, 3-H. Working together while one member was making connection, something flew into left eye of IE.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced foreign body in eye while instructing rig hands.

IncidentSummary: After checking pressure on well head, employees were hooking up pump lines. While holding chicksan t
IncidentDescription: After checking pressure on well head, employees were hooking up pump lines. While holding chicksan to pump swedge, the chick joint turned in IE's hand that was on the chick joint for test and inspection, cutting through IE's impact glove and lightly cutting right thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained light laceration/cut to left thumb through impact glove when band that was on chicksan joint sliced through glove.

IncidentSummary: While racking back pipe in derrick, IE was on the ground assisting and slipped, falling into cellar.
IncidentDescription: While racking back pipe in derrick, IE was on the ground assisting and slipped, falling into cellar.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained sprain to right ankle after slipping and falling into cellar while racking pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS stack tool
IncidentDescription:
After calibrating the stack tool at 600' down-hole, I was about to run to bottom with my tool when I noticed the tool 
pusher was caught up in the bottom sheave. He had taken the bottom tugger off the sheave, without our knowledge, 
to perform some task. Had I proceeded down-hole, I would have chopped his hand off. Tool 
pusher had no safety glasses or impact gloves.

IncidentSummary: During lay-down tubing operation after joint was unlatched, it slid off catwalk striking IE. IE was
IncidentDescription: During lay-down tubing operation after joint was unlatched, it slid off catwalk striking IE. IE was knocked off catwalk and hit tubing and pipe rack. Not really sure what body part was injured, possibly his back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lower back after being struck by joint, falling off catwalk and striking tubing and pipe rack.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS CBL/sheave chain
IncidentDescription:
Pavel Matruhan grabbed CBL from underneath and got hand pinched between tool and bottom sheave chain. Bottom sheave was rigged up at bottom of beaver slide. 
No pinch was detected until a few seconds after event when Pavel was observed shaking hand and holding it. No impact gloves were being worn, just cotton.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/elevators, schafe
IncidentDescription: Hands were laying down BHA when hand nearly watched elevators before schafe was all the way up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/unsecured light
IncidentDescription: While tripping out, Derrick hand noticed the light from across the board was hanging by one clamp.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/cable overlap, spool
IncidentDescription: Employee was lifting elevators with tugger when he realized the cable was starting to overlap on the spool.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slips, foot placement
IncidentDescription:
Employees were making connection on rig floor when slips nearly fell on an employee's foot after pulling them from the 
stand in the mouse hole because they were left upright.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slips
IncidentDescription: While making strands and switching from 4in to 5in strands hand forgot to tip slips over when not in use.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Manlift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was in manlift and seen a bolt loose.

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying back drill line because load was close to 60,000 lbs. The operator stopped the block
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying back drill line because load was close to 60,000 lbs. The operator stopped the blocks when the pipe collar and elevator had approximately a 1-inch gap. IE stated drill line was tight on drum. Operator communicated that he was going to pick up on blocks. The IE's fingers were on drill line checking for broken strands. IE's glove got snagged on drill line and fingers were pinched between drill line and the drum.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to right middle and index finger when glove snagged on drill line. Fingers were caught between drill line and the drum while he was checking for broken strands as the operator was picking up on the blocks.

IncidentSummary: IE and derrick man were moving a couple of joints from pipe racks onto catwalk. IE's hand and finger
IncidentDescription: IE and derrick man were moving a couple of joints from pipe racks onto catwalk. IE's hand and finger were pinched between two joints.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left middle finger when it became pinched between 2 points of pipe while moving them from pipe rack to catwalk.

IncidentSummary: IE was cutting boxes with a razor blade and cut tip of left index finger.
IncidentDescription: IE was cutting boxes with a razor blade and cut tip of left index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left index finger while using a razor to cut boxes.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P water truck H2S leak
IncidentDescription:
During job, our employee's H2S monitor started going off. Dylan immediately notified other workers to get off location. He noticed the water truck 
driver was unaware of the H2S gas coming from his truck when he brought the water over from a disposal well. Both our employees got driver out of area until 
gas was clear.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling triple rods (PA)
IncidentDescription:
Rig 59 running 1" rods in hole. Derrick hand picked up triple 1" rod for makeup. When he slacked off, triple rods came out of birdie. Safety ring failed to 
drop down 
due to paraffin buildup on birdie. Triple fell to ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Putting back fogheader the #2 mud pump changing swab rig hand swinging sledge hammer missed target almost lost 
hammer.

IncidentSummary: The driller and IE grabbed a 3-1/2 inch pipe joint out of basket and started carrying it to catwalk
IncidentDescription: The driller and IE grabbed a 3-1/2 inch pipe joint out of basket and started carrying it to catwalk to make it up to top of o/s. As IE was walking, he fell into a 2' cellar and scratched his arm. It was raining at the time and the location was flooded.
