InjuryDescripti: Sustained small laceration to left arm after falling 2' into cellar while walking with a 3-1/2" pipe joint.

IncidentSummary: While IE was changing out liner on pump, he was feeling hot and was cramping up so he went to the co
IncidentDescription: While IE was changing out liner on pump, he was feeling hot and was cramping up so he went to the cooling trailer to cool off. His cramping would not stop so he sat in cooling trailer for two hours until he got off work.
InjuryDescripti: Became overheated while changing out liner on pump.

IncidentSummary: Crew was trying to hook up vibrator hose on mud pump and dropped vibrator hose about 4 inches on his
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Crew was trying to hook up vibrator hose on mud pump and dropped vibrator hose about 4 inches on his foot and came to report it to the rig manager.
InjuryDescripti: Right ankle strain when vibrator hose fell on foot.

IncidentSummary: Crew was pulling tubing. Water came out of tubing and onto IE's right arm.
IncidentDescription: Crew was pulling tubing. Water came out of tubing and onto IE's right arm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to right arm after making contact with fluids from tubing .

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/tongs, pin
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While trying to break out over torqued drill pipe due to down hole torque. Tongs broke on make up side at the latch 
and 1 pin broke also 1 pin on break out tong.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/tail rope
IncidentDescription: Tail rope broke while tailing stand to the stump.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/oil base mud on floor
IncidentDescription: Tripping pipe in oil base mud (OBM). The mud would cover the floor around the rotary table, making the floor slippery.

IncidentSummary: While pulling slips, employee's foot slipped a little causing him to feel pain in his lower back.
IncidentDescription: While pulling slips, employee's foot slipped a little causing him to feel pain in his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back strain while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: Spotting 15% HCl down well. Began pumping acid and operator on pump truck accidentally opened wrong
IncidentDescription: Spotting 15% HCl down well. Began pumping acid and operator on pump truck accidentally opened wrong valve. IE was standing behind truck and come in contact with acid.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced mild irritation on body after coming in contact with 15% HCl when operator on pump truck opened wrong valve.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hammer handle broke.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, tie-off
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand cleaning rig on 2nd level with no fall protection.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/PPE
IncidentDescription: Tripping in hole: floor hand using tail rope, lost one stand using muddy gloves.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/safety keepers
IncidentDescription: Hand spotted that there were no safety keepers in lay down truck backet shives just after rigging.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/chain tongs
IncidentDescription: Chain tongs were hanging off the hand rail with the possibility  of falling down and hitting someone on the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/air hoist
IncidentDescription:
Hands were bringing a pipe into V-door and air hoist operator saw that the air hoist line got caught behind a beam in 
derrick.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/pipe spinners
IncidentDescription:
Hands were tripping in hole and Hand A was stabbing pipe in to stump when Hand B lost control of pipe spinners 
coming toward Hand A.

IncidentSummary: The crew was rigging up rig floor onto the rig. IE was placing one of the catlines on the rig to kee
IncidentDescription: The crew was rigging up rig floor onto the rig. IE was placing one of the catlines on the rig to keep rig floor from coming down while another catline was raising rig floor. While operation was being conducted, IE did not realize he had placed left hand between catline and rig floor. When driller put a bind on the catline, IE's left thumb was caught between rig floor and catline. IE yelled to the driller to stop, and driller slacked off catline that was holding rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to left thumb after it was caught between catline and rig floor as the rig floor was being raised.

IncidentSummary: Jerry Lester complained of nausea and blurred vision. He was sent to cool off, but this did not help
IncidentDescription: Jerry Lester complained of nausea and blurred vision. He was sent to cool off, but this did not help. He was taken to the doctor where he explained that he had just visited his personal doctor for his annual check-up, and today was his first day back on duty. He was also complaining of mild discomfort in the upper abdominal area and admitted he suffers from indigestion for which he takes medication. Dr. Basped's diagnosis was gastroenteritis and that it was not work related. He was advised to see a GI specialist and was allowed to return back to work.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced nausea and blurry vision while working at the yard. It was determined to be a non-work related issue by the doctor. A claim was filed with Travelers by an attorney for negligence and wrongful termination. Employee had NOT been terminated. He is currently on leave and had a re-repair of a hernia in August, according to the Travelers adjuster. His hire date was 06/26/2014.

IncidentSummary: Jewel had driven the forklift over to mud tanks and tilted the forks all the way back to put a chain
IncidentDescription: Jewel had driven the forklift over to mud tanks and tilted the forks all the way back to put a chain on the tanks to pick up the mud tanks. He had thrown the forks over the rack of the forks to tie the tanks off with the chain. He left the forklift to go talk to the tool pusher to make sure it was done the way he wanted. While he was gone, the hydraulics bled off the forks causing them to fall down and strike the IE on the right arm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right arm after being struck by forklift forks after the hydraulics bled off causing them to fall.

IncidentSummary: Louis Fernandez was operating the forklift unloading pumps off a truck. He informed floor hand, John
IncidentDescription: Louis Fernandez was operating the forklift unloading pumps off a truck. He informed floor hand, Johnny Keller, that he was feeling weak and dizzy. He was instructed to go to the cooling trailer. Rig Supervisor, Gilbert Keller, noticed that Louis was not talking normally and notified the Pioneer Safety Department. Safety Manager, Eddie Vela spoke with him and Louis told him he was not cramping. Louis also told him he had only 1.5 hours of sleep the night before. Fifteen minutes later Louis stopped answering questions he was being asked, and the decision was made to take him to the doctor.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced dizziness while operating forklift. This was determined to be a personal issue. He was diagnosed with Wolf-Parkinson-White Syndrome which showed up on the EKG done at the hospital. He was advised to see a cardiologist. He used his personal insurance for this visit.

IncidentSummary: IE and Richard Morgan were lifting the ladder to the floor. IE lost his grip, and his forearm was cu
IncidentDescription: IE and Richard Morgan were lifting the ladder to the floor. IE lost his grip, and his forearm was cut as the ladder slid down.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right forearm when the ladder he was lifting slid down his arm after he lost grip.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/bails, body placement
IncidentDescription: Hand was guiding bails onto catwalk and the bails slid back towards hand's foot nearly hitting him.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/slip(s) placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost had slips fall over on his leg

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/near-fall slip
IncidentDescription: Employee slipped pushing pipe almost mashed hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/slip(s) placement
IncidentDescription: While employee was walking across the floor to help push the pipe back, he tripped with the slip handle.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/near-fall slip
IncidentDescription: While employee was pulling on the slip handle his boot slipped causing him to almost fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/hose
IncidentDescription:
While crew member was walking down stairs he nearly hit his face on 1" hose with hammer union on the end of it that 
was hanging down from rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Employee was taking inventory of all PPE boxes on rig; he reached into the PPE box that is located i
IncidentDescription: Employee was taking inventory of all PPE boxes on rig; he reached into the PPE box that is located in the hopper house with his right hand. Employee was not aware there was an open box cutter in the PPE box. When he reached into the box the blade caused a laceration on the tip of his right thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thumb from exposed blade in PPE box.

IncidentSummary: IE was setting down the lubricator on a trailer when he slipped on some grease on the ground and fel
IncidentDescription: IE was setting down the lubricator on a trailer when he slipped on some grease on the ground and fell forward onto the lubricator hitting his hard helmet. Hard helmet came down on his face scratching the top part of his eyelid.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained small scratch to top of eyelid after slipping in grease and striking hard helmet on lubricator being loaded onto trailer.

IncidentSummary: Employee was helping set generator house; he was at end of house hooking up fuel lines and stepped w
IncidentDescription: Employee was helping set generator house; he was at end of house hooking up fuel lines and stepped wrong and rolled his ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after stepping down while setting down generator house.

IncidentSummary: IE and 2 others were unloading transport pig from a wood crate. As they rolled it over to get the pi
IncidentDescription: IE and 2 others were unloading transport pig from a wood crate. As they rolled it over to get the pig out, the pig rolled out of the crate and onto the top part of IE's right foot, just above steel toe.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained bruise/contusion to top of right foot after being struck by new density pig being unloaded from shipping carton.

IncidentSummary: Employee was putting PVC dump lines 10" PVC together for cuttings dump line. Had it picked up with f
IncidentDescription: Employee was putting PVC dump lines 10" PVC together for cuttings dump line. Had it picked up with forklift in middle with strap and a hand on each end. IE was on the end to put together with another piece of PVC on ground. As the PVC got close to the other on ground. He slipped and made pipe move and caught his finger between PVC pipe and ground resulting in a small cut on inside middle right finger.
InjuryDescripti: small cut to middle right finger after being caught between PVC pipe and ground.

IncidentSummary: After checking oil on rig, IE was stepping off carrier and slipped on steps and strained right ankle
IncidentDescription: After checking oil on rig, IE was stepping off carrier and slipped on steps and strained right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle after slipping and falling while exiting carrier steps after checking oil.

IncidentSummary: IE complained of cramping in hands and legs.
IncidentDescription: IE complained of cramping in hands and legs.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping in legs and hands while working in the heat.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: After taking two steps up stairs to catwalk, weld broke on angle iron holding stairs up. Steps came
IncidentDescription: After taking two steps up stairs to catwalk, weld broke on angle iron holding stairs up. Steps came down to ground causing IE to hyper-extend his left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left knee when weld broke on stairs being climbed to catwalk, resulting in fall to ground.

IncidentSummary: Crew was slipping the drill line. They had just cut off old section of drill line when part of it hu
IncidentDescription: Crew was slipping the drill line. They had just cut off old section of drill line when part of it hung in the cutter. IE pulled it out of the cutter and it popped up and hit him in the lip.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to lip after being struck by drill line when it popped up while pulling it out of the cutter.

IncidentSummary: IE and Eric locked out the transfer pump to unpack and repair the pump. After LOTO they removed the
IncidentDescription: IE and Eric locked out the transfer pump to unpack and repair the pump. After LOTO they removed the guards and broke free the pump shaft with the pipe wrench he removed the tools and LOTO. Eric stayed int he pump shed while IE went to the MCC to turn on and test the pump. Using radios they determined that the on/off switch was not working in the pump room but the on/off switch in the MCC worked and for a short period of time and then tripped. IE turned the switch in the MCC back to the off position but failed to LOTO the pump. Returning to the pump room, IE turned the pump over by placing his hand on the belt and pulling it to see if it was free. At this time, Eric was wiggling the off switch allowing whatever was stuck to free up kicking the pump on and pulling IE's hand through the belt pulley.
InjuryDescripti: Amputation to left pinky finger as well as multiple lacerations to the fingers, hand, and elbow of the left arm from contact with machinery.

IncidentSummary: IE was racking back a stand. As IE was unlatching stand from elevator it slipped and was falling bac
IncidentDescription: IE was racking back a stand. As IE was unlatching stand from elevator it slipped and was falling back towards block. As the IE reached to grab stand, right wrist was strained when the block hit top of stand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right wrist after block hit top of stand while reaching in to grab stand as it fell back towards block.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on a barge for a cement job and was pulling buckets of water out of the bayou repetit
IncidentDescription: IE was working on a barge for a cement job and was pulling buckets of water out of the bayou repetitively throughout the work day. The following morning, IE felt discomfort across lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after pulling buckets of water out of the bayou throughout the day for a cement job.

IncidentSummary: While driving east on Hwy 80 at 6:30 AM on way to the office; IE's vehicle was struck from behind by
IncidentDescription: While driving east on Hwy 80 at 6:30 AM on way to the office; IE's vehicle was struck from behind by another vehicle and then pushed into the vehicle in front of his. IE was knocked unconscious with the initial impact and awoke in the ER of Midland Memorial with a severe laceration to the head (with trauma) -- the back of the head and neck. IE has no recollection of events before or after the collision.
InjuryDescripti: Multiple traumatic injuries as the result of a motor vehicle accident.

IncidentSummary: IE was picking up 2-7/8" tubing and placing on rig floor. Tail-end of pipe fell of catwalk, causing
IncidentDescription: IE was picking up 2-7/8" tubing and placing on rig floor. Tail-end of pipe fell of catwalk, causing IE to lose balance and fall with tubing.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to torso after losing balance and falling with tail-end of pipe as it fell off catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While working on rig floor, crew was running tubing in the hole. IE inserted tubing drift into pipe
IncidentDescription: While working on rig floor, crew was running tubing in the hole. IE inserted tubing drift into pipe at the same time as lay-down operator moved tubing forward, catching IE's left hand between the drift and the tongs. IE was wearing impact gloves at the time of the incident.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hand after it was caught between tubing drift and the tongs when it was inserted into pipe at the same time lay-down operator was moving the tubing forward.

IncidentSummary: While working on #1 pump changing swab, rig manager noticed the employee wasn't looking very good. H
IncidentDescription: While working on #1 pump changing swab, rig manager noticed the employee wasn't looking very good. He told the IE to get water and noticed him stumbling away. Immediately pulled him aside and asked if he was OK. He said he felt dizzy and felt like he was going to fall down. Rig manager took him to the cooling station.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat stress while changing out swab in mud pump area.

IncidentSummary: Prior to start of the job, the rig supervisor noticed the IE did not look well. IE was placed in the
IncidentDescription: Prior to start of the job, the rig supervisor noticed the IE did not look well. IE was placed in the cooling trailer until a replacement was available. Around 11:00 AM the company man stated that the IE was throwing up.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced possible heat exhaustion prior to the start of the job.

IncidentSummary: While laying down pipe, the crew was using the tongs due to the pipe being torqued up due to tight h
IncidentDescription: While laying down pipe, the crew was using the tongs due to the pipe being torqued up due to tight hole, (the ST-80) would not break it). The IE was standing on the drillers side of the rotary table. As he was pushing the tongs away from pipe, his right foot was slowly slipping towards the rotary table due to rain and slippery conditions. His right foot was caught in the gap between handles on slips while the driller was spinning out the pipe, causing his foot to be twisted.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right ankle when caught in the gap between handles on slips.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: R/U Kelly hose to Tbg. Open TIW valve to pump manifold. Operator was closing Csg valve on manifold.
IncidentDescription: R/U Kelly hose to Tbg. Open TIW valve to pump manifold. Operator was closing Csg valve on manifold. Floor hand cracked Tbg valve open on manifold. Csg valve was not shut all the way and blew gas down Csg line. When hose blew around, it struck IE on right calf.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right calf after being struck by Kelly hose after gas blew hose off due to Csg valve not being totally shut when Tgb valve was opened on manifold.

IncidentSummary: MISS snubbing crew rigging down (MS)
IncidentDescription: Snubbing crew hand backed into winch handle while rigging down and made the winch go up to the tubing board and pull it down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/muddy floor
IncidentDescription: Hand was tailing pipe with rope and slipped on muddy floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/climbing without harness
IncidentDescription: Water haulers were filling frac tanks and starting climbing up without a harness.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ST-80 not shut off
IncidentDescription:
Working on the ST-80, changing the dyes on the top rollers and the ST-80 was not turned off to operate it, could have 
gotten stuck in it.

IncidentSummary: IE and crew were loading supplies into a pickup truck. While attempting to pick up a set of slips, s
IncidentDescription: IE and crew were loading supplies into a pickup truck. While attempting to pick up a set of slips, something pulled in the lower back area.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while picking up slips and loading them in the back of a pickup.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/keeper
IncidentDescription: While on the floor tripping pipe, a small keeper landed next to motorman,nearly hitting him.

IncidentSummary: The IE was weighing mud on top of mud tanks when an insect flew into his right ear.
IncidentDescription: The IE was weighing mud on top of mud tanks when an insect flew into his right ear.
InjuryDescripti: Insect flew into right ear

IncidentSummary: While loading pipe rack boards on beam, hand dropped board on IE's left ring and middle finger.
IncidentDescription: While loading pipe rack boards on beam, hand dropped board on IE's left ring and middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left middle and ring fingers after being struck by pipe rack board another employee dropped while loading boards onto beam.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/jumped on catwalk
IncidentDescription: While lowering cement head down beaver slide when a cementer jumped on the catwalk, in harm's way.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pump cap, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While looking for pump parts, derrickhand tripped over a pump cap and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: IE was at the well site putting on blue surgical gloves to begin cleaning tools. IE was in a hurry a
IncidentDescription: IE was at the well site putting on blue surgical gloves to begin cleaning tools. IE was in a hurry and was putting the glove on too quickly, catching right pinky finger in glove.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced dislocation of right pinky finger after it was caught in blue surgical glove as it was being put on.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/unsafe body placement
IncidentDescription: Roustabout was standing between pipe while the forklift operator was bringing in more pipe to the pipe racks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loader, unsafe body placement
IncidentDescription: Roustabout walked behind the loader while I was back digging.

IncidentSummary: The crew bled off the well and shut in the backside. Hooked up the hot oiler to the tubing to pump f
IncidentDescription: The crew bled off the well and shut in the backside. Hooked up the hot oiler to the tubing to pump fresh water down the tubing and started the rig. IE was told by the operator to start prepping the rods. IE was taking the thread protectors off with an electric impact wrench. The IE was prepping rods for approximately 5-10 minutes when a flash fire ignited at the vicinity of the riser for the fresh water line. The riser is approximately 3-4 feet from the well head and the IE was approximately 1-2 feet from the riser. The flash fire lasted approximately 5 seconds and resulted in burning the IE in multiple areas of the body. Immediately transported to the McKenzie County Healthcare Systems ER in Watford City, ND.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained burns to both hands and fingers, forearms, face, both ears, and left thigh when a flash fire ignited at the vicinity of the riser for the fresh water line, as an electric impact wrench was being used to remove thread protectors.

IncidentSummary: The crew bled off the well, shut in the backside and hooked up the hot oiler to the tubing to pump f
IncidentDescription: The crew bled off the well, shut in the backside and hooked up the hot oiler to the tubing to pump fresh water down the tubing. The crew started the rig. IE was leveling out the back operator side rig pad for the rig. The IE saw a bright flash and felt heat on the right side of his face. The IE immediately ran away from the well head and rolled on the ground. He then ran to the rig cab and shut off the rig. The company consultant brought him to the doghouse and put a wet rag on his face.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a burn to right side of face after flash fire while leveling out the back operator side rig pad for the rig

IncidentSummary: IE was walking on the suitcase by the mud pumps. As he stopped off suitcase onto a small step, he s
IncidentDescription: IE was walking on the suitcase by the mud pumps. As he stopped off suitcase onto a small step, he stopped too close to the edge of the small step, causing the small step to roll, hurting his right foot. (The only way Rig manager found out was that he saw IE limping and asked him what happened.)
InjuryDescripti: Strain to bottom of right foot when stepping too close to edge of small step, and small step rolled.

IncidentSummary: The crew had been laying down tubulars all day. IE was on the ground walking them out and laying the
IncidentDescription: The crew had been laying down tubulars all day. IE was on the ground walking them out and laying them on the pipe racks. Did not complain of soreness at the end of the day but felt sore and tight upon waking the next morning.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced soreness and tightness in lower back the following morning after laying down tubulars the previous day.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Crew was cutting 2-inch pipe in yard with a torch. All cut pieces of pipe were being picked up and p
IncidentDescription: Crew was cutting 2-inch pipe in yard with a torch. All cut pieces of pipe were being picked up and placed in a trailer. IE picked up one piece of pipe that was still hot and burned the palm of left hand. IE did not have proper PPE gloves on, which was covered in JSA.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained burn to palm of left hand while loading pipe on trailer and picking up a piece of pipe that was still hot after being cut. Not wearing PPE gloves.

IncidentSummary: IE was biting up nut on the flow cross valve. The hammer wrench slipped off and finger was caught be
IncidentDescription: IE was biting up nut on the flow cross valve. The hammer wrench slipped off and finger was caught between the handle and the flange.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right ring finger when hammer wrench slipped and finger was caught between handle and flange.

IncidentSummary: Rig crew had made up Kelly hose onto 3rd party swivel. Crew got about 12-feet in the air when the un
IncidentDescription: Rig crew had made up Kelly hose onto 3rd party swivel. Crew got about 12-feet in the air when the union on the swedge pulled out. The Kelly hose fell and struck the IE.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right arm when struck by falling Kelly hose after union on the swedge pulled out about 12-feet in the air.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/casing tongs, pipe
IncidentDescription:
Employee was hoisting up casing tongs and when it got to the rig floor, the casing hand went to grab them and was 
almost caught in between casing tongs and pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slips
IncidentDescription: Hand forgot to tip slips over after they were done using them.

IncidentSummary: While checking the fuel on the rig, IE was stung by an insect near his left armpit.
IncidentDescription: While checking the fuel on the rig, IE was stung by an insect near his left armpit.
InjuryDescripti: Noticed insect bite/sting near armpit on left arm while checking fuel on rig.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Floor line leaking
IncidentDescription: While reaming, employee saw that the floor line was leaking.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Bushing puller, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking to hydraulic hoist and tripped on bushing pullers and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/valve, hand placement
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While putting valve back together, inexperienced hand put fingers in pinch point.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/collar clamp, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employees were on rig floor making connection when one nearly tripped due to a collar clamp laying in the work area.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loader, obstructed view
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand was moving wind wall with loader and has obstructed vision.

IncidentSummary: Crew was running tubing in the hole. They were picking up tubing off the pipe racks using a hydrauli
IncidentDescription: Crew was running tubing in the hole. They were picking up tubing off the pipe racks using a hydraulic catwalk. The floor hand latched onto a joint and while he was making the connection, the hydraulic catwalk operator was moving the next joint into position to be picked up. The IE was standing between the joint being raised by the hydraulic catwalk and the tongs. As the joint was being moved into position by the operator, the IE was caught between the joint being moved and the tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to both hips after being caught between the joint being moved into position by the hydraulic catwalk and the tongs.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was re-building a #10 Baker setting tool. IE was sliding the piston into the barrel and bounced t
IncidentDescription: IE was re-building a #10 Baker setting tool. IE was sliding the piston into the barrel and bounced the piston off the table. The piston slid up, and something pinched his palm. IE's palm was cut slightly and started to bleed. IE was NOT wearing any type of hand protection.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to palm of left hand when pinched by "something" when the piston bounced off the table as it was being slid into the barrel of a #10 Baker setting tool being re-built.

IncidentSummary: MISS Stephens/drill line
IncidentDescription: While tripping in hole derrickhand noticed a bad spot in drill line.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling back 2-3/8" tubing on the catwalk. While walking in the middle section, IE slipped an
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling back 2-3/8" tubing on the catwalk. While walking in the middle section, IE slipped and rolled his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced some discomfort to right ankle after slipping and rolling ankle in the middle section of catwalk while pulling tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Crew was installing wellhead using 2 cheater pipes stacked for leverage. Three workers were using ch
IncidentDescription: Crew was installing wellhead using 2 cheater pipes stacked for leverage. Three workers were using cheaters, two pushing and one pulling. IE was pulling and lost balance falling backwards on stabbing mat for tubing.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained closed fracture to lower back after losing balance while pulling on cheater pipes as wellhead was being installed.

IncidentSummary: Driver was lining up to hook up a trailer and was not quite lined up correctly. As the IE tried to p
IncidentDescription: Driver was lining up to hook up a trailer and was not quite lined up correctly. As the IE tried to push the trailer by hand, the trailer fell over the ball and caught his left index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to left index finger after becoming caught when trailer being manually readjusted fell over ball.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling a 2-1/8" perforating gun from under the perforator. He pulled out the first one and l
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling a 2-1/8" perforating gun from under the perforator. He pulled out the first one and loaded it in the trailer. He then grabbed the second one and had it 3/4 of the way out from under the perforator when the gun slipped out of IE's hand and dropped on left foot. Proceeded to finish unloading barge and called Jimmy Pachall on the ride home.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left foot after being struck by perforating gun when it slipped out of hand as it was being loaded onto trailer.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down the derrick, IE was watching the guy lines when a bug flew into his left ear.
IncidentDescription: While rigging down the derrick, IE was watching the guy lines when a bug flew into his left ear.
InjuryDescripti: While watching guy lines while rigging down, but flew into left ear.

IncidentSummary: MISS fatigued driving
IncidentDescription:
After working fourteen hours on a pump-down, Cameron drove pickup back to the shop, which was about one hour away. Four miles away from the shop, he fell asleep and 
drove off into the ditch, hitting a reflector post on the side of the highway and damaging the truck. When he woke up, he was able to correct the vehicle and drive it back 
onto the interstate, with no further damage.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, loose hose, oil spill
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While 3rd party was pumping the used oil out of the oil drums into his tank the hose came loose and spilled some oil on 
the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/PPE
IncidentDescription: While working on the shower in the bunk house a hand was not wearing his safety glasses.

IncidentSummary: MISS/Apache forklift, pipes
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While moving drill pipe with forklift the pipe slid off the forks almost striking a 3rd party hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/body placement
IncidentDescription: Observed a hand being unaware and positioned himself in a crush point.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/diesel fuel spill
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While filling the forklift the shutoff handle failed to shut off causing a small spill of diesel.

IncidentSummary: MISS Linn/dog knot
IncidentDescription: After slip and cut, employee noticed the dog knot on the drill line had slid back and fell out of position.

IncidentSummary: MISS Linn/water hose, trip hazard
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Water hose was rolled up on the walk way between pumps trip hazard.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/gloves
IncidentDescription: Hammer slipped wet gloves oil based.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/winch controls
IncidentDescription: Hand moved a line and the controls for the winches fell and almost hit him.

IncidentSummary: IE cut his right index finger with a pocket knife while trying to cut a rag.
IncidentDescription: IE cut his right index finger with a pocket knife while trying to cut a rag.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right index finger while cutting a rag with a pocket knife.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/rig floor, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand slipped and almost fell on the rig floor due to wet floor and oil base mud.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Slip on muddy floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Was in a hurry slipped on wet stairway.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hard hat
IncidentDescription: Hand was climbing up the derrick and his hard hat fell off and almost hit another hand due to high winds.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription: Hand was making up hammer union and the hammer slipped out of his hand and almost hit his leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/unlatched elevators
IncidentDescription:
Employees were tripping pipe in the hole. Derrickman laid pipe out to latch it in the elevators; however, he did not 
latch the elevators completely. the driller proceeded to pick up the pipe off the floor without the elevators being 
completely latched.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/mat, trip hazard
IncidentDescription: While picking up pipe from V-door, floor hand almost tripped and slipped on rubber mat on racking mat.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/exposed mousehole
IncidentDescription:
While employees were making a connection, floorhand nearly stepped into an open mousehole vacated after picking up 
joint of drill pipe in mousehole with kelly.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/floor step tab, trip hazard
IncidentDescription: Driller tripped over tab on rig floor used to hold step down, step was removed for access to rotary.

IncidentSummary: MISS Linn/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Trip on stair going down to catwalk nearly falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/pipes, hand placement
IncidentDescription:
While making a connection and picking up a joint of drill pipe from the mousehole, employee was holding the pin end of 
the pipe with his hand. When the pipe came out of the mousehole, it swung in and struck the pipe in the rotary. 
Employee barely moved his hand in time to keep it from being smashed between the two pieces of pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/slips
IncidentDescription:
Employees pulled slips following a connection. They did not sit the slips on an even surface after pulling them out of the 
rotary bowl. The slips subsequently fell on their side, nearly striking an employee on the leg and foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription:
After one employee washed and cleaned the hopper area, another employee rushed through the area before the water 
had dried. Employee slipped on the wet floor and nearly fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/wrench
IncidentDescription:
Employee rode boatswains chair up to grease the travelling block. In the process of greasing the travelling block, he 
dropped a crescent wrench from his back pocket. The crescent wrench landed harmlessly on the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/water hose
IncidentDescription:
As employees were picking lift subs off rack at corner of floor with air hoist and walking them over to the rotary bowl in 
order to install them to the drill collars, employee tripped over the water hose that was stretched out along the edge of 
the floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/chisel
IncidentDescription:
Employees were using a chisel as a wedge in an attempt to remove the cathead. When the employee struck the chisel 
with a hammer, the chisel became dislodged and flew up in the air, nearly striking another employee in the face.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/hard hat
IncidentDescription:
Derrickman rode boatswains chair up to hang off traveling block. While in the air, his hardhat fell off his head and down 
to the rig floor where other employees were standing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/fast line
IncidentDescription:
Moving fast line from one water tank to the other using forklift and strap. One hand was on the forklift and other hand 
was flagging next to water tank. When fast line slipped out of tank, the fast line twisted and hit flagger. No injury 
involved.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/body placement
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe in the hole, hands on floor continuously got in driller's line of sight while stabbing pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/lift cap
IncidentDescription: Employee was reaching out to close the V-door gate, when he tripped over a lift cap in the walk way.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/elevators, link tilt
IncidentDescription:
While doing rig service noticed that the elevators were sitting crooked and investigated the problem. One side of the 
link tilt was bent went to take off the bent part of off driller side link tilt connection and replaced it with a new one.

IncidentSummary: MISS Laredo/tail rope, pipes MDM
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe in hole the pipe came off the tail rope and swung towards the floorhand almost hitting him.

IncidentSummary: IE stated that as pipe was being latched off the floor to go in the hole, the horns to latch the pip
IncidentDescription: IE stated that as pipe was being latched off the floor to go in the hole, the horns to latch the pipe hit left hand as he grabbed them.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hand after being struck by horns as pipe was being latched.

IncidentSummary: IE and another employee were maneuvering a floor plate in the catch all box and went to help him whe
IncidentDescription: IE and another employee were maneuvering a floor plate in the catch all box and went to help him when the weight shifted and caught the IE's right hand between box and plate. IE suffered a contusion to his middle and index fingers. IE refused medical treatment and first aid was given on site.
InjuryDescripti: Contusions to right index and middle fingers when caught between floor plate and catch all box.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pipe, ST-80, hand placement
IncidentDescription:
While tripping into hole, hand was tailing stand in with rope to stump. The employee dropped his rope too early and 
the stand whipped toward ST-80. This nearly caused the employee to pinch his fingers in between the stand and ST-
80.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Crossover
IncidentDescription:
While clearing floor, two hands were covering crossover with sling out v-door when sling slipped off causing crossover 
to fall onto catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription:
When driller went to pull up so hands could pull slips out of hole, the hand's foot slipped causing him to lose his balance 
and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down casing crew, the casing hand had tied the laydown truck onto tongs to pull out V-
IncidentDescription: While rigging down casing crew, the casing hand had tied the laydown truck onto tongs to pull out V-door. IE noticed that the 2" hose was caught on the tongs as it was being pulled out. IE went to get hose off tongs and was caught between drill pipe racked in derrick and swinging tongs which caused an abrasion on right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right knee when caught between drill pipe and tongs.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up joint with basket and winch line. Snubbing hand was pulling down on joint while
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up joint with basket and winch line. Snubbing hand was pulling down on joint while lifting and released pipe as IE was tailing it in. This caused a spring- action with pipe striking IE around the waist area.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to abdomen (waist) when struck by pipe as it sprung up when snubbing hand was pulling down on joint while it was being lifting, and released it as IE was tailing it in.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/elevators pin
IncidentDescription:
While tripping in hole, derrickhand noticed pin on elevators starting to jar loose. Brought elevators to the floor and 
fixed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hammer
IncidentDescription: Hammering up a two inch hammer union and hammer slipped out of cementer's hands almost hitting another hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/wrench
IncidentDescription:
After changing swab, hands unlocked pump, then did one last walk around before energizing pump and found wrench 
on bull wheel.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/truck, body placement
IncidentDescription:
We were moving the catwalk to get it were we needed it to be and a truck driver walked behind the truck when we 
were getting ready to move.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/3P, flowline
IncidentDescription:
Crane crew was rigging down flow line when the 4X4 boards broke on the one side and caused the flow line to roll. 
When it rolled, it pushed one of the crane employees out of the way. Employee had no injuries and he was o.k.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/exhaust manifold
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Truck was bob tailing a mud pump over to the middle of location to set it down for a haul truck to hole over. When the 
truck was setting the pump down, the exhaust manifold slid off the top and hit the ground.  No one was hit or nothing 
was damaged.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pin-brake band handle
IncidentDescription: Pin was coming out of brake band handle on tugger so brake could not set and may come apart.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/drill pipe, hand placement
IncidentDescription: Casing V-door hand had his hand on drill pipe when driller was kicking back elevators with top drive.

IncidentSummary: When positioning ST-80 towards mousehole to break directional tools, the IE's right hand got caught
IncidentDescription: When positioning ST-80 towards mousehole to break directional tools, the IE's right hand got caught between handle on ST-80 and a stand of drill pipe racked back in the derrick. The IE did mention he was glad he had impact gloves on at the time. He feels they helped.
InjuryDescripti: Contusions to right hand and fingers when caught between ST-80 and drill pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE and engineer in charge were using a 36" pipe wrench to remove a swedge. Swedge wouldn't budge, so
IncidentDescription: IE and engineer in charge were using a 36" pipe wrench to remove a swedge. Swedge wouldn't budge, so they put a metal cheater bar over the pipe wrench because the cheater bar only went half-way up the wrench. As they attempted to loosen the swedge, the pipe wrench broke at the exact point where the cheater bar stopped. The jaws from the pipe wrench fell off the swedge and struck IE in the left knee, causing him to fall.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left knee after being struck by the jaws of a 36" pipe wrench after it broke while using a cheater bar over it to loosen a swedge.

IncidentSummary: IE was opening a 2Gǣ 15-02 valve located on the side of the well head to equalize lubricator with the
IncidentDescription: IE was opening a 2Gǣ 15-02 valve located on the side of the well head to equalize lubricator with the well pressure. The well had about 5000 pounds on it making the valve very hard to open. IE was using the bar for the valve placed against right shoulder for leverage. Using legs to push up on the bar to get the valve open, heard a pop in right shoulder. About one hour later noticed right arm was hard to move.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced strain to right shoulder while using it for leverage to open the valve on the side of an oil well with a valve bar.

IncidentSummary: IE was climbing into the recorder cab without putting the stairs down and hit left knee on the edge
IncidentDescription: IE was climbing into the recorder cab without putting the stairs down and hit left knee on the edge of the floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to left knee after striking floor of recorder cab while climbing in without lowering stairs.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure release
IncidentDescription: While pressuring up on reel, employee was too close to iron when 1502 WECO seal did not hold, causing psi to release towards his face.

IncidentSummary: MISS high psi hose failure
IncidentDescription: While purging a reel, an N2 high psi hose that was being used blew from the inside out due to psi. The hose did not separate or cause equipment/personnel damage.

IncidentSummary: MISS BOP testing-breaking stack
IncidentDescription:
While testing BOPs and nearing the end of testing, went to get the torque crew and told them to stand-by. Instead of standing-by, they decided to try and break stack. 
When 
noticed, they were asked who told them to do this and they said that they just assumed it was ready to break. Explained that we were still testing and psi was still on.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up rig in the yard, IE tried to step across hole in floor and fell through.
IncidentDescription: While rigging up rig in the yard, IE tried to step across hole in floor and fell through.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to chest area after falling through hole in the floor while stepping across it while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: While relief crew of Rig 103 was going in the hole with 2-7/8" tubing, block struck transfer cup cab
IncidentDescription: While relief crew of Rig 103 was going in the hole with 2-7/8" tubing, block struck transfer cup cable when Operator, Juan Ibarra picked up on tubing. This resulted in lifting rod up into the air. When operator went down with the blocks, it snapped cable that was attached to the transfer cup and one 3/4" X 75' rod fell to the ground, striking IE, working on the work floor, on the right arm. Rod that fell was bent.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to right arm after being struck by falling rod after cable snapped that was attached to the transfer cup as operator went down with the blocks.

IncidentSummary: The IE was using both arms to pull slips. There was mud and water on floor due to tripping operatio
IncidentDescription: The IE was using both arms to pull slips. There was mud and water on floor due to tripping operations. While pulling slips, the IE's left foot slipped out from under him, causing him to lose footing. IE tried to keep himself from falling by not letting go of slip handles. In doing so, that caused his lower back to be strained.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after slipping on rig floor and trying to keep himself from falling.

IncidentSummary: IE was washing mud pumps with pressure washer with Opti-clean in it. He was wearing a face shield an
IncidentDescription: IE was washing mud pumps with pressure washer with Opti-clean in it. He was wearing a face shield and safety glasses when the liquid splashed in his eyes. IE went to Rig Manager's house with the driller and told rig manager and HSE Supervisor. His eyes were flushed with saline water and put eye drops from first aid cabinet. Visually looked in his eye for any kind of debris, none spotted. and looked at the MSDs on Opti-clean. While looking in his eye, saw that it was blood shot. IE took upon himself with no one aware of putting cream (Terramicina), around his eye when he got off tower at 6PM. IE does on a daily basis, when he is working, using the cream called clean and Clear.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left eye when cleaning agent splashed into eye when pressure washing.

IncidentSummary: A tubing snub was being laid down. The tubing bells bound up and when they straightened, the tubing
IncidentDescription: A tubing snub was being laid down. The tubing bells bound up and when they straightened, the tubing bells swung towards the IE and pushed him into the tubing tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to chest when pushed into tubing tongs as the tubing bells became unbound and swung over after straightening out.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS falling 2" pipe
IncidentDescription:
While pulling out of well with 2" coiled tubing pipe, the pipe came out of injector head and fell to deck. The Sparrow crane operator was walking to his crane to set in 
and start crane to unstab injector head and the pipe landed approximately 2' away from him.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/pipe, tail rope
IncidentDescription: While lifting a pipe a crew member forgot to use rope to hold the pipe in place.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure not bled off
IncidentDescription:
Rigging down pump iron and no one checked pressure on pump. Attempted to break iron and when it wouldn't break, checked gauge on pump and saw that it had 600 
psi on it. Bled off pressure and finished rigging down.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/unstable stack
IncidentDescription:
When picking up stack to nipple up hand saw that pick up line was caught up in rotating head bolt making stack 
unstable.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/PPE, gloves
IncidentDescription: Before making a connection hand was not wearing any gloves. When he was asked he said, "I can't find them."

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/PPE, face shield
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand was using the needle gun on gas buster chipping paint with no face shield.

IncidentSummary: MISS fire pump flange blowout
IncidentDescription:
While using a production fire pump to wash fluid tanks, line pipe fitting blew out from threads when closing ball valve. Flow was stopped via secondary valve and new 
flange was installed.

IncidentSummary: IE was guiding the slips from the base beam to the ground hooked on to the cat line winch. The opera
IncidentDescription: IE was guiding the slips from the base beam to the ground hooked on to the cat line winch. The operator set the slips on the ground and warned IE to watch out. At that time, the operator opened the slips and the spider portion of the slips pinched the tip of the IE's left middle finger against the slip body guard.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left middle finger when pinched by the spider portion of the slips and the slip body guard after slips were set on the ground and opened by the operator.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/kelly hose, body placement
IncidentDescription: Hand was standing in area where kelly hose descends as driller was coming down with the blocks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pressure washer hose
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Hand was pulling pressure washer hose when he encountered resistance. He pulled hose hard and it came easy, nearly 
causing him to lose balance.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/air hoist line
IncidentDescription: Hand was about to bring a pipe up the V-door and saw that the air hoist line had got between the storm bars.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/lifting eye
IncidentDescription: Finding a loose lifting eye on a drill pipe before it was lifting.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/wildlife
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Derrickhand was unwrapping salt water gel and was nearly stung by a scorpion.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription: Working on mud pump when sledge hammer slipped out of crew member's hand. No one hurt.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pressure washer wand
IncidentDescription: While washing, wand pressure locked and when released, the tip blew out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/exposed nails
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: and found board with nails in it, nails turned up. this could have punctured a tire or someone's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/slips
IncidentDescription: Hand was about to attempt to kick in the slips while tripping pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping build a setting tool. While attempting to set the floating piston in the oil chamber,
IncidentDescription: IE was helping build a setting tool. While attempting to set the floating piston in the oil chamber, IE was pushing the piston into place with a pipe wrench. It slipped and caused the IE's hand to push forward and catch the outer lip of the oil chamber.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right hand after striking against outer lip of oil chamber when wrench being used to push a piston in place slipped.

IncidentSummary: We had JSA in top dog house. The IE and the other floorhand were told to go into the cellar by the d
IncidentDescription: We had JSA in top dog house. The IE and the other floorhand were told to go into the cellar by the driller to take off the night cap. They started to break bolts and about halfway around, they started smelling gas. Then they asked the driller to go to the gas sniffer and he told us to continue work until he got back to see how much gas there was and gas levels went from 10 LEL% to 87 LEL%. At that point, he told to keep the floorhands to keep their heads away from 2" valve and to continue work. At that point, the other floorhand and IE decided to get out of cellar and once we got out, IE started feeling dizzy, light headed and nauseous. Then the Rig Manager came over to IE and helped back him to his office so he could be monitored closely. Then IE got into the drilling superintendents truck and headed to the clinic and IE started to have a hard time breathing and bad chest pains. At that point, he called 999 and an ambulance took IE to Washington, PA hospital.
InjuryDescripti: Dizzy and nauseous after smelling gas in the cellar.

IncidentSummary: While moving a light tower, one of the tires went into a rut causing an abrupt shift of the weight.
IncidentDescription: While moving a light tower, one of the tires went into a rut causing an abrupt shift of the weight. The weight shift resulted in strain to IE's back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to back while light tower being moved shifted after tire went into a rut.

IncidentSummary: After JSA, IE and other floorhand was told to go into the cellar by driller to take off night cap. T
IncidentDescription: After JSA, IE and other floorhand was told to go into the cellar by driller to take off night cap. They got all tools needed for job and climbed into the cellar. As they climbed into cellar, they smelled a little gas. They started to bust the bolts loose and when we got half way through untightening bolts, they smelled that the gas was stronger. They told the driller they smelled a lot of gas and they needed the gas sniffer. The driller told them to keep working on it while he gets the gas sniffer. When he returned with the gas sniffer, they checked to see how much gas it detected. The alarms went off on the gas detector, it ranged from 10 LEL% to 80 LEL% from what IE saw, and they told the driller. He told them to get out because of too much gas. When they got out of the cellar, IE started to get dizzy and nauseous so IE told the driller and went to tell the Rig Manager.
InjuryDescripti: Dizzy and nauseous after smelling gas in cellar.

IncidentSummary: The crew was rolling pipe from pipe rack to the catwalk when one joint of 2-3/8" tubing rolled off t
IncidentDescription: The crew was rolling pipe from pipe rack to the catwalk when one joint of 2-3/8" tubing rolled off the catwalk. IE and another employee each picked up on the ends of the tubing to lift back onto the catwalk. During the lifting of the tubing, IE stated he felt a pop in his back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while assisting in lifting tubing back onto catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was power washing underneath the substructure. When he was stepping off the matting boards, he lo
IncidentDescription: IE was power washing underneath the substructure. When he was stepping off the matting boards, he lost his footing and twisted his back trying to catch himself. He suffered a strain to his lower back but refused medical treatment. First aid was given on location.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after losing footing and trying to prevent himself from falling.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing stripper rubber from the stripper head using a hammer. IE swung the hammer to remove
IncidentDescription: IE was removing stripper rubber from the stripper head using a hammer. IE swung the hammer to remove rubber and in doing so struck right thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right thumb after being struck by hammer while removing stripper rubber from the stripper head.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ Walking down stairtower
IncidentDescription: While crew member was walking down stairs he nearly hit his face on the 1" hose with hammer union on the end of it that was hanging down from the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/stand, improper body placement
IncidentDescription: While bringing in stand from racking board hand was nearly struck by stand and smashed between stand and stamp.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/clevises
IncidentDescription: Hand noticed before putting all the weight of the power tongs on a tong line one of the clevises were sideways.

IncidentSummary: IE returned to shop from well site about 6:00 PM and started washing truck. IE stepped off the back
IncidentDescription: IE returned to shop from well site about 6:00 PM and started washing truck. IE stepped off the back of truck and slipped and fell backward. IE tried to brace fall with right arm and heard a pop in right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right arm after slipping off of back of truck being washed.

IncidentSummary: IE was digging through a tool box and sustained a laceration to the inside of his right palm.
IncidentDescription: IE was digging through a tool box and sustained a laceration to the inside of his right palm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right palm after striking against a piece of 2" tubing when reaching in tool box while putting away tools for the day.

IncidentSummary: While unscrewing lift nipple from mud motor, the driller grabbed the chain that was tied around the
IncidentDescription: While unscrewing lift nipple from mud motor, the driller grabbed the chain that was tied around the lift nipple and forklift to pull it out of the box end of the mud motor. The chain came off the lift nipple along with a chain tong falling to the ground. The chain tongs struck the IE on top of his right foot just behind the steel toe. The IE's right foot swelled up once his boot was removed.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of right foot when chain tongs fell on foot.

IncidentSummary: The IE was being fire watch for welder that was doing modifications to handrails to make them correc
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: The IE was being fire watch for welder that was doing modifications to handrails to make them correct height. While welder was making a cut with grinder (cut off disk) it became lodged and came apart. The IE was standing on the opposite side of truck and a small piece of disk struck him on top lip.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to top lip when struck by a small piece of a disk.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped tool string
IncidentDescription:
While working at night on a plug shoot, the crew was getting ready to lift up the next tool string. Due to the long tool string, they only had about one foot of space between 
the top of the lubricator and the crane anti-tube locks. They thought they were up high enough and as they were picking up the next tool, it caught on the 10-02 and caused 
the tool to pull off the wireline and land on the ground. They were not using a tool guide. The tool did not hit anything.

IncidentSummary: Let pressure off setting tool using the tool for bleed off. When no pressure seemed to be coming out
IncidentDescription: Let pressure off setting tool using the tool for bleed off. When no pressure seemed to be coming out, IE proceeded to take tool out. Upon reaching the last thread, it popped out and sprayed under safety glasses into eyes.
InjuryDescripti: Debris sprayed under safety glasses and into eyes as setting tool popped out after all pressure was assumed to have been released.

IncidentSummary: IE was lifting a set of mechanical jars off the catwalk and dropped one end on the ground and then w
IncidentDescription: IE was lifting a set of mechanical jars off the catwalk and dropped one end on the ground and then went to close them and smashed left thumb in the jars.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb after smashing it in the jars while closing them.

IncidentSummary: Crane was setting well head on lube trailer and IE's finger on left hand was caught between night ca
IncidentDescription: Crane was setting well head on lube trailer and IE's finger on left hand was caught between night cap and well head. IE was not wearing gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to finger on left hand after being caught between night cap and well head while crane was setting it on trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/oxygen leak
IncidentDescription:
While hand cleaning sub, noticed a sudden strong odor - He left the sub and notified crew on radio he was going for 
gas detector. When he returned it was found that the Oxygen level was down to 15% which caused the alarm to go 
off. Investigation found that fluid from the suction tank had oxygen Scavenger in it and was used to fill the trip tank. 
When circulated across the top of the hole the scavenger broke out and settled in the sub.

IncidentSummary: While making up bit to motor, employees had both tongs on bit to make it up. The IE put some bind on
IncidentDescription: While making up bit to motor, employees had both tongs on bit to make it up. The IE put some bind on both tongs and had employees move off rig floor while he torqued it up from the driller's console. As he began torquing up bit, the make up side tongs came open, causing them to swing towards the IE, pinning his right ankle between tongs and chain guide pole.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right ankle when it was caught between tongs and chain guide pole.

IncidentSummary: While lifting casing tongs to rig floor through V-door, tongs got hung up at top of V-door. Employee
IncidentDescription: While lifting casing tongs to rig floor through V-door, tongs got hung up at top of V-door. Employees were forcing tongs to come loose and IE used his right foot to push out tongs and had left foot pushing off the lay down flag pole. When tongs came loose, they swung around toward IE's left foot, smashing it against pole.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot when tongs came loose, swung around and hit foot.

IncidentSummary: CSG mud line was hooked up to right side suction on mud pump. CSG valve was opened and CSG side of m
IncidentDescription: CSG mud line was hooked up to right side suction on mud pump. CSG valve was opened and CSG side of manifold was shut. CSG had 200 PSI. IE reached over suction to close TBG side and 4" cam-lock fitting came apart and a piece stuck IE in left side of ribs and arm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to arm and ribs on left side after being struck by 4" cam-lock fitting after it came apart while closing Tbg.

IncidentSummary: IE was laying down pipe and felt a burning sensation in right leg.
IncidentDescription: IE was laying down pipe and felt a burning sensation in right leg.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right leg while laying down pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was in the derrick guiding pipe into swivel. IE had both hands on the pipe when the swivel was e
IncidentDescription: IE was in the derrick guiding pipe into swivel. IE had both hands on the pipe when the swivel was engaged by the Baker Hughes swivel operator. This resulted in the pipe twisting up in the cat line chain catching the IE's left hand between the chain and pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand after pipe being guided into swivel twisted as Baker Hughes swivel operator engaged swivel.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on shakers and needed duct tape. IE took gloves off and as he began to look for tape
IncidentDescription: IE was working on shakers and needed duct tape. IE took gloves off and as he began to look for tape in tool box, a drill bit scraped palm of right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to palm of right hand after a striking against drill bit in tool box while looking for duct tape. IE was not wearing gloves.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing a 2 X 4 board from top of the pipe rack to put under rack to level it. As IE grabbe
IncidentDescription: IE was removing a 2 X 4 board from top of the pipe rack to put under rack to level it. As IE grabbed the board, a splinter punctured the bottom right index finger. IE was wearing impact resistant gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right middle finger from a splinter that was in a 2 X 4 being removed from top of pipe rack to put at bottom to level rack. IE was wearing impact gloves.

IncidentSummary: Crew was running casing. Floorhands made up swedge on 5-1/2" casing in trough used by laydown truck.
IncidentDescription: Crew was running casing. Floorhands made up swedge on 5-1/2" casing in trough used by laydown truck. Floorhands attached 2" hose with chixen on it to swedge. Driller picked up casing and casing crew stabbed joint of casing to make it up. While making up casing, stabber shouted once for tong handler to stop and then waved him on. While tong handler was making up casing, swedge backed out of casing and fell to rig floor with 2" hose attached. The IE was standing by laydown pole in mousehole. Hose, swedge and chixen came down, striking laydown pole and the IE. It knocked IE's hard hat off and struck him on his left forearm. Driller had shouted for the IE to move but his reaction was not fast enough.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left forearm when 2" hose hit his arm

IncidentSummary: IE was going to car wash to wash tank. IE was putting coin in car wash, the machine started up. The
IncidentDescription: IE was going to car wash to wash tank. IE was putting coin in car wash, the machine started up. The end of the hose shot water and hit IE in chest and lip. IE shut down machine and called office.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lip after car wash suddenly started up while inserting money and end of hose shot water.

IncidentSummary: MISS TCP 6-min delay fuse
IncidentDescription:
A TCP 6-minute delay fuse initiated by accident when employee was hammering on the bottom end of the fuse to seat the fuse in the housing barrel instead of using the proper 
setting tool.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/sub
IncidentDescription:
Hand had went down to hook on to IBS. He hook on to IBS and the nomack (?) collar. They were hoisted to floor. 
Only one person on floor. IBS was too short to stay in tail rope swing across the floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hydromatic
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While making a connection motorman changed light plants, leaving rig with no water on the Hydromatic.

IncidentSummary: While coming out of hole with Tbg, IE unlatched elevator in derrick. As IE pushed bail away, the han
IncidentDescription: While coming out of hole with Tbg, IE unlatched elevator in derrick. As IE pushed bail away, the handles on elevators hung up in harness and pulled IE off board. IE was tied off two ways. On the way down, left foot caught in fingers on board.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left foot after being caught in fingers on board on the way down after being pulled off board when elevators hung up in harness.

IncidentSummary: IE and Cleo Ibarra were working in the snubbing unit basket along with Pipe Pros operator. While com
IncidentDescription: IE and Cleo Ibarra were working in the snubbing unit basket along with Pipe Pros operator. While coming out of the hole with 2-7/8" pH6 tubing, Pipe Pros Operator inadvertently closed tongs while pipe was going up. This caused the tongs to ride up on the pipe. IE's right hand was on tongs as they rode up causing right middle finger to get caught between backup tongs and top tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Severed tendon on right middle finger when finger was caught between backup tongs and top tongs. Pipe Pros Operator inadvertently closed tongs while pipe was going up.

IncidentSummary: IE was working with a chemical cutter tool. While unscrewing the cylinder from the tool, there was t
IncidentDescription: IE was working with a chemical cutter tool. While unscrewing the cylinder from the tool, there was trapped pressure and bromine triflouride sprayed out and onto his face. See private documents for detailed information.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained chemical burns on cheeks, forehead and right hand when trapped pressure was released as the cylinder tool was being unscrewed, and bromine triflouride powder was sprayed out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pipe screen
IncidentDescription:
After pumping pill and breaking string off of top drive, a pipe screen, minus ring retainer, which has been recovered 
earlier, fell out of top drive. It could have struck floorhand.  Apparently, the screen was stuck in top drive from 
previous well, following a pressure spike that lodged the screen up into the top drive.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/pin keeper
IncidentDescription:
While tripping pipe, a pinkeeper fell to the floor.  Hand noticed it and told driller to lock down the brake handle so 
they could inspect derrick, top drive and crown for a missing keeper.  Derrickhand found the shackle holding torque tube 
was missing the keeper

IncidentSummary: IE felt soreness in back while handling and lifting 2-7/8" tubing while snubbing operations were ins
IncidentDescription: IE felt soreness in back while handling and lifting 2-7/8" tubing while snubbing operations were installing pipe into well.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced strain to lower back while handling and lifting 2-7/8" tubing while snubbing operations were installing pipe into well.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS/hydraulic line leaking
IncidentDescription: While functioning pipe and blind rams, hand noticed a hydraulic line leaking.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/joint of pipe
IncidentDescription:
Catwalk operator was coming up on the trough and skate and  came up on skate too far, causing joint of tubing to 
come halfway out of trough, being stopped by hat on back of skate.

IncidentSummary: MISS Berry/broken cable
IncidentDescription: While drilling, the wind blew pason line into the top drive, breaking the cable and cable fell to the floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was picking up first joint of tubing and had a board across lay-down trough. As IE picked it up,
IncidentDescription: IE was picking up first joint of tubing and had a board across lay-down trough. As IE picked it up, the back of the joint came out of lay-down machine and hit the ground, swinging towards rig floor. IE injured ankle while trying to get out of the way.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained sprain to right ankle while trying to move out of the way of joint of tubing after it came out of lay-down machine.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/torque in drill string
IncidentDescription:
While sliding and oscillating pipe, directional driller noticed a 400 psi pressure drop so he shut down and driller picked up off bottom and torque in drill string 
caused it to back out a connection.

IncidentSummary: Adrian Dominguez was driving on Hwy 83, about 6 miles south of Asherton headed towards Catarina, TX,
IncidentDescription: Adrian Dominguez was driving on Hwy 83, about 6 miles south of Asherton headed towards Catarina, TX, when he dozed off and drove into a ditch on the right side of the road.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained concussion and contusion to face and left orbit, after truck he was passenger in drove into ditch after driver fell asleep.

IncidentSummary: The crew was fishing out a screen liner that had parted in the well. They had pulled four sections o
IncidentDescription: The crew was fishing out a screen liner that had parted in the well. They had pulled four sections of pipe and laid them down. On the fifth section, there was a 3-ft section of tubing connected to the area where it had parted. As they were taking the 3-ft section off, the trapped pressure released and sand struck the IE in the back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lower back after being struck by sand when trapped pressure released while removing a section of tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was laying down tubing on catwalk and was giving tubing a slight pull so elevator would miss stum
IncidentDescription: IE was laying down tubing on catwalk and was giving tubing a slight pull so elevator would miss stump. As IE applied pressure to right knee, IE states that the knee bent the wrong way and popped.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee after it bent wrong way when applying pressure to it while pulling on tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE stated there was a burning sensation on fourth toe of right foot. No visible sign of a bite or co
IncidentDescription: IE stated there was a burning sensation on fourth toe of right foot. No visible sign of a bite or contusion.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced a burning sensation to fourth toe of right foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Triangle/stump, hand placement
IncidentDescription:
While tailing in pipe and just before stabbing the pipe on the stump, a floor hand placed his hand on stump nearly 
causing an accident.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/Chemical Pallet
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Team member nearly stabbed forks into pallet of chemicals.

IncidentSummary: IE was putting chicksan into the belly box of the tool truck and right hand came in contact with the
IncidentDescription: IE was putting chicksan into the belly box of the tool truck and right hand came in contact with the door latch.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right hand after striking against door latch while putting chicksan into the belly box of the tool truck.

IncidentSummary: IE was loosening clamps on coiled tubing and the block jerked forward smashing hand between tubing a
IncidentDescription: IE was loosening clamps on coiled tubing and the block jerked forward smashing hand between tubing and hand rail.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb when blocks jerked forward as clamp on coiled tubing was being tightened. Decided he needed to go to doctor on 10-31-14. Self-terminated on 10-20- 14.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/silo pressure
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Cement hands went to set cement out of the silo and the silo started to pressure up use to it being cemented in.

IncidentSummary: The IE noticed spots of rash on his hands and forearms and believed it came from contact with OBM.
IncidentDescription: The IE noticed spots of rash on his hands and forearms and believed it came from contact with OBM.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to both forearms and hands due to contact with OBM.

IncidentSummary: Rig crew had rigged up power swivel unit and began to pick up swivel into the air. The crew and the
IncidentDescription: Rig crew had rigged up power swivel unit and began to pick up swivel into the air. The crew and the pusher noticed, at the same time, that the stiff arm wasn't properly attached to the power swivel. The driller began to lower the blocks to look at the stiff arm. While he was lowering the blocks, the Kelly valve tagged up on the joint in the well and the swivel tilted to the off-driller side, causing the stiff arm to pull off the stub on the swivel. When this happened, the stiff arm that was attached to the snub line flung around and fell approximately two feet, hitting the IE who was standing edge of the rig floor, on top of the head.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced trauma to the top of the head after being struck by the stiff arm, that was attached to the snub line, as it flung around and fell approximately two feet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/falling object
IncidentDescription:
While making a connection towards the end of our shift, a piece of metal fell from the top drive about 3 inches x .5 
inch x .5 inch(LXWXH) Nobody was hurt but it fell from Driller side of Top Drive while 3 floor hands were on the floor 
making the connection.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/wind wall
IncidentDescription:
Crane operator went to pickup wind wall while flagger was trying to take out a pin and the wind wall popped up 
almost striking the crane flagger.

IncidentSummary: Crew was tripping pipe into hole and IE slipped and fell on rig floor, landing on his buttocks. IE r
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping pipe into hole and IE slipped and fell on rig floor, landing on his buttocks. IE reported the incident to supervisor, David Cuellar, the next morning.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after slipping on rig floor while tripping pipe into hole.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up work string with the floor about 20' high. The joint blocks that had been picked
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up work string with the floor about 20' high. The joint blocks that had been picked up were swinging. Crew got joint up to floor and floor hand took protector off pipe. The pipe had to be picked up about an additional 1' to stab. When he picked up the pipe, the horns on the elevator hung under a beam, where the dogs are, and made the pipe kick out and hit the IE in the chest and nose.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained an abrasion to chest and nose after being struck by pipe when the horns hung under a beam where the dogs are, causing the pipe to kick out.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was checking operations through the collar locator and the engineer was in the truck on the contr
