IncidentDescription: IE was checking operations through the collar locator and the engineer was in the truck on the control panel. After the checks were complete, IE stood up holding the collar locator weighing 20 lbs and suddenly fell to knees, reached for his back and dropped the collar locator.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to lower back while carrying the collar locator.

IncidentSummary: IE was talking and walking across the yard with co-workers and fell.
IncidentDescription: IE was talking and walking across the yard with co-workers and fell.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to right ankle after falling while talking and walking across the yard in George West.

IncidentSummary: Crew was tripping 2-7/8" PH6 tubing out of hole. They had pulled approximately 25 stands out of the
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping 2-7/8" PH6 tubing out of hole. They had pulled approximately 25 stands out of the hole and racked in the racking board. The IE came out of the derrick and stated that as a stand of tubing was unlatched and put it in the racking board, a pain was felt in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back as a stand of tubing was unlatched and put in the racking board.

IncidentSummary: IE heard back pop while slipping on racking board and landing in a sitting position.
IncidentDescription: IE heard back pop while slipping on racking board and landing in a sitting position.
InjuryDescripti: Strained lower back after slipping on racking board.

IncidentSummary: MISS rear-end collision (AL)
IncidentDescription:
M.Martinez was returning with a load from Bryan, TX. He was driving truck #201 along with trailer #3023. While he was making the turnaround onto Hwy 44 East to 
the Alice yard, a vehicle behind him was barreling down at a high rate of speed and came close to rear-ending the back of our truck and trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was loading setting tool parts into back of pickup and struck right knee against the corner of tr
IncidentDescription: IE was loading setting tool parts into back of pickup and struck right knee against the corner of trailer.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee after striking against trailer while loading setting tool parts into pickup.

IncidentSummary: The IE was racking a stand of a 4" heavy weight drill pipe on the floor. As the stand was coming do
IncidentDescription: The IE was racking a stand of a 4" heavy weight drill pipe on the floor. As the stand was coming down, the IE pushed the stand back while twisting his hip. The IE felt a muscle strain near the groin area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to groin area while pushing back stand of heavy weight drill pipe.

IncidentSummary: Before cementing began, the IE went into cellar to install a valve onto wellhead to flush stack with
IncidentDescription: Before cementing began, the IE went into cellar to install a valve onto wellhead to flush stack with kill line after cementing. Driller honked horn for floor hands to come up to rig floor to rig up cement. He proceeded to exit cellar, placing right foot onto well head and left foot onto cellar to climb out. Left foot then slipped, causing all weight to go down onto right knee and right knee struck top of cellar.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee after left foot slipped, causing all weight to go down onto right knee and knee struck top of cellar.

IncidentSummary: IE told Jonathan Hargraves that a pre-existing condition was allegedly aggravated upon twisting wron
IncidentDescription: IE told Jonathan Hargraves that a pre-existing condition was allegedly aggravated upon twisting wrong, as the IE and another employee picked up a Kelly hose earlier that day.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly sustained strain to lower back upon twisting as Kelly hose was being picked up with the help of another employee.

IncidentSummary: Our driver ran into back of gooseneck trailer.
IncidentDescription: Our driver ran into back of gooseneck trailer.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left eye after rear-ending back of crane.

IncidentSummary: As crew was laying down polish rod, the IE placed left hand underneath polish rod and rod rotator sl
IncidentDescription: As crew was laying down polish rod, the IE placed left hand underneath polish rod and rod rotator slipped down and pinched left thumb. He was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb after it was pinched between polish rod and rod rotator as crew was laying down pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While rigging up, the base beam wasn't square with the rig or two-hole, so it had to be moved up. Sc
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, the base beam wasn't square with the rig or two-hole, so it had to be moved up. Scott Brooks pulled the rig up and when he did, the forklift was on the guy wires and caused it to lift the IE three feet off the ground, after catching right leg.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right leg after being lifted off ground when caught in guy wire that was under forklift as the rig was pulled up.

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying down lubricator onto goose-neck trailer using the crane. 3rd party plug hand was hol
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down lubricator onto goose-neck trailer using the crane. 3rd party plug hand was holding the tag line on the lubricator holding it so it would set down on trailer. Unknown reasons the plug hand let go of the tag line and lubricator swung forward hitting the pioneer employee in the chest knocking him off the trailer.
InjuryDescripti: Bruise to back and arm after being hit in chest by lubricator and falling against welding stand, as lubricator swung over after it was dropped while being loaded onto trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking to change house and slipped on wet grass, landing on knee.
IncidentDescription: IE was walking to change house and slipped on wet grass, landing on knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to knee after slipping on wet grass while walking back to change house.

IncidentSummary: IE was using a plasma cutter working in the re-fabricating shop and got the cutter too close to left
IncidentDescription: IE was using a plasma cutter working in the re-fabricating shop and got the cutter too close to left thumb and received a 2nd degree burn.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained 2nd degree burn to left thumb while using a plasma cutter.

IncidentSummary: IE was putting mud line together and had to move line 2-3" to connect. As the IE and two other emplo
IncidentDescription: IE was putting mud line together and had to move line 2-3" to connect. As the IE and two other employees were pushing line back, IE's back locked up.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while pushing mud line back 2-3" with two other employees.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/wrench, untethered tools
IncidentDescription:
While attempting to go up to grease the travelling blocks, a hand had a crescent wrench in his back pocket potentially 
falling out and hitting someone.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pressure washer wand
IncidentDescription: Hand was washing when tip on nozzle messed up. Went to look at it and pressure popped it off.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/slips
IncidentDescription:
Pulling slips and setting them on unlevel surface causing them to fall. Standing too close to them or not paying 
attention, they could fall on someone's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/ST-80
IncidentDescription: Hand was between collar and ST-80 when it was moving forward. He got out of the way in time.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/forks
IncidentDescription: Hand raised the forks and almost hit a hand in the face.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hammer handle split while breaking a hammer union off.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand was walking across the suitcase and wasn't paying attention and went to step off and almost tripped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand slipped on oil base mud on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/thread protectors, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription:
While making pipe up in V-door, floorhand threw thread protector down and next connection tripped over 
it.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/air hoist, foot placement
IncidentDescription:
Hand was tailing in drill pipe another hand went down on air hoist. Hand moved his feet but could have gotten them 
smashed.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/hand placement
IncidentDescription:
Hand was helping roll up the wire line tool and was about to grab the wire guide on the outside of the hand guards 
possibly resulting in pinched/cut hand

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/drill pipe, hand placement
IncidentDescription: Hand was stabbing drill pipe into stump and almost got his hand and fingers smashed.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/drill pipe, body placement
IncidentDescription:
Hand was putting lifting caps on drill pipe on catwalk wasn't paying attention and had his body between drill pipe. Pipe 
started to roll but stopped. Could have gotten hurt.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand was walking on crates over cellar and almost slipped in but caught himself.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/slips
IncidentDescription: Hand lifted slips up too high and almost had them land on his feet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/catwalk
IncidentDescription: Observed hand standing within 30 ft off catwalk while it was in operation.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/diesel spill
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Hand was transporting diesel to pump with forklift when he hit a bump and a little bit of diesel spilled out and onto the 
tanks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/hose
IncidentDescription:
Hand was hooking up pump to the frac tank when the hose he was dragging got caught on the tire (?) of the pump 
causing him to stumble.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/casing, hand placement
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand was rolling casing his hand slipped almost pinched his fingers.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand getting out master bushing, he slipped and almost fell into rotary.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/tongs
IncidentDescription: Employee's tongs came undone when applied pressure and almost hit another employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While working on catwalk hand jumped off catwalk nearly twisted ankle with rocks.

IncidentSummary: While the IE was on his way home from work, he felt pain in his left wrist. He contributed it to re
IncidentDescription: While the IE was on his way home from work, he felt pain in his left wrist. He contributed it to repetitive motion throughout the day while swinging a sledge hammer and daily activity while rigging down. The following evening, the IE reported it to his Rig Manager.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left wrist doing repetitive motion with a sledge hammer throughout the day.

IncidentSummary: MISS Penn Virginia/hoist hook
IncidentDescription: While rigging down BOPs with hoist hook, hoist came off landing on top of BOPs.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken drill line strands (LA)
IncidentDescription: Driller noticed drill line had broken strands. Driller stopped the job and informed the Tool pusher of the cable.

IncidentSummary: MISS drove over steel toe
IncidentDescription:
J. Pehrson's crew had returned to the shop from a plug shoot. After dropping off setting tools in the wash bay, Matt Oye reached into the pickup box to grab his lunch cooler. 
Pehrson was unaware of Oye's actions and drove forward, subsequently running over the steel toe of his shoe. He was not injured.

IncidentSummary: IE's job title is shop hand, occasionally he helps at the rig. He asked Chase Neitermayer and Cody T
IncidentDescription: IE's job title is shop hand, occasionally he helps at the rig. He asked Chase Neitermayer and Cody Theriot if he could go help out on the rig in STX because he could use the extra money. We sent him to take supplies and help out between 10-23-14 to 10-31-14. During this time, there were no reports that he injured himself. He returned to the office on 11-3-14 complaining of his back hurting. He told Chance and Cody that it was NOT job-related and he just needed to take a few days off to get it checked out. He worked the week of 11-10-14 thru 11-14-14 and attended Drill for the Army National Guard on that weekend. On 11-17-14, he approached Chance and asked to see a Pioneer doctor because of his back pain.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly sustained strain to back helping at the rig.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/tool tie-off
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was about to work overhead without having his tools tied off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was mixing chemicals and tripped on a pallet but did not fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/hose, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: A water hose was left laying across the walkway on the tanks causing a trip hazard.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/loose mud flap
IncidentDescription: The mud flap on the shaker was about to fall off and make mud spill onto the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/hose, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking on mud tank and almost tripped over a hose but caught himself.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/chemicals, body placement
IncidentDescription:
Employee was mixing chemicals and used a stick to get the chemicals to go down and employee almost got blow back 
in face by sticking stick too far.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/pipe, catwalk
IncidentDescription: Pipe slid down catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/hand rails
IncidentDescription: Missing hand rails on stops to catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/keeper pin, tong
IncidentDescription: Missing keeper in clevis for tong.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/clevis, shackle
IncidentDescription:
During the pre-nipple up inspection had found that the clevis that was going to be used was not big enough and would 
not tolerate the weight.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/hand placement
IncidentDescription:
While running the survey tool down the hole, a hand placed his hand on to the counter which was extremely close to 
the wheel that could pinch his hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/electric drill, tripping hazard
IncidentDescription:
An electric plug was found plugged in and laying in the walk way of the parts house potentially being tripped over or 
turned on.

IncidentSummary: MISS XTO/tailing pipe
IncidentDescription: While picking pipe up V-door Hand A saw that new hand was not ready to tail pipe in yet.

IncidentSummary: While the IE was walking with bucket of rig wash, to add to steam cleaner, he crossed a ditch and th
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While the IE was walking with bucket of rig wash, to add to steam cleaner, he crossed a ditch and the ground broke under him (location very muddy) and his left foot went into the ditch. He heard his knee pop, causing it difficult to walk on.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to left knee after slipping in ditch on muddy location.

IncidentSummary: IE was unloading the back end of a logging truck for cleaning. While stepping off the truck's bumper
IncidentDescription: IE was unloading the back end of a logging truck for cleaning. While stepping off the truck's bumper onto the ground, which were both wet with morning dew, left foot slipped as it hit the ground. IE fell onto the end of a weight bar that was on a cart directly behind the truck. The end of the weight bar scraped left butt cheek up to rectal area. IE experienced some pain and bruising, but continued working.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to buttocks after striking against weight bar on cart due to slipping off wet bumper of logging truck while unloading equipment.

IncidentSummary: While the IE was working on an air leak behind drillers console, he was struck by the wind wall door
IncidentDescription: While the IE was working on an air leak behind drillers console, he was struck by the wind wall door on his left knee. He was positioned between the console while working on job at hand, with right leg facing the console and kneeling on his left knee. When another employee was attempting to open the door, it was wedged tight so the employee used some force to open it. When the door opened, it flew towards the IE's left leg, twisting his knee.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee when wind wall door struck it.

IncidentSummary: MISS poor lighting
IncidentDescription:
Crew was off-loading equipment and putting it near red-tag area. There was a piece of equipment on the ground that was not seen, due to poor lighting. Equipment was pushed 
toward fence and had it been pushed a few inches further, the fence would have been damaged.

IncidentSummary: MISS forklift
IncidentDescription:
Employee was taking tools and equipment from tool box to inventory it. Someone driving forklift came from other side and forks when under toolbox and onto employee's foot. 
No injury.

IncidentSummary: IE was binding injector head to tree. Third-party flow-back hand was holding breaker bar to close bi
IncidentDescription: IE was binding injector head to tree. Third-party flow-back hand was holding breaker bar to close binder while IE was holding chain. Breaker bar slipped off binder causing binder to spring back and strike middle finger of right hand. IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right middle finger, when struck by binder while holding chain, as breaker bar slipped off binder causing it to spring back.

IncidentSummary: MISS defective crane scoping - dropped tools
IncidentDescription:
After crew had finished a 7" plug and came off the well head, they lowered the plug and then broke the plug off the tool string vertically. As they went to lay down the tool 
string, Crane 2085 started scoping all by itself. The crane operator could not stop it until it had scoped 13'. When the crane scoped in, it pit the bottom of the tool in the dirt 
and wedged cable head into lubricator sideways, breaking the cable head and pulling the tool off the wire line, dropping the tool to the ground. The tool was at about a 45 
degree angle from the ground and the top of the tool was about 3' off the ground. The tool did not hit anyone or anything.

IncidentSummary: Crew had the lubricator hanging and the grease head froze up. They had to lay it down to clean out t
IncidentDescription: Crew had the lubricator hanging and the grease head froze up. They had to lay it down to clean out the grease head and when putting it back on the lubricator, the grease head slipped and knocked over the gun string that was on stands next to the lubricator. The gun string fell on the back of IE's left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain/bruise to left foot and ankle after being struck by gun string after lubricator slipped and knocked over stands.

IncidentSummary: MISS worn cable (LA)
IncidentDescription:
Derrick hand, Thomas Bourque was on the tubing board tripping pipe when he noticed the cable that runs from the crown to the tubing board had some wear on it 
and had potential to get worse. He made the pusher, Richard Caillier, aware of the situation.

IncidentSummary: The crew had tripped out 2-7/8" tubing and were preparing to change over and lay down 2-3/8" tubing.
IncidentDescription: The crew had tripped out 2-7/8" tubing and were preparing to change over and lay down 2-3/8" tubing. The IE was attempting to install a TIW valve into the string for well control. The valve slipped out of the IE's hands, fell to the rig floor and landed on the top of right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot after being struck by the TIW valve after it slipped out of his hands.

IncidentSummary: The crew had circulated the well with 320 bbls of 11.2 lb water. After the well sat static for 1 hou
IncidentDescription: The crew had circulated the well with 320 bbls of 11.2 lb water. After the well sat static for 1 hour, the well appeared to be dead. When the crew started removing the valve and crossover, the well took a kick of gas, oil and saltwater. The IE had some of the fluid splash into both eyes while assisting another employee installing the TIW valve.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to both eyes after oil, gas and saltwater splashed into them when well took a kick as the TIW valve was being installed.

IncidentSummary: IE was driving down the highway and met a truck. The occupant of the truck threw something into the
IncidentDescription: IE was driving down the highway and met a truck. The occupant of the truck threw something into the windshield, causing it to shatter. Shards of glass struck the IE in the face and eyes.
InjuryDescripti: Foreign body (glass shards) in face and eyes after object thrown from another vehicle shattered windshield while driving down highway.

IncidentSummary: MISS stabbing miscommunication
IncidentDescription:
Our crew was on a plug shoot. The engineer was contacted over the radio by the Baker frac crew and told we were clear to stab onto the well they were fracking. We put our 
employee, Kyle Mackey, into the man basket. The frac crew shut-in the well and bled off the pressure. Kyle then knocked the cap off the well head. About 10-seconds later 
the company man came out and stopped all work. He explained there was a miscommunication. Frac was not completed on the well. They were only shut down for 
temporary maintenance. We put the cap back on and waited for Baker to complete the frac.

IncidentSummary: MISS misaligned crane boom
IncidentDescription:
Operator was lifting lubricator off grease trailer. When starting to lift, they did not have crane boom directly above the load and side-loaded the crane, causing the hoist cable to 
jump over the side of the sheave. When cable jumped over the sheave, it cut the armors of the cable. When scoping in boom, high strands from the cable became bunched up 
and knotted and kinked at the drum. This was a high potential for serious injuries and more equipment damage.

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/joint of pipe
IncidentDescription:
While laying down pipe, driller coming down with joint in pipe wrangler, pin end of joint got hung up on kicker section 
of catwalk and nearly stacked a lot of weight on service loop.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/piece of die, falling object
IncidentDescription: When tripping pipe, driller opened the grabber box and a piece of die fell from 90".

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/keeper
IncidentDescription: While laying down BHA, handle came off. Collar clamp was missing keepers.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/service loop
IncidentDescription:
While tripping in, the service loop was blowing into the top drive. Hand stopped the driller from coming down and 
breaking the service loop.

IncidentSummary: The IE had just finished working in manlift. Upon exiting the basket, he retrieved a can of soda tha
IncidentDescription: The IE had just finished working in manlift. Upon exiting the basket, he retrieved a can of soda that he had left on the substructure. He poured about 1/4 of the contents out because he had noticed bees flying around. He then drank then rest and swallowed a bee that was still in the can. The bee stung his throat on the way down and he threw up about thirty seconds later. The bee came out with the vomit.
InjuryDescripti: Sting in throat when bee was swallowed from a soda can.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/wind wall, hand placement
IncidentDescription: While guiding wind wall in, hand almost got his fingers between the wall and sub creating a pinch point.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/latch
IncidentDescription:
While tripping in, the derrick hand went to latch up stand but only got half a latch. Hands told driller to set down on 
stand and to watch if it Falls or becomes unlatched.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/cement line
IncidentDescription: Fitting on cement line was leaking and spraying cement onto the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/drill line
IncidentDescription:
While finishing up slip and cut, hand was doing find inspection of drill line on drum. Hand noticed broken strands in drill 
line. Hand stopped job for further inspection.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/wind wall
IncidentDescription:
Crane Operator went to pick up wind wall while flagger was trying to take out a pin and the wind wall popped up almost 
striking the crane flagger.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/overhead falling object HIGH
IncidentDescription:
While making a connection towards the end of our shift a piece of metal fell from the top drive about 3 inches x .5 inch 
x .5 inch (LXWXH) Nobody was hurt but it fell from Driller side of Top Drive while 3 floor hands were on the floor 
making the connection.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/signal miscommunication
IncidentDescription:
Hand that was latching up stand at the diving board gave the signal for down. The chugger operator thought he gave 
the signal for up. The hand at the board stopped operator before he dropped the stand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slip handle
IncidentDescription:
Floor hand noticed 5th slip handle was damaged so they pulled them to switch them out. Handle pulled out while slips 
were being pulled.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/drill line spool, chain
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Crane rigging was stuck under the drill line spool and operator pulled it free causing the chain to fly through the air and 
almost hit swamper.

IncidentSummary: While attempting to free the kelly hose off of derrick board handrail, IE swung kelly hose over caus
IncidentDescription: While attempting to free the kelly hose off of derrick board handrail, IE swung kelly hose over causing the derrick climb assist weight bucket to swing into IE's right shoulder resulting in a minor contusion.
InjuryDescripti: IE struck by derrick climb assist weight bucket resulting in contusion to right shoulder.

IncidentSummary: The IE was pulling slips and started to feel some discomfort in stomach, checked and felt a small bu
IncidentDescription: The IE was pulling slips and started to feel some discomfort in stomach, checked and felt a small bump around the umbilical area (belly button). Report states there were four hands on rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to abdomen while pulling slips

IncidentSummary: While laying down tubing, IE was pulling the tubing to clear the floor. When IE unlatched the tubing
IncidentDescription: While laying down tubing, IE was pulling the tubing to clear the floor. When IE unlatched the tubing, it bounced the end of the tubing off the catwalk and struck the two middle fingers of left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to two middle fingers of left hand after end of the tubing being pulled bounced off the catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Newfield/cable strands HIGH
IncidentDescription:
Employees were conducting a lift with crane company to get drawworks off the floor.  The derrickhand used the wrong 
cables to attach to the drawworks. As the lift was being performed, three of the six strands on the cable broke.

IncidentSummary: Man was pulling on slips after the connection when his lower back started hurting. Crew was reaming
IncidentDescription: Man was pulling on slips after the connection when his lower back started hurting. Crew was reaming to bottom after trip two men were at hopper mixing chemicals, one man was in derrick latching stand to be reamed. Two men were working floor. The slips being used are for rented 5 7/8" d.p. and hyd. slips were not being used at this time.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was pulling slips resulting in a possible lower back strain.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up tubing with hydraulic catline and a joint came out of the bucket. Juan Medina, F
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up tubing with hydraulic catline and a joint came out of the bucket. Juan Medina, Floor Hand yelled at Martin O'Campo, Operator, to stop. Operator did not hear him because of all the noise from the equipment. Ring came off tubing causing joint to fall and strike IE on the top of the head and shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Fractures to several vertebra and laceration to head when struck by falling joint of pipe, after ring came off tubing while tubing was being picked up by hydraulic catline.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While pulling pin on 3rd party equipment, lay down machine, IE pinched left hand.
IncidentDescription: While pulling pin on 3rd party equipment, lay down machine, IE pinched left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand while pulling pin on laydown machine.

IncidentSummary: The IE was tripping out of the hole. He was racking back a stand of 5" HWDP in the racking fingers
IncidentDescription: The IE was tripping out of the hole. He was racking back a stand of 5" HWDP in the racking fingers when his hand slipped on the rope, causing the stand of HWDP to pinch his left hand between another stand of 5" HWDP. He finished tripping out of the hole and informed the driller and Rig Manager of the incident afterwards.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand when hand slipped on rope and became pinched between two stands of 5" HWDP.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/mud transfer
IncidentDescription: Employee was mixing mud from the holding tank to the rig tank and was going to walk away from his station.

IncidentSummary: MISS Oak Valley/ST-80, hand placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost stuck his hand in wrong area but didn't. Other employee told him not to.

IncidentSummary: Crew attached catline to the end of the horse head to remove it. As they started to pick up on end o
IncidentDescription: Crew attached catline to the end of the horse head to remove it. As they started to pick up on end of horse head, the catline unhooked and horse head fell to the ground, grazing the IE's back.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to upper back after horse head being removed fell when catline unhooked.

IncidentSummary: Crew was washing down with power swivel. Operator, Heberto Martinez, was picking up 2-7/8" PH-6 tubi
IncidentDescription: Crew was washing down with power swivel. Operator, Heberto Martinez, was picking up 2-7/8" PH-6 tubing when the ring on the chain slipped, causing tubing to shift and strike IE on left shoulder. He refused medical treatment.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder when struck by 2-7/8" PH-6 tubing being picked up, after it shifted when the ring on the chain slipped.

IncidentSummary: Employee was pulling slips and allegedly strained his back then he changed his mind that his back no
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling slips and allegedly strained his back then he changed his mind that his back no longer hurt.
InjuryDescripti: Alleged strain on back while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: The IE was taking apart 5" Cameron valve from a ladder to replace the inside rubber because the valv
IncidentDescription: The IE was taking apart 5" Cameron valve from a ladder to replace the inside rubber because the valve was leaking. After pulling all the bolts out of the face, he pulled it out a little so it could drain. While he was waiting for help to come down, the valve face, weighing about 60 pounds, vibrated out and fell 3.5', striking his left leg above the knee.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to left knee when valve face vibrated and fell 3.5' on leg.

IncidentSummary: While cutting 2-1/2" square tubing with a pipe cutter, a sliver of metal poked through glove and scr
IncidentDescription: While cutting 2-1/2" square tubing with a pipe cutter, a sliver of metal poked through glove and scratched IE's index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left index finger after a sliver of metal poked through glove while IE was cutting a piece of square 2-1/2" tubing.

IncidentSummary: Crew picked up directional motor, 6" collars and mwd tools. Tripped in the hole to the shoe@1,976'.
IncidentDescription: Crew picked up directional motor, 6" collars and mwd tools. Tripped in the hole to the shoe@1,976'. After tripping in the hole, the IE noticed pain in his right arm (lower forearm). Did not report accident, just continued to work.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right lower forearm while tripping in the hole.

IncidentSummary: IE was making up tubing hanger with 36" pipe wrench. Wrench slipped from tubing and IE fell and stru
IncidentDescription: IE was making up tubing hanger with 36" pipe wrench. Wrench slipped from tubing and IE fell and struck left elbow on rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left elbow after falling to rig floor when 36" wrench being used to make up tubing hanger slipped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hand placement
IncidentDescription: 3rd Party hand nearly smashed hand between elevators and casing

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/steam line
IncidentDescription:
Hand went to knock off hammer union on steam line at bottom of stair tower. Hand told him not to hit it off until they 
know 100% there is no back pressure. Hands were trying to hit off steam line without knowing.

IncidentSummary: IE was hitting the saver sub on power swivel so they could break it out. While swinging the hammer,
IncidentDescription: IE was hitting the saver sub on power swivel so they could break it out. While swinging the hammer, the head of the hammer hung up in the tong hoses and IE hit his right index finger on the sub.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right index finger after hammer being swing to break out saver sub on power swivel hung up in tong hoses and finger hit sub.

IncidentSummary: During morning safety meeting motorman was advised that he and the rig manager would shut both gener
IncidentDescription: During morning safety meeting motorman was advised that he and the rig manager would shut both generators down at daylight and change diesel hoses on generator that had leaks in them. Directly after safety meeting motorman and floorhand went directly to generator and began to change out hoses with leaks while generator was running. After unscrewing one of the hose, diesel sprayed both the motorman and floorhand in the their faces which caused their eyes to get irritated. Both employees gave no one any notice that they were going to change diesel lines.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to eyes when diesel sprayed into face.

IncidentSummary: During morning safety meeting motorman was advised that he and rig manager would shut both generator
IncidentDescription: During morning safety meeting motorman was advised that he and rig manager would shut both generators down at daylight and change diesel hoses on generator that had leaks in them. Directly after safety meeting, motorman and floorhand went directly to generator and began to change out hoses with leaks while generator was running. After unscrewing one side of hose, diesel sprayed both motorman and floorhand in their faces, causing floorhand's eyes to get irritated. Both employees did not give any notice that they were going to change diesel lines.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to eyes when diesel sprayed into face.

IncidentSummary: While hammering the BOP's, IE slipped off the B-section into the cellar and strained right ankle.
IncidentDescription: While hammering the BOP's, IE slipped off the B-section into the cellar and strained right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after slipping off the B-section and into the cellar while hammering on BOP's.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P crane pulled tool string
IncidentDescription:
The gun was just lifted in the air with the wireline and was partially lifted into the lubricator, when the 3rd party crane boomed up too fast and pulled the tool string out of 
the rope socket. The tool string fell and hit the grate that is over the cellar. The top of the tool string was still in the lubricator.

IncidentSummary: While walking on substructure, the IE stepped on hose and rolled his left ankle. He removed his boot
IncidentDescription: While walking on substructure, the IE stepped on hose and rolled his left ankle. He removed his boot and found his ankle had started to swell up.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after stepping on hose and rolling ankle.

IncidentSummary: Employees were getting ready to run a survey when they noticed that the wire was out of the hay pull
IncidentDescription: Employees were getting ready to run a survey when they noticed that the wire was out of the hay pulley on the floor. The IE got wire in pulley and told motorman to pickup on the wire line. At that time, The IE got his right thumb cut on the hay pulley.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thumb by the hay pulley.

IncidentSummary: IE continued cleaning gun parts after removing glasses when they fogged over, and got back-spray in
IncidentDescription: IE continued cleaning gun parts after removing glasses when they fogged over, and got back-spray in his left eye.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left eye after back-wash got in eye, after removing glasses when they fogged up, while cleaning perforating gun.

IncidentSummary: MISS tool string pull-out, sheave strike
IncidentDescription: James was operating the winch coming out of the hole, and paying attention to the wraps on the drum, when the tool came out of the hole. Without proper instruments to see the depth and keep an eye on the person on the rig floor, the tool came out and made contact with the top sheave.

IncidentSummary: While climbing down derrick ladder, IE slipped and swung back into the ladder while holding with one
IncidentDescription: While climbing down derrick ladder, IE slipped and swung back into the ladder while holding with one hand. IE was able to regain footing and continue working. The ladder had oil on it.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left arm after grabbing onto ladder and swinging back into it while holding on with one hand, when slipping on oily derrick ladder while climbing down. Also struck left hip against ladder.

IncidentSummary: Crew was making up rod connections. When the polish rod on the well next to them snapped, it threw
IncidentDescription: Crew was making up rod connections. When the polish rod on the well next to them snapped, it threw off the rotator and miscellaneous parts that were connected to it. IE reacted by jumping over the handrail to the floor, that was about 4-feet from the ground, causing hardhat to come off his head. IE reached down to grab hardhat and upon standing back up, bumped head on the rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to the top of head while bending over to pick up hardhat that had fallen off while jumping over handrail that was about 4-feet from the ground, and striking head against rig floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was turning the hand crank on the light plant to scope it up. As the lights were going up, IE not
IncidentDescription: IE was turning the hand crank on the light plant to scope it up. As the lights were going up, IE noticed they were facing in opposite directions. IE stopped the crank and let go to adjust the lights. The pin that locks the crank in place did not engage, due to a worn-out spring. This caused the crank to turn and strike the IE on the left hand. Light Plant belongs to United Vision Rentals.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand after being struck by crank on light plant when pin that locks crank in place did not engage.

IncidentSummary: While snubbing out of hole in singles, the last 15 joints were wet-string. William Baker was operati
IncidentDescription: While snubbing out of hole in singles, the last 15 joints were wet-string. William Baker was operating tongs. When operator lifted joint off the tool joint, water got on William. William got mad, and after latching on was punching the elevators with fist. After knocking over the trash can full of thread protectors, William then proceeded off the rig floor. When he got to the bottom of the stairs, threw his hard hat, picked it up and threw it again. When tool pusher went out to confront him, he was still very angry. Went to Ozark medical on his own.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to hand after punching the elevators after water got on him when operator lifted joint off of the tool joint as William was operating the tongs. The last 15 joints were wet string.

IncidentSummary: At 7:30 PM on 12-31-14, IE called Randy Freeman and told him his back was hurting and he wouldn't be
IncidentDescription: At 7:30 PM on 12-31-14, IE called Randy Freeman and told him his back was hurting and he wouldn't be able to come to work the next morning. Randy asked if he had picked up something the wrong way at work and Charles said that he didn't think so. They had left work at 2:00 PM that day and Charles didn't say anything to Randy or the Operator as they were leaving regarding a back injury.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to back. Unknown cause.

IncidentSummary: While tripping in the hole with ST-80, the IE tailed a joint of drill pipe to the stump with a tail
IncidentDescription: While tripping in the hole with ST-80, the IE tailed a joint of drill pipe to the stump with a tail rope, placing the pin into the box. The other floorhand brought the ST-80 to the stump and spun the pipe in until pipe stopped. The pipe that is run is a double seal connection and the ST-80 doesn't always spin the pipe up tight before the rollers stop, causing you to have to torque the pipe several times before the desired makeup torque is reached. The driller and the tool pusher were standing behind the employee who was running the ST-80, discussing with the hand that he could try spinning the pipe in until it stops and then spin it out and back in to try and spin the pipe all the way up. During this time, the IE places his hands on the carriage assembly and when the hand running the ST-80 brought the head around into the make position, the IE's hand became smashed between the carriage assembly and the torque cylinder support.
InjuryDescripti: Contusions to left hand ring and middle fingers as well as hand.

IncidentSummary: Hands were pulling drill line off drum while rigging down. The IE had some burrs stick his hand thro
IncidentDescription: Hands were pulling drill line off drum while rigging down. The IE had some burrs stick his hand through his roughneck gloves. Federico Chavez asked him if he was OK because he saw him yank his hand back. He said he was ok that he just had a burr. Friday, the IE came in while rig manager was talking to John Vela. Then the IE asked John something in Spanish and John got a splinter kit out of the first aid box. The rig manager asked what was wrong and John said he had a burr. Today, the IE came in with Federico to translate because rig manager speaks very limited Spanish. His hand was a little swollen and he asked if there was anything he could take. They told the rig manager the story about the drill line and that he and John had removed three burrs with the splinter kit. He said he was fine until this morning. Rig manager cleaned it with alcohol, gave him some bandages and antibiotic ointment and told him to take it easy and to let him know if it became worse or if he was concerned. He left and came back later around 1:00PM. It was obviously swollen and he said it was throbbing and was concerned about infection.
InjuryDescripti: Punctures to right index finger from burrs off drilling line.

IncidentSummary: IE was exiting the doghouse after eating lunch, and stepped on a tire that was on a pallet being use
IncidentDescription: IE was exiting the doghouse after eating lunch, and stepped on a tire that was on a pallet being used as a step to get in and out of the doghouse.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right calf after stepping out of doghouse and onto tire that was on a pallet being used as a step.

IncidentSummary: The crew prepared to pick up 2-3/8" PH6 pipe using a pipe wrangler and slip-type elevators. While th
IncidentDescription: The crew prepared to pick up 2-3/8" PH6 pipe using a pipe wrangler and slip-type elevators. While the operator was lifting the first joint to a height of about 20', the pipe slipped out of the elevators and fell striking a tarp, grazing a workers right arm, the tongs and then dropped into the trough of the wrangler. A 1/2" fitting was broken off the tongs. The crew shut down operation and reported the incident to the supervisor. After reviewing the equipment, it was found that the crew had mistakingly installed 2-7/8" slip-type elevators instead of the required 2-3/8". The elevators had been brought out by a 3rd party tool company. They sent both elevators when the 2-3/8" were the only elevators required for this job, and are normally the only elevators used by this rig. The elevators were clearly stamped with the correct sizing. The fitting was replaced on the tongs which were then fully operational.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right arm after being grazed by falling pipe after it slipped out of elevators as it was being picked up by pipe wrangler.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The IE was standing on catwalk and Miguel Garza was on the forklift. Miguel was going to lift up a m
IncidentDescription: The IE was standing on catwalk and Miguel Garza was on the forklift. The monel started rolling when the IE put his foot to stop it and the monel rolled up against his foot and the edge of the catwalk.

IncidentSummary: Around the 10th of October Dylan started feeling some pain in his lower back. On the following week,
IncidentDescription: Around the 10th of October Dylan started feeling some pain in his lower back. On the following week, it started to intense more than prior and we still had no known cause to his back pain. Around the 20th was when he told Kenny that he was having some back pain. When he got off work on the 24th he went to the chiropractor. The doctor then stated that Dylan has a sprained lower back and needs time to rest and heal. Dylan stated to me that he has never had an ongoing back problem and doesn't know how it happened. If he had stepped wrong, pulling on his boots, or something else work-related. He returned to work on the 25th and the TP (Kenny Vanatta) told him to go home. On the 3rd of Nov he returned to the chiropractor. After the visit, Dyland called Kenny and told him that his back wasn't feeling well but never told Kenny he was going to be out for a week. He returned to work on the night of the 3rd and informed the pusher on tour (Shay Stromwald) what had happened the week prior.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to lower back, source of which cannot be determined.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the man basket, alone, trying to attach the cable to the injector head. The cable slipped
IncidentDescription: IE was in the man basket, alone, trying to attach the cable to the injector head. The cable slipped out of his hand and whipped back up into his face.

IncidentSummary: IE lost footing and fell 4-6 feet while coming down from the front driver side of the Western Star 4
IncidentDescription: IE lost footing and fell 4-6 feet while coming down from the front driver side of the Western Star 4500 swing cab crane, striking battery box before landing on the ground. There was fresh snow and rock on the ground. Coveralls were ripped on left knee, but no visible tear on jeans or blood on knee. The knee began swelling later that day. The crane was swung left of center and this was the only way down. Continental made the crew wait 2 hours because they only open or close both wells at the same time.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee after slipping and falling 4-6 feet to ground while exiting on front driver side of swing crane.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped tool string
IncidentDescription: During the safety meeting, our engineer wanted to lay down lubricator on each run, but company man elected no to do so. Our engineer was lifting tool assembly into lubricator on CC Forbes rig and had about 60' of lubricator with grease-head, and a 42' tool string. Did not have enough room for the tool string to enter the lubricator. Lubricator company put a person in man lift and moved the lubricator over so the tool string could enter. The employee could not hold on to the lubricator and the tool string fell off the line as he released it. The tool string fell and damaged the packer assembly.

IncidentSummary: Injured employee was cleaning cuttings from shaker screens. He then decided to go to turn on a trans
IncidentDescription: Injured employee was cleaning cuttings from shaker screens. He then decided to go to turn on a transfer pump behind the mud tanks. When he started walking down the stairs, he tripped on the overhang at the bottom of the stairs. He then lost his balance, falling forward striking his right forearm below the elbow on the right handrail. He then rolled 15 ft down stairs the bottom landing on the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back and contusion to right forearm after falling down stairs.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P in buffer zone
IncidentDescription: Third party casing hand was standing in buffer zone around catwalk while a joint of casing was being lifted to rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/ladder, near slip-fall

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure release
IncidentDescription: While breaking down a setting tool, a newer employee noticed the tool was coming apart hard, and realized that it had trapped pressure. He stopped and asked for help from a more experienced employee. They then cleared the area and started taking the tool apart. The section of the tool that they were working on blew off and hit our trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS well prematurely opened
IncidentDescription: Frac was completed on stage #14. Well was salted up, closed and bled off and tool string was pick up and stabbed onto the well. Halliburton was notified we were ready to equalize. Frac said they had to knock a couple pumps offline and they were going to be "a few minutes." I informed them we were going to shut our grease off and standby. Dan did not know the grease was killed off. After 15 minutes, Halliburton informed they were ready to equalize us. Walking back, I saw the sheave and wireline jump and was told there was 3800 lbs showing. Dan had opened the well prematurely via the hydraulic valve. Well was bled down and tool string was inspected. Everything look good, but we decided to pull line and re-head to be safe. See attachment in private documents for more detailed info.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning the sub caps in the shop using a bench grinder with a wire wheel. IE was holding the
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning the sub caps in the shop using a bench grinder with a wire wheel. IE was holding the cap with just an Allen wrench, while cleaning the threads on the cap, and the wire wheel pulled the cap off the Allen wrench. With the guard not adjusted properly on the bench grinder, the grinder threw the cap back at the IE's hand cutting the back of his ring finger between the 1st and 2nd knuckle.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left ring finger between 1st and 2nd knuckle after being struck by the sub cap being held by an Allen wrench, when the grinder threw it back due to the guard not being adjusted properly on the grinder.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/wrench
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While torquing bolts on compression ring on top drive, torque wrench slipped and almost struck another employee in the face.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While floorhand was making up hammer union the hammer came off handle and nearly striking another employee. Employee was able to move before hammer landed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ladder, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While working in the sub floorhand almost slipped on ladder due to muddy boots from walking on muddy ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/scrub brush
IncidentDescription: While employee was scrubbing top of dog house he dropped his scrub brush almost striking another employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/slips, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe in hole, floor hand nearly slipped while setting slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/unsecured hose
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While discharging KSW vac, hose came out of reserve pit liking to almost hit employee when emptying vac.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/sledge hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was using sledge hammer with cracked handle.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand slipped on ice and like to fell but caught his balance where a hose was left running on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: The crew was hydro-testing in the hole with 2 7/8" pipe. The IE was laying down 2 7/8" pipe from the
IncidentDescription: The crew was hydro-testing in the hole with 2 7/8" pipe. The IE was laying down 2 7/8" pipe from the rig floor to the ground and tailing 2 7/8" pipe to the rig floor. While the crew laid down and picked up 15 joints of 2 7/8" pipe throughout the day the IE felt a strain in the lower back. The IE worked the entire shift.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while crew was laying down and picking up 2-7/8" pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE walked up to the rig floor, grabbed the pump-T, turned around and slipped on the base beam. One s
IncidentDescription: IE walked up to the rig floor, grabbed the pump-T, turned around and slipped on the base beam. One side of the pump-T hit the beam and the other side hit the IE on the mouth.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to mouth after slipping on base beam and striking mouth on the pump-T.

IncidentSummary: While assisting rig crew change out a seat on pump #2 rig manager stepped off of mud pump skid slipp
IncidentDescription: While assisting rig crew change out a seat on pump #2 rig manager stepped off of mud pump skid slipping on the plastic liner that is laid out under all backyard equipment. Manager did not fall down but felt discomfort in his groin area.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain in groin area after experience a near slip-fall as IE was stepping down from mud pump skid.

IncidentSummary: After tripping out of hole, the IE was closing the hurricane bar. While pushing it back, the IE righ
IncidentDescription: After tripping out of hole, the IE was closing the hurricane bar. While pushing it back, the IE right hand slipped, causing his right middle finger to be pinched between hurricane bar and sleeve that bar slides into.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger when it was pinched between hurricane bar and sleeve that bar slides into.

IncidentSummary: IE and the crew were getting ready for a job and they had the weight bar in the vice on the back bum
IncidentDescription: IE and the crew were getting ready for a job and they had the weight bar in the vice on the back bumper of the perforator. As they were adjusting the bar to extend it further over the bumper, the IE underestimated the weight of the bar and got his right pinky finger smashed between the bar and the hinge of the back step on the bumper.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right pinky finger after it was caught between weight bar and bumper, as it was being adjusted while unloading it from back of truck.

IncidentSummary: MISS RKI/hand placement, tongs
IncidentDescription: Employee had hand in potentially serious pinch point while using tongs.

IncidentSummary: Left hand second finger struck (see attached)
IncidentDescription: Left hand second finger struck (see attached)
InjuryDescripti: PENDING

IncidentSummary: IE fell into perimeter canal as he tried to dodge a falling pipe off a forklift which struck him on
IncidentDescription: IE fell into perimeter canal as he tried to dodge a falling pipe off a forklift which struck him on the left clavicle.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion of left clavicle as the result of being struck by pipe.

IncidentSummary: refer to attached document.
IncidentDescription: refer to attached document.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to finger as IE was preparing to paint tong.

IncidentSummary: Unable to discern details of the incident from the report submitted (see attached).
IncidentDescription: Unable to discern details of the incident from the report submitted (see attached).
