IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While stabbing rotating rubber inside trip nipple, floorhand missed stabbed the drill pipe in the head of rubber causing nipple to turn over knocking floorhand off balance towards the A-leg.

IncidentSummary: IE was unloading pipe off a truck and caught right middle finger between two pieces of pipe.
IncidentDescription: IE was unloading pipe off a truck and caught right middle finger between two pieces of pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger after it was caught between two pieces of pipe while unloaded them from back of truck.

IncidentSummary: Crew was washing unit #117 at The Grease Rack truck wash. IE, the driller for Rig 109, was helping w
IncidentDescription: Crew was washing unit #117 at The Grease Rack truck wash. IE, the driller for Rig 109, was helping wash the dog house. Once they were finished, IE was loading two 4-gallon jugs of gasoline back into the dog house and felt a strain in the lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back lifting two 4-gallon jugs of gasoline while loading them back into dog house after being washed at truck wash.

IncidentSummary: When making up string mill, IE put 60" pipe wrench on mill then hammered it on for a tight grip. IE
IncidentDescription: When making up string mill, IE put 60" pipe wrench on mill then hammered it on for a tight grip. IE started the 2nd mill onto the first by hand, then got a 36" pipe wrench to finish tightening the mills together. As pressure was put on the 36" pipe wrench, the grip on the 60" wrench slipped, straining lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain lo lower back after 36" pipe wrench slipped while tightening two string mills together.

IncidentSummary: Prior to loading the gun, IE was cutting electrical tape off of a gun part with a razor blade, when
IncidentDescription: Prior to loading the gun, IE was cutting electrical tape off of a gun part with a razor blade, when it slipped and cut the top of the right ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger after razor blade being used to cut electrical tape off a gun part slipped.

IncidentSummary: Hit bridge. See attached statement from driver.
IncidentDescription: Hit bridge. See attached statement from driver.
InjuryDescripti: Struck bridge with spool while driving truck.

IncidentSummary: The IE reported that he had a small protrusion on his left groin area. Employee did not know how or
IncidentDescription: The IE reported that he had a small protrusion on his left groin area. Employee did not know how or when the strain occurred.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left groin area while rolling casing.

IncidentSummary: While conducting a tubular inventory in drilling yard employee was walking over and through metal st
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While conducting a tubular inventory in drilling yard employee was walking over and through metal stock, when employee lost footing his left foot became wedged in between 2 pieces of 4Gǥ I-beam, causing employee to lose balance and fall to ground while left foot was still in between beams. This caused employeeGs left ankle to fracture.
InjuryDescripti: fracture to fibula after stepping on scrap metal, foot slipped, left ankle was twisted.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hand placement
IncidentDescription: Employees were working on changing out rubbers on rotating head and were hammering on the top when employee was not paying attention and put his hand right by where the other employee was hammering on. He almost had his hand struck by the hammer.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped off trailer on onto pipe stand used as a step. Stand rolled backwards causing IE to fall
IncidentDescription: IE stepped off trailer on onto pipe stand used as a step. Stand rolled backwards causing IE to fall and strike knee on ground.
InjuryDescripti: Bruise to right knee when exiting trailer and falling to ground, after slipping off gun stand being used as a step.

IncidentSummary: IE had hand on elevator handle while helping crew open elevators on rig floor. As the elevator was o
IncidentDescription: IE had hand on elevator handle while helping crew open elevators on rig floor. As the elevator was opened, left index finger was caught between the handles and the tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left index finger as elevator was opened and finger on handle was caught between handle and the tongs.

IncidentSummary: While crew was rigging up the hydraulic catwalk trough using the winch line, the driller began to wi
IncidentDescription: While crew was rigging up the hydraulic catwalk trough using the winch line, the driller began to winch up the trough while IE was holding and guiding the trough as it was lifted. As IE attempted to stop the trough from skidding forward, a sharp pain was felt in the lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back when attempting to stop a trough from skidding forward as it being winched up.

IncidentSummary: IE was using a punch to knock out a roll-pin on hydraulic jars. Punch was in left hand and IE hit pu
IncidentDescription: IE was using a punch to knock out a roll-pin on hydraulic jars. Punch was in left hand and IE hit punch with hammer to knock out roll-pin. Punch broke and punctured just below the pinky finger on the left hand. IE shook left hand and a piece of punch flew out.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left hand below pinky finger after punch being used to hammer out roll-pin broke, striking hand.

IncidentSummary: At approximately 2PM, the crew was preparing to make a connection after making up the 4" stand and t
IncidentDescription: At approximately 2PM, the crew was preparing to make a connection after making up the 4" stand and the IE bent down and pulled on the slips and felt a strain in his back. There were two employees pulling the slips at the time.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: IE drove to Rig 102 to exchange a chute/slide for the catwalk. Upon leaving the location, IE was ste
IncidentDescription: IE drove to Rig 102 to exchange a chute/slide for the catwalk. Upon leaving the location, IE was stepping out of the truck to close the gate and experienced a sharp pain in the mid- to upper back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to mid- to upper back upon stepping out of truck to close gate when leaving location.

IncidentSummary: IE was working in the shop and two metal clips flew off and struck the left upper leg, breaking the
IncidentDescription: IE was working in the shop and two metal clips flew off and struck the left upper leg, breaking the skin.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left leg after being struck by two metal chips while working in the shop.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/rig floor, slip-fall hazard
IncidentDescription: Floor was slick due to MF55 employee slipped but did not fall.

IncidentSummary: IE tripped and fell over hydraulic hose and landed on left hand, injuring wrist.
IncidentDescription: IE tripped and fell over hydraulic hose and landed on left hand, injuring wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left wrist after tripping and falling over hydraulic hose on ground.

IncidentSummary: While laying down flex monel out of the hole, two employees were pulling drill pipe slips out of rot
IncidentDescription: While laying down flex monel out of the hole, two employees were pulling drill pipe slips out of rotary table when the IE felt a pain in his lower back. The incident occurred 30 minutes prior to relief and the IE did not report pain in his back until the next morning 12.5 hours later.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while pulling slips.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: After unhanging the casing tongs off the hanging line, the employees were bringing the winch line ov
IncidentDescription: After unhanging the casing tongs off the hanging line, the employees were bringing the winch line over the top drive so they could use the winch to rig up cementers. The employees brought the winch line to the height that it could be passed over the top drive. An employee was in the derrick assisting the cable over the top drive. After the employee raised the hooks 2.5 feet, he passed the hooks over the top drive and stepped around to the front of the derrick to assist the cable down. Once he got there, he noticed the cable was not there and looked up to see that it had traveled to the shiv at the crown. The double hook and swivel had come off and fell to the floor, striking the IE. The IE was looking up to tell the employee in the derrick that he should go to the board to assist the cable down. As he was attempting to communicate to the employee in the derrick, a Halliburton employee said "Look out". He attempted to jump out of the way and was struck in the middle of his back.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to upper back when struck by double hook and swivel.

IncidentSummary: IE was assisting with picking up the k-bar. While tailing, IE stepped on a joint of tubing which had
IncidentDescription: IE was assisting with picking up the k-bar. While tailing, IE stepped on a joint of tubing which had fresh snow on it.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after stepping on joint of tubing covered in fresh snow and falling on k-bar.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS stuck K-bar, rod
IncidentDescription:
After stripping out of the well the crew was unable to remove that K-bar and pull rod.  They decided to remove the top 
joint and let the K-bar fall.  When they did the K-bar fell and the pin snapped off and the pipe jumped.  The operator 
left the operator stand and the pipe went down hole.  The slips will ever was found to be in the open position.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/sala, high wind
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole the wind picked up severely. The off Side sala got caught on the top drive while the driller was going up with it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, pipe tube
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand was backing up his truck and was not paying attention and he almost side swiped pipe tube.

IncidentSummary: While nippling up the BOP, the IE and Justin Hoover were standing at ground level next to the cellar
IncidentDescription: While nippling up the BOP, the IE and Justin Hoover were standing at ground level next to the cellar installing the bolts that connect the BOP to the spacer spools. IE went to install a nut on stud when his feet slid from under him causing him to fall appx. 3 ft. to the casing valve, striking his left hip before falling another 3 ft. to the bottom of the cellar landing on his feet in the mud.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left hip as the result of the IE slipping and falling and striking a casing valve.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/traveling block
IncidentDescription: Driller engaged in drawworks and ran elevators up to latch a stand of HWDP. Latched onto the stand of HWDP and picked up same. Floated the elevators in and stabbed the pipe in the stump with the ST-80. Driller picked up off the slips and engaged the Wichita brake at 5psi. Lifted brake handle to bring stand down. Applied pressure to brake but noticed the pipe was not slowing in descent. Driller applied his full weight to the brake handle and told the crew to get off the floor. Driller engaged the drum clutch but was not able to the stop the pipe before the elevators made contact with the rotary table. The traveling block laid over at appx. 45 degree angle before clutch engaged and lifted the traveling block back to a vertical position. Chained the brake handle down, checked on crew members and called to report the incident.

IncidentSummary: The crew was preparing the rig for start-up. The IE walked around the front of the rig and slipped o
IncidentDescription: The crew was preparing the rig for start-up. The IE walked around the front of the rig and slipped on snow and ice and struck right side of lower back on rock. After being helped up by another worker, the IE walked to the doghouse and the supervisor was notified.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after slipping on snow and ice and striking lower back against rock.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ST-80, pin, bracket
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of the hole, the ST-80 extended and slammed into the pipe. Upon investigation, crew found that the yoke on the extension cylinder and the pin for that cylinder had broken and released the ST-80's weight and causing it to spring out. Both the pin and the bracket that the cylinder pinned to showed significant wear. No employee was between it and the pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE was carrying grease head back to rear bumper and felt a popping in right shoulder, hip and back.
IncidentDescription: IE was carrying grease head back to rear bumper and felt a popping in right shoulder, hip and back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder, hip and back while carrying grease head back to rear bumper.

IncidentSummary: The IE was on the floor helping remove the center steal. The sub was squared and the IE was tied of
IncidentDescription: The IE was on the floor helping remove the center steal. The sub was squared and the IE was tied off, working roughly 5' off the ground while removing a pin. After removing the pin, he was climbing down into the sub area, reached the ground level and his back D ring on his harness became hung up behind him, causing him to lose his balance and fall to his knees at an awkward angle and his left knee was twisted. He has had past issues and surgeries to that knee and just wanted to report it. He took a break and ibuprofen and returned to work.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee after harness D ring hung up and he lost balance and fell on knee at awkward angle.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping barge operator with the spuds. The company rep was rushing the crew to get the equipm
IncidentDescription: IE was helping barge operator with the spuds. The company rep was rushing the crew to get the equipment loaded so they could get the barges spotted. Once the equipment was on the barge they were picking up the spuds. The barge operator asked the IE to help put the pins in the spuds as he lifted them. IE was putting the last pin in place when the barge operator let go of the handle, the brake did not hold and IE's right hand was smashed.
InjuryDescripti: Fractures to right index and middle fingers when they were smashed while putting pin in spud after barge operator let go of handle. Update: Resulted in amputation of right index at a later date.

IncidentSummary: IE developed an infection on the left index finger of unknown origin. Initially thought to be caused
IncidentDescription: IE developed an infection on the left index finger of unknown origin. Initially thought to be caused by a metal sliver. I appears to be caused by substances along the nail, (dirt, oil, etc).
InjuryDescripti: Infection of left index finger of unknown origin.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, electric line
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: 3rd party driver was relocating pressure washer trailer and nearly ran over an unprotected electric line.

IncidentSummary: The crew was laying down rods and the rod pump. The second floor hand was walking out the rod pump w
IncidentDescription: The crew was laying down rods and the rod pump. The second floor hand was walking out the rod pump while the operator was lowering the blocks. The rig manager unlatched the elevators and laid down the rod pump on the cellar. As the IE and 2nd floor hand each picked up an end of the rod pump and started walking towards the sills, the IE's right foot slipped on the ice, left leg slid to the right causing IE to fall to ground. IE heard a "pop" as the rod pump landed on left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee after slipping on ice and being struck by rod pump being carried.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription: Knocking off choke line crew member miss with hammer like to hit himself.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping nitrogen rig up. He was walking backwards with an iron line, and stepped 2 feet down
IncidentDescription: IE was helping nitrogen rig up. He was walking backwards with an iron line, and stepped 2 feet down into the cellar. IE struck lower back against casing valve locking pins.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after falling 2 feet into cellar and striking casing valve locking pins, while walking backward with an iron line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall, bull wheel
IncidentDescription: Turning bull wheel with rachet rachet slip and crew member like to fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Crew members were rigging down and sending tongs down V-door the two inch hose used to pump on the casing was laying on the rig floor and the employee got his foot caught on it causing him to almost slip.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/body placement
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While rolling casing a crew member was between 2 joints of casing as casing was still being moved.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/well head, loose chain
IncidentDescription: Putting well head near chain came undone like to fell if it hit someone and somebody would have got hurt.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription: Crew members were pulling slips while laying down drill pipe. The ST-80 was not moved back far enough causing the employee to set between the ST-80 and elevators; wrong body placement.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/manlift, pressure washer hose
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While moving manlift out of water flood area noticed the manlift had been left parked on pressure washer hoses which could have (illegible) up on axles.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/thread protectors
IncidentDescription: Running casing thread protector came out of trough like to hit crew member.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/body placement
IncidentDescription: Crew member had his back turn to pipe wrangler operator saw him and stop.

IncidentSummary: The IE was removing a 1" quick release and nipple out of annular on BOP to place a 1" plug so that o
IncidentDescription: The IE was removing a 1" quick release and nipple out of annular on BOP to place a 1" plug so that oil would not leak out on ground during rig move. The IE was backing out nipple and got to the end of the threads on the nipple and it got tight. The IE started using a pipe wrench to continue removing nipple on annular. He reached over the nipple with his body to grab the pipe wrench and the nipple had pressure behind it and shot out of the annular, striking him in the abdominal area on his left side. Reported it to the rig manager.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left side of abdomen when struck by nipple.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/slips, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: After making connection went to pull slips when the handle from the slips broke off and employee almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/forklift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Pole truck pick up house, forklift started pushing wood block out from under house and almost hit house.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/mousehole, blocks
IncidentDescription: While laying down mousehole, mousehole almost struck blocks while being hoisted up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/hand placement
IncidentDescription: While employee was rigging up casing equipment, he had his hand in the wrong place and almost got his finger pinched between tongs and derrick.

IncidentSummary: MISS Cohort/body placement
IncidentDescription: While rigging up loggers crew logger nearly got caught between pulley and drill pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Cohort/mat, near trip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand was tail-roping in the drill pipe when he tripped on the mat nearly losing his balance when tripping in the hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS CML/stairs, hand placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was coming down stairs with his hands in his pockets.

IncidentSummary: MISS CML/pipewrench, improper use of tool(s)
IncidentDescription: An employee was using the wrong tool for the job using a pipe wrench as a hammer.

IncidentSummary: MISS CML/forklift, lighting
IncidentDescription: Employee could not see in dark while using the forklift. The forklift lights weren't working.

IncidentSummary: MISS CML/tail rope
IncidentDescription: Hand was about to tail in drill pipe without using rope. Other hand stopped him, showed him how to tail in pipe using rope.

IncidentSummary: While racking back drill collars, the mule line broke and the broken cable and chain fell, which was
IncidentDescription: While racking back drill collars, the mule line broke and the broken cable and chain fell, which was 5' long and 18" 5/16" chain, to floor, hitting the IE in the back and back of hard hat.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to back of head when struck by broken cable and chain which fell from derrick.

IncidentSummary: IE shut pump off, and while going to bleed it off, stepped off pump and rolled right ankle.
IncidentDescription: IE shut pump off, and while going to bleed it off, stepped off pump and rolled right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after rolling ankle upon stepping down from pump.

IncidentSummary: While taking coveralls off, IE stubbed finger on boot.
IncidentDescription: While taking coveralls off, IE stubbed finger on boot.
InjuryDescripti: Dislocated right middle finger after stubbing it on boot while taking coveralls off.

IncidentSummary: The IE was filling up pressure washer. After it was full, he shut the water off and started to walk
IncidentDescription: The IE was filling up pressure washer. After it was full, he shut the water off and started to walk to to the substructure. He tripped on the suitcase from the sub to the #1 pump, fell and hit his right shoulder on the wood location.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder after tripping and falling on it on wood location.

IncidentSummary: The electrician was riding an extractor used to work in confined spaces. At the time of the test, th
IncidentDescription: The electrician was riding an extractor used to work in confined spaces. At the time of the test, the blades hit the guard exhaust and worker injured second finger of the right hand to pull the guard with the fan causing trauma to the distal phalanx of same.
InjuryDescripti: Amputation of 2nd finger, right hand, as a result of IE trying to extract an exhaust guard that had been struck by a fan blade.

IncidentSummary: The crew was preparing to lay down a joint of 2 7/8" tubing. The IE walked on the floor under the jo
IncidentDescription: The crew was preparing to lay down a joint of 2 7/8" tubing. The IE walked on the floor under the joint of tubing, but was directed to get back so he wasn't under the tubing. The IE turned and fell over a flow line causing him to twist right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after falling over flow line while moving out of the way of a raised joint of tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE stepped out of tool container onto deck of the trailer and stepped on hydraulic hoses that were o
IncidentDescription: IE stepped out of tool container onto deck of the trailer and stepped on hydraulic hoses that were on the deck of the trailer, rolling left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to left ankle after stepping out of tool trailer and onto hydraulic hoses on deck of trailer.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping pipe in the hole. They were making up a stand when the IE and co-worker, James
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping pipe in the hole. They were making up a stand when the IE and co-worker, James, started to lift up the tongs. The IE had his hand on top of the tongs in the wrong spot and his left thumb got smashed between pipe spinners and tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left thumb when caught between pipe spinners and tongs.

IncidentSummary: MISS Continental Resources pin (ND)
IncidentDescription: The pin that holds the bottom part of the brake on was broken.  Pin was welded on one end.  Pin broke along weld.

IncidentSummary: MISS bent drum guard plate (ND)
IncidentDescription:
While tripping in tubing, a clamp came loose causing the tail of the line to slip out and strike the plate on the drum guards, bending 
it down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, windwalls
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand hooked the crane up to the wind wall and put his tag line on it and told the crane operator to lift it. When the wind wall came up, it swung and almost struck another 3rd party hand because he was not paying attention.

IncidentSummary: IE and Lloyd Savage (IE#2) were in the shop laying the rig floor down for repairs. IE was running th
IncidentDescription: IE and Lloyd Savage (IE#2) were in the shop laying the rig floor down for repairs. IE was running the winch line from the operators stand. There was no air to the rig so they let the air build up in the rig. Lloyd walked around in front of the floor as the IE unhooked the stow chain off the derrick. The IE then let out tension off the winch line and stopped. The floor stayed secured. Lloyd asked for more slack on the winch line and as the IE gave it more slack, the floor started to move forward. The IE grabbed the floor with his right hand to try and stop it and was dragged off the operator stand, which was about 5 feet off the ground. The IE landed on the shop floor, on the left elbow, about 20 feet from the operators stand.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to left elbow after being drug off the operators stand, falling five feet and landing twenty feet away on the shop floor.

IncidentSummary: IE and Marcos Jimenez (IE#2), were in the shop laying down the rig floor for repairs. Marcos was run
IncidentDescription: IE and Marcos Jimenez (IE#2), were in the shop laying down the rig floor for repairs. Marcos was running the winch line from the operators stand. There was no air to the rig, so they let the air build up in the rig. The IE walked around in front of the floor and Marcos unhooked the stow chain off the derrick and let tension off the winch line and stopped. The floor stayed secured. IE asked for more slack on the winch line and when Marcos gave it slack, the floor started to move forward. Marcos yelled to the IE to watch out and to get away from the floor. IE moved to his left and ducked his head. The floor came down on top of the IE, pushing the IE down on hands and knees between the rig floor and shop floor. Three mechanics picked up the rig floor and the IE rolled out from under it. The operations manager was immediately notified and 911 called. The IE was laid on right side with pillow under head. He had feelings in both arms and legs. Taken by ambulance Medical Center in Williston and then airlifted to Hospital in Minot.
InjuryDescripti: Trauma to lung (collapsed) and ribs (fractures), after being caught between rig floor and shop floor, when rig floor moved forward when slack was given to winch line.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on the setting tool mandrel. When spring stuck, the IE used a pick to try and loosen
IncidentDescription: IE was working on the setting tool mandrel. When spring stuck, the IE used a pick to try and loosen it and stabbed left hand with pick.

IncidentSummary: As IE was pulling dolly to lay down gun string, stepped on left foot wrong and rolled ankle.
IncidentDescription: As IE was pulling dolly to lay down gun string, stepped on left foot wrong and rolled ankle.

IncidentSummary: IE was carrying a gun that was to be hooked up and slipped on containment covered with snow and grea
IncidentDescription: IE was carrying a gun that was to be hooked up and slipped on containment covered with snow and grease. Containment was on top of ruts and rugged ground. Strained shoulder while trying not to drop gun. (4 barrels, 2 ft, 100 lbs.)
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder after slipping on containment and trying not to drop 100 lb gun being carried.

IncidentSummary: IE is ALLEGING that he has a chemical burn on the back of left leg. The crew began performing a rout
IncidentDescription: IE is ALLEGING that he has a chemical burn on the back of left leg. The crew began performing a routine clean-out at 7:00 AM. At 9:00 AM, IE states that started raining and pants got wet. Supervisor told IE to bring slicker suit to location, but IE did not and said it would be OK to work without it. After working in the cold rain for a few hours, the back side of left leg became irritated. IE thought it was just pants rubbing against the leg. IE states since they were working on Rig 26, they didn't have the doghouse with extra uniforms so he couldn't change clothes. IE states by the end of the day left leg was very uncomfortable. The supervisor noticed IE was walking funny and asked if IE was OK. IE replied that it was just a rash. The crew has not worked since that day. IE went to personal doctor on 03-02-15 and doctor is stating it COULD be a potential chemical burn. IE does not have personal insurance. The ticket shows calcium chloride, but supervisor states there wasn't any in the well. IE signed the ticket at the end of they day that he was not injured.
InjuryDescripti: Alleged irritation to left leg after working in rain performing a routine clean-out.

IncidentSummary: MISS snapped hitch pin (BR)

When winch operator began picking up on load, the pin the keeps the pole from scoping in/out snapped in half, causing the poles to shift towards the driver side. The truck was last inspected by out truck supervisor on 3-2-15. It was last inspected and certified by Laguna Crane Services in June, 2014.

IncidentSummary: The crew was doing a strip job with rods stuck in 2 7/8" tubing. They had 108 stands and couldn't ge
IncidentDescription: The crew was doing a strip job with rods stuck in 2 7/8" tubing. They had 108 stands and couldn't get far when they tried swabbing. They stood back the swab, raised the tubing and removed 1 joint. the rods were sticking up about 8' so they tried to raise the rod string. The consultant said the pump was bigger than the tubing and they needed to back off tool to try and get as many rods as possible. After they backed off, a rod elevator was installed on the top rod and the tubing elevators were installed below to lift the rods. The rods were raised to the next box and another rod elevator was installed on top of the tubing. The top rod was removed and laid down. The IE was using the tubing elevator below the rod elevator next to the collar to raise the rod string and latch the tubing elevator. As the operator came up, the blocks raised the rods several inches. The IE then slipped, allowing the tubing elevator to slip out and the rod string to come down, pinching his fingers between the rod elevator and tubing collar.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right middle finger after it was caught between rod elevator and tubing collar.

IncidentSummary: IE was assisting another employee move ST-80 when he decided to remove his hand off the handle at th
IncidentDescription: IE was assisting another employee move ST-80 when he decided to remove his hand off the handle at that time; his right thumb was caught between the ST-80 handle and the drill pipe that was standing in close proximity causing a laceration/contusion to his right thumb. IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thumb when IE placed right hand between the ST-80 handle and the drill pipe.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping rods out of hole, which had 2 7/8" pipe in it. For some reason, they had a cro
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping rods out of hole, which had 2 7/8" pipe in it. For some reason, they had a crossover back to 2 3/8" on top. When the pump hit the crossover, it pulled the pull rod out of the pump, the rod went up in the air and as it came down struck the IE on the arm.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left arm after being struck by falling pull rod that had popped out of the pump and flown into the air.

IncidentSummary: The crew was coming out of the hole with rods and hanging them in the rod basket. While coming out o
IncidentDescription: The crew was coming out of the hole with rods and hanging them in the rod basket. While coming out of the hole pulling rods, the operator, Martin O'Campo, missed a rod box as he was counting them. Due to missing the 2nd rod box coming out of the hole, he attempted to pull a stand of four rods. As the blocks approached the crown of the rig, the Posi-Stop Crown-Out/Floor Out Device, was activated brought the blocks to a stop at the crown of the rig. The Posi-Stop was set high so the blocks were not able to come to a complete stop before tapping the crown. When this happened, the IE jumped off the rig floor to escape the line-of-fire and bruised his right heel.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to heel of right foot after jumping off rig floor out of the way of the blocks as they were being stopped by the Posi- Stop at the crown of the rig.

IncidentDescription: IE was breaking bolts on HCR line to chock manifold with sledge hammer; when hammering down on hammer wrench, hurt lower back.

IncidentDescription: The rig crew was pulling out of the hole with 2-7/8" PH-6 tubing in stands. In the process of racking back a stand, IE unlatched the 2-7/8" slip-type elevators with left hand and was struck on the hand by the elevators.

IncidentDescription: After employee finished taking off Koomey lines off of BOPs, he unhooked his SRL and proceeded to walk out of the sub. IncidentSummary: IE was grabbing his work clothes that were inside a trash bag in the doghouse. While exiting the dog
IncidentDescription: IE was grabbing his work clothes that were inside a trash bag in the doghouse. While exiting the doghouse through side door, IE stepped on a spool of wire rope that was being used as a step. The spool flipped over and the IE fell to the ground.

IncidentDescription: IE was tightening stud for wear plate using 3/4" socket wrench. Standing on 18" platform pulling toward himself and the wrench slipped and he fell backward his leg went under the step.

IncidentDescription: Rig crew was laying down drill pipe on catwalk and a hook flew up and struck IE in the left shin as he stood by back of truck.

IncidentSummary: MISS faulty equip/dropped gun

IncidentSummary: MISS falling handrail (KN)
IncidentDescription: Crew was attempting to hoist up a chain with catline to the rig floor. The catline hook got caught up on the handrail causing it to come out of the slot and fall to the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/J-box, topdrive
IncidentDescription: EXTRACT FROM SAFETY ALERT: Crew were drilling surface at a depth of 190 ft. The driller was attempting to torque up a drill collar; however the top- drive would not drop the shot pin to allow grabber to engage pipe. It was during this time that a floor hand saw the cover plate to the topdrives junction box was lying on the rig floor near the v-door on the off drillers side (pic #1). Neither the company man nor any of our employees that were on the rig floor reported seeing or hearing when or how the junction box came in contact with anything, however they could see the J-box hanging off the top-drive. The job was immediately stopped and area secured. After further investigation it was determined that due to extreme rigorous shaking and vibration of the top drive, the spot welds on the junction box (pic #2) had broken loose allowing the top part of the  box to fall out forward away from top-drive and come in contact with the pivot mount of the derrick board. Because in the process of drilling, the highest point the top drive peaks out at would still have the J-box 10-12 feet below the derrick board, it was determined that the contact was made while pulling out a stand from the mouse hole. At that point, the door/cover (18x20 inch appx. 2 lbs.) plate on the rig floor would have fallen approximately 70 feet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/fitting, J-box, topdrive
IncidentDescription:
Following making a connection the driller began rotating the drill string with the TDS10 and set the bit back on bottom. Very soon thereafter a fitting fell to the rig floor from the TDS10 (appx. 75 ft.) As per the agreed upon procedure following the J-box cover falling to the floor (see INC# 2617 & 2618) all personnel had vacated the drill floor prior to drilling procedures commencing.

EXTRACT FROM SAFETY ALERT: This alert is directly related to a previous alert pertaining to a junction box coming in contact with the derrick board. During repairs to the junction box the third party serviceman conducting the repairs left a 90 degree fitting that was 5 inches in length and weighed 6 ounces (pic #1) hanging from the box that served no purpose and was not securely tightened. After a day of drilling surface, the fitting loosened itself out of lock washers that were designed to hold in place and fell to rig floor approx. 70-75 feet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/bolts, tongs
IncidentDescription:
While running casing I went down to change out a actuator valve cap on the #2 hydraulic winch that we were no longer using. When I went to lock out the winch and bleed off the pressure it actuated the valve and picked up the back up tongs for the casing crew, a bolt snapped and they fell to the floor from about 8'. I was unaware that the hoist were tied together

EXTRACT FROM SAFETY ALERT: While running casing, Rig Manager began the lock out/tag out procedure to change out an actuator valve cap on the #2 hydraulic winch that was broken and leaking fluid. Employee assumed that he could isolate the power source by by-passing the valve and bleeding off the pressure. As he removed the damaged actuator valve, hydraulic fluid began to gush out and the spring inside the actuator disengaged which allowed the hydraulic winch to come out of neutral. This caused the winch to pull up on casing tongs that were attached to the A- leg and snap two  inch bolts securing the tongs. As a result the casing tongs were jerked up and fell to rig floor approximately 7-8 feet. This was only stopped because at the time, the rig manager had the new replacement valve cap in his hand and instinctively secured it in place of the damaged one.

IncidentSummary: As crew was picking up pipe, Operator, Willie Hernandez, picked up a joint of pipe as IE was attempt
IncidentDescription: As crew was picking up pipe, Operator, Willie Hernandez, picked up a joint of pipe as IE was attempting to make up the connection on the pipe. Lay-down Operator, Ramiro Rodriguez, pushed pipe forward to attempt to move it into ready position. IE stated the handle on lay-down machine stuck, resulting in 2-3/8" pipe striking IE on upper left side of back.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to upper back after being struck by 2-3/8" pipe after handle on lay-down machine stuck.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While drilling ahead lightning struck the rig. The lightning strike caused damage to the top drive e
IncidentDescription: While drilling ahead lightning struck the rig. The lightning strike caused damage to the top drive encoder, and the lube pump for the #2 pump. When the lightning struck the derrick, the injured employee was priming a pump on the frac tanks. There was standing water in containment where derrick hand was working. After lightning strike, the derrick hand told the driller he felt the lightning strike and felt "tingly" with soreness in knees and joints. Driller asked if he was okay or needed medical attention. Derrick hand told him no he was fine to work. Driller reported it to rig manager at relief time. Rig manager asked derrick hand if he was okay or if there was any injury that he had sustained that needed to be reported. Derrick hand said there was no injury that he felt fine, however, he wanted to report it to document what happened
InjuryDescripti: Possible electrical shock as a result of a nearby lightning strike.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped to far out of gun loading trailer from the side door onto the metal step and hit the edge
IncidentDescription: IE stepped to far out of gun loading trailer from the side door onto the metal step and hit the edge of the step and flipped it over. IE then struck step while falling to the ground, bruising lower rib cage.
InjuryDescripti: Bruise to lower abdominal area after falling and striking metal step while exiting gun trailer.

IncidentDescription: While making connection, IE pulled slips and felt a sharp pain in left bicep. IE notified driller of incident and was then sent to tool pusher shack. A long knot was observed on left bicep.

IncidentSummary: There was a 2" X 5000# TEE rigged up off a cementing swivel and connected to a pump truck. Pump truc
IncidentDescription: There was a 2" X 5000# TEE rigged up off a cementing swivel and connected to a pump truck. Pump truck was pressuring up to 750 PSI on line. IncidentDescription: While propping cooler cover for new gasket, employee slipped with putty knife nearly hitting his hand.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking out of the restroom (Skid-O-Can) on location when he began to fell some discomfort to
IncidentDescription: IE was walking out of the restroom (Skid-O-Can) on location when he began to fell some discomfort to right ankle. Marathon company man pulled IE aside and asked if the ankle and been bumped against anything or rolled on location. IE replied that he had not bumped or rolled the ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to right ankle noticed while walking from Skid-O-Can on location.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-trip, cluttered surfaces
IncidentDescription: While pressure washing in subs hand nearly tripped over cluttered surfaces while washing overhead beams.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ST-80, chain tongs
IncidentDescription: While making up 8" DC w/ ST-80 the hands applied a set of chain tongs to the 8" DC to help get the 8" DC to spin up as the hands operated the chain tongs the motorman pushed on the backsides the floorhand pulled on the front almost striking the floorhand in the face (ST-80 not functioning properly).

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/mud bucket
IncidentDescription: After the pulling the first stand and using the mud brakes the blocks were lowered to grab the next stand as the blocks neared the floor kelly hose pulled on the hoist line pulling the mud bucket toward the rotary nearly striking a floorhand in the area.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/diesel transfer pump
IncidentDescription: While mixing chemicals into the hopper area the forklift driver nearly ran over the small diesel transfer pump, then again when the derrickhand was mixing chemicals the job was stopped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/PVC
IncidentDescription: While checking for flow on number 3 shaker an employee noticed the PVC attached at the end of shaker slide was stopped up and cuttings were not flowing into reserve pit.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/electric lines, hole cover
IncidentDescription: While cleaning floor noticed electrical line being smashed by hole cover.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, body placement
IncidentDescription: A 3rd party employee was observed standing under elevators while driller was lowering a tool onto the catwalk to lay down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/hose
IncidentDescription: While POOH the fill up hose on trip tank that runs from trip tank to BOP plugged off. Employee went down removed hose from trip tank while still POOH Driller came to fill up point turning on trip tank before hose was hooked back up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/foot placement
IncidentDescription: The near miss was employee placed foot under drill pipe while trying to stab mouse hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/loose step, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was coming up stairs from ground to dog house when employee reached top step of stairs employee noticed that the step had gave a little causing employee to lose balance almost falling to floor on back of dog house floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Conoco/loose nut
IncidentDescription: After nipple up and testing operation. Rig performed DROPS object inspection. During inspection employee noticed a nut that was loose and wedge in between the crown seal and crown beam.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the derrick running pipe in the hole. While attempting to latch pipe in elevators, the col
IncidentDescription: IE was in the derrick running pipe in the hole. While attempting to latch pipe in elevators, the collar hit the blocks and prevented the pipe from being latched. When the block came to a stop, the right hand continued forward resulting in striking against the elevators.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right hand after striking against elevators when blocks suddenly stopped.

IncidentSummary: Crew was in the process of installing new liners for the pump. IE was holding 4-foot drive-out sub w
IncidentDescription: Crew was in the process of installing new liners for the pump. IE was holding 4-foot drive-out sub when the pipe bounced back. The IE reached out to catch the pipe to prevent it from falling on foot and the sharp end of the pipe cut right ring finger. IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger after being cut by sharp end of pipe while trying to prevent it from falling on foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/shifting load, forklift
IncidentDescription: While moving a pallet of chemicals with forklift; pallet shifted causing it to lean.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/safety chain
IncidentDescription: While rigging up top sheave for wireline truck in the elevators Bakers Hughes employee attempted to tie off the sheave by running a half inch chain through the bails and lifting eye on the sheave when the chain slipped out of the bvail and swung towards the Bakers Hughes hand nearly striking him in his face.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/Casing tongs
IncidentDescription: While rigging down casing crew the crew tied onto the power tongs to set them off the rig floor. The casing tongs swung back towards a rig hand and nearly caught his leg between the casing tongs and the slip bowl.

IncidentSummary: Crew was tripping 2 7/8" pipe out of the hole when the well started to come in. IE asked Murphy comp
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping 2 7/8" pipe out of the hole when the well started to come in. IE asked Murphy company man, Daryl Ollinger, what he wanted to do. Mr. Ollinger walked up on the rig floor and placed a plastic bucket over the TIW valve and then instructed Pioneer floor hand, Victor Leal, Jr., to open the TIW valve to relieve pressure from the well. The well went static and Mr. Ollinger removed bucket off the TIW valve, swung the bucket from the rig floor to the base beam resulting in bucket striking IE on left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee after being struck by a plastic bucket, being used to cover the TIW valve, as it was swung down from the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: WHILE RE-POSITIONING MULE SHOE SUB IN PIPE WRANGLER TROUGH. FELT BACK SPASM. AND LATER SLIGHT NUMBNE
IncidentDescription: WHILE RE-POSITIONING MULE SHOE SUB IN PIPE WRANGLER TROUGH. FELT BACK SPASM. AND LATER SLIGHT NUMBNESS IN 2 FINGER TIPS ON LEFT HAND.
InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back strain while re-positioning mule shoe sub.

IncidentSummary: IE was on the rig floor helping floor hands make up 1 1/2" weight bars with rod wrenches. After the
IncidentDescription: IE was on the rig floor helping floor hands make up 1 1/2" weight bars with rod wrenches. After the weight bars were made up, IE jerked on the wrench to tighten them and felt something in the right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder while using rod wrench to tighten weight bars.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling block nut (KN)
IncidentDescription: Crew had finished running rods and Heberto Martinez cleared all employees from rig floor and was attempting pick up work floor to install polish rod. As he picked up on the blocks, approximately 15 feet, Derrick Hand, Santos Molina, heard something fall onto the rig floor. After investigating, a nut had fallen off the blocks and onto the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/unsecured stand of pipe
IncidentDescription: Hand was latching pipe grabbed wrong stand of pipe. Latched pipe and then floor hand had rope on the right stand to tail in when pipe latched it came swinging towards rig floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was stepping out of pump-down trailer onto step and overextended right knee.
IncidentDescription: IE was stepping out of pump-down trailer onto step and overextended right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee after stepping out of pump-down trailer onto step.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping into the well with 7/8" rods and the derrick hand picked up on a rod triple a
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping into the well with 7/8" rods and the derrick hand picked up on a rod triple and did not see the rod behind it had picked up as well. When the 1st rod was positioned, the 2nd fell and landed on the floor. The floor hand saw the 2nd rod while positioning the 1st triple and deflected the falling triple away from himself. After the rod landed, the IE pit left arm out and the rod struck the elbow as it stood back into the derrick. The two rod triples had become entangled toward the bottom of the hanging rods.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left arm after being struck by a rod as it stood back into the derrick after falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription:
While employee was hammering off drain hose on mud bucket. The hammer had OBM on handle and
slipped out of employee's hands. Almost striking himself on the leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/air line
IncidentDescription:
Employees had an air line rigged up with an impact gun to take off the clamps on the drill line anchor.
The line was in the way of the elevators as they were being brought to the rig floor, an employee noticed
this and moved the line before the elevators came to the floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was pumping the tool trap open and right index finger was pinched between the cylinder.
IncidentDescription: IE was pumping the tool trap open and right index finger was pinched between the cylinder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right index finger when pinched by cylinder while pumping the tool trap open.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/3P, body placement
IncidentDescription: While third party was drifting casing, he was nearly pinched in between two tubes of casing when the loader operator was pushing them down.

IncidentSummary: The crew was working around the cellar replacing a flange on the frac tree to allow a point to tie i
IncidentDescription: The crew was working around the cellar replacing a flange on the frac tree to allow a point to tie into. The IE had walked away to retrieve tools for the job. Upon returning, the IE walked around the base beam and stepped on a piece of scoria.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after stepping on a piece of scoria while walking around base beam.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping out 2 7/8" tubing. On the 13th stand, the operator came down with the blocks t
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping out 2 7/8" tubing. On the 13th stand, the operator came down with the blocks to latch onto the pipe. The IE pushed back on the elevators and then quickly pulled the elevators forward to latch onto the pipe and felt a sharp pain in lower back. The crew stopped the job, but resumed when the IE said he could continue. They pulled one more joint and shut down again because the IE was still hurting. They notified the supervisor, Axiom was called and a Hess medic dispatched to location.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after quickly pulling the elevators forward while latching pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing protector from sucker rod and right ring finger struck a burr.
IncidentDescription: IE was removing protector from sucker rod and right ring finger struck a burr.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right finger after striking against burr on sucker rod as the protector was being removed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/slips, uneven surfaces
IncidentDescription: While tripping, pipe slips was set on an uneven spot on rig floor mat and fell over almost on employee's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hydraulic lines
IncidentDescription: Employees noticed two hydraulic lines on the top drive that were sticking out and could have got hung while going up and down the derrick.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken armor/sheared wire
IncidentDescription: Halliburton slammed tool string into the grease tubes during equalizing, causing armors to break and copper-coated wires to shear.

IncidentSummary: The employee was attempting to pin the V-Door Beaver Slide to the rig floor. He was holding the pin
IncidentDescription: The employee was attempting to pin the V-Door Beaver Slide to the rig floor. He was holding the pin with his right hand and had it partially started in the pin hole. The crane was attached to the beaver slide and was being used to raise the beaver slide to the height of the rig floor. At the same time a forklift was at the front of the catwalk and was pushing the hydraulic catwalk and beaver slide toward the sub. The movement of the catwalk and beaver slide caused the pin that was partially started to roll downward pinching the employees rig index finger between the pin and the rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right index finger when hand was caught between pin and rig floor.

IncidentSummary: During rigging up power swivel, the crew was torquing up connections. Crew successfully torqued Kell
IncidentDescription: During rigging up power swivel, the crew was torquing up connections. Crew successfully torqued Kelly connection. While torquing up cross-over connection, there was loss of hydraulic power on power swivel. IE was holding the back-up wrench and was standing between the swivel tongs and derrick leg. The swivel operator engaged hydraulics and caused the back-up IE was holding to bite. As a result, the tongs and swivel pivoted on the tong stiff arm, swung over and pinned the IE between the derrick leg and tongs. Hydraulics were released and the equipment moved off him.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to torso after being pinned between derrick leg and tongs when struck by tongs and swivel when they pivoted on the stiff arm.

IncidentSummary: MISS released hangar gas (KN)
IncidentDescription: Crew was making up the landing joint on the hangar to begin testing the BOP's. The tubing string had no weight. The casing had minimal pressure and did not appear on the gauge. The tubing string turned to the right side which resulted in the release of some gas out of the hangar.

IncidentSummary: MISS Hat Creek/ST-80, slip handles
IncidentDescription: Hand was operating ST-80, other hand was about to reach down and pull in slip handle. ST-80 was still scoping back. Other hand stopped him, told him to wait until ST-80 is not in motion before reaching for slip handles.

IncidentSummary: While removing thread protectors off tubing, Rig Manager noticed a few whelps on IE's neck and asked
IncidentDescription: While removing thread protectors off tubing, Rig Manager noticed a few whelps on IE's neck and asked what happened. IE stated that something must have bitten him, but he did not not what.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to neck after possible being bitten while operating forklift.

IncidentSummary: Crew was TOH with 2 7/8" tubing. Relief operator took over brake handle for operator. Relief operato
IncidentDescription: Crew was TOH with 2 7/8" tubing. Relief operator took over brake handle for operator. Relief operator was pulling 9th stand in 4th gear and they were on the 142nd stand. Weight indicator stated 8000 lbs. Tubing was full of water and the anchor was also dragging. Crew was told they had 164 stands and a single in the hole. On the 142nd stand, anchor was pulled through slips into tubing tongs. Tongs were pulled out of the IE's hands. Tongs lifted about 10-15 feet in air and tubing parted above anchor. Tongs struck off-side of derrick. Tongs fell back to floor towards operators side. IE was trying to get off floor when tongs hit lower back and back of legs. IE was pushed into handrail of floor on operator side. Tongs slid down IE's legs and onto floor. IE got off work floor using the stairs. Operator closed slips, ensuring the tubing would no go down-hole. Crew laid down the parted joint, joint with the anchor, two joints under the anchor and the mud anchor, to ensure well control.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle when struck by tongs after tubing parted above anchor, causing the tongs to strike derrick and fall back towards the operators side.

IncidentSummary: Crew was asked to help Superior rig down their equipment so that Wireline operations could resume. C
IncidentDescription: Crew was asked to help Superior rig down their equipment so that Wireline operations could resume. Crew attended JSA and proceeded to help. IE rolled up Superiors data cables and began to disconnect the system. There were 3 tie wraps to cut and Ryan used pocketknife to cut 2 of them. With knife in right hand and the tip facing outstretched left hand, IE proceeded to cut the tie wrap, moving the tip of knife left, toward forearm. When the tie wrap was cut, the momentum carried right hand toward left forearm and the knife blade entered the top portion of left forearm near wrist, by about 1 inch.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left arm near wrist, when struck by pocketknife being used to cut tie wraps

IncidentSummary: IE was walking through shop to wash room. When passing behind mechanic, IE tripped on either mechani
IncidentDescription: IE was walking through shop to wash room. When passing behind mechanic, IE tripped on either mechanics foot or leg of stand that mechanic was working on. IE tripped, falling forward towards a trailer with a handrail against it. IE grabbed handrail the the way down and it slid to floor, causing IE to strike chin and right arm on trailer.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to chin after tripping over either mechanics foot or leg of stand mechanic was working on and striking against the trailer.

IncidentSummary: Driller went down too far with the block and bowed the pipe. This put pressure on the chain, broke t
IncidentDescription: Driller went down too far with the block and bowed the pipe. This put pressure on the chain, broke the handrail out of pocket, and pinned the IE between the handrail and the tubing.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to upper and lower back after being pinned between handrail and tubing when driller went down too far with block, putting pressure on chain and breaking handrail out of pocket.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS gooseneck support bar
IncidentDescription: While lowering gooseneck, noticed support bars were smashing down on hose reel and hoses.

IncidentSummary: MISS iron leaking
IncidentDescription: While preparing to psi test for high psi, crew noticed iron leaking.

IncidentSummary: While raising derrick on rig, IE engaged clutch at the operators control panel causing brake handle
IncidentDescription: While raising derrick on rig, IE engaged clutch at the operators control panel causing brake handle to jump up and strike the right forearm. Apparently, brakes at the drum were dry-locked when the IE engaged the clutch and this caused them to jump upward.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right forearm after being struck by brake handle when it jumped upward as it was engaged.

IncidentSummary: IE was using a pick to take off 0-rings from a gun sub. IE's hand that was holding the pick, slipped
IncidentDescription: IE was using a pick to take off 0-rings from a gun sub. IE's hand that was holding the pick, slipped and punctured IE's left index finger just above the palm.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left index finger when pick being used to take o-rings off sub slipped.

IncidentSummary: While IE was on the rig floor picking rods off the pipe rack and putting them on elevators, right ca
IncidentDescription: While IE was on the rig floor picking rods off the pipe rack and putting them on elevators, right calf started to cramp up.
InjuryDescripti: Cramping in right calf while picking rods off pipe rack and onto elevators.

IncidentSummary: The crew was preparing to trip out rods. They laid down the polish rod and prepared the rig floor. T
IncidentDescription: The crew was preparing to trip out rods. They laid down the polish rod and prepared the rig floor. The IE picked up a handrail to set on the floor and had a sharp pain in the lower back and legs.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while picking up handrail to set on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: IE felt bad due to possible heat/dehydration.
IncidentDescription: IE felt bad due to possible heat/dehydration.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat exhaustion/dehydration.

IncidentSummary: Crew was raising nitro hose to floor to connect to tubing stump to pump nitro down-hole. IE was on f
IncidentDescription: Crew was raising nitro hose to floor to connect to tubing stump to pump nitro down-hole. IE was on floor, opposite drill side, facing stump with hose in hand about eye level. As the IE looked up, clevis that was welded to well side of side walking board was knocked loose by winch line, causing clevis to fall and strike IE's upper lip.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip after being struck by falling clevis after it was knocked loose by winch line.

IncidentSummary: Set a box of Aerosolve II on work bench and a screw driver flew up and struck upper cheek under safe
IncidentDescription: Set a box of Aerosolve II on work bench and a screw driver flew up and struck upper cheek under safety glasses.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to upper left cheek after being struck by screwdriver that flew up from the workbench as a can of Aerosolve II was set down.

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure release (LA)
IncidentDescription:
Backing valve off when pressure behind valve shot valve our and sprayed hydraulic fluid on clothes and face of Jose Olvera.

Listed as Rig 199. This was rental equipment performing a government job. Crew is out of El Campo and was working in LA.

IncidentSummary: MISS US Enercorp, Ltd/stairs
IncidentDescription: Observed forklift operator remove small stairs, pulled on it too hard, almost struck the hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Firstrike/3P, hammer
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand was attempting to hammer a chic line loose, he swung and missed almost striking his leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS US Enercorp, Ltd/wrench
IncidentDescription: Observed 3rd party tie off wrench to pick up slipped off and almost hit a worker.

IncidentSummary: While picking up tubing with strap, strap hung under catwalk and threw joint of tubing off catwalk.
IncidentDescription: While picking up tubing with strap, strap hung under catwalk and threw joint of tubing off catwalk. IE was struck on left arm and ribs.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left arm after being struck by joint of tubing that was thrown off catwalk when strap hung under catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: On 6-7-15 Darrell Craig was working on Pioneer 76 catwalk. He was working with motor hand Ned Powers
IncidentDescription: On 6-7-15 Darrell Craig was working on Pioneer 76 catwalk. He was working with motor hand Ned Powers to remove hydraulic block from cylinder on gull wing. We used the forklift to suspend gull wing into the air so that the pressure on cylinder would be reduced. While removing block from cylinder, hydraulic oil blew from behind the hitting him in the eyes, knocking off his safety glasses. His right eye took most of the brunt of the pressure released from hydraulic block filling his eye with hydraulic oil. Ned Powers contacted rig manager, Shay Stromswold. After further investigation it was determined that the forklift bled off and the cylinder to gull wing was on the ground causing pressure build up behind the block.
InjuryDescripti: Right eye irritation after being splashed with hydraulic fluid from built up pressure.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loose nut
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe, a nut fell to the floor out of derrick, hitting on rig floor over by the Driller side hoist. Stopped operation and sent floor hand up with derrick hand to find out where the nut had fell from. In investigation, it was found that the nut had came off hinge for door going to slow decent line.

IncidentSummary: After rigging down the BHA, the employee was setting the tongs back. When he pushed tongs, the tong
IncidentDescription: After rigging down the BHA, the employee was setting the tongs back. When he pushed tongs, the tong jaws closed, pinching his left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb after being caught between tong jaws.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on rig floor helping pull stands out of hole and experienced slight cramping under ch
IncidentDescription: IE was working on rig floor helping pull stands out of hole and experienced slight cramping under chin, fingers and both hands.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced slight cramping under chin, fingers and both hands while pulling slips.

IncidentSummary: IE was on the deck of the crane greasing it. While going over to the other side, ducked under boom a
IncidentDescription: IE was on the deck of the crane greasing it. While going over to the other side, ducked under boom and struck head on the service step.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to top of head after striking boom while ducking under it moving to other side of crane to continue greasing.

IncidentSummary: IE was lifting tool string and felt a pop in groin area.
IncidentDescription: IE was lifting tool string and felt a pop in groin area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to groin area while lifting tool string.

IncidentSummary: IE was putting chain around support beam for piping and was stung by a red wasp.
IncidentDescription: IE was putting chain around support beam for piping and was stung by a red wasp.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation/inflammation to left hand after being stung by red wasp while putting chain around support beam for piping.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing on the catwalk, lost footing and slipped.
IncidentDescription: IE was standing on the catwalk, lost footing and slipped.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left arm after losing footing and slipping on catwalk while rolling pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While moving heavy weight from right side of board to left side, IE's elbow popped and he felt large
IncidentDescription: While moving heavy weight from right side of board to left side, IE's elbow popped and he felt large amount of pain in elbow. Notified supervisor.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to right elbow as employee was moving a heavy weight from one side of the board to the other.

IncidentSummary: Employee was attempting to make up the vibrating hose that connects to the substructure hard-line. W
IncidentDescription: Employee was attempting to make up the vibrating hose that connects to the substructure hard-line. While trying to manually lift the vibrating hose into place the hose slipped through his hands and caught Timothy's tip of his right hand middle finger pinching it between the hard line and the vibrating hose.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger while trying to manually lift vibrating hose into place, pinching it between hard line and hose.

IncidentSummary: IE was working the hoist on rig floor, when he heard the rig phone ring and hurried to answer it. En
IncidentDescription: IE was working the hoist on rig floor, when he heard the rig phone ring and hurried to answer it. En route to answer phone he slipped on wet surface and did the splits, resulting in a possible groin strain.
InjuryDescripti: Possible groin strain when IE was entering dog house and slipped on wet floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/blind rams, tester
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: After doing the last test on the blind rams. Tester rigged down. Blind rams would not open. After investigation it was discovered that the tester did not remove the check valve in the kill line before pumping through to test the blind rams. I did a JSA. Lined up super choke. Pumped back pressure against HCR. Opened HCR. Bled pressure through super choke. Discussed future safety procedures on the task.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ventex/hammer, collar clamp
IncidentDescription: Running drill collars in the hole. When putting collar clamp on, Employee A was holding the clamp so other Employee B screw it to get it tied. Employee B hit with hammer collar clamp to set it on place, but he missed and almost hit Employee A who was holding the clamp.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ventex/3P, trip hazard, hose
IncidentDescription: 3rd party worker was walking through the mud tanks area and tripped over a water hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ventex/3P, near slip-fall, stairs
IncidentDescription: 3rd party worker was going up the stairs and tripped but he was able to keep his balance because he had his hands on the handrails.

IncidentSummary: After rigging up, IE was rolling pipe on pipe rack and began to feel dizzy. Rig Supervisor, Ramon Es
IncidentDescription: After rigging up, IE was rolling pipe on pipe rack and began to feel dizzy. Rig Supervisor, Ramon Espinoza, advised IE to go to the cooling trailer rest, drink water and squencher. IE started feeling better after cooling down.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced dizziness and felt light headed while rolling pipe on rack in hot weather.

IncidentSummary: MISS flash fire (KN)
IncidentDescription: Night crew was running a 2 7/8" L-80 tubing in the hole. After the crew finished running tubing, operator installed hanger and back pressure valve. Rig tongs and rig floor were rigged down and 3rd party W/S Torque nipped down the BOPS. Our employee loosened casing line but did not close casing valve. BOPs were removed and BOPS were installed. Third party then proceeded to torque up BOP flange with electric power pack when a flash fire occurred on the casing line. Fire was extinguished by our floor hand. No injuries were reported.

IncidentSummary: Employee reported that he had noticed a marble-sized knot above his belly button the night before wh
IncidentDescription: Employee reported that he had noticed a marble-sized knot above his belly button the night before when the area started burning. He doesn't know when it happened, but stated he was a weight lifter and works out. Clayton took him to NOVA in San Antonio and was told by the doctor this was a possible hernia. The doctor advised him to see his personal doctor. See attached incident report.
InjuryDescripti: PERSONAL: Possibly a hernia of unknown origin. Will be check out by personal doctor and get a full-duty release prior to returning to work. Doesn't remember it happening at work.

IncidentSummary: While crew was rigging up BOP's, IE was filling up a 5-gallon bucket of Paraffin Inhibitor. IE finis
IncidentDescription: While crew was rigging up BOP's, IE was filling up a 5-gallon bucket of Paraffin Inhibitor. IE finished filling the bucket and as the hose was pulled out, a small amount of the chemical from the hose splashed on safety glasses and ran down into eyes. Refused medical treatment.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to eyes after Paraffin Inhibitor splashed onto safety glasses and into eyes while pulling hose out of bucket.

IncidentSummary: The crew was rigging up and the winch line slipped on the cable while tightening up the guy lines, s
IncidentDescription: The crew was rigging up and the winch line slipped on the cable while tightening up the guy lines, striking the IE and knocking hardhat off. The IE was standing next to the winch line and guy line.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to head after being struck by the winch line after it slipped on the cable while tightening the guy lines. Was wearing a hard hat.

IncidentSummary: IE was in work basket on Fieldwood platform Mustang III running the last joint of pipe in the hole.
IncidentDescription: IE was in work basket on Fieldwood platform Mustang III running the last joint of pipe in the hole. The tong door closed and as the IE opened the door, right thumb caught in the door. The tongs struck the drill pipe once, causing a laceration to the inside of right thumb. Fieldwood employee, Roof(?), and the IE pushed the tongs back to open the door and free the thumb. See attached incident report for IE's description of incident.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture and laceration to right thumb after caught between tong door and pipe being run in the hole while working on offshore platform in work basket.

IncidentSummary: Travis had just come down the stairs from the driller's cabin to unhook the tugger line on the catw
IncidentDescription: Travis had just come down the stairs from the driller's cabin to unhook the tugger line on the catwalk. After unhooking the equipment Travis was walking to get the forklift. He walked into the backyard behind the substructure. The forklift was located on the pit side of the rig next to the mud chemicals next to the festoon extension. Travis was stepping over the 3" air hard line with his right foot, after landing his right foot between the 3" air line and the festoon skid his boot unknowingly went under a 3" gap between the plastic containment mat and the festoon skid. When Travis went to lift his right foot as he was stepping onto the festoon skid his right foot was wedged under the festoon skid causing him to lose his balance and his body fell to the right with his right foot staying lodged under the festoon skid twisting his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Possible right ankle strain when IE's foot was caught between plastic containment mat and the festoon skid.

IncidentSummary: Two crew workers were putting the hardline together to flow back to a 400 bbl tank. One worker was s
IncidentDescription: Two crew workers were putting the hardline together to flow back to a 400 bbl tank. One worker was searching through the fittings on the mud pump. The worker flipped a fitting back, which consisted of several fittings put together. The fitting fell on the arch of the left foot of the IE, causing discomfort.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to arch of left foot after being struck by a mud pump fitting as another worker flipped it back while searching through the fittings on the mud pump.

IncidentSummary: At 10:30 AM, IE advised Rig Supervisor, Ralph Arredondo, he was feeling a little hot and wanted to g
IncidentDescription: At 10:30 AM, IE advised Rig Supervisor, Ralph Arredondo, he was feeling a little hot and wanted to go sit in personal truck to cool down. Mr. Arredondo told IE to go ahead and he would check every 20-30 minutes. About 1:30 PM, Mr Arredondo stated he received a text message from the IE who was still sitting in the truck. The IE stated that when getting out of the truck, the wind blew the door, striking the top of the head. Mr. Arredondo checked on him and he was fine.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat exhaustion, followed by contusion to top of head, after being struck by truck door when it was blown by the wind, as he got out after cooling off because of feeling hot.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/fallen tong line
IncidentDescription: While running casing with Wyoming Casing Crews, casing tongs were on casing torquing to spec. During the torque process tong line parted and fell to rig floor missing casing crew members. The casing tongs stayed on the pipe because they were in the process of torquing the pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking weight bar coupling with 24" pipe wrench and cheaters. Break was quick and cheater s
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking weight bar coupling with 24" pipe wrench and cheaters. Break was quick and cheater struck IE on right elbow.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right elbow after being struck by cheater bar, while breaking weight bar coupling when the connection broke quickly.

IncidentSummary: Employee was hammering on a center steel pin and a piece of the strap holding the D-ring (used to pu
IncidentDescription: Employee was hammering on a center steel pin and a piece of the strap holding the D-ring (used to pull the pins out) on broke off striking employee in the finger cutting through his impact glove resulting in a cut in his pinky finger on his left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand pinky when IE was struck by a piece of steel from steel pin that was being hammered.

IncidentSummary: MISS handrails removed-falling valve (AL)
IncidentDescription: Floor hand was taking handrails off rig floor before the floor was clear of all equipment. The slips had been lowered from the floor and operator was bringing the cat line back up to lower the TIW valve when the floor hand pulled the handrail and the valve rolled off the floor and fell 14' 3" to the ground. Another hand was standing about 6 ft away.

IncidentSummary: MISS H2S meter alert
IncidentDescription: Had swabbed head dry and was adding KCl water to perf from a water truck, different lease. While putting top sheave in the blocks, H2S meter went off. The load of water contained H2S.

IncidentSummary: The crew was laying down 4 1/2" tubing and picking up 2 7/8" tubing all day yesterday and this morni
IncidentDescription: The crew was laying down 4 1/2" tubing and picking up 2 7/8" tubing all day yesterday and this morning. The IE was working on the floor. When the crews shift ended last night, the IE felt discomfort in both hands. While working this morning, the IE felt discomfort in both hands again. IE was wearing rubber nitrile gloves under impact gloves. The IE thought there was a wicker stuck in both gloves that was causing the discomfort. When the IE took off gloves, hands were swollen and there were small blisters with dark spots in the middle.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation (blisters) to both hands after wearing nitrile gloves under impact gloves for an entire day while picking up and laying down tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The crew was laying down 4 1/2" tubing and picking up 2 7/8" tubing all day yesterday and this morni
IncidentDescription: The crew was laying down 4 1/2" tubing and picking up 2 7/8" tubing all day yesterday and this morning. The IE was working on the floor. When the crews shift ended last night, the IE felt discomfort in both hands. While working this morning, the IE felt discomfort in both hands again. IE was wearing rubber nitrile gloves under impact gloves. The IE thought there was a wicker stuck in both gloves that was causing the discomfort. When the IE took off gloves, hands were swollen and there were small blisters with dark spots in the middle.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation (blisters) to both hands after wearing nitrile gloves under impact gloves for an entire day while picking up and laying down tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: As the IE was putting a 2" valve on the BOP, it slipped and caught right index finger between valve
IncidentDescription: As the IE was putting a 2" valve on the BOP, it slipped and caught right index finger between valve and BOP.
