InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right index finger when it was caught between 2" valve and BOP.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken elevator horn strap (AR)
IncidentDescription: Latched onto fish and jarred for about 1 1/2 hours. Company man told operator to beat down on fish. Strap on elevator horns broke allowing elevators to open and lay swivel into derrick.

IncidentSummary: IE has an abscess on right lower abdomen and alleges it was caused by the derrick belt.
IncidentDescription: IE has an abscess on right lower abdomen and alleges it was caused by the derrick belt.
InjuryDescripti: Abscess to abdomen and alleges that it was due to wearing weight belt. Note: IE had inquired when his personal insurance was effective prior to reporting this injury. Re-hired on 06-12-15. Doctor diagnosed irritation as inspect bite.

IncidentSummary: While tearing down a generator from an old offshore unit to send to get refurbished, IE was taking t
IncidentDescription: While tearing down a generator from an old offshore unit to send to get refurbished, IE was taking the battery compartment off and noticed a spider crawling up right forearm. IE swiped at the spider with left hand and got bit on left index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left index finger after being bitten by spider while working in shop tearing down old generator for rebuild.

IncidentSummary: While using pipe wrench to release packer, pipe came down and wrench came loose from IE's hands. Wre
IncidentDescription: While using pipe wrench to release packer, pipe came down and wrench came loose from IE's hands. Wrench swung and struck IE in the abdomen.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to abdomen when struck by pipe wrench being used to release packer.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/skate chain
IncidentDescription: The skate chain on catwalk popped out of tray. New floorhand jumped up on catwalk to place chain back in tray. Rig manager happened to be watching and shut down job.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hand placement
IncidentDescription: While trying to position man lift in sub for 3rd party to pressure wash; 3rd party had his hand on outside of hand rail and could have smashed his hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer wrench
IncidentDescription: While hammering up nuts on flange that goes to flow line hammer wrench came off of nut and could have struck employees below.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ST-80, hand placement
IncidentDescription: While making up stand employee was bringing ST-80 between drill pipe and A-leg and almost pinned his hand between drill pipe and ST-80 as he was extending ST-80 out to make up stand in mouse hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/keeper pin
IncidentDescription: While bringing up a stand in the V-door an employee noticed a keeper missing on the single latch elevators.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/mud cross
IncidentDescription: While hooking up mud cross to stand pipe on rig floor, employee on the air hoist came up too fast causing the mud cross to catch on the top connection of stand pipe and that caused the cross to kick out toward employee that was trying to connect it.

IncidentSummary: The operator and IE were tightening a sub on a k-bar. The IE pulled on the cheater pipe, and felt so
IncidentDescription: The operator and IE were tightening a sub on a k-bar. The IE pulled on the cheater pipe, and felt something pop and pain in the stomach area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to abdominal area while pulling on cheater pipe to tighten sub on k-bar.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While nippling up B" (?) section crew was using air hoist to set DSA. While coming up on air hoist,
IncidentDescription: While nippling up B" (?) section crew was using air hoist to set DSA. While coming up on air hoist, the hoist caught the scaffold brace, brace dropped down on one side, striking employee in upper back.
InjuryDescripti: Upper back contusion resulting from being struck by scaffold brace.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/safety cable
IncidentDescription:
While tripping out of the hole the driller was coming up with the top drive and pulling a stand out of the
hole when a piece of 5/8" safety cable approximately 1" long fell to the rig floor. The piece of cable landed
about 10' from an employee. Upon inspection it was discovered that the top drive had caught the safety
cable for the tong hanging shiv.

IncidentSummary: While picking up 6" wash pipe, lift sub pulled out and wash pipe fell and struck IE on left shoulder
IncidentDescription: While picking up 6" wash pipe, lift sub pulled out and wash pipe fell and struck IE on left shoulder blade.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder when struck by 6" wash pipe after lift sub pulled out.

IncidentSummary: While picking up 6" wash pipe, lift sub pulled out and struck IE on right shoulder.
IncidentDescription: While picking up 6" wash pipe, lift sub pulled out and struck IE on right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right shoulder after being struck by lift sub while picking up 6" wash pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE was driving Wireline truck and noticed placard in the vice on bumper had turned sideways, instead
IncidentDescription: IE was driving Wireline truck and noticed placard in the vice on bumper had turned sideways, instead of facing to rear. Pulled off onto shoulder of highway and after checking, noticed that clips were missing. Decided to fix with tape. After getting tape from shooters cab, stepped off last step onto rock and rolled left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after stepping on rock while stepping down from shooters cab on Wireline truck.

IncidentSummary: IE had been rolling pipe for about one hour. Everyone took a thirty-minute break. IE was about to re
IncidentDescription: IE had been rolling pipe for about one hour. Everyone took a thirty-minute break. IE was about to resume work and started cramping.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping after taking 30-minute break. Had been rolling pipe for about 1 hour prior to break.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing a starter from a Wireline truck. The starter was very hard to remove, due to being i
IncidentDescription: IE was removing a starter from a Wireline truck. The starter was very hard to remove, due to being in the truck for years and its location. There was a lot of pulling, pushing and rotating of the starter and wire harness involved. During this process, the IE was working at a very awkward angle and strained left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder while working at an awkward angle removing the starter from a Wireline truck.

IncidentSummary: As engineer was lowering tool string, the winch gear kicked out and made a grinding sound. The crew
IncidentDescription: As engineer was lowering tool string, the winch gear kicked out and made a grinding sound. The crew on the ground thought the tools above were going to fall and turned to run away. The IE's face struck the sheave wheel stand while turning to run.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right side of face after striking against sheave stand while running from under tool string, mistakenly thought to be falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS gas vapor ignition (MS)
IncidentDescription: While bleeding well down, gas vapors leaked through one of the valves on the mud pump. Gas then came back around through the other pump line to the rig beam and was ignited by the torque crews hydro pump.

IncidentSummary: Employee was walking on top of the shaker skid section of the pits. He was attempting to locate a ch
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking on top of the shaker skid section of the pits. He was attempting to locate a chain hoist. There was a section of grating missing where the panic line comes from the choke manifold through the floor near the shakers. The employee accidentally stepped in the opening and hit his knee on the grating.
InjuryDescripti: Knee abrasion after stepping into uncovered hole.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the shop pressure testing BOP's. While being removed, the test bar shot out and struck rig
IncidentDescription: IE was in the shop pressure testing BOP's. While being removed, the test bar shot out and struck right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Struck on right hand as the test bar being removed from the BOP suddenly flew up.

IncidentSummary: Royce had just pressured the casing to 3,000 lbs to make sure it didn't have a leak. They held the p
IncidentDescription: Royce had just pressured the casing to 3,000 lbs to make sure it didn't have a leak. They held the pressure for 10 min. and then opened the valve on the pump to release the pressure off the well. After releasing all of the pressure off the well, both floor hands went to the floor to get ready to run the production tubing into the well. Upon opening the blind rams on the BOP stack, the tubing slips were flung up onto the floor, due to still having pressure. The slips brushed the back of the IE's leg. The pressure was found to have come from a partially collapsed hose in the mud line assembly which caused the well to hold pressure on it.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to leg after being struck by the tubing slips as they were flung from the well when the blind rams were opened.

IncidentSummary: IE was tying off floor chains and stepped back into a hole with a rock in it, straining left foot.
IncidentDescription: IE was tying off floor chains and stepped back into a hole with a rock in it, straining left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left foot after stepping back into left hole with a rock in it.

IncidentSummary: IE was coming down stairs off a 3rd party mixing plant, slipped and struck left knee and right elbow
IncidentDescription: IE was coming down stairs off a 3rd party mixing plant, slipped and struck left knee and right elbow on the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee and right elbow after slipping and hitting ground, while coming down stairs off a 3rd party mixing plant.

IncidentSummary: IE started feeling bad shortly upon returning to work after being off for 20 days.
IncidentDescription: IE started feeling bad shortly upon returning to work after being off for 20 days.
InjuryDescripti: Started feeling bad upon starting shift, after being off for 20 days.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing safety clamp from polish rod. Nuts seized on bolts, so IE used cheater-bar on ratche
IncidentDescription: IE was removing safety clamp from polish rod. Nuts seized on bolts, so IE used cheater-bar on ratchet. IE placed hand on back of clamp, pinching right pinky finger between t-bolt and clamp.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right pinky finger when caught between t-bolt and clamp while removing safety clamp from polish rod.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/unsecured stand of pipe
IncidentDescription: High winds caused a stand of pipe to come untied and fall out across the derrick while the derrick hand was getting one from the back of the fingers.

IncidentSummary: IE complained about mile stomach cramps.
IncidentDescription: IE complained about mile stomach cramps.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat exhaustion after experiencing stomach cramps while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: Employee was removing 2" from stand pipe. Hose was at an angle where two people were needed. Brody t
IncidentDescription: Employee was removing 2" from stand pipe. Hose was at an angle where two people were needed. Brody tied up so that the hose wouldn't fall through the sub. Brody was holding up on the hose as Bruce Bray unscrewed the hammer union. When hose came undone the momentum came free towards Brody's face striking him in the forehead and safety glasses. Cutting him between the eyes about 1" and on the nose about a 1/4" gash.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to nose and abrasion to forehead after being struck in face by hose.

IncidentSummary: Employee was putting on collar clamp with other employees. Collar clamp dropped down on drill collar
IncidentDescription: Employee was putting on collar clamp with other employees. Collar clamp dropped down on drill collar. Phillip went to lift up on collar clamp and his lower back tightened up and started hurting. Employee stood up and went and notified rig manager.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to lower back as a result of lifting drill collar.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Once well was killed, crew started POH with 2 7/8" tubing and had reached joint #203 with coil insid
IncidentDescription: Once well was killed, crew started POH with 2 7/8" tubing and had reached joint #203 with coil inside. As IE was attempting to break the joint, trapped pressure, believed to be nitrogen, blew up and struck left side of face, ear and eye.
InjuryDescripti: Foreign body in left eye after trapped pressure, believed to be Nitrogen, from joint of 2-7/8" tubing blew upward.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Skot and Jacob were pinning top drive guide rail on starting legs. They began folding out rail when
IncidentDescription: Skot and Jacob were pinning top drive guide rail on starting legs. They began folding out rail when they moved it out of shipping position it fell on barrel for the sub raising pin to pin MRC which fell on Skot's finger, giving him a laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Finger laceration as a result of being struck by dropped object being handled with another employee.

IncidentSummary: Barnes was closing cable tray lid, and said he was pushing a wire with his foot, so the lid wouldn't
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Barnes was closing cable tray lid, and said he was pushing a wire with his foot, so the lid wouldn't close on it, and lid closed on his finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left middle finger as a result of heavy lid closing on it.

IncidentSummary: MISS crane-wedge pin cotter pin missing
IncidentDescription: Crew was about to pick up lubricator and decided to bring down the parted block to inspect it. The block was sitting cockeyed on the winch line. When it got down to eye level, noticed there was a missing cotter pin in the wedge pin. The winch line was also sitting on the outer sheave, making the whole thing sit crooked. This was a rented crane and was 3-parted for extra load capacity. The cotter pin is a vital component and there is no doubt the wedge pin would have come out shortly, with the block leaned over, dropping the entire lubricator.

IncidentSummary: IE was putting bowl for drill collar slips into place when bowl slid off top of stripper head on BOP
IncidentDescription: IE was putting bowl for drill collar slips into place when bowl slid off top of stripper head on BOPs, catching left middle finger between bowl, top of BOPs and side of rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration on tip of left middle finger after it was caught between bowl, top of BOPs and side of rig floor when bowl slid off top of BOPs as the IE was putting bowl for drill collar slips into place.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking to Rig Managers (Jonathan Hartgraves) crew cab to see why his printer was not working
IncidentDescription: IE was walking to Rig Managers (Jonathan Hartgraves) crew cab to see why his printer was not working and walked into a dry rod (rod used to install back pressure valves), striking nose.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to nose after walking into dry rod while on the way to crew cab.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking beside accumulator, stepped on hoses and felt strain in lower back.
IncidentDescription: IE was walking beside accumulator, stepped on hoses and felt strain in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after stepping on hoses while checking accumulator.

IncidentSummary: While working on the floor, IE started to feel weak and overheated throughout upper body. IE was tol
IncidentDescription: While working on the floor, IE started to feel weak and overheated throughout upper body. IE was told by Rig Supervisor to go and rest in cooling trailer and re-hydrate.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced weakness and an overheated feeling throughout upper body while running rods on the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up valve to workbench to be serviced, IE stepped back to get into position to open val
IncidentDescription: While rigging up valve to workbench to be serviced, IE stepped back to get into position to open valve. Right foot landed in a gap in the grating cover of the test bay sump, causing IE to rip pants, cut leg and fall down.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right leg after stepping back into gap in the grating cover with right foot and falling down.

IncidentSummary: IE was in manlift basket and was wearing impact resistant gloves. IE had just removed chicksan from
IncidentDescription: IE was in manlift basket and was wearing impact resistant gloves. IE had just removed chicksan from tree and while attempting to lay it down on manlift platform floor, chicksan rotated and left middle finger was caught between gap of chicksan.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left middle finger after it was caught between gap of chicksan while laying it down on platform of manlift floor.

IncidentSummary: Employee was standing next to the tailgate of the truck when employee from Columbia put a spool of w
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was standing next to the tailgate of the truck when employee from Columbia put a spool of wire inside and the tailgate popped open striking Jose on the right side of his upper torso in the rib cage, the force did knock him down to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Bruising to right rib cage after being struck by truck tailgate.

IncidentSummary: MISS brkn lifting cap/dropped BOP
IncidentDescription: Crew was preparing to leave location and were in the rig-down process. While they were removing the BOP stack from the well, the lifting cap broke and the entire stack fell 18 feet, striking the well. See attached statements for further details.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped logger transmission
IncidentDescription: Jean Claude and Max Caldwell were removing the transmission from a logger. They had the transmission on a jack and were moving it from under the truck. The transmission became unbalanced on the jack. The jack failed and the transmission fell to the floor.

IncidentSummary: Our driver was t-boned by another driver at I-10 and Hwy 95 near Flatonia, Texas.
IncidentDescription: Our driver was t-boned by another driver at I-10 and Hwy 95 near Flatonia, Texas.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to body when t-boned by another vehicle.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling tool string
IncidentDescription: Engineer started in hole with CCL, 6' 2-3/4" weight bar, and #20 setting tool with CIPB. The CCL was not reading so engineer started coming out of hole. At around 300', he started messing with computer trying to make adjustments while tool string was still POH. Engineer heard crash and look up just as bottom of sheave was hitting ground and the wireline fell. The tool string crowned out against the top sheave, pulled out of rope socket, fell through the rig floor and stuck in the ground below the rig floor. The rig crew was in the doghouse and the wireline operator was near the wireline unit mixing cement for next run.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the women's restroom washing hands and slipped on tile when exiting.
IncidentDescription: IE was in the women's restroom washing hands and slipped on tile when exiting.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee and slight twisting of right ankle after slipping on tile while exiting women's restroom.

IncidentSummary: Jason was walking to the change shack to change out for the end of the day. While walking to the cha
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Jason was walking to the change shack to change out for the end of the day. While walking to the change shack it felt like a rubber band snapped in his knee. He did not trip or stumble. Rig manager was informed of the incident the next morning after the safety meeting.
InjuryDescripti: Possible left knee strain; source unknown, while walking to change shack.

IncidentSummary: IE and Chris Lee drove the manlift up to the stack to tighten bolts to get everything rigged up. IE
IncidentDescription: IE and Chris Lee drove the manlift up to the stack to tighten bolts to get everything rigged up. IE stepped out of manlift onto BOP stack to reach some bolts on the back. IE slipped on BOP stack while tightening bolts and began to fall. IE was tied off to manlift, grabbed the lanyard to stop fall and strained right arm by armpit.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right armpit area upon grabbing lanyard to manlift, after slipping off BOP stack while tightening bolts.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking between pickup and trailer and right thumb struck against a bent part of the tailgate
IncidentDescription: IE was walking between pickup and trailer and right thumb struck against a bent part of the tailgate. IE was not wearing gloves at the time.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thumb when it struck against bent part of pickup tailgate while walking between pickup and trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was asked to look for a t-bar in the tool box on the trailer. While looking in tool box, it shut
IncidentDescription: IE was asked to look for a t-bar in the tool box on the trailer. While looking in tool box, it shut on IE's head.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration/abrasion to head after tool box shut on it while looking for a t-bar.

IncidentSummary: Employee was power washing fiberglass grading in substructure when he slipped on a metal cellar cove
IncidentDescription: Employee was power washing fiberglass grading in substructure when he slipped on a metal cellar cover that is on one of the previous wells we drilled. After slipping, employee put his left arm out to catch himself hurting his left wrist on impact.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to left wrist when employee slipped on metal surface while power washing.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving equipment into tool shed and did not notice a yellow jacket nest until he was stung on
IncidentDescription: IE was moving equipment into tool shed and did not notice a yellow jacket nest until he was stung on the left forearm.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left forearm after being stung by wasp while putting tools in shed at yard.

IncidentSummary: Rig crew was in the process of laying down tubulars with a lay down machine. While laying down the f
IncidentDescription: Rig crew was in the process of laying down tubulars with a lay down machine. While laying down the first joint, the crew set the pipe in the trough and it was lowered down and run out the V-door. At this time the employee stepped forward to grab the tail rope and was standing on the mousehole housing cover. The lay down truck slacked off the lay down line and this caused the tension to come off of the flag pole in the mousehole. This shifted the mousehole housing cover throwing the employee about 2 ft in the air. When he landed, he twisted his right middle finger and dislocated it.
InjuryDescripti: Possible dislocation of right middle finger after being knocked to ground when mousehole cover shifted during lay down operations.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Employee was walking down stairs by shaker skid to get new shaker screens for shakers. When employee
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking down stairs by shaker skid to get new shaker screens for shakers. When employee stepped off landing onto plastic he stepped into and uneven spot on plastic that was covered by water. Employee twisted ankle on uneven spot on location.
InjuryDescripti: Possible ankle strain when employee slipped on an uneven area by shale shakers.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hand placement, ST-80
IncidentDescription: While employees were making a stand of drill pipe up in the mousehole, employee was lowering pipe down with air hoist with the stand of drill pipe. The single bottom of the single latch elevators hit the top of the ST-80, pushing ST-80 towards the hole. Another employee grabbed the safety handle on the ST-80 but could have smashed his hand in between drill string and ST-80.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: After making connection employee was connecting air hoist hook to the single latch elevators. Employee dropped the cable with the hoist and the D-ring on the single latch elevator came down almost striking employee on the shin.

IncidentSummary: MISS loading BOPs onto trailer
IncidentDescription: Crew was using a tag-line to pull BOPS off rig floor and onto trailer. It was determined the trailer was too far from the rig floor to manhandle. Engineer called for a stop and said to let go of the BOPs so they could hang freely. It was then discussed and decided that the trailer would need to be moved. The angle would need to be changed to get closer to the rig. Again, the rig hand holding the BOPs tied off was asked to release them, but engineer failed to confirm he had released the BOPs tag line. Engineer went to pull the trailer forward to realign, but the BOPs were still being held by the rig hand. Operator asked the crew member to release the BOPs multiple times, but the language barrier prevented timely execution. Engineer could not see the rig hand behind the grease unit and while looking forward for obstructions, did not see spotters giving the signal to stop from behind. Tag line pulled out of the crew member's hand and the BOPs swung toward the floor. Crew member jumped off trailer to the ground. The area around the BOPs was cleared of personnel so no one was in immediate danger of injury.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the shop walking near a cart used for gun subs. Left pant lag caught on cart, causing him
IncidentDescription: IE was in the shop walking near a cart used for gun subs. Left pant lag caught on cart, causing him to stumble, strike leg against cart, tear pants and bruise leg.
InjuryDescripti: Bruise to left leg after catching pant leg on cart, stumbling and striking leg against cart.

IncidentSummary: MISS fast-line sheave (KN)
IncidentDescription: While crew was going in hole with 2-7/8" tubing, Rig Supervisor, Mac Alvarado, heard a rattling noise on the rig. Work was stopped and derrick man, Julio Garibay, was sent up to inspect the rig crown. Mr Garibay saw that the fast-line sheave was slightly leaning to one side and had a lot of play. Rig Supervisor, Mac Alvarado immediately notified Division Manager Dwayne Byrd.

IncidentSummary: IE picked up a matting board and felt left shoulder pop.
IncidentDescription: IE picked up a matting board and felt left shoulder pop.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left should while picking up matting board.

IncidentSummary: IE was in doghouse getting dressed for the day. IE stepped out of doghouse onto a rock, causing ankl
IncidentDescription: IE was in doghouse getting dressed for the day. IE stepped out of doghouse onto a rock, causing ankle to roll. IE was not carrying any objects that would have caused a loss of balance.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after stepping on rock and rolling it when stepping out of doghouse.

IncidentSummary: Eric and IE were working breaking down a Baker 20 with pipe wrenches. When they could not get the ma
IncidentDescription: Eric and IE were working breaking down a Baker 20 with pipe wrenches. When they could not get the mandrel to break, Britt brought over a cheater pipe and slid it on the pipe wrench and attempted multiple times to break it. They hit the setting tool with a hammer and popped the mandrel free. However, no one noticed the IE's hand on the cheater pipe. The pipe wrench with the percussion of the tool breaking it free, jarred the IE's hand.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand when it was jarred by the cheater pipe being held onto as it broke the mandrel free.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/rod, foot placement
IncidentDescription: Employee tripped over mud pump ground rod.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down to move to the next well, IE was breaking mud lines and started to feel light hea
IncidentDescription: While rigging down to move to the next well, IE was breaking mud lines and started to feel light headed and had cramps in chest and arms. IE notified Rig Supervisor, Pete Infante, who advised the IE to hydrate in the dog house and rest for the remainder of his shift.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced a light headed feeling with chest and arm cramps while breaking mud lines in hot temperatures.

IncidentSummary: IE was instructed to clean a rope socket. As IE began to clean the rope socket, the object that was
IncidentDescription: IE was instructed to clean a rope socket. As IE began to clean the rope socket, the object that was in his hand slipped, causing one of the wire ropes to become impaled, sideways, into left thumb. IE had blue surgical "thickster" gloves on at the time of the incident. IE was not wearing cotton or impact gloves due to the nature of cleaning this tool.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left thumb when one of the wire ropes on the rope socket being cleaned slipped and impaled left thumb.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning weight bar and felt something between shoulder and chest.
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning weight bar and felt something between shoulder and chest.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to area between shoulder and chest while cleaning weight bar at shop.

IncidentSummary: Crew was preparing to break out a 4.5" hangar using the winch line and a 60" pipe wrench. After setu
IncidentDescription: Crew was preparing to break out a 4.5" hangar using the winch line and a 60" pipe wrench. After setup, the crew cleared the floor. As the hangar broke loose, the adjustment nut on the winch broke in half causing one half to fly off the floor and strike the IE on the left cheek below safety glasses.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left cheek after being struck by a flying broken wrench adjustment nut after hangar broke loose.

IncidentSummary: Crew was pulling tubing out of hole and were near the end of the string of tubing where the tubing a
IncidentDescription: Crew was pulling tubing out of hole and were near the end of the string of tubing where the tubing anchor was located. The rig supervisor instructed the IE to go slow because they did not know where the tubing anchor was located. As the IE was pulling the tubing out of the hole, the tubing anchor caught the side of the slips and picked up on the slips which caused it to hit the rig floor. When it did, the rig floor lifted about one-foot and then fell back down, causing the IE to lose balance and hit forehead on handrail.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration above right eye after losing balance and striking against handrail as rig floor lifted up and fell back down when tubing anchor caught the side of slips and picked up on the slips, causing it to hit the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/spray can, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: Employee almost dropped a can of spray lubricant while moving to the other side of top drive track to spray the track. Employee was able to re-position the can without dropping it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/track guide pad, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While making a connection top drive Teflon track guide fell to rig floor next to a hand.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling down on the sand line to seat it firmly in the rope socket. The third time he pulled
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling down on the sand line to seat it firmly in the rope socket. The third time he pulled down, the rope socket glanced off the ladder and struck upper lip.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip while seating sand line in rope socket and the rope socket glanced off ladder.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/slips, foot placement
IncidentDescription: Mousehole slips nearly fell on employees foot due to be set on an uneven surface.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken cable (LA)
IncidentDescription:
The crew was making up a joint of 2-7/8" tubing PH6 on to the power swivel. As the joint was being tightened, the cable became tight and parted. The joint was already 
connected to the power swivel, so nothing dropped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/hammer
IncidentDescription: Cementing hand was swinging a hammer to break apart a union and hammer slipped out of his hands and nearly hit another employee.

IncidentSummary: While pressure washing rig floor before taking off rig bails and casing bail extensions to install c
IncidentDescription: While pressure washing rig floor before taking off rig bails and casing bail extensions to install cables and single latch elevators casing crew had went down stairs for a break so rig floor wasn't crowded. Ernesto was washing by mousehole and when he stepped on cover it had tweaked over or slipped over causing his right floor to fall in (mousehole cover was on before the incident).
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to right foot from slip into mousehole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/boom pole, flow line
IncidentDescription: Employees were using the boom pole to adjust the height of the flow line in order to bolt it up to the surface conductor. When the flow line was lifted up the boom pole line did not hold the weight of the flow line. The boom pole would lift the flow line but when the handle was released the flow line fell appx. 1 ft. until it was caught by a secondary chain that was rigged up to a D-ring on the substructure. Upon investigation it was found that the boom pole cable was rigged up incorrectly and the brake only works in one direction.

IncidentSummary: Wireline crew was on location cleaning tools from 1st pump down run for the shift. Sixto Banuelos wa
IncidentDescription: Wireline crew was on location cleaning tools from 1st pump down run for the shift. Sixto Banuelos was between Wireline truck and gun trailer when he noticed a burning sensation on his face. He told the IE, the engineer, in the trailer. The IE told Sixto and Jeromy Forman to get in the trailer and wait. The IE grabbed the radio from the logging truck and asked the frac crew to stop pumping because they were getting covered in a fluid mist and it was burning their skin. The frac crew took a minute or two to switch to water and kept pumping for about five minutes to try and discover the leak. The IE went to edge of location to observe the shutdown of the pumping operation and called manager when pumping was stopped.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to arms, face and eyes after being sprayed by acidic mist while cleaning tools from first fracking pump-down run for the shift.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/PPE
IncidentDescription: While working on changing pipe rams employee was tied off improperly in man basket which if he fell could have resulted in his fall protection not properly saving him.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ladder, uneven surfaces
IncidentDescription: Hand was strapping pipe using the ladder that was unlevel due to rocks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/unsecured joint(s)
IncidentDescription: When picking up a joint of casing onto catwalk joint rolled off and almost hit 3rd party truck.

IncidentSummary: Wireline crew was on location cleaning tools from 1st pump down run for the shift. IE and was betwee
IncidentDescription: Wireline crew was on location cleaning tools from 1st pump down run for the shift. IE and was between Wireline truck and gun trailer when he noticed a burning sensation on his face. He told Stephen Damaske, the engineer, who was in the trailer. Stephen Damaske told the IE and Jeromy Forman to get in the trailer and wait. Stephen grabbed the radio from the logging truck and asked the frac crew to stop pumping because they were getting covered in a fluid mist and it was burning their skin. The frac crew took a minute or two to switch to water and kept pumping for about five minutes to try and discover the leak. Stephen went to edge of location to observe the shutdown of the pumping operation and called manager when pumping was stopped.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to arms, face and eyes after being sprayed by acidic mist while cleaning tools from first fracking pump-down run for the shift.

IncidentSummary: Wireline crew was on location cleaning tools from 1st pump down run for the shift. Sixto Banuelos wa
IncidentDescription: Wireline crew was on location cleaning tools from 1st pump down run for the shift. Sixto Banuelos was between Wireline truck and gun trailer and noticed a burning sensation on the face. Sixto Banuelos told Stephen Damaske, the engineer, who was in the trailer. Stephen Damaske told Sixto and the IE to get in the trailer and wait. Stephen grabbed the radio from the logging truck and asked the frac crew to stop pumping because they were getting covered in a fluid mist and it was burning their skin. The frac crew took a minute or two to switch to water and kept pumping for about five minutes to try and discover the leak. Stephen went to edge of location to observe the shutdown of the pumping operation and called manager when pumping was stopped.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to arms, face and eyes after being sprayed by acidic mist while cleaning tools from first fracking pump-down run for the shift.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure gauge
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, employee was going to take the blind flange off the wellhead. The gauge on the wellhead was reading 4000 psi. The employee loosened the gauge and wiggled it to let the pressure bleed off. After a while he noticed the pressure wasn't dropping. The employee, and two other of our employees, decided to stop the job and talk to the company man. The company man advised them to just keep doing what they were doing, telling them it will take a while for that much pressure to bleed off. The employee went back to work and loosened the gauge a little more, wriggling the gauge to release more pressure. The gauge blew off and landed on the ground 15' away.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/communication
IncidentDescription: Employees hooked hoist onto casing elevators to lift and push out V-door, employees pushed elevators to V-door and told the operator down bad communication caused the operator to lift them up due to the heavy weights hands couldn't hold onto them causing them to swing back towards the rotary.

IncidentSummary: David was putting a 6 1/2" collar into the elevators when the collar started to lean in the wrong di
IncidentDescription: David was putting a 6 1/2" collar into the elevators when the collar started to lean in the wrong direction. David pulled back hard on the collar in order to put the collar into the elevators. Nothing wrong was felt at that moment. While finishing the trip in the hole David noticed that his lower back was a little sore.
InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back strain as the result of latching up drill collar.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/elevators, latches
IncidentDescription: While laying down 8" drill collars driller latched elevators onto lift sub and started picking up and the elevators wasn't latched all the way. Floorhands were busy and didn't get a chance to lock elevators before driller started picking up.

IncidentSummary: IE was using scissors to cut paper and they slipped out of the IE's hand while putting them back in
IncidentDescription: IE was using scissors to cut paper and they slipped out of the IE's hand while putting them back in the drawer. The IE tried to stop them and the scissors struck between the index finger and thumb of the right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to area between thumb and index finger of right hand after being struck by falling scissors, due to an attempt to stop them.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/stinger
IncidentDescription: While attempting to remove the discharge module with a loader, the operator attempted to roll the stinger back, the stinger went the other way slamming it down on the roof. No one was injured and no equipment was damaged.

IncidentSummary: IE was exiting doghouse after changing for work and twisted ankle while stepping down.
IncidentDescription: IE was exiting doghouse after changing for work and twisted ankle while stepping down.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left ankle upon stepping out of doghouse after changing to work clothes.

IncidentSummary: Became stuck down hole approximately 21, 063 feet. XTO Company Man, Rusty Ward, made the decision to
IncidentDescription: Became stuck down hole approximately 21, 063 feet. XTO Company Man, Rusty Ward, made the decision to set the plug to try and break free. Gun was armed and turned into it but the tension never dropped. Decision was made to pull out of rope socket. Gleason says he based pullout tension for what the pullout would be for 5/16" line. Worked his way from 3000 lbs to about 6800 pounds. At 6800 pounds the line parted at the horse head and struck the engineer's view logger window.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left middle and index fingers after trapped pressure caused top sub to shoot out of tool and strike left hand that was on the top sub.

IncidentSummary: MISS incorrectly installed catline (BR)
IncidentDescription: The regularly assigned derrick hand was on vacation so a relied derrick hand was sent to Rig 93. While inspecting the rig prior to work, he noticed the recently installed caline was run on the wrong side of the internal load guy, causing the line to rub against each other. If this was not noticed, the lines could cut each other over time.

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped - pressurized lines
IncidentDescription: Hand was testing a fluid pump when he noticed a union leaking. He then decided to tighten it up while pump was still in gear and pumping at 7500 psi.

IncidentSummary: MISS testing reel manifold
IncidentDescription: While having pressure on reel manifold at 15,000 psi, thread-by-thread was installed on other 2x1 valve and hammered before realizing there was pressure on manifold.

IncidentSummary: MISS dead battery charge
IncidentDescription: Tried to jump 12 V battery with 24 V.

IncidentSummary: MISS gas buster
IncidentDescription: Employee was picking up gas buster to take it out of shop and put it back on green tag. The forklift was not all the way through the gas buster and it flipped off forks.

IncidentSummary: EQUP parted line - logger window strike
IncidentDescription:
Became stuck down hole approximately 21, 063 feet. XTO Company Man, Rusty Ward, made the decision to set the plug to try and break free. Gun was armed and turned into it but the tension never dropped. Decision was made to pull out of rope socket. Gleason says he based pullout tension for what the pullout would be for 5/16" line. Worked his way from 3000 lbs to about 6800 pounds. At 6800 pounds the line parted at the horse head and struck the engineer's view logger window.
See attachments for more detailed description.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/blind rams, trapped pressure
IncidentDescription: After making up the new drill bit the blind rams were opened. when the blind rams opened there was pressure on the well which blew out of the well for a few seconds.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/unsecured tool(s), wrench
IncidentDescription: Employees were working on washed wear plate after the test was complete. Employees were cleaning up work area and noticed the wrench got left on the bull wheel, if pump would have been started the wrench could have swung free and hit somebody.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/slippery surface
IncidentDescription: Employee was on BOP tightening up centering cables and slipped on hydraulic oil casing employee to grab onto sub so he wouldn't fall.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving 3 1/2" pipe with the forklift. Two joints became unbalanced on the forks. The IE moved
IncidentDescription: IE was moving 3 1/2" pipe with the forklift. Two joints became unbalanced on the forks. The IE moved the pipe into the correct position by lifting and twisting, which caused some lower back pain. IE did not report back pain issues until following morning.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while moving 3-1/2" pipe into correct position on forklift.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pressure washer hose
IncidentDescription: Company man was walking across mud tanks when he noticed pressure washer hose at top of hatch on mud tanks. After identifying the hazard at hand company man then got rig manager. After investigating problem found that the hatch on mud tank was left open and pressure washer hose was left on top of mud tanks causing hose to vibrate in mud tank. Then agitator wrapping hose around propeller causing hose to break and pressure washer wand to bend very easily that hose could have easily wrapped around someone's foot and taking them inside tank.

IncidentSummary: IE was stepping down off the ladder from the crane platform and tripped over the hand pump next to t
IncidentDescription: IE was stepping down off the ladder from the crane platform and tripped over the hand pump next to the ladder. This caused the IE to fall into an empty tool stand, striking back and shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to lower back and shoulder after climbing down from crane and stepping on hand pump left next to ladder, causing a fall into empty tool stand.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping one of the operators load a Baker tool onto a gooseneck trailer. While sliding the to
IncidentDescription: IE was helping one of the operators load a Baker tool onto a gooseneck trailer. While sliding the tool back, IE slipped on the environmental tarp that was covering several tire ruts in the work area and pinched right pinky finger between the collar of the tool and a piece of angle iron while trying to stop falling backwards.
InjuryDescripti: Cut to right pinky finger after it caught between collar of the Baker tool being loaded and a piece of angle iron while trying to stop fall after slipping on environmental tarp.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/pipe rams
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Crews were performing a formation integrity test. The pipe rams had been closed around the pipe to complete the test. Once the test was completed and the tester rigged down, the crew added a joint of drill pipe to make an even stand and then pulled up on the pipe to remove the slips, without opening the pipe rams, so that a wiping rubber could be installed. Once the wiping rubber was installed the driller started pulling the pipe out of the hole, again failing to open the pipe rams. He stripped the pipe appx. 10 ft. through the pipe rams before the tool joint impacted the pipe rams and cause the pipe to stop. The rig pulled 500k lbs. on the pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pipe wrangler
IncidentDescription: Employee was waiting to latch single latch elevators onto pipe out of pipe wrangler. Another employee was running pipe wrangler and skated pipe on pipe wrangler too far which could have pushed pipe out of pipe wrangler.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/hook
IncidentDescription: After hooking bail to top drive with hydraulic hoist and sling -- employees were lowering down hoist. Once the sling slacked off the hook on the hoist line came off the sling on its own. After checking out the hook employees Matt Miller and Kyle Damon noticed the locking thumb lever would not latch allowing hook to open freely. Employees then stopped to replace hook before(?) installing second bail.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall, hydraulic oil
IncidentDescription: Employee was on BOP tightening up centering cables and slipped on hydraulic oil causing employee to grab onto sub so he wouldn't fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was standing on top of subs brace pressure washing above 4 ft. and almost tripped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/leak, joint threads
IncidentDescription: After pumps were turned on after a connection, a hand noticed that salt water was leaking from the top drive. The pumps were turned off and the stand was mouseholed. A wash was forming in threads of the joint.

IncidentSummary: MISS tool entry guide
IncidentDescription: The plug shoot crew was picking up a tool string. The tool string was almost vertical when the tool entry guide fell off the lubricator, fell down the tool string and struck the plug.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/loose bales, top drive
IncidentDescription: While drilling with hammer bit a brace for top drive bales vibrated loose and fell 20 ft. to rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Jerrest Green catwalk (EC)
IncidentDescription: Ee was on catwalk and boots were muddy causing him to slip off. He landed on his feet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription: After changing valves and seats on mud pump, employee was using a sledge hammer and a BOP bolt to tighten suction valve cover cap on pump. Employee swung hammer to hit bolt and missed bolt hitting the bolt with the hammer handle close to where he was holding it nearly smashing his own hand or fingers.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: After changing valves and seats on mud pump, employee was using a sledge hammer and a BOP bolt to tighten discharge valve cover cap on pump, as he swung hammer to hit bolt, the hammer slipped out of his hand and employee lost his balance and nearly fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/tag line
IncidentDescription: Employee was in riding belt going to pin off top drive to track to slip and cut, employee instructed hoist operator to lift him, but he did not have a tag line so hoist operator did not lift him so they would avoid him swinging freely or getting hung up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pressure, air line
IncidentDescription: While tighten nuts on pump module with 3/4" impact the air fitting that screws into impact -- which is where air line hooks to, the fitting blew out of the impact almost causing the air line to blow also almost striking an employee, another employee was able to shut air off before causing incident. After troubleshoot the impact found that the fitting had stripped -- is to why it blew out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hydraulic hoist
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling up a sub with hydraulic hoist and almost went out of V-door.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/elevators
IncidentDescription: Upon picking up BHA Directional tools the rig crew installed a 3 1/2" I.F. handling sub in the monel and latched the elevators and proceeded to lift the tool the driller and rig manager observed the elevators were too large for the handling sub. The job was stopped and the handling sub and elevators were calipered and determined less than a quarter inch of the sub handling the load.

IncidentSummary: IE and Frank Medellin were carrying the 10k grease head to the back of P-84. They were about 5 feet
IncidentDescription: IE and Frank Medellin were carrying the 10k grease head to the back of P-84. They were about 5 feet away when the IE felt a pinch in lower middle back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to middle of lower back while assisting another employee to carry 10k grease head.

IncidentSummary: IE was bent over and walking backwards mopping the restroom floor. The IE straightened up and hit he
IncidentDescription: IE was bent over and walking backwards mopping the restroom floor. The IE straightened up and hit head on first-aid cabinet.
InjuryDescripti: Cut to head after striking against first-aid kit while mopping restroom floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS equalizing lubricator
IncidentDescription: While we were equalizing lube, frac shut the valve below our lube. At that time we had no idea what kind of pressure we had in the lube, but we did know there was 7,500 lbs below the lube.

IncidentSummary: MISS gun barrel pressure release
IncidentDescription: The gun barrel had pressure in it and when plug was removed it flew off at a high pressure.

IncidentSummary: While breaking a bit sub out (17 1/2 ) drill bit from a stand of 8 inch collars with the bit sub on
IncidentDescription: While breaking a bit sub out (17 1/2 ) drill bit from a stand of 8 inch collars with the bit sub on the bottom side off drill bit breaker box. Colt was securing tongs back to cathead when collar struck heel of left boot, causing minor contusions to left ankle and right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Ankle contusion as a result of being struck by drill collar.

IncidentSummary: IE was on the driller's console rigging down when a bee came out from under the console and stung hi
IncidentDescription: IE was on the driller's console rigging down when a bee came out from under the console and stung him the the right forearm. IE immediately advised Rig Supervisor, Ruben Bueno, of the incident.
InjuryDescripti: Bee sting to right forearm when bee came out from under driller's console while rigging down.

IncidentSummary: IE was tailing 1" rods to rig floor when Rig Supervisor, Jose Molina noticed IE was showing signs of
IncidentDescription: IE was tailing 1" rods to rig floor when Rig Supervisor, Jose Molina noticed IE was showing signs of fatigue. Mr. Molina asked if IE was feeling okay. IE stated he was having lower back pain and wanted to take a 5-minute break. Mr. Molina told IE to go and rest in the doghouse for the remainder of the shift.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while tailing 1" rods to rig floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was on the derrick latching pipe and the blocks swung, struck the rod basket, causing the pipe th
IncidentDescription: IE was on the derrick latching pipe and the blocks swung, struck the rod basket, causing the pipe the IE was holding to swing towards him. IE stated he had discomfort in right shoulder and could hear a "pop" when he moved it.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right shoulder when pipe being held swung towards him when blocks swung and struck the rod basket.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning up around location and as he bent over to pick up some BOP bolts off the ground, he
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning up around location and as he bent over to pick up some BOP bolts off the ground, he felt a sharp pain in the upper back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to upper back while bending over to pick up BOP bolts from ground when cleaning up area.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down, Marshall Moneaux was on the rig floor and called to the IE to come and grab the
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, Marshall Moneaux was on the rig floor and called to the IE to come and grab the sheave from him. When the IE grabbed the sheave, he thought it was attached to the rig's hoist line but Marshall was still holding it. As the IE began to pull the sheave away from the rig floor, Marshall released it, it fell to the ground and the IE felt a strain to left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left should while attempting to take the sheave from another employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS racking mat failure (EC)
IncidentDescription:
While Hawkins lease crew was excavating around wellhead to change out v-section and wellhead, racking mat and 5,000 of tubing sand dropped 4' to 
the ground 
after the middle core section under racking mat gave way.

IncidentSummary: Crew was trying to break a 1502 apart during rig up. Operator was using a 36" pipe wrench to loosen
IncidentDescription: Crew was trying to break a 1502 apart during rig up. Operator was using a 36" pipe wrench to loosen the 1502, but was unable to move it. The IE and the Operator both tried with one holding it in place and the other pushing down. As it broke free the IE felt a sharp pain in the back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while attempting to use a 36" pipe wrench to loosen a 1502 that was in a vice.

IncidentSummary: Stepped on hydraulic hose while pulling lines to BOPs slipped off mat board to ground about 5" but d
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Stepped on hydraulic hose while pulling lines to BOPs slipped off mat board to ground about 5" but didn't fall, felt right knee twist didn't pay much attention to it at the time. When man got up after work knee still and a little swollen.
InjuryDescripti: Near slip-fall on hydraulic line resulting in strain to right knee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While racking back 8" drill collar employee slipped on pipe dope on rotary table causing collar to come back towards stump nearly injuring his arm and leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer, body placement
IncidentDescription: While making up 1502 union on 1" squeeze pipe using 12 lbs hammer, employee missed union almost striking another employee on his knee.

IncidentSummary: IE picked up a reel swivel off the ground while cleaning out a connex box, using legs to lift. The I
IncidentDescription: IE picked up a reel swivel off the ground while cleaning out a connex box, using legs to lift. The IE turned as it got to chest level and felt a pop in lower back hip area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while picking up reel swivel off ground.

IncidentSummary: IE was getting a wiper carrier out of the tool box located on the base beam. As the IE pulled the wi
IncidentDescription: IE was getting a wiper carrier out of the tool box located on the base beam. As the IE pulled the wiper carrier out of the box, right ring finger struck the edge of the tool box.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger after striking it against side of tool box while getting wiper carrier out.

IncidentSummary: Crew was running production tubing when a gas bubble started pushing field saltwater out of tubing.
IncidentDescription: Crew was running production tubing when a gas bubble started pushing field saltwater out of tubing. While trying to get safety valve in tubing, saltwater was spraying in their eyes.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to eyes when sprayed by saltwater while trying to get safety valve in after a gas bubble started pushing field saltwater out of tubing.

IncidentSummary: Employee was attempting to back out landing joint after cement job with chain tong. They could not g
IncidentDescription: Employee was attempting to back out landing joint after cement job with chain tong. They could not get the pipe to move so they decided to use the break out tongs. They had to change the tong head to fit the pipe. As they were changing the tong head, the driller went to help by shaking the tong body which caused the tong head to slide pinching the motorman's left index finger which was positioned between the tong body and tong head. The motorman was wearing impact gloves and suffered small laceration between the first and second joint of his index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left index finger as a result of hand placement between tong head and tong body.

IncidentSummary: The crew was trying to install the stuffing box onto the polish rod. After several attempts, the cre
IncidentDescription: The crew was trying to install the stuffing box onto the polish rod. After several attempts, the crew was having difficulty with the polish rod going through the flapper valve. The supervisor assisted the IE and separated the top section from the stuffing box. As the IE held the top, the supervisor held the bottom section and the polish rod dropped through the flapper valve about three inches. As the polish rod dropped, the top section came with it and pinched the fingers of the IE between the two sections.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right ring finger when it was caught between the top and bottom sections of the stuffing box while attempting to get the polish rod through the flapper valve.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Was checking casing valves to make sure they were in the closed position; using a ladder and was don
IncidentDescription: Was checking casing valves to make sure they were in the closed position; using a ladder and was done with procedure and climbing back out of the cellar using ladder and hit left knee on ladder rung. The ladder is a commercial fiber glass ladder.
InjuryDescripti: Inflammation/irritation around left knee as a result of IE climbing up a ladder and knee hitting a rung.

IncidentSummary: IE climbed up the derrick to remove the sheave wheel for wireline and felt a cramp in the left leg,
IncidentDescription: IE climbed up the derrick to remove the sheave wheel for wireline and felt a cramp in the left leg, but continued to work. IE then came down and began helping the crew cut drill line and started cramping again.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping in left leg while climbing in derrick and assisting crew with cutting drill line.

IncidentSummary: Employee was pulling off ramp of I-20 to exit on to Hwy 151 continued across 151, rolled transport i
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling off ramp of I-20 to exit on to Hwy 151 continued across 151, rolled transport in ditch.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to forehead when vehicle employee was driving lost control in a turn resulting in rollover.

IncidentSummary: Employee was latching pipe in the derrick and noticed his hand was feeling numb at 9:00 PM. He conti
IncidentDescription: Employee was latching pipe in the derrick and noticed his hand was feeling numb at 9:00 PM. He continued for half an hour until 9:30 PM the numbness continually got worse during this time period. He then got relieved out and reported to the toolpusher.
InjuryDescripti: Employee began to experience numbness in right hand while tripping in.

IncidentSummary: MISS Escondido Resources catwalk (AL)
IncidentDescription: Tubing on catwalk to pipe racks slips off boards to one side of pipe.

IncidentSummary: Rig Supervisor, Rock Vasquez, was on the forklift moving pipe racks when IE approached him and advis
IncidentDescription: Rig Supervisor, Rock Vasquez, was on the forklift moving pipe racks when IE approached him and advised him that he had smashed his finger but did not know where or when it had occurred. IE stated that the weather was cold and could not feel any pain. IE had taken glove off and noticed a little swelling on the left middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion, swelling, to left middle finger but does not know when or where it happened. hands were cold there was swelling with no pain.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling out of hole with rods and spun elevator to the other side of the stump after putting
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling out of hole with rods and spun elevator to the other side of the stump after putting them under box. In doing so, IE did not remove hand from elevators. Right hand swung into rod tongs with elevator still in hand, causing IE to smash middle right finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger after it was caught between elevators and rod tongs.

IncidentSummary: Jason was cutting a piece of 1/4" rope to tie up drill line that they were preparing to cut. While c
IncidentDescription: Jason was cutting a piece of 1/4" rope to tie up drill line that they were preparing to cut. While cutting the rope he cut towards his left hand causing himself to cut his left index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left index finger as a result of employee cutting rope with a knife incorrectly.

IncidentSummary: Starting portable light tower and a bug flew into his right ear.
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Starting portable light tower and a bug flew into his right ear.
InjuryDescripti: An insect flew into an employee's ear while he was conducting normal drilling operation.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving BOP's from trailer to crane using a strap to pick up BOP's. The forklift became stuck
IncidentDescription: IE was moving BOP's from trailer to crane using a strap to pick up BOP's. The forklift became stuck and the BOP's had to be set down in mud and rocks. After the forklift was unstuck, IE had the BOP's hanging from the forks on the forklift and was moving them to the wash bay to wash them off. The lift was raised high when the frame around the forks struck the wash bay light and shattered it. The glass pieces fell on the IE's left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand after the frame around the raised forklift forks struck and shattered wash bay light.

IncidentSummary: IE struck head on edge of valve when the wrench being used to tighten the bolt lost grip on the nut.
IncidentDescription: IE struck head on edge of valve when the wrench being used to tighten the bolt lost grip on the nut.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to top of head after striking against edge of valve when wrench lost grip on the nut of bolt being tightened.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, stairs
IncidentDescription: Saw 3rd party hand coming down stairs not using 3-points of contact.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, sub handling
IncidentDescription: While installing a lift sub into collar mousehole, 3rd party attempted to pick up sub and put in by hand nearly rolling sub off box and of collar and landing on floor which could have landed on someone's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling block (AL)
IncidentDescription:
After running 6600' feet of tubing, Operator turned to talk to 3rd party hand and did not chain brake down. Block slowly came 
down and leaned on hand rail.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P Fieldwood slip failure/crane boom folded
IncidentDescription: Slips failed on jacks causing crane to shock-load. Following the shock-load, crane boom folded and crumbled to the deck.

IncidentSummary: The crew was TOH with 2 3/8" tubing. After pulling the 13th stand, the operator stopped and set the
IncidentDescription: The crew was TOH with 2 3/8" tubing. After pulling the 13th stand, the operator stopped and set the slips. The tubing and blocks jumped over because the slips were not sitting level on the wiper plate. This action caused the derrick to shake and bend a joint of tubing. The IE lurched forward while reaching back with left hand to grab the lanyard and felt a muscle strain in left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder while lurching forward to grab lanyard after tubing and blocks jumped forward due to slips not sitting level on wiper plate.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P Fieldwood riser/console strike
IncidentDescription: Riser spun on pivot point and hit console. No damage to equipment.

IncidentSummary: Rig Supervisor, Robert, 'Rock" Vasquez, was operating the forklift and had unbolted the flow line an
IncidentDescription: Rig Supervisor, Robert, 'Rock" Vasquez, was operating the forklift and had unbolted the flow line and tied it off to the forklift carrier. IE walked over and pushed on flow line. It came loose, rotated with a slight turn toward the IE and struck right forearm. Rig supervisor stated that he did not witness the incident. After working for about 20 minutes, IE approached rig supervisor's vehicle and state that there was some swelling in right forearm.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right forearm after being struck by flow line when it came loose from the forklift where it had been tied off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/keeper pin
IncidentDescription: While POOH I observed the keeper in the elevators was missing where the latch pin is located.

IncidentSummary: MISS BlackBrush/foot placement
IncidentDescription: Hand went to stab pipe in string and lost his footing causing to almost hit the ST-80.

IncidentSummary: MISS replaced sheave (AL)
IncidentDescription: While coming out of the hole with 2-7/8" pipe, Derrick Man, Rolando Salinas, noticed the sheave from the fast-line had some play and looked like it would move side-to-side.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/keeper pin
IncidentDescription: Keeper fell out of beam on derrick pin could have fallen out and hit someone.

IncidentSummary: Tripping in hole, after making up stand of drill pipe, IE pulled slips with other floorhands when hi
IncidentDescription: Tripping in hole, after making up stand of drill pipe, IE pulled slips with other floorhands when his right foot slipped on top of mouse hole cover causing him to put his left hand on stand of drill pipe, to keep him from falling causing him to get a sliver of steel in his left palm.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left palm from embedding of steel shaving.

IncidentSummary: MISS slipped ladder
IncidentDescription: While ascending ladder to break lubricator, the ladder slipped to the side of the wellhead and cocked slightly, causing Todd Tyler to slip. Todd held onto the ladder and was able to stand on the wing valve of the tree. Tim Sauce then stabilized the ladder while Todd repositioned and retied the ladder.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressurized brine water spray
IncidentDescription: While crew was coming off perforated well, Josh knocked off the hammer union and moved away from well head with the man basket. The pump-down operator for Halliburton kicked on the boost after she said that we were bled down. It sprayed brine water on Josh and the line truck. It happened a 2nd time that same night to the opposite crew. I think HESS was attempting to run brine through the pump-down equipment because it was cold and the previous night the had some iron that froze.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/foot placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was removing swab from top of pump to change out piston, when it was put on the edge causing it to roll and fall landing next to employee's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got body pinched between 2 joints of rolling casing.

IncidentSummary: Charles was standing on the stair tower next to the flow line and removed a sling from the flow line
IncidentDescription: Charles was standing on the stair tower next to the flow line and removed a sling from the flow line. Charles had just set the sling down. The forklift was pushing against the flange of the flow line to extend the flow line out to bolt it up. Charles grabbed his two way radio and was just about to tell the forklift operator that the flow line was starting to move and the fork slipped off of the flange and struck Charles in the right jaw.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to lip and jaw after being struck by fork tine.

IncidentSummary: They had just loaded the reel with 2" pipe on a trailer and were taking the spreader bar off of the
IncidentDescription: They had just loaded the reel with 2" pipe on a trailer and were taking the spreader bar off of the reel. IE was standing on a ladder taking the pin out of the spreader bar. The right pinky finger was pinched between pin and spreader bar.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right pinky finger after it was caught between pin and the spreader bar.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the man basket hammering the 1002 union off with a sledge hammer with a long handle. The I
IncidentDescription: IE was in the man basket hammering the 1002 union off with a sledge hammer with a long handle. The IE missed the union and hit right hand just above the knuckle. IE was wearing cotton gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand after being struck by long-handled sledge hammer being used to hammer 1002 union.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/sala line
IncidentDescription: When scoping derrick a hand noticed Sala hanging cable for the board was caught and getting tight.

IncidentSummary: Employees were loading perforating guns into the enclosed trailer. IE went in the trailer and was st
IncidentDescription: Employees were loading perforating guns into the enclosed trailer. IE went in the trailer and was standing by the explosives paperwork on the bench. The racks have rollers on the end so you put the guns on the end stand and then roll it into the trailer. While the employees were rolling the gun into the trailer, the gun slid off the rollers and fell about 1 foot, landing on the IE's right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after being struck by a gun that fell from rollers while it was being loaded into trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling blocks (BR)
IncidentDescription: Rig operator hadn't been putting enough brake water on the brakes to keep them cool. After running the rods in the hole, he had stepped away from the operator's platform without chaining the brake handle off. Had one floor hand on the work floor. The derrick man had climbed over the control box and was going to tie something off on the derrick ladder. He stepped on the brake linkage on the way over to the ladder, causing the brake handle to come up and the blocks to fall. The blocks were falling towards the floor hand when the crown-out/floor-out device locked the brakes down. No one was hurt and no equipment was damaged.

IncidentSummary: IE was eating lunch and was stung on the neck by a bee.
IncidentDescription: IE was eating lunch and was stung on the neck by a bee.
InjuryDescripti: IE was eating lunch in the trailer and was stung by a bee.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging down trough from floor with winch line so that it could be put on catwalk. IE pushe
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging down trough from floor with winch line so that it could be put on catwalk. IE pushed trough onto catwalk and felt a pop in right calf muscle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right calf while pushing trough onto catwalk while rigging down.

IncidentSummary: Making a connection on the rig floor. Strained lower back while pulling slips.
IncidentDescription: Making a connection on the rig floor. Strained lower back while pulling slips.
InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back strain as a result of picking up slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/K-braces
IncidentDescription: While removing double rams using bridle (top drive cables) and pull back line, the pull back line tore and double rams slammed into the K-brace and bent the brace. Everyone was standing at a safe distance and no one was injured.

IncidentSummary: MISS test sub stripped threads
IncidentDescription: While testing pack off, test bar stripped out of test sub and into chains. Had 5000 psi when it slipped out.

IncidentSummary: MISS injector head
IncidentDescription: Slim Hole Coil Connector was out too far when laying injector head down and it caught on unit and broke tip off.

IncidentSummary: MISS blown pump hose
IncidentDescription: Employee was testing combi in yard. While coming up on pressure test, the pump hose blew at crimp-on hose with 6000 psi on it.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling pipe wrench
IncidentDescription: Crew was helping chain tool string. The tool hand didn't make sure his pipe wrench was in a safe place in the man basket before having the crew help in remove the motor off the coil. The wrench fell out of the man basket and nearly struck one of the crew on the back.

IncidentSummary: SNUBBING-DOOR GATE WAS REMOVED FOR REPAIR & ROPED OFF WITH CAUTION TAPE AFTER REPAIRED TWO EMPLOYEES
IncidentDescription: SNUBBING-DOOR GATE WAS REMOVED FOR REPAIR & ROPED OFF WITH CAUTION TAPE AFTER REPAIRED TWO EMPLOYEES WAS REINSTALLING AND WHEN SET DOWN PIN HOLES DIDN'T ALIGN SO THIRD PERSON ON HOIST PICKED UP GIVING IT A LlTTLE BIND AND CLINARD SHOOK SO IT WOULD COME OUT SMOOTHLY AND V-DOOR GATE SWUNG AND SLAPPED CLINARD IN THE FOREHEAD SCRATCHING HIM. DIDN'T KNOCK HIM DOWN OR GIVE HIM A HEADACHE.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to forehead after being struck by V-door gate.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/unsecured shackle
IncidentDescription: While removing rotating rubber, employee observed shackle laying on beam at top of substructure not connected to anything on beam.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to cut a section of the drill line with sledge hammer and line cutter. Upon striki
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to cut a section of the drill line with sledge hammer and line cutter. Upon striking line cutter with sledge hammer, a very small piece of metal broke off sledge hammer, or line cutter, and struck IE in upper lip. IE was not wearing face shield, even though one was available on location.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to upper lip after being struck by a small piece of metal that broke off the sledge hammer or line cutter being used to cut a section of the drill line.

IncidentSummary: While the pack-off was free-standing in the shop, employees were making up hydraulic hoses on inject
IncidentDescription: While the pack-off was free-standing in the shop, employees were making up hydraulic hoses on injector head. Employee pulled on hoses to give them more slack and they hit the pack-off, causing it to fall and strike IE in the left calf.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left calf when struck by pack-off after it was knocked over by hydraulic hoses.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/open valve, near spill
IncidentDescription: Employee lined up hopper on to gun line to mix chemicals, employee noticed losing mud from system a different employee came down the tanks and noticed the trip tank about to overflow, alerted the employee of the situation stopped the centrifugal pump went to trip tank pump area and noticed a valve that was left open employee closed valve and emptied trip tanks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/uncovered mousehole
IncidentDescription: While walking the rig the spreader beams were pulled to avoid striking the previous well head. Upon unpinning the spreader beams, floorhand nearly stepped in the previous mousehole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/missing bolts
IncidentDescription: While laying out cement head on catwalk, John noticed two bolts had fallen out of the skate where it bolts to the chain.

IncidentSummary: IE was rolling 3 guns on a trailer in the shop and pinched right middle finger.
IncidentDescription: IE was rolling 3 guns on a trailer in the shop and pinched right middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger while rolling 3 guns on a trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to prime the mud pump with fluid. The centrifugal pump was locked up. After the pu
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to prime the mud pump with fluid. The centrifugal pump was locked up. After the pump was put in neutral and turned off, the guard was removed to free up the pump. IE pulled on the belt to the the pump and when it broke free, the IE lost footing on the icy containment the pump was sitting on and right ring finger caught between the belt and pulley. Finger was smashed and finger nail broken.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger after it was caught between belt and pulley of the centrifugal pump being worked on.

IncidentSummary: Rig hand was hoisting top sheave with tug line. Tug line caught handrail and lifted it off rig floor
IncidentDescription: Rig hand was hoisting top sheave with tug line. Tug line caught handrail and lifted it off rig floor. Handrail fell approximately 15 feet and struck IE in the right forearm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right forearm after being struck by falling handrail that had been lifted off rig floor by tug line.

IncidentSummary: IE approached Michael Berger on 01-07-16 and asked if he remembered the incident that he and Shawn O
IncidentDescription: IE approached Michael Berger on 01-07-16 and asked if he remembered the incident that he and Shawn Olheiser had on 11/05/12. IE informed Michael that there is still pain in the knee from the lubricator that struck his leg and would like to have it checked out. NOTE: On 11-14-12 the IE was taken to the doctor. WSI was not notified. Injury report was filled out, but not sent to Corporate. The IE was taken to the doctor on 01-21-16 and a claim has now been opened with WSI. Doctor report on 02-05-16 states this is low-grade chondromalacia. This is something that happens to a lot of people at some point in their life. Classifying as non-medical of personal.
