InjuryDescripti: Reported to supervisor that knee was still hurting from an incident where left leg was struck by lubricator in 2012.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hoist, 3P participation
IncidentDescription: After landing casing, rig hands started removing bails and elevators we had hand on boatswain chair up in the air with off driller side hoist and using other hoist to pick up bail. Employee was putting bolts back on the first bail when a casing head came out and tried to help. He went to the hoist that our employee was riding thinking that was the one being used for bails. He went up on the hoist and when other employee seen it, they shut him down. Employee was raised approx. 6''. No injures occurred

IncidentSummary: Trailer was pulled beside lube rack. IE was on one end of the lube and Kelly Atwood was on the other
IncidentDescription: Trailer was pulled beside lube rack. IE was on one end of the lube and Kelly Atwood was on the other end. Both picked up lube simultaneously and began moving to the trailer. As the lube was lowered onto the trailer, IE felt glove catch, dropped his end and smashed thumb between lube and trailer.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right thumb after lubricator being loaded onto trailer was dropped and it was caught between lubricator and trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on Rig 22, which is in the yard for repairs. IE was hammering out ball bearings with
IncidentDescription: IE was working on Rig 22, which is in the yard for repairs. IE was hammering out ball bearings with a punch. While doing this, the hammer slipped off the punch and struck left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb after striking it with hammer that slipped off punch while changing out ball bearings.

IncidentSummary: WHILE TIGHTENING DOG KNOT WITH PIPE WRENCH, IE SLIPPED AND FELL ON FLOOR. HE TRIED TO CATCH HIMSELF
IncidentDescription: WHILE TIGHTENING DOG KNOT WITH PIPE WRENCH, IE SLIPPED AND FELL ON FLOOR. HE TRIED TO CATCH HIMSELF AND FELT PAIN IN LEFT SHOULDER.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to left shoulder after near slip/fall on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/conductor
IncidentDescription: While trying to center conductor to weld, hands were pushing conductor on rig floor w/ winch lines. When it got in a bind and broke the tack weld that was already in place causing conductor to pop up and down nearly injuring the welder in cellar lining up conductor.

IncidentSummary: As the crew unloaded the bales from the tool truck, one employee pushed them down while another pull
IncidentDescription: As the crew unloaded the bales from the tool truck, one employee pushed them down while another pulled them to the ground. One bale landed with the eyelet up and it bounced and fell over on top of the IE's right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after being struck by bale being unloaded from tool truck.

IncidentSummary: MISS pump down-stuck line
IncidentDescription: After picking up the 5th run for the night, the tool came out of the gun wheels and there was about 5 feet before entering the lube. About one foot from entering the lube, gained weight really fast and the gun started to swing rapidly. Slacked off on the line, looked to see what happened and found that the line was stuck between the gap on the entry guard. Laid down the gun and looked at the line and found that there was no damage. Continued the job.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P HES water blown from well head
IncidentDescription: Wireline was coming off the well. The well was shut in and frac van said that the well was bled off. Josh knocked off the lube and walked half way down the staircase. Chance pulled the lube off the well and it sprayed water all over and almost knocked Josh off the staircase. The temperature was 8 degrees. The HES pump operator said the ground guy left the bleeds open and left the air compressor on and blew all the water out of the well head. This is the second location in a row that the ground guy has been sprayed with water when it is cold.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the process of rigging down wireline at the completion of the job. They were loading BOP b
IncidentDescription: IE was in the process of rigging down wireline at the completion of the job. They were loading BOP back on the trailer. Mike and Chad were pulling it onto the trailer and IE was pushing. IE felt the BOP ram tap hard hat and while moving away, stumbled left leg landed on grease hose. On the drive back IE was limping and there was some swelling when they stopped in Rawlings.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left leg after stumbling and falling on grease hose when moving out of the way after feeling BOP being moved tap hard hat.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/wrench, unsecured tool(s)
IncidentDescription: Employee was in the boatswain chair greasing the top drive when I noticed that there was a crescent wrench in his back pocket. It was deep in his hip pocket that was against the board but I asked him to give it to me and he did no problem doing so, he usually takes everything out of his pockets but he overlooked the one item.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While pushing back pipe, hand slipped and almost fell after pipe set.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/slips, foot placement
IncidentDescription: While pulling slips, hand had his foot in the wrong place and slips lightly skinned his steel toe (glancing off of his boot's steel toe).

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/forklift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand on forklift nearly backed into a truck but was stopped by a coworker.

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure release
IncidentDescription: Crew was taking a 1 9/16" gun that appeared to be a miss run. When the crew broke the connection with pipe wrenches it broke below the double male adapter sub. They started unscrewing the gun from the CCL by hand. When they got to the last thread, the gun barrel shot off the CCL and landed about 6" away. There was no indication of trapped pressure.

IncidentSummary: Rig was picking up 2 7/8" tubing and IE went to check the end of tubing to make sure it was free of
IncidentDescription: Rig was picking up 2 7/8" tubing and IE went to check the end of tubing to make sure it was free of debris. Board was across cellar area for footing and was muddy from recent rains. IE's foot slipped on board causing IE to fall 2' into cellar. IE twisted to the left and right lower back above the belt line hit the casing valve on B-section of well head.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after falling into cellar due to slipping on muddy board laying across cellar.

IncidentSummary: The crew was pulling and laying down a 4 1/2" frac string from the well. After the first joint was u
IncidentDescription: The crew was pulling and laying down a 4 1/2" frac string from the well. After the first joint was unlatched, the IE was pushing the elevators by the far horn to swing them around the pipe in the well. As the elevators swung in towards the pipe, the IE's left hand was on the elevators and was pinched between the elevators and pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right middle finger when hand was caught between elevators and pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/broken safety wire, castle nut
IncidentDescription: While doing post jarring inspection found that safety wire on cap head screws for die block broke and castle nut on die block retainer plate had cut through keeper.

IncidentSummary: Crew was eating lunch while IE was helping test crew while they were testing the well. Wellhead had
IncidentDescription: Crew was eating lunch while IE was helping test crew while they were testing the well. Wellhead had a leak on top section and IE instructed the test crew to bleed off pressure. IE was in the well cellar and stepped on wellhead, which was 12" from the ground, with left foot. IE attempted to place right foot onto the next section of the wellhead to look at the leak but it slipped on the water that had been running down the wellhead as a result of the leak. This caused the IE to slip backwards into the cellar and strike left hip and waist against the casing valve.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after slipping in the well cellar on water that had run down leaking wellhead.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loose pipe, windy conditions
IncidentDescription: Hand was tailing in a joint of 4" drill pipe when a gust of wind caught it causing him to lose his grip on the rope. The drill pipe swung across the rig floor missing equipment and personnel.

IncidentSummary: An employee was helping string up a 1 3/8 " drilling cable in the Crown, placing it in the dead shea
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: An employee was helping string up a 1 3/8 " drilling cable in the Crown, placing it in the dead sheave. The employee was threading the end of the cable thru the sheave. He then instructs a coworker to pull the cable thru by use of a forklift and tieback line. He noticed that the cable had come out of position and stops the operation. He then re-positions the cable with his hands. The forklift then releases the tension on the cable allowing the end of the cable to back out of the sheave and catching the employeeGs glove, resulting in a crushing injury to fingers.
InjuryDescripti: Severe trauma to fingers of left hand when fingers were caught between sheave and cable resulting in crushing injury.

IncidentSummary: As he crew was picking up 1" rods, the IE latched the rod elevator onto the rod and hooked the eleva
IncidentDescription: As he crew was picking up 1" rods, the IE latched the rod elevator onto the rod and hooked the elevator to the rod hook. As the operator started up with the blocks, the rod elevator swung over and struck the IE's safety glasses. The impact pushed the safety glasses up causing a small laceration on the forehead.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to forehead after safety glasses were struck by swinging rod elevator as the operator started up with the blocks.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS setting packer-pressure release
IncidentDescription: Key rig hand opened up BOP without checking pressure. Well pressured up and shot our snub pipe and pack-off up slightly. Sudden pressure release shot our tool up-hole (was approximately 200' below surface) past our Wireline. We got stuck down hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, faceshield
IncidentDescription: The backup tongs wouldn't hold the 7" casing so Express started to change the tong dies. Express employee was using the tong die driver and hammer without face shield.

IncidentSummary: IE had one hand on the cart and one on the weight bar so it would not move, while helping Wyatt brea
IncidentDescription: IE had one hand on the cart and one on the weight bar so it would not move, while helping Wyatt break a cable head off of the weight bar. The connection broke without issues. The IE took a step back and noticed left thumb was hurting and bleeding.
InjuryDescripti: Avulsion to left thumb

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/elevators, latches
IncidentDescription: Tripping out of the hole driller latch elevators to a drill pipe stand when he was going to pick up hand noticed that the elevators did not latch good and he told the driller to stopped.

IncidentSummary: MISS ignored caution tape
IncidentDescription: Crew had just finished logging and was bleeding off pressure when a farmer on a tractor tried to drive between rig and logger. Caution tape was out as well as a guy standing under our wireline that he paid no attention to. His hay forks went over our line before he was stopped.

IncidentSummary: MISS logger connection unplugged
IncidentDescription: Upon arriving on location for our first shift, we conducted a walk-around to make sure ground clamps were correctly hooked up. They were, but plug in back of logger was not plugged in. We immediately plugged it in and made sure it worked properly.

IncidentSummary: MISS brake pedal cross-pin (AL)
IncidentDescription:
Operator Abel Alvarez was inside rig cab and was about to drive rig from well to another location when he placed his foot on the brake pedal. The brake pedal fell to 
the floor on one side. Upon inspecting the pedal, Mr Alvarez noticed cross-pin holding the pedal had worked itself out.

IncidentSummary: Relief crew was raising the driller's console with the cat line. As the driller was winching up the
IncidentDescription: Relief crew was raising the driller's console with the cat line. As the driller was winching up the console, it caught on the derrick, resulting in the console leaning to one side. This caused IE to slide and strike lower back and right shoulder against handrail.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back and right shoulder after sliding and striking against handrail when console hung up on the derrick.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/torque
IncidentDescription: While pulling on slips after connection, pipe in hole had trapped torque on it, which makes pipe spin in reverse.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/leak, shaker slides
IncidentDescription: Shaker sliders were leaking at the top of the slides.

IncidentSummary: While coming out of the hole with 2 7/8" pipe, IE was in the tubing board, the wind blew one stand o
IncidentDescription: While coming out of the hole with 2 7/8" pipe, IE was in the tubing board, the wind blew one stand of pipe out of the derrick and pipe struck the IE's left arm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left arm after being struck by pipe while in the tubing board, when wind blew it out of the derrick.

IncidentSummary: Weather conditions were rain and changing to snow at time of occurrence. Employee was walking down t
IncidentDescription: Weather conditions were rain and changing to snow at time of occurrence. Employee was walking down the stair tower on off driller side of rig. Approximately half way down employee slipped landing on his right elbow on stairs.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right elbow resulting from a slip on stairs.

IncidentSummary: The crew was assembling the tubing and IE was monitoring and holding the slobber hose in a bucket. T
IncidentDescription: The crew was assembling the tubing and IE was monitoring and holding the slobber hose in a bucket. The hose became plugged and pressured up. The hose separated at a splice, the pressure suddenly released and the well fluid sprayed into the IE's eyes.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to both eyes after being sprayed by well fluid when slobber hose being held separated at splice.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped tool string
IncidentDescription: While picking up tool string to stab into Side Entry Package lube tool string hung and pulled off-line, dropping tool string 40 feet. Brushed the arm of employee stabbing tools into lube. Calling it a near-miss.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/body placement, catwalk
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: When the catwalk was raised in the air an employee was about to walk in the buffer zone.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near dropped item
IncidentDescription: An employee was moving a pallet of drilling soap with the forklift when the pallet shifted and a bucket nearly fell off the pallet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/unsecured door
IncidentDescription: Employee was throwing trash into the trash trailer when the wind blew the door shut almost hitting him.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/hammer(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: A cementer hammered up a union and when he was done, he tossed the hammer to another employee, almost hitting him.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/valve
IncidentDescription: Employee went to turn the mud tanks diesel pump on and noticed the water was open to the diesel hose and hanging off the tanks.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pipe
IncidentDescription: Employee was moving pipe from derrick to mousehole when he slacked off he almost hung the board (illegible) could caught the derrick (illegible).

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/chemical lines, hopper
IncidentDescription: Hand was fixing to put chemicals and he did not notice the lines were not lined up to mix and he opened the hopper slowly and oil base came back on the hopper.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/manbasket, tie-off
IncidentDescription: Saw hand put on harness and get in manbasket then got back out and come back with tools. Start manlift, stopped hand and told him he hadn't tied off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/flow line, high pressure
IncidentDescription: While circulating a bottom's-up to try and get gas out of the hole, at the time of bottom's-up gas pressured up and made the flow line raise up to the point of nearly coming out of dresser sleeve.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/flagger
IncidentDescription: Hand was coming out of motor shed and saw a truck driver backing up without a flagger.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/winch line
IncidentDescription: TIGHTEN WINCH LINE ON DRILLERS SIDE TO BREAK AWAY ROPE ALLEN WRENCH WAS BEHIND HANDLE NOT ALLOWING HANDLE TO GO TO NEUTRAL SO WINCH WAS STUCK IN UP POSITION CAUSING WINCH LINE TO BREAK AWAY FROM ROPE AND HOOK ON WINCH CABLE SWUNG TOWARDS ROTATING PIPE.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/whip check, flow line
IncidentDescription: Our employee noticed whip check missing to gun line hose on flow line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/wrench
IncidentDescription: Observed hand using pipe wrench and wrench was adjusted too small.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/defective hammer
IncidentDescription: Saw employee grab hammer by choke ask hand what he was doing and he said gonna put another gauge on choke told him not until he got a new hammer that he didn't check it and the handle had a crack in it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/loose mat
IncidentDescription: While drilling, wind picked up and employee noticed a coco mat was hanging off the board, and could have possibly fallen off, as floor hands were scrubbing on floor. Employee called up to rig floor and got everyone off rig floor and had derrick man climb up and bring coco mat down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: After cleaning suction screen on mud pumps, employees put lid back on and started tightening up nut with a pipe wrench, pipe wrench slipped causing employee to lose his balance stumbling backward nearly falling to ground.

IncidentSummary: As the crew was moving the rig out of the location, it became stuck due to muddy conditions. IE was
IncidentDescription: As the crew was moving the rig out of the location, it became stuck due to muddy conditions. IE was installing a bridle to the rig so it could be towed out of the mud by a Hilcorp winch truck. While reaching out to grab the bridle belonging to Hilcorp, a burr protruding from the towing bridle stuck right pinky finger. IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Slight puncture to right pinky finger after being stuck by burr on towing bridle while attaching it to winch truck.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking to rig and slipped.
IncidentDescription: IE was walking to rig and slipped.
InjuryDescripti: IE was walking toward rig and slipped. It had rained a lot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/mud bucket, top drive
IncidentDescription: Crew was back reaming and using mud bucket hanging off of driller side hoist. As driller was coming up on top drive, floorhand noticed mud bucket going up so immediately stopped driller. Hoist line got hung up on top drive causing it to lift mud bucket.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/body placement
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee re-positioning mats and almost backed into drill line spool.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/3P, body placement
IncidentDescription: Third party employee bending over to get tail rope and was nearly hit by the catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling pressure washer hose and slipped losing his balance almost falling into ditch.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/3P, hand placement
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hands was rolling casing and taking protector out same time the other hand roll casing too fast almost smash employee fingers.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/unsecured wrench
IncidentDescription: While walking around and checking equipment after crew change employee noticed that the wrench was left on the #2 mud pump bull wheel. Crew had worked on the liner washers earlier in the night.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/PPE, gloves
IncidentDescription: Saw hand working without impact gloves.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription: Employees were going through mud pumps to check valves and seats while testing BOPs. Employee was on top of mud pump in the process of removing the discharge cap. Employee put pin through holes on cap and swung at pin missing pin and letting hammer slip out of his hand NEARLY hitting another employee standing on the side of pump waiting to assist on pump.

IncidentSummary: MISS Forge/forklift, mats
IncidentDescription: Employee was operating forklift to set mats when dropping mat it shot out a rock nearly hitting employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Forge/ladder
IncidentDescription: While inspecting top drive we were using a ladder when climbing it wiggled and told employee to get off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Forge/loose pins, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: Employee was removing shipping pins when taking out the locking pins and fell out of his hand, falling onto rig floor.

IncidentSummary: As Justin Smith was driving over the overpass heading north on Hwy 58, the 18-wheeler in front of hi
IncidentDescription: As Justin Smith was driving over the overpass heading north on Hwy 58, the 18-wheeler in front of him suddenly stopped. Justin was unable to stop quickly enough and rear-ended the truck. Upon impact, the load on our vehicle broke the straps and slid to the front of the trailer, making the impact into the 18-wheeler much harder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back and neck after rear-ending and 18-wheeler that made a sudden stop.

IncidentSummary: MISS Forge/gloves, body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was using rope to tail in pipe when it slipped out of hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Forge/hoses, body placement
IncidentDescription: While changing discharge hose employee's leg was in between old hose and new hose. Employees were lining up the hammer union and pulling hose back not knowing one of the employees' leg was in between them.

IncidentSummary: MISS Forge/sub(s)
IncidentDescription: Employee was removing subs from directional driller basket while rigging the strap on sub the sub shifted and employee almost had his hand caught/smashed when sub shifted.

IncidentSummary: MISS Forge/unknown
IncidentDescription: While employee was dragging hoses to the cellar to pump out the snout on the conductor cracked open while he was under it.

IncidentSummary: MISS line wiper plate
IncidentDescription: Opened compartment door on Wireline unit #134 and line wiper plate fell out and was caught by David Moore.

IncidentSummary: MISS electrical line
IncidentDescription: 9/32" electrical line was slightly rubbing on the hoist line of the crane.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing on rig floor with well head hand waiting to take off wrap-around. Trapped pressure f
IncidentDescription: IE was standing on rig floor with well head hand waiting to take off wrap-around. Trapped pressure from under wrap-around blew it out of tubing head and up the joint. Pressure that was built under hanger hit IE in the face.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to cheek after being struck by oil from pressure that had built up under hanger when wrap-around blew out of the tubing head and up the joint.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/catwalk skate
IncidentDescription: While running casing the driller was coming down with the string of casing while the catwalk operator was bringing the next joint of casing up to the floor. During this operation the catwalk skate malfunctioned and would not stop after the controls were released. The joint of casing came in and ended up underneath the elevators as they where coming down. The elevators struck the joint of casing which caused the joint of casing to be knocked out of the catwalk trough and it fell down onto the ground.

IncidentSummary: INJURED EMPLOYEE WAS PLACING A GUARD INTO FESTOON BASKET. GUARD WAS NOT SITTING LEVEL ON FLOOR CAUSI
IncidentDescription: INJURED EMPLOYEE WAS PLACING A GUARD INTO FESTOON BASKET. GUARD WAS NOT SITTING LEVEL ON FLOOR CAUSING IT TO FALL OVER ONTO EMPLOYEE'S HAND THAT WAS ON THE EDGE OF FESTOON BASKET. IT CAUSED A SMALL CUT ON HIS RIGHT PINKY FINGER.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right pinky as a result of being struck by falling festoon basket guard.

IncidentSummary: MISS bottom sheave
IncidentDescription: While stabbing JB into hole, tool got into a bind. Pack-off hose was pulled so that it was directly over well allowing tool to fall. Wireline was slightly slack and bottom sheave sagging. Moved all personnel away from sheave before pulling pack-off hose. Tool went down and bottom sheave went up. Made run.

IncidentSummary: MISS flagger's limited view
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up 7" lube grease head with 7" packer inside lube. One man was flagging the forklift driver while tailing assembly up inside derrick. Flagger was told to halt operations. Flagger could not see from the area he was in that the top of the lube at grease head was binding up at opposite side of the derrick. Instructed the forklift driver to back up and positioned another flagger on opposite side of derrick so he could signal forklift driver.

IncidentSummary: MISS truck bed box cover
IncidentDescription: While driving in high wind conditions down I-70, a gust of wind blew the back cover of truck bed box into the center median of the highway.

IncidentSummary: Crew was driving south on Hwy 95 to location. As they approached the top of the hill, a vehicle was
IncidentDescription: Crew was driving south on Hwy 95 to location. As they approached the top of the hill, a vehicle was in their lane passing another vehicle in a no passing zone. They did not have time to react and hit the oncoming vehicle head-on.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to shoulder while passenger in crew truck involved in head-on collision.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pipe
IncidentDescription: Latching up pipe at the board (while tripping in) didn't realize relief had a pipe in a finger that didn't correspond with the number at the floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P Select Energy/pressure wash wand
IncidentDescription: Select Energy had three employees on location. Two were working on the wellhead under pressure and the third was up on the water tanks. One of the two working on the wellhead opened a valve by mistake and a bunch of water blew out, soaking the employee. Fifteen minutes later, a water valve blew open and sprayed water up in the air off of one of the hard lines going from the wellhead to the water tanks. One of the employees ran across the work area and was soaked in water while trying to shut off the valve. Once the valve was shut he jogged over to the wellhead and got a pressure gauge to put on the line.

IncidentSummary: MISS clevis shaft
IncidentDescription: While coming out of the well after completing run, someone noticed the wireline was wrapped around the holding brackets on the lubricator. The wireline was rubbing on the clevis shaft. No one knew how long this had been happening. There could have been a groove worn into the shaft and the holding point weakened. There were high winds and limited visibility.

IncidentSummary: MISS hot welding iron
IncidentDescription: After completing a weld, employee removed glove to wipe sweat from forehead. Employee then went to grab iron with no glove but stopped himself. Employee put glove back on, moved iron and continued with project.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken hammer head
IncidentDescription: While hammering fishing tools off tool string, hammer head broke off the handle and fell to the floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure washer wand
IncidentDescription: Zip tie was placed on pressure washer wand to clean out floor drain. The wand came out of the floor drain and was spinning around on the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS standing on drum/greasy line
IncidentDescription: Employee was standing on drum washing back of wireline truck. The line was greasy and could have caused him to slip and fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS lubricator
IncidentDescription: Rig operator raised lubricator past the sheave and damaged the line. Calling this a near miss even though damage occurred.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/missing bolt(s), unsecured bolt(s)
IncidentDescription: While lifting the rotary bushings, with the offside hoist, it was noticed that there was slack between the hoist body and the pedestal. Upon equipment inspection, it was discovered that the hoist was missing 1 bolt and 3 more were not tight.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/floor plate
IncidentDescription: Floorhand was heading down stairs and when he stepped on the piece of floor plate leading to rig floor, the plate broke from one of the hinges and caused floor hand to lose his footing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/belly belt rope
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Derrickman noticed rope for belly belt was not in good working condition on board.

IncidentSummary: Driver was traveling southbound on Hwy 71 when a city dump truck failed to yield and struck our vehi
IncidentDescription: Driver was traveling southbound on Hwy 71 when a city dump truck failed to yield and struck our vehicle on the left side.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after being t-boned by a dump truck.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe, employee almost slipped and fell down with mud on racking board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/lift cap
IncidentDescription: When picking up BHA, mud motor was being lifted with hoist and lift cap until employee saw lift cap make a half-turn. Hoist operator then lowered motor back into trough of pipe wrangler.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand was tailing stand towards mouse hole with tail rope and slipped almost falling on racking board due to slip hazard caused by OBM.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription: When swinging ST-80 toward mousehole employee nearly struck another employee with ST-80 that was tightening collar clamp.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/unsecured bolt
IncidentDescription: Employee was breaking suction cap off of mud pump when he hit the bolt used to break the cap it fell out almost striking another employee in the chin.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/fallen object(s), box
IncidentDescription: Employee was getting some rope from the middle shelf when a box of rags fell from the top shelf almost hitting him on the arm, due to the box just being thrown on the top shelf.

IncidentSummary: IE alleges that on 03-30-16, while attempting to pick up pipe to latch it to the elevators a pain wa
IncidentDescription: IE alleges that on 03-30-16, while attempting to pick up pipe to latch it to the elevators a pain was felt in right knee. The IE did not report the incident to the supervisor and continued working the rest of the day and subsequent days through 04-06-16. On 04-05-16, the IE felt a pop in the knee followed by more pain. This subsequent incident was not reported to the supervisor. On the evening of 04-05-16, the IE was still experiencing pain and went to Seton Smithville Regional Hospital without any report to supervisor or management. The IE was diagnosed with knee strain and advised to see primary care physician on 04-11-16 for follow up.
InjuryDescripti: Alleged strain to right knee while picking up pipe and running tubing back in well.

IncidentSummary: While working on mud pump #1 removing liner retainers from mud pump, employees working on pumps were
IncidentDescription: While working on mud pump #1 removing liner retainers from mud pump, employees working on pumps were backing out the bolts on the liner retainer with impact, but impact would not back some of the bolts out, so employee tied strap around the allen wrench and break bolt with the chain hoist used to remove liners, while coming up with hoist allen wrench hung and stripped out of the bolt slinging up striking the employee in the lip causing laceration
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip after being struck by an allen wrench.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking around truck going to close bay door and struck left knee on tool rack while trying t
IncidentDescription: IE was walking around truck going to close bay door and struck left knee on tool rack while trying to fit between opened driver's side door and tool rack.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee after striking against tool rack while trying to fit between the rack and opened driver's side door.

IncidentSummary: IE was using grinder to cut a piece of metal out of a flat tank when the cutting wheel came apart. A
IncidentDescription: IE was using grinder to cut a piece of metal out of a flat tank when the cutting wheel came apart. A piece of the wheel cut through the left hand glove
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand after being struck by a piece of the grinding wheel being used after it came apart.

IncidentSummary: IE was re-heading cased hole line. While sliding brass block on line and running armors through bloc
IncidentDescription: IE was re-heading cased hole line. While sliding brass block on line and running armors through block, noticed he had cut one short. IE pulled block back up pushed down on on it to try and run armor through. This resulted in the armor popping out and puncturing three fingers of right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right pinky, ring and middle fingers after striking against armor while pushing down on block.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/pipe wrench
IncidentDescription: While changing swab, employee was using pipe wrench with a closed hand grip. Pipe wrench slipped and employee almost hit hand on skid.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/manlift, loop winch
IncidentDescription: Employee was driving manlift and it almost became hung up on the loop winch the employee noticed and backed away from the hazard.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/hand placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was going to move collar slips and almost mashed his finger between the handrail and slip handles.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hinges
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: New hinges were welded on walkway that goes from rig floor to stairs on draw works, old hinges were left on walk way and one was about to fall off. Could have fell off and hit somebody.

IncidentSummary: AFTER EMPLOYEE WINCHED DRILL COLLAR INTO THE ALLEY. HE THEN RELEASED TENSION ON THE WINCH AND GUIDED
IncidentDescription: AFTER EMPLOYEE WINCHED DRILL COLLAR INTO THE ALLEY. HE THEN RELEASED TENSION ON THE WINCH AND GUIDED DRILL COLLAR INTO THE RACKING FINGER. THE DRILL COLLAR THEN ROLLED ON THE RIG FLOOR CAUSING THE TOP OF THE DRILL COLLAR TO "WHIP" OVER INTO THE DRILL COLLARS ALREADY RACKED BACK INTO THE FINGERS, PINCHING HIS HAND BETWEEN 2 DRILL COLLARS.
InjuryDescripti: Right hand was caught between two drill collars resulting in minor contusion.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/top drive, body placement
IncidentDescription: While tripping in the hole employee was standing under the service loop and when the top drive came down it almost sat on his head.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/shaker screen wedge, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While attempting to pry wedge out pry bar broke the lip of the shaker screen wedge causing pry bar to slip off and employee nearly falling down.

IncidentSummary: The crew was rigging service unit up. While moving base beam a spider crawled up leg and bit the IE
IncidentDescription: The crew was rigging service unit up. While moving base beam a spider crawled up leg and bit the IE behind the left knee. Supervisor was immediately notified and the IE went to the dog house and removed clothes. IE was able to locate spider, black and fuzzy with long legs, and smashed it.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced slight irritation to area behind left knee after being bitten by a spider while moving base beam.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pressure washer line
IncidentDescription: Employee had pressure washer tied to manlift while pressure washing sub. He rotated manlift and pinched the line between sub and manlift nearly cutting line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/wrench, dropped object(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While employee was tightening up the dresser sleeve, he lost grip of a wrench and it fell down bouncing off several objects and landing near another employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall, trip hazard
IncidentDescription: While employee was working on mind pump, he was not fully aware of his surroundings when he stepped on to the skid on a wrench making him lose his footing. The employee nearly tripped over the suction line.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/impact gun
IncidentDescription: The employee was in the process of making up the bolts on the flow line with an impact wrench. The threads on the hose connection to the impact failed and the air line blew off of the connection to the wrench. The employee shut the valve and stopped to flow of air to the line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/hammer union ear
IncidentDescription:
While hoisting cement bails up to elevated cement head (approximately 15') winch hook slipped over 2" 1502 hammer union ear, winch operator was signaled to come up again as lines were not moving, tension was built up due to hook being snagged on hammer union ear. It came free popping up past team.
members face above head (Approximately 1.5') . No one realized anything was wrong. After the event
work was stopped and everyone assessed what the cause was.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking down tool/gun string with pipe wrench and right hand was on barrels and left hand wa
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking down tool/gun string with pipe wrench and right hand was on barrels and left hand was on pipe wrench handle. Hand slipped as IE pushed down. IE was wearing greasy/oily gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left hand when it slipped off pipe wrench handle while breaking down tool/gun string with greasy/oily gloves.

IncidentSummary: MISS slipped tool - clam shell shut
IncidentDescription: Crew was preparing to lay down bond tool. Travis and Mike were putting on the clam shell when tool slipped on rig floor and slammed clam shell shut. Clam shell just missed closing on their fingers.

IncidentSummary: IE was cutting o-rings off port plugs when left hand slipped and was cut by the hook razor blade.
IncidentDescription: IE was cutting o-rings off port plugs when left hand slipped and was cut by the hook razor blade.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to hand after being cut by a hook razor blade when hand slipped while cutting o-rings off port plugs.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was on his way up the stairs and almost missed a step almost hitting his shin.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/wrench, tool placement
IncidentDescription: Was walking by pump to put pressure washer up noticed bull gear wrench on top of pump.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/snake(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While cleaning a pile of casing thread protectors off ground into bag, employee went to bend down to pick up thread protector when he seen the head of a snake coming out from under thread protector when employee seen snake he then turned and run away from area of work/where snake was.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/manlift, hose
IncidentDescription: Employee was operating manlift and another employee saw him about to pull a hose in half so he stopped.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/trough, foot placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was standing on trough to roll a joint of pipe back in that had rolled out and almost got his foot caught between the pipe and the trough.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While stepping out of the driller's cabin, the driller slipped on some hydraulic fluid that was on the floor and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/tail rope
IncidentDescription: While tripping 8" collars in the hole derrickman latched up stand, driller came up, the "tail rope" on the floor being helped by a floorhand broke causing ii to come across the floor uncontrolled.

IncidentSummary: Employee claims that she has a pain in her right wrist area and has been sore for several days. She
IncidentDescription: Employee claims that she has a pain in her right wrist area and has been sore for several days. She is not sure what is causing her pain but that it does hurt while she is entering data on her computer.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to right wrist as a result of overexertion while executing data entry over long periods of time.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hoist
IncidentDescription: While attempting to slack off of the ODS hoist on rig floor to pick up casing spider slips, the employee pushed lever on hoist to lower the hook to remove the hook from the snubby and place hook or casing spider slips to pick up while attempting to slack off hoist with no load on hoist, the housing and gear on hoist blew outside of the hoist, damaging side plate and stripping bolts out of side of housing.

IncidentSummary: IE was using cutting wheel on a grinder to cut top of a ground rod off to install clamp. Cutting whe
IncidentDescription: IE was using cutting wheel on a grinder to cut top of a ground rod off to install clamp. Cutting wheel broke and a piece of the wheel struck right index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to right index finger after being struck by a piece of cutting wheel after it broke off grinder being used to cut top off ground rod.

IncidentSummary: MISS multiple operations-hand placement
IncidentDescription: While breaking guns down off coil above wire line in well head, there were multiple operations and moving parts. The crane was moving, coil was moving, and coil operator or crane operator moved down and caught hand between pipe wrench and man basket.

IncidentSummary: IE was making up chain of reel motor. While lifting motor with valve bar IE noticed a pinch and slig
IncidentDescription: IE was making up chain of reel motor. While lifting motor with valve bar IE noticed a pinch and slight swelling in right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right hand when lifting motor with valve bar while making up chain of reel motor.

IncidentSummary: IE was screwing lock pins into halls head while installing stripper rubber. Left hand was in a tight
IncidentDescription: IE was screwing lock pins into halls head while installing stripper rubber. Left hand was in a tight spot and crescent wrench was freed up, causing left thumb to strike against BOPs.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb after striking against BOPS when wrench freed up while screwing in lock pins.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/gas monitoring, air burst
IncidentDescription: After pumping an attempted cement plug employees went to the rig floor to drop a string line down the conductor to try and tag cement for a measurement. While dropping the string line down the conductor two gas detectors were used in the substructure to check for gas. The gas was monitored around and inside of the conductor. A welder proceeded to start cutting the conductor while the measurement for cement was being taken from the rig floor with the string line. While taking the measurement with the string line from the rig floor a large burst of air shot out from the top of the conductor through the rotary table bushings and blew all of the string line out.

IncidentSummary: During rig up, while using 2 chain hoist to pick up and position the flow line, IE was using a tag l
IncidentDescription: During rig up, while using 2 chain hoist to pick up and position the flow line, IE was using a tag line to maneuver the flow line. One of the hoist was in a bind allowing the line to slip off one end and partially fall landing on sub. This caused a tag line that the IE was holding to jerk out of the employee's right hand. The employee was asked if he was ok at the time of the incident and the employee verified he was ok and no injury. Today 5/9/16 the employee has returned back to work and is showing some deep bruising around small finger and palm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand pinky finger after tagline IE was holding was jerked out of his hand due to fallen hoist line.

IncidentSummary: MISS server battery box
IncidentDescription: Battery box on server unit burned up, shut down and almost caught fire.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/3P, hose
IncidentDescription: Vac truck pulled on location to suck water from the mud tanks, the derrickhand was not notified by third party. Derrickhand noticed that there was a hose thrown into the pits without proper LOITOITO of the agitators. After finding the hose in the tanks the derrickhand shut down the job.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking down a Baker 20 tool and didn't move the pressure release port away from him before
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking down a Baker 20 tool and didn't move the pressure release port away from him before letting out the pressure in the gun. As the IE opened the valve, pressure from the gun sprayed out striking the left wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to left wrist after being struck by pressure being released from the Baker 20 tool being broken down because the release port was not facing away from him.

IncidentSummary: IE was backing the studs out of the top of the hydril with a pipe wrench and cheater pipe. The wrenc
IncidentDescription: IE was backing the studs out of the top of the hydril with a pipe wrench and cheater pipe. The wrench slipped and the cheater pipe came off and struck near left eye. Studs were rusty and very tight.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration near left eye after being struck by cheater pipe being used to remove studs from top of hydril.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/sledge hammer
IncidentDescription: Hand was swinging sledge and it slipped out of his hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/unsecured greased fitting
IncidentDescription: New wash pipe was being installed in top drive. While greasing new wash pipe, crew member noticed that the grease fitting was not fully installed and tightened.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/Broken safety wires, top drive
IncidentDescription: During rig service employee noticed several safety wires broken on bolts on top drive. Bolts had not backed out so new safety wire was installed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/flagger
IncidentDescription: Truck driver started to back up without a flagger.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/Dirty face shield
IncidentDescription: Third party hand was pressure washing with dirty face shield.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/vacuum hose
IncidentDescription: Employee was trying to discharge vacuum hose to reserve pit. Hose was not tied down or secured to prevent spills or injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/PVC pipe
IncidentDescription: While adding barite t the hopper area, the PVC pipe that transfer the barite from the bulk tank fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/environment, wildlife
IncidentDescription: While going to check water tank volume, employee walked into area that was swarming with bees. The bees were found to be collecting in an area that had water inside of a hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/catwalk, body placement
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, cement crew about to send hand lines down the V-door, cement hand was standing on catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/near trip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand was walking and tripped on a hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/slips, foot placement
IncidentDescription: After connections, hands pulled slips and when they set them down, they fell by a hand's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/tail rope
IncidentDescription: Hand was tailing in joint after connection, hand rope slipped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/forklift, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee want to get on the forklift and missed the step almost causing him to fall into the forklift.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/mousehole cover
IncidentDescription: Employee was holding mousehole cover and let it go almost landing on another employee's foot.

IncidentSummary: Employees were working on taking double nuts off of studs on the discharge line of the pulsation dam
IncidentDescription: Employees were working on taking double nuts off of studs on the discharge line of the pulsation damper. Injured employee was holding back up with a box end wrench while standing on the pump skid. The other employee was spinning out the nut with 3/4" drive air impact on a 4 ft ladder. They were taking off outside nut from the stud, the nut backed off so quickly that the employee running the impact wrench lost control of the impact. Injured employee holding box and wrench was standing approximately 2 ft to the side of the impact wrench when the impact wrench swung around and hit him in the top front tooth and bottom lip. The impact chipped his front tooth and split his bottom lip. Employee grabbed his mouth removing his front upper tooth and his bottom lip bleeding. Employee using impact wrench came and notified the rig manager.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was struck in the mouth when hand tool slipped out of another employee's grip resulting in laceration to lower lip and dislodging a tooth.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/fuel filter gasket
IncidentDescription: While doing a walk around an employee discovered that a fuel filter gasket started to leak causing a slow drip from filter housing.

IncidentSummary: WHILE MAKING UP STANDS IN THE MOUSE HOLE THERE WAS A DOUBLE HANGING FROM THE BLOCKS. THE CREW WAS PI
IncidentDescription: WHILE MAKING UP STANDS IN THE MOUSE HOLE THERE WAS A DOUBLE HANGING FROM THE BLOCKS. THE CREW WAS PICKING UP THE THIRD JNT TO PUT IN THE MOUSE USING THE SINGLE JNT ELEVATORS. THE EMPLOYEE LATCHED THE SINGLE JNT ELEVATORS ONTO THE JNT OF PIPE THAT WAS IN THE TROUGH OF THE HYDRAULIC CATWALK. HE THEN REACHED FOR THE TAIL ROPE AND WAS PULLING IT BETWEEN THE SINGLE LATCH AND THE END OF THE TROUGH WHEN THE CATWALK OPERATOR MOVED THE SKATE BACK, CAUSING THE JOINT OF DRILL PIPE TO SLIDE BACK DOWN THE TROUGH, PINCHING EMPLOYEE'S HAND BETWEEN THE SINGLE LATCH ELEVATORS AND THE END OF THE TROUGH.
InjuryDescripti: Employee injured the thumb of his left hand after it got pinched in between the single latch elevators and trough of the hydraulic catwalk.

IncidentSummary: IE was hammering the night cap off the well. As the IE grasped the needle valve with left hand and t
IncidentDescription: IE was hammering the night cap off the well. As the IE grasped the needle valve with left hand and the cap with the right hand, the cap slid toward him and smashed right index finger between night cap and flange bolt.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right index finger when it was caught between night cap and flange bolt while removing the cap.

IncidentSummary: MISS lost trailer wheel
IncidentDescription: Somewhere between shop in Ft. Morgan and Extraction location near Greeley, a trailer wheel was lost. The trailer drove fine all the way to the location.

IncidentSummary: MISS Extraction - stuck lubricator/shock loaded crane
IncidentDescription: While coming off well head after shooting guns, the crane started scoping in until BOP's touched the ground, within a matter of seconds, after the BOPS' and lube came off the well head.

IncidentSummary: MISS Extraction - needle valve
IncidentDescription: Operator was in man basket and had just put the night cap on. Before there was time to close needle valve on crown, valve frac opened up to that well and well fluid came out of needle valve.

IncidentSummary: IE and Zack Wooley were about 10 feet up in the man basket loosening bolts on a BOP. A bolt would no
IncidentDescription: IE and Zack Wooley were about 10 feet up in the man basket loosening bolts on a BOP. A bolt would not come out so a 1 1/2 hammer wrench and a 10 lb hammer were used. As Zack swung at the hammer wrench, the sledge hammer pinged off the hammer wrench and hit the left arm of the IE.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left arm after being struck by a 10 lb sledge hammer while using it to hammer on a 1 1/2 lb hammer wrench to loosen a bolt on BOP.

IncidentSummary: MISS "grease lock" broke free
IncidentDescription: After bumping up in lube and bled off, wireline was "grease locked in the tubes. An operator went to move the hoses by the well head when the "grease lock" broke free. It caused the bottom sheave wheel to jump from 4' to 9' off the ground. The operator was about 3' away from the sheave when the incident occurred.

IncidentSummary: Crew was removing tree bolts with tree valves open and Kelly hose removed. The well came in and spra
IncidentDescription: Crew was removing tree bolts with tree valves open and Kelly hose removed. The well came in and sprayed crew with condensate. Crew changed clothes but IE only changed his shirt and not pants resulting in an irritation/burn around waistline.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained irritation to lower back after being sprayed by condensate from well due to not changing into clean pants.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/foot placement
IncidentDescription: While breaking bolts that anchor a traction motor so that we could adjust the drive belts...Hand was crouched down breaking bolt that was tight with a breaker bar... Once bolt gave, hand nearly lost his balance.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/3P, hydraulic catwalk trough
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand walked out in front of hydraulic catwalk trough while bringing in a joint of casing. Man running machine stopped as soon as he noticed the hand in harm's way.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/unsecured cotter pin
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe out of the hole one of the cotter pins in the bolts for the elevator ears fell out.

IncidentSummary: IE was using a hammer to take bolts off well head and twisted right knee.
IncidentDescription: IE was using a hammer to take bolts off well head and twisted right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right knee while hammering bolt off well head.

IncidentSummary: At approximately 8 AM on 06-06-16, IE notified Alice Managers, Juan Lopez and Noe Garza that left kn
IncidentDescription: At approximately 8 AM on 06-06-16, IE notified Alice Managers, Juan Lopez and Noe Garza that left knee was injured on 06-01-16 while helping rig #105. IE stated that on 06-01-16 at about 5 PM, the crew was washing out and picking up pipe and he was holding the tail rope to hold back joint of pipe. IE felt a slight discomfort to left knee when twisting. IE said the incident was not reported because he thought the pain would go away. IE worked the following day, 06-02-16.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee while holding back joint of pipe with tail rope.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: As the IE was crouched down pulling the tool string into the lube with a pipe wrench, the pipe wrenc
IncidentDescription: As the IE was crouched down pulling the tool string into the lube with a pipe wrench, the pipe wrench slipped off and hit on the right side of the nose.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a laceration to right side of nose after being struck by a pipe wrench being used to pull the tool string into the lube.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped swedge
IncidentDescription: A.Reyes was in the process of rigging down tree connection (2 7/8" swedge). While he was placing it into the man lift, the swedge slipped out of his hands, fell 10 feet and struck the hydraulic hose on scoping ram belonging to Rig #127.. It then fell an additional 10 feet and landed in the well cellar. No injuries were reported.

IncidentSummary: MISS exploding pump fan blade
IncidentDescription: Crew was pumping at low pressure at 1/4 barrel per minute, pulling out of hole to check wash tip. Suddenly, they heard a loud bang, immediately shut down the pump, switched to another pump and continued pumping and pulling out of hole. Upon inspection the crew found the fan blade had exploded, throwing pieces across location and knocking of the belt guard.

IncidentSummary: IE was unloading the #20 setting tool from the truck and felt a pop in left shoulder. IE went to the
IncidentDescription: IE was unloading the #20 setting tool from the truck and felt a pop in left shoulder. IE went to the office and notified the supervisor.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder while unloading a #20 setting tool from company truck.

IncidentSummary: IE was leaving shop around 2:00 PM on 06-15-16 and stated he had a headache. Supervisor also noticed
IncidentDescription: IE was leaving shop around 2:00 PM on 06-15-16 and stated he had a headache. Supervisor also noticed IE was soaked in sweat. IE returned to shop on 06-16-16 at 8:00 AM and within 30 minutes of doing shop work, loading guns and driving forklift, IE began to not feel well and around 9:00 AM told someone he needed to sit down. After about 10 minutes of sitting in an air conditioned office, supervisor checked on him an found no improvement. His symptoms were dizziness, nausea, chest tightness, difficulty breathing, and felt if he stood up he would pass out. We agreed IE needed immediate attention due to becoming less alert. We called 911 and ambulance arrived and brought IE to ER in Norman, OK.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced dizziness, nausea, chest tightness, and difficulty breathing upon returning to work the morning following experiencing a headache and sweating the day before.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT unsecured pin
IncidentDescription:
Truck was pulling off location with middle section of derrick and hitch released king pin causing it to slide
off plate and set on truck.

IncidentSummary: Crew was nippling down BOP stack with riser spool and had removed all nuts from studs. As they picke
IncidentDescription: Crew was nippling down BOP stack with riser spool and had removed all nuts from studs. As they picked up on BOP, riser spool hung on a stud and spool fell and glanced off IE's right arm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right arm after being struck by falling riser spool that hung on a stud as crew picked up on BOP.

IncidentSummary: Our driver was returning back home after loading out for Llewellin job, As he traveled north on Busi
IncidentDescription: Our driver was returning back home after loading out for Llewellin job, As he traveled north on Business 77, a car stopped at a stop sign on FM 446. The car then proceeded through the intersection and hit the left rear door and bed of the truck. The impact put the truck in a skid and it came to rest about 75 yards down the road on the opposite side.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced stiffness and soreness after truck was t-boned by a car while driving through intersection.

IncidentSummary: Employee set his Coke down and later went to take a drink of it and was stung on the bottom of his t
IncidentDescription: Employee set his Coke down and later went to take a drink of it and was stung on the bottom of his tongue by a honey bee. His tongue swelled slightly.
InjuryDescripti: Bee-sting to tongue after employee reached for a beverage.

IncidentSummary: IE was opening door to dog house and an was stung by an insect on the handle.
IncidentDescription: IE was opening door to dog house and an was stung by an insect on the handle.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to right hand after being stung by and insect that was on the dog house door handle.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling Baker 20's off the rack and while bending over to pick up the other end was struck on
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling Baker 20's off the rack and while bending over to pick up the other end was struck on the right shoulder by a falling unsecured tool.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right shoulder after being struck by a falling unsecured tool while pulling Baker 20's off the rack.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking flange studs on BOPS with a pull wrench and felt a sharp pain in lower back while pu
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking flange studs on BOPS with a pull wrench and felt a sharp pain in lower back while pulling on wrench.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced strain to lower back while breaking flange studs on BOPS with a pull wrench.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/rig floor, foot placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling slips after connection when slips tipped over almost striking employee's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/3P, safety glasses
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Third party employee was not using safety glasses on location.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/rig floor, slip-fall hazard
IncidentDescription: Employee almost slip and fall down when pulling slips while tripping the rig floor was full of oil base.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/tail rope
IncidentDescription: While picking up BHA employee noticed tail rope was torn.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription: At approximately 9 AM while casing crew was preparing to resume running long string casing, the ST-80 swivel lock came loose. At this point the ST-80 swung around nearly striking member of the casing crew in the back. Immediately upon seeing the ST-80 pivoting freely the driller called on the intercom for the casing hand to "watch out" allowing him to move before being struck in the back.

IncidentSummary: A piece of equipment was being moved with the forklift and the IE's right hand was pinched between t
IncidentDescription: A piece of equipment was being moved with the forklift and the IE's right hand was pinched between the forks and the equipment.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right wrist after it was caught between forklift forks and piece of equipment being moved.

IncidentSummary: IE was hammering bolts loose from flange, became overheated and went to rest in cooling trailer. IE
IncidentDescription: IE was hammering bolts loose from flange, became overheated and went to rest in cooling trailer. IE complained of weakness, dizziness and stomach cramps.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat exhaustion while loosening bolts on flange.

IncidentSummary: IE was picking up rods from ground level and felt a bee sting on right side of neck and then on left
IncidentDescription: IE was picking up rods from ground level and felt a bee sting on right side of neck and then on left side of neck.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained a bee sting to both sides of neck while picking up rods.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS tool entry guide
IncidentDescription: After re-heading, wireline came through slot in tool entry guide while picking up. Operator on ground noticed it before tool came to entry guide and signaled to stop.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/3P, safety harness
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand was about to tie up load above 4 ft tall and was not using a safety harness.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/3P, PPE
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand was working on lining behind mud tanks without a hardhat.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/3P, vehicle
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand was backing up vacuum truck and almost hit hopper.

IncidentSummary: IE was stuck on the neck by a bee while he was tripping rods in the hole. Rig Supervisor, Jacob Barr
IncidentDescription: IE was stuck on the neck by a bee while he was tripping rods in the hole. Rig Supervisor, Jacob Barrientez sat the IE down in the dog house to check for any swelling or reaction to the sting. There was none.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained bee sting on the neck while tripping rods in the hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/slip-fall hazard
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was mixing chemicals on hopper and almost slipped while carrying bag of chemicals with mud on floor.

IncidentSummary: Derrick man, Chris Gonzales, had taken hanger out of junk box and was rolling it onto the forks of t
IncidentDescription: Derrick man, Chris Gonzales, had taken hanger out of junk box and was rolling it onto the forks of the forklift. IE thought Chris was struggling with the hanger and got off the forklift to assist. As the IE was laying the hanger down, the left ring finger caught between the hanger and forks on the forklift. IE was not wearing impact resistant gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to left ring finger when it was caught between forks on forklift and hanger being moved.

IncidentSummary: After the IE had picked up a joint with tongs, the tong cable broke and struck left shoulder as it f
IncidentDescription: After the IE had picked up a joint with tongs, the tong cable broke and struck left shoulder as it fell to the floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to left shoulder after being struck by tongs when cable broke while picking up joints.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS missing stinger latch
IncidentDescription: Crew was using a loader with a stinger on it to tail in the lubricator as it was lifted by the rig. After pulling the sling on the hook of the stinger, crew noticed the latch was missing.

IncidentSummary: IE was lifting one end off a perforating gun and felt a pain in his abdomen.
IncidentDescription: IE was lifting one end off a perforating gun and felt a pain in his abdomen.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain (hernia) to abdominal area while lifting one end of a perforating gun.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/3P, safety glasses
IncidentDescription: 3rd party hand was working behind mud tanks on pump from reserve pit without safety glasses.

IncidentSummary: MISS heating unit exhaust/box fire
IncidentDescription: The wind started to blow and a box blew onto heating unit exhaust. Box caught fire and was put out right away with fire extinguisher.

IncidentSummary: MISS grease-covered crane step
IncidentDescription: When climbing into crane cab, the diamond plating was covered in wireline grease causing it to be very slick. Employee slipped and almost fell off crane.

IncidentSummary: MISS air supply line
IncidentDescription: Employee was getting ready to shut in and was walking to the crane when an air supply line broke. Both ends were whipping around and he immediately grabbed both lines and killed the air supply coming from tank on crane. The line had broken where the male air fitting was crimped to the hose.

IncidentSummary: The day crew had pumped CaCl into the well to kill it. When night crew came on tour, they began trip
IncidentDescription: The day crew had pumped CaCl into the well to kill it. When night crew came on tour, they began tripping pipe out of the hole. The IE unlatched a joint of tubing and began guiding the pipe into the tubing board. His glove was cut by a burr on the tubing which allowed CaCl that was on the pipe to get on the skin.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained chemical burn to right hand after burr on tubing cut glove and allowed CaCl to come in contact with hand.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging up BOP and went to the BOP trailer to gather more tools. On the way to the trailer th
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging up BOP and went to the BOP trailer to gather more tools. On the way to the trailer the IE lost balance and fell to the ground, striking nose.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to nose after slipping and striking face on ground while walking back to the BOP trailer.

IncidentSummary: Francisco was rigging down the platform for derrick ladder and started feeling cramps on hands as he
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Francisco was rigging down the platform for derrick ladder and started feeling cramps on hands as he was removing the pins from the platform.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat stress, multiple internal systems.

IncidentSummary: While working through the day then setting Generator skids Melvin started feeling light headed, weak
IncidentDescription: While working through the day then setting Generator skids Melvin started feeling light headed, weak and minor stomach cramping.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat exhaustion, multiple internal systems.

IncidentSummary: IE was using the forklift to move 4 - 4' x 8' sheets pf plywood to the base beam and noticed that on
IncidentDescription: IE was using the forklift to move 4 - 4' x 8' sheets pf plywood to the base beam and noticed that one sheet was not aligned properly. IE slipped off the forklift to realign the top sheet and felt discomfort in his middle/lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to middle/lower back while readjusting plywood being moved with forklift.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking up stairs, back and forth to the well bay, and back up to main deck. After a while, I
IncidentDescription: IE was walking up stairs, back and forth to the well bay, and back up to main deck. After a while, IE's right knee started getting sore. IE did't think it was serious and went to bed. Upon waking the next morning, the knee felt worse. He then filed an incident report with the offshore company medic.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee after climbing up and down stairs.

IncidentSummary: Crew was in the process of changing out rig floor for another smaller rig floor. IE was removing the
IncidentDescription: Crew was in the process of changing out rig floor for another smaller rig floor. IE was removing the washer from the railing socket with a sledge hammer and the washer flew up and struck the IE in the chin below lip. IE was wearing safety glasses but not a face shield.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to chin after being struck by washer being removed from railing socket with a sledge hammer.

IncidentSummary: Pioneer vehicle was stopped at red light and another vehicle struck it from behind. Other driver was
IncidentDescription: Pioneer vehicle was stopped at red light and another vehicle struck it from behind. Other driver was taken to the hospital before a citation was issued.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced lower back pain when crew truck he was a passenger in was rear ended while stopped at a light. Initially refused medical treatment but on 08-01-16 decided medical treatment was needed.

IncidentSummary: IN PROCESS OF Installing MUD HOSE FROM MUD PUMP #2 TO MUD TANKS IE WAS LIFTING HOSE FROM GROUND TO I
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: IN PROCESS OF Installing MUD HOSE FROM MUD PUMP #2 TO MUD TANKS IE WAS LIFTING HOSE FROM GROUND TO INSTALL HAMMER UNION WHEN HOSE SLIPPED AND LANDED ON IE ANKLE.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left ankle after hose slipped and landed on IE's ankle.

IncidentSummary: IE was wearing slicker suit while coming out of hole and became overheated.
IncidentDescription: IE was wearing slicker suit while coming out of hole and became overheated.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced slight heat exhaustion wearing slicker suit while tripping out of hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS lightning strike
IncidentDescription: Lightning appeared to strike crane while coming out of the hole with perforating gun. Computer in crane operator cab shut down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/possible trapped gas
IncidentDescription: While removing flange from water melon I reminded employees that there was a chance that there could be trapped gas in the water melon, I told them to leave two bolts across from each other and break one slowly and they did and there was trapped gas and condensate. We told the company man about it and we closed the two valves up stream and it bleed off of about thirty minutes.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/ST-80, hose
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe the topdrive was lowered to latch onto stump. The kelly hose slightly rested on top of the protruding ST-80. The floor hand running the ST-80 noticed this and attempted to scope the iron rough neck back to its position before any more of the hose could rest on the device. While doing so the hose slipped off the ST-80 and swung toward the employee. No injuries, damages or impact occurred.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/trailer imbalance
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
While loading bad collars on truck trailer to send to shop, employee loaded 3 drill collars and as he
did, the collars rolled all to one side causing the trailer to shift and become uneven. As the trailer
became uneven rather quickly, it caused the truck driver to lose his balance. The truck driver nearly fell off the trailer and nearly got his feet smashed by rolling drill collars.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/rig floor, slip-fall hazard
IncidentDescription: While setting back stand of drill pipe, hand slipped on floor causing stand to swing back. Setting in wrong spot derrickhand unlatched stand. Had to latch back up and move stand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall, hose(s)
IncidentDescription: While hooking up discharged for super vac, hand was dragging hoses when he almost fell over other hoses that were not properly put up.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/rig floor, slip-fall hazard
IncidentDescription: While untangling pressure washer hose, the hose got wrapped around hand's feet almost causing him to trip and land on K-beam.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hand placement
IncidentDescription: While taking off bolt from guard to draws (???). Open end wrench slipped causing hand to almost smash finger in between guard and wrench.

IncidentSummary: The crew was hydro testing in the hole. The IE was on the rig floor running the tubing tongs. The cr
IncidentDescription: The crew was hydro testing in the hole. The IE was on the rig floor running the tubing tongs. The crew was picking up the 80th joint off the pipe wrangler, running in 3rd gear. The trough of the pipe wrangler was about 2 feet above the rig floor. The IE put the rabbit inside the joint and the bottom of the joint cleared the trough. The IE and operator both thought they heard the rabbit hit the trough so the operator kept picking up tubing. The IE grabbed the tubing with right hand and wrapped left arm around the bottom to the tubing. The IE noticed the rabbit did not come out of the tubing and immediately tried to move left arm away from the bottom of the tubing as the rabbit came out of the tubing and glanced off the IE's left forearm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left arm when rabbit came out of the tubing while the crew was hydro testing in the hole.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/substructure, near trip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was pressure washing under substructure and almost tripped with choke line.

IncidentSummary: Employee was driving home to El Campo from Kenedy yard. Employee had been doing a brake job that had
IncidentDescription: Employee was driving home to El Campo from Kenedy yard. Employee had been doing a brake job that had taken most of the day. On his way home, he fell asleep near Telfemer, TX and struck a guard rail. He was alone and no other vehicles were involved.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower legs after falling asleep and striking guardrail while driving back to El Campo from Kenedy yard.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/hand placement
IncidentDescription: While stabbing a stand of drill pipe into stump at rotary table a hand placed his hands dangerously close to the pinch point created by stabbing pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/forklift, body placement
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee almost pinched other employee with forklift while emptying trash cans employee had wrong body position and poor visibility.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got struck by ST-80 while making a connection.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/manlift, hoses
IncidentDescription: Employee was operating manlift under substructure and the basket. Got hung up with some hydraulic lines.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the process of opening a valve when stung below the jaw bone by a yellow jacket.
IncidentDescription: IE was in the process of opening a valve when stung below the jaw bone by a yellow jacket.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained wasp sting to neck just below jaw bone while opening a valve.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking to desk and slipped/tripped and landed on both knees. Stayed on floor briefly as she
IncidentDescription: IE was walking to desk and slipped/tripped and landed on both knees. Stayed on floor briefly as she has had knee surgery in the past. There was a "goose egg" on right knee but more pain in the left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion/abrasion to both knees after slipping/tripping while walking across office to desk.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping Gilbert Lopez unload a weight bar from the trailer bed. As Mr. Lopez pulled the weigh
IncidentDescription: IE was helping Gilbert Lopez unload a weight bar from the trailer bed. As Mr. Lopez pulled the weight bar, the IE's attention was on the forklift that was too close to the trailer and the weight bar fell on his right middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to right middle finger after it was caught between trailer and weight bar he was helping to unload.

IncidentSummary: Employee was sleeping in crew quarters while off duty. When employee woke up 8/9/2016, he noticed wh
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was sleeping in crew quarters while off duty. When employee woke up 8/9/2016, he noticed what looked like and felt like a mosquito bite on his right forearm. When he woke up on 8/10/2016, employee noticed the swelling had worsened and gotten a black spot in the middle.
InjuryDescripti: Spider bite resulted in skin irritation/inflammation to right forearm.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging up wireline and crane truck. IE was retrieving an object from the lubricator basket
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging up wireline and crane truck. IE was retrieving an object from the lubricator basket and while climbing down the ladder, maintaining three points of contact, his boot caught on the rung. This resulted in the IE falling on the right knee. The IE finished the job and reported incident to Riley Brent the next morning because his knee was hurting.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right knee after boot caught on ladder causing him to fall and strike right knee on ground.

IncidentSummary: On 8-12-16 Tammy was working on a two axle trailer in the WTX shop replacing axles and repairing tra
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: On 8-12-16 Tammy was working on a two axle trailer in the WTX shop replacing axles and repairing trailer, he states that while bending over repairing trailer through the day he began to feel pain in his lower back and began experiencing pain. It was not severe and he just attributed the discomfort from working while bending over, he didn't not report his pain to anyone. On 8-15-16 Tammy called safety supervisor and stated he could barely get out of bed and was having severe pain from his lower back and it was radiating down his right leg.
