InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back strain from over-exertion while working on trailer in shop.

IncidentSummary: WHILE EMPLOYEE WAS PRESSURE WASHING THE SUB, HE BENT DOWN TO CLEAN LOWER PARTS OF THE SUB AND WHEN H
IncidentDescription: WHILE EMPLOYEE WAS PRESSURE WASHING THE SUB, HE BENT DOWN TO CLEAN LOWER PARTS OF THE SUB AND WHEN HE STOOD BACK UP, HE BECAME DIZZY AND DISORIENTED. HE WALKED BACK TO THE CHANGE HOUSE TO GET A DRINK OF WATER AND TAKE A BREAK. THEN HE BECAME SHORT OF BREATH AND STARTED SWEATING HEAVILY.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat stress while pressure washing under substructure.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/tie-back rope
IncidentDescription:
WHILE TRIPPING PIPE THE WINCH HOOK TIE BACK ROPE BROKE AND THE WINCH LINE AND
HOOK SWUNG INTO THE MIDDLE OF THE FLOOR WHILE THE BLOCKS WHERE COMING DOWN
THE DERRICK.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/air hose, leak
IncidentDescription:
AIR HOSE HAD A SMALL LEAK COMING FROM THE FESTOON TO THE RIG FLOOR, COULD HAVE
RUPTURED AND STRUCK SOMEONE WHILE WALKING BY.

IncidentSummary: IE showed up for work on 08-16-16 and worked for approximately 2 hours before reporting that lower b
IncidentDescription: IE showed up for work on 08-16-16 and worked for approximately 2 hours before reporting that lower back was hurting. IE alleges that during the day on 08-15-16, lower back might have been strained while hooking up a hose the circulate the well. The incident was not reported and no pain was felt that day.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly strained lower back on day prior to reporting while hooking up hose to circulate well. No pain was felt the day of the alleged strain.

IncidentSummary: AFTER TESTING THE ROTATING HEAD. PRESSURE WAS ALREADY RELEASED AND JOE GUERRA PROCEEDED TO OPEN THE
IncidentDescription: AFTER TESTING THE ROTATING HEAD. PRESSURE WAS ALREADY RELEASED AND JOE GUERRA PROCEEDED TO OPEN THE FLOW LINE VALVE. AS THE VALVE WAS BEING OPENED. THE 2 PIECE CONNECTING ROD OF THE VALVE HANDLE STEM BROKE LOOSE AT THE THREADED CONNECTION, UNKNOWINGLY TO JOE. THE STEM WAS UNSCREWED COMPLETELY CAUSING THE LENGTH OF STEM (APPROXIMATELY 15'). TO FALL AND LAND ON THE SPREADER BEAMS IN THE SUB, RESULTING IN THE VALVE HANDLE "WHIPPING UP" AND STRIKING HIM JUST ABOVE HIS RIGHT EYE.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to forehead above right eye after being struck by valve handle.

IncidentSummary: MISS Felix/pins, BOP, well head
IncidentDescription: WHILE TRYING TO GRAB BOPS WITH BOP HANDLER DRILLER REMOVED PINS THAT SECURE HANDLER TO SKID, ANOTHER EMPLOYEE STOP THE JOB AND TOLD THE DRILLER THAT THIS WAS NOT RIGHT. DRILLER WENT AHEAD WITH OPERATION ANYWAY. AFTER ATTACHING HANDLER TO BOPS DRILLER NEVER PUT PINS BACK IN. WHILE LIFTING BOPS BOP HANDLER SLID BACK MAKING THE BOPS REST ON TOP OF WELL HEAD. (DUE TO CASING BEING INSIDE BOPS THIS KEPT THEM FROM TOPPLING OVER)

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/mouse hole, foot placement
IncidentDescription: While making stand in mouse hole, employee's foot was under mouse hole cover when employee attempted to walk, he tripped and fell forward. He grabbed the hoist line to help him stay upright.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/ratchet
IncidentDescription: Employees were taking off jars clamp and the employee that was using the ratchet loosening the bolts almost struck himself in the face when the ratchet slipped off the bolt.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/drill line
IncidentDescription: While slipping drill line back on drum observed damaged spots on drill line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/hammer
IncidentDescription: While using hammer employee missed target causing handle to crack just below hammer head.

IncidentSummary: IE was beside garbage dumpster at the yard and was stung on lip, forearm and back by a wasp.
IncidentDescription: IE was beside garbage dumpster at the yard and was stung on lip, forearm and back by a wasp.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained wasp sting to lip, forearm and back while walking by garbage dumpster at the yard.

IncidentSummary: Receiving loads from ND to OH. After the drillers cabin arrived on location. We were looking it over
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Receiving loads from ND to OH. After the drillers cabin arrived on location. We were looking it over for any repairs that may be needed. While discussing repairs needed with electrician and superintendent, I rested my left hand on a cabinet on driller's cabin skid, that has a sliding gate system for a door. Not realizing that the Gate/Door was not down all the way, it fell down into place (approximately 1 1/2" slightly pinching my left ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left ring finger after it was caught between sliding gate/door and cabinet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/loose line, wedge
IncidentDescription: Hand was going to re-spool tugger line because it was loose and crossed on drum. He noticed the wrong size wedge had been used. Hand stopped the job and got right sized wedge. Hand then re-spooled tugger line.

IncidentSummary: The crew was getting ready to rig up the work floor. The IE was walking towards well head and when s
IncidentDescription: The crew was getting ready to rig up the work floor. The IE was walking towards well head and when stepping onto cellar grating, right foot slipped off the grating and strained right ankle. IE continued working until the end of the work day.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle when it slipped off side of cellar grating while walking to well head.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up pipe while IE was operating the hydraulic catwalk. When the crew broke for lunch
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up pipe while IE was operating the hydraulic catwalk. When the crew broke for lunch, IE informed Rig Supervisor, Larry Veloz, Sr, that both of his hands were cramping up a little.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping of both hands while operating hydraulic catwalk.

IncidentSummary: IE was folding over work platform side wing off driller's side with winch line. When wing was straig
IncidentDescription: IE was folding over work platform side wing off driller's side with winch line. When wing was straight up, hand slipped off as IE took off winch line. Wing fell and struck IE behind steel toe on right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right foot after being struck by falling platform side wing after unhooking winch.

IncidentSummary: Crew had just finished laying out a 16" hanger joint assembly. They were using the rig hoist line an
IncidentDescription: Crew had just finished laying out a 16" hanger joint assembly. They were using the rig hoist line and forklift to move the hanger. The forklift operator placed his forks under the hanger and lifted it about 4 feet off the ground. Instead of tilting the forks back to secure the pipe he tilted them forward, causing the pipe to roll off and land on top of the IE's left foot. The IE was standing too close to the pipe when it was being lifted.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left foot after being struck by 16' hanger joint assembly when it rolled off forklift.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS broken pallet/falling tongs (EC)
IncidentDescription: Placed hydraulic tongs on wooden pallet for storage. Weight of tongs was too heavy and broke pallet. Tongs fell over and could have potentially struck someone.

IncidentSummary: IE was building stetting tools and placing piston into chamber. Another employee was screwing top su
IncidentDescription: IE was building stetting tools and placing piston into chamber. Another employee was screwing top sub on chamber while another employee applied air to push piston forward. Top sub was not screwed all of the way in position and piston shot out of chamber, striking IE on the right hip.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left hip after being struck by piston when it shot out of Baker setting tool chamber after air was used to push piston forward.

IncidentSummary: IE was carrying the perforating gun our of pump down trailer on right shoulder. While walking out of
IncidentDescription: IE was carrying the perforating gun our of pump down trailer on right shoulder. While walking out of the trailer the felt that was on the bottom of the door tore and the IE slipped with the gun still on the shoulder. IE fell to the ground on knee and left arm and the gun fell on right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right shoulder after slipping and falling and being struck by perforating gun being carried.

IncidentSummary: MISS Felix/wrangler
IncidentDescription:
WHILE ATTEMPTING TO ATTACH BOP WRANGLER TO BOPS, WRANGLER WOULD NOT MOVE
FAR ENOUGH TO GRAB BOPS. DRILLER REMOVED THE TWO PINS IN FRONT OF THE
WRANGLER. ANOTHER EMPLOYEE TOLD THE DRILLER THIS WAS NOT RIGHT AND TO STOP
THE JOB. THE DRILLER DID NOT STOP JOB AND CONTINUED. DRILLER LIFTED BOPS HIGH
ENOUGH TO CLEAR THE BOLTS THE WRANGLER SLIDE BACKWARDS CAUSING BOPS TO FALL
RESTING ON WELL HEAD.

IncidentSummary: Crew had picked up about 86 joints of 2 7/8" pipe. IE was operating the tubing tongs on the floor an
IncidentDescription: Crew had picked up about 86 joints of 2 7/8" pipe. IE was operating the tubing tongs on the floor and was manually threading the pipe with back facing towards the hydraulic catwalk unit. Catwalk operator, Homero Sanchez, proceeded to raise a joint of pipe and was distracted as two joints of pipe began to roll towards the catwalk. Mr. Sanchez failed to stop the catwalk unit and the joint struck the IE's lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lower back after being struck by a joint of pipe that rolled towards the catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging down tongs using catline and tagline. IE was on rig floor pushing tongs off floor.
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging down tongs using catline and tagline. IE was on rig floor pushing tongs off floor. Two floor hands were pulling on the tagline on the ground. Driller, Richard Cano, lowered the tongs. The tongs hit the hand rail and the IE's right thumb before they cleared, flipping the IE's right thumb nail up.
InjuryDescripti: Right thumb nail was pulled back after being caught between the tongs and hand rail while rigging down.

IncidentSummary: Crew was trying to release the packer down hole. The employees put 2.5 rounds of right hand torque i
IncidentDescription: Crew was trying to release the packer down hole. The employees put 2.5 rounds of right hand torque in the tubing and began to work torque down to packer. After multiple attempts of working torque down to packer, the driller set the tubing down on the slips to take off 36" pipe wrench to release the torque on the tubing. An employee went to the rig floor to remove the pipe and the 2 3/8" L80 tubing spun inside the slips and caused the wrench to spin around and hit the IE in the back. This knocked the IE into the handrail on the back of the rig.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to lower back after being struck by pipe wrench that spun around when the 2 3/8" L80 tubing spun inside the slips.

IncidentSummary: After removing a barrel off a shot perforating gun, IE was carrying the gun barrel to the pickup, ab
IncidentDescription: After removing a barrel off a shot perforating gun, IE was carrying the gun barrel to the pickup, about three feet away, when the barrel slipped and landed on top of right foot just past the steel toe.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right foot after greasy perforating gun being carried slipped and struck behind steel toe.

IncidentSummary: Rods parted in hole at about 2,100 feet one inch above rod guide. Crew went in the hole with short c
IncidentDescription: Rods parted in hole at about 2,100 feet one inch above rod guide. Crew went in the hole with short catch overshot but was unable to latch on. They then attempted to push guide down but it would not move. Rig hands Angel Lopez, the IE and consultant Gary Smith attempted to turn rods to move rod guides with two 24" pipe wrenches. Crew planned to turn until torqued up, pull up and attempt to latch on again. At time of incident, IE and Angel were holding one wrench and the company man was across from them holding the other. Due to unknown reasons, they lost control of the torqued up wrenches and one struck Angel on the wrist, the IE in the throat, Gary on the shoulder and threw them all to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left wrist after being struck by flying wrench being used to turn rods to move rod guides.

IncidentSummary: Rods parted in hole at about 2,100 feet one inch above rod guide. Crew went in the hole with short c
IncidentDescription: Rods parted in hole at about 2,100 feet one inch above rod guide. Crew went in the hole with short catch overshot but was unable to latch on. They then attempted to push guide down but it would not move. Rig hands Angel Lopez, the IE and consultant Gary Smith attempted to turn rods to move rod guides with two 24" pipe wrenches. Crew planned to turn until torqued up, pull up and attempt to latch on again. At time of incident, IE and Angel were holding one wrench and the company man was across from them holding the other. Due to unknown reasons, they lost control of the torqued up wrenches and one struck Angel on the wrist, IE in the throat, Gary on the shoulder, throwing them all to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to neck and chest area after being struck by flying torqued wrench being used to turn rods to move rod guides.

IncidentSummary: PER THE EMPLOYEE: Working throughout the day in the sun I was drinking plenty of water 15-20 bottles
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: PER THE EMPLOYEE: Working throughout the day in the sun I was drinking plenty of water 15-20 bottles I started to get a headache so I went to the rig manager's office to get some medicine. I got the medicine from the first aid kit and rig manager told me to cool off for awhile so I did in the VPD house which has AC. After a few minutes I still wasn't feeling too good so I walked to the driller's house and sat down. After a few minutes in the driller's cabin I got sick to my stomach and so the rig managers cooled me off and advised me before returning to work for the rest of the day to just relax in the driller's cabin.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat exhaustion during rigging up process.

IncidentSummary: Crew was in the process of rigging up. IE was attempting to measure the distance from the wellhead t
IncidentDescription: Crew was in the process of rigging up. IE was attempting to measure the distance from the wellhead to the rig in order to square rig to center of the wellhead. As the IE reached out with measuring tape in hand, left foot began to slide towards the cellar and the momentum pushed the IE into the tree, causing left arm to strike against the wing valve block. There was no grating available on the well cellar.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left arm after foot slid towards the cellar causing him to be pushed into the tree and strike arm against wing valve block.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT hose
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While testing surface lines with fresh water vibrator hose on back of #2 pump failed in the middle of hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS crushed gun
IncidentDescription: JSA was held and gun assembly and procedures were discussed. After making guns up and placing coil lubricator on well, the procedure is to bump the tool string up, close blind rams and open well to check pressure. The night company man stated he did not want to check the well pressure, he said it has zero pressure. Mando insisted the procedure be followed. Once the procedure discussed was done, it was found the tool string was not completely bumped up in lubricator. Coil crew saw there was a problem, broke lubricator off well, lowered tool string down and found the blinds closed on to the gun body at then end of the carrel at the tandem sub. Upon inspection of gun body, it was found the gun was slightly crushed. After replacing gun, proceeded into hole and gun successfully fired.

IncidentSummary: GRABBED ONTO CELLAR PUMP SWITCH STAND HE THOUGHT IT WAS MOUNTED ON SUB STRUCTURE AND IT FELL ABOUT 2
IncidentDescription: GRABBED ONTO CELLAR PUMP SWITCH STAND HE THOUGHT IT WAS MOUNTED ON SUB STRUCTURE AND IT FELL ABOUT 2 FEET ON HIS RIGHT KNEE AND UPPER LEG.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right leg after being struck by unmounted cellar pump switch stand.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing bolts from the wellhead and the needle valve coming from the capillary string spraye
IncidentDescription: IE was removing bolts from the wellhead and the needle valve coming from the capillary string sprayed the left calf. There was no rash or swelling.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced extremely slight irritation to left calf after being sprayed by Proflow 31 chemical while removing bolts from the wellhead.

IncidentSummary: The crew was making up bottom hole assembly and the IE was using a 48 inch pipe wrench as a backup.
IncidentDescription: The crew was making up bottom hole assembly and the IE was using a 48 inch pipe wrench as a backup. As the IE pulled on the pipe wrench, left knee was strained. The IE continued working until the end of the shift.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left knee while pulling on 48 inch pipe wrench to back up crew while making up bottom hole assembly.

IncidentSummary: MISS missing brake cotter pin (KN)
IncidentDescription:
While crew was tripping in the hole, Eddie Vela was observing operator. As he looked toward the turnbuckle leading up to brake handle, he noticed pin was working 
itself out of position. Upon closer inspection, the cotter pin had fallen out.

IncidentSummary: IE climbed down from derrick ladder and took off harness. IE' right foot slipped into a 2 inch hole
IncidentDescription: IE climbed down from derrick ladder and took off harness. IE' right foot slipped into a 2 inch hole upon turning around and right ankle was strained.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle upon stepping into a 2-inch hole after exiting derrick.

IncidentSummary: While in the personnel lift, IE and Sergio Gonzales were using an air-operated impact wrench to remo
IncidentDescription: While in the personnel lift, IE and Sergio Gonzales were using an air-operated impact wrench to remove the nuts and bolts from the flange connecting the riser stack to the BOP flange. When the IE picked the wrench up out of the basket, the 1/2" fitting stripped out of the impact gun and struck the IE across the nose. A whip-check was in place, but it was connected to the fitting that stripped out of the impact wrench.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to nose after being struck by air hose when picking up impact wrench from basket.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling riser bolt
IncidentDescription: During Coil operations, one of the bolts from the riser became loose and fell about 35' to the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Murphy frak tank (AL)
IncidentDescription:
While circulating well back into return tank and flaring off gas the flare struck check valve.  The valve was stuck in open position 
igniting back into frac tank causing 
tank to blow up with flash fire.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/loose equipment
IncidentDescription: While moving the driller's side substructure with 2 cranes with RDL Movers. They were raising sub and moving away from mud boat to raise and load, a rotating head rubber was on top of the sub. The movement of the subs caused the rotating rubber to fall off the top of the sub. The rubber fell on wellhead, breaking the gauge.

IncidentSummary: Employee alleged that during tripping pipe operations 2 days prior to reporting the incident, he inj
IncidentDescription: Employee alleged that during tripping pipe operations 2 days prior to reporting the incident, he injured his shoulder while racking back pipe. An employee broke out of the stump with the ST-80 while tripping out of the hole, while breaking and spinning it out the employee alleged that the pipe was wobbling. The employee stated that the driller raised the joint of pipe from the stump and he stood back to let the wobble out, then as he went to grab the pipe to rack it back it wobbled causing pain in his right shoulder. He said the reason he didn't say anything at the time was because he was going to try and "tough it out."
InjuryDescripti: Possible right shoulder strain while pulling back pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/slips, foot placement
IncidentDescription: While pulling slips after making a connection, hand came close to setting slips down on his foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/wrench
IncidentDescription: Wrench slipped while mud hand was tightening up bolts on mule shoe. The cause being his wrench not being fully inserted on to the Allen head bolt.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/PPE, face shield
IncidentDescription: Employee was pressure washing without a face shield.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While stepping off of mud pumps skid, employee slipped almost falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/drill line
IncidentDescription: While slipping drill line back on drum observed damaged spots on the drill line.

IncidentSummary: IE was trying to start a wireline truck that was parked in the stack yard. The truck didn't start an
IncidentDescription: IE was trying to start a wireline truck that was parked in the stack yard. The truck didn't start and the IE was going to pull the truck out and change the battery. He needed to clevises to pull the truck forward. There was a trailer sitting by the trucks that had bops on it. On the lifting caps for the bops, there were clevises. The IE got the first clevis and while getting the second, the bops needed to be lifted to remove the bolt. The IE lifted one end of the bop up and used the first clevis to prop up while he took the bolt out of the second clevis. After removing the bolt the IE lifted the bop us to remove the first clevis and upon pulling the clevis out, the bop came down and caught finger between the two bops.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained amputation to right index finger after it was caught between two bops while trying to remove the bolts out of two clevises to be used to pull a wireline truck that wouldn't start forward.

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying down the cement baler when the IE tripped over a tool stand and fell to ground, land
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down the cement baler when the IE tripped over a tool stand and fell to ground, landing on both knees.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to both knees after tripping over a tool stand and falling to ground.

IncidentSummary: IE was struggling to get the BP3 sub out of the firing head. It finally came out with force and stru
IncidentDescription: IE was struggling to get the BP3 sub out of the firing head. It finally came out with force and struck the IE on the eyebrow.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration above eyebrow after being struck by the stuck BP3 sub after freeing it from the firing head.

IncidentSummary: Employee was working on a valve bank and was attempting to adjust the position of the valve bank on
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was working on a valve bank and was attempting to adjust the position of the valve bank on the pallet it was on. As he attempted to do so his finger struck a stray piece of metal that was sticking out of the filter housing and he received a laceration to his middle finger of the left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to middle finger, left hand after being struck against piece of metal sticking out of filter housing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/PVC pipe
IncidentDescription: While checking mud tanks, noticed 8" PVC setting lower in trough. Investigated and found 8" had fallen off centrifuge. Discharge pipe has the potential to flow 150 gpm. (Not running at time of accident)

IncidentSummary: Crew was prepping to rig down. The IE was cleaning tools and equipment around well head, tripped ove
IncidentDescription: Crew was prepping to rig down. The IE was cleaning tools and equipment around well head, tripped over board that was covering the mouse hole and landed on knee.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to knee after tripping over board covering mouse hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS #20 Baker setting tool
IncidentDescription: Found pressure between Baker #20 firing head and quick change (low pressure). Placed firing head in vise (clamp type) with bottom facing out of trailer. Kept outside of trailer clear and unscrewed the BP3 holder (tight). BP3 holder shot out of trailer +-6'. Baker BP3 Lot date 06-28-16, #15 of box of 20, JK Enterprises Vendor.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped load
IncidentDescription: The crane operator hooked up to Bakers P-tank. Brandon Broussard and Roy were going to slide it over next to the other P-tank to make room on the back of the boat deck. The crane operator picked tried to re-position the load and just about had it in place when he was signaled to set the load down. He set it on the corner of the other P-tank and they signaled him to pick it up and try again. The load was directly over the P-tank that it was going to sit next to, and as it hit the top the load fell towards Brandon Broussard. He turned and ran. He though the cable on the crane broke but it turned out to be more than that.

IncidentSummary: MISS #17 Zinc
IncidentDescription: While in hole circulating #16 zinc, the 4-inch suction hose running from monster pump to fluid pump broke, causing zinc to fly everywhere. Operations were stopped and a massive cleanup occurred. While wearing the proper PPE, the whole crew became extremely overheated, dizzy and lightheaded.

IncidentSummary: IE and Luis were connecting pump hose to rod BOP and something bit the IE's neck four times. It was
IncidentDescription: IE and Luis were connecting pump hose to rod BOP and something bit the IE's neck four times. It was possibly a fire ant.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained insect bites to neck while connecting pipes under rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Andrew Longoria forklift (EC)
IncidentDescription: While moving frac valve with forklift, valve slipped off the forks and fell on the ground.

IncidentSummary: IE WAS GOING TO OBSERVE THE TRIP TANK/CHOKE SKID BEING SEPARATED FROM THE PROCESS TANK. HE THEN ASKE
IncidentDescription: IE WAS GOING TO OBSERVE THE TRIP TANK/CHOKE SKID BEING SEPARATED FROM THE PROCESS TANK. HE THEN ASKED AN EMPLOYEE TO CHECK THE BACK SIDE OF THE TANK TO MAKE SURE EVERYTHING WAS SECURED BEFORE MOVING THE SKID AND HE WAS TYING UP A 2" HOSE. THE TANDEM OPERATOR PROCEEDED TO PULL THE TANK AHEAD BEFORE IE GAVE THE OK AND THE WALKWAY HE WAS STANDING ON FELL OFF THE ADJOINING SKID CAUSING HIM TO FALL BACK. A SLIDING WALKWAY ON THE TOP OF THE TANK THEN CAME OFF THE TRIP TANK SKID FROM APPROXIMATELY 8' HIGH, AND FELL ON HIS LEG JUST ABOVE HIS LEFT KNEE CAUSING A SEVERE LACERATION.
InjuryDescripti: Severe laceration and trauma to left knee after being struck by loose sliding walkway.

IncidentSummary: At the time of making a connection, while pulling slips on stand coming out of the mouse hole upon p
IncidentDescription: At the time of making a connection, while pulling slips on stand coming out of the mouse hole upon pulling slips, they were accidentally set down on the injured employee's right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right foot after right foot was struck by slips while making a connection.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was kneeling on the catwalk of the offside of the rig to replace the bearings on the drill line h
IncidentDescription: IE was kneeling on the catwalk of the offside of the rig to replace the bearings on the drill line hub. The crane from his mechanics truck was holding the drill line hub for fall prevention. The IE was pulling the hub off the drum shaft, using both hands. While the IE was pulling on the hub, it cocked to the left and immediately stopped. The IE heard a pop in the right shoulder. The IE continued working and finished the job.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced strain to right shoulder while hub being pulled on cocked to the left and immediately stopped.

IncidentSummary: MISS pump-down
IncidentDescription: Crew was working on a pump-down for Sandridge. A frac pump that was 33 feet away from the pump-down trailer started spraying oil from the pump motor compartment. Immediately informed the company man and told him they needed to stop fracking. By the time the pumps were shut down the pump with the mechanical problem was smoking and had dropped quite a lot of oil. The pump was shut down and disconnected and the frac continued.

IncidentSummary: The IE was loosening the hydraulic connection on a grease unit and as it freed up, the IE's right ha
IncidentDescription: The IE was loosening the hydraulic connection on a grease unit and as it freed up, the IE's right hand moved down and index finger was cut on a piece of metal. Hydraulic fitting had a lot of hoses around it and it was difficult to get a wrench on it.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to right index finger when hydraulic connection on grease unit broke free, causing hand to slip down and strike a piece of metal.

IncidentSummary: IE and Morris Gummer were putting a bond tool together and when they went to tighten it with pipe wr
IncidentDescription: IE and Morris Gummer were putting a bond tool together and when they went to tighten it with pipe wrenches, the IE twisted the wrong way and strained lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after twisting the wrong way while tightening a bond tool with pipe wrenches along with another employee.

IncidentSummary: While making up a connection on the stump, the crew realized they forgot the pipe screen. They brok
IncidentDescription: While making up a connection on the stump, the crew realized they forgot the pipe screen. They broke the connection and inserted in the screen. When stabbing the stand into the stump, IE was maneuvering it. They missed the stab and IE's arm was caught between ST-80 and the stand of pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Right arm was caught between ST-80 and pipe stand while making a connection resulting in a contusion.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping to rig up rig in Corpus yard. He was unbolting blower motor on pump when his legs beg
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: IE was helping to rig up rig in Corpus yard. He was unbolting blower motor on pump when his legs began to cramp.
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat stress while unbolting blower on pump #1.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/Pressure washer line
IncidentDescription: Hand was operating manlift with pressure washer line tied off to the manlift basket when said line got hung up and pulled tight.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/hose, near trip-fall
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got tripped by pressure washer hose. Hose got wrapped around employee foot, other employee pulled on hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got pinched between stump / ST-80 employee operating the ST-80 pulled the wrong lever.

IncidentSummary: While employee was rigging up mud bucket line on floor he pushed down on the ear of cam lock and did
IncidentDescription: While employee was rigging up mud bucket line on floor he pushed down on the ear of cam lock and did not see the safety keeper. In doing so the keeper went through his glove and poked him in the center of left hand. After that he showed the driller what had happened when employee removed his glove there were only 2 small black marks on hand. Employee said that he was fine and there was no sign of blood. Employee said that he was fine just letting driller know that it wentn through his glove. And he thought he should report it.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left hand by keeper pin on camlock.

IncidentSummary: MISS wash bay grease
IncidentDescription: Ronnie Dobbs was walking through the wash bay carrying tools. Jason Griffin was washing his truck and stepped back into a puddle of grease that blended in with the water. Jason slipped but managed to catch himself.

IncidentSummary: IE opened a can of soda and sat it down. When the IE picked it back up to drink, a bee had gotten in
IncidentDescription: IE opened a can of soda and sat it down. When the IE picked it back up to drink, a bee had gotten in the can and stung the lip.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained bee sting to lip after picking up and drinking out of a can of opened soda which a bee had gotten into.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT derrick brace pin
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Motorhand was getting ready to remove pin from derrick brace to rig down board. In doing so he placed his ladder in a spot where if brace were to fall it would smash his ladder he would be standing on. Toolpusher had set derrick board down to where it touched ground with remote, while standing by mud boat and noticed what hand was fixing to do. He told him to stop but he continued to remove safety pin. Toolpusher come around and in front of hand and raised hand and told him not to hit pin. Hand did not listen and hit pin out of brace. In doing so, brace did not fall because board was sitting on ground pin flew out and missed toolpusher by 2'. At this time toolpusher then shut down complete Job.

IncidentSummary: The crew was laying down 2 3/8" PH-6 work string. Driller was letting joint down through the floor.
IncidentDescription: The crew was laying down 2 3/8" PH-6 work string. Driller was letting joint down through the floor. Floor hand unlatched the elevators and as IE grabbed the horn on the elevators, they swung and pinched left pinky finger.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left hand after it was caught between horn on elevators after the elevators were unlatched by the floor hand.

IncidentSummary: IE secured pipe wrench to mud anchor inside tubing tongs. Operator throttled up and floor hand engag
IncidentDescription: IE secured pipe wrench to mud anchor inside tubing tongs. Operator throttled up and floor hand engaged tongs. Backup support in tubing tongs broke causing wrench to spin around, strike IE on right side of body and knock him to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to right side of torso after being struck and knocked to ground by 48" spinning wrench when tubing tongs broke.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped weight bar
IncidentDescription: Rig operator started picking up lube before we had someone holding the wireline to catch the weight bar and it slid down and hit the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS  truck hood
IncidentDescription: Two employees were working on truck when hood was bumped, almost closing on employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure-piston release
IncidentDescription: Crew members had finished bleeding off and breaking down a Baker #10 setting tool when pressure was found trapped in the upper barrel containing the floating piston. The tool had been disassembled and both tandem subs were removed from the middle barrel, leaving it open-ended. The operator was using a rod to remove the floating piston. As he was hitting the piston out of the barrel, trapped pressure caused it to shoot out of the barrel and hit the side of the pump down trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS tripped over angle iron
IncidentDescription: Operator stumbled over a piece of angle iron laying on the shop floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS tire blowout
IncidentDescription: As Matt Marks was travelling east on I-20, the 18-wheeler in front of him had a blowout. The tire went under truck T-77. It made a lot of noise and when inspected after getting back to Bossier shop, found that the skid plate was damaged and there was a small drip from the diesel tank.

IncidentSummary: IE was getting ready for work and cleaning up in doghouse and thinks a bristle from a wire brush stu
IncidentDescription: IE was getting ready for work and cleaning up in doghouse and thinks a bristle from a wire brush stuck the right middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right middle finger after striking against wire brush while cleaning doghouse.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure testing reel manifold
IncidentDescription: We were pressure testing the reel manifold on Unit 7. After a failed test, we were filling the manifold back-up with water. I had the needle valve on and the ball drop open to evacuate air in the line. As I was closing the needle valve, I noticed that it was only rated for 6,000 psi. The test pressure we were using was 14,500 psi. I just finished a job for Devon Energy with this unit and the working pressure on this needle valve was 8,500 psi. This failure to use the proper equipment had the potential to cause a very serious injury, or even a fatality.

IncidentSummary: MISS injector head
IncidentDescription: Chain popped on reel while standing up the injector head. Employee did not release reel brake inside the coil unit while standing up the injector head, causing the pressure from the pipe being pulled to break the reel chain. Once the chain failed, the reel began to spin freely and caused the pipe to loosen up on the reel. Emergency brake was not functioning properly when the employees attempted to stop the free spin.

IncidentSummary: IE showed up on location to set a plug. Company man was there and said they were trying to kill the
IncidentDescription: IE showed up on location to set a plug. Company man was there and said they were trying to kill the well. It was gassy. Crew was taking off tubing slip to put on 3K well connection so they could flange up. While flanging up, H2S monitor started going off and they could smell gas. After they got the flange on the well, IE went to truck to pick up tool. They were pumping water to kill the well. Plug couldn't go through well so they had to come off and on a couple more times. IE started feeling nauseous and started throwing up.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced nausea and vomiting while taking off tubing slip to put on 3K well connection so they could flange up while rigging down. H2S meter read 12 ppm.

IncidentSummary: IE got on driller side of catwalk to remove some casing protectors. While positioning feet to remove
IncidentDescription: IE got on driller side of catwalk to remove some casing protectors. While positioning feet to remove the protectors, the skate began moving on its own, pinning right foot between skate and stopper.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to right 4th toe and little toe after foot was caught between skate and catwalk while removing casing protector.

IncidentSummary: The injury occurred while placing a bearing back on idler arm. We were tapping it with a hammer and
IncidentDescription: The injury occurred while placing a bearing back on idler arm. We were tapping it with a hammer and a chip of the hammer head flew off and lodged in the IE's left arm.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left arm after being stuck by a piece of hammer head that broke off while using it to get a bearing back on idler arm.

IncidentSummary: WELL RIGGING DOWN CASING CREW POWER TONGS WERE BROUGHT DOWN TO FLOOR WITH TUGGER. JERRAMY WENT TO TA
IncidentDescription: WELL RIGGING DOWN CASING CREW POWER TONGS WERE BROUGHT DOWN TO FLOOR WITH TUGGER. JERRAMY WENT TO TAKE 4 PIECE CLEVIS OFF POWER TONGS WHEN HE PULLED THE BOLT (PIN) OUT OF CLEVIS THE CABLE BEGAN TO SPIN. THE SPIN OF THE CABLE CAUSED THE CLEVIS HANGING ON THE CABLE TO COME UP AND HIT JERRAMY IN THE NOSE CAUSING HIS NOSE TO BLEED.
InjuryDescripti: Struck in the face by clevis hanging on a swinging cable resulting in contusion to nose.

IncidentSummary: Employee said to me that his back was hurting; I then asked why, he said that he slipped to his knee
IncidentDescription: Employee said to me that his back was hurting; I then asked why, he said that he slipped to his knees earlier while pushing back drill pipe to racking area. I asked if that was why his back was hurting, he said that he was not sure, that it started to hurt a couple hours after he slipped and he was not sure what the pain was caused from, and also said that he had a couple bulging discs from 2 years ago.
InjuryDescripti: Possible back strain from an alleged slip/fall while pushing back drill pipe to racking area.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hand placement
IncidentDescription: Hand was making up BHA when he placed his hand in pinch point area almost getting it smash with joint of collars.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/insect
IncidentDescription: While mixing chemicals employee noticed Black Widow on chemicals sack.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/foot placement, slips
IncidentDescription: Employee almost set slips on foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS lubricator/grease tubes
IncidentDescription: After retrieving wireline out of the hole, we removed BOP, tool trap, one stick of lube and grease tubes from the well. We placed the tool trap on the trailer and then went to remove the BOP. After unhooking the BOP, the crane operator lifted up and the lubricator and grease tubes flipped upside down and almost it an employee on the trailer, twice.

IncidentSummary: MISS trip hazard
IncidentDescription: Employee was changing garbage bags in cans in the shop. He turned the light out in eastern bays and walked toward the other bay that had lighting. He tripped over an extension cord that was left in the doorway between the bays. He nearly fell but stabilized himself.

IncidentSummary: MISS wire in shoe
IncidentDescription: Wire stuck in rubber shoe sole while cleaning outside of shop.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hose
IncidentDescription: While dragging cellar pump hose out from between tanks with forklift camlock on end of hose got caught on tanks nearly tearing hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking across K-braces and almost slipped trying to get off of them.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand almost lost footing and fell into reserve.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near trip-fall
IncidentDescription: While walking to top of reserve pit, employee tripped over fencing material neqalry fllinl

IncidentSummary: MISS vehicle accident avoided
IncidentDescription: Third-party was driving in front of logging truck and suddenly slammed on his brakes at intersection. Our truck driver was alert enough to avoid the accident.

IncidentSummary: MISS tire blowout
IncidentDescription: While traveling back from a job, the front passenger tire blew out on P-104 with DJ Landry driving. DJ was able to safely navigate the truck to the shoulder of the road. No one was hurt, roadside was called, tire was replaced and truck was driven back to the shop.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hoist line, top drive
IncidentDescription: When rigging up casing equipment hoist line almost got caught behind the top drive.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While employee was rigging up cellar pump ladder slipped causing employee to nearly fall in cellar.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While installing PVC pipe to reserve pit, hand lost footing almost slipping into brine water reserve.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling tailgate
IncidentDescription: An engineer and operator had replaced the wire plug on a trailer and used a pickup to check the lights for correct connection. As the operator was attempting to close the tailgate, it came loose from the hinge and fell. The two steel cables on the tailgate kept it from falling to the ground and possibly injuring the two employees and/or causing damage to the tailgate.

IncidentSummary: MISS missing trailer deck plank
IncidentDescription: A light on the building was not working and didn't see a plank was missing on the gooseneck trailer while loading it, resulting in foot going through hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/forklift, mud motor
IncidentDescription: While unloading hot shot trailer forklift driver nearly dropped mud motor off forks.

IncidentSummary: MISS dump bailer dropped
IncidentDescription: Two employees were on the rig floor preparing dump bailer for cement. The bailer was 3 feet out of the well head to reach bailer fill opening. The employees were standing quite close on one side of rig floor with multiple rig tools and stairs just behind them. Michael Moon decided to move across to give a safe distance. Rig helper slacked off on winch to help assist cement bucket to rig floor. He chose the winch line that was hoisting a tubing tool that had weight just above it and it fell where Michael had been standing before he moved across.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/air valve handle
IncidentDescription: Noticed air valve handle missing knob, potential for impalement.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee went to step on the mat and missed step and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/head placement
IncidentDescription: While moving a pallet of lime by hopper hand almost struck eye on shower pole with pallet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall, K-braces
IncidentDescription: While climbing over K-braces in sub employee slipped nearly falling. K-braces were dirty and had oil on them.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing about four rungs up on a ladder in the cellar tightening bolts on hydril and night c
IncidentDescription: IE was standing about four rungs up on a ladder in the cellar tightening bolts on hydril and night cap studs. The operator and two other crew members were going to lay out cutter assembly with lay-down machine. The cutter swung and knocked slips through rig floor opening to well head area. On the way down, the slips grazed the IE on the side of hard hat, neck and right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to neck after being struck by the slips after the cutter swung and knocked them through rig floor opening in well head area.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand almost used a hammer that was split.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hose, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While getting bit breaker employees carrying bit breaker tripped over hose nearly falling. Mud bucket hose lying in walkway.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/rope, body placement
IncidentDescription: While on board put stand in a single latch elevators to put in mouse hole belly belt rope got hung up in fingers almost causing employee to lose balance and fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/equipment placement, bit
IncidentDescription: Employee almost fell over the bit that was placed on the racking board while trying to guide the mud tool up to the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: While walking down stairs to hopper hand almost slipped on last step down.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/ladder
IncidentDescription: While removing 4 ft light, hand was on ladder. Ladder moved almost causing hand to drop light and falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hoist line, ropes
IncidentDescription: Hands got hoist line caught in finger almost cut ropes.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hose(s)
IncidentDescription: Employee was washing with a little bit of diesel and almost spilled it when he was pulling the water hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/foot placement, forklift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was getting off forklift and missed the step and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS hand tools/falling gun
IncidentDescription: Mike Moon and another employee were tightening a top sub on a 4" gun that was in close proximity of other guns. They had to lift the gun with a strap and rest it on an 18" pipe wrench sitting across two other 4" guns. After tightening, another employee noticed the pipe wrench beneath the gun was slipping. Just after Mike Moon moved, the wrench slipped, the gun fell 4 feet and the wrench flew 10 feet past him.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/insect, hand placement
IncidentDescription: While mixing chemical sacks employee almost put hand on spider.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken hammer head
IncidentDescription: Employee was in man basket swinging hammer to loosen 10-02. Hammer head came off and he lost his balance but didn't fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/3P, trip-fall hazard
IncidentDescription: Third party employee was going to walk from behind the drill pipe and almost tripped over centralizers that were piled up.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling #20 Baker tool
IncidentDescription: A #20 Baker tool slipped off the rack and hit the floor, just missing employee's foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS cleaning fluid
IncidentDescription: Employee was spraying brake cleaner on a weight bar end and the cleaner splashed off the part and a few drops hit safety glasses.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hand placement, hammer
IncidentDescription: Employee almost struck coworker's hand while installing collar clamp due to OBM on small hammer f/wet (?) trip.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking up to hopper and his foot got caught under the skid almost making him fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hammer
IncidentDescription: While hooking up hoses for peanut pump discharger, hand was hammering union when hammer slipped out of hand nearly striking him in the leg.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/Line(s), hose(s)
IncidentDescription: Employee was washing in the man basket and the pressure washer line was hung up and he didn't know so employee went and un-hung it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near trip-fall
IncidentDescription: While working on collar pump hand was crossing over beam when he lost his footing and almost fell on top of beam.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/wrench
IncidentDescription: While tightening up flow line flung (flange?), hammer wrench slipped off nut almost falling to ground but rope on hammer wrench caught wrench.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/BOP line(s)
IncidentDescription: Employee was installing BOP lines to BOP while in the man basket, the BOP line slipped almost falling to the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS avoiding vehicle accident
IncidentDescription: While driving in Mineral Wells, TX in a double lane with heavy traffic, a school bus slammed on the brakes and then turned on the flashers to let a child off about two blocks from the school. This nearly caused a multiple car accident.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/flex holes
IncidentDescription: While installing kill flex line in, hand was trying to line up bolt holes by shaking line when flex holes jumped up almost striking hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/3P, ladder
IncidentDescription: Third party employee left a ladder standing he was done using it.

IncidentSummary: IE went to grab ramps to unload a skid steer off a trailer and felt a spasm the the lower back area.
IncidentDescription: IE went to grab ramps to unload a skid steer off a trailer and felt a spasm the the lower back area.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while getting ramps to unload skid steer.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hoist, cable, hoses
IncidentDescription: Employees were rigging up off side driller hoist to help pull out 8" collar. Employees had a strap wrapped around square tubing that holds hoist, and hoist wrapped around collar and hooked to strap. Driller stopped operation because hoist and cable could damage hydraulic hoses to hoist.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/forklift, hose
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While operating forklift, employee almost ran over 2" high pressure hose (hose is to be used to release pressure on rig floor).

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/slip hazard
IncidentDescription: While pulling out of hole, employee was push pipe to get racked back, employee almost slipped due to (wet trip) - (oil based mud).

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/proper tool handling
IncidentDescription: Employees was prying a keeper out with a screwdriver and almost struck himself.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/puncture hazard
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Almost stepped on board with nail from broken pallet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Lost footing slid on liner and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure in rams
IncidentDescription: While testing ram #5, the Eq port plugged off. We moved to secondary and bled off. It also plugged off and trapped 10,000 lbs in the rams with no bleed off.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling blocks (AL)
IncidentDescription: Crew of #105 was rigging up rig floor with the catline when rig floor struck the brake handle, causing the safety chain on brake handle to come loose. This resulted in blocks to come down slowly, about 10 feet, hit the top of BOP's, and swing down the side of the BOP's while the Operator, Alex Lucio was lifting the rig floor and trying to pin it to the catline.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up 4" hose from rig pump to frac tank, IE used the palm of left hand to lock ears down
IncidentDescription: While rigging up 4" hose from rig pump to frac tank, IE used the palm of left hand to lock ears down on 4" cam-lock connection, piercing palm with cam-lock safety pin.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to palm of left hand after being stuck by cam-lock safety pin after using hand to lock ears down on the 4" cam-lock connection.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/forklift(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee driving a forklift too fast around corners almost hit another forklift driver.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/hand placement
IncidentDescription: Hand was slacking off hoist setting stand in the mousehole. Other hand attempted to get slips but they became wedged while hoist operator continued to slack off almost smashing his co-worker's hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pressure washer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While washing casing 3rd party employee almost sprayed other employee with pressure washer.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/hammer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was going to break still lines with a hammer when another employee walked up behind him and almost got struck by swinging hammer.

IncidentSummary: Crew was on location and had picked up the beam. After securing front of beam, IE was walking to the
IncidentDescription: Crew was on location and had picked up the beam. After securing front of beam, IE was walking to the back of the rig when ladders started to fall. IE tried to hold the ladder but the weight of the ladder was too heavy. The ladder fell from the bed of the trailer, striking the back and causing the IE to twist right knee upon falling to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to back and strain to right knee after being knocked to the ground when struck by falling ladder while loading beam on truck.

IncidentSummary: MISS slipped on line oiler bar
IncidentDescription: While greasing drum bearings employee slipped on line oiler bar.

IncidentSummary: MISS deer miss
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling in Lance Creek at a speed of around 30 mph when a deer ran in front of him. The lighting was poor and he missed it by inches.

IncidentSummary: MISS JBGR packer
IncidentDescription: While coming up hole with JBGR, the rig crew forgot to close three of the valves. The JBGR was swabbing the well and fluid came out all three at a slow to high rate.

IncidentSummary: MISS slip from vehicle
IncidentDescription: Employee was loading out for the EOG job. He was doing a pre-trip and when he went to step out of the driver's cab, he did not have three points of contact, slipped and caught himself.

IncidentSummary: IE hammered off nightcap from wellhead, picked the nightcap off and strained upper back while turnin
IncidentDescription: IE hammered off nightcap from wellhead, picked the nightcap off and strained upper back while turning to set it down. Nightcap weighs about 30-40 lbs.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to upper back while turning to set down nightcap.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/pop off
IncidentDescription: After a rig service, the driller asked me to open the bypass on our air manifold. I went to open the bypass, it was really tight so I assumed that someone already opened it. So then I closed the main air which deadheaded the air jammers equipment causing a pop off to go off.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/cable drag chain
IncidentDescription: During visit from upper management, rig manager requested to remove cable drag chain. So on rig service, crew removed cable from drag chain and whole removing cable noticed the bars in the middle of the drag chain were being rubbed by cable and starting to wear a groove in the middle bars of the drag chain.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hammer
IncidentDescription: While breaking loose a 4" hoses, hammer slipped out of hand's hand nearly striking his knee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/mud pump cap
IncidentDescription: Employee was taking off mud pump threaded cap and it almost fell on him when it came out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/rotating rubber
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was getting a new rotating rubber out of the box when another rubber rolled and almost mashed his hand between the rubber and the box.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/pressure washer wand
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was washing in manbasket and the pressure washer hose that was tied to the hand rail came undone and the excess slack in the hose caused the wand to twist almost striking the employee in the face when it fell.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/wellhead, pallet
IncidentDescription: While moving new wellhead by subs, pallet broke almost dropping wellhead against sub.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hand placement
IncidentDescription: While tripping in pipe, hand had his hand in a pinch point area.

IncidentSummary: MISS manlift
IncidentDescription: Employee was climbing stand for lubricators while guys were coming down in a manlift and the manlift almost hit the employee climbing the stand.

IncidentSummary: IE was trying to remove o-ring inside units with screw driver when it slipped and scraped the skin b
IncidentDescription: IE was trying to remove o-ring inside units with screw driver when it slipped and scraped the skin between index finger and thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Minor laceration to area between left thumb and index finger after being struck by screw driver being used to remove o-rings inside unit when it slipped.

IncidentSummary: MISS offshore platform grating
IncidentDescription: After tightening gamma gun to tool string, operator took a step and the grating fell from below him and fell into the water. Operator was caught from falling down by the chiksan iron he was standing on.

IncidentSummary: MISS wireline placement
IncidentDescription: Employee went to pick up tool and noticed the wireline was run incorrectly over the top of the door on large sheave. This could have resulted in sheave or wireline damage.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/broken weld, steps
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking up stairs on hydraulic catwalk and noticed that the welds on one step had broken which could have caused employee to fall through.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pipe wrench
IncidentDescription: Employees were changing swab on mud pump #1 middle pod. They were trying to break the swab when the pipe wrench slipped, could have pinched hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Concho/hammer
IncidentDescription: Hand swinging hammer bushing missing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hose, trip hazard
IncidentDescription: Hand was walking across mud pumps and almost tripped over hose when to get off mud pump.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hammer
IncidentDescription: Hand was making up union on mud pump and when swinging hammer; hammer slipped off employee hand almost hitting other hand on arm.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/tail rope
IncidentDescription: While picking up pipe from catwalk, hand was using tailrope; rope slipped off employee's hand, almost hitting other hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/winch line tag
IncidentDescription: While picking up mud motor using 2 winches, the tag from the winch line came off landing by driller's cabin door and hand on hoist.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/lighting, surroundings
IncidentDescription: Third party almost fell into reserve pit when trying to move a mud line due to poor lighting.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hoist line
IncidentDescription: Employee was being lifted on hoist for rig service. The hoist line got tangled. Employee noticed. The job was stopped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/junk box, hose
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Two employees were organizing hose in junk box. Employee 1 was standing next tot he box while flagging the forklift operator. While coming up to pull out a hose, it became lodged and after enough tension it gave way resulting in almost hitting the flagger.

IncidentSummary: IE reached over the side of the manlift for the Halco Valve to equalize lube and well. Well head pre
IncidentDescription: IE reached over the side of the manlift for the Halco Valve to equalize lube and well. Well head pressure was SK and valve was difficult to turn, even with no pressure. IE was in an awkward position and while pulling lever on valve, a sharp pain was felt on right side of back. IE completed task and reported incident 30 minutes later because back was still sore.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while reaching over side of manlift for Halco valve.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped bottom sheave
IncidentDescription: While running 300 fpm, tool got caught in collar at 2400 feet. Bottom sheave dropped out and hit the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS gun trailer door
IncidentDescription: While moving manlift into position to stub onto well, gun trailer door swung into manlift.

IncidentSummary: MISS snagged BOP hoses
IncidentDescription: While removing lube from well, BOP hoses caught under frac line on top of well.

IncidentSummary: MISS frac pump
IncidentDescription: Crew was working on a pump-down when a frac pump, that was 33 feet away from the pump-down trailer, started spraying oil from the motor compartment. Austin Meyer immediately went to the data van and informed the company man and engineers what was happening and that they needed to stop fracing. By the time the pumps were shut down, the pump with the mechanical problem was smoking and had dropped quite a lot of oil.

IncidentSummary: MISS loading guns
IncidentDescription: Josh Seaman was taping wires on guns and stacking them in a pile. The pile became too tall and shifted, sending two charged and taped guns, with no deck cord, over the side of the bench and onto rubber mat.

IncidentSummary: MISS manifold
IncidentDescription: Manifold fell over while being re-assembled.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling Baker 20's
IncidentDescription: Baker 20's were being loaded when they started falling and breaking the safety chains. This resulted in the rest of the Bakers falling and almost landing on employees.

IncidentSummary: MISS collar removal
IncidentDescription: While bleeding pressure off Baker, Zac did not hear the pressure release. He turned the head too far and did not realize that there were no threads in the tube. When they added air to stroke the tool, the collar assembly launched off.

IncidentSummary: MISS tripped over stand
IncidentDescription: When moving setting tools around bay, employee tripped over a stand and almost fell.

IncidentSummary: ST-80 was turned so it was out of way for pressure testing and needed to make TIW up to 4" DP. Hands
IncidentDescription: ST-80 was turned so it was out of way for pressure testing and needed to make TIW up to 4" DP. Hands went to turn ST-80 so it could reach the mouse hole. Handle struck him in thigh.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was struck on left leg by ST-80 handle resulting in a contusion.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling the rubber off an electrical line on Coil Unit #8. The rubber gave way and the IE fel
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling the rubber off an electrical line on Coil Unit #8. The rubber gave way and the IE fell backwards, striking right hand and wrist on the unit.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right hand and wrist after falling backwards and striking Unit #8 after rubber gave way while pulling it off electrical line.

IncidentSummary: MISS CTU #12 power pack
IncidentDescription: While moving CTU #12 power pack across yard, the power pack rolled through a deep hole and leaned over to the right, almost turning over.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling pipe (KN)

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/generator engine fan(s)
IncidentDescription: While going into the generator shed, the door slammed shut due to generator engine fan suction. It nearly pinched an employee's leg in the door.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/containment plastic, near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Well going into the motor shed team member slipped on small patch of ice on containment plastic nearly causing him to fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/hose
IncidentDescription: While tripping in hole, driller turned charge pump on to fill back side of hole through fill up line, was not seeing any fluid movement so he stroked the pump (slowly 3 stks/min) the hose pressured up & parted the hose @ rotating head. (Ice plug in hole)

IncidentSummary: MISS slipped pipe wrench
IncidentDescription: Employee was trying to break tools on ground with pipe wrench and fell to his knee when the pipe wrench slipped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking on stairs to the rig floor when one of his hands slipped off the hand rails, but employee was able to stay on balance not getting injured.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/forklift, tools
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was moving tools with forklift when one tool fell off the forks landing on the ground.

IncidentSummary: WHILE EMPLOYEE WAS DISCHARGING THE RIG VACUUM INTD THE HALF ROUND THE VACUUM STARTED TO KICK THE END
IncidentDescription: WHILE EMPLOYEE WAS DISCHARGING THE RIG VACUUM INTD THE HALF ROUND THE VACUUM STARTED TO KICK THE END OF THE HOSE AS THE VACUUM BECAME EMPTY AND STARTED BLOWING AIR. WHEN THIS HAPPENED THE END OF THE HOSE THAT WAS CUT OFF HAD A WIRE STICKING OUT OF IT THAT PUNCTURED THROUGH HIS GLOVE AND CUT HIS RIGHT THUMB
InjuryDescripti: Struck by frayed hose wire resulting in puncture to right thumb.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling rod elevator & weight bar (KN)
IncidentDescription: As crew was picking up 1-1/2" weight bars, Floorhand, Arturo Sosa, latched the rod elevator to rod hook and Operator, Santos Molina, began to pick up on blocks. While Arturo Sosa was making the connection, operator looked up and saw rod elevator had come out of rod hook. Santos Molina yelled to engineer, who was standing nearby, to get out of the way of falling rod elevator and weight bar. No injuries or equipment damage reported.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT stairs, ice hazard
IncidentDescription: While circulating hole at curve hands were cleaning up rig floor from trip. When employee went to leave rig floor and go down the stairs to get more cleaner. He noticed ice was starting to form at top of stairs.

IncidentSummary: Well had 2000 lbs shut-in pressure. Crew started bleeding off slowly through adjustable choke. Press
IncidentDescription: Well had 2000 lbs shut-in pressure. Crew started bleeding off slowly through adjustable choke. Pressure had dropped to 20-25 lbs when welded cap blew off dry hole flange. Well blew cement plug, mud and other debris out of well.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasions to face after being struck by mud and other debris when welded cap blew off dry hole flange.

IncidentSummary: Well had 2000 lbs shut-in pressure. Crew started bleeding off slowly through adjustable choke. Press
IncidentDescription: Well had 2000 lbs shut-in pressure. Crew started bleeding off slowly through adjustable choke. Pressure had dropped to 20-25 lbs when welded cap blew off dry hole flange. Well blew cement plug, mud and other debris out of well.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasions to face after being struck by mud and other debris when welded cap blew off dry hole flange.

IncidentSummary: Well had 2000 lbs shut-in pressure. Crew started bleeding off slowly through adjustable choke. Press
IncidentDescription: Well had 2000 lbs shut-in pressure. Crew started bleeding off slowly through adjustable choke. Pressure had dropped to 20-25 lbs when welded cap blew off dry hole flange. Well blew cement plug, mud and other debris out of well.
InjuryDescripti: f

IncidentSummary: Well had 2000 lbs shut-in pressure. Crew started bleeding off slowly through adjustable choke. Press
IncidentDescription: Well had 2000 lbs shut-in pressure. Crew started bleeding off slowly through adjustable choke. Pressure had dropped to 20-25 lbs when welded cap blew off dry hole flange. Well blew cement plug, mud and other debris out of well.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasions to eye after being struck by mud and other debris when welded cap blew off dry hole flange

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped stand (KN)
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole with tubing, the tubing was set on the slips and the tong hand had backed tubing out. Tubing had about 1/2" thread left when it popped last thread which resulted in tubing bouncing up and then down on the elevators. This caused elevators to open and allow the stand to drop to rig floor, away from the tongs and employees.

IncidentSummary: MISS Loadcraft turnbuckle (BR)
IncidentDescription:
The crew heard a loud pop while rigging up raising the derrick. The crew continued raising the derrick to the secured 
half-mast position. Upon inspection, the crew found that the large turnbuckle that goes from the frame of the rig to the 
y-base to adjust the derrick tilt had pulled away from the frame. The weld had parted and it was no longer attached to 
the frame. After further inspection, it was discovered that the lug was not welded all the way around to secure it to 
the frame when the rig was manufactured. The off-driller side was inspected and it was properly welded.

IncidentSummary: IE was using an open-ended wrench to turn drive shaft when wrench slipped and caused him to hit a pi
IncidentDescription: IE was using an open-ended wrench to turn drive shaft when wrench slipped and caused him to hit a piece of angle iron above right elbow.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right elbow after striking it against angle iron when open-ended wrench being used to turn drive shaft on pump slipped.

IncidentSummary: IE was loading the sheave wheel into the side compartment of the wireline truck and struck left hand
IncidentDescription: IE was loading the sheave wheel into the side compartment of the wireline truck and struck left hand against the compartment.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left hand after striking against side compartment of wireline truck while loading sheave.

IncidentSummary: IE was getting ready to go out on a job and needed to load fuel tank. The IE made room in the back o
IncidentDescription: IE was getting ready to go out on a job and needed to load fuel tank. The IE made room in the back of the truck and set the tank in the box of the pickup. The IE then attempted to load the lay-down cart onto a fifth wheel grease trailer, After a couple of attempts to lift from the ground, the IE climbed onto the trailer and tried to lift from there by bending and pulling them up onto the trailer. As the IE did this he felt a pain in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while attempting to pull lay-down cart up onto trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE had done a re-head and while walking by the vise, the cable head in it scraped/cut back.
IncidentDescription: IE had done a re-head and while walking by the vise, the cable head in it scraped/cut back.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to back after scraping against cable head in vise.

IncidentSummary: The IE bent down to pick up another rod elevator and put right hand on the flow line just as the Rig
IncidentDescription: The IE bent down to pick up another rod elevator and put right hand on the flow line just as the Rig Manager unlatched the rod hook from the rod elevator. The bale on the rod elevator pivoted over and struck the IE's right index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right index finger after being struck by the bale on the rod elevator due to hand being on the valve for the flow line.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The crew was TOH with 1" rods and were on their 4th triple. The operator came up with the rods and t
IncidentDescription: The crew was TOH with 1" rods and were on their 4th triple. The operator came up with the rods and the IE put the rod transfer on, unlatched the elevator and was holding the transfer with right hand above the swivel. The operator looked up while the blocks were coming down to make sure the blocks cleared the transfer. The operator throttled up and the floor hand began to break out the triple of rods. The rods were broken about half-way when the IE's right glove became snagged and wrapped in the transfer. The IE then used the left hand to push and attempt to free himself from the transfer. The temperature was -15 degrees with a wind chill at -35 degrees. IE was NOT wearing the impact gloves that were issued. He was wearing mittens that he purchased.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right forearm and dislocated left pinky finger after gloves (unauthorized mittens) snagged and wrapped in the rod transfer.

IncidentSummary: During normal drilling operations a approx. 2"x 5/8 pin fell from the derrick ladder in crown sectio
IncidentDescription: During normal drilling operations a approx. 2"x 5/8 pin fell from the derrick ladder in crown section hitting employee on backside of hard hat while he was on the rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: For record only. Potential for injury but no confirmation as of yet.

IncidentSummary: IE backed the truck out of the wash bay and got out to make sure he was clear to keep backing up and
IncidentDescription: IE backed the truck out of the wash bay and got out to make sure he was clear to keep backing up and slipped on ice that was under the snow. The IE's left leg went forward and right leg went back and down, slamming knee into the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee after slipping on ice while walking to back of truck.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped off the pipe skid one foot above ground level and while stepping onto grass, left ankle w
IncidentDescription: IE stepped off the pipe skid one foot above ground level and while stepping onto grass, left ankle was twisted.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle while stepping off pipe skid onto grass.

IncidentSummary: MISS truck not in correct gear
IncidentDescription: Crew was spooling line and had to re-spot truck. They had a front-end loader in front of the truck to keep it from sliding on the ice. When hand got out he forgot to put truck in park. When the other employee went to hoist line the truck hit the back of front-end loader.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling wireline
IncidentDescription: While logging on a drilling rig, the recorder head stopped recording depth as the tool approached the surface. The wireline pulled out of the rope socket instantly, passed through the top sheave and fell onto the rig floor. There were no personnel on the floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS ice plug
IncidentDescription: Ice plug shot out of line at the same time the hose came out of tank. Hose ends were strapped down, but too long.

IncidentSummary: MISS forklift/shop door
IncidentDescription: Hand was on forklift going out through the overhead door. He stopped underneath the half-open garage door and reached over to close the door while still on the forklift. When the door started to close, he tried moving the forklift and stopped just before the forklift hit the door frame.

IncidentSummary: MISS shop floor grease
IncidentDescription: Employee slipped on grease that was on shop floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS hole in rig floor
IncidentDescription: Employee went up to the rig floor to help the pressure control operator break his connection between runs. As he walked on the rig floor he was not paying attention and nearly walked into a hole in the floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS electric current
IncidentDescription: Plugged truck into wall outlet to use truck computer for training and every time the truck or cord was touched it had current.

IncidentSummary: MISS slipped on ice
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking to car in the parking lot and slipped on an icy patch.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken rig floor board
IncidentDescription: When employee went up on the rig floor to start washing tools and rig down, he stepped on a board that was broken on one end and had no support. The board went down several inches before he was able to get better footing.

IncidentSummary: IE had pain in wrist due to computer use for long extended hours everyday.
IncidentDescription: IE had pain in wrist due to computer use for long extended hours everyday.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right wrist after using computer for extended hours.

IncidentSummary: Jesus Jesse Jimenez was traveling west on Hwy 239 near Choate, Texas. As he approached a curve, he f
IncidentDescription: Jesus Jesse Jimenez was traveling west on Hwy 239 near Choate, Texas. As he approached a curve, he felt the back of his truck begin to fishtail. This caused him to run off the road and strike a tree.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to multiple body parts after truck struck fishtailed around a curve and struck a tree.

IncidentSummary: While going in the hole, picking up 1 1/2" tubing and using 1/2" bolt for no-go, IE was tailing in a
IncidentDescription: While going in the hole, picking up 1 1/2" tubing and using 1/2" bolt for no-go, IE was tailing in a joint when 1/2" no-go stuck top of right foot just past toe on boot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after being struck by 1/2" no- go just past steel toe on boot.

IncidentSummary: The IE was repairing the airline for the rod transfer cylinder and needed a screwdriver. The crew ho
IncidentDescription: The IE was repairing the airline for the rod transfer cylinder and needed a screwdriver. The crew hooked the screwdriver to the blocks with a tool lanyard. The IE was sitting on the rod fingers facing the derrick and the operator was raising the blocks slowly in 2nd gear. The drill line was snagged behind the tab for the rod bar and when the blocks approached the rod basket the blocks were pulled to the off-side of the basket. This caused the blocks to raise the rod basket and made the blocks swivel sideways. This resulted in the blocks pushing the IE's right leg into either the rod basket mounting bracket or the derrick leg. Two pieces of the rod basket bracing fell 80 feet to the ground. The rod basket and drill line were damaged.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hip and leg after striking against either the rod basket mounting bracket or the derrick leg after the blocks raised the rod basket and made the blocks swivel sideways.

IncidentSummary: MISS lubricator fluid
