IncidentDescription: Crew was coming off Well #1.  Well was shut in and bled off and needle valve showed a small amount of fluid. Operator loosened nut on lubricator and when crew lifted lube, fluid came out from the top of the well and covered the operator in the man basket and two people on the ground. The flow continued to come out of the top of the well until the pump-down operator closed in the pumps and shut down boost pump.

IncidentSummary: MISS blank cap on well stack
IncidentDescription: While POOH the well next to Wireline truck was being fracked. As they were about to start pumping #6 sand at 80bbls/min, black cap on well stack started spraying water.

IncidentSummary: The crew had stopped work to do a JSA on a job change and a bee stung the IE on the right ear.
IncidentDescription: The crew had stopped work to do a JSA on a job change and a bee stung the IE on the right ear.
InjuryDescripti: Slight irritation to right ear after being stung by a bee during a JSA.

IncidentSummary: MISS guns blown out of hole
IncidentDescription: After shooting squeeze gun, pulled out of hole 200'. Stopped wench and talked with rig operator about pressures on well. Opened BOP's so we could pull spent guns out of hole. Immediately after they opened, BOP's, the well started blowing and blew squeeze guns out of hole. One operator was on rig floor and gun fell on opposite side from where he was standing.

IncidentSummary: While removing rotary table bushings with floor hoist employee was guiding bushing off to side, when
IncidentDescription: While removing rotary table bushings with floor hoist employee was guiding bushing off to side, when he slipped on rig floor causing him to fall and injuring right wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to right wrist after slipping on stairs.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped gun
IncidentDescription: While loading guns into trailer, a gun slipped off roller onto floor near foot.

IncidentSummary: Crew was TIH with 2 3/8" tubing and were on the the 32nd stand. They had to split the stand of tubin
IncidentDescription: Crew was TIH with 2 3/8" tubing and were on the the 32nd stand. They had to split the stand of tubing to install a gas lift mandrill. The derrick hand unhooked his positioning lanyard so he could rig up a wind wall while waiting to make a connection. The derrick hand did not communicate to the operator that he was going to take off his lanyard and rig up the wind wall. The crew made up the mandrill in the stump and came down with the string of tubing. The operator came up with the blocks to set another stand of tubing. The derrick hand leaned out of the tubing board and fell approximately two feet before the SRL set. The derrick hand self-rescued. He was not injured.
InjuryDescripti: Slight strain to multiple ext body parts after falling about two feet out of the tubing board due to removing lanyard to rig up the wind wall.

IncidentSummary: IE was sweeping floor at the shop and oil on the floor caused the IE to slip down to floor.
IncidentDescription: IE was sweeping floor at the shop and oil on the floor caused the IE to slip down to floor.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left hip after slipping on oil that was on the shop floor while sweeping.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/housekeeping
IncidentDescription: Frozen bottle of water was on derrick board against wind wall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/slip hazard
IncidentDescription: Water from air conditioner dripped onto stairs and formed ice and created a dangerous slip hazard.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/unsecured slips
IncidentDescription: When latching elevators to mouse hole, mouse hole slips did not hold causing pipe to slip and fall to tool joint with potential strike injury between stump in hole and elevators.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking out of the trailer after putting clothes in to wash. It had just started raining and
IncidentDescription: IE was walking out of the trailer after putting clothes in to wash. It had just started raining and left foot slipped, causing the IE to fall on buttocks.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to buttocks after slipping on trailer stairs.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription: Employee almost slipped off mud pump while changing out a swab; employee had poor footing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pressure washer
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got sprayed in face by pressure washer; employee didn't see other employee on opposite side of sub.

IncidentSummary: The crew was getting ready to change over to run tubing. The IE was in the back of the tool truck he
IncidentDescription: The crew was getting ready to change over to run tubing. The IE was in the back of the tool truck helping unload the bails. The IE attached the winch line to the top eye of one bail and lifted it over the tail gate of the tool truck. The IE was holding the bottom eye of the bail with the left hand and was reaching over the bail with right hand for the tag line. The bail started to slide off the tool truck and the IE's middle finger got caught between the bail and the tail gate of the tool truck.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left middle finger after it was caught between bail and tail gate of tool truck while bail was being loaded.

IncidentSummary: IE was getting out of the back of the wireline truck after rolling the tarp part way down. The IE wa
IncidentDescription: IE was getting out of the back of the wireline truck after rolling the tarp part way down. The IE was facing out the back of the truck while stepping down, not using three points of contact. Right ankle rolled while stepping onto the bumper, causing the the IE to fall off the back of the truck and onto the shop floor, landing on shoulders and back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle after foot slipped while stepping off bumper of wireline truck while rolling tarp.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing on the rear bumper of a wireline truck attempting to pull a piece of equipment off w
IncidentDescription: IE was standing on the rear bumper of a wireline truck attempting to pull a piece of equipment off when a plastic cap slipped. This caused the IE to fall backwards, land on his feet and hyperextend the right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right knee after slipping from the back of the wireline truck while pulling a piece of equipment off of it.

IncidentSummary: Crew was performing a squeeze job and were looking for hole in casing. They had ran approx 2,000 ft
IncidentDescription: Crew was performing a squeeze job and were looking for hole in casing. They had ran approx 2,000 ft. of tubing in hole that morning and pressured up on the casing with not avail. They decided to come up 500 ft. so they began pulling tubing out of hole. On the fourth stand of tubing they were going to pull, the IE went to latch the elevators around the tubing and the bottom of the elevator hit the tubing that was in the well head. This caused the elevators to flip up and pinch his left middle finger between the elevators and the bales.
InjuryDescripti: Crew was performing a squeeze job and were looking for hole in casing. They had run about 2,000 ft of tubing in hole and pressured up on the casing, without success. They decided to come up about 500 ft and began pulling tubing out of hole. On the fourth stand of tubing, the IE went to latch the elevators around the tubing and the bottom of the elevator hit the tubing that was in the well head. This caused the elevators to flip up and pinch left middle finger between elevators and bales.

IncidentSummary: Crew was pulling tubing out of the hole and racking it in the derrick. They had pulled all the tubin
IncidentDescription: Crew was pulling tubing out of the hole and racking it in the derrick. They had pulled all the tubing and were just about to lay the last joint on the ground. The IE left the rig floor and went to the ground to pull a joint of tubing off floor. As the IE pulled, the joint hit and bounced off the side of the BOP trailer that was parked next to the rig floor and struck the IE next to the right eye.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration by right eye after being struck by joint of tubing that hit and bounced off the side of the BOP trailer parked next to the rig floor.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was working on the Extraction pad and feet began to go numb in -20 degree temps. The IE continued
IncidentDescription: IE was working on the Extraction pad and feet began to go numb in -20 degree temps. The IE continued to work the rest of the shift and after returning to the hotel and taking off boots, felt pain in toes. When the IE woke up, both feet were swollen and it felt like walking on pins and needles.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained frost nip on large and pinky toes of both feet while working in -20 degree temperatures.

IncidentSummary: The crew was TOH with the string of rods. The IE had been working in the rod basket for about 2 hour
IncidentDescription: The crew was TOH with the string of rods. The IE had been working in the rod basket for about 2 hours and upon completing the task, came down from the derrick and warmed up in the dog house. The crew went back out and nippled up and released the anchor. The crew went home and the IE noticed frost nip on right middle, left 4th and little fingers and right 3rd toe. Upon arrival at the location the following morning at 8 AM, the IE notified the rig manager. The temperature was -15 with 15 mph winds and a wind chill of -40.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained frost nip on right middle, left 4th and pinky fingers and right 3rd toe, while working in the rod basket TOH. The temperature was -15, 15 mph winds and -40 wind chill.

IncidentSummary: Temperature was 11 degrees. Crew started rigging down at 8AM. The rig operator was running winch on
IncidentDescription: Temperature was 11 degrees. Crew started rigging down at 8AM. The rig operator was running winch on rig and the IE was standing at the rear of the trailer. The IE started to push the 20' riser that was being set down on the trailer, felt a sharp pain in the back of the left calf and thought something hit the back of the leg. It was very cold and the IE had a hard time walking afterward.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left calf while pushing on 20' riser being set down on trailer with a winch. Temperature was 11 degrees.

IncidentSummary: MISS grease port
IncidentDescription: While closing the lower master valve so valve company could grease wellhead, the valve company busted a grease port allowing 3500 PSI to shoot through the broken fitting. Our employee, Zac, in the man basket and Cody and myself within 10' of the well head turning the valve.

IncidentSummary: MISS wireline "jumped" sheave
IncidentDescription: On stage 3 while POOH, there was a sudden and severe increase in tension a 7480', which is still horizontal on this well. Stopped the drum and brought the tension down to check to see if it was stuck in the tubes. Around 3000 lbs it became unstuck and around 7300 ft the lead operator began seeing metal shavings on the line. The large deflection and correction had caused the wireline to go on top of the sheave. See attachment for detailed description.

IncidentSummary: While breaking down tool string, IE felt pain in his hands and wrists. IE stated to Seth that he fel
IncidentDescription: While breaking down tool string, IE felt pain in his hands and wrists. IE stated to Seth that he felt this pain since the start of the job around 10-18-16, but does not remember what he was doing at the time. IE's date of hire was 10-18-16, the date the pain was felt.
InjuryDescripti: Alleged strain to wrists while breaking down tool string. This was his first day on the job.

IncidentSummary: Employee attached lifting strap to casing circulating swedge to remove from casing stump, when air h
IncidentDescription: Employee attached lifting strap to casing circulating swedge to remove from casing stump, when air hoist operator lifted the swedge, Jesus began to guide swedge over to lay it down on the floor when the swedge shifted and struck top of his hard hat causing hard hat to slide down on Jesus's face and cause a minor laceration under bottom lip (center). (FROI) - While running production string of casing driller had to stop at depth given by company representative to fill up casing. Bobby and Jesus installed pump in sub to fill up casing. Driller filled up casing with mud pump. Jesus opened up the 2" relief line to bleed off the pressure (pressure was bled off). Employee's backed of the pump in sub and went to remove the sub with a strap and hydraulic hoist Jesus installed strap on on sub and Bobby was operating the hoist. When removing the sub it came out and oft the casing, it was top heavy and struck Jesus on the hard hat causing hard hat to strike Jesus on the lip (causing a small nick).
InjuryDescripti: Nick/laceration to lip after being struck on the hard hat from a top-heavy sub.

IncidentSummary: IE was crouching down to tighten the bottom set of bolts on the flange of a BOP test stand. The IE
IncidentDescription: IE was crouching down to tighten the bottom set of bolts on the flange of a BOP test stand. The IE hit the crossover while standing up, causing hard hat to come off and forehead to strike crossover.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration above right eye when hard hat fell off and forehead struck against crossover while standing up.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up PH6 pipe off pipe racks using hydraulic catwalk to lift it to the rig floor, whi
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up PH6 pipe off pipe racks using hydraulic catwalk to lift it to the rig floor, which was set at 10 feet. They ran a joint in the hole and the operator set the slips and floor hand RJ Ruiz attempted to unlatch the NYT slip-type elevators. They did not easily come loose so RJ pushed them harder as he unlatched towards the v-door. The elevators came loose and swung towards floor hand Jesse Lopez, Jr, who was holding the next joint up ready to be latched off the hydraulic catwalk trough. Jesse dropped the pipe into the trough to avoid the elevators swinging towards him and the pipe came out of the trough and struck the IE, who was operating the hydraulic catwalk on the ground. The IE attempted to duck and push the pipe behind, but it grazed and slid off the back of the hard hat and struck the upper back between the shoulders.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to upper back after being struck by pipe that came out of the hydraulic catwalk trough.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE went to reach back for the tool cart and thought another employee was holding the tool they had j
IncidentDescription: IE went to reach back for the tool cart and thought another employee was holding the tool they had just filled with oil and let go of it. As the IE turned around, the Baker tool was falling towards him and while attempting to catch it, the tool jerked him back and the IE felt discomfort between shoulder blades.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced strain to upper back after trying to catch Baker tool falling towards him while also reaching for the cart.

IncidentSummary: IE was pressure washing parts of a 5k grease head. IE stepped on one side of a 7" long tandem sub wi
IncidentDescription: IE was pressure washing parts of a 5k grease head. IE stepped on one side of a 7" long tandem sub with left foot while pressure washing it and water swept across inside of left foot. The boot was not cut but the hot water made it's way through the small holes of the boot and caused a minor burn.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained burn to left foot and index finger after pressure washer being used to clean grease head parts swept across boot.

IncidentSummary: IE was jogging from well to Marshall Guthrie and stepped in a rut from a heavy truck, straining left
IncidentDescription: IE was jogging from well to Marshall Guthrie and stepped in a rut from a heavy truck, straining left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left ankle after stepping in a rut made by a heavy truck while walking from well.

IncidentSummary: IE was pushing a cart with a perf. gun laying in the V angle iron placed left hand on the cart and r
IncidentDescription: IE was pushing a cart with a perf. gun laying in the V angle iron placed left hand on the cart and right hand on the gun. IE's left hand slipped forward on angle iron and cut ring finger on left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left ring finger when hand slipped forward and struck against angle iron on cart being used to move perf. gun. IE was not wearing gloves.

IncidentSummary: IE was on catwalk laying down 2 7/8" pipe. Pipe was rusty and IE had to pull hard to get pipe to sli
IncidentDescription: IE was on catwalk laying down 2 7/8" pipe. Pipe was rusty and IE had to pull hard to get pipe to slide down trough. The collar hit hard on trough and and bounced out and fell about 2-1/2 feet onto right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained abrasion to right foot after being struck by pipe when it bounced out of trough.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging down and was using a 6' ladder to get to well head. After tightening well connection,
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging down and was using a 6' ladder to get to well head. After tightening well connection, IE was coming down the ladder and was about 4' above the ground when ladder shifted, causing the IE to fall off the ladder. Slickline Supervisor, Mingo Jimenez, and company supervisor, Roland, witnessed the incident and helped the IE up.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to right ankle after falling about 4' off ladder being used to access well head while rigging down

IncidentSummary: IE fell approximately 3.5 feet off trailer and landed on the lateral side of both feet, twisting bot
IncidentDescription: IE fell approximately 3.5 feet off trailer and landed on the lateral side of both feet, twisting both knees and down onto the tailbone. No discomfort was felt in feet but immediately felt discomfort to both knees and tailbone.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to both knees and lower back after falling 3.5 feet off trailer and landing on lateral sides of feet.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/loose stand
IncidentDescription: After making a connection from the derrick the driller commenced drilling @ after a few min a stand became loose from the tie back ropes and came out of the fingers and into the alley way and the out into the derrick due to not being tied off and high winds.

IncidentSummary: MISS miscommunication
IncidentDescription:
Well was opened before properly equalized.
-Different pump operator communicated in a different way than previous operator, causing miscommunication with Wireline.
-Company man, engineer, frac supervisor and pump operator had safety meeting to clarify communication procedures.

IncidentSummary: IE is alleging that while working in the derrick latching elevators around tubing, a "spark" was fel
IncidentDescription: IE is alleging that while working in the derrick latching elevators around tubing, a "spark" was felt in the right wrist below the thumb. The incident was reported the morning after the incident. The IE also states this has happened a few times over the past year, but had never reported it.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly strained right wrist while latching elevators around tubing. Did not report until following morning and states this has happened several times during the past year. There was no evidence of swelling or bruising. Refused medical treatment.

IncidentSummary: MISS backhoe
IncidentDescription: A back hoe operator was digging around well (cellar) with a rig hand in the hole. The hand lifted his foot out of the hole just as the back hoe bucket slammed into the side of the hole, just missing the rig hand's foot.

IncidentSummary: When crew came out of well with spent gun, IE notice signs of trapped pressure, hissing and bubbling
IncidentDescription: When crew came out of well with spent gun, IE notice signs of trapped pressure, hissing and bubbling from perf. holes, and informed the other Operator, Chris Jennings that they needed to melt the gun gas out before they proceeded to break down the tool string. When Rodney came out, we decided to continue letting the gun bleed out. They waited and then easily broke off the bull-plug with no signs of pressure on the bottom. Once they got passed the top o-ring on the tandem sub, it started releasing pressure and at that point they decided to give it more time. Once all signs of pressure stopped, they continued breaking the gun down. As they reached the end of the tandem sub, the gamma gun blew off and hit the IE in the chest and right side of ribs, knocking the IE down. The gun then released trapped pressure and debris and blasted the IE in the face and right arm.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to chest, right side of ribs, face and right arm after being struck by the gamma gun that blew off when trapped pressure was released while breaking down the gun.

IncidentSummary: Crew was in the process of running casing and as employee on ground was rolling casing, the casing r
IncidentDescription: Crew was in the process of running casing and as employee on ground was rolling casing, the casing rolled at an angle causing the joint of 9 5/8" casing to roll crooked toward the sub structures. The joint of casing rolled off the top layer (top of 2 layers) and landed on the pipe racks. employee running the catwalk and the employee rolling the pipe notice the joint of casing was now to far toward the subs so in order for it to go in the trough he had to pull the joint back toward the company man's house. He stood on the side of the casing and grabbed the casing at the collar and pulled it toward the company man's house (away from the rig). As he was pulling, the employee running the catwalk saw the other end of the casing under the index finger and attempted to lift the joint of casing the side that the man on the ground wasn't yet under the index arm so when he lifted the index arm, it pushed the casing away from the catwalk hitting the employee on his left leg at the knee.
InjuryDescripti: Bruising to left knee after being struck when one side of casing slipped out while being picked up by cradle arms onto the catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/flowline leak
IncidentDescription: While walking up to rig floor noticed drip from flex hose on flowline. OBM was dripping down on to the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/loose pipe
IncidentDescription: While kicking out elevators to monkey board, an adjustment to link rotation was needed to place the stand in the proper allay way (???) (It was thrown off by tight hole) Driller floated elevators to do so and pipe swung nearby/nearly (???) a hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/forklift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hand started forklift and reversed as another was walking behind forklift. Hand walking behind moved out of harm's way.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pressure washer, body placement
IncidentDescription: Hand pressure washing mud pump was unaware of second hand and nearly got him with the pressure washer.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/high wind, hardhat
IncidentDescription: Employee was head up the derrick ladder when a gust of wind blew his harhat off of his head and nearly struck another employee on the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS failed frac iron
IncidentDescription: On a plug and perf/frac location, a frac iron failed during a frac. The failed iron was identified as a one-by-two plug valve located on the frac manifold between the missile and the zipper. Estimated pressure on the iron at the time of the incident was 7500 psi at 75 bpm. Frac fluid was blown out at a forty-five-degree angle, upward and toward the Wireline side. Estimated height of fluid was fifty feet. The blowout lasted approximately two minutes. The basket of the man basket that is used to stab on the well and open the crown valve was in direct contact with the blowout.

IncidentSummary: The crew was changing over from tubing equipment to rod equipment and the operator was lowering the
IncidentDescription: The crew was changing over from tubing equipment to rod equipment and the operator was lowering the blocks to remove the tubing bales. The IE was pulling the bales back while the blocks came down. As the blocks came down, the IE took a step back and slipped on the ice/snow that was on the ground. The IE finished his tour.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after slipping and falling on ice/snow while helping crew pull the bales back as the blocks came down.

IncidentSummary: While picking up a gun, IE was walking past James towards the manlift. James had pulled a stand and
IncidentDescription: While picking up a gun, IE was walking past James towards the manlift. James had pulled a stand and tossed it behind him to grab the next one under the gun. IE was struck by the stand, tripped and fell.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right leg when struck by a stand being tossed aside by another employee, as he walked to manlift.

IncidentSummary: Driller went up in derrick with block to latch drill collar. Derrick hand released collar out too fa
IncidentDescription: Driller went up in derrick with block to latch drill collar. Derrick hand released collar out too far allowing drill collar nubbin to make contact with block. Drill collar swung and struck IE on lower left leg.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to left ankle after being struck by drill collar after it swung out too far while being latched.

IncidentSummary: The IE was going to pick up blocks and was struck in the forearm by the brake handle as the clutch w
IncidentDescription: The IE was going to pick up blocks and was struck in the forearm by the brake handle as the clutch was engaged.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained laceration to left arm after being struck by brake handle when clutch was engaged to pick up blocks.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS debooster bladder
IncidentDescription: While employee was pumping up the bladder on a debooster, the bladder busted and sprayed antifreeze on the employee's face. Employee was wearing safety glasses so the antifreeze did not get in the eyes. Employee did get a small amount in the mouth. HSE was notified and poison control hot line was called. It was determined he would be fine.

IncidentSummary: IE had just finished putting the chain on the coil reel and was coming down off the trailer. IE was
IncidentDescription: IE had just finished putting the chain on the coil reel and was coming down off the trailer. IE was about one foot off the ground and jumped down off the trailer. Upon landing, the IE heard a pop in left calf.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left calf after jumping about one foot down off trailer after putting the chain on the coil reel.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling guide fingers
IncidentDescription: Wind gusts increased during the morning and caused winch line on crane boom to slap against guide fingers. Eventually, some of the guide fingers broke and fell next to operators working about 80 feet away.

IncidentSummary: IE was working in the perf trailer next to employees that were using brake cleaner to clean off the
IncidentDescription: IE was working in the perf trailer next to employees that were using brake cleaner to clean off the port caps, quick changes and firing heads. The ventilation was poor and the IE claims to have inhaled too much and wasn't able to "think straight".
InjuryDescripti: Became disoriented while working in perf trailer, that was not ventilated, next to employees that were using brake cleaner.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking from the grease trailer to the well head on uneven ground and slipped and fell on rig
IncidentDescription: IE was walking from the grease trailer to the well head on uneven ground and slipped and fell on right elbow, wrist and knee. The incident was not reported until the IE returned to the shop. The IE states he wanted to finish rigging down.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right elbow, wrist and knee after slipping and falling on uneven ground while walking from grease trailer to well head.

IncidentSummary: While laying down pipe, Joshua was pushing back the drill pipe to set into the catwalk trough. As th
IncidentDescription: While laying down pipe, Joshua was pushing back the drill pipe to set into the catwalk trough. As the joint was coming down into the trough, Joshua slid his hand up from the thread protector onto the tool joint and a large piece of metal shrapnel from the ST-80 breaking the joint entered his right ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: Handling piece of pipe when struck by metal fragment resulting in puncture to right ring finger.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS crane control engaged
IncidentDescription: While getting into crane, a rag in back pocket caught on controls, secondary swing. When turning on crane power, it started swinging and winching up.

IncidentSummary: MISS slipped down logger stairs
IncidentDescription: While exiting logger, employee slipped on stairs.

IncidentSummary: While rolling the Mud Pump, the bar used to manually roll the pump slipped out of position and cause
IncidentDescription: While rolling the Mud Pump, the bar used to manually roll the pump slipped out of position and caused Cori to hit his left hand against the guard, causing a small cut (superficial) to his middle finger.
InjuryDescripti: While rolling mud pump, bar came out of slot causing employee to strike hand against guard resulting in a small cut to right middle finger.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling guide fingers
IncidentDescription: The wind started picking up and crew decided to shut down operations. The winds were steady at 25 with gusts 30+mph. In the process of rigging the cranes down, the guides on top of the boom broke off from the cable that was whipping in the wind and fell to the ground near personnel.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was swinging a hammer hitting a pin to break the discharge cap off the mud pump and missed the pin with the hammer nearly slipping and falling off mud pump. When employee swung hammer and missed, he lost his balance and lost his footing and nearly fell backwards off pump. He regained balance and did NOT fall.

IncidentSummary: WHILE EMPLOYEE WAS POSITIONING STEEL MUD BUCKET ON TO DRILL PIPE, THE LATCH HANDLE SWUNG BACK AND HI
IncidentDescription: WHILE EMPLOYEE WAS POSITIONING STEEL MUD BUCKET ON TO DRILL PIPE, THE LATCH HANDLE SWUNG BACK AND HIT RIGHT THUMB. EMPLOYEE WAS WEARING IMPACT GLOVES.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was positioning steel mud bucket onto drill pipe when the latch handle swung back and struck employee's right thumb resulting in contusion.

IncidentSummary: MISS incorrect needle valve size
IncidentDescription: While testing reel manifold, employee found that there was a 10k needle valve on a bull plug on the reel manifold that is rated for 15k.

IncidentSummary: IE was picking up a loaded gun string from tool stand that was not tied to wireline. The crew needed
IncidentDescription: IE was picking up a loaded gun string from tool stand that was not tied to wireline. The crew needed to move the gun string out of the way in order to get the flow-back grease tote under the wireline and next to the grease trailer. The IE picked up the gun string, cradling it and taking about 2-3 steps backwards before tripping over the tool string dolly wheel. This caused the IE to let go of the gun string, twist around and fall on belly. The other two crew members could not hold the gun string and let it go. The gun string fell onto the back of the IE's leg and then rolled down over left knee and onto shin. The guns string weighed about 400 lbs and consisted of five loaded perforated guns and a Baker 20 tool with plug.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left leg after tripping and falling backwards over tool string dolly wheel when gun string being carried by IE and other crew members was dropped onto leg when they could not hold onto it.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning shop and while moving a 2-foot valve that was on the floor, struck left thumb agains
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning shop and while moving a 2-foot valve that was on the floor, struck left thumb against the valve.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left thumb after 2-foot valve being moved rolled over it while cleaning shop.

IncidentSummary: IVAN WAS TRIPPING ON THE DERRICK BOARD, GOING THE HOLE WITH 8" DRILL COLLARS. IVAN PULLED THE COLLAR
IncidentDescription: IVAN WAS TRIPPING ON THE DERRICK BOARD, GOING THE HOLE WITH 8" DRILL COLLARS. IVAN PULLED THE COLLAR BACK TOWARDS THE ALLEY WAY TO GET HIS 3/4" ROPE AROUND THE COLLAR, TO PULL BACK ENOUGH TO GET HIS 1" ROPE AROUND THE COLLAR. AS HE WAS PUTTING THE 3/4" ROPE AROUND THE COLLAR, THE ROPE SLIPPED. THE COLLAR SWAYED BACK, CATCHING HIS HAND BETWEEN 2 COLLARS. DOING SO RESULTED IN GETTING HIS HAND BETWEEN THE COLLARS, ON HIS RIGHT INDEX KNUCKLE. HE JACKED THE COLLAR BACK TO RELEASE HIS HAND.
InjuryDescripti: While tripping in, employee's hand was caught between two collars resulting in swelling of right hand index knuckle.

IncidentSummary: While moving sheave from truck to the rig IE caught left index finger between the hand rail and shea
IncidentDescription: While moving sheave from truck to the rig IE caught left index finger between the hand rail and sheave after the sheave struck against another tool already on the floor.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left index finger after it was caught between sheave and hand rail while lifting it up to rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS slipped in grease
IncidentDescription: Crew removed a grease trailer from bay and replaced with guns awaiting Sinclair plug shoot. Run-off from grease trailer left three small puddles. Employee stepped in one with heel of shoe and right foot slipped, He regained balance and avoided fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS tarp on fire
IncidentDescription: Tarp on Cameron's valve grease unit caught on fire in the work area. Crew was working on getting the lubricator stabbed on at the time. One operator was on the well stand and about to get the lubricator entry guide off when he noticed the flames. He promptly got off the well stand.

IncidentSummary: The employee was spooling electrical cables onto a pallet and alleges his back began to hurt. The pa
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: The employee was spooling electrical cables onto a pallet and alleges his back began to hurt. The pain was temporary and went away so he wasn't concern. Later that day the pain came back and he began to exhibit flu like symptoms. The employee called and reported the incident to his supervisor and said he wasn't sure if the pain in his back was from the symptoms of from a strain while he was moving the cables.
InjuryDescripti: Possible back strain while spooling up electrical cables.

IncidentSummary: MISS stiff arm (AL)
IncidentDescription: Relief crew was releasing packer with tongs. As the driller was going up the stiff arm was pulled, causing the welds to break. Floor hands immediately notified the driller to sop the job.

IncidentSummary: MISS ice - fall avoided
IncidentDescription: Employee parked truck and as he stepped out he nearly slipped and fell on ice.

IncidentSummary: Truck with mast unit is stuck and Cat. D6 comes to pull it out. D6 backs up to mast unit and unwraps
IncidentDescription: Truck with mast unit is stuck and Cat. D6 comes to pull it out. D6 backs up to mast unit and unwraps 1-inch cable off D6 for towing. Once mast unit is unstuck, cable was unhooked and wrapped back on D6. Tried to turn around and got stuck again. D6 backed up to front of truck and as IE went to unwrap cable again, the cable sprung up and struck nose where safety glasses rest.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to nose when struck by cable being unwrapped for 2nd time in an attempt to pull mast unit out of mud.

IncidentSummary: Thomas Vela and the IE were laying down tool string with the junk basket and the IE tripped while ho
IncidentDescription: Thomas Vela and the IE were laying down tool string with the junk basket and the IE tripped while holding onto the weight bar. This caused the tool string to fall across the left shin area.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to shin on left leg after being struck by the tool string while laying it down with the junk basket.

IncidentSummary: MISS gap around well head
IncidentDescription: Titan scaffolding has a large gap around well head. Temporary plywood was put in place to cover gap, but not secured to scaffold. Plywood slid while operator was removing night cap and foot slipped into gap, causing one leg to slip between well head and scaffold.

IncidentSummary: While walking down rig floor stairs, IE slipped, avoided fall and strained left knee
IncidentDescription: While walking down rig floor stairs, IE slipped, avoided fall and strained left knee
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee after slipping and avoiding fall while walking down rig floor stairs.

IncidentSummary: IE drove to location and felt severe lower back pain while getting out of the truck.
IncidentDescription: IE drove to location and felt severe lower back pain while getting out of the truck.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while getting out of truck on location.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging on the ground while the Engineer picked up the tool string to go in the well. IE noti
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging on the ground while the Engineer picked up the tool string to go in the well. IE noticed as the tools were being picked up by the wireline, the wireline was hung on the top spreader bar by the top sheave. IE grabbed the wireline just above the bottom sheave and tried to pull it and pop it free. The IE failed to realize that the bottom sheave was coming up toward left hand at the same time. The bottom sheave came up and pinched the tip of left ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left ring finger after it was caught under the bottom sheave while trying to free the wireline that had hung on the top spreader bar by the top sheave.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the process of rebuilding a #20 setting tool at the shop and as he set down a section of t
IncidentDescription: IE was in the process of rebuilding a #20 setting tool at the shop and as he set down a section of the rebuilt tool, right ring finger was pinched between tool and table.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger after it was caught between table and #20 Baker setting tool.

IncidentSummary: Crew was TOH with 7/8-inch rods and the IE was running the rod tongs. The IE was looking up at the d
IncidentDescription: Crew was TOH with 7/8-inch rods and the IE was running the rod tongs. The IE was looking up at the derrick hand while breaking out the rods to make sure the derrick hand had proper hand/body placement. A drop of production fluid fell from the rod and landed in the IE's left eye. The IE was wearing safety glasses.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left eye after a drop of production fluid fell from the rod, and behind safety glasses, while looking up at derrick hand while breaking out the rods.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/cellar door, foot placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost had the cellar cover fall on his foot when it slipped out of his hand while moving it into position.

IncidentSummary: Employees were laying out mud motor and stabilizer and while they were putting the drill collar clam
IncidentDescription: Employees were laying out mud motor and stabilizer and while they were putting the drill collar clamp on the mud motor in the mouse hole to break off stabilizer, another employee started bringing trough up to rig floor to lay tools out. Employee brought trough in and struck employee on the lower back. Employee running catwalk wasn't given any hand signals to bring trough in and couldn't see employees putting clamp on mud motor because there was drill pipe on that side of the racking board obstructing his view.
InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back pinched nerve after employee was bending and crouching down when raised up he bumped into stationary hydraulic catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS shutting truck hood
IncidentDescription: Employee started to close the hood of a truck while another employee was looking at what oil filter was needed.

IncidentSummary: Dustin Longoria and Evarado Solares were in the doghouse changing clothes to go home. They started p
IncidentDescription: Dustin Longoria and Evarado Solares were in the doghouse changing clothes to go home. They started pushing and shoving one another in a rough manner and Evarado was struck in the eye by Dustin. The horseplay was not reported for 5 days. When it was reported, it was done in a manner that made it seem that it occurred after work hours.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left eye after being struck by another employee, during horseplay, while changing clothes in the doghouse before leaving work.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/tong line
IncidentDescription: While breaking out tight joint, I was pulling 60,000 Ft/lbs of torque on tong lines. The break out side tong line broke causing tong to swing until it got to the end of the snub line.

IncidentSummary: Gun rolled off table and landed on the IE's left foot.
IncidentDescription: Gun rolled off table and landed on the IE's left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot after being stuck by gun when it rolled off the table.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning subs and cut hand on expanded metal.
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning subs and cut hand on expanded metal.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right hand after striking against expanded metal while cleaning subs.

IncidentSummary: IE was prepping perforating gun for stabbing on. Typically, they team-lift the back of the tool off
IncidentDescription: IE was prepping perforating gun for stabbing on. Typically, they team-lift the back of the tool off the back of the stand but the back stand appeared to be low enough that the IE thought it could be done alone. The stand got caught on a large piece of scoria. The IE jerked the stand to free it and was struck below the left knee when it became free.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee after being struck by tool stand after it became free after being caught on a piece of scoria.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken 7" swedge
IncidentDescription: While rig crew was blowing down well into frac tank, 7" swedge broke and well blew oil all over location. Safety cables were on hose and kept hose in place.

IncidentSummary: MISS carrying tools
IncidentDescription: One of the tools being carried up to the rig floor swung out of the operator's hands and struck the sheave.

IncidentSummary: MISS lube removal - frac water
IncidentDescription: When the crew removed the lube from the well head, frac water blew out because one of the frac trucks still had a motor turning after zero had been confirmed with the frac crew.

IncidentSummary: MISS oily wireline unit steps
IncidentDescription: The steps out of unit 112 were slick with oil. The employee had three points of contact and was barely able to catch himself.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/forklift, straps
IncidentDescription:
WHILE USING FORKLIFT TO PICK UP SUPER SACK OF BARITE THE LIFTING STRAPS THAT ARE
ON THE SACK WERE PLACED OVER THE FORKS TO PICK THE SACK UP WHEN THE EDGE OF
THE FORKS CUT THE STRAPS CAUSING THE SACK TO FALL ABOUT A FOOT TO THE GROUND
(NOTE THAT THE FORKLIFT IS A BRAND NEW MACHINE AND THAT THE FORKS ARE ALSO
BRAND NEW.)

IncidentSummary: IE was stemming pump #9. While writing on the stem sheet, noticed the stem sheet was getting dirty b
IncidentDescription: IE was stemming pump #9. While writing on the stem sheet, noticed the stem sheet was getting dirty because of the gloves. The IE removed the gloves so the stem sheet would not get dirty. The IE was about to climb onto the pump, noticed the ladder was stuck and went to get a hammer to tap it down. The IE had the left hand in a pinch point area without realizing it. As the IE tapped on the ladder, it fell onto the left hand and peeled the skin away on the two middle fingers. The IE was not wearing gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to middle fingers of left hand after getting them caught in pinch point on ladder. IE was not wearing gloves.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving one 9-barrel perforating gun from a bumper-pull trailer to a fifth-wheel trailer on th
IncidentDescription: IE was moving one 9-barrel perforating gun from a bumper-pull trailer to a fifth-wheel trailer on the side of the lease road so that it could be taken back to town after failing to fire. The fifth-wheel is taller than the bumper-pull and both trailers were sitting at an angle due to the crown of the road. The fifth-wheel trailer also has a metal C-channel on the edge of the trailer that was involved in the incident. The perforating gun weighs about 300-350 lbs. The IE and Skylar lifted the front of the gun onto the fifth-wheel trailer and Skylar held the gun while the IE walked down the gun string and pushed it up onto the trailer. When the gun got to a certain spot, it slipped on the C-channel and fell, catching the IE's left thumb between the gun and the edge of the trailer.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to left thumb after it was caught between trailer and perforating gun while moving the gun between trailers.

IncidentSummary: Two employees were attempting to move a pallet with a 4X4 basket on top. The iE was standing behind
IncidentDescription: Two employees were attempting to move a pallet with a 4X4 basket on top. The iE was standing behind the pallet with left foot between a Conex container and the pallet. The employee operating the forklift attempted to move the pallet and struck the basket with the forks, knocking onto the IE's left foot and crushing it between the basket and the container.
InjuryDescripti: Bruising to left foot after it was crushed between 4X4 basket on pallet being moved with forklift and Conex container.

IncidentSummary: When pulling pins to lower floorplate on the horse head when the pin came out the load came down qui
IncidentDescription: When pulling pins to lower floorplate on the horse head when the pin came out the load came down quickly and pinched the employee's arm at the elbow in between the plate and the horse head.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right elbow when employee's elbow was caught between floor plate and horse head.

IncidentSummary: While adjusting rod clamp, IE stepped on edge of matting board and lost balance. This caused the IE
IncidentDescription: While adjusting rod clamp, IE stepped on edge of matting board and lost balance. This caused the IE to slip, fall and twist left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after slipping and falling on matting board while adjusting rod clamps.

IncidentSummary: While tightening the pin on the Baker #20, it broke off and shot back and hit the IE in the right bi
IncidentDescription: While tightening the pin on the Baker #20, it broke off and shot back and hit the IE in the right bicep and shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right bicep and shoulder after pin on Baker #20 shot back after breaking while the Baker #20 was being built.

IncidentSummary: Crew was running 2-1/8" perforating guns off a workover rig. Forty feet of 3" 5K lubricator was bei
IncidentDescription: Crew was running 2-1/8" perforating guns off a workover rig. Forty feet of 3" 5K lubricator was being used. The tool string was 37.5' long. There was no pressure on the well, so crew and driller lifted lubricator up high, then bumped up into lube until tool was out of well. Tool was then pushed to side of rig floor where Jourdan grabbed bottom of tool and started to pull tool towards wireline truck away from rig to lay down. At this point, half of the gamma gun was still in lubricator, but still coming down on winch of e-line truck when wire pulled out of cablehead. The tool string came down diagonally about 28', striking the IE on the right thigh. Cable was re-headed before job, with 8 outers pulled down and had 6 runs on it. This was the last run of job. Driller said he did not lower lubricator with rig while tool was being laid down, but this seems to be the most likely scenario as to what happened. Distances: End of lubricator to ground = 38.6' Rig floor to end of lubricator = 28.1' wellhead to bumper of wireline = 40.4' tool string = 37.5'
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thigh after being stuck by tool string after wire pulled out of cablehead while POOH.

IncidentSummary: IE had just finished Well Control School and walked over to the BOP test area to see if they needed
IncidentDescription: IE had just finished Well Control School and walked over to the BOP test area to see if they needed help. The crane was hooked up to the pack-off and the IE sees they are trying to take the test bar out of the pack-off. The IE asks the BOP tech, Fortino, if all pressure was bled off and the strippers retracted, and Fortino said it was. Fortino had already disconnected the hydraulic hoses from the pack-off prior to the IE walking over to the test area. IE said that they tried different ways to get the test bar out of the pack-off. As the IE was walking around the pack-off looking at it, one of the female quick connects blew and the internal check valve inside the quick connect flew out and struck the IE in the chest.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to chest after being struck by internal check valve inside quick connect after it blew out while trying to remove test bar out of the pack-off.

IncidentSummary: Floor hand got a 3/4" metal shaving from tool joint stuck in his skin on his stomach area, while rac
IncidentDescription: Floor hand got a 3/4" metal shaving from tool joint stuck in his skin on his stomach area, while racking back pipe tripping out of the hole.
InjuryDescripti: Employee got a 3/4" metal shaving from tool joint stuck in his skin on his stomach area, while racking back pipe tripping out of the hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/fan blade
IncidentDescription: While shutting down #2 gen to inspect motor hand heard strange noise from #3 radiator. Radiator fan shot out of top of cage on radiator. The fan became unbalanced and threw the rest of the blades. Motor hand hit estop on gen and investigated cause and damage. Fan blades punctured inside of radiator.

IncidentSummary: MISS unpinned brake band (AL)
IncidentDescription: Snubbing unit was going in the hole while Operator, Justin Martinez was tailing with the blocks. Snubber was pushing pipe in the hole when the pin to one of the brake bands came out, causing the brakes to fail. Mr. Martined clutched the rig to maintain power on the draw works to keep the block from falling. Floor hand, David Fuentes, went up to the blocks on a man lift and secured them with the cat line. Once the blocks were secured, they re-pinned the brake band and restored control of the brakes.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/hammer, body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got hit by swinging hammer while nippling up flow line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pipe, hand placement
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe, employee almost got fingers pinched between 2 stands of drill pipe.

IncidentSummary: Walking to hopper when dust storm blew through and dust got in eyes.
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Walking to hopper when dust storm blew through and dust got in eyes.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation of the eyes after getting dust in eyes from wind storm.

IncidentSummary: MISS bleed off pressure release
IncidentDescription: Hand was bleeding setting tool off and pressure appeared to be at 0 psi. Due to charge (Diamond Back) debris in bleed off, port failed to bleed off to 0. Hand removed bleed off tool and was met with a small discharge of pressure.

IncidentSummary: MISS pinched glove
IncidentDescription: Jeff Haapapuro was holding backup for Jason M. as they broke connections on gun while it was on the stands. One connection was near a stand and as Jason grabbed pipe, part of Jeff's glove was pinched between stand and pipe wrench. His hand was not in the part of the glove that was caught.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking a gun down and a piece of metal stuck in the side of right hand. The metal came out
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking a gun down and a piece of metal stuck in the side of right hand. The metal came out when the IE removed the blue rubber glove and it then started to bleed.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right hand after piece of metal went through blue gloves being worn. Metal came out when gloves were removed.

IncidentSummary: Crew was at the yard doing maintenance. As they were laying down the bails, the IE approached area t
IncidentDescription: Crew was at the yard doing maintenance. As they were laying down the bails, the IE approached area to unlatch the catline from the bails before they were completely shut down. One of the bails was about 2 inches off the ground and as it was set down, struck IE on steel toe of left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained contusion to left foot after being struck by one of the bales as it was being set down.

IncidentSummary: Our vehicle stopped at the intersection at a flashing red light. As he proceeded through the interse
IncidentDescription: Our vehicle stopped at the intersection at a flashing red light. As he proceeded through the intersection, he didn't see the truck coming and hit it.
InjuryDescripti: Strain lo back after vehicle incident.

IncidentSummary: Employee was working rolling casing during a casing run. As he was doing this he stepped on a large
IncidentDescription: Employee was working rolling casing during a casing run. As he was doing this he stepped on a large rock and rolled his ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to right ankle after mis-stepping on a rock.

IncidentSummary: Employees were in the process of laying down drill pipe, the injured employee placed a thread protec
IncidentDescription: Employees were in the process of laying down drill pipe, the injured employee placed a thread protector on the drill pipe then slid his hand up the pipe to the tool joint to push the pipe into the trough. As he slid his hand up to the tool joint, his finger was lacerated by a piece of metal that was sheared off the tool joint by the jaws of the ST-80. He received a small laceration on the index finger of his right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right index finger lacerated by a piece of metal that was sheared off a tool joint by the jaws of an ST-80.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS falling rod finger sleeve (AL)
IncidentDescription: Floor hand had installed seven new rod finger sleeves on the rod basket at about 7:30 AM. Derrick man had set the transfer cup on the rod and at 11:30 AM, while crew was running in the hole with 3/4" rods, the rod guide on the rod struck finger sleeve. This lifted the sleeve off and out of the rod finger and resulted in rod finger sleeve falling from the rod basket onto the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: The IE was using a 36-inch pipe wrench with a cheater bar to break a 4-foot sub off a de-sander. The
IncidentDescription: The IE was using a 36-inch pipe wrench with a cheater bar to break a 4-foot sub off a de-sander. The pipe wrench slipped off the sub, causing the IE to fall on the right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee after striking against ground when pipe wrench slipped off sub.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/lug(s)
IncidentDescription: After raising mast rig crews were on the ground picking up tools to shut down for the night, we heard a shudder from the mast area and after investigation we found that ODS front dog had not grabbed dog lug, it appears that that dog centered on the ODS front lug then slipped to rest on the other 3.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/pipe stands
IncidentDescription: While making a connection, the driller was attempting to make up the stand of drill pipe to the stump. As he was doing this the driller lost communication with the joystick as he was attempting to lower the top drive to connect it to the stand. As he was trying to re-establish communications, he continued to try and come down with the top drive and ended up putting too much weight on the stand causing two of the stands to bend.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking across the BOP test bay and tripped over a 2" air hose that was running across the mi
IncidentDescription: IE was walking across the BOP test bay and tripped over a 2" air hose that was running across the middle of the shop floor. The IE landed on left shoulder and hard hat hit the floor. The other two employees were working on another task and did not witness the incident.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder after tripping over 2" air hose that was laying across the middle of the shop floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Tool Pull Off
IncidentDescription: Crew picked up lubricators from ground with CCL and weight bar inside lubricators. Once lubricators were vertical, crew realized that pumping sub was too high from ground in order to connect equalizing hose. They decided to swing lubricators about 5 feet to the left, next to grease unit, and then install the hose. Weight bar and CCL were already inside of the lubes. Engineer was inside logging unit and was not informed about moving lubricators. While swinging about 5 feet to the left, the tool reached top of the lube and weak point was broken. Bottom of the lubricators was about only 3 ft from the ground, so fallen tool hit the ground but stayed inside the lubricators.

IncidentSummary: Employee was going around the front of the suction and premix tank to transfer saltwater to the tank
IncidentDescription: Employee was going around the front of the suction and premix tank to transfer saltwater to the tanks. When he came around the corner he was looking down and walked into a top hinge ventilation window on the hopper pump room. He struck the corner of the window right above the left side of his lip causing a 1/2 inch laceration to the face.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip when employee turn around a blind corner not looking up striking against a top hinge ventilation window on the hopper pump room.

IncidentSummary: MISS Tool string pull out
IncidentDescription: Crew was RIH and had made it to bottom set plug and fired all guns. Logged out of hole, bled pressure off and lowered tool in the lubricator and the tool trap was opened. The tool was then lowered out below the bottom of the lubricator to be in view of the engineer while lube was being moved. Once it was communicated that it was in place, the crane operator and engineer both stopped movement of equipment to have the hand in the man basket install the tool guide. While reaching over to install tool guide, the tool pulled out of the rope socket. Tools stayed in the lubricator. See attached document for further details.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped tool string
IncidentDescription: While tripping tools out of the hole, employee bumped up to the pup joint & pack off while waiting for rig crew to get the well pressure bled down. After the pressure was bled down, the rig crew released the hydraulic rams and began to raise the pup joint and pack off with a winch line. While they were raising it, the employee observed that the tool had became lodged into the pup joint and was being raised into the air causing slack in the wireline. While trying to signal for the rig crew to lower the pup joint, the tool became dislodged and fell approximately 4 feet to the rig floor. The employee immediately applied tension back to the wireline to prevent the tool from falling over.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the man basket on the forklift. Juan Duran was operating the forklift and had lifted the I
IncidentDescription: IE was in the man basket on the forklift. Juan Duran was operating the forklift and had lifted the IE up to disconnect the Kelly hose from Rig 51 to replace it. The IE broke the Kelly hose from the union and the hose fell downward. There was a stainless steel clamp around the hose that had a five-inch end piece sticking out from the clamp and it struck the IE's left arm as it fell.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left arm after being struck by stainless steel clamp sticking out on Kelly hose as it was falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/hooks, dropped object(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While crane was lifting walking feet braces over the crew camp, the riggers did noit hook the hooks all the way so that the safety latches could latch. The crane operator did not see that they were hooked wrong until he had already lifted them up and over the crew house. When he went to lay them down on the ground, the braces came off the hooks and fell to the ground.

IncidentSummary: While moving 8 inch pipe for gas buster in preparation for painting, the employee put his hands in t
IncidentDescription: While moving 8 inch pipe for gas buster in preparation for painting, the employee put his hands in the pipe to push off beam. The pipe flipped over, smashing left thumb up against gas buster.
InjuryDescripti: Crushing injury, laceration to left thumb when hand was caught between pipe being handled and gas buster.

IncidentSummary: While cleaning wash bay, IE was untangling pressure washer hose. While stepping over the hose, passe
IncidentDescription: While cleaning wash bay, IE was untangling pressure washer hose. While stepping over the hose, passed the wand from right to left hand behind his back and accidentally pulled the handle and sprayed the back of left leg. The IE continued working and didn't think about it until feeling pain after finishing.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left leg when sprayed by power washer as the handle was accidentally pulled while passing it behind the back changing from right hand to left hand.

IncidentSummary: The IE and another employee were carrying a 200 pound perforating gun at chest level and felt pain i
IncidentDescription: The IE and another employee were carrying a 200 pound perforating gun at chest level and felt pain in lower back while squatting to place it on a 1-foot shelf.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while setting down a 200 pound perforating gun that was being carried with another employee.

IncidentSummary: While unscrewing trailer wall sheet metal back splash, screw tip broke and punctured the IE's left i
IncidentDescription: While unscrewing trailer wall sheet metal back splash, screw tip broke and punctured the IE's left index finger through cotton glove.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left index finger after striking against screw tip when it broke while screwing on sheet metal backsplash in trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS Tool Pull Off
IncidentDescription: Crew finished rigging up and noticed the transmission on the crane was leaking and decided to switch out cranes. The plan was to suck up the tool into the lube until the tool trap closed. Employee checked to make sure tool trap was bled off and explained hand signals to new employees before setting AA and starting to pull into the lube. Hand signal never changed from open and employee tagged the crown. By the time he saw the sheave move up and stop, it was too late and he had just pulled out of the head. The tool fell to the ground and penetrated about 1-2 feet. The lube was still about 3' above the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS tool string pull out
IncidentDescription: While rigging up for second run, wireline twisted around winch cable as gun was hoisted up. Swung lubricator over to untwist line and cable was about 6' from the ground when the lubricator gun got hung up on tooltrap that wasn't open all of the way. Crane pulled cable out of rope socket as it was winching down. There wasn't anyone in harm's way.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/slips, mousehole bowl
IncidentDescription: While making a connection and coming out of the mousehole with a stand. Slips and mousehole bowl was seized up onto pipe. Driller came up about ten feet before stopping.

IncidentSummary: While pumping out cellar, employee pulled 4 inch hose out of cellar when it slipped out of his hand
IncidentDescription: While pumping out cellar, employee pulled 4 inch hose out of cellar when it slipped out of his hand causing the hammer union (4 inch, Fig. 200 thread half) on the 4 inch hose to fall and hit employee's top right foot. Employee was wearing metatarsal guards but it was on the very high side of his foot where the hose hit causing a bump on employee's foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of right foot after being struck by dropped hammer union-end of a 4 inch hose.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving an "X" nipple from one joint to another and dropped the nipple, striking right knee. I
IncidentDescription: IE was moving an "X" nipple from one joint to another and dropped the nipple, striking right knee. IE was standing directly beside Kevin Bartlett at time of incident and did not report it until shift change at 6:00 PM.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee after being struck by dropped "X" nipple being moved between joints.

IncidentSummary: The pry bar the IE was using to hold up shaker slipped out and the shaker fell on right index finger
IncidentDescription: The pry bar the IE was using to hold up shaker slipped out and the shaker fell on right index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right index finger after pry bar being used to hold up shaker slipped causing shaker to land on finger.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rolling pipe onto the lay-down machine and up to the floor. IE by the pipe racks rolled a j
IncidentDescription: Crew was rolling pipe onto the lay-down machine and up to the floor. IE by the pipe racks rolled a joint of tubing on the lay-down machine and it started to roll back towards the pipe racks. This caused the joint to hit the pipe rack, bounce back and fall between the lay-down machine and pipe rack, striking the IE on the left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot after being struck by a joint of tubing that rolled back off the lay-down machine, struck the pipe rack and fell between machine and pipe rack.

IncidentSummary: In preparation for a clean up cycle prior to a motor trip, the crew was racking back mousehole stand
IncidentDescription: In preparation for a clean up cycle prior to a motor trip, the crew was racking back mousehole stand with hoist and single joint elevators. Hoist operator partially slacked off stand onto employee's steel toe, rolling off onto toes.
InjuryDescripti: Left foot contusion (possible toe[s]) resulting from tubular striking employee on foot due to partial slack in stand during prep for clean up cycle prior to a motor trip.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/track pad
IncidentDescription: While drilling, hand noticed a track pad sticking up out of housing. Floor was cleared and hand was sent up to remove pad. Top drive was moved to rig floor and inspected.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/hobble
IncidentDescription: While sending blocks up to latch onto a stand...hobble broke in two and both pieces fell onto racking board nearly striking a hand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pressure washer wand
IncidentDescription: After pressure washing festoon roof top hand was lowering down pressure washer wand by hand when he lost his grip and dropped pressure washer wand...meanwhile, a hand was walking below, passing by.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/surface hazard, skid
IncidentDescription: While washing mud pump hand stumbled upon skid that was slippery from soap...did not fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/missing bolts
IncidentDescription: Hand was changing sock on top drive. Looked over and saw the bolts on the stand pipe upper clamp were missing. Inspected and found the welds on one side had broke.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/cable inner core(s)
IncidentDescription: After reviewing alert from office, we checked the tong pull and snub line cable inner cores and found them to be bad.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/tank pressure
IncidentDescription: After rig was walked, air was rigged back up to the drawworks air tank and turned on. On walk around with John M., it was noticed that the tank pressure was way over operation pressure -- regulator must have stuck -- boosters were on and still pumping, trying to build more air.

IncidentSummary: MISS tubing anchor (AL)
IncidentDescription: While POH with 2-7/8" pipe, crew and pipe scanner operator lost count of pipe and pulled 298 joints of 2-7/8" and tubing anchor. This caused tubing scanner to rise about 2 feet. Tubing anchor jammed inside the scanner. Crew set scanner back down and unjammed the tubing anchor. Crew then rigged down tubing scanner, set tubing anchor down and checked for injuries and equipment damage.

IncidentSummary: MISS stabbing lubricator onto wellhead
IncidentDescription: After PES employee stabbed the lubricator onto the well, he lowered the man basket to the ground. He got out of the basket and valve guy stepped in. While scoping out and maneuvering the basket to open the crown valve, the control side of the man basket body made contact with the passenger front outrigger. Some of the fiberglass was peeled away next to the controls. No visual damage to the crane.

IncidentSummary: IE started to experience pain in right ring finger after he tightened a tool string together using a
IncidentDescription: IE started to experience pain in right ring finger after he tightened a tool string together using a 24" pipe wrench. The incident occurred on 05-12-17 and wasn't reported until 05-18-17.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced strain to right ring finger while using 24" wrench to make up tool string. Noticed finger was hurting after sitting down.

IncidentSummary: The employee was power washing on work platform around the BOP. Injured employee alleged that he sli
IncidentDescription: The employee was power washing on work platform around the BOP. Injured employee alleged that he slipped off of scaffolding and fell 6 foot. SRL caught him and the back of his head struck BOP. Upon investigation it was found that the alleged story couldn't have happened due to the location of the anchorage point for the SRL as it compared to the BOP. Had the SRL caught him it would have pulled him away from the stack not toward it. Employee was shown this evidence and did admit he was not wearing fall protection as he was working on the top level of the work platform. He stated that he fell from the work platform 14 feet to the ground level striking his head on the sub structure causing the laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was working on scaffold power washing when he slipped and fell and struck his head on BOP resulting in a laceration to back of head.

IncidentSummary: IE was unloading setting tools from back of work truck at the yard, slipped on a sub, fell off truck
IncidentDescription: IE was unloading setting tools from back of work truck at the yard, slipped on a sub, fell off truck and landed on right hip.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hip after falling off work truck while unloading setting tools.

IncidentSummary: After finishing a job, IE backed a trailer containing dump bailer and lubricator into the wash bay.
IncidentDescription: After finishing a job, IE backed a trailer containing dump bailer and lubricator into the wash bay. The IE was removing the 3" dump bailer by sliding it under two remaining straps and then up over the tailgate. The first one was successfully removed. The second one was in the top window section and as it slid under the straps, the IE lost grip and right thumb was pinned between bailer and tailgate. After glove was removed, blood was spraying out of the wound.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thumb after it was caught between tailgate and 3" dump bailer being removed from trailer in wash bay.

IncidentSummary: IE changed a flat on his vehicle at lunch and did not eat. While helping the mechanic fix a pump, th
IncidentDescription: IE changed a flat on his vehicle at lunch and did not eat. While helping the mechanic fix a pump, the IE started feeling lightheaded.
InjuryDescripti: Experience slight heat exhaustion while helping mechanic work on pump. Had not eaten lunch.

IncidentSummary: It was raining and as the IE stepped out of doghouse, left ankle twisted upon stepping on 4 X 4 boar
IncidentDescription: It was raining and as the IE stepped out of doghouse, left ankle twisted upon stepping on 4 X 4 board that had been put in front of the door.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to left ankle after stepping on wet 4 X 4 board that had been put in front of dog house door.

IncidentSummary: IE slipped on a board that was being used to stay out of mud, while walking from floor to catwalk to
IncidentDescription: IE slipped on a board that was being used to stay out of mud, while walking from floor to catwalk to lay one joint of tubing down. The IE struck hip against racking board which had 2 X 2 angle around it.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hip after slipping on muddy board while walking from rig floor to catwalk to lay down one joint of tubing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/operator, trough
IncidentDescription: While laying down a joint of pipe into pipe wrangler trough, pipe wrangler operator accidentally hit wrong control and trough almost hit employee who was going to unlatch elevators.

IncidentSummary: Hand was starting to rig down bypass line off of the shaker skid and open top. Weld broke on the ope
IncidentDescription: Hand was starting to rig down bypass line off of the shaker skid and open top. Weld broke on the open top bracket allowing the 6" bypass pipe to fall on the employee. Employee caught it as it hit him across the upper thighs. The weight pushed him backwards and down hitting his tailbone area against a piece of 1" square tubing.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to upper thighs from unsecured pipe.

IncidentSummary: IE was stepping up on the base of the Rotaflex unit to close the locking pin on the BOP and left leg
IncidentDescription: IE was stepping up on the base of the Rotaflex unit to close the locking pin on the BOP and left leg slipped on the concrete. The IE landed on both feet and did not strike against anything or fall to the ground. The IE felt a slight discomfort to lower left side of hip area.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back after slipping on concrete while standing on Rotaflex to close locking pins on the BOP rams.

IncidentSummary: Driver was travelling to the Victoria shop and following the GPS directions. The GPS said to make a
IncidentDescription: Driver was travelling to the Victoria shop and following the GPS directions. The GPS said to make a right turn onto Stubbs School Rd. He had too much speed going into the turn and the crane rolled over onto the driver side, slamming the boom on the road. Truck cab is totaled. Status of crane boom TBD. Citation issued for unsafe speed.
InjuryDescripti: Crane truck rolled over on driver's side and IE reported a scraped nose and left arm and soreness in left lower back and hip.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/manlift
IncidentDescription: While cleaning the sub structure with manlift the employee was attempting to maneuver the man lift into the desired position. As he was doing this the manlift slipped off the end of matting boards onto the metal cellar cover.

IncidentSummary: Three hands were on the floor to take off Kelly hose and Alco valve. They put the catline on the hos
IncidentDescription: Three hands were on the floor to take off Kelly hose and Alco valve. They put the catline on the hose and the Driller picked up the hose. When they removed the Kelly hose and valve, they both fell and struck the IE on the left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left foot after being struck by Kelly hose and Alco valve as the Driller picked up on the hose while tripping out.

IncidentSummary: Crew was spotting base beam, connecting a steel line into wellhead and locating BOP bolts and connec
IncidentDescription: Crew was spotting base beam, connecting a steel line into wellhead and locating BOP bolts and connections for hydraulic hoses when Rig Supervisor, Chris Villalobos noticed that the IE was not in the work area. He checked the doghouse and found the IE stretching his back and drinking water. Stated he was having slight back spasms and feeling some tingling in the fingers.
InjuryDescripti: Slight heat exhaustion while helping crew spot base beam and connect steel line into well head.

IncidentSummary: Crew was attempting to unset the packer and they were given a water break while Rig Supervisor, Joe
IncidentDescription: Crew was attempting to unset the packer and they were given a water break while Rig Supervisor, Joe Molina, was on the brake handle finishing making pipe wrench connection to work pipe. BHP consultant, Derick Powell informed Joe Molina that the IE needed to be transported to the hospital because while walking away from the cooling trailer, the IE laid down on the ground and was complaining of cramps to stomach area and both hands.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced stomach and hand cramping while walking from the cooling trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS hydraulic rams
IncidentDescription: The rig hand was informed that we were bumped up and he shut in the well. Rig crew said we were shut in and pressure was at zero. After pack-off and grease unit pressure was bled down, a large amount of pressure and gas began to release from the top of the grease head. Rig hand re-opened the well head and we ensured we were bumped up all the way, the the well head was closed again. The ram was closing all the way at this time. The escaped pressure caused almost one barrel of crude to spill on location. The wireline tools were inspected and no damage was found. It was determined the rams hadn't closed all the way causing the wellhead to remain open.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure release/making up toolstring
IncidentDescription: While making up tool string near wellhead, one of the rig hands was connecting the hydraulic hoses from the accumulator to the hydraulic ram. After he had connected the hoses, he opened the well to test the connections and a large amount of pressure was released. After about 10-15 seconds of uncontrolled release of gases and crude, the well was shut back in.

IncidentSummary: IE left location and was traveling on Hwy 72 when he began to smell a water leak. The IE pulled off
IncidentDescription: IE left location and was traveling on Hwy 72 when he began to smell a water leak. The IE pulled off the highway and climbed up on the passenger's side tire to inspect the radiator. As the IE was climbing down, he slipped and struck back, head, and backside on the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to back, head and backside after slipped off passenger side tire while climbing down after checking radiator for a leak.

IncidentSummary: IE was exiting sleeper cabin after a three-hour nap. The IE exited forward with three points of cont
