IncidentDescription: IE was exiting sleeper cabin after a three-hour nap. The IE exited forward with three points of contact but right ankle buckled inwards when it touched the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle upon exiting sleeper cab.

IncidentSummary: MISS plug and perf - pressure
IncidentDescription: After pumping frac stage #13 on Well #1, the hydraulic valve was shut in before all pumps were shut down. The resulting pressure blew a 9500 psi and 9800 psi burst disk. The burst disk unit is located 12' from WL unit P-01. Iron is rated to 10,000 psi work pressure.

IncidentSummary: MISS plug and perf - blown valve
IncidentDescription: While pumping frac stage 17 on the Kiteley #1, a 2" valve on the bleed off manifold blew out. Cross linked fluid and frac sand blew out for about 30 seconds in the direction of WL unit P-01. The well was shut in and the frac crew cleaned up as much of the fluid as possible.

IncidentSummary: MISS free point, back off
IncidentDescription: Crew was doing a pipe recovery job and was down hole at 10,200 ft. Company man, Hector Rodriguez, was on the rig floor with rig crew torquing pipe to fire string shot. Hector Rodriguez gave Hazael Dominguez, Wireline Engineer, the come-up signal. As he started coming up hole, the rig hand grabbed the wireline above the sheave wheel. Hazael stopped the winch, but not before he could get his hand out of the way. His finger was slightly pinched inside the impact glove. He was able to pull his hand out with no injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/body placement
IncidentDescription: While tailing in a stand of drill pipe, hand lost grip on rope and stand swung across the rig floor...no one was struck.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/near trip-fall
IncidentDescription: Hand was walking through substructure area when he caught his toe on double stacked matting boards and nearly tripped. He did not fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got struck by ST-80 while tripping pipe, employee walked between stump and ST-80.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/tag line, boatswain chair
IncidentDescription: While lifting man in boatswain's chair, the tag line got snagged up in a notch in top drive and pulled tight before hoist operator stopped.

IncidentSummary: While making up stands in the derrick, employee was taking off a thread protector when it slipped ou
IncidentDescription: While making up stands in the derrick, employee was taking off a thread protector when it slipped out of his hand. Thread protector had some OBM inside of it and it hit the ground splashing back into his face and under his safety glasses.
InjuryDescripti: While handling thread protector containing oil-based mud, employee lost grip and thread protector hit the ground causing OBM to splash into employee's eyes (under safety glasses) resulting in irritation/inflammation to the eyes.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While working on the mud pumps, employee went to close the 4" on the mud pump. Employee slipped and
IncidentDescription: While working on the mud pumps, employee went to close the 4" on the mud pump. Employee slipped and lost his footing and hit himself on his nose with he valve handle causing a laceration to his nose due to his safety glasses.
InjuryDescripti: Employee lost his footing and hit himself on the nose against valve handle resulting in laceration to nose from the safety glasses he was wearing.

IncidentSummary: While employee was working the floor tripping pipe out of hole, he started experiencing cramping in
IncidentDescription: While employee was working the floor tripping pipe out of hole, he started experiencing cramping in his legs.
InjuryDescripti: Employee began experiencing leg cramps while tripping pipe resulting in possible heat stress.

IncidentSummary: IE was using absorb pad to clean up oil and was stung by a scorpion on left thumb.
IncidentDescription: IE was using absorb pad to clean up oil and was stung by a scorpion on left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left thumb after being stuck by a scorpion while cleaning up oil around BOP.

IncidentSummary: At relief time, daylight crew was setting mousehole in rotating mousehole. Relief crews relieved out
IncidentDescription: At relief time, daylight crew was setting mousehole in rotating mousehole. Relief crews relieved out and Jeremy stayed to help them finish the job trying to be helpful. The bushing puller slipped out of one side swinging up and hitting employee in the stomach/groin area.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to stomach/groin area when employee was struck by bushing puller during rig operations.

IncidentSummary: As the crew was rigging down at 4:30 pm after working in temps up to 95 degrees since starting work
IncidentDescription: As the crew was rigging down at 4:30 pm after working in temps up to 95 degrees since starting work at 7:00 am, the IE felt cramping in stomach and hands. He started feeling better and continued working. After leaving the location for the 90-mile drive back to Laredo, the IE started cramping again.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping in stomach and hands while rigging down after working in temps of 95 degrees.

IncidentSummary: While unloading tires from bed of truck, IE felt a pop or pull in elbow. Finished unloading and drov
IncidentDescription: While unloading tires from bed of truck, IE felt a pop or pull in elbow. Finished unloading and drove to Ft. Morgan for the next job. There was never any swelling.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right elbow while unloading tires from bed of truck.

IncidentSummary: Our driver was traveling north and a blue vehicle was traveling towards him in the southbound lane.
IncidentDescription: Our driver was traveling north and a blue vehicle was traveling towards him in the southbound lane. Another vehicle attempted to pass the blue car and struck our driver's side mirror. The mirror came through the the open window and struck him in the jaw.
InjuryDescripti: Struck on the jaw by driver side mirror after mirror was struck by oncoming vehicle.

IncidentSummary: Crew had finished second well of the day and crew was rigging down. IE and Keith Ledet were placing
IncidentDescription: Crew had finished second well of the day and crew was rigging down. IE and Keith Ledet were placing 10-feet-long pieces of 3" OD 5K lubricator on the crane bed for transport to shop. The joint of lubricator slipped out of Keith's hands and fell towards the ground, causing the opposite end to go up and wedge the IE's left arm between crane bed and lubricator.
InjuryDescripti: Small laceration to left arm after it was wedged between crane bed and lubricator when lubricator slipped while being loaded.

IncidentSummary: IE and two other employees were taking a trailer with used guns to the scrap bin. The IE was not in
IncidentDescription: IE and two other employees were taking a trailer with used guns to the scrap bin. The IE was not in the correct position as they lifted the second gun up and left arm was pinched between scrap bin and used gun.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture wound and bruising to left arm when it was caught between used gun and scrap bin as gun was being lifted into bin.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging up equipment with rig hands and started to cramp in back and rib cage area.
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging up equipment with rig hands and started to cramp in back and rib cage area.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping in back and rib area while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: Hand had just finished making hook and was getting ready to build a stand in the mouse hole. Hand wa
IncidentDescription: Hand had just finished making hook and was getting ready to build a stand in the mouse hole. Hand was putting rabbit (pipe drift) into the pipe. and his thumb got caught between the pipe drift and the joint of the pipe in the catwalk. Hand was wearing impact gloves. At the time after incident hand was complaining his thumb was sore.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was handling pipe and got right thumb caught between drift pipe and joint of pipe resulting in contusion to right thumb.

IncidentSummary: The rig was at half mast and the IE was going to pick up block. When the IE hit the clutch, the doub
IncidentDescription: The rig was at half mast and the IE was going to pick up block. When the IE hit the clutch, the double side clip broke. This caused the brake handle to shoot upwards and strike the right forearm and wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right forearm and wrist after being struck by brake handle after the double side clip broke.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/dropped object, keeper pin
IncidentDescription: The crew was attempting to set the pack off assembly. They were in the process of lowering the pack off assembly through the BOP with a joint of pipe that was in the elevators. Because of the tight fit the driller was pushing the pack off assembly through the annular with the top drive. As the pack off cleared the annular the joint of pipe fell five feet to the elevators. Upon impact the rear pin on the elevators bounced upwards allowing the elevators to open from the back and the pipe fell 10-15 feet until the pack off landed.

IncidentSummary: IE was backing TIW valve out of tubing and Operator was picking up another stand. The stand was not
IncidentDescription: IE was backing TIW valve out of tubing and Operator was picking up another stand. The stand was not caught while it was swinging into the floor and struck the IE on the left hand that was between tubing and cheater pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand after the stand swung out and struck the hand that was between the tubing and cheater pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken (flying)  hammer head
IncidentDescription: While an employee was hammering up 10-02,  the hammer head broke off and landed about five feet from a Halliburton crew member.

IncidentSummary: While running casing, employee started to feel week and "woozy".
IncidentDescription: While running casing, employee started to feel week and "woozy".
InjuryDescripti: Employee began to experience symptoms of heat stress while rolling casing.

IncidentSummary: Floor hand, Casey Burkett and the IE were at the well head rigging down. Casey had the rig floor han
IncidentDescription: Floor hand, Casey Burkett and the IE were at the well head rigging down. Casey had the rig floor hanging up against the derrick with one winch line and lowered the second winch line down to the IE to attach to the stripper head. Casey was looking down at the IE as the IE attached the winch to the stripper head. Casey then activated the wrong winch line connected to the floor, causing the line to break and the floor the fall and strike the IE.
InjuryDescripti: Fractures to vertebra in lower back after being struck by rig floor after wrong winch line was activated while rigging down.

IncidentSummary: While pulling tool string back using both hands with a tool hook and walking backwards on the catwal
IncidentDescription: While pulling tool string back using both hands with a tool hook and walking backwards on the catwalk, the IE slipped on the catwalk and fell backwards. The IE placed right hand back to break fall and held on to the hook with the left hand. As the IE fell back, the tool string went back the other direction, straining the arm. Catwalk was greasy and IE says he has fallen several times before with no injury.
InjuryDescripti: Allegedly strained left arm after slipping on catwalk while walking backwards and pulling tool string back with a tool hook using both hands.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling tubing with crew and at 10:00 AM shut down and took a break until 10:15 AM. At 12 the
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling tubing with crew and at 10:00 AM shut down and took a break until 10:15 AM. At 12 they shut down for lunch at went back to work around 12:30 PM. The IE stomach started cramping after lunch and the Rig Manager was notified.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced stomach cramping after eating lunch. Crew had been pulling tubing all morning in the heat.

IncidentSummary: MISS forklift alternator (KN)
IncidentDescription: Rock Vasquez was lifting generators with the forklift and moving them to a covered area when he smelled electrical smoke. He stopped and inspected the engine compartment and saw smoke coming from the alternator.

IncidentSummary: A 3 1/2 X 6' pup joint was standing on top of the blind rams, with cat line still attached, after it
IncidentDescription: A 3 1/2 X 6' pup joint was standing on top of the blind rams, with cat line still attached, after it had been picked up off the floor. Rig supervisor had one hand on the pup joint and the other on the back of the elevator. As the elevator was being lowered, the collar hung on the inside lip of the elevator, causing the elevator to flip up. The IE already had both hand on the ears to latch the elevator when it flipped and caught right index finger between the elevator on the bale.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained fracture to right index finger after it was caught between elevator and the bale when the collar hung on the inside lip of the elevator and flipped.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS disconnected lanyard
IncidentDescription: While threading wing half on tool guide of lubricator, the lanyard caught the wing. The operator disconnected the lanyard and dropped the tool guide.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on rig floor, lost footing and fell to the rig floor. IE said he was OK. IE continued
IncidentDescription: IE was working on rig floor, lost footing and fell to the rig floor. IE said he was OK. IE continued working for 45 minutes until tour was finished. While changing clothes in the dog house a small scrape was noticed on right hip and right elbow.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right elbow and hip after slipping and falling on rig floor while running tubing.

IncidentSummary: IE was working floors and began to feel overheated. IE took a break and drank water in the dog house
IncidentDescription: IE was working floors and began to feel overheated. IE took a break and drank water in the dog house at 1:00 PM. He resumed working and at 2:30 PM began having cramps and was removed from the rig, placed in the dog house with A/C and drank water and Pedialyte.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping while working on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pad holders
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe in the hole, we hit a bridge causing top drive to get into a bind, breaking off a few of the buggy bolts. 3 pad holders fell out.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken sledge hammers
IncidentDescription: The intern was trying to knock a hammer union loose on goat head and broke several sledge hammers just below hammer head.

IncidentSummary: MISS stumbled with perf gun
IncidentDescription: Employee was carrying a shot 5-barrel perf gun from the tool stands to the tall breakdown stands by the trailer and stumbled as he stepped off the concrete pad.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/wrench
IncidentDescription: While tightening up dognut on drill line, employee was pushing on wrench when it slipped; could of gotten fingers mushed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/keeper, pin
IncidentDescription: While going up the off-driller's side stairs, noticed a keeper missing on one side of the pins.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got hand and arm pinched between 2 joints of rolling casing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/worn hose
IncidentDescription: While making connection with ST-80 employee noticed hydraulic oil seeping from hole in a hose that had been wearing out.

IncidentSummary: MISS laying down tools
IncidentDescription: Floor hand was in the way while they were laying down tools.

IncidentSummary: While tripping out of hole, a split was found in the tubing and two joints were dry. The tubing star
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole, a split was found in the tubing and two joints were dry. The tubing started pulling wet and it was assumed to be water. After five joints were pulled, water turned green with a strong odor. Rinsed off in shower on location. Water was tested and found to have a pH equal to vinegar.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to right arm and abdomen after coming in contact with chemicals after water turned green and had a strong odor while pulling joints.

IncidentSummary: While tripping out of hole, a split was found in the tubing and two joints were dry. The tubing star
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole, a split was found in the tubing and two joints were dry. The tubing started pulling wet and it was assumed to be water. After five joints were pulled, water turned green with a strong odor. Rinsed off in shower on location. Water was tested and found to have a pH equal to vinegar.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to right arm and abdomen after coming in contact with chemicals after water turned green and had a strong odor while pulling joints.

IncidentSummary: While mixing lime in the hopper, a gust of wind blew lime under safety glasses into his right eye.
IncidentDescription: While mixing lime in the hopper, a gust of wind blew lime under safety glasses into his right eye.
InjuryDescripti: Right eye irritation when a gust of wind blew lime under safety glasses of employee who was mixing lime in hopper area.

IncidentSummary: While employees were making a connection, he and the other floorhand tossed in the slips toward the
IncidentDescription: While employees were making a connection, he and the other floorhand tossed in the slips toward the rotary table and the slips failed to make it into the bowl. They fell backwards and the handle of the slips smacked the employee on the knee.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was handling slips when the slip handle struck him resulting in contusion to right knee.

IncidentSummary: Employee was rolling casing and had been drinking water throughout the morning. He started to puke u
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was rolling casing and had been drinking water throughout the morning. He started to puke up the water he was drinking and started to feel light headed and dizzy.
InjuryDescripti: While running casing, employee began to experience symptoms of heat stress.

IncidentSummary: The IE tripped on a rock while picking up tubing bails and left ankle twisted and was struck by bail
IncidentDescription: The IE tripped on a rock while picking up tubing bails and left ankle twisted and was struck by bails.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after tripping on rock and getting hit by tubing bails being picked up.

IncidentSummary: MISS swing arm shaft
IncidentDescription: It appeared that the 1' squeeze gun did not fire so Clint McCollough was mentally preparing to come to the surface with a live gun. The gun had fired so they started to rig down. The junior operator was holding tension on the line while the excess cable was being spooled on the drum. Clint thought he pushed the lever to neutral but increased it instead. The pack off and cable head sucked into the measuring head and then pulled the measuring head and swing arm off the mounts and into the front wall of the logging cab. Logging cab was not significantly damaged but swing arm will need to be replaced.

IncidentSummary: IE was doing normal housekeeping around the well and started to get mild cramping in the arms and wa
IncidentDescription: IE was doing normal housekeeping around the well and started to get mild cramping in the arms and was told to take a break. Replenished electrolytes with Gatorade and 1 oz of Bob's pickle potion. The IE felt nauseous upon leaving cooling trailer and thought the Gatorade might have been consumed to quickly. Sat out rest of the day in cooling trailer.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping of arms and nausea while cleaning up work area.

IncidentSummary: MISS cement pallet
IncidentDescription: Employee was unloading a pallet of cement from pickup truck and twelve cement and water fell to the ground.

IncidentSummary: Nick Brown was breaking down a gun string on the Stromberger Extraction pad. While unscrewing barrel
IncidentDescription: Nick Brown was breaking down a gun string on the Stromberger Extraction pad. While unscrewing barrels from the subs, the IE's gloves were falling off so he removed them and continued working. The IE reached down with the left hand to grab a gun barrel and cut it on the raised metal on the scallop from the shape charge.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand after striking against raised metal in the scallop from the shape charge while reaching form spent gun. IE's gloves were falling off so they had been removed.

IncidentSummary: Hand was cleaning HPU, stepped out to the ground and felt sharp pain on outside of left knee.
IncidentDescription: Hand was cleaning HPU, stepped out to the ground and felt sharp pain on outside of left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Possible knee strain when employee unevenly on the ground after cleaning HPU.

IncidentSummary: Crew had moved to a new location that morning and rigged up and started tripping pipe out of the wel
IncidentDescription: Crew had moved to a new location that morning and rigged up and started tripping pipe out of the well. The heat index was 104. The IE became light headed and sat in cooling trailer and hydrated.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced mild heat exhaustion while tripping out of well in temperatures with 104 degree heat index.

IncidentSummary: Crew had killed the well and was in the process of removing Kelly hose to install back pressure valv
IncidentDescription: Crew had killed the well and was in the process of removing Kelly hose to install back pressure valve. A 3rd party employee from Cactus Wellhead was on the manlift removing Kelly hose when it slipped out of his hands and fell about 6 feet. The IE was struck on the hardhat by the union as he stood outside the flowline area.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to head, while wearing hardhat, after being struck by the union when 3rd party employee in manlift dropped the Kelly hose.

IncidentSummary: The crew was hydro-testing in the hole with 2 7/8 EU pipe and were on the 20th stand. As the operato
IncidentDescription: The crew was hydro-testing in the hole with 2 7/8 EU pipe and were on the 20th stand. As the operator picked out of the slips they turned. The IE had the tubing tongs at chest level and kicked the ear of the slips to center them. The IE went to grab the up/down lever, but grabbed the tong engage lever instead. The tongs head engaged and bit below the collar of the stand. The tongs came down and the pipe bowed. The tong heads released and the tubing tongs popped back up and the shift lever on the tubing tongs grazed the IE's upper lip and nose. A joint of pipe was damaged.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip and nose after being struck by the shift lever on the tubing tongs when the wrong lever was engaged.

IncidentSummary: Crew was building and racking back 4" stands for the lateral. Injured employee was removing thread p
IncidentDescription: Crew was building and racking back 4" stands for the lateral. Injured employee was removing thread protector on a joint of pipe while the trough was being retracted to get another joint when the weld broke on the base of the main cylinder. The trough was about 2 feet back from the forward most position when the weld broke allowing the trough to fall forward freely to the rig floor. The trough struck the injured employee in the left arm and side forcing him forward into the off drillers side tongs. The employee was checked over and has pain in his left side and arm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusions to multiple body parts as a result of a loose trough striking the injured employee and causing him to strike up against tongs; bruising to lower back, left arm and left wrist.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Two derrickhands were disarming the rotary table, releasing a pin with a 10 lbs hammer, when one of
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Two derrickhands were disarming the rotary table, releasing a pin with a 10 lbs hammer, when one of them hits the pin with the hammer, it shoots out hitting the left hand of the other derrickhand.
InjuryDescripti: Injured employee's left middle finger fractured when it was struck by a flying pin which had been loosened by another employee striking the pin with a 10 lb hammer.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking a grease head down that was on a tool stand by the well head. He and Wade Vanwinkle
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking a grease head down that was on a tool stand by the well head. He and Wade Vanwinkle each had a pipe wrench on opposite sides of the tool. The IE's wrench did not bite hard enough and slipped when Wade spun his wrench. The grease head fell and struck the IE on the left pinky toe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left pinky toe after wrench slipped off grease head causing grease head to fall on left foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/weighted cable
IncidentDescription: During a trip hand was watching drag chain and noticed the weighted cable was coming out and no good to be fixed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/drill screen
IncidentDescription: While running elevators up to latch up a stand of drill pipe with the drill screen hanging off a safety cable looped around the head, with the wind blowing the screen drifted under the diving board and tagged causing it to flip the screen upside down allowing it to to fall out of its loop and fall to the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was making a connection with power swivel. While removing thread protector, drift tool came down
IncidentDescription: IE was making a connection with power swivel. While removing thread protector, drift tool came down and protector glanced IE's right hand when it was knocked off.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand after it was struck by thread protector after it was knocked off by drift tool while making connection with power swivel.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down, IE missed while attempting to whip crown on rig hooks. Cable swung back and weig
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, IE missed while attempting to whip crown on rig hooks. Cable swung back and weight of the cable knocked the IE off the walkway and upper back struck the handrail box attached to rig walkway on the way down.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to upper back after falling off walkway and striking against handrail box when crown cable missed rig hooks and swung back, causing him to lose balance.

IncidentSummary: MISS Orlando Rivera stairs (AL)
IncidentDescription:
Ee was descending down the stairs from the rig floor when he lost his footing and had the potential to fall approximately 7 feet 
from ground level.

IncidentSummary: IE had been stretching hoses out from accumulator to BOP's and at 1:00 PM informed Rig Manager sweat
IncidentDescription: IE had been stretching hoses out from accumulator to BOP's and at 1:00 PM informed Rig Manager sweating was slowing down and he was okay but going to the cooling trailer to re-hydrate. Rig Manager checked on him 5 minutes later and the IE stated he was okay. At 1:15 PM the crew shut down form lunch. At 1:40 PM the IE walked out of the cooling trailer complaining of lower back cramps but did not want to call XtremeMD. Mac Alvarez was on location dropping off rig supplies and took the IE back to the Kenedy yard.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced lower back cramps and reduced sweating while stretching out hydraulic hoses from accumulator to BOPs.

IncidentSummary: Fortino Ramirez and the IE were using a pry bar to remove a body that was stuck from the BOP. The ba
IncidentDescription: Fortino Ramirez and the IE were using a pry bar to remove a body that was stuck from the BOP. The bar slipped an caught the IE's left index finger between the bar and the body.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained cut to left index finger after it was caught between pry bar and body of BOP.

IncidentSummary: The employee was in the process of rigging down the festoon lines in preparation for rig move. The r
IncidentDescription: The employee was in the process of rigging down the festoon lines in preparation for rig move. The rig had walked away from the pits around 100 feet and portable festoon extension lines we brought in to carry the junction box to the rig. The weight of the lines and the distance from the pits was causing the junction box to pull back towards the pits so the crew placed a ratchet strap on the junction box and attached it to the sub. The injured employee was attempting to remove the ratchet strap. Once the tension was taken off the ratchet strap the junction box moved and caught the employee between it and the pillar brace for the festoon extension. The employee was able to free himself from between the two objects.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was caught between a loosened junction box which caught him between it and the pillar brace resulting in a contusion to the chest.

IncidentSummary: Bryant was rolling casing. At one point he started getting dizzy and he went and sat in the forklift
IncidentDescription: Bryant was rolling casing. At one point he started getting dizzy and he went and sat in the forklift with the fan to cool down. Bryant started throwing up. 10 minutes later he went to get the thread protectors off of the catwalk. One of the thread protectors fell to the ground. When he bent over to pick up the thread protector, he lost his balance and fell to one knee. After this, Bryant came to the Rig Manager's office to report not feeling well. (Bryant said he was consuming a bottle of water an hour)
InjuryDescripti: Possible heat exhaustion during regular drilling operations.

IncidentSummary: While employee was walking across a muddy K-brace inside the sub while rigging down, he slipped and
IncidentDescription: While employee was walking across a muddy K-brace inside the sub while rigging down, he slipped and fell 3 feet to the ground. landing on his feet. While doing so, he scraped his shin on the lower flange of the K-brace, landed with his right foot slightly sideways.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right shin when employee slipped off muddy K-brace and fell, scraping against the K-brace's flange.

IncidentSummary: The employee was in the process of rigging down the rig in preparation for the upcoming move. After
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: The employee was in the process of rigging down the rig in preparation for the upcoming move. After stopping all the crew members for a safety meeting, the employee began to complain of cramping in his legs and arms. He stated that he felt he had drank plenty of water but also commented that he had not eaten anything since breakfast at 5 AM.
InjuryDescripti: Employee displayed symptoms pf possible heat stress during rigging down operations.

IncidentSummary: The IE and Mando Barranco were under the mixing tank area removing a butterfly valve with an actuato
IncidentDescription: The IE and Mando Barranco were under the mixing tank area removing a butterfly valve with an actuator attached. While removing the valve, they had instructed Oscar Sepulveda to close the valve up in the control panel. When the valve closed, it fell and struck the IE on the left upper cheek and glasses.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left cheek after being struck by the butterfly valve on the mixing tank after it fell while being closed.

IncidentSummary: MISS pump- down well
IncidentDescription: Crew had completed job and was rigging down. Company man asked if they could pump 40 bbls down the "D" well. They already had swedge with 1502 iron tied into top of well. Our crew connected the 1502 iron to their iron and started psi test of 0-1000 psi. Then, if good, would go to 1000-3000 psi. The 0-1000 psi test was fine, but when they started the 1000-3000 psi test the swedge, 2-90's and 1-10' 1502 iron, flew up in the air and pulled the threads off the swedge.

IncidentSummary: Floor hand has a sprain elbow from the motion of setting the slips in after connection; displaying s
IncidentDescription: Floor hand has a sprain elbow from the motion of setting the slips in after connection; displaying symptoms of tennis elbow. Employee indicated that he felt his elbow "pop".
InjuryDescripti: While tripping out of hole and setting slips, employee began to experience symptoms of tennis elbow.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/forklift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee using forklift almost backed into a cement tank. Employee didn't check surroundings first before moving forklift.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/drill pipe, body placement
IncidentDescription: While placing drill pipe on pipe wrangler, employee almost got struck by rolling pipe.

IncidentSummary: Installing choke flex line to mud tanks, using 2 forklifts. 1 forklift to hold the line up, the othe
IncidentDescription: Installing choke flex line to mud tanks, using 2 forklifts. 1 forklift to hold the line up, the other to help push the line to the flange. Josey was holding the ring gasket in place, using teflon tape, to keep his fingers clear. The second forklift operator was flagged to boom out to line up the bolts to the flange. As the forklift operator boomed out to fast, caused the bolt to glance off the flange. The bolt went upwards striking Josey's middle finger. The bolt scrapped the skin on his finger.
InjuryDescripti: While working on connecting choke hose, employee's right middle finger was pinched when they attempted to stab flanges together, resulting in abrasion(s) to right middle finger.

IncidentSummary: Employee was working the floor while tripping pipe. In the process of tripping pipe they were using
IncidentDescription: Employee was working the floor while tripping pipe. In the process of tripping pipe they were using the mud bucket. When they were putting on the mud bucket the handle to the bucket got caught inside of the bucket. The injured employee told the other hand to stop but didn't hear him and proceeded to close the mud bucket while the injured employee was getting the handle out. This caused IE to lose grip of the handle and his hand got caught between the handle and the door to the bucket. His little finger on his left hand was caught in the bucket.
InjuryDescripti: While handling mud bucket, lost grip on mud bucket handle resulting in laceration to left pinky finger as it got caught between bucket and a door.

IncidentSummary: Employee was in the process of taking apart the cathead enable manifold. He was working on loosening
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was in the process of taking apart the cathead enable manifold. He was working on loosening a check valve on the manifold that was difficult to loosen. He had placed a wrench on the check valve and was hitting it with a hammer to attempt to get it to loosen. As he was doing this he impacted his hand in between the wrench and the hammer. He received a laceration to the part of his hand between his thumb and index finger of his left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand (between thumb and forefinger) after being caught between wrench and hammer while trying to loosen valve on a manifold.

IncidentSummary: After making up bit, bit and die stand was set on floor to remove bit breaker. Weather got bad, oper
IncidentDescription: After making up bit, bit and die stand was set on floor to remove bit breaker. Weather got bad, operation was stopped for 1 hour. Then went to pickup and start in hole. Stand swung away from hole, employee put his hands around stand to stop it and his right hand was caught between 8" mud motor and ST-80.
InjuryDescripti: While handling stand, right hand was caught between stand and ST-80 resulting in contusion.

IncidentSummary: Crew had just finished rigging up when IE started experiencing cramping in the right arm. Rig Superv
IncidentDescription: Crew had just finished rigging up when IE started experiencing cramping in the right arm. Rig Supervisor, David Rodriguez, told the IE to cool off in the doghouse and drink pickle juice and water. The IE was told not to return for the remainder of the shift.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping in right arm after rigging up in extreme heat.

IncidentSummary: The IE was helping another employee unload rig-up pads off the tool truck, slipped, fell and the rig
IncidentDescription: The IE was helping another employee unload rig-up pads off the tool truck, slipped, fell and the rig-up pad landed on top of lower left leg.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left leg when rig-up pad fell on it after slipping and falling while carrying it.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing night cap and tubing sub when and while pulling on a 36-inch pipe wrench to loosen i
IncidentDescription: IE was removing night cap and tubing sub when and while pulling on a 36-inch pipe wrench to loosen it, left shoulder muscle was strained.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder while removing night cap and tubing sub with a 36-inch pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: Crew was preparing pump #10 for pressure testing. They had opened the required valves to conduct th
IncidentDescription: Crew was preparing pump #10 for pressure testing. They had opened the required valves to conduct the test. As the IE attempted to open the discharge valve with the valve bar it slipped, causing the IE to lose balance, fall backwards and strike left shoulder against test stand skid.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder after valve bar slipped, causing IE to fall backwards and strike against test stand skid.

IncidentSummary: MISS slip/fall Josh Ruiz
IncidentDescription: As Josh Ruiz was laying down tools, he slipped and stopped his fall with his arm. He did not fall all the way down on the wooden catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pressure washer, body placement
IncidentDescription: Employee almost got sprayed by diesel pressure washer while around shakers.

IncidentSummary: MISS Wireline truck steps
IncidentDescription: Back steps on Wireline truck are slanted, not level. The steps were slippery and caused employee to slip and fall into the truck bumper.

IncidentSummary: Josh Harper and the IE were unloading a gun from the belly of the line truck. As they pulled the gun
IncidentDescription: Josh Harper and the IE were unloading a gun from the belly of the line truck. As they pulled the gun out, the IE's hand was caught between the gun and the bumper of the truck.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right hand after it was caught between gun being unloaded and bumper of truck.

IncidentSummary: The crew was preparing to slip and cut a bad spot in the drill line. Chad had a 5 foot bar in his ha
IncidentDescription: The crew was preparing to slip and cut a bad spot in the drill line. Chad had a 5 foot bar in his hand to guide the drill line. The 3rd party forklift operator was signaled to pull the slack out of the drill line. He was looking back to make sure his path was clear. While in movement, the drilling line rubbed against the sub door and swung against the 5 ft bar into Chad's upper arm and shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: A sub door struck employee in the right shoulder resulting in minor abrasion(s).

IncidentSummary: When making a connection a joint of 4" drill pipe rolled across the catwalk. IE walked down to the c
IncidentDescription: When making a connection a joint of 4" drill pipe rolled across the catwalk. IE walked down to the catwalk to push the 4" joint back into the trough. While fighting the pipe into the trough, he felt a pop in his lower back, as well as sharp stings in the back afterwards.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to lower back while employee was attempting to roll pipe into trough.

IncidentSummary: After two runs the crew was on standby from 10:00 AM until 2:00 pm, and the IE had been in the truck
IncidentDescription: After two runs the crew was on standby from 10:00 AM until 2:00 pm, and the IE had been in the truck eating a snack. Third run with the pefr gun was from 2:30 to 3:15 PM. Crew rigged down at 3:15 PM and the IE started feeling hot and tired and had cramping. The IE wasn't feeling well enough to drive so Trenton Woodard drove the truck back. On the ride back the IE started feeling nauseous. Next day the IE was fine.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramps and nausea after working in heat.

IncidentSummary: IE was travelling in the passenger seat of the logging truck on the way to location. While reaching
IncidentDescription: IE was travelling in the passenger seat of the logging truck on the way to location. While reaching for a drink on the dash, middle right finger caught the grab bar on the a-pillar and bent backwards and to the side. The IE quickly pulled hand back and said "Ouch." The IE immediately informed Dan Schmidt that his finger had almost been jammed. Once they arrived at the location the pain level was at zero.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right middle finger while reaching for a drink on the dashboard of the logging truck after it caught the grab bar on the a-pillar and bent backwards.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped (flying) hammer
IncidentDescription: Intern was in a man basket hammering up 1002 when hemmer flew out of his hands and landed in cellar.

IncidentSummary: IE stopped on Hwy 76 and bent down to check tires on the truck. The IE felt a tightness on right sid
IncidentDescription: IE stopped on Hwy 76 and bent down to check tires on the truck. The IE felt a tightness on right side of back after straightening back up. Drove to Love's Truck Stop and still had the pain after getting out of the truck and could barely stand up straight to walk. Clint asked the IE if he was OK because he looked pale. Drove to location in pain and back continued to stiffen.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to back upon straightening up after checking tires on vehicle.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling gun
IncidentDescription: Stopped at 500' and shifted to 2nd gear POOH. Shut in the well and bled off. While lowering the gun to verify shots, the truck jumped out of 2nd gear and the gun fell about 8', hitting the ground about 1.5' from pump down's 2" iron and fracs 4" main lines.

IncidentSummary: IE was connecting pump lines and breaking down well head and started to feel light headed. IE sat in
IncidentDescription: IE was connecting pump lines and breaking down well head and started to feel light headed. IE sat inside crew truck to cool down.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced a feeling of being light-headed while connecting pump lines and breaking down well head in high heat and humidity.

IncidentSummary: Rock Vasquez was approached by Operator, Ramon Quevado, who informed him that IE was inside the dog
IncidentDescription: Rock Vasquez was approached by Operator, Ramon Quevado, who informed him that IE was inside the doghouse with body chills. Rock spoke to the IE who refused medical attention. He cooled off in his personal vehicle and returned to work after 20 minutes with no further issues.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced body chills while hanging rods on horse head in high heat and humidity.

IncidentSummary: Rock Vasquez noticed IE leaning on flow line and the IE told him that his sides were hurting. Rock t
IncidentDescription: Rock Vasquez noticed IE leaning on flow line and the IE told him that his sides were hurting. Rock took the IE to the doghouse to cool off. The IE wanted to return to work after 20 minutes but was told to continue to rest and cool off in the doghouse because it appeared the IE was still cramping.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced cramping while hanging rods off horse head in extreme heat and humidity.

IncidentSummary: MISS Blocked Crane Pedal
IncidentDescription: Crane Operator got into crane when he sat down to turn on the main power and crane started to scope in.

IncidentSummary: IE was swatting a fly with a towel and grazed right index finger knuckle on setting tool.
IncidentDescription: IE was swatting a fly with a towel and grazed right index finger knuckle on setting tool.
InjuryDescripti: Slight abrasion to right index finger after striking against setting tool while swatting at a fly with a towel.

IncidentSummary: The crew was picking up 2 7/8" tubing with the laydown machine when IE pinched right index finger be
IncidentDescription: The crew was picking up 2 7/8" tubing with the laydown machine when IE pinched right index finger between the elevators and the pipe. IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right index finger after it was caught between elevators and pipe being picked up with lay-down maching.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While standing outside the doghouse, an employee noticed a swollen red rash on the IE's forehead. Th
IncidentDescription: While standing outside the doghouse, an employee noticed a swollen red rash on the IE's forehead. The IE stated the rash had been there the day before, but was getting better. The IE noticed a burning sensation after placing a rag on the forehead to cool off. IE stated that it could be poison ivy.
InjuryDescripti: A red and slightly swollen rash on forehead from an unknown cause.

IncidentSummary: IE was loading sources on truck and hand slid over something sharp on inside of truck side compartme
IncidentDescription: IE was loading sources on truck and hand slid over something sharp on inside of truck side compartment. A layer of skin was scraped off IE's index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to index finger after striking against something in truck side compartment.

IncidentSummary: The AC unit inside the PD trailer was dripping water due to high humidity. Jeremy Metcalfe and the I
IncidentDescription: The AC unit inside the PD trailer was dripping water due to high humidity. Jeremy Metcalfe and the IE loaded a 13' - 3 3/8" gun on a dolly, secured it with a chain vise that was welded to the dolly. They had pushed it halfway through the PD trailer ramp and the IE noticed the dolly was going too fast. The IE look back to see that Jeremy had slipped on the water and fallen to his knees. The IE tried to regain control of the dolly, but it was going too fast and it couldn't be stopped. The dolly fell on its side and as it landed, struck the IE on the top part of the left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of left foot after dolly being used to move gun started moving down the ramp too fast causing it to fall over and strike foot.

IncidentSummary: While the derrick was laid over, IE was on the pipe fingers taking the board off the mast when he wa
IncidentDescription: While the derrick was laid over, IE was on the pipe fingers taking the board off the mast when he was struck in the leg by one of the pins used to pin the board. The pin on the off-driller's side had been hammered out to the tapered part, and they were unable to remove it further so they began to work on the last pin on the driller's side. As they were loosening the last pin, the forklift operator began to manipulate the board to align the pin holes so the pin could be removed. During this operation the pin that was previously loosened was pushed out and struck the employee in the left leg across the thigh, knee, and calf.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee and general area after a loosened pin struck the IE during dismantling procedures for the racking board.

IncidentSummary: Barrett was in the cellar and grabbed the nightcap from matting board and went to put on wellhead an
IncidentDescription: Barrett was in the cellar and grabbed the nightcap from matting board and went to put on wellhead and in doing so got his finger pinched under cap.
InjuryDescripti: Right middle finger pinched as IE was placing nightcap on wellhead resulting in a laceration to finger.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/elevators
IncidentDescription: While coming down with the top drive to latch onto the drill pipe in the stump, hands working the floor did not get elevators pushed back far enough. causing elevators to stack out on tool joint face.

IncidentSummary: IE was installing A140s and port plugs. Rotated gun to be able to work on top part and rubber roller
IncidentDescription: IE was installing A140s and port plugs. Rotated gun to be able to work on top part and rubber roller rolled out from under the tail end of the gun and it hit the table and slid off. Right hand was caught between the table. port plug and gun.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right hand when it was caught between table, port plug and gun when the gun being loaded rolled off the table as it was rotated.

IncidentSummary: IE pulled into driveway of the shop and rolled left ankle while stepping out of truck.
IncidentDescription: IE pulled into driveway of the shop and rolled left ankle while stepping out of truck.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after rolling it while getting out of truck at the shop.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing on a ladder to replace a transmission hose on DFP #10. The IE lost his balance while
IncidentDescription: IE was standing on a ladder to replace a transmission hose on DFP #10. The IE lost his balance while coming down the ladder and fell about two feet, landing with all the weight on his prosthetic leg. The IE was helped up by co-workers.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee after losing balance on ladder and falling two feet to the ground while changing transmission hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/OMB, body placement
IncidentDescription: While changing shaker screens employee almost got covered in oil base mud; employee didn't check to see if all covers were closed.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/forklift
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee using big forklift almost dumped all casing protectors on the ground, employee almost struck trailer and personal truck while dumping casing protectors in trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling wireline tools
IncidentDescription: Pressure was bled off the well. There was two feet of slack in the wireline so when the 1002 connection was knocked off, the tool string wouldn't be at the top of the lubricator while it was moved from the well. Once they were off the well, the wireline entry guide was installed and the employee noticed the tool string was not dropping. He signaled to lead operator to make sure the tool trap was open and there was no pack off pressure applied. While doing that, the tools released and fell, causing the cable head to be shock loaded and cause the tools to fall out of the lubricator. Top of gun string stayed within lubricator.

IncidentSummary: The crew was coming out of hole with rods. The floor hand put the rod tongs on the rods to break co
IncidentDescription: The crew was coming out of hole with rods. The floor hand put the rod tongs on the rods to break connection. When the tong operator engaged the tongs, the tongs swung around and hit the IE in the shin. IE refused medical attention and continued working. He signed a medical treatment waiver (attached).
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shin after being struck by the tongs after they were engaged by the Operator.

IncidentSummary: After coming out of well from previous RIH, IE and another employee laid the tool string down, disas
IncidentDescription: After coming out of well from previous RIH, IE and another employee laid the tool string down, disassembled tool string and then carried next tool string to stands for next RIH. IE then sat in the truck to get rest until the next run started and felt an ache in the left shoulder. IE thought it was normal aches. IE was released from duty and went home to get some sleep. The IE woke up later in the morning and left shoulder was in pain. IE informed the District Manager. The tool string consisted of 5 3.125" x 2' perforating guns and a Baker E-4 style #10 setting tool. The weight of the tool string was approximately 165 pounds.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder after carrying tool string which consisted of 5 3.125" x 2' perforating guns and a Baker E-4 style #10 setting tool. The weight of the tool string was approximately 165 pounds.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped out of plug shoot trailer onto step and then onto a large piece of scoria on the ground.
IncidentDescription: IE stepped out of plug shoot trailer onto step and then onto a large piece of scoria on the ground. IE rolled ankle and fell to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after rolling it and falling to ground when stepping on a large piece of scoria while exiting the plug shoot trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was carrying a pump in sub across location using left arm. The sub slipped and the IE attempted t
IncidentDescription: IE was carrying a pump in sub across location using left arm. The sub slipped and the IE attempted to catch it with right hand before the sub hit the ground. The IE felt right shoulder pop because of the twisting motion made. The IE did not report it and didn't think it was a major issue.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder when carrying tools across location. Heard a pop in shoulder.

IncidentSummary: Employee was in the process of removing the hopper on Rig 55 as it was to be transferred to Rig 52.
IncidentDescription: Employee was in the process of removing the hopper on Rig 55 as it was to be transferred to Rig 52. After the employee removed the base screws he was attempting to maneuver the hopper and lost control of it. The hopper was top heavy and became unstable, causing it to fall over. This resulted in the employee trying to stop the hopper from falling and injured the middle finger of his left hand, between the hopper and a grading stand.
InjuryDescripti: Possible crush injury to middle finger, left hand as employee was trying to dismantle hopper during regular rig repair.

IncidentSummary: Crew was preparing to repair BOP.
IncidentDescription: Crew was preparing to repair BOP.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee after foot got caught under pipe stand while carrying lube to trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS re-entry guide placement
IncidentDescription: The day crew hung the lubricator re-entry guide by a strap so they would not have to bend over in the manlift to pick it up and screw it on. Coming off the far well, the re-entry guide got hung up on  a candy cane. The crane operator and manlift operator did not catch it in time to stop the operation. The re-entry guide broke off the strap and fell to the ground.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing oily tape with a pocket knife and cut left arm.
IncidentDescription: IE was removing oily tape with a pocket knife and cut left arm.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right arm after pocket knife being used to cut oily tape slipped.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/ST-80, body placement
IncidentDescription: While making a connection, hand turned his back to ST-80 while still standing in its path (not a pinch point). ST-80 operator stopped and told the hand to move before he got struck in the back by machine.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/knife
IncidentDescription: While cutting open a sack of dry chemicals, hands knife snagged up on bag and he jerked it through the cut almost striking himself with the blade, which is a retractable safety knife but not functioning properly due to trash inside blade.

IncidentSummary: IE was stacking spent perforating guns on a pallet when one of the guns fell off the pallet and stru
IncidentDescription: IE was stacking spent perforating guns on a pallet when one of the guns fell off the pallet and struck the right foot above the steel toe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after being struck by a spent perforating gun when it fell off pallet as it was being stacked.

IncidentSummary: A weight bar-CCL fell off work stand and struck IE on top of right foot, behind steel toe, as the IE
IncidentDescription: A weight bar-CCL fell off work stand and struck IE on top of right foot, behind steel toe, as the IE was trying to connect to perforating gun.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after being struck on top of right foot, behind steel toe, by a perforating gun when it fell off the stand while making up gun string.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping the tool hand get his tools out of the back of his truck. As the IE was pulling a jar
IncidentDescription: IE was helping the tool hand get his tools out of the back of his truck. As the IE was pulling a jar out it slipped, causing right pinky finger to be smashed between jar and a metal beam in the back of the truck. The IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion/crush to tip of right pinky finger after jar slipped and finger was caught between it and a metal beam in the back of the truck.

IncidentSummary: John tried to break out a nipple and a camlock from a brass valve in order to use them again to fix
IncidentDescription: John tried to break out a nipple and a camlock from a brass valve in order to use them again to fix the drain hose for the mud bucket. No luck trying to remove the valve with pipe wrenches. Started to use a hack saw to cut the brass valve off, this was taking considerable time so started to use a cut off wheel an an electric grinder. While cutting the ball valve in an upright position the grinder kicked. When the grinder kicked his hand slipped off of the side grip and the cut off wheel cut the first two fingers (Index finger and the middle finger) on his right hand.
InjuryDescripti: While cutting ball valve, grinder kicked and hand slipped resulting in cuts to index and middle fingers of right hand.

IncidentSummary: Employee was repairing an electrical plug that contained various small pin like prongs. As IE was pr
IncidentDescription: Employee was repairing an electrical plug that contained various small pin like prongs. As IE was pressing the prongs thru the electrical plug, the plug slipped and caused the prong to puncture IE's left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left thumb while making repairs to an electrical plug.

IncidentSummary: IE's left index finger was pinched in the umbrella swivel while rigging down on driller's platform.
IncidentDescription: IE's left index finger was pinched in the umbrella swivel while rigging down on driller's platform.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left index finger after it was caught between swivel on umbrella while rigging down on driller's platform.

IncidentSummary: IE was lifting a gun off the bench and pulled a muscle in the back.
IncidentDescription: IE was lifting a gun off the bench and pulled a muscle in the back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to upper back while lifting gun string off bench.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking down the Shorty setting tool from the tool string and began to stroke it. After the
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking down the Shorty setting tool from the tool string and began to stroke it. After the 6th time, right hand slipped in the setting sleeve, cutting right middle finger tip. IE was wearing cotton gloves, but the process of stroking setting tool made the gloves slippery.
InjuryDescripti: Avulsion of right middle finger when hand slipped in the setting sleeve while stroking the setting tool.

IncidentSummary: IE was struck in the mouth when a loop that was stuck on a hose being untangled freed up. IE lost fr
IncidentDescription: IE was struck in the mouth when a loop that was stuck on a hose being untangled freed up. IE lost front two veneers.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to mouth after being struck by hose being untangled when loop freed up. Lost 2 veneers.

IncidentSummary: IE was unloading dry cement bucket out of trailer and stacking on pallet in shop.
IncidentDescription: IE was unloading dry cement bucket out of trailer and stacking on pallet in shop.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to abdomen, groin, area while unloading bucket of dry cement from trailer and stacking on pallets in the shop.

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying down tubing and got forklift to slide pipe rack on one end. IE was at the other end
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down tubing and got forklift to slide pipe rack on one end. IE was at the other end when one side slid off and struck top of left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot when pipe rack slid off forklift while being moved.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was picking up the safety valve from the rig floor to install it onto the pup joint. The IE lost
IncidentDescription: IE was picking up the safety valve from the rig floor to install it onto the pup joint. The IE lost footing while stepping onto the rig floor, fell forward, and jammed right thumb while attempting to stop fall by bracing right hand against rig floor.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right thumb while trying to break fall with right hand after slipping while stepping onto the rig floor to pick up safety valve.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling the plunger on #1 mud pump suction module number #2. While he was using a pry bar, it
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling the plunger on #1 mud pump suction module number #2. While he was using a pry bar, it slipped, causing him to hit his right knee on the pump shed floor. He had both feet on the floor when he slipped.
InjuryDescripti: IE was using a pry bar when the pry bar slipped causing him to hit his right knee on the shed floor resulting in a contusion.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/dog nut
IncidentDescription: Rig crew and rig manager was in the process for slip and cut drill line when they pulled the cover off the dog nut and removed the drill line from the drum, they discovered that the dog nut had been installed backwards.

IncidentSummary: Employee struck by third party drill collar.
IncidentDescription: Employee struck by third party drill collar.
InjuryDescripti: While picking up BHA, employee was struck by third party drill collar resulting in head trauma.

IncidentSummary: Dump baler had been run down hole and had come back to surface full of sand. Pressure washer on rig
IncidentDescription: Dump baler had been run down hole and had come back to surface full of sand. Pressure washer on rig wasn't working so crew left baler suspended off to the side. They were shaking the out the sand clumps from the baler when one of the employees grabbed a wood-handled squeegee and was using it to knock the sand from the bottom of the baler. The IE was holding the baler at an angle when the handle came out of the bottom of the tool and was rammed into the IE's face. It was deflected by the safety glasses, but the IE did get a black eye and a small cut from the safety glasses.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion, black eye, after being struck by the wooden handle of the squeegee after it came off while using it to knock sand off baler.

IncidentSummary: While testing, tubing going in the hole burst a joint. To break it out, the tubing weight was set on
IncidentDescription: While testing, tubing going in the hole burst a joint. To break it out, the tubing weight was set on slips with stiff arm unpinned and 36" pipe wrench was put on top joint to break joint with tongs biting on bottom joint. Wrench slipped and tongs bumped the IE on the left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder after being stuck by tongs when 36" wrench being used to break joint slipped.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The racking seals had been set to that the racking boards could be placed on top. One of them needed
IncidentDescription: The racking seals had been set to that the racking boards could be placed on top. One of them needed to be straightened, so the IE attached the catline to the rod on the seal and told Juan, the operator, to tighten up on the catline. When he did, the IE did not move right hand off the catline and rod and right ring finger was caught between catline, rod and wood boards.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger after it was caught between catline, rod and wood boards when hand wasn't moved after giving the operator the okay to tighten up on the catline.

IncidentSummary: Job being performed was to remove the transportation pins before raising the sub. Driller: Driller
IncidentDescription: Job being performed was to remove the transportation pins before raising the sub. Driller: Driller was controlling the remote, which consisted of using the MRC (Manipulating Raising Cylinder) button (set to manual mode). He was moving the button Up and Down to line up the pad eyes that hold the transportation pins. While he held the button in the UP position the sub did not move. Then he moved the button to the Down position and also noticed that the sub did not move. He did these same steps a total of 3 times. The 4th time that he move the button to the UP position the pad eyes to the inside transportation pin broke causing a load sound. Due to the pad eyes breaking, caused stored energy, causing the sub jerk. When the sub jerked 2 hand rails located on each side of the V door came out of the anchor base. One of these hand rails (Driller side) brazed against an employee's (Ramiro Soto) right shoulder and right fore arm (No signs of abrasions nor lacerations).
InjuryDescripti: IE was lightly grazed on the right arm and right shoulder by a dislocated handrail during rigging up operations.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down, the IE and VIctor Lirette, were laying down the gamma gun and perforating assemb
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, the IE and VIctor Lirette, were laying down the gamma gun and perforating assembly. As the IE was about to set the tool string down onto the lubricator stand, Victor slid the stand toward the IE so that the stand was closer to the end of the tool for proper balance. The IE continued down with the tool at the same time the stand slid under left index finger and pinched it between the tool and the stand. They were wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left index finger after it was pinched between tool and stand while setting the tool string down on the lubricator.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/pipe, wrangler
IncidentDescription: Picking up a joint of 5" drill pipe with wrangler, employee did not realize that his left hand was touching the skate lever. So when the catwalk was in the vertical position, employee then realized the skate was pushing pipe out of the trough. Employee stopped immediately when he saw pipe sticking out from trough. With the sudden stop of the wrangler the pipe tilted over landing on V-door. (Employee was wearing impact gloves while running catwalk, not being able to feel that his hand was on the lever).

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/SRL cable, lever
IncidentDescription: The rope securing the SRL on the driller side of the rig floor was tied to a hose coming off the valve bank for the mast winch controls. The wind must have either blown the rope around the lever and pulled it to the up position were it stayed or someone inadvertently move it pulling the SRL down and it stuck because the handle was stiff. When the driller cut the HPU on the winch, winch started retracting. It picked the swing arm for the TDS cables that run down the back of the mast to the Drillers cabin up approximately 6' before he could get it shut down. This resulted in the bands securing the cables to break and the winch line becoming pinched in the sheave so that the arm couldn't be lowered back down. No one was on that side of floor when it happened It could have resulted in equipment damage, or had it parted the cables there might have been a voltage release or falling objects.

IncidentSummary: Employee was tightening valve on the landing joint, valve was tightening up and still had half a tum
IncidentDescription: Employee was tightening valve on the landing joint, valve was tightening up and still had half a tum to go. Employee wrenched hard on the valve and the pipe wrench slipped causing him to fall forward towards conductor scraping left knee and bruising left hand on the well head.
InjuryDescripti: While tightening valve, IE overwrenched -- the pipe wrench to slipped -- causing him to fall forwards resulting in abrasions to left knee and left hand on the well head.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging up pump line to the tank. It was about eye level when the pump line slipped out of th
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging up pump line to the tank. It was about eye level when the pump line slipped out of the IE's hand and grazed nose.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to nose after being struck by pump line when it slipped while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped off the back of the wireline truck onto uneven ground and twisted right ankle.
IncidentDescription: IE stepped off the back of the wireline truck onto uneven ground and twisted right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after stepping on uneven ground upon exiting wireline truck.

IncidentSummary: Pressure tester slid, hit collar and crushed right middle fingertip between collar and other piece o
IncidentDescription: Pressure tester slid, hit collar and crushed right middle fingertip between collar and other piece of pressure tester.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger after it was caught between pressure tester collar and another piece of the pressure tester.

IncidentSummary: Moved on location and rigged up unit then rigged down tree and installed BOP. Just got off job where
IncidentDescription: Moved on location and rigged up unit then rigged down tree and installed BOP. Just got off job where they were running 2 7/8" tubing. Changed BOP's, slips and tong dyes to run 2 3/8" tubing. Employees overlooked changing the elevator to 2 3/8". They pickup up first joint from the ground and tubing slid through 2 7/8" elevator and struck IE on the hard hat/head.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to top of head after being struck by a joint of 2 3/8" tubing when it slid through 2 7/8" elevator.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The IE got oil base on his face when they unscrewed the test plug from the drill pipe. He cleaned oi
IncidentDescription: The IE got oil base on his face when they unscrewed the test plug from the drill pipe. He cleaned oil base from face and some from his left ear and finished his shift.When he woke up for his next shift he noticed that his hearing on his left ear was muffled and when he cleaned it with a Q-tip it had oil base residue on it. He told the pusher and the pusher gave him some ear flush to clean his ear.
InjuryDescripti: IE was splashed by oil-based mud while well-testing resulting in some OBM getting in his left ear.

IncidentSummary: IE was injured while trying to remove the choke line. The crew had attached a lifting sling to the c
IncidentDescription: IE was injured while trying to remove the choke line. The crew had attached a lifting sling to the choke line and stuck it around the fork of the forklift. Mike was inside the sub near the MRC and was guiding the choke line out so the flange didn't hang up on the sub. As the forklift operator was backing out and lifting the choke line, the sling slipped off the end of the fork and the choke line fell pinning Mike between the choke line and MRC.
InjuryDescripti: IE was struck by choke line flange, pinning him to the sub cylinder resulting in contusion to right side torso.

IncidentSummary: MISS improper guy line tie-off (AL)
IncidentDescription: Employee walked on top of draw works on rig to tie off mid-section of guy line. Stop Work Authority was put in place and employee was asked to get off top of draw works.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling tool string
IncidentDescription: Release tool failed to hold tool string up. When release tool broke, bottom on tool string broke and tool string fell to the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS tool string - bump-up process
IncidentDescription: Engineer was picking up tool string to bring into lubricator and attach onto well. He was lifting tool string to top of lubricator without following the proper bump process and pulled tool string into top of hub. He was not able to stop in time and pulled out of rope socket.

IncidentSummary: Crew was running 2 7/8 PH6 Tubing in the well. They had picked up a stand of tubing with MYT slip-
IncidentDescription: Crew was running 2 7/8 PH6 Tubing in the well. They had picked up a stand of tubing with MYT slip- type elevators. The Derrick man had latched the elevators around the pipe and the MYT elevators picked the tubing up off the ground before they got to the upset / collar. When this happened, the derrick man hollered to the operator to stop and lower the pipe back down so he could re-latch the elevators. As the operator began lowering the pipe back down to the ground, the IE who was standing on the ground next to the racking boards, reached out to stab the pipe back on the racking boards. As he did this, the stand of tubing slipped within the MYT elevators and fell approximately 18-24" to the ground, landing on top of the IE's steel toed boot.
InjuryDescripti: Trauma to toes of right foot after being struck by falling 2 7/8 PH6 tubing after it slipped out of the racking boards while attempting to stab it back.

IncidentSummary: IE was building perf guns and felt a strain in the right wrist while tightening a screw on the charg
IncidentDescription: IE was building perf guns and felt a strain in the right wrist while tightening a screw on the charge carrier.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right wrist while tightening a screw on the charge carrier while building a per gun.

IncidentSummary: Employees were installing the rod back-off tool. As the IE turned a 24" pipe wrench to get a better
IncidentDescription: Employees were installing the rod back-off tool. As the IE turned a 24" pipe wrench to get a better view, it slipped, striking above right eyebrow/safety glasses.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration above right eyebrow after 24" wrench being used to turn rod back off tool to get a better view slipped.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was getting out of the mast unit, P-42, and stepped on a big rock that hidden in tall grass.
IncidentDescription: IE was getting out of the mast unit, P-42, and stepped on a big rock that hidden in tall grass.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after stepping on large rock hidden in tall grass while stepping out of mast unit.

IncidentSummary: IE was pounding in a floating piston, looked outside, missed the piston and smashed hand and pinky f
IncidentDescription: IE was pounding in a floating piston, looked outside, missed the piston and smashed hand and pinky finger against the cylinder.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left pinky finger after striking it while pounding in a piston into a cylinder.

IncidentSummary: The rig electrician had been contacted to troubleshoot a drawworks motor that was malfunctioning. Af
IncidentDescription: The rig electrician had been contacted to troubleshoot a drawworks motor that was malfunctioning. After trouble shooting the motors the electrician had decided to replace the inverter for the drawworks motor in the VFD. The power was shut off and lock out from the generator to the inverter, however, the inverters are equipped with a capacitor that stores electricity. The electrician then attempted to dissipate the energy by shorting it across the positive and negative circuits. The electrician then tested the circuit between the positive and negative leads and had a 0 reading for voltage. As he placed his wrench on the bolt to remove the fuses he received an electric shock and fell to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Employee received an electrical shock while checking inverter.

IncidentSummary: The IE banged right elbow on catwalk while walking beside the catwalk and carrying the pipe bucket t
IncidentDescription: The IE banged right elbow on catwalk while walking beside the catwalk and carrying the pipe bucket to put on pipe. The crew completed the connected and shut down to circulate the well. When they got to the dog house the IE noticed the elbow had started to swell.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right elbow after striking it against the catwalk while walking beside it carrying a pipe bucket.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving overshot and felt pain in lower back.
IncidentDescription: IE was moving overshot and felt pain in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while moving overshot on the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: The Baker 20 setting tool was laid down on stands on ground in front of PD trailer. The IE flipped t
IncidentDescription: The Baker 20 setting tool was laid down on stands on ground in front of PD trailer. The IE flipped the bleeder tool around so it could bleed off. The day before when they used the bleeder tool, it cracked the disk and then punctured it, but they thought it would work fine. The IE twisted the thread part of the bleeding tool and it started to sound like it was releasing pressure. Suddenly, it stopped. The IE started to remove the bleeding tool. There was no change in pressure. The IE tightened it back and then removed it to see if it would remove the pressure. The IE did what Jeremy (Lead Operator) showed him, which is to use Allen wrench to puncture the disc to released pressure. The bleeder tool went up and slammed right hand. Pressure was too much and couldnGt keep hand on it. The bleeder tool is damaged and was brought to the shop.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand, pinky finger, after being struck by released pressure and by Baker 20 setting tool.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down, the IE smashed right index finger while carrying a setting sleeve. The sleeve wa
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, the IE smashed right index finger while carrying a setting sleeve. The sleeve was smashed against the pump down trailer, catching the finger.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right index finger after it was caught between setting sleeve being carried and pump down trailer.

IncidentSummary: IE was bent over pushing the cable head into two weight bars while another employee was turning the
IncidentDescription: IE was bent over pushing the cable head into two weight bars while another employee was turning the tool string. The cable head started turning and torquing up. The IE remembers telling him to stop, being hit by a pipe wrench and another employee asking if he could tell him how many fingers he was holding up.
InjuryDescripti: Concussion/trauma to left temple after being struck by pipe wrench when another employee using it to make up tools strings lost control of it.

IncidentSummary: The IE was installing a mud line and while swinging the sledge hammer to tighten the union discomfor
IncidentDescription: The IE was installing a mud line and while swinging the sledge hammer to tighten the union discomfort was felt in the right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder while swinging sledge hammer to tighten up hammer union on mudline.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped out of mud tank, slipped and rolled foot.
IncidentDescription: IE stepped out of mud tank, slipped and rolled foot.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left foot after slipping and rolling foot while stepping out of mud tank.

IncidentSummary: IE was using the out-house when a 3rd party transport semi ran into roll-off dumpster and pushed it
IncidentDescription: IE was using the out-house when a 3rd party transport semi ran into roll-off dumpster and pushed it into the out-house, squeezing the IE tightly inside before it came to a stop.
