InjuryDescripti: Trauma/crush injury to torso after out-house being used was crushed and drug by roll-off dumpster that was struck by 3rd party transport semi.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing outside out-house by roll-off dumpster when 3rd party transport semi caught dumpster
IncidentDescription: IE was standing outside out-house by roll-off dumpster when 3rd party transport semi caught dumpster and drug it into IE.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to torso after being struck by roll-off dumpster after it was struck and drug by 3rd party transport semi.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing curtain from back of gun trailer and scraped finger on sharp metal.
IncidentDescription: IE was removing curtain from back of gun trailer and scraped finger on sharp metal.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right middle finger after striking against sharp metal on gun trailer while removing curtain.

IncidentSummary: IE came into the shop after days off and informed manager of pain in back and neck. Manager asked wh
IncidentDescription: IE came into the shop after days off and informed manager of pain in back and neck. Manager asked when this had happened and the IE said he couldn't pinpoint an exact date but back had been hurting a lot after work for a period of time. After days off it would get better, but after starting a hitch, the pain would return. The IE said he had been working extra hard since the crew usually consists of himself and an extra hand to operate the crane. The IE feels the excess of work has been accumulating and causing the extra pain. Due to the lack of help, he has had to lift heavy tools, such as the setting tool, rig up equipment and guns. He has to work harder for longer hours.
InjuryDescripti: Strain/pain to upper back and neck which has accumulated due to lifting heavy tools for extended periods with a lack of help over a period of time, in his opinion.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling on a wire when it slipped out of the pliers, snapped back and punctured the inside of
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling on a wire when it slipped out of the pliers, snapped back and punctured the inside of the left forearm near the inside of the elbow.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to inside of left arm near elbow when wire slipped out of pliers while re-heading.

IncidentSummary: IE was in man basket unscrewing lubricator from wellhead to switch from junk basket/gauge ring to th
IncidentDescription: IE was in man basket unscrewing lubricator from wellhead to switch from junk basket/gauge ring to the packer. After lowering man-lift down back to ground the IE stepped out onto a 2" hose and turned right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after turning it on 2" hose while stepping out of man-lift.

IncidentSummary: The IE slipped while climbing into the back of the truck to pull the BOP into the bed and felt a str
IncidentDescription: The IE slipped while climbing into the back of the truck to pull the BOP into the bed and felt a strain in the upper back near the shoulder blades.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to upper back while loading BOP into back of truck.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/keeper pin, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While making a connection, a keeper pin fell to the floor. The job was stopped until we found where it came from. The employees found that the keeper was used for a secondary retention for the drill pipe screen; it was not installed properly on the safety cable.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/hobble, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: Driller was sending the elevators up to the derrick hand to latch up a stand of drill pipe to put in the mouse hole. The elevator horn hit the end of the diving board causing the elevators to pull down and stretch the hobble. The hobble snapped in half and both sections fell to the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/hobble, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While making a connection out of derrick the employee was latching a stand drill pipe in the elevators.  As the elevators were being latched  is when the hobble broke and the bottom piece holding the horn of the elevators fell to the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was assisting another employee in carrying a box of bolts and nuts from the festoon and upon step
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: IE was assisting another employee in carrying a box of bolts and nuts from the festoon and upon stepping down from the skid, he felt a slight strain in his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back strain when employee was stepping down from wire festoon.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking across mud pits by the shakers to go and check the choke manifold. On his way by the
IncidentDescription: IE was walking across mud pits by the shakers to go and check the choke manifold. On his way by the shakers, he slipped on diamond plate flap that has oil base on it. As he caught himself with his left arm, he jammed his left wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Left wrist strain as employee was walking across mud pits area, slipped on oil-based mud covered floor plates.

IncidentSummary: IE was popping 0-rings off and screw driver slipped ans struck palm of left hand.
IncidentDescription: IE was popping 0-rings off and screw driver slipped ans struck palm of left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand after screw driver being used to remove o-rings slipped.

IncidentSummary: IE had picked up a 1502 elbow and was moving it off the well cellar grating and stepped into a 10" x
IncidentDescription: IE had picked up a 1502 elbow and was moving it off the well cellar grating and stepped into a 10" x 10" hole in the grating. This caused the IE to fall and strike right knee against the edge of the grating.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right knee after stepping into a 10" x 10" opening in grating, falling and striking knee against edge of grating.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/nipple valve, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: The 2" Nipple coming off of the rotating head had backed out due to vibrations.   Which caused it to fall to the ground.  A Employee coming from the backyard noticed it and immediately notified the Driller.

IncidentSummary: Employee was spooling up slack in cord at end of catwalk, when he grabbed the cord resulting in a mi
IncidentDescription: Employee was spooling up slack in cord at end of catwalk, when he grabbed the cord resulting in a mild electrical shock.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was spooling up slack in cord at end of catwalk when he grabbed the cord resulting in a mild electrical shock.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/hose & nipple, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While pressure testing with third party testers there test sub was screwed into top drive to test back to the pumps. Where there nipple threads into the Test Sub is where it blew off with 5000 psi on the line. The whip check was tied from sub nipple to test hose causing the hose and nipple to strike side of derrick. As per standard procedure, no one was on the rig floor while the testing was going on.

IncidentSummary: Employee was driving the forklift to move a diesel pump to a frac tank. As he was getting off the fo
IncidentDescription: Employee was driving the forklift to move a diesel pump to a frac tank. As he was getting off the forklift, he stepped crooked on a dry rut from previous rain caused him to twist his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Employee stepped off forklift into dry rut from previous rain resulting in strain to right ankle.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped tool
IncidentDescription: After a successful gun run, the gun was back up in the lube and lube was bled off quickly. The lube was picked up about 2', the tool guide put on, tool trap opened, and tool lowered to see the setting sleeve come out of the bottom of the lube. As the crane was booming up and line was being let out, the tool dropped 15' to the ground. The top of the tool stayed in the lubricator so it did not tip over.

IncidentSummary: IE was laying 2-3/8" tubing down on ground on a home-made catwalk to slide tubing, and using trough
IncidentDescription: IE was laying 2-3/8" tubing down on ground on a home-made catwalk to slide tubing, and using trough to slide tubing from floor. Instead of picking the end of pipe up that was on the trough, the IE decided to kick it off the trough. This resulted in a joint of pipe landing on the left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot after being struck by joint of pipe that he kicked off the trough instead of picking it up.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Employees were fixing a red tag Baker and had it about one foot in the air in a vise, when it came l
IncidentDescription: Employees were fixing a red tag Baker and had it about one foot in the air in a vise, when it came loose and fell on the IE left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot after being struck by red tag Baker that fell out of vise from about one foot in the air.

IncidentSummary: Crew member was taking clusters off tool string when it slipped from his hands and landed on the IE'
IncidentDescription: Crew member was taking clusters off tool string when it slipped from his hands and landed on the IE's right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after clusters being taken off tool string by another employee slipped out of their hands.

IncidentSummary: IE felt something in lower back while lowering ramp on pump-down trailer. At first it didn't hurt an
IncidentDescription: IE felt something in lower back while lowering ramp on pump-down trailer. At first it didn't hurt and then while walking, began to feel pain.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while lowering ramp on pump-down trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS toe frac
IncidentDescription: Well finished pressure test and it was starting on toe frac. Liberty was taking rate and just spotted acid. Wireline crew was hooking up their gun and in the process of arming gun when a greenish liquid was noticed spraying our from below the master valve. It turned out to be the acid that was just spotted. Liberty finally shut down the frac, but not before gallons of it sprayed out all over about a 25-foot radius. All affected wireline had to be cut off are re-headed and wellhead torn apart.

IncidentSummary: MISS coming off well with lubricator-Extraction
IncidentDescription: When lubricator was lifted off well, water shot out and then upward about five feet. Frac ground employee got on the radio to tell blender operator to shut off his boost. Before the boost was shut down, Wireline Operator, Rogelio Acevedo's leg was drenched with frac fluid.

IncidentSummary: Employee was pulling in a back 5 1/2Gǥ stand. It came back too fast and he tried to stop it, pinching
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling in a back 5 1/2Gǥ stand. It came back too fast and he tried to stop it, pinching a finger between the stand and the back rail where the tail rope is tied.
InjuryDescripti: While pulling back pipe, finger got caught between stand and back rail resulting in laceration to left ring finger.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/ladder, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While removing floor plates and handrails on rig floor, a gust of wind blew over a ladder and fell through where floor plates were removed and fell to the ground. No equipment damage or injuries.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/catwalk
IncidentDescription: While laying down drill pipe the catwalk trough was brought up to the rig floor when the operator stopped the trough, it  still came forward more than usual. That is when the operator saw that both main beams on the main arm of the catwalk were broken.

IncidentSummary: Driver was SB on I-25 travelling between 50-60 mph. As he was going down the hill, driver ahead tapp
IncidentDescription: Driver was SB on I-25 travelling between 50-60 mph. As he was going down the hill, driver ahead tapped his brakes and our driver let off the accelerator. The Jake brakes kicked on and the trailer started to slide left, he corrected and it slid to the right. This repeated several more times before the truck slid off the interstate and rolled 1.5 times, coming to rest on the passenger side.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to rt side of head, left knee and shoulder after sliding off road and rolling Wireline truck 1.5 times in icy conditions.

IncidentSummary: Employee was cleaning over the shakers, when suddenly stepped on a bad placed grill and suffered a t
IncidentDescription: Employee was cleaning over the shakers, when suddenly stepped on a bad placed grill and suffered a trauma on his left foot. Doctor reviewed him. The next day due to symptoms persisted, the doctor decides to take him for a RX in Bucaramanga Hospital; the orthopedist specializing in foot trauma, diagnosed an injury of the fibula tendons.
InjuryDescripti: IE was cleaning over the shakers, when suddenly stepped on a bad placed grill and suffered a trauma on his left foot.

IncidentSummary: IE went to tighten the sand line before pulling rods. The brake bands were frozen to the sand drum a
IncidentDescription: IE went to tighten the sand line before pulling rods. The brake bands were frozen to the sand drum and as the IE clutched in the sand drum and was throttling up, the brake band came free and the brake handle struck right hand and wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand and wrist after being struck by sand drum brake handle after the frozen brake bands came free while throttling up.

IncidentSummary: Slipped on floor while tripping out of hole. Twisted knee while pushing tongs back out of the way. H
IncidentDescription: Slipped on floor while tripping out of hole. Twisted knee while pushing tongs back out of the way. Hand has pre-existing knee injury. Stopped and put knee brace on. Will continue to work and as of of this time, has no problems at this time.
InjuryDescripti: While tripping out of hole, employee twisted knee while pushing tongs back out of the way resulting in possible knee strain.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/3P, choke manifold
IncidentDescription: Super Choke hand came to rig to change transducer on choke. After he completed that, he took it upon himself to change the drill pipe pressure transducer on the stand pipe. Driller was not told and the pumps were running at 2400 psi/65 strokes. Rig manager noticed him and stopped him.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/bolt
IncidentDescription: When changing 3rd party rental elevators back to rig elevators, employee noticed bolt and nut damaged that secures elevator ears, employee found that the nut was almost completely rubbed off bolt and bolt was bent. Bolt had pre-drilled hole for safety keeper and keeper was in bolt prior to bolt getting damaged.

IncidentSummary: While grabbing a shooting panel that was stacked on top of another on a shelf about 6 feet high, the
IncidentDescription: While grabbing a shooting panel that was stacked on top of another on a shelf about 6 feet high, the panel slipped and fell and the sharp corner struck the IE's head.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to top of head after being struck by the corner of a shooting panel that slipped and fell while being taken off shelf.

IncidentSummary: Employee was working at ground level setting a floor walkway between the choke and shaker skids. He
IncidentDescription: Employee was working at ground level setting a floor walkway between the choke and shaker skids. He lost his footing and walkway came down and scrapped both leg shins.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was working at ground level setting a floor walkway between the choke and shaker skids. He lost his footing and walkway came down and scrapped both leg shins.

IncidentSummary: During the rig move, the generator #1 was being backed against the VFD house. The injured employee w
IncidentDescription: During the rig move, the generator #1 was being backed against the VFD house. The injured employee was standing on the back end of the generator skid and was holding a wooden 5' 2x4. He was using the 2x4 to hold up the generator roof flap (flap prevents rain water from contacting electrical wires located on the side wall of the VFD house) while the generator was being backed into place. During this process, the wooden 2x4 got pinched between the VFD House and the roof flap. This resulted in the wooden 2x4 to make contact with employee's mouth and chin.
InjuryDescripti: While setting the generator house, IE was using a board to lift a metal roof flap. Lost control of the board and the board hit his bottom lip resulting in contusion.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on drive line of perf. truck and was attempting to remove u-joint from the line. IE w
IncidentDescription: IE was working on drive line of perf. truck and was attempting to remove u-joint from the line. IE was holding the piece when the cap of the u-joint moved and left thumb was caught between joint and hammer.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left thumb after cap of u-joint moved while trying to remove it from the drive line and caught it between u-joint and hammer.

IncidentSummary: Prior to the accident, the drill string twisted off while backreaming and the fish fell appx. 70-80
IncidentDescription: Prior to the accident, the drill string twisted off while backreaming and the fish fell appx. 70-80 ft. We think this is what caused the batteries in the EM tool to start leaking Lithium out of them when we latched onto fish; we tripped out of the hole not knowing they were leaking or what could happen. Then when we got the last drill collar we set the IBS in the rotary table and broke out the last collar, the EM tool was about 10 ft below where we had broken the last collar out at the driller, then picked the collar up out of the box. The injured employees (2) one of them then pushed the drill collar away from the stump, putting his hand and wrist directly over the stump so the other IE could put the thread protector on. This is when the batteries ignited and both employees sustained injuries to the hand and wrist on they're(/their?) left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Chemical burns resulting from flash explosion from leaking lithium batteries while performing regular rig operations on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Prior to the accident, the drill string twisted off while backreaming and the fish fell appx. 70-80
IncidentDescription: Prior to the accident, the drill string twisted off while backreaming and the fish fell appx. 70-80 ft. We think this is what caused the batteries in the EM tool to start leaking Lithium out of them when we latched onto fish; we tripped out of the hole not knowing they were leaking or what could happen. Then when we got the last drill collar we set the IBS in the rotary table and broke out the last collar, the EM tool was about 10 ft below where we had broken the last collar out at the driller, then picked the collar up out of the box. The injured employees (2) one of them then pushed the drill collar away from the stump, putting his hand and wrist directly over the stump so the other IE could put the thread protector on. This is when the batteries ignited and both employees sustained injuries to the hand and wrist on they're(/their?) left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Chemical burns resulting from flash explosion from leaking lithium batteries while performing regular rig operations on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: IE strained his right wrist. Employee was sitting on the catwalk and handing down tools to another e
IncidentDescription: IE strained his right wrist. Employee was sitting on the catwalk and handing down tools to another employee who was working on the catwalk, after he finished handing down tools he jumped down (about 2 ft.) onto the mud boat where he slipped and as he was falling, he tried catching himself and strained his right hand/wrist area.
InjuryDescripti: While performing rig repairs, IE jumped down from about 2 ft, lost his balance, used his hands to stop his fall, resulting in a strain to right wrist.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning tool in diesel fuel wearing short chemical gloves and started to get a rash on both
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning tool in diesel fuel wearing short chemical gloves and started to get a rash on both arms. Rash started on 11/14/17 but did not inform manager until 11/16/17.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to both arms after coming in contact while cleaning tools with diesel fuel. Employee was wearing short chemical gloves.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped tool-Extraction
IncidentDescription: Crew came off the well and the lube was winched up to put on the entry guide. The tool was slowly winched down so it was visible. Since crew knew these trucks had a tendency to slip out of gear, they swung it away from the iron before dropping the tool out to verify shots. Roughly 10' above ground, employee noticed the tool picked up speed and the truck had come out of gear. The truck was put back in neutral and brakes applied. But because it was so close to the ground, the tool did hit the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling night cap/Extraction
IncidentDescription: Crew came off well with lubricator, swung over, verified shots and dropped ball. Operator, Jim Kendall, was putting the nightcap on the well and placed it on top of the flange. He was about to turn collar to start threading it to flange. Apparently, it wasn't seated well enough and the cap fell to the ground in front of the well.

IncidentSummary: IE was using a 24" pipe wrench and cheater bar to tighten gun string. As the IE applied force, pipe
IncidentDescription: IE was using a 24" pipe wrench and cheater bar to tighten gun string. As the IE applied force, pipe wrench slipped and IE fell on right knee. As the IE stood up, pain was felt in abdomen, right lower back area and right upper leg.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to rt knee, abdomen, rt lower back, rt upper leg after pipe wrench being used to tighten gun string slipped, causing him to fall on right knee.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/high pressure, cement head, dog house
IncidentDescription: While cementing liner grease insert for the dart wheel blew out of the cement head striking the dog house. The dart bumped 20 bbls early causing the cementers to pressure up to 4200 psi. Floor was clear no injuries occurred. Dog house was not damaged.

IncidentSummary: IE and another employee were moving tool string closer to the well to pick up. As they set the tool
IncidentDescription: IE and another employee were moving tool string closer to the well to pick up. As they set the tools string down on the stands, the IE felt a pop in lower back. Left leg went numb and felt like pins and needles in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Sustained strain to lower back while setting tool string on stand.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/broken wire line
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While wire line log was being performed by Gyro Data, the tool became stuck coming out of hole. Rig was cleared due to pulling tight on wire line truck. Tool freed up continuing out of hole hitting another tight spot. On this tight spot rig was still cleared from previous spot they pulled 9k into wire with wire and truck able to pull 15k safely. The wire parted halfway between floor and truck hitting wireline truck window and breaking it. On the floor side got hung up in snatch blocks so it never fell to ground. No one was close on ground or on rig that could have been close to getting injured. Wire line hands were inside truck and pickups at time of incident.

IncidentSummary: Employee was moving a valve onto the forks of the forklift, when the valve slid from its resting poi
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was moving a valve onto the forks of the forklift, when the valve slid from its resting point and struck the top of IE's left foot; he had some slight bruising on top of his foot.
InjuryDescripti: IE was moving a valve onto the forks of the forklift, when the valve slid from its resting point and struck the top of IE's left foot resulting in slight contusion.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling winch line guide - Conoco
IncidentDescription: During operations, a winch guideline  broke off, due to wind whipping it around, and fell about 80 feet to the ground. The winch line guide had broken off and caused it to fall outside the guides. When load weight was increased, the guide broke off, fell to the ground and landed about 15 feet from employees.

IncidentSummary: Hand was pushing drill pipe to the trough. His hand was above the tool joint, but his hand slipped a
IncidentDescription: Hand was pushing drill pipe to the trough. His hand was above the tool joint, but his hand slipped as he pushed the pipe to the trough. This resulted in a wicker in his right palm.
InjuryDescripti: Right hand punctured while employee was handling pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While Van was pulling dawworks power cables, after completing task several hours later he felt disco
IncidentDescription: While Van was pulling dawworks power cables, after completing task several hours later he felt discomfort and stiffness in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back strain after performing regular tasks during rig operations. This was not reported until several hours later.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/missing bolt(s), unsecured bolt(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was going to raise light plant from stowed position to upright position, before doing so he noticed that three bolts of the four bolts used to secure light plant post to the frame were missing and the only bolt left in the bracket was loose. Employee stopped rigging the light plant up and notified our HSE rep and rig manager that were on site.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/pump, unsecured equipment
IncidentDescription: While employee was in the board getting ready to put a stand of drill pipe in the mouse hole he noticed a hydraulic pump on the top of the Topdrive The hydraulic pump was used to add oil to the Topdrive and was left up there after a rig service.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/light plant, spotter
IncidentDescription: 3rd party employee almost backed into light plant; employee didn't have a spotter.

IncidentSummary: IE climbed up on fluid pump to investigate knocking noise it was making from fluid end of pump and
IncidentDescription: IE climbed up on fluid pump to investigate knocking noise it was making from fluid end of pump and may have slipped on the way down due to hand placement. IE's gloved right hand slipped from body of fluid end of pump and was pinched.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right index finger after it was pinched between plunger while checking out knocking noise coming from fluid pump.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling rig floor hand rail
IncidentDescription: While lifting tools to RIH, the wire line hooked the tool stand on the rig floor hand rail, causing it to fall to the ground.

IncidentSummary: Two employees were lowering generator from the truck to the ground and the IE felt a pain in left s
IncidentDescription: Two employees were lowering generator from the truck to the ground and the IE felt a pain in left shoulder area. IE states after incident there was no pain and later that night felt pain and reported to supervisor the next morning.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder while unloading generator from back of truck.

IncidentSummary: After the morning safety meeting, IE was attempting to remove bags from the back of the crew truck t
IncidentDescription: After the morning safety meeting, IE was attempting to remove bags from the back of the crew truck to get hardhat and felt a pop in right shoulder. IE advised supervisor and says the pain has not gotten better since the incident.
InjuryDescripti: h

IncidentSummary: The employees were changing out a rotating head. After the rotating head was changed and the bushin
IncidentDescription: The employees were changing out a rotating head. After the rotating head was changed and the bushings were pulled out of rotary table the driller came down to chest level with the rotating head. The employee grabbed the handles on the rotating head to line it up with the bowl on the BOP. When the employee grabbed the handles he suffered a puncture wound from a wicker on his right hand just below his ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: While handling stand with rotating rubber on it, employee grabbed handles which caused a wicker (splinter or shaving) to embed itself into his right hand.

IncidentSummary: Crew ran 10 triples of 3/4" rods and began removing the rod work table and installing rod shut-in to
IncidentDescription: Crew ran 10 triples of 3/4" rods and began removing the rod work table and installing rod shut-in tool to hot oil tubing. After the rod table was removed and moved to corner of rig floor, the rod shut-in tool was picked up and suspended in the air. IE lost his footing while in the process of connecting the shut-in tool to rods, due to slack in the cord that is used to secure floor piece to work floor, and landed on right hip.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hip after losing footing and falling on rig floor while connecting the shut-in tool to rods.

IncidentSummary: The IE had just changed the cutting disk on a 4" grinder being used to cut a steel handrail. The gr
IncidentDescription: The IE had just changed the cutting disk on a 4" grinder being used to cut a steel handrail. The grinder came out of the IE's hands and the disk struck lower right thigh.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thigh after disk grinder being used to cut handrail slipped.

IncidentSummary: Crew was running rods in the hole to tag parted rods with two 36" pipe wrenches, As they turned the
IncidentDescription: Crew was running rods in the hole to tag parted rods with two 36" pipe wrenches, As they turned the wrenches to the right, it torqued up and wrench released, striking the IE in the abdomen knocking him to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to abdomen after being struck and knocked down by torqued 36" pipe wrench after it released while turning rods.

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure spray
IncidentDescription: After running bailer to retrieve debris from well, crew proceeded to break the bailer apart to retrieve debris. One the connection was broken, the trapped pressure sprayed well fluid, knocking hard hats off and  getting in the mouth of the crew.

IncidentSummary: While positioning pneumatic mud bucket out back of way so they could continue to T.O.O.H. He was not
IncidentDescription: While positioning pneumatic mud bucket out back of way so they could continue to T.O.O.H. He was not using the mud bucket handles to maneuver it. As a result he pinched his right small finger, between the mud bucket and drillers side rear mast leg.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was handling mud bucket when his right pinky finger was caught between bucket and derrick mast resulting in compound fracture and laceration (and eventual amputation).

IncidentSummary: MISS clutch stuck-full throttle (AL)
IncidentDescription: While running pipe in the hole, the clutch got stuck in full throttle (open position). Derrick man latched pipe and block kept going up. Operator reacted quickly by pulling down throttle and brakes however the throttle stayed in the open position and he immediately pressed the emergency shut off button stopping the blocks.

IncidentSummary: Two employees on rig floor were hammering off transducer from stand pipe. Upon first couple of strik
IncidentDescription: Two employees on rig floor were hammering off transducer from stand pipe. Upon first couple of strikes, transducer spun evenly with hammer union, employee Carr positioned himself not to get in the way of employee swinging hammer, or struck by hammer. When employee swung hammer, bottom of hammer handle caught other equipment causing hammer to deflect up and struck Carr's fingers.
InjuryDescripti: While tripping out of hole, employee was struck by deflected sledge hammer strike resulting in laceration to right hand pinky finger.

IncidentSummary: IE was transferring gun string from the lower stand to the taller stand when the gun slipped and fel
IncidentDescription: IE was transferring gun string from the lower stand to the taller stand when the gun slipped and fell off the trailer. The gun rolled off the IE's left leg and struck left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion up top of left foot after gun string being moved from lower to upper level of stand fell.

IncidentSummary: IE was taking tools off the back of the truck bumper and a 7-foot, 200-lb weight bar rolled off the
IncidentDescription: IE was taking tools off the back of the truck bumper and a 7-foot, 200-lb weight bar rolled off the rear step and landed on left foot behind steel toe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of left foot after 7-foot, 200-pound weight bar fell off and landed behind steel toe of boot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/bolts, tab
IncidentDescription: During rig service after a slip & cut, employee found a Teflon pad that went inside the shoe on the top drive. During inspection of TDS found the tab that retains the pad inside of the shoe, both bolts were sheared off & tab was hanging by its tie wire to the top drive.

IncidentSummary: IE was in Lydia Infante's office and overextended while reaching around the chair to answer the phon
IncidentDescription: IE was in Lydia Infante's office and overextended while reaching around the chair to answer the phone, straining her back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back and left hip while reaching around a chair in the office to answer the phone.

IncidentSummary: Employee was assisting a welder who was mounting coal roll on the edges of the subs for the wind wal
IncidentDescription: Employee was assisting a welder who was mounting coal roll on the edges of the subs for the wind walls. The injured employee was holding the cold roll when a piece of welding slag dropped and landed on his left thumb. It burned through his impact glove and caused a mild burn to his left thumb. There was no blistering just mild redness.
InjuryDescripti: Mild skin inflammation to left thumb after IE's glove came into contact with hot slag during welding procedure.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken -falling vise
IncidentDescription: Taking pack-off apart in vise on back of truck when the vise came apart and fell on the floor. If this happens on the road, it can kill someone. Second similar incident witnessed in a month and third heard about.

IncidentSummary: MISS damaged top sheave
IncidentDescription: Set plug on Stage 9 with ball on the bottom of the plug to isolate from pressure below the plug. Pulled out without shooting any guns so Extraction could bleed off the well pressure above the plug in an attempt to pinpoint the location of pressure build up on the backside of the casing. The company man wanted to bleed off while coming out of the well to monitor the casing while pulling through the tool trap at surface. The plug gave out, bringing over 3000 psi up-hole and shooting the tool into the lubricator.  The tool was caught by the tool trap, but the line jumped the top sheave damaging it where it jumped.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped tools in hole
IncidentDescription: Carl was pulling out of the hole after making a free-point survey. As he approached the surface, company rep. opened the door distracted Carl when he opened the door to ask a question. Carl ran into pack off and dropped tools in the well.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking a #10 Baker setting tool off of a 2" weight bar. There was only one stand on the tr
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking a #10 Baker setting tool off of a 2" weight bar. There was only one stand on the truck so they were putting one end on the ground and breaking the side in the air. The IE was trying to size the wrench properly and the tool stand fell over and landed on the left foot behind the steel toe and on the arch.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of left foot after being struck by tool stand.

IncidentSummary: Elite tong crew was making up tubing when the tong operator engaged the tongs. The safety cable atta
IncidentDescription: Elite tong crew was making up tubing when the tong operator engaged the tongs. The safety cable attached to the tongs and derrick leg came loose and tongs struck IE in the lower back area.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after being struck by the tongs when the safety cable attached to the tongs and derrick leg came loose as the Elite tong crew engaged the tongs .

IncidentSummary: Elite tong crew was making up tubing and when the tong operator engaged the tongs, the safety cable
IncidentDescription: Elite tong crew was making up tubing and when the tong operator engaged the tongs, the safety cable attached to the tongs and derrick leg came loose and tongs struck IE on the left arm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion

IncidentSummary: IE was helping another employee to tighten bolts on the trough (extension) of the pipe wrangler. As
IncidentDescription: IE was helping another employee to tighten bolts on the trough (extension) of the pipe wrangler. As the IE bent under the trough to put the wrench on a nut, the other employee was tightening a bolt on the other side of the wrangler using a 10" adjustable wrench. The 2nd employee's wrench slipped and struck the IE on the left side of the chin.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left side of chin after 10" adjustable wrench being used to tighten a bolt on the pipe wrangler by another employee slipped.

IncidentSummary: IE was stepping off back of truck and didn't see small rut. IE rolled right ankle on uneven ground.
IncidentDescription: IE was stepping off back of truck and didn't see small rut. IE rolled right ankle on uneven ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after twisting it while stepping off back of truck onto uneven ground.

IncidentSummary: Employee was carrying the bit breaker with two hands and walking backwards away from the rotary towa
IncidentDescription: Employee was carrying the bit breaker with two hands and walking backwards away from the rotary toward the drillers cabin after breaking the bit. He tripped over the collar clamps that were next to the rotary due to laying down the BHA previously. As he fell backwards, he put one hand down to catch himself and the bit breaker landed on his legs. It landed on his inner thigh just above his right knee and he has some slight bruising.
InjuryDescripti: While carrying breaker with two hands and walking backwards away from the rotary toward the drillers cabin after breaking the bit, employee tripped over collar clamps that were next to the rotary due to laying down the BHA previously. As he fell backwards, he put one hand down to catch himself and the bit breaker landed on his legs. It landed on his inner thigh just above his right knee resulting in some contusions to leg.

IncidentSummary: The crew landed the well and the floor hand was unscrewing the TWI off the 2' 2 7/8" sub. The IE was
IncidentDescription: The crew landed the well and the floor hand was unscrewing the TWI off the 2' 2 7/8" sub. The IE was sizing a 36" pipe wrench to take the collar off the 2' sub and set it down so he could help the floor hand with the TIW. The floor hand lost control of the TIW and it leaned over to the right and grazed the IE's hardhat on the left front side, causing the IE to strain neck.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to neck after being struck / grazed on the hardhat by the TIW when the floor hand lost control of it as it was being unscrewed off the sub.

IncidentSummary: IE was getting out of pickup at the district office and slipped and fell on the ice.
IncidentDescription: IE was getting out of pickup at the district office and slipped and fell on the ice.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to left wrist while slipping and falling in district parking lot after getting out of truck. Accumulating snow and ice.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling/bent diaper pin (AL)
IncidentDescription: Crew had been running rods when floor hand heard something hit the beam of the pumping unit.  It was discovered that a diaper pin, weighing about an ounce, was bent and had fallen about 55 feet. It landed about 20 feet from the nearest employee. The pin was being used to secure the escape door for the derrick board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/parted cable
IncidentDescription: While employees were prepping derrick to raise they had a cable attached to a pad eye on the center of the block dolly. The cable ran though a shiv that was attached to the top drive and ran out to a forklift. As they were pulling the blocks to the top drive, the blocks hit a tight spot causing strain on the cable which caused it to separate. The cable separated between the shiv and the forklift causing no damage to the forklift

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/boom pole sheaves
IncidentDescription: Two employees were attempting to spool up boom pole when line slipped from their grasp and un-spooled out of the boom pole sheaves, hitting ground at the back of the sub.

IncidentSummary: Night crew stayed over to help rig up test stump to perform the offline testing. IE was trying to li
IncidentDescription: Night crew stayed over to help rig up test stump to perform the offline testing. IE was trying to line the bolts on the flange with the holes on the BOP's while forklift operator was picking up on test stump. IE was holding on to the studs sticking up from the test plug and as he was wiggling test stump around, it got in a bind, then freed up and came up and smashed his hand cutting his ring finger on his right hand. IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: IE's right ring finger was caught between 2 flanges (BOP wrangler flange and test stump flange, resulting in minore laceration on palm-side of right ring finger.

IncidentSummary: Forthcoming
IncidentDescription: Forthcoming
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to head and abrasion to left forearm after crew truck he was driving hit a patch of ice and rolled over.

IncidentSummary: While rigging down mud lines below shakers, employee knocked hammer union end on 6" pipe loose, afte
IncidentDescription: While rigging down mud lines below shakers, employee knocked hammer union end on 6" pipe loose, after knocking hammer union side loose employee on other end of 6" pipe knocked loose hammer union seal loose. Injured employee then positioned his self under the 6" pipe to help the 2 employees assist pipe to skid, while employee was removing the o-ring from hammer seal side of pipe. Employee started from the top of the o-ring and was working his way around o-ring when employee got the bottom side of the o-+ring out of slot the 6" pipe the fell striking injured employee on top of head causing him to fall backwards and hitting his back on trip tank then landing on ground.
InjuryDescripti: Pipe fell and struck employee on hard hat resulting in cervical sprain.

IncidentSummary: While unloading a 4' 11" unloaded gun body out of pickup bed with Ray Garis, the IE slipped and fel
IncidentDescription: While unloading a 4' 11" unloaded gun body out of pickup bed with Ray Garis, the IE slipped and fell to the ground, causing slight pain in right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder after slipping and falling while unloading gun body from back of truck.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on a snow and ice covered catwalk when a stand slipped and knocked the IE on buttocks
IncidentDescription: IE was working on a snow and ice covered catwalk when a stand slipped and knocked the IE on buttocks and back. Then, a weight bar fell and struck lower left leg.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left leg after being struck by weight bar that fell after stand on ice-covered catwalk fell and knocked IE down as stand was being repositioned.

IncidentSummary: 1" steam line was place in boiler to thaw. After believing the line was clear, employee hook the 1"
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: 1" steam line was place in boiler to thaw. After believing the line was clear, employee hook the 1" line up to the air manifold to blow the water and ice out. He stood with his right foot on the hose and while blowing out shot himself in his left foot with a piece of ice.
InjuryDescripti: While blowing out air through hose to clean out debris, ice shot out from hose being cleared and struck him in the left foot resulting in contusion.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/drill pipe screen(s), dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: After working stuck pipe w/ surface jars, pipe came free. It was then decided to backream out of the hole 2 jts then L/D surface jars; Upon getting to 1st joint to break and put in mousehole, driller broke out of top drive and upon coming up the jar traveled causing it to jar DP screen out of pipe landing on rig floor (NOTE: Jars were not cocked.)

IncidentSummary: IE was using two 36-inch pipe wrenches to break out testing tools and pinched left thumb between the
IncidentDescription: IE was using two 36-inch pipe wrenches to break out testing tools and pinched left thumb between the two wrenches.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb after it was pinched between two pipe wrenches being used to break down test tools.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS Falling tool string
IncidentDescription: Started to bump up well to close in after coming off with stage 23. While unstabbing lubricator, moved tool slightly down inside lubricator to avoid being pulled off with the crane. When giving line down hole with lubricator on side of the valves, either wire line or string got obstructed and did not react in time to stop winch as obstruction suddenly gave up. Tool string fell with enough weight to pull off the rope socket. It landed on top of the valves and stopped.

IncidentSummary: While helping to remove pump iron from the back of a fluid pump, the iron broke loose and knocked th
IncidentDescription: While helping to remove pump iron from the back of a fluid pump, the iron broke loose and knocked the IE off the back of the pump. The IE fell about 3 feet and landed on right side, injuring elbow, shoulder, rib and hip.
InjuryDescripti: IE was helping remove pump iron from back of a fluid pump when the iron broke loose and knocked the IE off the back of the pump. The IE landed on right side on a concrete floor.

IncidentSummary: Employee was helping mix super sack of barite. When the hopper plugged off he was clearing the hopp
IncidentDescription: Employee was helping mix super sack of barite. When the hopper plugged off he was clearing the hopper of barite and the hopper feed chute that was full of barite fell off hitting the employee on the right hand side of the head neck and shoulder pinning him down to the hopper table.
InjuryDescripti: While helping mix barite, unsecured hopper feed chute filled with barite fell off, striking employee on the right side of his face, neck and shoulders resulting in a shoulder strain.

IncidentSummary: MISS wrong well opened
IncidentDescription: Crew had just come off well and frac was just finishing up the 4C. The operator in the man basket was waiting for the tool to be swung away and the tool dropped out to check all the shots, when the hydraulic valve was opened by a frac hand.  He heard the valve opening up and thought about looking into the well. Once the well valve was opened, water was released from the well. The crown valve and the night cap were off the well waiting for the ball to be dropped. Once the hand realized he opened the wrong well, he closed the hydraulic valve and the well was shut in again.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping 2 7/8" pipe out of the well. The floor hands broke the connection, stabbed the
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping 2 7/8" pipe out of the well. The floor hands broke the connection, stabbed the stand of tubing onto the racking board and the IE began to unlatch the elevators. As the operator began to lower the blocks, the IE reached out to unlatch the elevators and missed the latch as the elevators were coming down. As the blocks continued to descend, the IE held onto the pipe and was pushed into a squatting position by the elevators and rolled right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after being pushed into a squatting position by the elevators after missing the latch and holding onto the pipe as the blocks continued to descend.

IncidentSummary: IE was holding a port plug in left hand and a flathead screwdriver in the right. As the IE placed th
IncidentDescription: IE was holding a port plug in left hand and a flathead screwdriver in the right. As the IE placed the screwdriver between o-ring and body of port plug to twist and pop o-ring off, the screwdriver slipped and punctured through cotton and rubber glove and into flesh of hand.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to

IncidentSummary: Employees were preparing for Rig move and were rigging down the Rig floor. The Driller and both Flo
IncidentDescription: Employees were preparing for Rig move and were rigging down the Rig floor. The Driller and both Floor Hands were on the Rig floor sending the Drill pipe elevators and Top drive bails down the beaver slide to the catwalk. The Motor man was on the ground taking the equipment off the catwalk. The Motor hand checked to insure the breaker was off on the catwalk and proceeded to the stairs to get on top. He then walked down the Catwalk and started to take the strap off of the Bail. In the process of taking the strap off his left foot slipped in the V of the trough causing him to fall backwards. As he was falling he covered his head with his hands and arms. When he impacted the ground he struck the outside of his left foot on the inside corner of the toe sub. He then called his Driller and Derreck hand over the radio for help.
InjuryDescripti: IE's slipped on catwalk falling off causing him to strike the sub with the outside of his left foot resulting in a contusion.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/parted cable
IncidentDescription: While making up stand with rotating head, crew hooked hoist with double hook to rotating head to pull up rubber in order for ST-80 to be able to access tool joints. Only one hook was attached to head. When attempting to pull head up, sling cable parted, causing hoist bullet to slingshot towards board and tangling hoist line. Parted cable showed signs of corrosion.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/falling object HIGH
IncidentDescription: During a connection we heard a loud noise like something striking the floor. We stopped the job and I found a  fitting off of an unused ram for the batwing on the off-driller's side of the derrick had been backed out by the kelly hose and had fallen to the floor almost striking an employee.

IncidentSummary: The crew was tripping in with 3/4" rods with a fishing tool. They had 94 triples in the rod basket a
IncidentDescription: The crew was tripping in with 3/4" rods with a fishing tool. They had 94 triples in the rod basket and were on their 8th triple of rods. The IE was standing on the concrete for the rota-flex operating the rod tongs. The rods stacked out on something down-hole. The triple of rod started to bow towards the IE. The IE stepped backwards, turned to the right, slipped and fell from the same level, landing on right wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right wrist after slipping and falling on the rig floor after triple of rods started to bow towards him while operating the rod tongs.

IncidentSummary: The crew was in the process of rigging up the festoon lines, MCC building, and connecting the wiring
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: The crew was in the process of rigging up the festoon lines, MCC building, and connecting the wiring to the VFD. There had been significant snow and a period of extreme cold weather prior to the rig move. After pulling out the festoon cable trays the crew noticed that some of the cables were not staying in the saddles on the cable trays so they were going to secure them. The driller asked someone to go get rope to tie the unsecured cables to the saddle. The injured employee walked from the festoon over to the generator building to get the rope to secure the lines. As he was walking back, the employee attempted to step up on the suitcase when he slipped on ice that had gathered on the mats. The employee raised his left foot to the suitcase and his right foot slipped out from underneath him causing him to fall forward where he caught himself with his arms. The impact of the fall caused the injured employee to fracture his left wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Employee slipped while he was stepping up on the suitcase between the water house and electrical festoon. He fell forward catching himself with his hands, straining his left wrist resulting in a fracture to same wrist.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging up well head, lost foot placement and slip into the cellar.
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging up well head, lost foot placement and slip into the cellar.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left shoulder after slipping and falling into cellar while rigging up well head.

IncidentSummary: IE was tailing in perforating gun to run in hole, slipped in mud and fell backwards onto tools stand
IncidentDescription: IE was tailing in perforating gun to run in hole, slipped in mud and fell backwards onto tools stands.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back and left leg after slipping in mud and falling onto tool stand while tailing in perf gun.

IncidentSummary: IE was carrying sheave to truck from well head and slipped in mud, twisting lower back.
IncidentDescription: IE was carrying sheave to truck from well head and slipped in mud, twisting lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after slipping in mud while carrying sheave from well head to truck.

IncidentSummary: IE was riveting an asset tag onto truck #47's recorder cab and cut the tip of left ring finger when
IncidentDescription: IE was riveting an asset tag onto truck #47's recorder cab and cut the tip of left ring finger when the tool closed all the way and slipped, causing finger to strike lip of driver's cab.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left index finger after striking it against the lip of the driver's cab when rivet tool closed all the way and slipped while attaching an asset tag.

IncidentSummary: IE was assisting David Van Assche in removing five setting tools from storage and preparing them to
IncidentDescription: IE was assisting David Van Assche in removing five setting tools from storage and preparing them to ship to OKC. As David unchained the rack, removed a setting tool and moved to the side to make room for the IE, who had grabbed a second setting tool and was waiting to follow David out, a third setting tool tipped over and struck the IE on the upper lip.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to upper lip after being struck by a setting tool that tipped over as they were being removed from storage.

IncidentSummary: MISS trapped pressure release
IncidentDescription: After breaking the disc and bleeding off tool, Operator, David Rios, slowly backed the tool off the disc. About 1/4 from fully removing the tool, trapped pressure inside the tool blew back through the hole were the tool was and into his face. The tool was properly facing downward and proper PPE was being worn. It was discovered that debris from the burned power charge clogged up the original hole where the pressure escapes, causing it to blow out the top.

IncidentSummary: MISS dislodged safety pin
IncidentDescription: While raising lubricator, grease hoses caught bottom sheave stand and knocked out safety pin.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P winch chain hook
IncidentDescription: Third party employees were breaking a drill pipe connection apart and it slipped.  When they tried to catch it, employee let go of winch chain with large hook and it swung and nearly hit another third party employee in the face.

IncidentSummary: IE was lifting a bag of cement onto the truck for a job and left shoulder popped.
IncidentDescription: IE was lifting a bag of cement onto the truck for a job and left shoulder popped.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left shoulder while loading a bag of cement onto truck.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS cut lifting strap
IncidentDescription: After shift change and coming out of hole, the engineer noticed the strap used to lift the lubricator off the well had been cut into two pieces by the wireline

IncidentSummary: Eco-head was being rebuilt in vise when co-worker thought they should loosen it. Piece of head fell
IncidentDescription: Eco-head was being rebuilt in vise when co-worker thought they should loosen it. Piece of head fell on IE's left smalltoe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left small toe after being struck by a piece of Eco-head that fell out of vise when co-worker loosened vise.

IncidentSummary: Employee alleges that his left shoulder started hurting while tripping in the hole. NO SPECIFIC INCI
IncidentDescription: Employee alleges that his left shoulder started hurting while tripping in the hole. NO SPECIFIC INCIDENT -- just started to get sore while tripping in the hole and through the rest of the night. Employee was tripping in the hole from 1800 to 2000 and making connections and pressure washing from 2000 to 600.
InjuryDescripti: Employee alleges strain to left shoulder during regular rig operations but unable to tie to specific incident that may have triggered shoulder strain.

IncidentSummary: IE was rebuilding quick change firing blocks using a knife to seat spring onto brass conductor. The
IncidentDescription: IE was rebuilding quick change firing blocks using a knife to seat spring onto brass conductor. The IE dropped brass button and brushed left hand across blade while picking it up.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand after brushing against blade of knife being used to seat spring on brass conductor.

IncidentSummary: IE was trying to stabilize lube in breezy conditions when it came off well. The IE's foot slipped of
IncidentDescription: IE was trying to stabilize lube in breezy conditions when it came off well. The IE's foot slipped off rig floor just under the support bar, causing lower back discomfort.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back when foot that was under the support bar slipped, while trying to stabilize lube that had come off well in breezy conditions.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking on location and twisted left knee outward after stepping on a rock. IE did not fall t
IncidentDescription: IE was walking on location and twisted left knee outward after stepping on a rock. IE did not fall to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee after stepping on a rock with left foot while walking across location.

IncidentSummary: IE was working with a Baker tool when it started to slip off the stands. The IE became tangled in th
IncidentDescription: IE was working with a Baker tool when it started to slip off the stands. The IE became tangled in the stands and fell onto left side while trying to sip the tool from falling. The Baker tool landed on the inside of left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left ankle after being struck by a Baker tool after falling onto ground after becoming entangled in stand trying to stop the tool from falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling tool string
IncidentDescription: After picking up lubricator with tool string inside, lifted tool string off wheels with wireline. After removing wheels, found the bottom sub of Gamma-Ray tool backed off, causing tool string to fall a foot or so. Could have been worse of tool held on till it was higher in the air. Found the tool string was made up in lubricator and then rotated to make up to cable head.  This caused the bottom section tool to back off.

IncidentSummary: Employee was rolling the bull wheel on the mud pump with the bull wheel bar pulling downward when he
IncidentDescription: Employee was rolling the bull wheel on the mud pump with the bull wheel bar pulling downward when he felt a pain in his left shoulder. The employee stated he did not feel pain while he was in the process of rolling the bull wheel. After finishing the task his muscles in his shoulder began to feel tight.
InjuryDescripti: Possible left shoulder strain when employee was rolling the bull wheel on the mud pump with the bull wheel pulling downward -- he felt a pain in his left shoulder.

IncidentSummary: Employee was pulling slips out of the mouse hole by himself while building stands to rack back in th
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling slips out of the mouse hole by himself while building stands to rack back in the derrick when he strained his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: n++Employee was pulling slips out of the mouse hole by himself while building stands to rack back in the Derrick when he strained his lower back.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/service loop, grabber box
IncidentDescription:
When tripping in hole wind blew service loop underneath grabber box on top drive, right before
setting the slips.

IncidentSummary: MISS slip/fall Dominic Brown - no injury
IncidentDescription: Dominic slipped on ice and fell forward, landing on front side. He denies any pain. XStremeMD was notified.

IncidentSummary: The crew was changing out the kelly hose after the kelly hose they were using had failed. The injure
IncidentDescription: The crew was changing out the kelly hose after the kelly hose they were using had failed. The injured employee was on the outside of the derrick tied off to the crown SRL and was guiding the kelly hose up to the gooseneck. The employee was attempting to pull the hose out from under a girt and had his arm on the top of the union, then he signaled the hoist operator to raise the hose and as he did the hose slipped back under the girt and his arm was caught between the girt and hose union. He signaled the hoist operator to come down and pulled his arm from under the girt.
InjuryDescripti: While attempting to pull kelly hose out from under a girt, employee's arm was caught between the girt and hose union resulting contusion to left arm.

IncidentSummary: IE was putting fuel cans in the back of truck , slipped on ice and landed on back.
IncidentDescription: IE was putting fuel cans in the back of truck , slipped on ice and landed on back.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after slipping and falling on ice while loading fuel cans in the back of the truck.

IncidentSummary: IE got out of truck, slipped on ice and twisted left ankle due to running late and being in a hurry.
IncidentDescription: IE got out of truck, slipped on ice and twisted left ankle due to running late and being in a hurry.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after slipping on ice and twisting it due to running late and being in a hurry while getting out of truck.

IncidentSummary: IE was hammering lube onto wellhead when a small metal chip from hammer union flew off, striking rig
IncidentDescription: IE was hammering lube onto wellhead when a small metal chip from hammer union flew off, striking right cheek.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right cheek after being struck by a small metal chip from broken hammer union while hammering lube onto wellhead.

IncidentSummary: Employee was disconnecting a water hose used to fill the boiler by water truck drivers when he unhoo
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was disconnecting a water hose used to fill the boiler by water truck drivers when he unhooked it hot water came out of it and burned him on the left wrist. The hose was able to fill with hot water from the day tank on the boiler due to overfilling the day tank.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was disconnecting a water hose used to fill the boiler by water truck drivers when he unhooked it hot water came out of it and burned him on the left wrist

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/stairs, pad eyes
IncidentDescription: While removing the stairs on the backside of the rig floor, the stairs tipped down and impacted the sub crossover stairs. The stairs have four pad eyes for picking to be able to control the stairs as they are removed. The crane swampers only hooked to the bottom two pad eyes. As they picked the stairs, the heavier top end tipped down and impacted the handrails on the crossover steps in the substructure.

IncidentSummary: Was in process of slip and cut drilling line after the line was cut and dog nut was installed employ
IncidentDescription: Was in process of slip and cut drilling line after the line was cut and dog nut was installed employee picked up the drilling line to put back in drum and got a metal wicker in glove and thumb on right hand
InjuryDescripti: Employee was slipping and cutting drilling line when a piece of metal wicker punctured his right thumb.

IncidentSummary: IE was using pocket knife to cut insulation off discarded coated wire.
IncidentDescription: IE was using pocket knife to cut insulation off discarded coated wire.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand while using pocket knife to cut insulation from discarded wire.

IncidentSummary: MISS needle valve pulled off
IncidentDescription: Crew did not have the proper lifting device attached when pulling nightcap off well head. They applied too much pressure when using the needle valve to tie off on and pulled the needle valve off the nightcap throwing it 10-15 feet.

IncidentSummary: While positioning sheave stand, it hung up on stabbing mats on rig floor. Pulled stand to free it, a
IncidentDescription: While positioning sheave stand, it hung up on stabbing mats on rig floor. Pulled stand to free it, and it slid across floor and struck inside of IE's left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot after being struck by sheave stand as it slid across rig floor after it was freed from hanging up on stabbing mat.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P CoP/opened wrong valve
IncidentDescription: CoP 3P consultant actuated the lower hydraulic valve, partially opening it and instantly equalizing our lubricator with the well bore. This caused an instantaneous severing of the wire line at the fishing neck and an unintentional opening of the tool trap. Wireline tool was dropped onto the lower hydraulic valve, about 9 feet below the top of the well head.

IncidentSummary: IE was first person to arrive at the Casper yard and parked outside of fence. Temperature was 18 deg
IncidentDescription: IE was first person to arrive at the Casper yard and parked outside of fence. Temperature was 18 degrees, snowy and icy. The last the IE remembers is getting out of truck and then coming to. The IE got coveralls and hard hat out of the back seat and was observed by Dan Shandorf stumbling back to shop, covered in snow, with poor speech.
InjuryDescripti: Concussion after slipping on ice and falling upon exiting truck at the shop.

IncidentSummary: MISS making up TCP assembly
IncidentDescription: The rig hands were making up a joint of pipe to the packer for TCP BHA. A two-foot pup joint was latched in the elevators on top of the joint of pipe. It was only hand high. While making the packer up, the pup joint backed out of the joint of pipe and caused it to fall into the derrick.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/casing load shifting
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Truck backed up to off load casing while undoing the last strap, the casing shifted, bending over the side post on the driver side of the trailer causing the entire load of casing to roll off and land on the ground.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS falling tubing (AL)
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down 2-7/8" tubing and floor hand, Marcos Benitez was standing on the side of the hydraulic catwalk using the Shove-It tool. When the tubing reached halfway up the trough, it fell off trough and catwalk, landing on the ground.

IncidentSummary: Left thumb was caught between pipe and pipe stand. IE was wearing cotton gloves.
IncidentDescription: Left thumb was caught between pipe and pipe stand. IE was wearing cotton gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb when lubricator being lifted came of quicker than expected and caught it between rack and lubricator.

IncidentSummary: Crew had finished lunch and started to rig down. The IE was loosening the turnbuckles to drop the gu
IncidentDescription: Crew had finished lunch and started to rig down. The IE was loosening the turnbuckles to drop the guy lines. The IE took off left glove and noticed middle, ring and little finger were white from the cold.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced frost-nip to middle, ring and small fingers of left hand while rigging down.

IncidentSummary: IE went to the truck to get the cleaner to clean the line and struck head against weight bar.
IncidentDescription: IE went to the truck to get the cleaner to clean the line and struck head against weight bar.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration above left eyebrow after striking against weight bar on truck while getting cleaner out of truck.

IncidentSummary: MISS buckled scoping ram (AR)
IncidentDescription: While scoping up rig, the scoping ram buckled.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P Linn Energy/Stingray Frac well head pressure release
IncidentDescription: 3rd party was in the middle of dropping pods. Someone shut the bottom master valve. As a result a wing valve from the well head was blown off by internal pressure. A Frac hand was near the well head and got the wind knocked out of him but sustained no injuries. After this, everyone gathered at the muster point, 2 guys (not our personnel) went to the hospital to get checked out but no injuries were sustained.

IncidentSummary: IE and another employee were removing the plug from the shorty setting tool. The setting tool was pl
IncidentDescription: IE and another employee were removing the plug from the shorty setting tool. The setting tool was placed in the chain vice on the back bumper of the logger. The IE placed one hand under the sleeve of the tool and one under the plug while another employee unscrewed the sleeve. As he finished, the plug along with the sleeve and mandrel fell from the shorty and struck the top of the IE's left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of left foot when it was struck by the plug , sleeve and mandrel as they were being unscrewed from the shorty setting tool being held in a vise on the back bumper of the logging truck.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS falling live gun
IncidentDescription: Employee pulled out of rope socket on surface which resulted in live gun falling to the ground.

IncidentSummary: IE slipped on ice/snow and fell on his tailbone.
IncidentDescription: IE slipped on ice/snow and fell on his tailbone.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after slipping and falling on slick aluminum stairs while exiting trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped risers/forklift
IncidentDescription: Operator had two risers on the forklift and as he was moving them, they fell when he hit the brakes because the forks were not lifted back enough.

IncidentSummary: Employe removing drain plug from liner washer pump in pump shed. Employee stood up and turned around
IncidentDescription: Employe removing drain plug from liner washer pump in pump shed. Employee stood up and turned around and stepped on a 2" vacuum hose used to suck out the duck ponds for mud pump. Employees fool slipped causing ankle to strain.
InjuryDescripti: Possible right ankle strain when employee stood up and turned around and stepped on a 2" vacuum hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS P-89-dragging torn tarp
IncidentDescription: While driving on Hwy 21, the tarp on P-89 ripped in half and was dragging behind truck, held by one buckle above bumper. Vehicle behind flashed lights and operator in the engineer truck called driver to make him aware.

IncidentSummary: Guns were being loaded on location instead of shop due to lack of time between pads. While trying to
IncidentDescription: Guns were being loaded on location instead of shop due to lack of time between pads. While trying to cut the explosive sign off a box of charges, IE cut left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left thumb after struck by box cutter being used to cut sign off box of charges.

IncidentSummary: MISS trailer-brkn leaf springs, tire blowout
IncidentDescription: Driver side trailer tire blew out while coming back from location near Ruston, LA. Upon inspection, leaf springs for the driver side front axle had broken at the front bolt junction and only two of the six remained. The rear-bolt assembly was dragging the ground facing forward. Broken leaf springs punctured tire. Logging truck following about 1/4 mile behind did not notice any debris on the highway.

IncidentSummary: Crew was coming out of the hole with 4 1/2 X 42" tubing. The IE was on the catwalk laying down 3rd j
IncidentDescription: Crew was coming out of the hole with 4 1/2 X 42" tubing. The IE was on the catwalk laying down 3rd joint of tubing. While walking to the front of the catwalk, picked up right foot to step on catwalk but missed and fell to the ground, landing on right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Dislocated right shoulder after slipping and falling off catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS falling joint (AR)
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up pipe making swivel connections and trying out a new aluminum bucket. The bottom of the bucket used to pick up pipe got knocked out by the tubing drift. The joint fell out the bottom of the bucket and rested against the work floor.

IncidentSummary: The crew was rigging up and the IE was kneeling under the operator stand removing a pin. The floor h
IncidentDescription: The crew was rigging up and the IE was kneeling under the operator stand removing a pin. The floor hand that was holding onto the operator stand lost his grip and the stand folded down and stuck the IE's left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder after being struck by operator stand after floor hand that was holding it lost his grip.

IncidentSummary: IE was working on ST-80 at shop. At the time of incident IE was tightening a fitting on the duplex c
IncidentDescription: IE was working on ST-80 at shop. At the time of incident IE was tightening a fitting on the duplex cylinder pushing the wrench up and forward. The wrench slipped off of the nut IE lost control of the wrench causing the wrench to strike him by his right eyebrow.
InjuryDescripti: While working on ST-80, IE was using a wrench to tighten a nut when the wrench slipped off the nut, lost control of the wrench which popped up and forward resulting in a small laceration over the right eyebrow.

IncidentSummary: Derrickman was on pumping unit to remove bolt on horse head, lost balance and slid off side of the p
IncidentDescription: Derrickman was on pumping unit to remove bolt on horse head, lost balance and slid off side of the pumping unit falling 6-8 inches before being caught by Sala line.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to groin after losing balance and slipping 6-8 inches off pumping unit while removing bolt on horse head. Was caught by Sala line.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving the perforating gun from the workbench when the gun slipped and pinched his finger
IncidentDescription: IE was moving the perforating gun from the workbench when the gun slipped and pinched his finger
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion on left ring finger

IncidentSummary: Building #20 setting tools, Ie went to open the vice and teh handle swung around and struck IE in th
IncidentDescription: Building #20 setting tools, Ie went to open the vice and teh handle swung around and struck IE in the face
InjuryDescripti: Building setting tools in a vice on the bench, went to loosen vice swung handle over, the handle came around and struck IE in the face just above the mouth

IncidentSummary: Employees were making up polish rod into rod string. Stuffing box 3" above pipe wrench on polish rod
IncidentDescription: Employees were making up polish rod into rod string. Stuffing box 3" above pipe wrench on polish rod. IE placed hand on pipe wrench and stuffing box slipped down and caught left finger tip.
InjuryDescripti: Amputation of portion of left index finger after it was caught between stuffing box and pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: Crew was pulling tubing out of the well. The operator was coming down with the blocks and they were
IncidentDescription: Crew was pulling tubing out of the well. The operator was coming down with the blocks and they were swaying slightly in the 10-15 mph wind. The IE grabbed the horns of the elevators, as the blocks were coming down, to push them away from the collar of the tubing that was sticking out of the well bore. The IE pushed the elevators too hard and they hit the tubing that was sticking out of the well bore, flipped up and pinched left index finger between elevators and the bales.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left index finger after it was caught between elevators and bales .

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up 3/4" rods from the ground and the operator was running in 4th gear. The IE atta
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up 3/4" rods from the ground and the operator was running in 4th gear. The IE attached the rod elevators to the rod and the operator clutched in and started to raise the blocks.The IE was looking back and forth at the rod tongs to adjust the tong heads while receiving the rods. The floorhand let go of the rod and the IE was struck above the left eye while turning around to catch it.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration above left eye after being struck by the rod after missing it as it was released by the floorhand.

IncidentSummary: Floorhand was helping casing crew rig down power tongs from hoist cable. Floorhand had removed nut f
IncidentDescription: Floorhand was helping casing crew rig down power tongs from hoist cable. Floorhand had removed nut for the bolt on the shackle and casing hand removed the bolt. When the bolt was removed from the shackle there was trapped tension in the cable. The cable spun with the shackle in the thimble eye and struck the floorhandGs right thumb causing laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thumb when freed cable tension spun with shackle in thimble eye, striking floorhand's thumb.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging down and laying lube down on the trailer. Crane operator's view was obstructed by
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging down and laying lube down on the trailer. Crane operator's view was obstructed by grease unit, but the engineer could see. The engineer signaled and the lube swung and hit IE mid-thigh.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right thigh after being struck by swinging lube as it was being moved with a crane.

IncidentSummary: A crew was lifting lubricator with a tool dolly on one end and winch line from drilling rig on the o
IncidentDescription: A crew was lifting lubricator with a tool dolly on one end and winch line from drilling rig on the other. The lubricator had a 15-degree angle to it when the lubricator shifted forward the operator could not hold the dolly with the handle and let it go. The IE was standing in front of the dolly and the handle caught him in the back.
InjuryDescripti: struck in the back right below the kidney section

IncidentSummary: MISS safety chain link (AL)
IncidentDescription: Crew was inspecting the derrick before rigging up. Juan Juarez and Francisco Lozano were changing out stainless steel cotter pins and noticed the safety chain link on the tubing board was wearing down from both sides due to the catline running up and down.
