IncidentSummary: IE was working under truck and stuck head on open truck door upon standing up.
IncidentDescription: IE was working under truck and stuck head on open truck door upon standing up.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to temple after striking against open truck door upon standing up after working under it.

IncidentSummary: MISS pumping acid
IncidentDescription: During pumping operations, the customer decided to change fluids to a 15% HCl. During this task, it was noticed that the crew did not possess the proper PPE to handle the acid. The supervisor made the decision that they could safely do the job by borrowing chemical gloves. After pumping the acid, it was decided to pump  an acid-neutralizing solution. For this to take place, a hose had to be removed from the acid tank and placed in the solution tank. When the employee removed the hose, they installed a 5-gallon bucket to catch any run over. The contents of the bucket contained Gel and Acid. Once the neutralizing solution came into contact with the bucket it formed a cloud of vapor.

IncidentSummary: IE was tearing down a spent gun and glove caught on a spent scallop, tore through glove and cut righ
IncidentDescription: IE was tearing down a spent gun and glove caught on a spent scallop, tore through glove and cut right thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right thumb after spent scallop tore through glove while pulling the stand under the gun.

IncidentSummary: The crew was laying down K-bars and the IE was running the rod tongs and using them to break the pat
IncidentDescription: The crew was laying down K-bars and the IE was running the rod tongs and using them to break the patco off the K-bar. The K-bar square rounded off, causing the bail on the rod elevator to spin and strike the left hip of the IE.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hip after being struck by the elevator bail.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS damaged  truck cables and batteries
IncidentDescription: While traveling to location, a sign in the compartment fell over and landed on the battery.  Did not realize it was there until it arced and shorted out the truck, shutting it down while driving. Once discovered, it was found that all the cables  and been melted and batteries damaged.

IncidentSummary: IE was working at the Alice yard on Thursday, March 15, removing the flange on pump to replace the s
IncidentDescription: IE was working at the Alice yard on Thursday, March 15, removing the flange on pump to replace the swabs. While swinging the sledge hammer, there was a slight discomfort in the left shoulder, but the IE continued to work the rest of the day. The incident was not reported until Monday, March 19 to Abel Alvarez.
InjuryDescripti: ALLEGED strain to left shoulder while swinging sledge to remove the flange on the pump to replace swabs. Incident was on Thursday, March 15 and IE did not report until Monday, March 19.

IncidentSummary: Crew had just moved to a new location and were rigging up. The floorhand was holding the end of the
IncidentDescription: Crew had just moved to a new location and were rigging up. The floorhand was holding the end of the turnbuckle as the IE was putting the pin through the pad eye on the base beam. The floorhand set the upper end of the turnbuckle on the junk basket. The IE bumped the turnbuckle and it fell off the junk basket as the IE placed the pin through the turnbuckle and the pad eye. This resulted in the IE's left index finger being caught between the turnbuckle and the base beam.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left index finger after it was caught between turnbuckle and base beam, after knocking the turnbuckle off the base beam it was resting on, while placing pin through turnbuckle and the pad eye.

IncidentSummary: MISS office/shop door
IncidentDescription: Door between shop and office is made of solid steel. Door almost opened into a person standing in the shop because there is no way of telling if someone is standing on the other side. Tool box is located near door and people are often standing near the door.

IncidentSummary: While installing the pin that connects the forks to the forklift IE was struggling to get the pin li
IncidentDescription: While installing the pin that connects the forks to the forklift IE was struggling to get the pin lined up.IE was wiggling the pin up and down as the pin started in the hole the IE's right hand slipped off and his right index finger was pinched by the side of the pin pocket. IE was not wearing impact gloves but was wearing rubber nitrate gloves.
InjuryDescripti: While hooking the forklift up to forks, to install the pin in place to hold attach the forks to forklift, the pin was tight, so employee began wiggling it up and down. The pin started to move and his right hand slipped off and his right index finger got scrapped barely breaking the skin.

IncidentSummary: The IE was pushing on a pipe wrench to break the flow tee on the well head. As the IE stepped over t
IncidentDescription: The IE was pushing on a pipe wrench to break the flow tee on the well head. As the IE stepped over the flow line piping, left pant leg caught on a valve handle and twisted leg in an awkward motion. The IE felt a pop in the left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee after pant leg caught on valve handle and leg twisted in an awkward motion while stepping over flow line.

IncidentSummary: IE was laying down tubing and felt a sharp pain in shoulder while pulling on the pipe as it came dow
IncidentDescription: IE was laying down tubing and felt a sharp pain in shoulder while pulling on the pipe as it came down the catwalk.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder while pulling pipe as it came down catwalk.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE called XStremeMD to report onset of left groin pain while working. He was unable to identify a sp
IncidentDescription: IE called XStremeMD to report onset of left groin pain while working. He was unable to identify a specific mechanism of injury.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to left groin area. IE called XStremeMD and was unable to identify a specific mechanism of injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped nightcap
IncidentDescription: Crew had just pulled out of well and checked shots. The operator set the nightcap on the flange but didn't make sure it was stable before taking his hands off of it. This resulted in the nightcap falling to the ground. No equipment was damaged and no personnel were in the way.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging down and was clearing the catwalk of tools and equipment because there was no space
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging down and was clearing the catwalk of tools and equipment because there was no space to work on either side. The IE was dragging the top sheave wheel to the end of the floor to hand it down to the other operator because the stairs were unstable. Along the way, one of the cleavis attached to the wheel lodged into a space in the floor. The wheel stopped suddenly and right arm twisted and overextended.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder after clevis on the top sheave wheel being drug across floor lodged into a space and overextended arm.

IncidentSummary: The IE was picking up the boards from a wooden box that had fallen apart while being moved and a sma
IncidentDescription: The IE was picking up the boards from a wooden box that had fallen apart while being moved and a small nail punctured the palm of left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to palm of left hand after striking against small nail in wooden boards being picked up from a box that fell apart while being moved.

IncidentSummary: Employee was installing a beam on the substructure to put the rail of the BOP-s, then they (Supervis
IncidentDescription: Employee was installing a beam on the substructure to put the rail of the BOP-s, then they (Supervisor and derrickhand) see that this beam was improperly installed and must change it's position to be able to anchor the rail. The derrickhand needed to move to another place, then he released his anchor line and he leaned on a metallic surface, but he didn't realize that this surface was a mobile gate, also his gloves were coated of grease by removing pins, that caused him to lose his balance, slides, and falls to the floor from a height of 6 ft approximately. A fracture to the left arm is diagnosed, the doctor stabilizes and immobilizes the patient.
InjuryDescripti: Not applicable.

IncidentSummary: MISS reel swivel failure
IncidentDescription: Reel swivel was rebuilt and tested to 10,000 psi on 03-23-18 and tested again on location on 03-25-18. Unit 16 ran in the hole and started drilling plugs. On 03-26-18 at 6:00 am, the circulating pressure was too high at 10,800 feet. While pulling out of the hole, the reel swivel blew off the shaft and hit the safety stop, which fell to the ground. The u-bolts holding the swivel also broke loose. The well head pressure at the time was 5700 psi and the circulating pressure was 7850 psi.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/dropped object(s), shim measuring tool
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While raising Derrick- a shim measuring tool fell out of crown on to the rocks.

IncidentSummary: IE was climbing on the back of the unit to close the windows in the cab and slipped and fell about 5
IncidentDescription: IE was climbing on the back of the unit to close the windows in the cab and slipped and fell about 5.5 feet while stepping on the discharge side 2 by 2 valve, landing on left wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left wrist after slipping on discharge valve and falling 5.5 feet to the ground while climbing on unit to close the window.

IncidentSummary: IE was being hoisted up by the rig hand on a riding sitting belt to take off the lubricator from the
IncidentDescription: IE was being hoisted up by the rig hand on a riding sitting belt to take off the lubricator from the wireline BOP's. He came up too fast and the IE was caught with the handle of the wireline BOPS against the groin area.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to groin area after being caught against handle of wireline BOPS while being raised on a sitting belt to remove lubricator.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/trapped pressure HIGH
IncidentDescription: While testing casing testers were tied into the stand pipe under subs, the kill line valve was opened and casing was pressured up to 1500 psi and held for 15 minutes. The testers bled off stand pipe to zero. The driller checked for trapped pressure by opening the HCR valve to the choke and observed 900 psi on the backside. All operations were stopped to determine where the trapped pressure come from. Being the testers tied into the kill line the pressure trapped between the check valve on the kill line, the blind rams and the HCR valve.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/malfunctioning hydraulic fitting(s)
IncidentDescription:
An employee had shut the HPU off and the driller locked it out. Therefore the hand could unhook
the BOP wranglers hydraulic line and stow them away. Hand put caps on the hoses, and the hydraulic fitting(s) coming off of the hardline that goes to the rig floor after wrangler hoses were put away. Employee told the driller everything was unhooked and finished, and he could use the HPU when needed. 30 minutes later an employee was taking off a broken hydraulic cylinder for the locking mechanism on the BOP wrangler, and that's when the driller had kicked the HPU on. The hydraulic fitting(s) coming off of the rig feed when it was taken apart had malfunctioned and stayed in the open position, and the hand did not notice it before he had put the cap on it. This caused the pin holding the safety cable on the end of the cap to shoot out with the 3000 pounds of pressure from the HPU behind it shooting over the hand's head missing him and spraying hydraulic fluid at him and towards his exits. A hand on the rig floor heard him yell shut it down and had the driller shut down within 5-10 seconds.

IncidentSummary: While tripping out of hole for casing run, employee was pushing a stand of drill pipe back to start
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of hole for casing run, employee was pushing a stand of drill pipe back to start a new row of pipe. As he pushed it back the other floor hand came behind him to assist pushing it back. Doing so the affected employee's left lower palm/wrist was momentarily squeezed between the existing stands in the mast and the stand being pushed back. Employee had his left hand wrapped around tubular portion of pipe.
InjuryDescripti: While performing regular drilling operations, employee's left hand got caught between stands in the mast and a stand being moved resulting in an abrasion to the left wrist.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped off trailer on location and left knee popped.
IncidentDescription: IE stepped off trailer on location and left knee popped.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee while stepping down off trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS rod plates (KN)
IncidentDescription: Crew was coming out of the hole with rod and tubing. While pulling tubing, they reached the depth where the rods backed off. After switching to our equipment for pulling rods, crew latched on to the 3/4" rod string with a 3/4 - 7/8" rod elevator. The operator began to pull the rod string to see if the pump was stuck as instructed by the company man. As the rod string was pulled, the crew heard a popping noise and saw the rod string move down. The rod shoulder slipped through the elevator and got caught on the lip of the rod right below the threads.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/foot placement, K-brace(s)
IncidentDescription: While cleaning OBM from subs and around cellar, employee was climbing over K-braces in sub, his foot slipped off the lip of the beam. Employee used his hand to catch himself.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P Cased Hole/swinging crane load
IncidentDescription: Wireline employee was in the man basket verifying shot guns and getting ready to drop the ball. Cased Hole Wireline next to our crew was doing the same thing. The Cased Hold crane operator with less the 4 months experience, was swinging over to lay down the gun they had just run. He had no spotter to guide him and swung long load at a higher rate than he should have. The long load swung about 3 feet over the Wireline operator in the man basket stopping 3 feet away from his side.

IncidentSummary: Casey Burkett and IE were taking thread protectors off pipe and tossing them into a 55 gal drum loca
IncidentDescription: Casey Burkett and IE were taking thread protectors off pipe and tossing them into a 55 gal drum located by the pipe rack. Casey took one off and tossed it towards the drum and it struck the IE, who was standing next to the drum 2.5 feet away, on the right forearm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right forearm after being struck by thread protectors being tossed into a 55-gallon drum.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/broken cable HIGH
IncidentDescription: After laying over mast rig manager saw a broken secondary cable. The secondary cable was for the ODS winch line sheave.  The secondary cable was caught and pulled up into the sheave which caused the cable to break.

IncidentSummary: The employee came up to the rig manager and told him that he was having a lower abdominal/groin area
IncidentDescription: The employee came up to the rig manager and told him that he was having a lower abdominal/groin area pain. The employee alleges that 4 days prior he had started to feel a slight pain in his groin area that was not extreme and he thought was simply soreness. The employee said there was not anything that happened that was identifiable that could have caused this soreness. Over the course of the next four days the pain got increasingly worse until the point he felt that it needed to be checked out. The employee stated that he could not identify an incident that happened to cause the pain.
InjuryDescripti: Possible strain to lower abdomen area/groin; unable to ascertain a clear origin or source for the alleged injury.

IncidentSummary: IE was talking to fellow operator about the pressure on the rubbers. While leaving the trailer, the
IncidentDescription: IE was talking to fellow operator about the pressure on the rubbers. While leaving the trailer, the IE was walking down the ramp and right ankle went into a hole underneath the containment tarp, buckled/twisted and popped at least four times, causing IE to fall to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to right ankle after stepping off exit ramp from trailer into a hole underneath containment tarp. IE fell to the ground and heard ankle pop at least four times.

IncidentSummary: Employee was cleaning up rig floor. He went to move the bit breaker by picking it up and setting it
IncidentDescription: Employee was cleaning up rig floor. He went to move the bit breaker by picking it up and setting it by the hand rail. The bit breaker is appx 70 lbs. When he set the bit breaker down, he didn't realize his finger was in a bad spot. He let go of the breaker with his right hand, the bit breaker then slid down a little, pinching his finger between the collar clamp and the bit breaker (he was wearing impact gloves).
InjuryDescripti: Bruise to left middle finger while employee was moving bit breaker when left hand was caught between collar clamp and bit breaker.

IncidentSummary: IE stepped down from crane to help co-worker and rolled left ankle on loose gravel. Was using the dr
IncidentDescription: IE stepped down from crane to help co-worker and rolled left ankle on loose gravel. Was using the driver side ladder, facing the crane , using 3-point contact.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after rolling it on loose gravel while stepping off crane ladder.

IncidentSummary: Dominic Brown was practicing parallel parking a semi and when he was finished the IE was walking up
IncidentDescription: Dominic Brown was practicing parallel parking a semi and when he was finished the IE was walking up to do the same. Dominic had left the truck in gear and the door open and the door struck the IE in the face and shoulder as he walked up to the truck.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder and face after being struck by door of semi that was left open and moving due to another employee leaving it in gear and not applying brakes upon exiting.

IncidentSummary: Crew had made several attempts to try and free a tool that was stuck in the lubricator. The crane o
IncidentDescription: Crew had made several attempts to try and free a tool that was stuck in the lubricator. The crane operator lowered the lube so Shawn could shake it free. The IE started to walk towards the bottom sheave to give Shawn a hand and while reaching for the wireline, the tool broke free. This caused the bottom sheave to rise up about four feet and catch right ring finger between wireline and bottom sheave.
InjuryDescripti: Amputated end of right ring finger after it was caught between wireline and bottom sheave while trying to free a tool that was stuck inside lubricator.

IncidentSummary: Employee was removing turnbuckles in sub with a breaker bar. While trying to unscrew driller-side re
IncidentDescription: Employee was removing turnbuckles in sub with a breaker bar. While trying to unscrew driller-side rear turnbuckle, employee's foot slipped, causing his hand to slip off the breaker bar and the breaker bar to back spin from built up resistance, striking employee on the nose.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to nose while removing sub turnbuckles with a breaker bar; his foot slipped, causing his hand to slip off the breaker bar and the breaker bar to back spin from built up resistance, striking him on the nose.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling down on a ratchet to remove a piece of equipment from a truck. A bolt broke and the w
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling down on a ratchet to remove a piece of equipment from a truck. A bolt broke and the wrench on the bolt fell and struck the face from the inner corner of right eye down to the nose.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to face after being struck by wrench when bolt on ratchet being pulled down on to remove equipment broke.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling wrench
IncidentDescription: Rig hand knocked a wrench off the rig floor while working. It landed about 10' away from  where employees were standing and where an employee had been standing moments before.

IncidentSummary: MISS potential falling object
IncidentDescription: Two employees were on rig floor and began to take down wireline equipment. Rig hand was in tubing board preparing to remove top sheave and lower to ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS plug shoot
IncidentDescription: Employee was unwinding a high string that had tension. When it was cut, it sprung back and hit employee's safety glasses.

IncidentSummary: MISS pack-off
IncidentDescription: Crew was pressure testing lubricator when top of pack-off popped off. Because of the wireline, it did not fall to the ground.

IncidentSummary: IE was racking back tubing and as the tubing slid off the IE's hands, debris from the tubing landed
IncidentDescription: IE was racking back tubing and as the tubing slid off the IE's hands, debris from the tubing landed in right eye. IE was wearing safety glasses and impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to right eye from debris off tubing being put on rack.

IncidentSummary: IE was getting a pipe wrench, that was stuck in a PVC sleeve, out of the back of P-01. As the IE p
IncidentDescription: IE was getting a pipe wrench, that was stuck in a PVC sleeve, out of the back of P-01. As the IE pulled harder to free the wrench, it came out , catching finger between the wrench and the expanded steel in the back of the truck.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right middle finger after it was caught between pipe wrench and expanded steel in the back of the truck.

IncidentSummary: The IE was tightening the polish rod using a 24" pipe wrench with a cheater pipe. As the IE pushed o
IncidentDescription: The IE was tightening the polish rod using a 24" pipe wrench with a cheater pipe. As the IE pushed on the cheater pipe, the pipe wrench slipped off the polish rod and the IE fell forward and right knee struck top edge of base beam.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee after striking it on base beam when pipe wrench being used to tighten rods slipped.

IncidentSummary: MISS brake handle (KN)
IncidentDescription: Operator was on brake handle working pipe up and down, trying to release on-and-off tool. While pipe was on the way down, operator pushed down on brake handle and heard a pop. Brake handle broke over and he immediately set slips and stopped job to investigate. The turnbuckle off the driller's side that holds the brake band hand broken. No employees were on the floor when the incident occurred.

IncidentSummary: IE drove logger to location and stepped into mud after climbing down. Left leg slipped and knee popp
IncidentDescription: IE drove logger to location and stepped into mud after climbing down. Left leg slipped and knee popped, but didn't hurt. Woke up next day with a swollen knee and in pain.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee upon climbing down out of logger and slipping in mud.

IncidentSummary: Employee was walking out of pump house #3 going to the hopper house. As he stepped out of the pump h
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking out of pump house #3 going to the hopper house. As he stepped out of the pump house on to the step platform, his right foot got hung up, causing him to fall forward. He hit the ground and his left knee impacted the corner of a matting board.
InjuryDescripti: Slip from steps, resulting in contusion after striking left knee on matting board.

IncidentSummary: IE was having difficulty properly setting the piston while redressing the setting tool. The IE was h
IncidentDescription: IE was having difficulty properly setting the piston while redressing the setting tool. The IE was handling the portion of the adaptor which slid, and pinched right hand between sliding portion and the square shoulder of the stationary segment.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right hand after it was caught between sliding portion and square shoulder of stationary segment of shorty setting tool while redressing it.

IncidentSummary: Crew was traveling westbound on FM 99, approaching intersection of FM 626. Tractor trailer belonging
IncidentDescription: Crew was traveling westbound on FM 99, approaching intersection of FM 626. Tractor trailer belonging to South Texas Oilfield Solutions LLC, was eastbound and had missed the turn onto FM 626. As he was backing the semi up, his trailer jack-knifed into our driver's lane and our driver struck the trailer's driver side rear rims and tires., injuring the crew.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to left elbow after crew truck he was driving struck semi that had jack-knifed while backing up on FM. 99.

IncidentSummary: The crew was in the process of tripping out of the hole when the employee working with the ST-80 was
IncidentDescription: The crew was in the process of tripping out of the hole when the employee working with the ST-80 was struck in the head by a piece of A-leg chap that fell. The piece had been tied with rope after the original straps fell and the rope failed.
InjuryDescripti: While tripping out of the hole, employee was lowering ST-80 when he was struck in left side of his head with piece of a leg chap. No observable injury other than glancing blow to the head.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/sawdust, fire hazard HIGH
IncidentDescription:
The employee was walking around checking location when he thought he smelt something burning. He checked the mix off half round for the mud cleaning equipment and saw the contents of the half round were beginning to smolder. The employee notified the rig manager and the rig
manager contacted the track hoe operator for Crossfire who went and mixed the contents which stopped the sawdust from igniting.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/latch and pin HIGH
IncidentDescription: While drilling differential pressure and torque was lost. After checking surface equipment it was determined we should POOH. The driller racked the stand back and was coming back down when the traveling assembly stopped suddenly and the drum was backlashed. Upon inspection we realized the pin for the latch to hang the block off had fallen out and the latch had opened. The traveling assembly was sitting on the track where we dock the TDS for transport. After straightening out the drill line on the drum we picked it up, shut and secured the latch, came  down and inspected the TDS, track and all dollies and carriage bolts. All were good, they were secured and retained properly.

IncidentSummary: While employee was latching onto agitator from catwalk, the hobble slacked off causing it to slide f
IncidentDescription: While employee was latching onto agitator from catwalk, the hobble slacked off causing it to slide forward on the elevator horn and pinched the employee's left thumb when he went to close them.
InjuryDescripti: Hobble slid forward on the elevator horn resulting in employee's left thumb being pinched.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/generator
IncidentDescription:
Derrick hand radioed for the motorman to make his way to Generator 4 because it was smoking. When motorman got to the generator he saw there was fuel spraying from the top by the injector lines. Employee then attempted to shut  the motor down, but it wasnt responding. Employee ran to the VFD
and switched 4 to idle. While employee was attempting to kill the motor the fuel on the generator caught fire. After the motor had stopped 2 employees extinguished the fire.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/mud bucket, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While drilling ahead, driller notice fluid psi loss on his gauge.  He then went to pick up off bottom as he was about to pick up the casing tong hanging line with mud bucket attached to it fell to the rig floor.  Due to the Top Drive being caught on the line.

IncidentSummary: Employee was moving rail road tie to position it under catwalk walking foot. Employees middle finge
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was moving rail road tie to position it under catwalk walking foot. Employees middle finger on his left hand was pinched between a matting board and the railroad tie as he was trying to slide it over. When his finger impacted the matting board it caused 2 small lacerations on the tip of his finger.
InjuryDescripti: While walking the catwalk, the employee went to move a rail road tie out of the way, lost his grip & pinched his finger between the railroad tie and rig mat resulting in laceration to left, middle finger.

IncidentSummary: IE twisted around with tubing in hand and heard back pop.
IncidentDescription: IE twisted around with tubing in hand and heard back pop.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while POH with 2 7/8" tubing in derrick.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to cut 20' section of pipe from the bottom of the coil tubing injector. While cutt
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to cut 20' section of pipe from the bottom of the coil tubing injector. While cutting the bent section with a torch, the section suddenly sprang up and struck the IE in the forehead.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration, requiring 17 stitches to forehead, when a 20' section of coil tubing sprang up while being cut with a torch.

IncidentSummary: MISS pump down
IncidentDescription: Operators of the RigLock system did not lock the dogs or "fingers" of the system that locks the lube in place before pump down turned on their boost to fill the lube. Once the lube was full, it lifted the lube enough for the o-rings on the RigLock adapter to release the pressurized water. We had already given the thumbs-up to lock the lube into place several moments before the boos pump was turned on.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure release
IncidentDescription: While bleeding off pressure to setting tool with the new course threads, pressure came up the threads and blew pressure at employee's arm.

IncidentSummary: MISS crane roof damage
IncidentDescription: Crane  C25 was being driven to location. Driver had not properly secured the door latch for the cab roof and it was damaged because of the wind.

IncidentSummary: MISS secured area breach
IncidentDescription: Parked pickup behind wireline truck, which was between truck and cranes, so no one would drive in work area or under wireline. Employee noticed pickup go around our pickup. Third party pickup stopped 10' from wireline.

IncidentSummary: IE was at the shop loading #20 setting tools into the bed of the company truck, without help, and fe
IncidentDescription: IE was at the shop loading #20 setting tools into the bed of the company truck, without help, and felt a twinge in lower back. IE was then sent to Casper, WY on the way back to home district. Upon waking the next morning at 3 AM, IE experienced extreme pain in lower back and numbness in left leg.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while loading #20 setting tools into the bed of the truck, without help.

IncidentSummary: While putting return line back in slobber tank, IE was nearly blown off side of trailer after ball v
IncidentDescription: While putting return line back in slobber tank, IE was nearly blown off side of trailer after ball valve opened with 2800 psi of gas. IE grabbed tote to keep from falling and strained right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder after grabbing tote to stop fall off side of trailer when tank ball valve with 2800 psi opened and blew him off the side.

IncidentSummary: While drilling ahead Generator 2 went down. The employee put on a harness and went on top of genera
IncidentDescription: While drilling ahead Generator 2 went down. The employee put on a harness and went on top of generator to check the coolant level. As soon as the employee's foot touched the radiator cap by the sight glass the cap blew off. When the cap blew off coolant got on employees right forearm. Employee got down from generator and went to use the shower in the hopper house to get coolant off of him. After using the shower he noticed blisters forming on his right fore arm. He immediately let the rig manager know and put it in cold water.
InjuryDescripti: Superficial burns on right forearm after radiator cap blew off while employee was checking coolant level.

IncidentSummary: MISS pump down/wind gusts
IncidentDescription: Wind was reading 25-30 mph with 30-36 mph gusts. Jake relayed to company man that we would shut the job down until safe. Took reading every five minutes and was told to proceed even though our crew did not agree. Lube was lifted in the air and while moving into position to unscrew the entry guide, several wind gusts set the crane in an uncontrolled load situation. This pushed the load toward the employee in the man basket. He had no time to adjust the basket so he moved in the basket to keep from being hit.  Load was controlled and lowered to the ground and job was stopped until safe to continue.

IncidentSummary: Hole was blown in vibrating hose in sub. Employee was string out high pressure 2Gǥ hose from #1 pump
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hole was blown in vibrating hose in sub. Employee was string out high pressure 2Gǥ hose from #1 pump house to rig floor to circulate thru pump in sub while waiting for replacement hose. While walking forward with hose employees left foot slipped off matting board to ground level approx 6Gǥ causing employee to lose balance. When employee tried to balance self with right foot it twisted under his weight causing strain in right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle when employee was walking across deck stepping down to ground level about 6", slipped losing his balance.

IncidentSummary: As IE was helping to place lubricator on trailer, it rolled and pinched left hand between lubricator
IncidentDescription: As IE was helping to place lubricator on trailer, it rolled and pinched left hand between lubricator and trailer.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand after it was caught between lubricator and trailer.

IncidentSummary: After the IE had put his things in the company truck , the tip of the left ring finger was slammed i
IncidentDescription: After the IE had put his things in the company truck , the tip of the left ring finger was slammed in the door at it was shut.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to tip of left left ring finger after shutting the truck door on it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/pressure gauge
IncidentDescription: During rig service crew LOTO/TO number one pump, an employee was helping the Derrick man check out and service mud pumps. Employee was told to replace a pressure gauge on the filter housing for the external mud pump oilier. Employee started to unscrew gauge when derrickman stopped him. He notice there was still pressure on the gauge, so he opened valve to drain pressure off filter housing.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/pipe walking
IncidentDescription: New employee was walking on casing.

IncidentSummary: IE arrived at the office and while unlocking the door was stung by a bee on the neck and hand.
IncidentDescription: IE arrived at the office and while unlocking the door was stung by a bee on the neck and hand.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to hand and neck after being stung by a bee while unlocking the office door.

IncidentSummary: IE and Juan Garza were trying to screw 7/8" rods back on and had turned 40-50 rounds to the right wi
IncidentDescription: IE and Juan Garza were trying to screw 7/8" rods back on and had turned 40-50 rounds to the right with 2-36" pipe wrenches, creating torque. One pipe wrench was removed and as they were about to start walking it back in order to release torque, the other pipe wrench slipped out of the IE's hand causing it to swing around and strike left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand after being struck by 36" torqued pipe wrench when it slipped while attempting to release torque on 7/8" rods.

IncidentSummary: Employee was walking up stairs and caught his hand on a bur caused by the crane rigging used to hand
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking up stairs and caught his hand on a bur caused by the crane rigging used to hand the doghouse stairs.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was walking up stairs and caught his hand on a bur caused by the crane rigging used to hand the doghouse stairs.

IncidentSummary: Employee was using a chain come-a-long to remove the drillers side pipe ram. He was lowering the ram
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was using a chain come-a-long to remove the drillers side pipe ram. He was lowering the ram into the manlift basket with the come-a-long when the ram became hung up on the hand rail. He reached over and grabbed the ram to pull it into the manlift basket, once it came off the hand rail it pinched his right little finger between the ram and the hand rail. He was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: While lowering pipe ram into the man basket pipe ram rolled smashing the employees right pinky finger.

IncidentSummary: IE picked up the bottom of the Baker 20 setting tool, gave it a hard shove onto the roller racks whi
IncidentDescription: IE picked up the bottom of the Baker 20 setting tool, gave it a hard shove onto the roller racks while leaning into it and felt strain in the groin area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to groin area while lifting a Baker 20 setting tool onto roller rack.

IncidentSummary: IE was building a perf gun in gun trailer on pump down pad. The IE was turning gun to face sub port
IncidentDescription: IE was building a perf gun in gun trailer on pump down pad. The IE was turning gun to face sub port upwards and while rolling hands forward, a wood sliver from the workbench went through rubber gloves and under the fingernail of the right index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to fingernail of right index finger after a wood sliver from workbench went under nail while building a perf gun.

IncidentSummary: MISS perforating
IncidentDescription: Operator was in the man basket waiting for frac to signal zero. The signal was given but the operator realized the well wasn't closed yet. He signaled them, got out of the basket and stopped them from hammering. They got frac to communicate with the van and made sure the transducer was working properly.

IncidentSummary: The IE and co-worker were removing a gun from the trailer and the IE asked him to stop pulling the g
IncidentDescription: The IE and co-worker were removing a gun from the trailer and the IE asked him to stop pulling the gun several times because he needed to lift it. As the co-worker continued to pull, gun fell onto the IE's right hand.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand after gun being unloaded from trailer fell on it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/vibrating hose, skid
IncidentDescription: While doing a morning walk around the derrick man noticed the vibrating line was rubbing into the skid that the mud pumps set on.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/hazard sign
IncidentDescription: The finger board hazard sign was damaged on only held on by on bolt in mild winds at the time.

IncidentSummary: MISS plug shoot
IncidentDescription: Employee was taking a #10 setting tool apart by hand and when he got to the last thread, the sub blew off due to the trapped pressure. It landed about 5 feet away.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS pressure release protocol
IncidentDescription: At the last stage of wireline, employee was setting lube down to take off Oil States flange. Jake and Alex were next to the well when the line boss came over and told Jake they were going to pressure test. Jake asked him to give them 3-5 minutes and we would be out of the way. The two BJ hands walked away and didn't say anything. Once our crew removed the flange, employee set the lube down and saw the line boss relieving the pressure off the well.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to tail out perforating gun and walk down the rig stairs at the same time. The gun
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to tail out perforating gun and walk down the rig stairs at the same time. The gun slipped, slid over left hand and cut the knuckle open.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to knuckle of left index finger after being struck by perf gun as it slipped while walking down rig stairs.

IncidentSummary: MISS gun string wireline slack
IncidentDescription: A gun string was hooked to a wheeled card and the gun string was set down so that the card was still vertical and supporting the gun string. Slack was loosened on the wireline and it was determined they were ready to suck the gun string back up without looking at the bottom sheave to see if there was still slack in the line. Employee started taking off the car and the engineer had to suck up the line quickly to take the slack out.

IncidentSummary: Rig crew was tripping out of the hole for a bit trip when a top drive pad fell out and struck employ
IncidentDescription: Rig crew was tripping out of the hole for a bit trip when a top drive pad fell out and struck employee in the back of his right hand while waiting to set the drill pipe slips.
InjuryDescripti: Rig crew was tripping out of the hole for a bit trip when a top drive pad fell out and struck employee in the back of his right hand while waiting to set the drill pipe slips.

IncidentSummary: Our driver was eastbound on I-94, cruise control set at 80 mph which is the legal speed. A blue tru
IncidentDescription: Our driver was eastbound on I-94, cruise control set at 80 mph which is the legal speed. A blue truck cut in front of him and the bumpers locked together. Isaiah braked to slow down and the bumper of the other vehicle came off and slung him into the guard rail. The airbags deployed and he slammed him into the guard rail again. He wanted to check on the other driver but fell down upon exiting his truck. Paramedics arrived and he was taken to the ER.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to head, face and neck after air bags deployed after crashing into guardrail.

IncidentSummary: After picking up wiper plate, IE turned and felt a pain in lower back.
IncidentDescription: After picking up wiper plate, IE turned and felt a pain in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after reaching to pick up wiper plate.

IncidentSummary: MISS incorrect foot placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was placing one foot on BOP over cellar to guide tool into well and stepped too close to valve handle causing it to turn and unbalance him. Rather than trying to grab for BOP and possibly fall into cellar, employee opted to fall on the ground on his side. No injury.

IncidentSummary: IE was moving gun from top of bench to rack underneath with another employee. Gun slipped out of the
IncidentDescription: IE was moving gun from top of bench to rack underneath with another employee. Gun slipped out of the IE's hand and caught right middle finger between gun and rack.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right middle finger when caught between gun and rack while gun was being moved from bench to rack.

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging down and while breaking sections of Baker setting tool and right pinky finger was cau
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging down and while breaking sections of Baker setting tool and right pinky finger was caught between stand and setting tool.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right pinky finger after it was caught between Baker setting tool and stand.

IncidentSummary: While maneuvering ground level walk way on fire house skid, employee was pulling out the walkway fro
IncidentDescription: While maneuvering ground level walk way on fire house skid, employee was pulling out the walkway from its scoped-in position when the walkway struck top of his right foot, resulting in minor contusion.
InjuryDescripti: While maneuvering ground level walk way on fire house skid, employee was pulling out the walkway from its scoped in position when the walkway struck top of his right foot, resulting in minor contusion.

IncidentSummary: IE was tailing out a 3" lubricator and tubing puncher and felt a sharp pin-point pain in left lower
IncidentDescription: IE was tailing out a 3" lubricator and tubing puncher and felt a sharp pin-point pain in left lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left lower back while laying a tubing puncher down.

IncidentSummary: Night cap that weight about 74 pounds was being lifted into basket from well. It was a long reach an
IncidentDescription: Night cap that weight about 74 pounds was being lifted into basket from well. It was a long reach and the IE felt a pain in lower back while lifting it over handrail.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while reaching to lift lubricator over handrail.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/drill line HIGH
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Hydraulic unit was shut off to hook up hoses. After hoses were hooked up, hands went to unit and started it again, then started to the rig floor; that was when it was noticed that the control valve must have been stuck in the unspool position and was backing off the drill line causing a huge tangle of drilling line.

IncidentSummary: MISS picking up lubricator
IncidentDescription: While picking up lubricator with crane, green hat wasn't paying attention as lube swung towards him.

IncidentSummary: IE was washing subs from the job when something went in right ear.
IncidentDescription: IE was washing subs from the job when something went in right ear.
InjuryDescripti: Foreign body flew into right ear.

IncidentSummary: Employee was transitioning from the stairs to the ground on the ODS front stairs. As he stepped off
IncidentDescription: Employee was transitioning from the stairs to the ground on the ODS front stairs. As he stepped off the last step to the ground, he rolled his left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was transitioning from the stairs to the ground on the ODS front stairs. As he stepped off the last step to the ground he rolled his left ankle.

IncidentSummary: Employee was in the process of putting a 10" blank flange on a piece of flow line on the bed of the
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was in the process of putting a 10" blank flange on a piece of flow line on the bed of the truck. He had the flange leaned up against the flow line. As he was prepping to put it on it started to fall over. He reached out with his left hand to stop it from falling and it pinched his middle finger on his left hand. The skin was not broken but there is a small abrasion. He did not have impact gloves on.
InjuryDescripti: Employee set blind flange up in place on end of flow line section that was loaded on a trailer. As he was about to install it the flange began to fall. Employee quickly reached to catch it resulting in blank landing on his left middle finger tip.

IncidentSummary: Night crew was rigging up and the IE was using a pipe wrench to tighten up a swedge for the suction
IncidentDescription: Night crew was rigging up and the IE was using a pipe wrench to tighten up a swedge for the suction hose on the pump when it slipped off and caused left index finger to be caught between pipe wrench and base of frac tank.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left index finger after being caught between pipe wrench and frac tank when wrench slipped while tightening up a swedge.

IncidentSummary: MISS pulling rods (BR)
IncidentDescription: Crew was pulling out of hole with 1" rods, standing back. Rods stacked out on flap on rig floor while standing back. Floor hand pushed rod off flap and rod whipped and rod came out of finger.

IncidentSummary: IE started to cramp on rig floor after lunch.
IncidentDescription: IE started to cramp on rig floor after lunch.
InjuryDescripti: IE experienced cramping while latching elevators on rig floor after lunch.

IncidentSummary: IE was taking cam lock on the suction hose apart. As the IE bent over to take it apart, it came apa
IncidentDescription: IE was taking cam lock on the suction hose apart. As the IE bent over to take it apart, it came apart as it was lifted, resulting in the hose springing up and striking left cheek next to mouth.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration near mouth on left side after being struck by suction hose being taken apart.

IncidentSummary: MISS overhead door
IncidentDescription: While closing the overhead door, IE did not notice that the door was not coming down at same speed as motor. When he noticed, the support cables for the door had a lot of slack. He attempted to stop the door, but it fell and stuck the floor. The door stayed in the tracks, but was damaged.

IncidentSummary: Crew was unloading 2 7/8" tubing from the haul truck when I began to feel light headed.
IncidentDescription: Crew was unloading 2 7/8" tubing from the haul truck when I began to feel light headed.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced mild heat exhaustion while unloading 2 7/8" tubing from haul truck.

IncidentSummary: IE was swinging the sledge hammer to tighten the union on the mudline and felt a discomfort in right
IncidentDescription: IE was swinging the sledge hammer to tighten the union on the mudline and felt a discomfort in right side of rib area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right rib area while swinging sledge hammer to tighten union on the mudline.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/window, dropped object(s) HIGH
IncidentDescription: Third party casing torque hand was in tool house on driller's side, when the glare from tool house window was interfering with his monitoring screen; he tried to place cardboard and duct tape on window. When pushing outward on window, it popped out if the frame and fell 30 to ground, shattering.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS pump-down/gunstring out of rope socket
IncidentDescription: At shift change, shift left successfully shot tool in lubricator bumped up. Word from frac was to come off the well. Ground operator hammered off the wellhead to our lubricator connection. The crane winched up about one foot and came off the wellhead and our employee winched down to see the bottom of the tool string. He saw the bottom of the tool come out of the lubricator and the stopped the winch and set the brake so the operator could put the tool guide on. That is when the gun string pulled out of the rope socket.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking back and forth picking up rods and twisted left knee after stepping on uneven ground.
IncidentDescription: IE was walking back and forth picking up rods and twisted left knee after stepping on uneven ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee after twisting it while stepping on uneven ground while picking up rods.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning and painting weight bars and felt a pull in groin area while placing a 3 1/8, 7 foot
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning and painting weight bars and felt a pull in groin area while placing a 3 1/8, 7 foot, 149-pound weight bar back on the rack.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to groin area while placing weight bar back on the rack after cleaning and painting it.

IncidentSummary: MISS snap ring strike
IncidentDescription: A snap ring came loose and struck safety glasses while being loaded into gun barrels.

IncidentSummary: MISS laying down lubricator
IncidentDescription: While laying down lubricator to change out the grease tubes,  the ground guy started to remove the wireline from the bottom sheave, as is normally done, as the engineer started to reel in the wireline.

IncidentSummary: IE was holding capillary string when it swung around and struck above lip as it was about to be band
IncidentDescription: IE was holding capillary string when it swung around and struck above lip as it was about to be banded to tubing.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to upper lip after being struck by capillary string that swung around as it was being banded to tubing.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling bearings and transfer
IncidentDescription: The crew was assembling another rod fishing tool and the derrick hand was unwrapping the transfer from the line that holds the rod basket in place. The roll pin on the bottom of the transfer came out, causing the nut to unscrew. This resulted in the bearings and transfer to fall approximately 80 feet to the walking beam and bounce to the back of the pumping unit.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS falling sub and mud anchor (ND)
IncidentDescription: Crew picked up the 4-1/2-inch X 40-ft mud anchor with a 10-ft sub into the derrick. The crew was tightening the crossover and the no-go with the tubing tongs. The collar on the top of the 10-ft sub unscrewed and fell 50 feet to the work floor. The mud anchor came out of the tubing elevators and fell into the tubing board. No injuries and no equipment damage.

IncidentSummary: While coming out of the shooter's cab of the wireline truck, IE missed the step and fell backward on
IncidentDescription: While coming out of the shooter's cab of the wireline truck, IE missed the step and fell backward onto the top step. The IE's hand went down to break the fall and left wrist scraped the step, causing a small laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left wrist after striking it against top step of shooter's cab due to missing a step and falling backwards while exiting.

IncidentSummary: After changing out quick release valve on brake drum, crew was installing clutch guard back on drum.
IncidentDescription: After changing out quick release valve on brake drum, crew was installing clutch guard back on drum. After guard was moved in and line up with holes, the forklift started to ease, on its own, up with the guard. Crew realigned guard and then shut forklift off. The forklift still eased up slightly and caught Heberto's middle finger between alignment bar and guard. Finger was not hurt and there was no signs of swelling or discoloration.
InjuryDescripti: Small laceration to right hand after glove ripped while realigning guard with holes using faulty forklift.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P Halliburton  frac blowout
IncidentDescription: 3rd party frac was on our well and their low torque valve wore a hole through, resulting in water blowing out all over their area. They shut down and tried to close the well in.  3rd party hand was having trouble with the valve, so our employee helped shut the well in. Well was shut and bled off and the iron changed and frac finished.

IncidentSummary: IE got the man lift to break the setting tool off, after the plug failed to set in the horizontal, t
IncidentDescription: IE got the man lift to break the setting tool off, after the plug failed to set in the horizontal, to be inspected. The IE used to pipe wrenches opened at a 22-degree angle to bear hug them. There was a pop in the IE's chest, while squeezing, as the tool broke loose.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to chest while squeezing pipe wrenches to break tool string off the tractor.

IncidentSummary: IE descended the operator's pedestal of the crane, and felt a small "tweak" in left knee while stepp
IncidentDescription: IE descended the operator's pedestal of the crane, and felt a small "tweak" in left knee while stepping onto the groun . It worsened as the day progressed.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee upon stepping onto ground while stepping down off the operator's pedestal of the crane.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning sleeve and other parts of the plug assembly and felt a sharp pain on the right ring
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning sleeve and other parts of the plug assembly and felt a sharp pain on the right ring finger. IE removed glove and observed swelling and redness around the nail. As the day went on, the area of redness and swelling increased.
InjuryDescripti: Noticed irritation around nail of right ring finger while cleaning sleeve and other parts of plug assembly, while wearing gloves.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up 4 1/2" tubing and the IE was unlatching the tubing elevators from the tubing. Wh
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up 4 1/2" tubing and the IE was unlatching the tubing elevators from the tubing. When the 2nd floor hand pulled the elevators back off the tubing, the IE's left hand was on the horn of the elevators and was caught between the tubing elevators and the tubing tongs.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand after it was caught between tubing elevators and the tongs while unlatching the tubing elevators.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: Crew was laying down tubing and were on the 82nd joint. The operator was running in 2nd gear when th
IncidentDescription: Crew was laying down tubing and were on the 82nd joint. The operator was running in 2nd gear when the IE latched the elevators and the operator picked up on the blocks. When the joint was half-way out of the hole, the IE moved right hand that was resting on the backup knob and accidentally engaged the backups on the tongs. The backups bit into the joint of tubing and lifted the tongs about 4 feet in the air. The IE turned to exit the floor, slipped and grabbed the tubing with right hand. The backups disengaged and the tongs came back down, striking the tip of the IE's right hand. One joint of 2 7/8" tubing was also damaged.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of right hand after being struck by falling tubing tongs after they were accidentally disengaged by the IE and lifted into the air.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE's hand and legs began cramping and started to feel weak while working on location.
IncidentDescription: IE's hand and legs began cramping and started to feel weak while working on location.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced heat stress while fracking.

IncidentSummary: Driver states that he took the turn and dropped to 59-60 and caught the dirt with tag axles. It push
IncidentDescription: Driver states that he took the turn and dropped to 59-60 and caught the dirt with tag axles. It pushed him over, he tried to correct and then tipped over and slid to a stop.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasions to right side of face while passenger in crane rollover.

IncidentSummary: After disconnecting mud line from Christmas tree, employees were picking up the end of the mud line
IncidentDescription: After disconnecting mud line from Christmas tree, employees were picking up the end of the mud line to attach to A-Leg, while picking up mud line hammer union struck handle on boom pole winch breaking winch control handle. Winch was stuck in the full up position, driller ran to shut off HPU, hose stretched all the way which caused the safety clamp, which the winch was tied too, to fail. Mud line came swinging to the floor striking an employee in the buttocks.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was struck on the left side hip/buttock area when mud line fell to the floor.

IncidentSummary: Man on forklift picked up load of tubing and joint fell off end of fork and struck IE's left thumb.
IncidentDescription: Man on forklift picked up load of tubing and joint fell off end of fork and struck IE's left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left thumb after being struck by tubing when it fell off forklift.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: As the IE was pulling, the wireline broke and a strand poked through glove into left ring finger.
IncidentDescription: As the IE was pulling, the wireline broke and a strand poked through glove into left ring finger.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left middle finger after a strand of wireline broke and went through glove.

IncidentSummary: An winged ant flew into the IE's right ear.
IncidentDescription: An winged ant flew into the IE's right ear.
InjuryDescripti: Insect bite when ant flew into left ear.

IncidentSummary: Motor man was working on switching out a drawworks lube pump, after the old lube pump was unbolted t
IncidentDescription: Motor man was working on switching out a drawworks lube pump, after the old lube pump was unbolted the motor man carried the new lube pump to back of the drawworks. He went to lift the old lube pump out of the drawworks and said he said he felt a pop in his back and lowered it down.
InjuryDescripti: Possible lower back strain when employee was lifting lube pump during rigging up operations.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking out of trailer he stepped on a pallet that was placed at the rear of the trailer beca
IncidentDescription: IE was walking out of trailer he stepped on a pallet that was placed at the rear of the trailer because of the muddy location on rolled his right ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after stepping on pallet that was put outside trailer due to muddy conditions.

IncidentSummary: Employee was in pump shed number 1 scrubbing the ceiling with de-greaser. As he was scrubbing some
IncidentDescription: Employee was in pump shed number 1 scrubbing the ceiling with de-greaser. As he was scrubbing some de-greaser came off of the brush and landed on the right side of his face between his eye and nose. He was wearing his safety glasses. He eventually developed a rash the size of a nickel on the right side of his face between his nose and eye. IE thoroughly rinsed his face with water for 15 minutes per the SDS.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was scrubbing top of wall with rig soap, soap splashed off scrub brush and landed on face, under safety glasses on right side of face, resulting in minor skin irritation/inflammation of right cheek.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/slips
IncidentDescription: While tripping out of the hole wet with invert, the slips would get stuck and the hands would dope the slips often. More than one occurrence the slips would get stuck in the master bushings, causing them to be lifted in the air one to two foot. Sometimes they would fall back in to place if they could not be set down in time. When driller set masters back into place, it would take hammers to knock the slips loose. This also took place during tight spots in the well where the driller needed to keep a close eye on his weight indicator, but he didnt get complacent and was able to shut the the operation before putting any employees at risk.

IncidentSummary: While bleeding off tubing from TIW valve first thing in the morning, condensation landed in IE's lef
IncidentDescription: While bleeding off tubing from TIW valve first thing in the morning, condensation landed in IE's left ear after the valve burped.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left ear after TIW valve condensation bubble "burped" while being opened first thing in the morning, causing condensate to get in ear.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure release
IncidentDescription: While rigging down lubricator, a slow leak through working valve caused a build up in pressure. This resulted in difficulty breaking the connection and a sudden release of pressure once connection was broken.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/secured signage HIGH
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: During heavy rain and wind storm, two employees were walking by pump sheds when rig floor standards sign that was magnetically stuck to Derrick a-leg hit the rig mat a few feet behind employee, nearly striking him.

IncidentSummary: IE's left ring finger was caught between two handrails while stacking them on rig beam.
IncidentDescription: IE's left ring finger was caught between two handrails while stacking them on rig beam.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left ring finger after it was caught between handrails and base beam while handrails were being stacked.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken turn buckle shaft eyelet (ND)
IncidentDescription: Crew was jarring on pump when the operator heard a pop and the brake handle dropped towards the floor of the operator stand. The operator immediately hit the e-brake button to stop the blocks from falling. The crew stopped the job and inspected the brakes. They found the top eyelet of the turn buckle shaft broke on the brake band assemble. Nothing fell to the ground and no one was injured.

IncidentSummary: Employee was racking back a stand of drill pipe. As the drill was setting down the stand to the rack
IncidentDescription: Employee was racking back a stand of drill pipe. As the drill was setting down the stand to the racking mat, employee slipped when the pipe was apparently 4Gǥ from the floor. The drill let go of the joystick and the block coasted, setting pipe on the rig floor, landing on employee's right index finger. Derrickhand unlatched the stand and racked it back not knowing employee's index finger was underneath the stand of drill pipe. The other employees on the floor yelled at the derrickhand to latch the stand of pipe back up. He latched up the stand of pipe back up and the drill picked back up on the stand.
InjuryDescripti: While setting pipe, employee's finger got caught between pipe and rig floor as pipe was being set down resulting in a crush injury (partial amputation).

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to take shear screws out of a setting tool mandrel. One of the screws was tighter
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to take shear screws out of a setting tool mandrel. One of the screws was tighter than usual, and the flat head screwdriver slipped off and punctured right thumb while attempting to loosen it.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right thumb when being struck by screwdriver being used to loosen shear screws from setting tool.

IncidentSummary: IE started cramping.
IncidentDescription: IE started cramping.
InjuryDescripti: Mild heat exhaustion while POOH.

IncidentSummary: IE was helping floor hand get the horse head ready to be installed on the pumping unit. As they were
IncidentDescription: IE was helping floor hand get the horse head ready to be installed on the pumping unit. As they were moving it closer with the forklift, the IE picked up the bridle, slipped on a rock and lost footing. The bridle slipped out of the IE's hand and landed on the steel toe portion of his boot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after being struck by bridle when it slipped while being moved by the forklift.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling power swivel (ND)
IncidentDescription: The crew was baling the well and had the power swivel rigged up because of the depth of the well. they were at 17,000 feet. The pin that holds the bales onto the swivel and the still arm sheared off flush with the side of the power swivel. The stiff arm fell approximately 20 feet to the clamps on the static line. The power swivel wrapped around three times before the operator shut down the power swivel. No one was on the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Employee was watching returns at the shakers when he started feeling symptoms of heat exhaustion, (i
IncidentDescription: Employee was watching returns at the shakers when he started feeling symptoms of heat exhaustion, (i.e., dizzy, weak, overheated). He went down to the hopper house to cool down when another employee noticed he was not feeling well.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was watching returns at the shakers when he started feeling symptoms of heat exhaustion.

IncidentSummary: Employee was changing shaker screens when he said he started to lose his breath because of the mist
IncidentDescription: Employee was changing shaker screens when he said he started to lose his breath because of the mist and heat coming from the flow of mud. Employee said he started to feel cramps in his hands and a little faint so employee went to the VFD house to cool down in the AC room.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was changing shaker screens when he said he started to lose his breath because of the mist and heat. Coming from the flow of mud employee said he started to feel cramps in his hands and a little faint so employee went to the VFD house to cool down in the AC room.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling gun cases
IncidentDescription: Employee was pushing gun carrier back so that he could reach another one and the tail of the carrier pushed the one under it off the rack. This caused two cases to drop 4.5 feet.

IncidentSummary: MISS following semi w/ tire blowout
IncidentDescription: While exiting Hwy 52, 18-wheeler pulled in front of our vehicle and and had a blowout. Minor debris struck vehicle and tire flew to the side of the road.

IncidentSummary: MISS removing night cap
IncidentDescription: Verified pressure and started to hammer night cap off well.  Pressure release could be heard. Stopped hammering and had Tyler confirm with frac that the well had zero pressure. Frac stated, again, that well had no pressure. Attempted to remove night cap but could still hear pressure and stopped, again. Frac and Tyler came out, opened valves and found that  frac boost pump was left on.

IncidentSummary: MISS plug shoot
IncidentDescription: Employee was in the man lift waiting for zeroes when a 3rd party hose exploded, sending the hose into a snaking motion with fluid as propellant.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking into the pump-down trailer from the side door and was knocked down after striking hea
IncidentDescription: IE was walking into the pump-down trailer from the side door and was knocked down after striking head against metal doors to the storage area in the tongue of the gooseneck that had been left open.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to top back of head after striking against open door of metal cabinet while walking into pump-down trailer.

IncidentSummary: As the IE was rebuilding a cable head, hand slipped on grease and thumb struck metal armor.
IncidentDescription: As the IE was rebuilding a cable head, hand slipped on grease and thumb struck metal armor.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right thumb when hand slipped on grease while rebuilding cable head.

IncidentSummary: Crew was putting on the wiping rubber at the same time as the IE was lying under the floor between t
IncidentDescription: Crew was putting on the wiping rubber at the same time as the IE was lying under the floor between the base beam and the BOP tightening the nuts on the BOP. The derrick hand put the air slips in the well and the operator lowered them with the winch line on the wiping plate. The operator slacked off the winch and the derrick hand took the winch off the slips. The operator opened the slips so the 2nd floor hand could install the slip door and bolt to the slips. The slips were not centered on the wiping plate pegs and they slid off and fell about 3 feet onto the base beam, grazing the IE's lower back on the right side.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to lower back after being struck by the slips as they fell about 3 feet onto the base beam from the wiper plate.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/J-box, cut wires
IncidentDescription:
While tripping out of the hole the crew broke off stand and racked it back the driller then started coming down and sat the stand on racking mat the Derrick hand unlatched the stand and started to pulling back but the stand hit the toe board and didnt go in the alley way when the stand hit the toe board it caused the stand to fall back out in the Derrick the driller had started coming down due to he thought the stand was clear the round tubing guard on top drive struck the top of stand
causing the guard to be bent into the j-box of top drive this caused the link tilt wire to be cut and the drillers side blower motor wire to be cut and damage to the j-box.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/drill line, draw works
IncidentDescription: Morning tour crew was removing drill line from draw works. At this time it was relief time, or crew change. During relieving the two Drillers discussed that the unspooling of drill line was done. The process of pinning the Derrick cylinders were ready to be done. The cylinders were pinned. Then survey of unplugging all hydraulic lines from to the floor, hoist in position so Derrick would clear. Crew went down to move drill line spool closer to end of mud boat with a crane tied onto it, for slack. In the process of doing so the drill line spool twisted causing the the slings from the crane to stop the spool. When that took place that caused the untied drill line from the draw works to be jerked. The sudden jerk pulled the drill line out of draw works house and up the back side of the Derrick, thru crown and block sheaves, descending to floor, and partly off the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Injured employee twisted his left knee while working on the mud pump. Employees were in the process
IncidentDescription: Injured employee twisted his left knee while working on the mud pump. Employees were in the process of putting MP#2 back together when he stepped onto the skid and slipped causing his knee to twist in an awkward motion. They had vacuumed excessive oil base and had soak pads down on skid prior to starting their task. He has some discomfort on his knee, but is able walk and finish his tour.
InjuryDescripti: Employee twisted his left knee while working on the mud pump, stepped onto the skid and slipped causing his knee to twist in an awkward motion resulting in a strain to his left knee.

IncidentSummary: Employee was painting and started feeling light headed. He was working outside painting the HPU. The
IncidentDescription: Employee was painting and started feeling light headed. He was working outside painting the HPU. The weather was overcast and it was 80 degrees with low humidity. The employee was not working inside a hot building or around any heat source. He stated he thought he was having a reaction to overheating.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was painting when he began to experience symptoms of heat stress.

IncidentSummary: IE was picking up lube to move it over to a well further down the pad. Hoses were double taped to th
IncidentDescription: IE was picking up lube to move it over to a well further down the pad. Hoses were double taped to the lube because the grease head was not attached. The cart for the lube ran over the hoses, causing them to break loose, fall and strike the IE in the upper chest and collar bone area.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to chest and left shoulder after being struck by double-taped hoses that broke loose from the lube when the cart ran over them.

IncidentSummary: IE overheated while operating lay down machine.
IncidentDescription: IE overheated while operating lay down machine.
InjuryDescripti: Overheated while operating lay-down machine.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was rigging BOP off pump on rig floor. BOP was basketed with a rig winch line and caught right ha
IncidentDescription: IE was rigging BOP off pump on rig floor. BOP was basketed with a rig winch line and caught right hand between BOP and winch line as it shifted.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right hand after it was caught between winch line and BOP when the BOP shifted.

IncidentSummary: MISS debris on highway
IncidentDescription: While traveling to location, sand hauler had lost 4" hose that was laying across the shoulder and most of the right lane. Our driver had traffic to the side and behind him and clipped the hose while trying to avoid hitting it. The vehicle behind him was travelling close behind and was not able to avoid hitting it.

IncidentSummary: IE rolled left ankle after stepping over pipe while helping to pull wireline.
IncidentDescription: IE rolled left ankle after stepping over pipe while helping to pull wireline.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after stepping over pipe while helping to lay wireline down.

IncidentSummary: After the safety meeting and prior starting work, an insect bit the IE on the chin. There was no swe
IncidentDescription: After the safety meeting and prior starting work, an insect bit the IE on the chin. There was no swelling.
InjuryDescripti: Insect bite on chin while walking back from JSA meeting prior to starting work.

IncidentSummary: On the morning of 07-18-18 the IE told the supervisor that upper back was hurting. He alleges that w
IncidentDescription: On the morning of 07-18-18 the IE told the supervisor that upper back was hurting. He alleges that while laying down drill collars on 07-16-18, there was a slight strain to upper back. It wasn't reported because the IE thought it would go away, which it has not.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to upper back while laying down drill collars on 07-14-18. Did not report to supervisor until 07-18-18.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was hammering on splash guard on the pony rod trying to get it into position to clamp together sw
IncidentDescription: IE was hammering on splash guard on the pony rod trying to get it into position to clamp together swab rod and pony rod and struck left ring finger with hammer.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left ring finger after striking it with a hammer while hammering on splash guard on the pony rod trying to get it into position to clamp swab rod and pony rod together.

IncidentSummary: IE started feeling bad and vomiting after work. Crew had been working in heat and wearing slicker su
IncidentDescription: IE started feeling bad and vomiting after work. Crew had been working in heat and wearing slicker suits all day.
InjuryDescripti: Slight heat exhaustion experienced after working in heat and slicker suits all day.

IncidentSummary: MISS tool string pullout/fall
IncidentDescription: Disconnected well head and swung over and away from platform. Began to pick up gun string back into the lube and the tool string pulled out of the rope socket and fell about 3 feet to the ground, staying upright in the lube. Crane operator was not moving the lube at the time.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS falling tool string
IncidentDescription: Crane operator boomed up crane when he was not supposed to and the end of the tool got caught up on lip of pup joint, causing a pullout on surface and the tool to fall vertically  into cellar.

IncidentSummary: MISS deer strike avoided
IncidentDescription: Deer ran out in front of pickup and slammed on brakes to avoid hitting it.

IncidentSummary: IE was using a pick to take o-rings off port caps and the pick slipped and struck left thumb.
IncidentDescription: IE was using a pick to take o-rings off port caps and the pick slipped and struck left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left thumb after being stuck by pick when it slipped while being used to remove o-rings.

IncidentSummary: Driver was stopped at a light and was rear-ended by a 2015 Malibu.
IncidentDescription: Driver was stopped at a light and was rear-ended by a 2015 Malibu.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after being rear-ended while stopped at a light.

IncidentSummary: While moving perf gun from back to front of bench in gun trailer, gun rolled off bend and cut right
IncidentDescription: While moving perf gun from back to front of bench in gun trailer, gun rolled off bend and cut right pinky finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right pinky finger after being struck by perf gun when it rolled off bench while being moved.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/BOP, possible obstruction
IncidentDescription: The BOP was tested yesterday offline. The testers didnt bleed the pressure off after testing the blinds. We assumed they did because we saw them removing their fitting from the test stump while we were unhooking the hydraulics to connect to the sub walking feet. We didnt realize until today when we couldnt get the bolts broke on the test stump, with the hydraulic wrench or a hammer wrench, as we were getting everything ready to nipple up.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure release/flying pipe
