IncidentDescription: While taking a Baker 20 setting tool apart that was held in a vice, the 20 lb piece of pipe flew about 30 ft across the shop when the bleeder piece was twisted with a pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: The IE was light headed and dizzy upon coming down from the derrick after racking pipe.
IncidentDescription: The IE was light headed and dizzy upon coming down from the derrick after racking pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Experienced symptoms of slight heat exhaustion upon exiting derrick after racking pipe.

IncidentSummary: Employee was throwing trash into trash bin from the ladder. Trash cans were on a pallet. Employee lo
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Employee was throwing trash into trash bin from the ladder. Trash cans were on a pallet. Employee lost handle of trash can and attempted to catch the can when the ladder slipped from under him and he fell to the ground landing on his back.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was throwing trash into trash bin from the ladder when the ladder slipped from under him and he fell to the ground landing on his back resulting in a possible lower back strain.

IncidentSummary: IE was opening the front gate to the employees parking lot and felt something go in eye.
IncidentDescription: IE was opening the front gate to the employees parking lot and felt something go in eye.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to right eye after being struck by an insect while opening the gate.

IncidentSummary: IE jumped on pipe wrench to break weight bar and landed on feet. Bent over to place pipe wrench unde
IncidentDescription: IE jumped on pipe wrench to break weight bar and landed on feet. Bent over to place pipe wrench under CCL and back popped.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while bending over to place pipe wrench under CCL to break weight bar.

IncidentSummary: IE crouched down to pick up a flange bolt nut and felt a twinge in lower left back/hip area.
IncidentDescription: IE crouched down to pick up a flange bolt nut and felt a twinge in lower left back/hip area.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower left back/hip while bending over to pick up a flange bolt nut.

IncidentSummary: Our driver was stopped at a red light and was rear-ended by vehicle #2 causing him to strike the bac
IncidentDescription: Our driver was stopped at a red light and was rear-ended by vehicle #2 causing him to strike the back of vehicle #3 stopped in front of him.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to head when it hit the back of the seat in vehicle accident.

IncidentSummary: After replacing the fluid end on pump 9, the crew was lifting the pump manifold to flange it back to
IncidentDescription: After replacing the fluid end on pump 9, the crew was lifting the pump manifold to flange it back to the pump when the u-bolt holding the manifold on the support stand stripped out of the bracket, causing the manifold to strike the IE on the right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right shoulder after being struck by pump manifold that fell when the u-bolt stripped out of the bracket while lifting it to flange it back to the pump.

IncidentSummary: While driving north on I-25, a deer ran in front of truck. Hit the brakes and struck the deer going
IncidentDescription: While driving north on I-25, a deer ran in front of truck. Hit the brakes and struck the deer going about 75 mph. Air bags deployed.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to chest and face when struck by air bags after hitting deer.

IncidentSummary: Employee was lowering the toolstring down from the lubricator and the IE was aligning the wheels wit
IncidentDescription: Employee was lowering the toolstring down from the lubricator and the IE was aligning the wheels with the string. The IE was using right leg to push the wheels forward and fell to the ground due to all of the IE's weight being on left leg, causing it to give out.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee after it gave out while putting all of his weight on it while trying to align lay-down wheels with string.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/winch line
IncidentDescription: Third party trucking company was attempting to pull 1# mud pump forward into place with their bed truck. During this operation the 1  inch winch line center core failed near the truck winch causing the outer lays of wire rope to break and pig tail.

IncidentSummary: Marathon personnel gave orders to flow well back to gas separator so rig hands disconnected lines fr
IncidentDescription: Marathon personnel gave orders to flow well back to gas separator so rig hands disconnected lines from rig pump and tied pump lines from tree to Knight manifold. IE then opened bottom master valve on tree and pressure on manifold gauge read 3800psi. After watching gauge for 30 seconds, the chiksan parted on top of the well head and the lower section of the mud line at the hammer union parted. Employees noticed the IE on the ground and that the pressure released caused rocks on the ground to pepper him.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to multiple external areas after being peppered by rocks when the chicksan parted on the top of the well head and the lower section of the mud line at the hammer union parted due to pressure release.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/slips
IncidentDescription: When backing out of tool joint for connection slips slipped on pipe causing string to drop where tool joint landed on tool joint putting strain on slips when tool joint hit slips and pulling a few threads on burn sub.

IncidentSummary: MISS driving
IncidentDescription: While driving home, another driver went to pass another vehicle and Steve had to pull completely off the road to avoid a head-on collision.

IncidentSummary: IE was unscrewing the bull plug off the mud anchor with a 36-inch pipe wrench. The bull plug came lo
IncidentDescription: IE was unscrewing the bull plug off the mud anchor with a 36-inch pipe wrench. The bull plug came loose and the IE slipped and fell over the k-bar while turning away to avoid the fluid and strained left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee after tripping and falling over k-bar while moving away to avoid fluid after bull plug came loose off the mud anchor.

IncidentSummary: MISS sheared rig floor pin bolt -falling floor wing (ND)
IncidentDescription: The crew was rigging up the rig floor using the winch line and two tag lines on a lLoadcraft rig. The floor was in a vertical position about 8 feet off the ground. The front offside bolt for a pin that holds the floor wing hinge sheared. The front offside pin came out and and the floor wing slid off the back offside pin and fell 8 feet to the ground.

IncidentSummary: While the IE was cleaning a sub with a rag, a metal sliver went through rubber glove and punctured r
IncidentDescription: While the IE was cleaning a sub with a rag, a metal sliver went through rubber glove and punctured right index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right index finger after being stuck by metal sliver while cleaning sub.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling a charge carrier out of a piece of pipe.
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling a charge carrier out of a piece of pipe.
InjuryDescripti: Small laceration to right hand after sliding across a piece of metal on gun carrier while sliding them out of the barrels. Not wearing gloves.

IncidentSummary: Crew was tripping tubing in the hole when the IE came down from the tubing board to let Dan Jalufka
IncidentDescription: Crew was tripping tubing in the hole when the IE came down from the tubing board to let Dan Jalufka know he was feeling a little exhausted.
InjuryDescripti: Slight heat exhaustion while working derricks tripping in tubing.

IncidentSummary: While putting a 6-foot gun string on the rack, the gun fell about 1.5 feet and struck the IE's left
IncidentDescription: While putting a 6-foot gun string on the rack, the gun fell about 1.5 feet and struck the IE's left foot. The IE was not wearing steel-toed boots.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of left foot after being struck by falling gun as it was being put on the rack.

IncidentSummary: Our driver was on the way home on SH146 when a vehicle struck driver side door. Our driver had a gre
IncidentDescription: Our driver was on the way home on SH146 when a vehicle struck driver side door. Our driver had a green light and the other vehicle had a red light. There was a witness.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to torso after being struck by side air bags that deployed after being stuck by vehicle.

IncidentSummary: Crew had adjusted the horse head and the IE was coming down on the winch with the pickup rod and the
IncidentDescription: Crew had adjusted the horse head and the IE was coming down on the winch with the pickup rod and the rod elevator between legs while the 2nd employee was tailing out the pickup rod. The IE was facing the 2nd employee instead of the operator. The IE was getting close to the fence of the pumping unit so the operator stopped the winch. The 2nd employee pulled back on the pickup rod and pulled the IE back about 2 feet from the fence. The IE let go of the pickup rod and rod elevator, letting them drop about 4 feet to the ground. The IE reached around to push away from fence and strained right shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder while reaching back to push away from fence while coming down on the winch line.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/hose
IncidentDescription: While picking up flow line with boom line, winch hose blew off crimped end of hose that goes to filter on winch.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/lift subs, inspection(s) HIGH
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Upon reaching BHA to lay down tools, lift subs were inspected and calipered resulting in finding that they were not in range of ours or API specifications. (NOTE: BH distributor)

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/drill line, trip hazard
IncidentDescription: After reaching bottom from TIH, employees were cleaning rig floor. One employee went to OSD doghouse to put up tools, and noticed that the drill line from the horse head to drill line spool was not in its floor cover guard. He realized this was creating a trip hazard in front of an exit point.

IncidentSummary: Crew lowered sand pump and pulled diving board back to have room to lower pump and break it out. IE
IncidentDescription: Crew lowered sand pump and pulled diving board back to have room to lower pump and break it out. IE turned around with back to pump to avoid possible sand and pressure. The IE did not realize the rig floor had been moved, turned around and stepped through floor, bumping right knee and rib cage
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to torso and right knee after stepping through rig floor after not realizing floor had been moved while turned around.

IncidentSummary: Employees were removing the wellhead bolts from the flange to be able to remove the stack tool and l
IncidentDescription: Employees were removing the wellhead bolts from the flange to be able to remove the stack tool and log the wellhead. The tool hit the pack-off head before it was lifted off the well and pulled out of the cable head. The wireline pulled through the top sheave and fell about 50 feet to the ground. As it fell, the end struck the IE on left shoulder and chest.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder and chest after being struck by end of wireline as it fell 50 feet to the ground after pulling through top sheave.

IncidentSummary: IE was holding a 4-foot rope that was attached to a 1 3/4" bolt while installing the caps on a pump.
IncidentDescription: IE was holding a 4-foot rope that was attached to a 1 3/4" bolt while installing the caps on a pump. New-hire, Jose Neito was swinging a 15lb sledge and missed the bolt on the second attempt. The sledge came loose and struck the IE on the left quad.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left leg after being struck by sledge after it came loose while being used by another employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS top sheave
IncidentDescription: Employee noticed the top sheave was not secured properly so operation was shut down and it was secured correctly.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging up Rig 37 in the yard to look it over, and was getting ready to lay down the floor
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging up Rig 37 in the yard to look it over, and was getting ready to lay down the floor with the winch line. IE was running winch line through the new 2-legged spreader lanyard on the rig floor when the line slacked/rolled and unhooked from lanyard and struck the IE below the right eye.
InjuryDescripti: Small laceration below right eye after being struck by winch line as it unhooked from new 2-legged spreader lanyard.

IncidentSummary: IE was lifting a tool trap off a trailer that weighs approx. 200-300-lbs. The trap was standing vert
IncidentDescription: IE was lifting a tool trap off a trailer that weighs approx. 200-300-lbs. The trap was standing vertically and the lifting strap was in a choking style around the bottom of the tool trap. The IE was holding the top of the trap and when the crane operator lifted the trap, it flipped on its side. As the IE tried to balance it, the right forearm was strained.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right arm while attempting to hold the tool trap after if flipped on its side while being lifted with the crane.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/faulty seal, cutting box
IncidentDescription: Open top cutting box back door seal was leaking when discharged vacuum into it.

IncidentSummary: IE was on trailer checking grease tote, slipped on grease and fell off trailer landing on the ground
IncidentDescription: IE was on trailer checking grease tote, slipped on grease and fell off trailer landing on the ground injuring arm.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to arm after slipping and falling off grease trailer while checking grease tote.

IncidentSummary: Employee was adding a secondary support brace to the shaker folding catwalk when the primary support
IncidentDescription: Employee was adding a secondary support brace to the shaker folding catwalk when the primary support broke, causing it to swing downward and strike employee on his left eye brow, causing about an inch long laceration.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left eyebrow when employee was struck by walkway bracing which had broken away from the walkway during rigging operations.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/handling equipment
IncidentDescription: Lowered casing tongs down from Rig floor, when time to unhook the hook from the load the casing hand removed hook and swung hook from catwalk nearly hitting CRT hand in the head.

IncidentSummary: MISS drum/cable head
IncidentDescription: Employee was pulling wireline onto drum during rig down and operator was tailing in wireline at a speed of about 15-20. About 6 to 8 feet before employee was going to stop drum, the drum speed shot up and he was unable to stop in time. The cable head pulled out at measuring head.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/body placement, awareness
IncidentDescription: Operator on fork lift was bringing in a pallet of chemicals and employee that was mixing chemicals had back turned when employee that was mixing turned and noticed that pallet was coming behind him he quickly stepped aside and stopped the job.

IncidentSummary: The crew was TOH with 1" rods and were on the 7th triple when the IE told the operator to stop the j
IncidentDescription: The crew was TOH with 1" rods and were on the 7th triple when the IE told the operator to stop the job so the transfer cable could be fixed. The operator asked the IE if he needs to come down with the blocks and the IE misunderstood and said, yes. The operator told the floor hand to take off the rod elevator and then came down with the blocks with the rod transfer still attached to the rod. The s-hook on the transfer assembly parted and the cable struck the IE's right cheek.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion on right cheek after being struck by transfer cable when the s-hook on the transfer assembly parted.

IncidentSummary: IE's hand was in pinch point area of double hook strap and right ring finger was cut through impact
IncidentDescription: IE's hand was in pinch point area of double hook strap and right ring finger was cut through impact glove.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger, through impact glove, after it was caught in pinch point area of double hook strap while tying plastic water line to tank.

IncidentSummary: IE noticed blood on left hand during the process of cutting armors while reheading.
IncidentDescription: IE noticed blood on left hand during the process of cutting armors while reheading.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand during the process of cutting armors while reheading, without wearing gloves.

IncidentSummary: IE was removing tree bolts and derrick man knocked Kelly hose loose from top of tree. Slack in chain
IncidentDescription: IE was removing tree bolts and derrick man knocked Kelly hose loose from top of tree. Slack in chain wrapped around hose and it hit IE on the left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left shoulder after being struck by Kelly hose after derrick man knocked to loose from top of tree.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/near slip-fall, falling object(s), slips
IncidentDescription: While setting slips, hand slid in water base mud on rotary mat causing slips to fall and nearly strike his foot.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/casing elevator(s) HIGH
IncidentDescription: Franks Casing crew rigged up and ready to run two different size casing string a 4.5 casing by 5.5 casing the driller got the ID of the casing elevators and the ID of the casing when he noticed the casing elevators were the wrong size. The casing elevators that were rigged up were for the the 5.5 string of casing and not the 4.5 string of casing.

IncidentSummary: Employee was taking a joint of drill pipe to the catwalk trough when he stepped on a 1-1/4 inch long
IncidentDescription: Employee was taking a joint of drill pipe to the catwalk trough when he stepped on a 1-1/4 inch long shard of metal from the drill pipe. The metal went through his sole of his left boot and punctured his left foot. The puncture was minor.
InjuryDescripti: Employee walked on a small shard of metal which penetrated the sole of his boot and made a small puncture to left foot.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While laying 1-1/4" weight bars down onto rod trailer, weight bar rolled off trailer and struck the
IncidentDescription: While laying 1-1/4" weight bars down onto rod trailer, weight bar rolled off trailer and struck the IE's right pinky finger. IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right pinky finger after it was caught between weight bar and rod trailer.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While laying 1-1/4" weight bar down onto rod trailer, weight bar rolled off and stuck the top of the
IncidentDescription: While laying 1-1/4" weight bar down onto rod trailer, weight bar rolled off and stuck the top of the IE's right foot just behind the steel toe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of right foot after being struck by weight bar when it rolled off rod trailer.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/near slip-fall, falling object(s), slips
IncidentDescription: While drilling #4 surface hole the 4x4 trash pump stopped working.  As we were changing out pumps one of the hands tripped on suction hose as he was hooking discharge hose.  There was a lot of gumbo mud on and around hoses from drilling previous holes.

IncidentSummary: While rigging up, IE was stung by a yellow jacket.
IncidentDescription: While rigging up, IE was stung by a yellow jacket.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to neck after being stuck by a yellow jacket while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: Upon cutting coiled tubing, crew pulled out of the hole and started breaking the lubricator from the
IncidentDescription: Upon cutting coiled tubing, crew pulled out of the hole and started breaking the lubricator from the pump in tee. The IE was shaking the pump in tee and a Coiled operator was shaking the lubricator with the pack-off hose. The lubricator was sitting at an angle due to the coiled tubing being bent. When the lubricator came free from the tubing, the tubing spun around towards the coiled unit's crane hook and caught the IE's right index finger between pump and tee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right index finger after it was caught between crane hook and pump in tee while breaking the lubricator from pump in tee.

IncidentSummary: IE slipped in grease on back of the trailer steps and rolled left ankle.
IncidentDescription: IE slipped in grease on back of the trailer steps and rolled left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after slipping in grease on trailer steps.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/bit box
IncidentDescription: During picking up bit for BHA, bit box lip got caught underneath catwalk trough. Causing the bit box to get in a bind.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/flow line, nipple
IncidentDescription: While making a connection, a floor hand bypassed air to the flow line. As he bypassed the air the 2 high psi nipple which attaches the bypass line to the flow line blew out.

IncidentSummary: Crew was putting the work floor on the rig with the help of the crane operator. The IE's job was to
IncidentDescription: Crew was putting the work floor on the rig with the help of the crane operator. The IE's job was to put the leg on the floor with the help of the Operator. Te leg had a pin through it with the winch line tied off so the Operator could lift and hod it up while the IE ran it through the brace to the ground. The scaffold that the IE was standing on was over the brace that the leg of the floor was being run through. The IE was shaking the leg and turning it by hand to get it to go down. There was too much slack on the winch line and when the leg slid down through the brace, it went further than expected and the pin running through the leg struck the IE's left middle finger against the scaffold railing.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left middle finger after it was caught between rig floor leg pin and the rail of the scaffold.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up pipe using the catwalk when the cable on the catwalk parted. The Murphy company
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up pipe using the catwalk when the cable on the catwalk parted. The Murphy company man and the Rig Supervisor agreed to use the cat line to pick up the remaining 25 joints of tubing to complete the job. There were 8 joints left to pick up. As the IE walked over to get the cat line for the next joint before it had been picked up all the way to the work floor, the pipe came out of the trough and brushed up against left arm.
InjuryDescripti: Slight contusion to left arm after being grazed by pipe after it came out of the trough.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/broken bolt
IncidentDescription: Employees were attempting to stand a light on the pits. As he was walking the light up, he crossed the plate that joins the pits. When he stepped on the plate, the bolt broke.

IncidentSummary: Employee was squatting on a 12" beam in the substructure attempting to tie back a 2" flex line when
IncidentDescription: Employee was squatting on a 12" beam in the substructure attempting to tie back a 2" flex line when he lost his footing after shifting to have a better angle. As employee fell forward, he tried catching himself with his left arm, which resulted in it being dislocated at the shoulder. Employee was tied off, which prevented him from falling to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: When attempting to grab stand pipe bleed off hose, employee slipped while on beam of substructure; employee was tied off but first reaction was try to grab something. In that instance, his hand slipped and put his shoulder in an awkward position dislocating it.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to break cable head apart and slipped and fell onto right knee while putting body
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to break cable head apart and slipped and fell onto right knee while putting body weight on wrench.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee after slipping and falling on it while putting his weight on wrench to break cable head apart.

IncidentSummary: IE was pressure washing a truck in the wash bay with a short-wand sprayer and the hose got tangled u
IncidentDescription: IE was pressure washing a truck in the wash bay with a short-wand sprayer and the hose got tangled up. As the IE reached down with left hand to untangle it with the wand in the right hand still engaged, the left wrist ran across the spray of water.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left wrist after being struck by high-pressure spray from wand while trying to untangle hose.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/broken hobble, falling object(s)
IncidentDescription: While reaming out of derrick, blocks were run up to latch stand; hobble broke, causing it to fall to floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/lifting handle
IncidentDescription: While picking pump shell off of mud pump 1, the lifting handle on the top cracked and broke before the pump shell was lifted, causing potential for personnel and equipment damage.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/sliding handrail
IncidentDescription: While sucking out the the cellar, employee went to climb down the ladder on the scaffolding into the cellar. When reaching for the handrail, employee grabbed the sliding handrail and slipped, but caught himself with the other hand.

IncidentSummary: IE was at the yard and while sitting down on the bench located in front of the yard, the opposite si
IncidentDescription: IE was at the yard and while sitting down on the bench located in front of the yard, the opposite side of the bench lifted up and the IE fell to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to buttock after falling on the ground when opposite end of bench lifted up while sitting down.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning bench off and cut left ring finger on a razor blade while grabbing a set of vise gri
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning bench off and cut left ring finger on a razor blade while grabbing a set of vise grips.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left ring finger after striking against razor blade on bench while grabbing a pair of vise grips.

IncidentSummary: IE was taking a smoke break from cleaning the wireline centralizers and was stung twice on the right
IncidentDescription: IE was taking a smoke break from cleaning the wireline centralizers and was stung twice on the right bicep by a hornet.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to right arm after being stung twice by a hornet while taking a break from cleaning the wireline centralizers.

IncidentSummary: While unloading tubing off the haul trucks, a bee stung the IE on the left elbow.
IncidentDescription: While unloading tubing off the haul trucks, a bee stung the IE on the left elbow.
InjuryDescripti: Slight irritation to left elbow after being stung by a bee while unloading pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/dropped-fallen object(s), casing elevators
IncidentDescription: 7 casing elevators were sitting on the front of the catwalk. Hand didnt notice them sitting there, and he picked up the trough causing the casing elevators to fall inside the catwalk.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/travel assembly
IncidentDescription: Running in a joint of 9.625 casing, the casing hand tripped the lever and set the slips. The travel assembly then stacked out on top of the casing and spooled slack in the drilling line.

IncidentSummary: Employee got his left hand caught between two drill pipes as they were racking drill pipe back. Empl
IncidentDescription: Employee got his left hand caught between two drill pipes as they were racking drill pipe back. Employee says that another drill pipe was sticking out too far and caught his elbow as he guided the drill pipe in place and delayed him from moving his hand out from between the pipes.
InjuryDescripti: Injured employee got his left hand caught between two drill pipes as they were racking drill pipe back. Employee says that another drill pipe was sticking out too far and caught his elbow as he guided the drill pipe in place and delayed him from moving his hand out from between the pipes.

IncidentSummary: IE doesn't know exactly what happened, but noticed a bruise on left bicep upon taking shirt off to s
IncidentDescription: IE doesn't know exactly what happened, but noticed a bruise on left bicep upon taking shirt off to shower.
InjuryDescripti: Bruise on loft bicep. Doesn't know how it happened.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/ratchet adapter HIGH
IncidentDescription: Ratchet adapter for turning bull wheel sheared off pump while drilling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/improper rigging, un-anchored line HIGH
IncidentDescription: The employee was attempting to re-spool the winch line and noticed it had been incorrectly rigged up. Upon further inspection all three of the floor winches had been improperly rigged up.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling diaper pin (KN)
IncidentDescription: Crew was running tubing in the hole while pipe was set in the slips. The block slightly swung and caused the tong line to knock the diaper pin off that was attached to the load pin on the blocks. The diaper pin fell about 15 feet and landed on the ground. No employees were on the floor and no equipment was damaged.

IncidentSummary: While pulling tubing out of the hole, the IE was sprayed with Calcium chloride while stabbing the T.
IncidentDescription: While pulling tubing out of the hole, the IE was sprayed with Calcium chloride while stabbing the T.I.W.
InjuryDescripti: Slight irritation to ext. body parts after being sprayed with Calcium chloride while pulling tubing out of hole.

IncidentSummary: While pulling tubing out of the hole, the IE was sprayed with Calcium chloride while stabbing the T.
IncidentDescription: While pulling tubing out of the hole, the IE was sprayed with Calcium chloride while stabbing the T.I.W.
InjuryDescripti: Slight irritation to ext. body parts after being sprayed with Calcium chloride while pulling tubing out of hole.

IncidentSummary: IE grabbed the railing with both hands while getting down from bed of pick-up after fueling slip tan
IncidentDescription: IE grabbed the railing with both hands while getting down from bed of pick-up after fueling slip tank. Stepped down with lift foot onto the step hanging below the bed. Shifted weight to left foot and right foot, which was still in truck bed, slipped and caught on angle iron in bed.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right foot after catching it on angle iron while stepping down from bed of pick-up truck

IncidentSummary: MISS missing trailer hitch pin
IncidentDescription: After completing job, employee was driving about 30 mph when trailer dropped. The trailer was secured by safety chains and upon inspection, the hitch pin was found to be missing. No damage was noted.

IncidentSummary: MISS grease head
IncidentDescription: Employee arrived at the shop and noticed the grease head had come out of the latch on the back of the truck. One side was in the latch and the other was resting on the back bumper step.

IncidentSummary: MISS faulty winch
IncidentDescription: Danny will insert description.

IncidentSummary: The crew latched onto the fish with the power swivel. They could not come down with the joint of pip
IncidentDescription: The crew latched onto the fish with the power swivel. They could not come down with the joint of pipe because of the liner top so they broke out the joint of pipe with the power swivel. They laid the joint of pipe on the trough and as it slid down it caught on the end of the pipe skate. The operator stopped the blocks. The IE waited about 5-10 seconds and started to come down the stairs of the work floor to push the joint of pipe off the trough onto the pipe skate. The IE was on the 2nd step when the blocks swung back and lifted the pipe off the trough. The pipe swung back towards the floor, the IE grabbed the pipe with right hand and the end struck the IE's right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after being struck by a joint of pipe as it swung back towards the rig floor while being lifted off the trough.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was cutting o-rings on the Baker #20 setting tool and the knife slipped and cut bottom of left th
IncidentDescription: IE was cutting o-rings on the Baker #20 setting tool and the knife slipped and cut bottom of left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left thumb after being struck by knife while cutting o-rings from Baker setting tool.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/barbed wire, reserve pit
IncidentDescription: Barbed wire around reserve pit had come off T-posts, unraveled on the ground. Employee walking near reserve pit caught/ripped pants on barbed wire.

IncidentSummary: Employee was in the process of putting the bushings back in the rotary. When they sat the bushings
IncidentDescription: Employee was in the process of putting the bushings back in the rotary. When they sat the bushings down they were cocked to the side. Injured employee pushed and pulled on the bushings pullers. As he pulled back he felt a strain in his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: While installing bushings, employee pulled back on bushing pullers to rock bushing into place; reported minor straining of lower back after pulling.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling joint (KN)
IncidentDescription: Crew was ready to trip back in well and latched on and suspended first stand in air via slip-type elevators and block, placing stand in tongs. Jordon Istre began to rotate joint to make up bit sub to joint. The connection bonding the two joints making a stand began to back out completely and cause the bottom joint to fall about 5 ft, resting on the floor in the tongs which were still suspended about 4 ft above rig floor.

IncidentSummary: Leak and wipe tests were being performed on all sources, due to one failed leak test last week with
IncidentDescription: Leak and wipe tests were being performed on all sources, due to one failed leak test last week with an improper SN. When IE removed latex gloves from right hand, there was a small abrasion below the pinky finger. Upon cleaning with antiseptic pad, there was a small amount of blood. He doesn't remember any pain from being pinch or scratched.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right hand while conducting leak and wipe tests of RA sources and pigs.

IncidentSummary: As the crew was rigging up the lines for the pump, the IE felt a pop in lower back while moving the
IncidentDescription: As the crew was rigging up the lines for the pump, the IE felt a pop in lower back while moving the mud line to make the connection.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while moving mud line to make the connection while rigging the lines for the pump.

IncidentSummary: While removing rotary table bushings, injured employeeGs hard hat was knocked off by lifting sling a
IncidentDescription: While removing rotary table bushings, injured employeeGs hard hat was knocked off by lifting sling after he attached to it to bushing and was holding tension on sling to keep pullers in place. When his hard hat was knocked off, he stood up rapidly and stepped backwards, bumping the left side of his head behind the ear on nearby stand of pipe. Employee delayed reporting injury for two days to supervisor until yesterday evening when he felt discomfort and some dizziness before his tour started. Employee requested to seek medical attention and was taken to ER by Ramon Perez. He was diagnosed with a severe sinus infection. A CT scan was also conducted and showed no signs of complications. Employee was directed by ER physician to take off work 3 days for sinus infection and use OTC sinus meds and to follow up with his personal health care provider.
InjuryDescripti: A small contusion behind the left ear as a resulting of his hard hat knocked off, stepping backwards, bumping his head against a stand of pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS gun SOP not followed
IncidentDescription: Employee was attempting to shoot 2' and 4' gun and noticed it showed a short. Came out of the well and noticed he had kinked the wire while screwing the sub on. Fixed the problem and got back in the well. As he went to shoot the gun, shot the bottom gun on negative and the whole gun shot at once.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/forklift, K-brace
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While operating forklift, operator lost sight of forks due to carriage. While manipulating boom and forks into alternate position, fork hung on K-brace causing forklift to get into unexpected bind.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/tailrope
IncidentDescription: While tailing joint of drill pipe out of wrangler, tail rope came off of joint, swinging across rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS gun run-lightning strikes
IncidentDescription: Clouds started to form around well site and lightning was striking in the distance. Stopped work and checked the weather app. Nearest strike was within 5 miles. Consulted company man and used stop work authority to shut the job down for 30 minutes until the strikes stopped.

IncidentSummary: MISS ladder failure
IncidentDescription: As the employee climbed up the ladder, it gave out causing him to fall off.

IncidentSummary: While opening door to truck bay, IE had finger of right hand on the open button and was looking outs
IncidentDescription: While opening door to truck bay, IE had finger of right hand on the open button and was looking outside as someone drove up to the gate. The IE touched the garage door track with the left hand and was shocked. This resulted in a slight burn mark on left ring and middle fingers.
InjuryDescripti: Slight burn to fingers of left hand after touching garage door track.

IncidentSummary: IE was carrying a Baker 20 setting tool and a packer with another employee. As they were setting the
IncidentDescription: IE was carrying a Baker 20 setting tool and a packer with another employee. As they were setting the tool string down, the IE felt the tool slipping and felt strain in lower back while trying to get a better grip.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back while setting down a Baker 20 setting tool being carried with another employee.

IncidentSummary: IE was breaking out pony rod with 24" pipe wrench and cheater pipe when the pony rod broke loose, ca
IncidentDescription: IE was breaking out pony rod with 24" pipe wrench and cheater pipe when the pony rod broke loose, causing the IE's right knee to give out.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right knee when it buckles while breaking out pony rod with 24" pipe wrench and cheater pipe.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/pipe, rope
IncidentDescription: Pipe jumped over rope, began to swing into derrick when making up pipe in mouse hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS sinkhole
IncidentDescription: Employee was in a porta potty on location and felt it move. He quickly got out just before it sank into a sinkhole created by rain. Just after that, a light plant fell and also sank into the hole.

IncidentSummary: IE was holding hose while sucking out oil in the environmental pipe racking pan. While moving to the
IncidentDescription: IE was holding hose while sucking out oil in the environmental pipe racking pan. While moving to the other side of the pan the IE slipped and fell, landing on left knee and right side of torso.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee and torso after slipping and falling while moving to the other side of the pipe racking pan.

IncidentSummary: MISS dropped sheaves on highway
IncidentDescription: Crew loaded out for the job, did the pre-trip inspection on the truck and left the shop. When they turned at the intersection, the two wireline sheaves fell out of the side compartment of the truck and onto the highway.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/elevated load(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Taking trash out & trash can was elevated off the ground almost fell over a hit a worker walking beside it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/stray pipe
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe in the hole the floor hand tailing in the pipe did not have a good grasp on the rope and let the stand go past the point needed which nearly struck the floor hand running the ST-80.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/V-door side block guide pad, falling object(s)
IncidentDescription: While drilling in the lateral the driller went to make a connection. While setting in the slips the top drill side V-door side block guide pad fell to the floor. The pad fell 12 feet to the floor causing no injury or damage to personnel or equipment.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling tilt stopper
IncidentDescription: While rigging down, a C-shaped piece, the rod basket tilt stopper, fell from the rod basket and landed above the rig engine cover as they were laying the derrick down on the headache rack.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling rod string (BR)
IncidentDescription: Crew was running rods in the hole with pump and rods. Pump hung up, stacking out rods in the hole which created a bow in the rods. The bow in the rods touched a rod that was hanging in the derrick. The pump released in the well causing the string of rods to shoot out of fingers in the derrick and the rod string fell to the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: A joint was unlatched and hit edge of trough. IE lost balance and jumped backwards while attempting
IncidentDescription: A joint was unlatched and hit edge of trough. IE lost balance and jumped backwards while attempting to push joint back in trough. IE landed on feet wrong, rolled right ankle and fell to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right ankle after losing balance while attempting to push joint of tubing to center of trough.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS nightcap placement
IncidentDescription: Set nightcaps in Rig lock system for coil job. When crew returned, pulled four rig lock nightcaps, 30" tall, 7"OD, 174 weight. Set nightcaps on ground vertical.

IncidentSummary: MISS ground rod
IncidentDescription: Light tower was grounded with a ground rod. Tried to pull the rod using wrenches, leverage, hammers, etc, but couldn't get it out. Moved a a Liberty Frac High Pressure sign a few feet over to mark hazard. Liberty safety man asked why we moved sign and then brought an orange cone to place over rod.

IncidentSummary: MISS equalizing pressure
IncidentDescription: Crew was ready to enter the well. Engineer consulted with the company rep. Company rep did not verify the well was bled off and instructed the ground guy to open the master valve before equalizing pressure. High pressure blew into the lubricator damaging our wireline in the lubricator.

IncidentSummary: Crew was POOH with rods and as IE had hand on bottom of rod while putting on 1-inch rod transfer. Fl
IncidentDescription: Crew was POOH with rods and as IE had hand on bottom of rod while putting on 1-inch rod transfer. Floor hand swung rod tongs to wrap around rods and they tangled up with the catline. The IE's left pinky finger was caught between the rod tongs and catline.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left pinky finger after it was caught between rod tongs and catline.

IncidentSummary: As crew was raising the rig mast, a crescent wrench that had previously been left in the derrick whi
IncidentDescription: As crew was raising the rig mast, a crescent wrench that had previously been left in the derrick while replacing the tubing board cables fell and struck the IE on left arm just below the shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left arm below shoulder after being struck by a falling crescent wrench that was left in the derrick during a previous tubing board replacement.

IncidentSummary: IE was laying down 2-3/8" tubing on catwalk pipe racks and began getting overheated and experiencing
IncidentDescription: IE was laying down 2-3/8" tubing on catwalk pipe racks and began getting overheated and experiencing cramping.
InjuryDescripti: Heat stress while laying down tubing on catwalk pipe racks.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While making a connection an employee was tailing a stand into the mousehole to put the drill pipe s
IncidentDescription: While making a connection an employee was tailing a stand into the mousehole to put the drill pipe screen in. The employee tailed the stand into the mousehole and the floor was cleared while the drill pipe screen was placed in the stand. The crew then came back out to the floor to make up the stand to the stump. The injured employee folded up the mousehole cover and leaned it against the stand as they were coming up on the traveling blocks so as the stand came out of the mousehole the cover would fall over the mousehole. As the tool joint came out it knocked the cover open and the employee stepped in the mousehole while trying to tail the pipe to the stump.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was tailing a stand of pipe when he stepped in an uncovered mousehole resulting in a contusion to left leg.

IncidentSummary: The crew had just finished rigging and putting the slips on the floor. One crew member put the 2-7/8
IncidentDescription: The crew had just finished rigging and putting the slips on the floor. One crew member put the 2-7/8" slip dyes on top of each other and placed them next to the handrail on the operator's side of the work floor. The IE went under the floor to help take the bull plug off the backside flow line so they could bleed off the well and was struck on the top of the left foot when one of the slip dyes fell between the toe board and work floor.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of left foot after slip dyes fell between the toe board and work floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/casing protectors, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While lowering the catwalk with casing protectors on skate 2 protectors came out of skate and fell to the ground inside buffer zone where no personnel was present. The remaining protectors were lowered down to the catwalk and taken off.

IncidentSummary: A 3rd party employee was injured on the trip tank so the two rig managers went to help. When they go
IncidentDescription: A 3rd party employee was injured on the trip tank so the two rig managers went to help. When they got down there, they helped with the 3rd party employee for approx. 15 minutes. IE started to feel light headed from seeing the blood on the 3rd party employee, so he went and sat down in front of the shakers. After approx. 10 minutes, once he started to feel alright, he got up to go down to the rig manager's house. As he started to walk across the trip tank, he felt light headed and fell hitting his head off of the valve going from the shakers to the trip tank.
InjuryDescripti: While helping a 3rd party injury, IE became light-headed due to condition which caused him to faint at the sight of blood; IE fell, resulting in laceration to cheek and upper lip.

IncidentSummary: IE was loading guns, opened a box of charges with a screwdriver and jabbed left thumb with screwdriv
IncidentDescription: IE was loading guns, opened a box of charges with a screwdriver and jabbed left thumb with screwdriver while opening the plastic bag containing charges.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to left thumb after being struck by screwdriver being used to open bag of charges.

IncidentSummary: IE picked up gun string with Kyle Renouf to place on outside tool stand for gun change over. Front o
IncidentDescription: IE picked up gun string with Kyle Renouf to place on outside tool stand for gun change over. Front of gun was set on stand and as the IE lowered the back of gun, lost balance because of hole hidden by containment. As the stand tipped over the gun fell toward right foot above steel toe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of right foot after being struck by dropped gun string after losing balance because of hole hidden by containment.

IncidentSummary: IE was on the well stand unstabbing the lubricator and then went down to the ground to help lay down
IncidentDescription: IE was on the well stand unstabbing the lubricator and then went down to the ground to help lay down the tool string. As the IE was breaking down the gun string, there was no stand set in place. When it was unscrewed, the string fell and landed on top of the IE's right foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right foot after being struck by falling tool string.

IncidentSummary: While doing house keeping around the mud pump, employee picked up a fire extinguisher that had been
IncidentDescription: While doing house keeping around the mud pump, employee picked up a fire extinguisher that had been left out of its holder. As employee was stepping off the skid to set the fire extinguisher in the holder he slipped and twisted his left knee as he stepped from the skid to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Injured employee was setting fire extinguisher in the holder when he slipped and twisted left knee as he was stepping down from the skid to the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/drill line, dropped object(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While picking up drill line with crane to bring to the rig floor, the strap that was hooked onto the drill line slipped. Drill line fell to the ground nearly striking employees.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/pressure washer, active breaker
IncidentDescription: Hand was going to pressure wash top of catwalk, but hand forgot to turn off the breaker.

IncidentSummary: IE was reaching for meter for co-worker and left forearm arm brushed against a spur on the bull plug
IncidentDescription: IE was reaching for meter for co-worker and left forearm arm brushed against a spur on the bull plug that was laying on a stand.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left forearm after striking against spur on bull plug that was laying on the stand.

IncidentSummary: MISS tool stands
IncidentDescription: Wireline operator was loading for a job and had some tool stands laid out on the floor where they were working. He tripped on a stand and lost his balance, but did not fall.

IncidentSummary: Crew was in the process of laying down rods. The IE was approaching wellhead to bread out rod and st
IncidentDescription: Crew was in the process of laying down rods. The IE was approaching wellhead to bread out rod and stepped in a hole in grating.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left knee and arm after stepping into hole in grating while approaching wellhead to break out rod.

IncidentSummary: IE was drifting the ph6 tubing while RIH. As the IE took the tubing protector off, the drift was sli
IncidentDescription: IE was drifting the ph6 tubing while RIH. As the IE took the tubing protector off, the drift was slightly stuck in tubing which caused the drift to slide down and scrape left hand. IE was wearing wedding ring under impact glove.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left hand after being struck by drift as it slid down after being stuck in tubing.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While stabbing rubber with joint made up on PS, something fell from above and struck IE on hardhat.
IncidentDescription: While stabbing rubber with joint made up on PS, something fell from above and struck IE on hardhat.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of head, large knot, after possibly being struck by clevis falling from derrick. Could not find clevis. IE was wearing hardhat.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS Wireline unit parking brake failure-Chesapeake
IncidentDescription: Field engineer got indication that the CIBP set and as he was ROH it was determined that the CBIP did not shear from the setting tool and he became stuck in the well. He was advised my management to pull 3500 pounds on the hoist and set the hoist brake to see if the tool would free. He set the brake and heard popping as the wireline unit started rolling backwards toward the well head, crushing the chock blocks and  stopping after hitting the cement barricade.

IncidentSummary: Junk basket that IE was lifting slipped and pain was felt in right wrist.
IncidentDescription: Junk basket that IE was lifting slipped and pain was felt in right wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right wrist while lifting junk basket.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/snub cable
IncidentDescription: While running casing, when attempting to torque up casing, 3rd party hand stopped tong operator to inspect snub cable, and observed that cable was damaged.

IncidentSummary: IE was cleaning and organizing tools in the shop and right hand struck against a broken spring on a
IncidentDescription: IE was cleaning and organizing tools in the shop and right hand struck against a broken spring on a small centralizer on the bench.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right hand after striking against broken spring on small centralizer on bench while cleaning the shop.

IncidentSummary: IE was re-heading and while pulling a strand of wire through the bobbin, the pliers broke the wire t
IncidentDescription: IE was re-heading and while pulling a strand of wire through the bobbin, the pliers broke the wire then flew up and struck above left eyebrow.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left eyebrow after being struck by pliers when wire being pulled through bobbin broke.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/frayed strap
IncidentDescription: Hand was booming out blank cap to replace a washed out cap on pump #3, while booming out another hand noticed the strap was frayed.

IncidentSummary: Crew had just stabbed onto the well and where was getting ready to equalize the lubricator. Jeremy
IncidentDescription: Crew had just stabbed onto the well and where was getting ready to equalize the lubricator. Jeremy Tadlock was in man basket opening the manual valve. He turned the valve wheel (handle) 29 turns, when it suddenly fell off the valve and onto the ground. IE was grabbing to move the vent sub line near the welled and had placed right hand on a lower hydraulic valve. When the upper wheel fell, it pinched the tip of the right index finger on the lower valve. IE was wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right index finger after it was struck by the wheel as it fell to the ground while another employee was opening the valve to equalize for pressure testing.

IncidentSummary: MISS cutting coil/replacing blade
IncidentDescription: Two men on man basket to cut 120 feet of coil. Blade on band saw broke so they brought the basket down and were given new blade. They tried putting new blade on with band saw still connected.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling rod transfer (BR)
IncidentDescription: As the crew pulled the 20th stand of tubing, they heard something fall through the derrick and land in the y-base area by the draw work and found it to be the rod transfer.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS picking up pipe (CO)
IncidentDescription: While picking up singles, the job was stopped because the tong dyes were slipping on the tubing. It was determined that the drag blocks needed adjusting. The tongs were taken off the pipe and TIW valve was installed. The blocks were taken up 15' and brake handle was chained down. While gathering the tools to adjust the drag blocks, the brake handle chain disengaged, the blocks descended and tripped the low set.

IncidentSummary: IE was knocking down pump lines and was holding joint with left hand while spinning off union. As th
IncidentDescription: IE was knocking down pump lines and was holding joint with left hand while spinning off union. As the last thread was spun off the joint, it dropped and pinned left middle finger to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left middle finger when it was pinned under pipe joint when it fell to the ground while spinning union off.

IncidentSummary: IE was driving from Havre, MT to Shelby, MT and stopped at Town Pump Truck Stop. Exited vehicle and
IncidentDescription: IE was driving from Havre, MT to Shelby, MT and stopped at Town Pump Truck Stop. Exited vehicle and backed into a curb that was behind truck door, lost balance and fell to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to calf of left leg and abrasion to right hand after backing into curb and falling while exiting truck at truck stop.

IncidentSummary: The crew was TOH with 47 stands of tubing in the derrick. While the blocks were coming down, the IE
IncidentDescription: The crew was TOH with 47 stands of tubing in the derrick. While the blocks were coming down, the IE grabbed the horns of the elevators, pulling down and pushing away so the elevators would clear the top of the joint of tubing. The IE's left hand slipped off the horn and the elevators did not clear the top of the tubing and the elevators caught the top of the tubing. The elevators closed and with the horns pointed down with the door of the tubing elevators resting on the top collar of the joint. The IE's left hand was caught between the ear of the elevator and the eye of the bails.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left middle finger after it was caught between the ear of the elevator and the eye of the bails.

IncidentSummary: MISS trailer hitch unsecured
IncidentDescription: While travelling over railroad track, the trailer came off the bail because the hitch wasn't properly secured. Operator Stephen Russell drug trailer +-40 yards with chains before realizing it had come off.

IncidentSummary: IE was getting cables out to rig #64 up and raising mast up from the headache rack. Halfway up in th
IncidentDescription: IE was getting cables out to rig #64 up and raising mast up from the headache rack. Halfway up in the air the IE saw the winch line hanging and while grabbing it to correct, the winch line hung up, snagged and twisted left hand.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left hand and wrist after being caught in line while trying to free the winch line when it hung up while raising the mast.

IncidentSummary: MISS accumulator hydraulic valve
IncidentDescription: Tree had two bottom hydraulic valves and had flow cross on top. Crew was rigging up 5K in front of the well when the company man, T Wharton went to check if both hydraulic valves were closed. One was open according to the accumulator. So, he supposedly closed it, but the handle was installed in the wrong direction.

IncidentSummary: Kevin Benge was picking up the joint with the catline winch. The joint hung up and popped back down.
IncidentDescription: Kevin Benge was picking up the joint with the catline winch. The joint hung up and popped back down. The IE was guiding the joint and left thumb caught when the joint came back down and the IE tried to stop it.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left thumb when it was caught between joint and catline after joint hung up and popped back down.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS manlift-guardrail strike
IncidentDescription:
Employee lowered man lift down on on top of guardrail and damaged it. Damage was not reported to the Supervisor directly. Company rep informed the
Supervisor of the incident.

IncidentSummary: When the IE opened the valve on the manifold at 2500 p.s.i., the well kicked and caused the pop-off
IncidentDescription: When the IE opened the valve on the manifold at 2500 p.s.i., the well kicked and caused the pop-off valve from pump to leak pressure out. The IE ran away from the pump and tripped in the mud on location, fell on top of Jonathan RIvera and landed on left wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left wrist after tripping and falling in muddy conditions while running away from pressure release when the well kicked.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing near the rig manifold and was trying to equalize pressure on the manifold to open th
IncidentDescription: IE was standing near the rig manifold and was trying to equalize pressure on the manifold to open the tubing valve. At 2500 p.s.i. pressure increased causing the pop-off valve on the pump to release pressure. As the IE was running away from the pump, tripped and fell to the ground, landed on a chicksan and Operator, Willie Soto landed on the IE.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left knee after tripping and falling while running away after pop-off valve on pump release pressure.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing near the manifold to see if any help was needed when the pop-off valve on pump blew
IncidentDescription: IE was standing near the manifold to see if any help was needed when the pop-off valve on pump blew off releasing pressure. The IE ran away from the pump, tripped in the mud and fell to the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after tripping in the mud and falling while running away from the pump after the pop-off valve blew off and released pressure.

IncidentSummary: Lowering V-door back in position after walking rig, the bullet on the cable struck employee in the f
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Lowering V-door back in position after walking rig, the bullet on the cable struck employee in the face.
InjuryDescripti: While lowering V-door back in position after walking rig, the bullet on the cable struck employee in the face, resulting in an abrasion to the lip.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/stand, dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: After reaming a stand we set slips and broke out of the bottom of the stand drained the mud out of the pipe, while unscrewing the saver sub from the top and picking up the saver sub caught a thread in the top of the stand causing the stand to picked up then fall about a foot hitting the rotary table.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/ladder, uneven surface
IncidentDescription: Employee was attempting to replace a bolt with pin on tank walkway. Placed step ladder on uneven surface stepped onto ladder and ladder slipped on a rock, causing employee to lose balance.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/unsecured wheel mechanism
IncidentDescription: When retrieving SALA block for rig service, the wheel mechanism came loose and nearly struck hand in face.

IncidentSummary: MISS Gulfport/parted strand, dropped object(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While moving subs off containment a strand on the wire rope of the pole truck parted causing the load to drop from its suspended position (2 inches) to the ground. The swamper was the closest worker at the time of the incident was standing 5 feet away. The wire rope had been visually inspected by the truck pusher in the morning and had only been through 2 previous rig moved prior to the incident.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS dropped lubricator-lubricator sling
IncidentDescription: While rigging down lubricator from well and getting ready to lay mast down, Steve Knox rotated the lubricator so he could put the line clamp on it. As he reached up to put the line clamp on, the lubricator dropped and stayed leaning against the well. It was found the somehow the lubricator sling had come out of the hook. The cotter pin was in the hook.

IncidentSummary: Our driver was at intersection and was struck from behind.
IncidentDescription: Our driver was at intersection and was struck from behind.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left side of shoulder and neck from seatbelt after being involved in a vehicle accident.

IncidentSummary: HP-MISS coiled tubing hole
IncidentDescription: As crew was going down to plug #10 at a depth of 12,624, they discovered a pin-hole in the coiled tubing.

IncidentSummary: IE was on the well head connecting the crane to the night cap with a safety valve installed on top o
IncidentDescription: IE was on the well head connecting the crane to the night cap with a safety valve installed on top of the hydril with a chain sling. The IE told the crane operator to lift the chain to get slack out and right hand was caught between night cap and chain.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right thumb after it was caught between chain and night cap as the crane operator lifted the chain to remove slack.

IncidentSummary: IE was tightening up nut on polish rod clamp and hit right ring finger against bridle on horse head.
IncidentDescription: IE was tightening up nut on polish rod clamp and hit right ring finger against bridle on horse head.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right ring finger after it hit against bridle on horse head when ratchet wrench slipped while tightening polish rod clamp.

IncidentSummary: IE bent down to help another employee pick up and set a Baker 20 setting tool, that was standing upr
IncidentDescription: IE bent down to help another employee pick up and set a Baker 20 setting tool, that was standing upright on the floor, on a cart and felt a strain in the middle of back upon straightening up.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower/middle back upon straightening up after assisting to pick up Baker 20 setting tool and set it on a cart.

IncidentSummary: The backups on the tubing tongs were set while changing tubing collar. The IE latched the tubing ele
IncidentDescription: The backups on the tubing tongs were set while changing tubing collar. The IE latched the tubing elevators onto the tubing and the operator started to pick up on the blocks. The backups on the tongs did not release and they fell back down and high-low lever on tongs struck the IE's right wrist.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right wrist after being struck by falling tubing tongs when the backup released after picking up tongs about 4 feet.

IncidentSummary: While attempting to break the swedge off the fluid pump, a small piece of metal flew off as the hamm
IncidentDescription: While attempting to break the swedge off the fluid pump, a small piece of metal flew off as the hammer struck the wing and struck the IE on the left side of the nose.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left side of nose after a piece of metal broke off when the hammer struck the wing while attempting to break the swedge off the fluid pump.

IncidentSummary: MISS wireline pull-out/guns dropped downhole
IncidentDescription: After pressure testing lubricator and opening up the well, the engineer pulled the control lever the wrong way. This caused the wireline to pull out of the grease head and drop to the ground and the guns to be dropped down hole.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/drill line HIGH
IncidentDescription: Noticed the drill line jumped a wrap when trying to get to bottom.

IncidentSummary: While tripping in the hole employee was going to latch a stand and hit elevators with left hand on h
IncidentDescription: While tripping in the hole employee was going to latch a stand and hit elevators with left hand on horn.
InjuryDescripti: While tripping in the hole employee was going to latch a stand and hit elevators with left hand on horn, resulting in a contusion.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to remove the lid of an empty 5-gallon bucket with a pocket knife. The knife slipp
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to remove the lid of an empty 5-gallon bucket with a pocket knife. The knife slipped and nicked left thumb.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left thumb when pocket knife being used to remove lid on 5-gallon bucket slipped.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/taping hooks HIGH
IncidentDescription: While laying out 9 5/8" spider casing crew chained up without taping hooks so rig crew stopped job and put on tape.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/drill line HIGH
IncidentDescription: Noticed the drill line jumped a wrap when trying to get to bottom.

IncidentSummary: While flanging down the flange from the well head, IE was walking around the well head where the cel
IncidentDescription: While flanging down the flange from the well head, IE was walking around the well head where the cellar had been filled in with gravel and stepped through a bridge the gravel made, causing the IE to fall.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after falling into hole under bridge made by gravel around the well head.

IncidentSummary: MISS snagged sling-Marathon
IncidentDescription: Employee noticed sling was caught on the bottom of the grate around the well head while picking up tool string.

IncidentSummary: MISS flange-Marathon
IncidentDescription: When centering tool string to go into well head, noticed flange being lowered and honked the horn so the crane operator would stop. Had him raise the flange so he would not run into the tool string.

IncidentSummary: IE was on rig carrier holding on with one hand and holding a 2-lb hammer with left hand, trying to b
IncidentDescription: IE was on rig carrier holding on with one hand and holding a 2-lb hammer with left hand, trying to break Kelly hose from stand pipe. Upon exiting carrier, foot slipped and the IE landed in a seated position on the carrier, striking the lower left side of back.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to lower back after slipping and falling on rig carrier floor while getting ready to exit.

IncidentSummary: While laying down a joint with the TIW valve in it, IE put two fingers in the end of the TIW valve.
IncidentDescription: While laying down a joint with the TIW valve in it, IE put two fingers in the end of the TIW valve. The joint was shaking and pulled the IE's hand down. He heard a pop, but continued to work and told Rig Supervisor they didn't need to report it.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right elbow (bicep) after joint he was holding started shaking and pulled right arm down.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/welding work
IncidentDescription: Employee was working on installing a new liner washer and was about to kneel down where the welder had just cut off the old brace from the previous liner washer the other employee noticed and stopped him to prevent him getting burned.

IncidentSummary: MISS Range Resources/dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription:
The floorhands were pulling slips after they made a stand of drill pipe to drill with when they heard a noise
and saw something splash in the catch pan on the rig floor on the driller's side. When they sucked the mud out
of the catch pan, they found a safety knife which they think that it was that is what fell to the rig floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/stairs, broken weld
IncidentDescription: I was walking out of the sub and a weld on the top stair broke, which caused me to nearly fall down the stairs.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/protectors
IncidentDescription:
Employee was emptying protectors out of protector bag with the forklift and untied the bottom. At that time
another employee went to pick up protectors off the ground and was almost struck by the protectors falling
out of the bag.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure testing
IncidentDescription: Crew was pressure testing to 9,000 psi on the coiled tubing all the way to the flow back manifold when a grease fitting from one of flow back's valves broke off and fluid started spilling out. No one was around the equipment.

IncidentSummary: Hand was carrying 2Gǥ valve to parts house to repair it. When he stepped on the landing he slipped an
IncidentDescription: Hand was carrying 2Gǥ valve to parts house to repair it. When he stepped on the landing he slipped and hit left shoulder on the ground.
InjuryDescripti: Hand was carrying 2Gǥ valve to parts house to repair it. When he stepped on the landing he slipped and hit left shoulder on the ground resulting in contusion to shoulder.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/black widow spider
IncidentDescription: Employee was cleaning meeting room and went to move the MSDs book from behind the microwave; while handling the book the employee noticed a black widow in between the page dividers.

IncidentSummary: IE removed one safety clip off rig floor and while walking over to remove the other clip, slipped on
IncidentDescription: IE removed one safety clip off rig floor and while walking over to remove the other clip, slipped on the rig floor opening. The IE put hand down to break fall and strained shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to shoulder after tripping and falling over hole in rig floor while rigging floor down.

IncidentSummary: IE was coming down from derrick after running 178 stands, and notified rig manager of a possible str
IncidentDescription: IE was coming down from derrick after running 178 stands, and notified rig manager of a possible strain to the back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to upper back while running stands in derrick.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/bent diaper pin
IncidentDescription:
While working on the ST-80 noticed the diaper pin that holds starter leg pin had become unlatched, due to being
bent.

IncidentSummary: Employee was helping carry bit breaker to hole when he tripped on handle of hole cover causing the e
IncidentDescription: Employee was helping carry bit breaker to hole when he tripped on handle of hole cover causing the end of left ring finger to get pinned between breaker and handle.
InjuryDescripti: Injured employee slipped on hole cover at back of rig floor falling causing the bit breaker to land on his hand resulting in laceration to left ring finger.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While hammering up union inside reel manifold, the hammer handle smashed the IE's left index finger
IncidentDescription: While hammering up union inside reel manifold, the hammer handle smashed the IE's left index finger against the lifting pad eye.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to left index finger after it was smashed between lifting eye pad and reel manifold while hammering up union on inside reel manifold.

IncidentSummary: Michael Shellenberger (Motorman) was getting BOP winches to-operate correctly up and down motion. Th
IncidentDescription: Michael Shellenberger (Motorman) was getting BOP winches to-operate correctly up and down motion. The block with the hook traveling down wasnGt correctly rolling the chain in the block. He had tong heads attached to the hook for weight to get the chain rollers in the block to rotate with the chain movement in which the rollers werenGt rolling properly. He cleaned and lubricated rollers, still wasnGt rolling properly. Rusty Shellenberger installed a screwdriver in the chain link. He was pulling down on the screwdriver to help the movement of the chain downwards. Doing so the screwdriver slipped sideways, causing his middle right finger to get pinched between the screwdriver and the chain of the hoist. This caused a cut on the inside knuckle of his finger. He was not wearing impact gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Injured employee pinched his left middle finger around the joint area while trying to free up a stuck chain from the BOP hoist. Employee stuck a screwdriver in one of the links and used both hands to pull in a downward motion, which caused his left hand to slip and get pinched by the tip of the screwdriver. He has a small abrasion on the inside of his knuckle.

IncidentSummary: MISS Carrizo/pressure washing, "live" transformer
IncidentDescription:
Third party roustabout pressure washing the transformer on the MCC/wire festoon. Immediately after a connection. The lead floorhand observed a third party roustabout about to electrocute himself. The roustabout was working hard pressure washing the MCC/festoon. He was unfamiliar to the equipment he was working on. The lead  floorhand noticed the roustabout was about to start pressure washing the transformer on the wire festoon (right
behind the MCC) and immediately called down to the derrickhand using his radio.

IncidentSummary: The crew was pulling tubing out of the hole and racking it in the tubing board. The stands were abou
IncidentDescription: The crew was pulling tubing out of the hole and racking it in the tubing board. The stands were about 66' long. IE did not mention any incident while working, but after coming down from the derrick, told supervisor that there might have been a light strain to left side earlier in the day.
InjuryDescripti: Slight strain to left side of torso while in the derrick pulling tubing out of the hole and racking it in the tubing board.

IncidentSummary: During troubleshooting efforts, injured employee stepped up on the tool cage in front of drillers ca
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: During troubleshooting efforts, injured employee stepped up on the tool cage in front of drillers cabin with left leg and heard a popping sound and immediate pain from left knee.
InjuryDescripti: Injured employee was climbing up on tool cage when he experienced a loud pop in his left knee.

IncidentSummary: Rig Supervisor and IE were working at the Alice yard getting Rig 142 ready to go out for Murphy. The
IncidentDescription: Rig Supervisor and IE were working at the Alice yard getting Rig 142 ready to go out for Murphy. The IE was on the rig floor removing a bolt from the tongs, turned and right leg slipped completely into opening on the rig floor resulting in abrasion to right leg and elbow.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right leg and elbow after slipping into hole on rig floor while removing a bolt from the tongs.

IncidentSummary: MISS pressure bleed off (KN)
IncidentDescription: Derrick hand, Michael Barnes, opened the bleed-off line and was not aware that both the tubing and casing valves were open. This resulted in tubing hose that was not connected to the well to whip around before he was able to close the valve.

IncidentSummary: While waiting for the tool to come up to stab it in the lubricator, company man did not know there w
IncidentDescription: While waiting for the tool to come up to stab it in the lubricator, company man did not know there was pressure behind it and opened the low-torque valve. The needle valve opened and blew water, striking the IE on the left side of the face and in the left eye.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation to left eye after needle valve opened up and blew pressurized water at it when company man opened the low-torque valve not knowing there was pressure behind it.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/conductor, night cap
IncidentDescription:
While setting conductor into side of sub before rig walk, conductor was loaded on forks long ways. Forklift
operator went to set conductor in substructure with forklift and tilted down, resulting in conductor sliding off
of forks and almost hitting roustabout and floorhand standing to the sides of conductor. Conductor hit night
cap and stayed on top of night cap and edge of substructure. Small Pressure gauge on night cap broke
off and was replaced.

IncidentSummary: IE was pulling a shelf out of a container where it was wedged in with a forklift and when the shelf
IncidentDescription: IE was pulling a shelf out of a container where it was wedged in with a forklift and when the shelf cleared the other standing EQ shelf, it fell over and pinned the IE against the wall.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right forearm after being struck and pinned against the wall by a falling shelf unit.

IncidentSummary: IE was in the process of breaking down a perf gun string (stage #37-39). One of the connections was
IncidentDescription: IE was in the process of breaking down a perf gun string (stage #37-39). One of the connections was difficult to break so the IE placed both hands on the end of a 24" pipe wrench and threw body weight down for maximum force. The connection broke free earlier than expected and the IE's back was jarred.
