InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after the connection on a perf gun string broke sooner than expected while putting body weight on a 24" pipe wrench.

IncidentSummary: Two employees were pulling pipe out of the full scrap metal bin at the yard to be hauled off. One of
IncidentDescription: Two employees were pulling pipe out of the full scrap metal bin at the yard to be hauled off. One of the employees left the area to go to lunch. The IE threw a 6' piece of 2.375" coil tubing from the ground into the bin and was struck on the left side of the face when it bounced back.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to left side of face after being struck by a 6' piece of coil tubing when it ricocheted out of the bin.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling tool string
IncidentDescription: Crane operator swung PLE without communicating with Engineer and without visual on the bottom of tool string. Moved equipment and pulled out of rope socket. Tool string fell 12' to the ground.

IncidentSummary: Crew was picking up tubing with pipe skate and drifting pipe with a rabbit. IE was running the pipe
IncidentDescription: Crew was picking up tubing with pipe skate and drifting pipe with a rabbit. IE was running the pipe skate and rolling pipe when the rabbit got caught in the joint of pipe. The operator noticed the rabbit did not come out of the joint of pipe and stopped the job. The joint was still in the trough of the pipe skate. IE was reaching for another joint when the rabbit came free from inside the joint of pipe and fell to the bottom. The rabbit bounced off the trough of the pipe skate and struck the IE's right arm.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right arm after being struck by the rabbit after it came free after being stuck in a joint of pipe in the trough of the pipe skate.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/dropped joint
IncidentDescription: When picking up drill pipe from trough from catwalk at the v-door with hoist and single latch elevators, the joint was near the end to pass trough hoist spooled up incorrectly as hand tailed in drill pipe hoist cable slipped and joint came down approximately 4.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/broken hose
IncidentDescription: Floorhands making a connection and were torquing the stand once it was stabbed in the stump. While torquing the stand the main 1 hose, going into the hydraulic distribution hose broke and sprayed out hydraulic oil.

IncidentSummary: Our driver was heading south on I-45 and was rear-ended while stopped in traffic. The truck cab fill
IncidentDescription: Our driver was heading south on I-45 and was rear-ended while stopped in traffic. The truck cab filled with smoke after a possible failure of airbags to deploy, which has happened previously in this truck. Driver struck head/nose on steering wheel.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to face/nose after striking against steering wheel after being rear-ended while stopped in heavy traffic. Possible malfunction of seat belts.

IncidentSummary: MISS cracked spare tire bracket
IncidentDescription: Aaron Allred and Frank Udouj, found a cracked mounting bracket when they noticed the spare tire was loose on the trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS truck under wireline
IncidentDescription: During rig up, picked up tool string and was waiting on crane to center it on well head when a truck pulled under wireline.

IncidentSummary: The IE stepped on the step to exit the pump down trailer and it gave way. While trying to catch foot
IncidentDescription: The IE stepped on the step to exit the pump down trailer and it gave way. While trying to catch footing, right ankle turned sideways and the IE felt a pop.
InjuryDescripti: Sprain to right ankle after stepping down on it while trying to catch balance as step gave way while exiting pump down trailer.

IncidentSummary: MISS crew truck - manlift strike
IncidentDescription: Brandon pulled onto location and put  truck in park. Sat in driver's seat and put steel toed boots on. He got out of the truck and walked behind it to the logger's cab and heard a loud noise. The truck had slipped out of park and rolled back into the manlift. Tail light was damaged.

IncidentSummary: MISS broken safety glasses
IncidentDescription: While rigging down lubricator, Noe was pulling on the grease hoses and one of them swung, hit and broke safety glasses. No injury.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/near slip-fall, body placement
IncidentDescription: When tripping pipe out of hole in rainy conditions, derrickman was placing stand in fingers to secure it when he slipped through finger Sala block stopped him before making contact with finger and lower body.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/near slip-fall, hazardous surface(s)
IncidentDescription: Wet surface due to rainy weather and possibly ice conditions employee was walking towards rotary table to set slips when he slipped nearly falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/near slip-fall, foot placement
IncidentDescription: Employee was getting off forklift on a muddy wet area and stepped off on a baseball size rock, when his ankle buckled a bit.

IncidentSummary: MISS Anadarko/unsecured equipment
IncidentDescription: While tripping pipe, our employee noticed a piece of square tubing dangling off rig floor that could have injured someone.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P Independence/pressurized hose
IncidentDescription:
3rd party diesel delivery hand was completing the transfer into mud diesel tank. He blew out line into tank and closed valve. Turned off his HPU pump and began to remove a 3 camlock hose with pressure still in hose.
Opened camlock and hose popped off.

IncidentSummary: MISS 3P Odis - stabbed onto well being fracked
IncidentDescription: Third-party crane, Odin, decided to swing over and stab onto the well that was being fracked on, with rig locks. The engineer was in the restroom and the operators were breaking down the tool string that just came off the well.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/unsecured stand, broken rope
IncidentDescription: While breaking 8 drill collar stand in stump, rope busted on drill collars in derrick board, causing 1 stand of 8 and 6 stands of 6.5 drill collars to go across derrick, landing on the opposite side of derrick. Very high winds were causing drill collars to rock back and forth hitting rope and cutting it.

IncidentSummary: While tripping in hole, a gust of wind blew a stand across the derrick out of the tubing board. The
IncidentDescription: While tripping in hole, a gust of wind blew a stand across the derrick out of the tubing board. The IE was trying to push the stand back to the derrick hand as another stand was pushed by the wind. The IE's left middle finger was caught between the two stands.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left middle finger after it was caught between two stands that had been blown across the derrick and out of the tubing board.

IncidentSummary: IE was unloading tubing with fork lift and pierced glove with a piece of metal that was sticking up
IncidentDescription: IE was unloading tubing with fork lift and pierced glove with a piece of metal that was sticking up from a tubing joint while rolling it off.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to finger on left hand after piece of metal that was sticking up pierced glove while picking up tubing joint.

IncidentSummary: While climbing the derrick ladder, employee felt a pop in the center of his right foot. Employee fel
IncidentDescription: While climbing the derrick ladder, employee felt a pop in the center of his right foot. Employee felt pop as he was using his right foot as his lift off foot while climbing.
InjuryDescripti: While climbing ladder employee felt a pop in the center of his right foot. Employee felt pop as he was using his right foot as his lift off foot resulting in possible strain.

IncidentSummary: Injured employee was working with a third party roustabout to loosen up a turnbuckle from the stack
IncidentDescription: Injured employee was working with a third party roustabout to loosen up a turnbuckle from the stack on the front driller's side of the sub. While attempting to loosen the turnbuckle, the wrench slipped from the roustaboutGs hand and hit our employee on the lip. He has some slight swelling of his lip.
InjuryDescripti: Injured employee was working with a third party roustabout to loosen up a turnbuckle from the stack on the front driller's side of the sub. While attempting to loosen the turnbuckle, the wrench slipped from the roustaboutGs hand and hit our employee on the lip. He has some slight swelling of his lip.

IncidentSummary: Lubricator was on the brackets of the trailer. Normally, the tail-end of the lubricator is put on th
IncidentDescription: Lubricator was on the brackets of the trailer. Normally, the tail-end of the lubricator is put on the ground prior to picking up. As the crew started to pick it up prior to having the end on the ground, they didn't hear the IE try and stop them, due to the noise of the high winds and the rig. The IE picked it up off the bracket by himself, set it on the ground and felt a pain in lower back.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to lower back after picking lubricator up off the bracket of the trailer, without help, and setting it on the ground.

IncidentSummary: IE was building guns and punctured right thumb while trying to guide armor wire, being used to groun
IncidentDescription: IE was building guns and punctured right thumb while trying to guide armor wire, being used to ground the carriers, through the gun carrier.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right thumb after being struck by an armor wire, being used to ground the carrier, while trying to guide it through the gun carrier.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/unsecured joint
IncidentDescription:
While Running 5.5 casing in the hole, catwalk operator was picking up joint of 5.5 casing and kept skate
engaged, while joint was coming up. Elevators were linked out to prepare to pick up the joint, when joint was
ejected from catwalk with skate and left joint teetering on end of catwalk and the top of elevators.  Driller
stopped catwalk operator from moving catwalk any further.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking towards the work floor, misjudged the distance to the base beam, slipped, fell and st
IncidentDescription: IE was walking towards the work floor, misjudged the distance to the base beam, slipped, fell and struck right lower leg against beam.
InjuryDescripti: Fracture to right tibia after slipping and falling against base beam while stepping onto it.

IncidentSummary: The crew had picked up 40-45 single joints of 2-7/8" tubing from a skid jack with a catline that had
IncidentDescription: The crew had picked up 40-45 single joints of 2-7/8" tubing from a skid jack with a catline that had a ring on one end that went over the top of the pipe and a bucket on the other end to slide over the bottom section of the pipe. The driller started picking the pipe up to the floor. About halfway up, it slid out of the ring, fell back into the skid jack and bounced to the ground, striking the top of the IE's left foot in back of the steel toe.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to left foot after being struck by pipe being pick up with a catline when it slid out of the ring and bounced out of the skid jack to the ground.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: While picking up production string, IE was making connection on rig floor and was struck on right bu
IncidentDescription: While picking up production string, IE was making connection on rig floor and was struck on right buttock by another joint that was being lifted with pipe wrangler.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right buttocks after being struck by a joint that was being lifted with pipe wrangler while making connection on rig floor.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The crew was rigging up and had to lean the derrick forward to clear the horse head, which was on up
IncidentDescription: The crew was rigging up and had to lean the derrick forward to clear the horse head, which was on up stroke. The IE was standing between the drum of the drill line and facing the derrick while guiding the belly lines. The winch line was pinched in the hinge of the rod basket. The operator kept scoping up the derrick and the winch line parted about 40 feet from the swivel, came over the crown and fell onto the deck between the drum and derrick, striking the IE on the left side of hard hat and back on the way down.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to left side of forehead after being struck by winch line after it parted and fell to the deck of the rig while rigging up.

IncidentSummary: MISS release tool
IncidentDescription: While rebuilding release took, Jerry noticed the Acme thread on top of the release tool was bent. Further investigation revealed the threads were cracked and nearly broke off from the tool.

IncidentSummary: Crew was moving the rig and equipment 10 feet over to the next well. As IE grabbed the stabbing mat
IncidentDescription: Crew was moving the rig and equipment 10 feet over to the next well. As IE grabbed the stabbing mat by the handles and dragged it waist high to the next well, left hand became stuck and was struck on top by the mat as it was released.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to top of left hand after it was struck by the stabbing mat when it became stuck in the handles upon release while it was being moved.

IncidentSummary: IE was walking over to dog house to retrieve hard hat after lunch and was stung under the chin by a
IncidentDescription: IE was walking over to dog house to retrieve hard hat after lunch and was stung under the chin by a bee. The IE stated an allergy to bee stings.
InjuryDescripti: Irritation under chin after being stung by a bee while walking to dog house to retrieve hard hat after lunch.

IncidentSummary: IE was attempting to remove a piece of hammer handle from hammer head with a cheat. While holding wi
IncidentDescription: IE was attempting to remove a piece of hammer handle from hammer head with a cheat. While holding with left hand and hitting with right hand, hammerhead bounced and struck right pinky finger. Was wearing gloves.
InjuryDescripti: Small laceration to right pinky finger after being struck by hammerhead when it bounced while removing piece of hammer handle. Not using vise.

IncidentSummary: IE was unloading 21' 2"perforating gun from the bumper pull trailer onto the shop forklift. As the I
IncidentDescription: IE was unloading 21' 2"perforating gun from the bumper pull trailer onto the shop forklift. As the IE and Josey Hudson were about to get the guns off the forklift, one of them slipped and struck the inside of the left foot.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to inside of left foot after being struck by perf. gun when it slipped off forklift while being unloaded.

IncidentSummary: MISS setting derrick dogs (EC)
IncidentDescription: After scoping up top section, operator set dogs for it to sit on. Employee looked up and saw that the dogs on the off-drillers side did not kick under the top section.  The job was stopped and the derrick man went up and saw that the bolt that engages both sets of dogs had come out.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/falling object(s), dope bucket
IncidentDescription:
Employee was moving a dope bucket when the handle came unhinged falling on the floor with possible risk to
impact of foot.

IncidentSummary: The IE was cleaning the shop and while wrapping the hose and electrical cord for the hydraulic filte
IncidentDescription: The IE was cleaning the shop and while wrapping the hose and electrical cord for the hydraulic filter cart, right index finger slid across the on/off switch and was cut.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to right index finger after striking against sharp metal switch cover while wrapping hoses on hydraulic pump.

IncidentSummary: IE is alleging that finger was injured while working on a pump on 11/19/18. No one on location was a
IncidentDescription: IE is alleging that finger was injured while working on a pump on 11/19/18. No one on location was aware of the incident and the finger had no obvious signs in injury. It was not reported until 12/4/18, at which time safety, management and XstremeMD were called to consult. After consultation, IE stated that the finger was not causing any pain.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to index finger while working on a pump on 11/19/18. Did not report until 12/4/18.

IncidentSummary: MISS EQT/Dropped, fallen object(s), nipple
IncidentDescription: While laying down drill pipe, the employee unlatched the elevators and noticed a piece of 3/8 fitting rolling on the floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was standing on rig floor where a section of hand rail had been removed to rig up a wireline shea
IncidentDescription: IE was standing on rig floor where a section of hand rail had been removed to rig up a wireline sheave and was pushing out on winch line #2 from rig floor to guide BOP being lowered to ground level. Three 3rd party personnel on the ground level were using a 20-ft tag line to also guide BOP equipment away from rig. The BOP made contact with the ground, shifted and fell on its side because it was resting top heavy on bottom flange. This caused the IE who was holding the winch line in left hand to fall from the rig floor to the base beam below.
InjuryDescripti: Trauma to head, torso and back after falling from rig floor to base beam while holding onto winch line for BOP. Handrail had been removed for Wireline operations.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/near slip-fall
IncidentDescription:
Floor hand was carrying bucket of pipe dope from ODS doghouse to edge of rotary table and lost footing due
to ice on rig floor. Employee was walking in a quickened pace to complete job before the driller was ready for
slips to be set.

IncidentSummary: While relieving floorhand so he can go to the bathroom, we were laying down pipe, and as I was pulli
IncidentDescription: While relieving floorhand so he can go to the bathroom, we were laying down pipe, and as I was pulling slips with my left arm, I felt a sharp pain on my left shoulder.
InjuryDescripti: While pulling slips, injured employee felt sharp pain in left shoulder resulting in possible shoulder strain.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: The employee was in the process of rebuilding an upper IBOP at the shop. As he was lifting the outer
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: The employee was in the process of rebuilding an upper IBOP at the shop. As he was lifting the outer shell to place it on the IBOP he felt a strain in his lower back.
InjuryDescripti: While in the process of rebuilding an upper IBOP at the shop, employee was lifting the outer shell to place it on the IBOP when he felt a possible strain in his lower back.

IncidentSummary: MISS Independence/SRL
IncidentDescription: SRL got caught on MSR pin while employee was greasing block sheaves.

IncidentSummary: MISS brake linkage pin (KG)
IncidentDescription: While picking up tubing off catwalk, brake linkage pin came out of place. Posi stop failed to set while operator was going up to prevent blocks from falling. Placed a 24-inch pipe wrench on brake linkage to set lock on linkage (turn buckle).

IncidentSummary: IE was removing joint of 2 7/8" P-110, 8.6" PF from lay down machine to replace with a shorter joint
IncidentDescription: IE was removing joint of 2 7/8" P-110, 8.6" PF from lay down machine to replace with a shorter joint and right thumb struck against sharp edge of machine.
InjuryDescripti: Abrasion to right thumb after striking against sharp edge of lay down machine while removing joint with a short bar.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was walking from wellhead to closing unit and tripped over ground cable hidden by rainwater, slip
IncidentDescription: IE was walking from wellhead to closing unit and tripped over ground cable hidden by rainwater, slipped, fell, striking right side of torso on grapefruit-sized rock.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right side of torso after tripping and falling over ground cable hidden by rain water and striking against grapefruit-sized rock.

IncidentSummary: While removing o-rings from a Baker #20 setting tool on the wash rack at the shop, IE cut left hand
IncidentDescription: While removing o-rings from a Baker #20 setting tool on the wash rack at the shop, IE cut left hand with a hook blade box cutter in the area between his thumb and index finger.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left hand after striking against hook blade box cutter being used to remove o-rings from a Baker #20 setting tool.

IncidentSummary: MISS hand rail
IncidentDescription: While lifting the lubricator to the rig floor, the collar of the lube bumped the hand rail, it popped up, came loose and the safety chain prevented it from falling.

IncidentSummary: MISS loose trailer winch
IncidentDescription: While tagging the lube onto the rig floor, the winch used to tag the lube off the trailer came loos from the reel and the lube slid forward and hit the rig floor. No damage.

IncidentSummary: While setting a portable heater next to a cement truck with a forklift, the operator backed into a p
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While setting a portable heater next to a cement truck with a forklift, the operator backed into a personal vehicle belonging to injured employee. The rear counterweight of the forklift impacted the front passenger side panel of the personal vehicle causing damage to the headlight, passenger side panel, hood, front bumper, and grill of the personal vehicle. When the forklift impacted the vehicle it caused the vehicle to slide approximately one foot towards the driver's side of the vehicle. The IE had opened the rear drivers side door and was searching in a tote for clothing when his vehicle was struck. The injured employee states that as the truck moved, it impacted his left knee causing it to hyper extend.
InjuryDescripti: Forklift maneuvering equipment made contact with injured employee's vehicle, causing the vehicle to move, impacting IE on the left knee resulting in possible strain.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/fallen-dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: Apex roustabouts were lowering a three foot section of flow line to the ground with the forklift. The chain they used to secure the load failed causing the load to fall approximately three feet to the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/light plant, falling-dropped object(s)
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription:
Motor man was lowering light plant so he could face the lights down as directed by Apache safety man. While
doing so one of the cables busted and the light plant fell approximately 5 to 6 feet, almost striking employee.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/storm bar, safety pin HIGH
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: While tailing in pipe floorhand noticed storm bar from derrick board was out of sockets. Safety pin came off while drilling surface. Was laying on walkway on derrick board.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/winch, fallen-dropped object(s)
IncidentDescription: While bringing down wireline sheave with topdrive, off driller side winch was ripped out of derrick. Winch line fell to rig floor and potentially could have hit floor hands..Winch line was attached to ODS A-Leg with a snatch block and the hook was attached to strap that was wrapped around casing to center it up in the hole before cement set up.

IncidentSummary: Crew was making a connection on 8-inch wash pipe with chain tongs and sledge hammer. When bumping up
IncidentDescription: Crew was making a connection on 8-inch wash pipe with chain tongs and sledge hammer. When bumping up to tighten wash pipe, Cody Lee was hammering up connection and hammer bounced off chain tongs and struck IE on right knee.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee after being struck by hammer being used by another employee to tighten up wash pipe after it bounced off chain tongs.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS guns falling out on road
IncidentDescription: Crew stacked spent guns in the back of the goose-neck trailer equipped with a lower center section. While driving, two guns slid over the other stacked guns and fell out onto the road.

IncidentSummary: MISS running JB/GR and packer
IncidentDescription: Crew made a JG/GR run and while coming off the well, the winch operator winched our lubricator into the top sheave hanging in the elevators. Ground personnel had been warning him to stop. After the impact, extra line was run out to inspect for kinks and other damage. The line looked fine so crew performed a shoot through, hooked up the Baker #20 with the packer and ran back into the well. On the way out, crew realized the packoff head was not operating correctly and they lowered grease pressure and pulled out at a lower rate of speed. The line was not easily pulled through the packoff head by hand and could not be separated. Verified there was no pSi on the head, pulled it apart and everything looked fine. Possibly, when the head hit the sheave, the piston was offset slightly, but enough to impair normal operation of the packoff.

IncidentSummary: The injured employee was assisting the removal of the derrick board. He was on the off driller side
IncidentDescription: The injured employee was assisting the removal of the derrick board. He was on the off driller side of the derrick standing behind an employee that was removing a pin on the derrick board support beam. At the same time employees were removing the same pin on the opposite side of the derrick. When the pin on the drillers side of the derrick was knocked loose, the tension of the pin hole caused the pin to shoot out and travel the width of the derrick striking the employeeGs right knee on the knee cap. The pin was welded to the derrick with a small chain which broke when the pin shot out.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to right knee when employee was struck by derrick pin while employees were in the process of dismantling the derrick board during rigging down operations.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/catwalk, tail rope
IncidentDescription:
When running casing, loading catwalk with protectors; then when lowering catwalk tail rope got snagged on
catwalk. When it came free, it almost struck 3rd party personnel.

IncidentSummary: IE was carrying two boxes of shaped charges and felt something pop just below the sternum while step
IncidentDescription: IE was carrying two boxes of shaped charges and felt something pop just below the sternum while stepping down out of the mag.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to abdomen while carrying two boxes of charges upon stepping out of mag.

IncidentSummary: IE's right hand was punctured when the flat screwdriver being used to bend the tab that holds the ch
IncidentDescription: IE's right hand was punctured when the flat screwdriver being used to bend the tab that holds the charge slipped.
InjuryDescripti: Puncture to right hand after being struck by flat head screwdriver being used to remove tab from charge.

IncidentSummary: Crew was hydro-testing and picking up pipe from the trailer. As the IE turned around with a joint of
IncidentDescription: Crew was hydro-testing and picking up pipe from the trailer. As the IE turned around with a joint of pipe, left knee struck a hammer union on the flow line.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left knee after striking against hammer union on the flow line
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: IE was in the pipe skate helping to spot. As the IE used left hand to open the safety latch on the s
IncidentDescription: IE was in the pipe skate helping to spot. As the IE used left hand to open the safety latch on the stinger hook and release it from the pipe skate, left index finger was caught between the safety latch of the stinger hook and the eye hook on the pipe skate.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left index finger after it was caught between the safety latch of the stinger hook and the eye hook on the pipe skate while opening the latch.

IncidentSummary: MISS stuck rod transfer (ND)
IncidentDescription: The crew was TIH and the rod transfer became lodged between rod elevator and rod. The derrick hand made a hand signal and the leaned back in the rod basket. Floor hand and operator thought the hand took the rod transfer off the rod. Floor hand took the rod elevator off the rod and the operator came down with the blocks, causing the aluminum pin in the s-hook, the weak point in the rod transfer assembly, to shear. Rod transfer stayed on the rod and the s-hook stayed on the transfer line.

IncidentSummary: Rig crew was in the process of changing out a bad mud line. As the forklift was driving between the
Area: Rig Pad / Decks / Well Site / Yard
IncidentDescription: Rig crew was in the process of changing out a bad mud line. As the forklift was driving between the back end of the subs and the electrical festoon with the new mud line the forklift mast struck a weight bucket line. The weight bucket line parted and the cable swung down and hit injured employee on his little finger.
InjuryDescripti: Rig crew was in the process of changing out a bad mud line. As the forklift was driving between the back end of the subs and the electrical festoon with the new mud line the forklift mast struck a weight bucket line. The weight bucket line parted and the cable swung down and hit injured employee on his little finger resulting in a mild contusion to same.

IncidentSummary: While working around sub structure employee felt some discomfort in his right eye due to maybe somet
IncidentDescription: While working around sub structure employee felt some discomfort in his right eye due to maybe something getting into it. He kept working and then noticed that his eye was weeping and showing signs of swelling and at that time notified the rig manager.
InjuryDescripti: While working around sub structure injured employee felt some discomfort in his right eye due to maybe something getting into it, resulting irritation/inflammation.

IncidentSummary: MISS Ascent/cement head blowout
IncidentDescription:
After rigging up cement head to 9 5/8 casing, attempted to break circulation with 20 strokes per minute on mud
pump, while rig manager, derrickman and floorman were installing 1/2 inch chains and ratchet boomers from cathead to cement head. Right when they started ratcheting chain tight, cement head blew out of stump at 100 psi due to having 8 round thread cement swedge instead of buttress threads.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/UBHO sub
IncidentDescription:
Had UBHO sub standing up on floor putting new sleeve in with two hands holding it and both hands let go of it
at same time thinking the other hand had it. When both hands let go the sub feel to the floor close to
employees.

IncidentSummary: MISS falling board
IncidentDescription: A board fell down the stairs after it was bumped.

IncidentSummary: Injured employee and another employee were rigging down 3Gǥ hoses to reserve pit pump. They unclamped
IncidentDescription: Injured employee and another employee were rigging down 3Gǥ hoses to reserve pit pump. They unclamped the camlock ears and separated the hoses and IE was bumped in the cheek with the female end of the camlock.
InjuryDescripti: Injured employee and another employee were rigging down 3Gǥ hoses to reserve pit pump. They unclamped the camlock ears and separated the hoses and IE was bumped in the cheek with the female end of the camlock, resulting in a contusion on left cheek.

IncidentSummary: Crew was rigging up power swivel and installing sub with 48" pipe wrench. As third party employee wa
IncidentDescription: Crew was rigging up power swivel and installing sub with 48" pipe wrench. As third party employee was setting torque on power swivel, tongs engaged and pipe wrench swung around, striking the IE in the chest.
InjuryDescripti: Contusion to chest after being struck by 48" pipe wrench that swung around when power swivel and tongs were engaged.

IncidentSummary: HP -MISS crane outrigger
IncidentDescription: While practicing for crane training, a gust of wind caused the front outrigger to come off the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS plug setting
IncidentDescription: While lifting an 8 5/8" surface plug with a tag line, crew lost footing on the icy ground and slipped. They let the tag line go, plug hit the wellhead and broke the plug.

IncidentSummary: Employee was latching the single latch elevators in the trough when the back of his right little fin
IncidentDescription: Employee was latching the single latch elevators in the trough when the back of his right little finger hit the trough and caused a small laceration to the back of his right little finger.
InjuryDescripti: Employee was latching the single latch elevators in the trough when the back of his right little finger hit the trough and caused a small laceration to the back of his right little finger.

IncidentSummary: IE had a joint of pipe on right shoulder and while attempting to lay it on the ground, floor hand un
IncidentDescription: IE had a joint of pipe on right shoulder and while attempting to lay it on the ground, floor hand unlatched the pipe from tubing elevators causing the pipe to jar shoulder. Rig operator was attempting to stop the task but the IE couldn't hear him.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to right shoulder while carrying a joint of pipe when floor hand unlatched the pipe from the tubing elevators, jarring pipe.
OperationAtTimeofInjury: Laying Down / Picking Up Pipe / Tubulars

IncidentSummary: MISS perf gun entry guide dropped
IncidentDescription: Entry guide came off of 4" 1002 connection, slid down plug/perf gun and landed on ground in front of well. Guide slid down gun from approximately 45' elevation.

IncidentSummary: IE was exiting recorder cab and 2nd metal pullout step gave way, causing the IE to fall to the groun
IncidentDescription: IE was exiting recorder cab and 2nd metal pullout step gave way, causing the IE to fall to the ground and strain left ankle.
InjuryDescripti: Strain to left ankle after falling when the metal pullout step out of the recorder broke.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/broken bolt
IncidentDescription: While tripping in hole, employee tailed pipe in to the stump, stabbed the pipe and then went to put his rope around another stand of pipe. The ST-80 was then brought in to the stump to make up pipe torque. While torquing pipe, the bolt that holds die block broke, employee notice bolt/nut on rig floor.

IncidentSummary: IE was holding the hammer wrench with a rope and Matthew Dees was using a hammer to remove bolts fro
IncidentDescription: IE was holding the hammer wrench with a rope and Matthew Dees was using a hammer to remove bolts from BOP's. Matt hit the hammer wrench with a glancing blow and it continued through, striking the left thumb of the IE which was resting on the wellhead. The IE did not know left thumb had been struck until a red spot appeared on impact glove.
InjuryDescripti: Laceration to left thumb after being struck by hammer being used by another employee to remove bolts from BOP.

IncidentSummary: MISS Whiting/dropped-fallen object(s), latch pin
IncidentDescription: When latching the single latch elevators to stand in derrick, the secondary latch pin fell to floor.

IncidentSummary: MISS ground rod
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking to the company man's trailer for the safety meeting and almost tripped over a ground rod sticking up out of the ground.

IncidentSummary: MISS slip, no fall
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking in the PCE of shop with eyes focused on destination and did not see a puddle of wireline grease on the floor. Slipped but did not fall.

IncidentSummary: MISS skidding car
IncidentDescription: While driving to meet co-workers, employee was running late and focus was on rushing so they wouldn't have to wait. Upon approaching intersection, the light turned green so employee didn't check the intersection but noticed a car approaching that was skidding on the ice.

IncidentSummary: MISS SM Energy/bolts, safety cable HIGH
IncidentDescription: On top drive inspection the stabbing guide had several loose bolts and a safety cable missing.

IncidentSummary: MISS Apache/wind sock pole
IncidentDescription:
While rigging up cementers, C & J cementers employees were on the ground besides the sub structures next to the drill line spool putting their circulating iron (stand pipe that goes from the ground to the rig floor) together on the
ground. The zip ties holding the wind sock pole busted and the wind sock and pole fell over the handrails and
landed on the ground nearly striking one of the C & J employees.

IncidentSummary: MISS COG/water tank hatch
IncidentDescription: Employee was walking backwards on the water tank while pressure washing and almost fell through the door of the water tank due to the hatch not being installed properly.
